title: Expert Lead II (Data)
description:
Expert Lead II (Data)**Your job**
------------


As Data Product Owner (DPO), you are responsible for the delivery of Data Products and/or Golden Datasets to Credits data domain of ABN AMRO.  

Your scope is the golden data sets of Asset Based Finance. As DPO you have specific in-depth knowledge of the data domain related standards and guidelines.  

You organise and lead the Credits Data Product Team (CDPT), this team is an agile-working team focussing on the continuous development of data related products, services and processes. You are responsible for taking informed decisions and achieving the objectives set for the CDPT.


Some examples of your responsibilities:

* Deliver Data Products aligned with the (data) strategy of the Credits Data Domain and ABN AMRO
* Manage (data) risks for a Data Product and or Golden Datasets
* Gather Data Product requirements and deliver the Data Product compliant to the relevant standards and policies, local law and regulations
* Implement Data Quality Checks
* Alignment with other data domains, and resolution parties on progress of data issues
* Identify and act on impediments and other factors which hamper issue resolution.
* Monitor and ensure compliance with BCBS 239 and other regulations(such as GDPR).
* Coach, motivate and develop the team members
* Be inspiring and supportive in leadership and sets the example for others
**Working environment**
-----------------------


The new CDPT is part of the Value Proposition ABF Commercial Finance> and is part of the ABF Data Community.  

The CDPT consists of Data Stewards with a single reporting line to you and Data Engineers from the IT Department(functional reporting line). Additionally the team may consist of Data Analysts, Data Scientists and Subject Matter Experts, which will be added to the team on a use-case basis.  

You report directly to Iris Reijndorp and you will also have a functional reporting line to the Credits Data Domain Owner of ABN AMRO bank.


At ABF we have an open and transparent way of working where your opinion is valued and dialogue is encouraged. The Value Proposition Team ABF Commercial Finance is diverse with regards to culture, experience and age. The atmosphere is lively and informal, closely monitoring a safe environment where everyone is able to share their thoughts, feelings and worries. It is normal to make mistakes and we aim to help each other grow as learning is one of our main focuses.  

The team you will lead is in constant collaboration with different stakeholders within the credits data domains of ABN AMRO, the ABF data office, the other ABF Data Product Teams and other data enabling teams of the CIO organisation.

**Your profile**
----------------


You are an energetic individual with a passion for combining strategic thinking and hands-on execution. You provide your team with the ability to not only keep up with, but also pioneer, in their field of expertise and you can motivate and inspire your employees to follow your example.


If you resonate with the following, you may be the ideal candidate:

* You work and reason at a university level
* You know how a bank works and have experience (3+ years) as a product owner
* You have a proven track-record in the field of data management
* You have strong knowledge and experience in products, processes, IT systems and data within the field of Credits and preferable Lease and Factoring
* You oversee the complexity of regulation, compliance, legislation, risk, commercial interest, IT and know how this related to each other
* You are skilled in analysing and structuring complex problems, identifying solutions/options and presenting your advice to stakeholders in a convincing and structured manner
* You are a solid communicator and discussion partner for stakeholders at all levels
* You have effective cross-functional collaboration skills

  

Leadership

* As a leader you know how to show up for your team and adjust your communication style to the different audiences.
* You mobilise your team to collaborate, enable execution and get the right results.
* You encourage and empower your team to challenge the status quo and to experiment
**At a glance**
---------------


Do you want to be part of the Data Revolution in the banking industry? Do you have a strong passion for data and do you agree that data is at the core of creating value for customers? Do you like to work together with a team to come up with concrete solutions and, above all, to deliver them?  

Then come help us unlock the power of data at the Credits Data Products Team of ABN AMRO Asset Baset Finance!  

You help realise the delivery of the ABN AMRO strategy: a Personal Bank in a Digital Age. You ensure that the entire bank follows the correct route towards a fully data driven organisation.

**Interested?**
---------------


Are you interested? Please respond to this vacancy. For any questions, please reach out to Iris Reijndorp (iris.reijndorp@nl.abnamro.com) and/or Lars Anliker Munante (lars.anliker.munante@nl.abnamro.com)

**Equal opportunities for all**
-------------------------------


The success of our organisation depends on the quality of our people and the ideas that they have. Truly surprising insights and innovative solutions for our clients result from an interplay of cultures, knowledge and experience. Diversity is therefore extremely important to our organisation. To ensure that everyone at ABN AMRO can develop their talents, we encourage an inclusive culture in which all colleagues feel engaged and appreciated.

**We are offering**
-------------------

* The gross monthly salary displayed above is based on a 36-hour work week, including vacation pay and benefit budget.
* The Benefit Budget is 11% of your salary. The Benefit Budget allows you to acquire additional employment benefits. If you make no purchases or reservations in the Benefit Shop in a given month, you are paid one twelfth of your Benefit Budget that month.
* Five weeks of vacation per year. You have the option to purchase an additional four weeks per year.
* Personal development Budget of € 1,000 per year, which you can accumulate up to € 3,000.
* Possibility to work from home (in consultation with your team and depending on your position).
* An annual public transport pass with free public transportation throughout the Netherlands.
* An excellent pension scheme.
**Equal opportunities for all**
-------------------------------


The success of our organisation depends on the quality of our people and the ideas that they have. Truly surprising insights and innovative solutions for our clients result from an interplay of cultures, knowledge and experience. Diversity is therefore extremely important to our organisation. To ensure that everyone at ABN AMRO can develop their talents, we encourage an inclusive culture in which all colleagues feel engaged and appreciated.

**Disclaimer external recruitment agencies**
--------------------------------------------


External recruitment agencies need to have a signed agreement with ABN AMRO BANK N.V., executed by a Talent Acquisition Specialist, when submitting a resume to a vacancy. No unsolicited services or offers, please.

### **Wij vragen**

* Passie voor je vakgebied

### **Wij bieden**

* Analytische skills

title: Data Management Consultant Identity & Access Management (IAM)
description:
Are you passionate about data? And do you want be part of the new Area IAM Data & Insights and lead the implementation of Data Management within the Tribe IAM? Then don’t hesitate to apply for the role of Data Management Consultant IAM!

**You and your job**  

As a Data Management Consultant IAM you use your extensive Data Management and banking skills /experience to drive our Data Management ambitions. The Data Management Consultant IAM sets up a clear vision on Data Management for the Tribe IAM and maintains an overview over the entire data domain. You coordinate projects to lead the implementation of Data Management within the Tribe. You make a difference in ensuring and improving the data quality within IAM by developing and maintaining relationships with different stakeholders together with the Data Stewards IAM. You are pro-actively taking actions when data quality is below expectations and give advice about the correct use of data in different projects. You are very familiar with the latest developments on Data Management and are eager to help the Tribe IAM to grow to the next level of maturity.


You work, together with your Data Steward colleagues, within the new Area IAM Data & Insights. This Area is responsible for providing IAM data and create relevant actionable insights to improve efficiency and effectiveness of our user journeys and to show IAM is in control. The Data Management Framework is not implemented yet, so there is a great challenge ahead of us.

**Top 4 responsibilities**

* Setting up and operationalizing the data management framework within IAM. Making sure teams within the Areas are working based on the data management standards of the bank. Topics to think about are: Data Governance, Data Lineage, Data Quality monitoring & Reporting.
* The analysis, monitoring and solving of data quality issues in close cooperation with product owners and business analysts
* Guiding and coaching the Data Stewards IAM.
* Providing guidance (stakeholders) and inspiration (literacy program) to improve data management awareness and maturity throughout the Tribe IAM in collaboration with Global Data Management and Data Literacy teams

**Facts and figures**

* 36 hours per week
* Part of Tribe Identity & Access Management which employs around 200 colleagues from a wide range of backgrounds and countries
* 43,822 Rabobank colleagues around the world

**Together we achieve more than alone**  

We believe in the power of difference. Bringing together people's differences is what makes us an even better bank. So we are very curious about what you can bring to our team at Area IAM Data & Insights.

*' With the launch of the Tribe IAM and the start of the Area IAM Data & Insights we aim for solid IAM data services. And that’s only the beginning. Simple and digital access to IAM information and services will be embedded as part of the user experience, just as you as a customer expect in your daily live. It’s great to take charge of further building on digital IAM Experience and show that IAM is in control.’*


Amy Bovelander – Area Lead IAM Data & Insights


Working together is the way we work; as 1 results-driven, problem-solving, data-minded team at Rabobank. Talking of Rabobank: We are a Dutch bank that operates in 38 countries for over 9,5000,000 customers. Together with these customers, our members and partners we stand side by side to create a world in which everyone has access to enough healthy food. In the Netherlands we work to create a country in which people are happy with how they live, work and do business.

 **You and your talent**


* Academic (Masters or Bachelor) working and thinking level;
* At least 5 years experience with Data Management, e.g. Data Quality Management, Data Analysis, Data Governance;
* Knowledge of and experience with DAMA dimensions;
* Able to inspire, motivate and coach in Dutch and English;
* Demonstrable experience in working in complex banking environments, speak the language of various stakeholders and inspire them to play their responsible part.

**This is what we offer you**


* a salary between € 5115,- and € 7307,- gross per month (scale 10).
* a thirteenth month salary and holiday pay;
* an Employee Benefit Budget of 11% of your monthly salary. You decide how to spend this budget. This may include purchasing extra leave days, making extra pension contributions or even receiving a monthly cash pay-out;
* a personal budget that you can spend on activities related to your personal development and career;
* flexible working times and location-independent working in The Netherlands;
* and a pension scheme, to which your contribution is only 3,5% or 5,5%, that’s your choice.

  

This is a selection of the terms of employment for a Data Steward IAM based on a 36 hour working week. You can find all terms of employment on rabobank.jobs/en/conditions-of-employment.  

  

**You and the job application process**


Reply to the vacancy for Data Steward Identity & Access Management at Rabobank now.

* Any questions about the job content? Contact Amy Bovelander, Area Lead IAM via amy.bovelander@rabobank.nl.
* Any questions about working at Rabobank and the process? Contact Sylvana Janssen, recruiter, via sylvana.janssen@rabobank.nl.
* We will hold the interviews through a video call.
* You can find answers to the most frequently asked questions on rabobank.jobs/en/faq.
* A security check is part of the process.
* We respect your privacy.

title: Math Analyst I _NL
description:
VACANCY MATH ANALYST I
  
  

You love Math, but don’t want to work in a classroom? The Math Analyst I position is an entry-level opportunity for a graduate with a math background to apply their knowledge of probability, statistics, and programming into a real-world application. The Math Analyst is responsible for performing complex statistical methods to test software designs that impact the products and services in the gambling & lottery industry. Working closely with the Engineering team, the Math Analyst devotes a large majority of time directly towards testing and review, and may focus on standard game analysis, strategy game analysis, and/or random number generator (RNG) analysis.
  
  

Who We Are…
  
With over 30 years in the industry, Gaming Laboratories International is the global leader in the testing and certification of gaming devices and systems. We are proud of our stability and our history of world-class customer service delivery to more than 475 jurisdictions worldwide.
  
  

Why You Should Work Here…
  
Our employees are at the heart of everything we do, which is why they are our biggest investment. We offer competitive salaries, top-notch benefits and a company culture focused on employee development and career enhancement. Our team members have the opportunity to communicate and collaborate with colleagues around the world.
  
  

What You Will Accomplish Here…
  
  

**The Math Analyst’s main focus will be on the following:**  

Testing and Math Analysis
  
* Writing programs and performing other analyses to calculate needed mathematical features of games.
* Writing programs or scripts to manipulate, parse or reorganize large data files into standard formats for testing.
* Conducting and interpreting statistical testing on game simulation results and on RNG data.
* Reading and interpreting jurisdictional requirements, consulting appropriately for interpretation.


Reviewing and Documenting
  
* Reading and modifying programs and analyses developed by others to meet testing needs.
* Reviewing, understanding, and documenting source code written in various languages.
* Writing project reports by summarizing the testing conducted and the results.
* Carefully reviewing analysis work conducted by others for accuracy.


Communicating Externally and Internally
  
* Working with external clients, communicating professionally and courteously on topics of a technical nature
* Effectively communicating and collaborating with other members of the Math Department and other employees


**Experience, Education, Skills and Credentials:**  

* Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a closely related discipline
* Associate degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or 2+ years of equivalent experience may be considered; Certification, formal training, or experience may also be evaluated and considered in lieu of educational requirement
* Previous related experience a plus; salary will commensurate with experience
* Must have knowledge of Probability, Statistics, and Combinatorics
* Knowledge of a modern, object-oriented programming language such as C++, including appropriate use of object-oriented design is required
* Must have an understanding of core programming concepts and techniques
* Knowledge of Microsoft Excel is required
* Must have the ability to communicate, both orally and written, with other members of the team and external contacts
* Ability to handle and organize multiple projects and deadlines is required
* Must demonstrate a high degree of attention to quality, details, and correctness
* Must be able to pass a thorough background investigation


**We offer excellent paid benefits that include:**  

* 25 holidays per year, excluding bank holidays
* Pension Plan
* Commute travel allowance, covering 100% of public transportation, €0,23ct by car and €0,10ct by bike
* Annual Discretionary Bonus
* €25, - monthly health insurance contribution
* €15, - monthly wellbeing contribution
* Quarterly company events
* Quarterly team lunches
* Discretionary Annual Salary Reviews
* Opportunity to work in a diverse workplace with 48 different nationalities
* Fresh fruit at the office
* Weekly Friday Social Hour


Gaming Laboratories International (GLI) is a gaming company. Any of our employees may be required to obtain a gaming license within one or all of the gaming jurisdictions. If you are requested by GLI to obtain a gaming license, your continued employment may be contingent on your ability to obtain that gaming license.
  
This job description should not be interpreted as all-inclusive; it is intended to identify major responsibilities and requirements of the job. The incumbent may be requested to perform other job-related task and responsibilities than those stated above.
  
  

GLI is an Equal Opportunity Employer
  
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.

title: Senior Finance Analyst
description:
Location:
Amsterdam - Amsterdam, Netherlands
Job Family:
Finance
Worker Type Reference:
Regular - Permanent
Pay Rate Type:
Salary
JOB ID:
R-38691-2024
  
### **Description & Requirements**

***Do you want to work for some of the world’s leading audio brands? Become a part of the HARMAN team and get to work for JBL and Harman/Kardon.***

***By joining HARMAN, you'll dive headfirst into the exciting world of headphones, portable speakers, party boxes and other audio technologies, and contribute to the success of Harman Lifestyle EMEA business. The consumer audio industry is fast paced, fun and dynamic and we’re looking for someone who is proactive, loves to work with a lot of different stakeholders from all over the globe and has creative ideas.***

***But that's not all - at HARMAN, you'll have the opportunity to rapidly develop your skills and cultivate new ideas in our agile and supportive culture.***

***You will join our Global Finance department based in our EMEA Headquarters in Amsterdam, The Netherlands in the position of:***

**Senior Finance Analyst**

**About the Role:**


In this role you are responsible for driving the day-to-day execution of transformation effort to help the cross-functional team achieve benchmark performance. You will apply Harman's proven, methodology-driven approach to large-scale transformation/ performance improvement, focusing on execution and capability building. You will enable critical decisions and drive transformation results through data analytics and insights. You will coach your workstream members to develop and execute effective improvement plans and role-modeling a mindset of executional excellence.

**What You Will Do:**

* Drive day-to-day execution of transformation teams, right from ideation through implementation, value capture, and lessons learned.
* Hold the team accountable for the execution rigor and results by conducting performance reviews focusing on action/measure tracking and gap closing.
* Monitor and report project progress; bring data insights to drive effective decision-making and course correction.
* Coach teams on improvement approaches and systems.
* Infuse a sense of urgency and establish where to focus (Initiatives, deep dives)
* Assist in the SAP S/4 Hana system implementation. Requiring collaboration amongst global process owners and subject matter experts to ensure business requirements are met.
* Support and conduct system and integrations testing for SAP S/4 Hana along with other system implementation.
* Ensures connectivity across the different cross-functional transformation teams to leverage best practices and knowledge sharing.

**What You Need:**

* Bachelor's Degree, ideally in Economics, Finance, Accounting, Business management, or related business management discipline.
* At least 3 years of experience in Business Process, Strategic Finance, Business Project management, or other related areas.
* Demonstrated aptitude for analytical and conceptual problem solving.
* A sense of urgency and an urge to create an impact and make a difference.
* Impactful communication skills with an ability to articulate messages to a variety of audiences.
* Strong interpersonal and collaboration skills: ability to work on project cross-functionally.

**What is Nice to Have:**

* Knowledge in ERP systems: SAP.
* MBA or CPA a plus.
* Certification of Lean Six Sigma or any Improvement methodology.

**What Makes You Eligible:**

* Be willing to travel up to 10%, domestic and international travel.
* Be willing to work in an office in Amsterdam.

**Are you ready to take your career to the next level?**

* HARMAN is offering a unique opportunity for growth and development in the dynamic and exciting world of consumer electronics.
* We provide a flexible work schedule that allows you to work from home, while also enjoying a fantastic new office at Houthavens, Amsterdam.
* At HARMAN, we value diversity and inclusivity, and foster a friendly and supportive global working atmosphere. We believe in investing in our employees through career development opportunities, professional training, and competitive market-based compensation. As part of our commitment to employee well-being, we also offer a commuter travel package, environment allowance, and interesting collective health insurance scheme, pension, and employee discounts on world-class HARMAN/Samsung products (JBL, HARMAN Kardon, AKG, etc.).
* As a HARMAN employee, you will have access to professional development opportunities through HARMAN University's business and leadership academies, internal talent management leadership acceleration programs, and our "Be Brilliant" employee recognition and rewards program.

**And a few reasons you might love it:**

* We're seeking talented and passionate individuals to join our team and help us transform the way people experience sound. As a global leader in the audio industry, HARMAN offers the chance to work with iconic brands like JBL, Harman/Kardon, and AKG, as well as cutting-edge technology and industry-first features.
* We value excellence and brilliance in all of our 30,000 employees and we're looking for talented individuals who share our passion for innovation and superior sound technology. If you're looking for a career full of brilliant possibilities and the chance to work on industry-first features, then HARMAN is the place for you!

**Don't miss out on the chance to be part of a culture that values excellence and brilliance in all of our employees. Apply now and take the first step towards a career full of brilliant possibilities!** https://jobs.harman.com/en\_US/careers


We look forward to receiving your application! Send your application with your resume and letter of motivation. We will process the applications as we receive them.


For more information about the position or the recruitment process, feel free to contact our Recruitment department: conor.kelly@harman.com

**Join HARMAN and discover a world of endless possibilities!**


#LI-CK2


#LI-Hybrid

  


  

**Important Notice: Recruitment Scams**
Please be aware that HARMAN recruiters will always communicate with you from an '@harman.com' email address. We will never ask for payments, banking, credit card, personal financial information or access to your LinkedIn/email account during the screening, interview, or recruitment process. If you are asked for such information or receive communication from an email address not ending in '@harman.com' about a job with HARMAN, please cease communication immediately and report the incident to us through: harmancareers@harman.com.  


  

HARMAN is proud to be an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.
company_description: HARMAN is an innovative technology leader that is rapidly on the move. We empower our global teams to do their best as they take on the big challenges that make life better.

title: Analytics Engineer (Data Product & Research Team)
description:
Job Description
  
  

Hi there!
  
We are Semrush, a global IT company developing our own product – a platform for digital marketers. New stars are born here, so don’t miss your chance.
  
This is our role Analytics Engineer for those who want to turn ideas into reality and participate in improving Semrush’s analytics tools.
  
  

Tasks in the role
  
  

* This role is focused on the creation, maintenance, and ongoing development of core data assets that serve as a single source of truth for core company metrics used in reporting, data models, and analysts' work
* The person will support the global “Metrics Definition” initiative and focus on creating and managing a consistent system of main metrics (including Churn, Retention, MRRPPU, etc.), their dimensions (e.g. Churn Reasons, …), and business entities (e.g. who is a Paid User), acting as a further owner of these metrics’ calculation logic.


Requirements
  
  

Who we are looking for
  
  

* Bachelor's degree in STEM, Economics, Business Analysis, or a related field is preferred
* Solid foundation in math and statistics.
* 2+ years of experience in data engineering, data analysis, data science, or a related field
* High proficiency in SQL and relational databases
* Proficiency in Python for data manipulation
* Good analytical and problem-solving skills
* Good communication and interpersonal skills
* Familiarity with airflow, dbt (and Jinja), git, and cloud-based platforms (GCP)
* Experience in being responsible for complex multistep data pipelines or analytical projects, including working with conceptual & logical data modeling, data schemas, and ELT/ETL steps.
* English language proficiency at the Upper Intermediate level or higher


Not required, but a plus
  
  

* Proficiency in data visualization and BI (Tableau)
* Proficiency in airflow, dbt (and Jinja), git, and cloud-based platforms (GCP)
* Experience with bash
* Software engineering experience
* Experience with creating company-wide metrics calculation pipelines from the requirements gathering stage to maintenance in production
* Thoroughness, meticulousness, and nerdiness (in a good way )


A bit about the team
  
  

The Data Product & Research team is a part of the Analytics Division. The team focuses on delivering analytical projects and products. The team achieves this by constructing scalable analytical solutions and models, utilizing both heuristic and machine-learning approaches, aimed at resolving business problems.
  
  

We will try to create all the right conditions for you to work and rest comfortably
  
  

* It’s up to you to decide what work format works best for you. You can #wfo, #wfh, or mix both.
* Flexible working day start
* Unlimited PTO
* Hobby benefit
* Breakfast, snacks, and coffee at the office
* Corporate events
* Training, courses, conferences
* Gifts for employees


Finally, a little more about our company
  
  

Semrush is a leading online visibility management SaaS platform that enables businesses globally to run search engine optimization, pay-per-click, content, social media and competitive research campaigns and get measurable results from online marketing.
  
We’ve been developing our product for 16 years and have been awarded G2's Top 100 Software Products, Global and US Search Awards 2021, Great Place to Work Certification, Deloitte Technology Fast 500 and many more. In March 2021 Semrush went public and started trading on the NYSE with the SEMR ticker.
  
10,000,000+ users in America, Europe, Asia, and Australia have already tried Semrush, and over 1,000 people around the world are working on its development. The Semrush team is constantly growing.
  
Our new colleague, we are waiting for you!
  
  

Semrush is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, creed, color, national origin, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, ancestry, physical or mental disability, or medical condition including medical characteristics, genetic identity, marital status, military service, or any other classification protected by applicable local, state or federal laws. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements, merit, and individual qualifications.

title: IT Risk Analyst (WAVE Team)
description:
Job Description
  
  

Hi there!
  
We are Semrush, a global IT company developing our own product – a platform for digital marketers. New stars are born here, so don’t miss your chance.
  
Our role IT Risk Analyst for those who value interaction with customers, understand risk management and develop and maintain the risk registry for Infrastructure Division
  
  

**Tasks in the role are include:**  

* Develop and maintain the risk registry for the infrastructure division, ensuring it is comprehensive and up-to-date. Transforming our risk registry from qualitative to quantitative risk analysis
* Risk Assessment: Analyse statistical data to estimate the probability, severity and cost of realised threats on infrastructure assets
* Data Collection and Cleaning: Gathering data from various sources and ensuring it is accurate and usable. Participation in M&A due diligence audits for external companies
* Data Analysis and Interpretation: Applying statistical methods and machine learning algorithms to interpret data. Use software to analyze data and run simulations to predict future trends and outcomes
* Model Building: Creating predictive models and algorithms to analyze data trends and patterns
* Validation and Testing: Ensuring the accuracy and validity of models through rigorous testing
* Communication: Presenting findings in a comprehensible manner to stakeholders, often through visualizations and reports
* Financial Modelling: Create and use mathematical models to develop strategies and models for financial planning to evaluate investment decisions, distribute and forecast costs
* Advisory Duties: Provide expert advice to other Platform infrastructure teams


Requirements
  
  

**Who we are looking for:**  

* Bachelor’s degree in Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field. A Master’s degree is a plus
* 2+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a related field
* 3+ years of experience in risk evaluation, ideally within the IT infrastructure and/or cybersecurity sector
* Possess h2 knowledge of risk management frameworks and best practices
* Proven track record of managing multiple projects and priorities in a fast-paced environment
* Familiarity with regulatory requirements and IT industry standards related to risk management
* Understanding of Industry Regulations: Knowledge of relevant laws, regulations, and best practices in the industry
* Knowledge of data visualisation and BI tools such as Tableau
* Excellent communication skills with the ability to present data-driven insights to non-technical stakeholders
* Significant experience with statistical analysis techniques, tools and predictive modelling
* Excellent documentation skills - clear, visual and understandable artefacts
* Analytical Skills: Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills as well as ability to think strategically
* Strong attention to detail, critical thinking, time management, and the ability to work both independently and as part of a team
* English at B2 level or above


They say there are no perfect candidates, but that might well be you, if you have:
  
  

* Solid foundation in math, probability theory, and statistics
* Good knowledge of SQL
* Python knowledge or other programming language
* Great Excel skills
* You share our common values: Trust, because we prefer to speak up and be our true selves; Sense of Ownership, because it’s not worth wasting time on something you don’t believe in; and enthusiasm for Constant Changes, because we are always looking to make things better


**A bit about the team:**  

You can get to know the team better at one of the interviews, but some brief information about future colleagues will be useful now.
  
  

The Team ensures adherence to regulatory requirements and industry standards, identifies and mitigates compliance risks, and develops and implements risk mitigation projects for project stakeholders, including senior management, legal, security and compliance teams.
  
So that compliance violations are minimised, risks mitigated, and organisation’s reputation is protected through effective risk management and compliance practices.
  
  

We will try to create all the right conditions for you to work and rest comfortably:
  
  

* It’s up to you to decide what work format works best for you. You can #wfo, #wfh, or mix both
* Flexible working day start
* Unlimited PTO
* Hobby benefit
* Breakfast, snacks, and coffee at the office
* Corporate events
* Training, courses, conferences
* Gifts for employees


**Finally, a little more about our company:**  

We’ve been developing our product for 15 years and have been awarded G2's Top 100 Software Products, Global and US Search Awards 2021, Great Place to Work Certification, Deloitte Technology Fast 500 and many more. In March 2021 Semrush went public and started trading on the NYSE with the SEMR ticker.
  
  

10,000,000+ users in America, Europe, Asia, and Australia have already tried Semrush, and over 1,000 people around the world are working on its development. The Semrush team is constantly growing.
  
Semrush is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, creed, color, national origin, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, ancestry, physical or mental disability, or medical condition including medical characteristics, genetic identity, marital status, military service, or any other classification protected by applicable local, state or federal laws. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements, merit, and individual qualifications.

title: Data Engineer
description:
**Who we are**



At Vandebron, we're transforming the energy landscape, steering away from the conventional to champion sustainability. Born in 2014, our journey began with Chapter 1, disrupting the market with a transparent platform connecting consumers directly to local, green energy producers. Now, in Chapter 2, we are dedicated to ensuring 100% green energy availability, 100% of the time. Think smart solutions — flexible use of wind and solar farms, Smart EV Charging, and efficient energy storage.

  

No waiting around, we actively shape a sustainable future. Good energy, smart solutions — that's Vandebron.

 **This is where you’ll end up**



You will end up in the Data Analytics team, which is at the core of Vandebron. We enable a wide variety of business teams such as digital, finance, marketing, electric mobility as well as customer facing teams, to make data-driven decisions by means of automated reporting, deep dive/ statistical analytics as well as building and maintaining data products.



We also work closely with leadership teams to support business-wide projects and facilitate decision making on a company level. You’ll be working in the commercial analytics team consisting of both data analysts and engineers and led by a Product Owner.



We’re a fast-pacing team that makes high-impact decisions and provides a mix of building and maintaining a state of the art data platform, data modeling and dashboarding as well as solving advanced analytics challenges together with a larger group of business analysts in the domain teams.

 **What are you going to do?**


* Work on improving and operating our (modern) data stack, maintain and improve our current and future ETL (/ELT) pipelines run smoothly and help analysts and engineers improve and extend the existing infrastructure
* Manage our orchestration tooling and make sure our (critical) data products are accessible to internal and external teams
* Working closely within a tight knit central data team that consists of analysts, engineers, data scientists and be the point of contact for embedded analysts
* Work on actively sharing and presenting your findings and knowledge with other business teams, embedded analysts and in the wider data community
* Learn new tools and techniques that continuously improve our existing data infrastructure

 **This is how you make a difference**


* You have a strong background and solid working experience as a data engineer (2+ years)
* You are an strong experience using Python, SQL and have strong knowledge of ETL (ELT) processes and tooling
* You are familiar with modern data tools and preferably have experience with Snowflake/ dbt (or data modeling in general) and orchestration tooling (e.g. Dagster)
* You are engaged and committed to helping stakeholders/ analysts derive value from their data; you’re interested beyond the mere technical details.
* You are someone who actively thinks about business problems, shares findings with stakeholders and is eager to help others find solutions in data. You will help people understand how to get value from data and get the business relevance of an analysis.
* You have experience with visualization tools used for reporting
* You have experience (preferably) with version control and are comfortable with git, working in a centralized environment
* You are a good communicator and are keen to work closely in a close knit team

 **What’s in it for you**


* To work towards our mission with a good dose of energy, we offer you 30 paid days off per year.
* Work abroad for up to 6 weeks per year (max 4 consecutive weeks, including up to 4 weeks outside the EU).
* Employees with three years of service can go on a sabbatical for up to three months (one month paid with holidays, two unpaid).
* Request special leave for significant personal events, volunteering for SDG 11 or 13, and an additional day for religious or personal celebrations (starting on Jan ’25).
* Dive into new skills with an annual €850 learning budget, as well as access to Learning & Development workshops and programs.
* Plan for the future with our solid pension scheme.
* Stay connected hassle-free with a monthly €50 net reimbursement for your phone and wifi.
* One-time €200 net allowance to create a comfortable home workspace for our team members.
* Split your time between our carbon-neutral Amsterdam office at the city’s heart and your home, finding the perfect balance for you.
* Enjoy daily organic lunches prepared by our in-house cooks.
* For those living 10km or more from the office, hop on board with an NS business card for smooth commuting.

  

**Interested?**



Maybe you don’t fit all these requirements but you still think you’re the right person for the role, still apply :).



At Vandebron we believe in diversity, inclusiveness and equal career opportunities. Be your authentic self and it's totally okay with us if you don't mention your gender or date of birth on your resume. We also care about your privacy and handle your data carefully. Under the GDPR, you are not required to provide us with any information about your health, race/nationality, and religion, and you may also omit your social security number (BSN) and passport photo from your job application documentation.

  

If you are as enthusiastic as we are, please apply via this page. Not convinced yet and do you have questions? Feel free to ask them via Jordreukers@vandebron.nl

title: Junior Digital Marketing Specialist
description:
**About the job**  

Join our energetic team as we propel our digital presence forward! We're on the hunt for an enthusiastic Junior Digital Marketing Specialist who's ready to dive into the world of digital marketing. This entry-level position is perfect for someone passionate about developing their skills and contributing to exciting online campaigns.

  

**About Innova Market Insights**



INNOVA MARKET INSIGHTS is a global leader in market intelligence and business information serving the fun and fast-paced food and beverage industry. With three decades of experience Innova is a dedicated partner for industry leaders all around the world. The company is famous for trends, insights, and intelligence to build and sustain successful innovation

 **What you will learn?**

  


As a Junior Digital Marketing Specialist, you will embark on a comprehensive learning journey across various key digital marketing areas:


* **Campaign Management**: Gain experience assisting in the development and management of digital advertising campaigns across platforms like Google Ads, Bing Ads, LinkedIn Ads, Facebook Ads, and more.
* **SEO Strategy Development**: Learn to develop and implement effective SEO strategies that enhance organic search rankings through keyword research, backlink strategies, and on-page optimizations.
* **Content Optimization**: Collaborate with content creators to ensure all website content is optimized for both search engines and user engagement.
* **Website Management**: Support the team in daily website operations, including updates, design modifications, and functionality enhancements.
* **Analytics and Reporting**: Help monitor campaign performance using tools like Google Analytics and Microsoft Clarity and contribute to the analysis that helps steer our digital strategies.
* **Creative Coordination**: Assist in coordinating with creative teams to develop marketing materials that resonate with our target audiences.
* **Market Research**: Participate in market research to understand trends, competitor strategies, and audience preferences.
* **Optimization**: Support continuous testing and optimization of ads and targeting to boost campaign results and ROI.
* **Collaboration**: Work closely with a diverse team of senior digital specialists, content creators, and marketing analysts.  

  

**Who Should Apply?**


* Individuals interested in learning more about interactive media or technology in marketing, especially online advertising.
* Candidates familiar with MS Office, particularly those who can create PowerPoint presentations and manage Excel data.
* Detail-oriented individuals with a strong desire to learn and grow.
* Those looking to join a team full of positive energy and a proactive attitude toward new challenges.
* Curious and detail-focused individuals who are enthusiastic about gaining new experience.  

  

**Preferred Qualifications**
* At least six months of experience in a media house or interactive agency is a plus, especially in content marketing.
* Educational background in marketing or digital marketing.  

  

**What we offer**
* Competitive Starting Salary
* Rapid development of specialist competencies within an international environment.
* The chance to work with an experienced team passionate about creating innovative digital solutions in the food and beverage industry.
* Great autonomy in managing assigned tasks and the opportunity to implement your own ideas.
* Access to all necessary tools for optimal performance and growth.
* A rewarding and enjoyable experience where you grow professionally.
* Modern office with an open desk structure
* A fully equipped on-site gym with changing facilities for colleagues.
* The pension plan includes a 50% employer contribution.
* 25 vacation days (plus Dutch Bank holidays).
* The possibility to purchase 10 extra days on an annual basis
* One work-from-home day per week
* 8% holiday allowance
* A diverse and international team with over 30 different nationalities.
* Free onsite parking
* Free snacks and drinks
* Travel allowance  

  

**Are you ready to grow with us**  

Do you want to be part of an exciting, energetic, and international company and influence what we eat and drink in the coming years? Then we would like to hear from you, and we encourage you to apply for this position. Begin a great career journey right now. We are excited to meet and learn more about you.

title: Data Analyst Credit Risk
description:
For one of the key strategic projects (‘MORSE’) in the domain of Residential Mortgages, we are looking for a Senior Data Analyst Credit Risk. To support this business initiative, a separate team is being set-up to assess the impact on the various credit risk processes and systems to ensure continuity from a modeling and reporting perspective. This team is set-up in a multi-disciplinary way with capacity from modeling, credit risk reporting, and data management.


You will also become part of the Center of Expertise Risk Analytics chapter in Tribe CRM, which focuses on providing and developing knowledge and expertise in the areas of credit risk and data analytics.

**Role & Responsibilties**

* Analyze data, design and build physical models at the various stages of the data pipeline: ingestion of data sources, mapping in data warehouse and creating data marts for consumption
* Maintain applications in our Data Lake, managing data using Oracle Exadata as main database, while adhering to set performance standards
* Estimating the impact of changes in the data environment on Risk calculations (capital, provisions)
* Evidencing to the internal and external stakeholders that the data is compliant with ING standards (Data Management Process Control Standards)

**How to succeed**


You have experience in working with large databases within the financial services industry (preferably credit risk related), either in the Netherlands or Internationally, and have a thorough understanding of:

* Datawarehouse concepts and data modelling techniques in the context of a complex data landscape
* BI tooling (SAS, SQL Developer) at an advanced level, a.o. writing macro scripts to extract data directly from Oracle and perform fully automated reconciliations between datasets
* Translating business requirements and observed defects into clear user stories for the developers
* Importance of script hygiene for readable and understandable code and clear documentation
* You are experienced in how to optimize scripts in order to reduce processing time and data storage
* Knowledge of Credit Risk concepts (e.g. Risk Weighted Assets, Expected Loss, Definition of Default) is a plus.

**In addition (required):**

* You have an enthusiastic personality, and enjoy working in a diverse environment
* You foster and good collaboration and communication in the team
* You can write and speak in English fluently
* You have project management experience, preferably in an Agile setting
* You are stress resilient, able to prioritize, and manage effectively
* You constantly develop yourself professionally and are passionate about Credit Risk related topics

**Rewards & benefits**


We want to make sure that it’s possible for you to strike the right balance between your career and your private life. You can find out more about our employment conditions at https://www.ing.jobs/netherlands/Why-ING/benefits.htm.


The benefits of working with us at ING include:

* A salary tailored to your qualities and experience
* 24-27 vacation days depending on contract
* Pension scheme
* 13th month salary
* Individual Savings Contribution (BIS), 3.5% of your gross annual salary
* 8% Holiday payment
* Hybrid working to blend home working for focus and office working for collaboration and co-creation
* Personal growth and challenging work with endless possibilities
* An informal working environment with innovative colleagues

**About us**


With around 60,000 employees and operations in approximately 40 countries, there is no shortage of opportunities for people with initiative who want to make a diﬀerence. We hire smart people like you for your potential, not your past. Our biggest expectation is that you’ll stay curious. Keep learning. Take on more responsibility. In return, we’ll back you to develop into an even more awesome version of yourself. If you want to work at the cutting edge of what’s possible, surrounded by progressive, inspiring and supportive colleagues, there is no better place to invest your talents than at ING. Join us. Apply today.
company_description: With 9 million account holders, ING is one of the largest and most prominent financial service providers in the Netherlands. We are part of ING Group, a global financial institution.
ceo_name: Steven van Rijswijk, CEO ING Group

title: Jr. Market Research Analyst (9 months temp role)
description:
**Company Description**  

Avery Dennison Corporation (NYSE: AVY) is a global materials science and digital identification solutions company that provides a wide range of branding and information solutions that optimize labor and supply chain efficiency, reduce waste, advance sustainability, circularity and transparency, and better connect brands and consumers. Our products and solutions include labeling and functional materials, radio frequency identification (RFID) inlays and tags, software applications that connect the physical and digital, and a variety of products and solutions that enhance branded packaging and carry or display information that improves the customer experience. Serving an array of industries worldwide — including home and personal care, apparel, general retail, e-commerce, logistics, food and grocery, pharmaceuticals and automotive — we employ approximately 35,000 employees in more than 50 countries. Our reported sales in 2023 were $8.4 billion. Learn more at www.averydennison.com.

**Avery Dennison is an equal opportunity employer.**  

Please let us know if we can support you with reasonable accommodations throughout the application process by contacting our team via Requestaccomodation@eu.averydennison.com.

 **Job Description**  

As Jr. Market Research Analyst, you will develop an in-depth knowledge of the ecosystem we are currently engaged in. You will act as a valuable resource of the European Marketing team to provide insights related to the Packaging and Label industry as well as the entire value chain. You will have opportunities to participate in projects or assignments where you can interface with different departments and the senior management.


Key Responsibilities

* Deliver monthly and quarterly reports for the management team including market growth and market growth drivers, share performance, macro economic trends, market & competitive insights
* Research and maintain in-depth knowledge of the the Packaging and Label industry ecosystem, including assessment of new technologies and business models
* Analyze and track competitors’ strategy using financial data, annual reports, SWOT analysis, etc.
* Conduct market analysis to assess new business opportunities and Avery Dennison’s positioning
* Conduct market sizing (calculating TAM & SAM) and market forecast analysis
* Translate market insights into relevant findings and recommendations to the commercial teams
* Work cross-functionally with Sales, Marketing, Finance, Procurement, Innovation and IT to provide and consolidate insights
* Deliver presentations and work in project teams where relevant
* Conduct surveys and market research based on business requirements (i.e. VOC, Customer Satisfaction, content for webinars)
* Handle ad-hoc assignments and spot requests/questions
* Fast learner, able to take an initiative, work well under pressure and adapt quickly to changes

 **Qualifications**  

We are looking for candidates who are highly motivated and analytical with the following requirements;

* Bachelor or Master degree in Market Research, Economics, Business Administration, or related
* 1-3 year(s) of experience in Strategic Marketing, Consulting or Market Research / Intelligence, or equivalent
* Strong data analysis, reporting and visualization skills with an eye for details and creativity
* Excellent problem solving skills
* Proficiency in Google Slides & Google Sheets AND/OR Excel
* Knowledge in Qualtrics, Cognos, R (other data analytics tools considered a plus)
* Fluent in writing, speaking and reading in English (other languages considered a plus)
* Excellent organizational and multitasking skills with a positive mindset

 **Additional Information** **We offer:**

* Attractive salary package
* Workplace & work hours flexibility
* Structured learning and development / Mentoring program
* International environment
* Events such as International Women’s Day, Earth Day, etc.
* A growing and welcoming team with good spirit!

**Who we are! - Our Story:**

**Every voice. Every day!** **Eight Values****. One Team!**


Being open to every voice, every day, brings our value of diversity to life and makes Avery Dennison a vibrant and engaging place to be. We understand diversity and equal opportunities as enrichment for our future-oriented work. Across our diverse, global team, every voice makes us stronger. When we listen to and learn from each other, there is no limit to what we can achieve together. Each of us is unique, and we appreciate bringing together different personalities and talents.


Avery Dennison is an equal-opportunity employer. In the **EMEA region**, we have these **Employee Resource Groups**:

* **EmpoWer** - focusing on the engagement, mentoring, and promotion of women
* **Mental Health** - striving to provide a safe space for employees to discuss mental health issues in the workplace
* **Unite** - supporting the LGBTQI+ and ally community in the EMEA region


To find out more about **all our employee resources groups globally** as well as our **Diversity, Equity & Inclusion** approach, please go to our Diversity and Inclusion pages in the About Us section of our website: https://www.averydennison.com/en/home/about-us/diversity-and-inclusion.html


At Avery Dennison, we do what we love, and we love what we do - Just click here, and get to know us better: **Life @ Avery Dennison** (linkedin.com/company/avery-dennison/life/emea)
company_description: Materials science is in our DNA. The pursuit of our vision has aligned our businesses into a focused, customer-driven company that specializes in materials science.

title: Customer Support Analyst
description:
Description:

SPS Commerce is seeking a **Customer Support Analyst** to join our team in the Netherlands. If you are passionate about the customer and have strong problem-solving skills, this position offers you some great opportunities. You will:
Join an international team at a time of positive change and growth * - the kind of growth that can create opportunities for strong players.
* Expand your knowledge; you'll start by providing first-line support, but we'll also train you to cover for second and third-line analysts when they are out.
* Enjoy an open and welcoming culture, get to know diverse people on several teams, and take advantage of a flexible hybrid schedule.
* Showcase your potential to advance. This role provides a broad understanding of our business, setting you up to pursue opportunities in client onboarding, sales, project management and other areas of our organization.
* Earn a competitive salary (fixed and variable), 8% holiday allowance, a company laptop and comprehensive benefits.


You will work a hybrid schedule, coming into the office at least once a week. You may come in more frequently as you get up to speed. **Does this sound like you?*** You are the key when customers need (immediate) help when using our solutions.
* Whether it's troubleshooting, assisting with business system integrations or navigating time-sensitive transaction data (EDI), you enjoy putting your technical and customer-facing skills to the test.
* You handle requests for technical support in a timely and friendly manner (within the guidelines of individual SLA agreements).
* You love data and enjoy working with other teams to ensure data integrity and perform daily checks.

**About SPS Commerce**
SPS Commerce is the world's leading retail network, connecting trading partners around the globe to optimize supply chain operations for all retail partners. We support data-driven partnerships with innovative cloud technology, customer-obsessed service and accessible experts.  

SPS Commerce has achieved 94 consecutive quarters of revenue growth and is headquartered in Minneapolis. SPS Commerce recently acquired TIE Kinetix, a Netherlands-based company with 36 years of EDI and e-invoicing experience, and approximately 1,200 customers across the Netherlands, France, Germany, and the United States. **Why SPS?**
We solve retail supply chain problems by cutting through inefficiency with innovation and automation. At SPS we empower retailers, suppliers, distributors, grocers and logistics partners to work better together with our people, our process and our tech products.  

We have the world’s largest retail network, and we don’t just lead the industry, we are the industry. At SPS, we believe every employee makes a difference. We ensure employees have the tools, resources, and training to explore new ideas and execute them. Our success comes from playing as a team and always playing to win. Careers don’t just grow here, they’re made here. **Day to Day**
As part of the Operational Team in our Dutch Division, you will work closely with the Project Managers, Consultants, Support Specialists, Onboarding Specialists and the Customer Success Team. As part of this team, you will be responsible for answering all active customer queries and assisting with all first-line support issues as per our individual customer SLA agreements.
You'll proactively communicate with customers about the status of their application. You also will maintain the knowledge base for frequently asked questions (FAQs) and help identify sales opportunities to pass on to the Customer Success Team. In this versatile job you'll have daily contact with suppliers, sellers and retailers in, for example, (non-)food retail, manufacturing industry and government.
More specifically, you will:* Help and support all active customers with all 1st-line support issues.
* Assume responsibility for escalating 2nd-line and 3rd-line support issues in a timely manner.
* Identify change requests and communicate with both the Account Manager and the Customer Success Manager.
* Assume responsibility for maintaining the knowledge base to keep our FAQ up to date.
* Maximize customer satisfaction and minimize customer loss.

**Required Skills**
To be a good fit for the Customer Support Analyst opportunity, you will have:* 1 to 2 years of experience in client services or software support;
* A good opportunity to work from home, undisturbed and with a good internet connection;
* Passion for the customer and advocating for their requests within the company;
* An eye for detail with logical problem-solving skills;
* A technical mindset and the ability to adapt quickly;
* Ability to speak and write fluently in Dutch and English;
* Experience with E-invoicing and electronic data interchange (EDI) is a plus.
* Fluent written and oral communication skills in German are a plus.

 *Note: this description is intended to give you a general overview of the position and is not an exhaustive listing of duties and responsibilities.*  

#LI-HYBRID
company_description: SPS Commerce is the world’s leading retail network, connecting trading partners around the globe to optimize supply chain operations for all retail partners.

title: Global Account - Business Analyst
description:
Job Summary
Reporting to the Global Account Director and part of the Global Account Leadership Team.  

  

* To provide support and enable the global account team to build successful commercial strategies, drive value creation (profitable growth and margin improvement) and make well informed business decisions.
* To continuously improve on business processes, data accuracy, management reporting and commercial project management tools (PUMA, SAP Business Warehouse platform & SFT).

  

The Global Account – Business Analyst will essentially create value and manage complexity by making sure:  

  

* Business operation processes are in place.
* Areas of improvement (vis-à-vis processes) are identified regularly and acted upon.
* Key stakeholders are timely informed about important information they can/should act upon.
* Data in systems and Insights for decision making are accurate & relevant.

  

The seniority of the person would impact:  

  

* The speed at which all those changes will take place.
* The depth he/she will get into, from Pricing to Margin, and from Margin to Economic Profit.
* The connectivity he/she will bring to the different tools and vis a vis the Global Account.
* The autonomy and proactivity when leading initiatives.

  

Higher level tasks could include:  

  

* Manage Global Account Team calls, agendas, minutes and follow-up.
* Working on new business model to better capture value generated by some specific initiatives.
* Representation of the Global account on Scent Business Unit initiatives.


Analyses & Reporting* Provide reports with relevant insights on quarterly orderbook development (weekly updates) and sales & profitability results (monthly actuals). Key to understand variances versus prior year results and budget.
* Coordinate Sales Budget & Forecast process for the account team: provide estimations to the team, discuss and aggregate Budget & Forecast proposals insights coming from the team, prepare discussion with management.
* Preparation of the analysis/data on Account performance for the monthly business review with management (discussion on the commercial/financial status on the sales account).
* Sales Variance Analysis (volume, price, mix variances vs budget/previous year).
* Provide Gross Profit analysis monthly including insights on the main variations (price, cost or mix driven) vs previous month/year and follow up with Commercial team category and regional leads.
* Provide rebate accrual estimation to finance team and calculate the rebate amounts to be paid for the various commercial agreements in place.
* Provide and analyze reports from Business Warehouse (SAP data warehouse), responding to ad-hoc inquiries. Build BW source-based reports that Account Manager can refresh themselves. Train Account Managers on how to run and read those reports.
* Centralize & be the owner of all financial reporting & key account KPI (incl. Economic Profit) – ensuring relevance & accuracy throughout the year.
* Analysis of Global Account financials every quarter and the key insights from investor conferences
* Build PUMA (project management) reports that provide relevant insights to Global Account leadership team and ensure PUMA data is accurate and complete according our internal Global Account guidelines.


Price Negotiation Support and Cost Optimization Activities* Consolidate cost data provided by pricing team, insights provided by the Purchasing team and then help build negotiation strategies for semesterly price negotiation with the client, capturing learnings to ensure continuous improvement and successful negotiations.
* Provide price quotations and estimate sales and profit impacts for commercial deals.
* Identify, track, record and measure value of activities and services to the client. (e.g. estimate savings offered to the client through price decrease, rebates, cost optimization activities). Ensure we maximize our result on savings we provide in their KPI metrics system.
* Work with VP Global Account on new commercial deals/ business models for management validation internally then on the negotiation of them with the client.
* Track all the ongoing commercial deals.


Global Coordination* Centrally orchestrate key financial planning activities (e.g., 5-year Strategy Refresh, Quarterly RSFs & Budgeting, Market Potentials etc.) along the year requiring action by the global team, ensuring standard procedures and best practices are followed for each activity.
* Support the Global Account Director for presentation with management and other stakeholders (e.g., Board Presentation, CFO presentation).
* Support Global Business Development Manager with data mining & analyses.
* Centralize ad-hoc requests, leveraging prior work and ensuring minimal disruption to account-team.
* Establish best practices for global back-office/account support team vis-à-vis internal IFF systems & processes (SAP, BW, PUMA)– engaging IT support where needed to automate (e.g., mass-upload).

  

Global team meetings and calls* Setting up agendas, taking minutes, following up on actions and generally supporting internal Global Account Leadership team meetings


Culture and Leadership
To be fully successful in this role you will demonstrate ideal leadership behaviors and live the IFF culture.
Our high performing culture is driven by 3 pillars:* Extreme accountability: we set clear expectations with others, take responsibility for both success and failures and stand up for what is ethical and right.
* Bias for action: we forge ahead with clear purpose, never leaving our integrity behind. We make informed decisions, plan, and focus on few critical priorities.
* Effective Collaboration: we activist seek our partners throughout the organization to achieve our business goals, putting aside personal interests to do what is best for IFF.


We are a global leader in taste, scent, and nutrition, offering our customers a broader range of natural solutions and accelerating our growth strategy. At IFF, we believe that your uniqueness unleashes our potential. We value the diverse mosaic of the ethnicity, national origin, race, age, sex, or veteran status. We strive for an inclusive workplace that allows each of our colleagues to bring their authentic self to work regardless of their religion, gender identity & expression, sexual orientation, or disability.
Visit IFF.com/careers/workplace-diversity-and-inclusion to learn more
