title: Software Engineer ASP.NET / C#
description:
**About Ostrica**

Ostrica Investments is an independent, data driven and fast growing asset management company and hedge-fund growing towards their ambition of becoming a FinTech company. They have positioned themselves as a niche player in developing a unique mix of quantitative and fundamental investment strategies over the last decade. They use a self-developed multi-factor valuation system with machine learning and artificial intelligence that continuously looks at which companies are the most attractive in terms of valuation. The unique ‘man & machine’ investment concept enables the Portfolio Management Department to realize high Sharpe ratios. This department processes several million data items per day through a layered system of several hundred programmed investment decisions.


**Your Role**

To support the expansion and growth and reach their ambition of growing towards a FinTech company we are currently recruiting for a Software Engineer to join the IT team and mainly focus on development of the Ostrica portals. You will also participate in the transformation of migrating the IT & Data Infrastructure to Azure cloud, with the clear goal of making the environment scalable and future proof.


**Responsibilities**

* Support the business by maintaining and further developing the applications/portals used for reporting, trading, client servicing, etc.
* Work in close cooperation with all stakeholders in other teams within the organization as well as external (IT) parties, data scientists, programmers, providers of market data, etc.
* Support in all phases of the development lifecycle starting with analyzing and estimating business
* Requirement setting, designing, implementing, and testing the solutions, and finally deploying and maintaining the software

**Profile**

* Minimum HBO level – University degree in Computer Science or a comparable study
* Experience in coding in ASP.NET and C#
* Experience with SQL databases: running jobs, SQL scripts ,stored procedures in Microsoft SQL server
* Preferably knowledge about migration from On prem to cloud
* Preferably experience in Microsoft Azure cloud infrastructure and developing solutions in cloud
* Experience or proven interest in the financial sector, capital markets and/or asset management
* Excellent written and spoken English
* Understanding of Dutch is a plus

#### **soft skills:**

* Excellent analysis and problem-solving skills and acute attention to detail
* Strategic thinker
* Excellent project management skills
* Ability to work independently and in a team
* Proactiveness and willingness to take responsibility
* Ability to communicate effectively, constructively and professionally
* Client-oriented with an attention to practice and efficiency

**The Offer**

* An annual salary up to € 90.000,-
* An entrepreneurial environment with a high degree of freedom and responsibility
* Learning & development opportunities;
* Hybrid working options;
* Pension regulations;
* 25 vacation days;
* Travel allowance;
* A lunch facility where a healthy lunch is prepared daily;
* And a nice workplace in the easily accessible Amstelveen with enough parking options.

**NOTE: We are open for providing VISA sponsorship / NOT for relocation**

**Interested? Or do you have questions about this position?**

RIXT® Recruitment exclusively handles the recruitment & selection for this role. Contact Ameet Sidhoe from RIXT®: 06 - 18 83 05 76 or email at Ameet@RIXTrecruitment.nl .

title: Postdoc 'Nurturing Connections: The Role of Physical Closeness in Parent-Infant Well-being and Development'
description:
4 years ***The transition to parenthood can be challenging and is often related to mental and physical problems in parents. Parent-infant physical closeness (PIPC) sharply decreases over the first months in Western families, while studies show that PIPC is important for healthy child development and potentially also for maternal wellbeing. PIPC may hence offer unique opportunities to support both child development and new parents’ wellbeing. However, large gaps in knowledge on fathers, causal associations, underlying mechanisms, and long-term relations preclude further developments. Will you help us with further research?***  

  

This 4-year project is financed by NWO and focused on early parenthood and infancy and will be lead by Prof Dr. Carolina de Weerth (Developmental Psychobiology Lab).  

  

Our multidisciplinary team will fill these gaps with sophisticated intervention, experimental, and longitudinal studies on daily life PIPC: baby carrying, skin-to-skin contact, and room sharing. We will determine whether, to what extent, and through what mechanisms easily accessible avenues for increasing PIPC can lead to improved maternal, paternal, and child mental and physical health, both concurrently as well as later in childhood and adolescence.  

  

The project includes collaborators from Erasmus University Rotterdam, Utrecht University, and University of Trento. You will be part of a team consisting of senior researchers, a PhD student, a student assistant, as well as perinatal professionals and parents. You will be affiliated to the Donders Institute for Brain Cognition and Behaviour and the Baby & Child Research Center.  

  

We offer a challenging position in an innovative project within a team of dedicated colleagues. Our collaboration is characterized by creativity, collegiality, team work, and responsibility. You will be part of a dynamic, enthusiastic, collaborative, and ambitious research group specialized in early life, the developmental psychobiology lab.  

  

**Tasks and responsibilities*** Developing and pre-registering research protocols.
* Preparing and submitting (medical) ethical applications.
* Support recruitment and data collection.
* Data analysis and statistical analyses.
* Writing and dissemination of results for peer-reviewed publications in high-impact journals.
* Writing and dissemination of results for the public, professionals, internal reports, etc.
* Presentation of findings at conferences and symposia.
* Training and supervision of PhD and (Research) Master students, as well as research assistants.


The ideal start date is 1 January 2025. At Radboud university medical center, you build on your future. We are committed to providing the best care, education, and research. And we are true to our word, because we help you develop and seize opportunities and give you the room to grow. As an employer, we believe that employees should feel vital and happy at work in all stages of life. We are also committed to creating a healthy and safe working environment. Our employment conditions contribute to that. What we offer:* A gross monthly salary between € 3.493 and € 5.504 (scale 10) for full-time employment (36 hours per week). You will also receive an 8% holiday allowance, an 8.3% end-of-year bonus, and a 47% to 72% bonus for working unsocial hours.
* 172 vacation hours per year based on a 36-hour working week. (As of 1 January 2025, you will receive 176 vacation hours.)
* An Employment Conditions Selection Model, allowing you to use part of your employment conditions to your choosing. For example, you can use your gross salary to purchase additional vacation hours or hours for providing informal caregiving. Or, for example, you can use your gross end-of-year bonus to purchase a bicycle, so you pay less tax.
* Plenty of opportunities for personal development. You can take a variety of courses in our online learning environment.
* Your well-being and vitality are a priority. For example:
	+ Save time for work-life balance leave.
	+ A 40% discount on a sports membership of the Radboud Sports Center.
	+ Healthy Professionals program to help you manage your energy.
	+ Company Support Team and a personal coach if you are going through a life-changing event.
	+ Financially beneficial working less through a Generation Scheme as you approach state pension age.
* Support in achieving a good work-life balance at every stage of your life. Examples:
	+ Advice and courses on, for example, 'Millennial dilemmas' and 'Your Career After 57'.
	+ Activities at our own mindfulness center.
	+ Informal caregiving consultations if you have questions about juggling work and caregiving responsibilities at home.
* In addition to statutory pregnancy and maternity leave, Radboud university medical center offers 26 weeks of parental leave, nine of which are paid. In addition, as a partner you can take a maximum of five weeks of supplementary partner leave. During supplementary partner leave and parental leave, we supplement the UWV benefit up to 100% of your salary.
* Pension accrual at the ABP Pension Fund. Radboud university medical center pays 70% of the pension premium.
* Discounts on supplementary packages of two group health insurances and ten other types of insurance, from home insurance to legal assistance.
* As of 1 October 2024: an allowance for your commuting costs of € 0.18 per km up to a maximum of 40 km one way. If you use public transport to commute, we will fully reimburse the public transport costs (2nd class). If you regularly work from home, you will receive a working from home allowance of € 2.35 per day.


For this position you will work at the Department Cognitive Neuroscience of Radboud university medical center (Radboudumc). The Cognitive Neuroscience department is part of the Donders Institute for Brain, Cognition and Behavior ('the Donders'). The Donders is a world-class research network with over 1,000 scientists dedicated to advancing brain, cognitive, and behavioral sciences. The institute enables access to the most advanced research facilities, fosters interdisciplinary collaborations, and trains new generations of researchers. Research into stress and stress-related disorders is an important area of attention.  

  

**Radboudumc**  

Welcome to Radboud university medical center (Radboudumc), where our research groups strive for innovative solutions that make impact on health and healthcare. We challenge the status quo to overcome current and future health challenges. Our goal is to shape the future of healthcare for generations to come. Our focus is on prevention, sustainability, and meaningful care, which we achieve through our in-depth understanding of disease mechanisms, clinical science, public health research, medical technology and data science. Our approach is centered on breakthroughs that can truly enhance personalized healthcare and public health.  

  

At Radboudumc, a comprehensive range of research programs provide the compass for our research efforts. Each program has a clear goal, where collaboration within and outside our organization is highly valued. We integrate care, education and research in partnership with our patients to ensure that our research programs have significant impact on health and healthcare. We invite you to join us in our mission to create a healthy future for all. Our ideal candidate has a PhD diploma in psychology, pedagogics, or similar study and strong affinity with the perinatal period and working with young parents. You have excellent communicative skills, strong writing skills and good statistical skills. You are fluent in English (spoken and written), fluency in the Dutch language is an advantage.  

  

In addition you possess the profile below:* Excellent organizational skills and highly precise in communication and data management.
* A proactive attitude and eager to learn and develop academic skills.
* Independent working style.
* A collaborative spirit and flourishes within team science.


Any questions? Or wondering what it is like to work at Radboudumc? Then email toProf. Dr. Carolina de Weerth, full professor CNS. Use the Apply button to submit your application.

title: Postdoc Foundation Models for Radar-based Autonomous Vehicle Perception
description:
Postdoc Foundation Models for Radar-based Autonomous Vehicle Perception
 Apply Now
Job description


Autonomous vehicles have been shown to underperform when deployed on conditions that differ substantially from the training conditions, so-called domain gaps. These domain gaps can include deployment in different regions, weather or using different sensors. Numerous domain adaptation methods have been proposed to bridge these domain gaps and let the model operate well on the target data. In this project we seek to find an intermediate representation for data coming from varied sources. By bringing new data into this representation, we overcome domain gaps and are able to train models that are robust to different conditions, also referred to as foundation models. While foundation models have achieved widespread success on images and text, currently none exist for radar data, making this a promising research direction. These foundation models will bring superior performance and allow us to utilize data from varied sources, thus reducing the data collection and labeling costs.



The Intelligent Vehicles section at TU Delft, the Netherlands, invites applications for a fully funded two-year (up to 30 months) Post-Doctoral research position in the area of foundation models for autonomous vehicles. This position is part of the EU Horizon project Cynergie4MIE and in collaboration with the chip company NXP. While the exact task (detection, segmentation) is flexible, it should make use of radar sensors, potentially fused with other sensors. Your results will be published in top tier conferences like CVPR, ICCV, ECCV, ICRA and NeurIPS. For your work you will have access to the compute resources of TU Delft, ranging from personal machines, to shared GPU servers, the Delft AI Cluster that is shared across departments, as well as DelftBlue, which is one of the top 250 supercomputers in the world. Your main supervisor will be Dr. Holger Caesar, creator of the nuScenes dataset and co-author of the PointPillars method for lidar-based object detection. You will receive hands-on mentoring for your career development and help with applying for future research grants, to kick-start your continued academic career.


Requirements


* We are seeking Post-Doc applicants with an interest in performing cutting edge research in an active and exciting research area.
* Prospective applicants should have a strong academic record with a solid background in sensor processing (vision/radar/lidar, sensor fusion) and Machine Learning (Deep Learning, domain adaptation, foundation models).
* Good programming skills (Python/Matlab) and knowledge of deep-learning frameworks (TensorFlow/PyTorch) are expected.
* A certain affinity towards turning complex concepts into real-world practice (i.e. vehicle demonstrator) is desired.
* The successful candidate is expected to be able to act independently as well as to collaborate effectively with members of a larger team and supervise Master and PhD students. Good English skills are required.


Conditions of employment


Salary and benefits are in accordance with the Collective Labour Agreement for Dutch Universities. The TU Delft offers a customisable compensation package, discounts on health insurance, and a monthly work costs contribution. Flexible work schedules can be arranged.



From 1 September next, a salary increase of 3.7% applies due to a Collective Agreement amendment, followed by an additional 1% increase on 1 January 2025. In addition, most employees employed on 1 September 2024 will receive a one-off payment of €300 gross based on full-time employment.



For international applicants, TU Delft has the Coming to Delft Service. This service provides information for new international employees to help you prepare the relocation and to settle in the Netherlands. The Coming to Delft Service offers a Dual Career Programme for partners and they organise events to expand your (social) network.


TU Delft (Delft University of Technology)


Delft University of Technology is built on strong foundations. As creators of the world-famous Dutch waterworks and pioneers in biotech, TU Delft is a top international university combining science, engineering and design. It delivers world class results in education, research and innovation to address challenges in the areas of energy, climate, mobility, health and digital society. For generations, our engineers have proven to be entrepreneurial problem-solvers, both in business and in a social context.



At TU Delft we embrace diversity as one of our core values and we actively engage to be a university where you feel at home and can flourish. We value different perspectives and qualities. We believe this makes our work more innovative, the TU Delft community more vibrant and the world more just. Together, we imagine, invent and create solutions using technology to have a positive impact on a global scale. That is why we invite you to apply. Your application will receive fair consideration.



Challenge. Change. Impact!


Faculty Mechanical Engineering


From chip to ship. From machine to human being. From idea to solution. Driven by a deep-rooted desire to understand our environment and discover its underlying mechanisms, research and education at the ME faculty focusses on fundamental understanding, design, production including application and product improvement, materials, processes and (mechanical) systems.



ME is a dynamic and innovative faculty with high-tech lab facilities and international reach. It’s a large faculty but also versatile, so we can often make unique connections by combining different disciplines. This is reflected in ME’s outstanding, state-of-the-art education, which trains students to become responsible and socially engaged engineers and scientists. We translate our knowledge and insights into solutions to societal issues, contributing to a sustainable society and to the development of prosperity and well-being. That is what unites us in pioneering research, inspiring education and (inter)national cooperation.



Click here to go to the website of the Faculty of Mechanical Engineering. Do you want to experience working at our faculty? These videos will introduce you to some of our researchers and their work.


Additional information


The work takes place in Delft, The Netherlands, but allows for working two days per week from home.



For information, please contact Dr. Holger Caesar (h.caesar@tudelft.nl).


Application procedure


Are you interested in this vacancy? Please apply before **15 September 2024** via the application button and upload your motivation and CV.


* A pre-employment screening can be part of the selection procedure.
* You can apply online. We will not process applications sent by email and/or post.
* Please do not contact us for unsolicited services.


FACULTY/DEPARTMENT### **Faculty of Mechanical Engineering**

JOB TYPE### **Postdoc Positions**

SCIENTIFIC FIELD### **Engineering**

HOURS PER WEEK### **38-40**

SALARY### **€ 3.226,00 - € 5.090,00**

DESIRED LEVEL OF EDUCATION### **Doctorate**

VACANCY NUMBER### **TUD05662**


Apply Now

title: Postdoc Federated Learning for Autonomous Vehicle Perception and Prediction
description:
Postdoc Federated Learning for Autonomous Vehicle Perception and Prediction
 Apply Now
Job description


Autonomous vehicles have come a long way from initial public testing with safety drivers to fully driverless deployments in multiple cities across the world. However, to further improve these vehicles, they need to be trained from ever growing data sources collected by their fleets. Due to the vast cost of storing and processing this data, car manufacturers face the problem that they can only store a fraction of it (storing 1h of data costs about $5000 per year). Therefore new paradigms are needed to reduce the storage and processing cost.



Federated learning is such a novel paradigm that revolutionizes how Machine Learning systems are trained. Rather than storing all data on a central server and training there, federated learning allows us to learn in a distributed way. In the case of autonomous vehicles, this means that every vehicle can perform training steps while the system is idle, thereby saving energy and bandwidth. Furthermore, federated learning is much less privacy-sensitive, since sensor data of faces does not need to be transferred to the cloud.



The Intelligent Vehicles section at TU Delft, the Netherlands, invites applications for a fully funded two-year (up to 30 months) Post-Doctoral research position in the area of federated learning for autonomous vehicles. This position is part of the EU Horizon project Cynergie4MIE and in collaboration with the chip company NXP. You will be one of the first to train modern perception and/or prediction (a.k.a. motion forecasting) algorithms in a federated learning setup and provide an analysis of the pros and cons of this approach. While the exact task (detection, segmentation, prediction) is flexible, it should make use of radar sensors, potentially fused with other sensors. Your results will be published in top tier conferences like CVPR, ICCV, ECCV, ICRA and NeurIPS. For your work you will have access to the compute resources of TU Delft, ranging from personal machines, to shared GPU servers, the Delft AI Cluster that is shared across departments, as well as DelftBlue, which is one of the top 250 supercomputers in the world. Your main supervisor will be Dr. Holger Caesar, creator of the nuScenes dataset and co-author of the PointPillars method for lidar-based object detection. You will receive hands-on mentoring for your career development and help with applying for future research grants, to kick-start your continued academic career.


Requirements


* We are seeking Post-Doc applicants with an interest in performing cutting edge research in an active and exciting research area.
* Prospective applicants should have a strong academic record with a solid background in sensor processing (vision/radar/lidar, sensor fusion) and Machine Learning (Deep Learning, optionally federated learning).
* Good programming skills (Python/Matlab) and knowledge of deep-learning frameworks (TensorFlow/PyTorch) are expected.
* A certain affinity towards turning complex concepts into real-world practice (i.e. vehicle demonstrator) is desired.
* The successful candidate is expected to be able to act independently as well as to collaborate effectively with members of a larger team and supervise Master and PhD students.
* Good English skills are required.


Conditions of employment


Salary and benefits are in accordance with the Collective Labour Agreement for Dutch Universities. The TU Delft offers a customisable compensation package, discounts on health insurance, and a monthly work costs contribution. Flexible work schedules can be arranged.



From 1 September next, a salary increase of 3.7% applies due to a Collective Agreement amendment, followed by an additional 1% increase on 1 January 2025. In addition, most employees employed on 1 September 2024 will receive a one-off payment of €300 gross based on full-time employment.



For international applicants, TU Delft has the Coming to Delft Service. This service provides information for new international employees to help you prepare the relocation and to settle in the Netherlands. The Coming to Delft Service offers a Dual Career Programme for partners and they organise events to expand your (social) network.


TU Delft (Delft University of Technology)


Delft University of Technology is built on strong foundations. As creators of the world-famous Dutch waterworks and pioneers in biotech, TU Delft is a top international university combining science, engineering and design. It delivers world class results in education, research and innovation to address challenges in the areas of energy, climate, mobility, health and digital society. For generations, our engineers have proven to be entrepreneurial problem-solvers, both in business and in a social context.



At TU Delft we embrace diversity as one of our core values and we actively engage to be a university where you feel at home and can flourish. We value different perspectives and qualities. We believe this makes our work more innovative, the TU Delft community more vibrant and the world more just. Driven by a deep-rooted desire to understand our environment and discover its underlying mechanisms, research and education at the ME faculty focusses on fundamental understanding, design, production including application and product improvement, materials, processes and (mechanical) systems.



ME is a dynamic and innovative faculty with high-tech lab facilities and international reach. title: RF Validation Engineer
description:
***Join our cutting-edge start-up adventure!***

**Who are we?**  

Imagine being part of the dynamic journey at Qualinx – a start-up born when three visionary PhD Engineers from TU Delft set out to revolutionize radio chip technology. At Qualinx, we're on a mission to conquer the high-power consumption challenges in Global Navigation Satellite Systems and IoT sensors. With a great team of over 38 individuals, scaling to 50, hosting more than 16 nationalities, we've achieved the impossible - the world's lowest power GNSS chipset. Now, we're on the verge of unleashing our game-changing digital RF technology product, ready to flood the market with millions of annual shipments.  



**What Sets Us Apart**



Joining Qualinx isn't just about a job; it's about embracing high standards, and boldly navigating unexpected challenges. We thrive on collaboration, with a commitment to self-improvement and product excellence. At Qualinx, you're not just an employee; you're an integral part of our exciting journey, contributing to the growth and success of a ground breaking solution.

  


**Job Description**



As an RF Validation Engineer, you will be responsible for creating and carrying out test plans, as well as troubleshooting and analyzing RF measurements using automated test setups. The following will be your core responsibilities:


* Collaborate with the internal design team to define measurement requirements effectively.
* Develop and execute characterization test plans to report the performance of all the parametric data from RF Front End.
* Create Python scripts based on the test plans and perform measurements using automated setups with PXI system and RF instruments.
* Collect and organize data to verify RF performance across different operating conditions, such as temperature, voltage, and process corners.
* Utilize SQL and Jupyter for data management and data visualization.
* Debug and troubleshoot issues that arise during testing, including debugging circuits, analyzing data, and proposing solutions in collaboration with design, application and software teams.
* Document test procedures, results, and specifications for internal reference.
* Develop and configure test equipment (hardware/software/automation) in support of performance characterization.
* Ownership spanning from component-level to full system operation, including SoC bring-up.

 **Requirements**



Qualinx is looking for a result driven and conscientious RF Validation Engineer. Someone who thrives in an environment where your proactive and can-do attitude is highly appreciated. The ideal candidate for this role should have:


* BSc or MSc in Electrical Engineering degree.
* In-depth knowledge and experience with RF circuits include amplifiers, filters, mixers, oscillators and measurement techniques.
* Experienced in PVT characterization and expertise in testing hardware and firmware, including automated test management, integration, and lab failure troubleshooting.
* Experienced in data management and data visualization.
* Experience conducting large-scale automation lab testing across multiple products concurrently.
* Experience in working with Lab equipment, including PXIe, Spectrum analysers, Network analysers, Digitizing Oscilloscopes, Signal generators, DMMs, and programmable power supplies.
* Skilled in programming languages and software tools like MATLAB, Python, and Excel.
* Familiar with microcontroller programming in C language, with knowledge of peripheral interfaces and their integration into embedded systems.
* Proficiency in version control software like GIT.
* Fluency in English, both written and spoken.
* Having knowledge of GNSS and IoT protocols would be considered a bonus point.

  

**What's in it for you?**

* Given that we are a start-up, we provide all our employees with Stock Appreciation Rights. You will be eligible to financially profit from Qualinx's success.
* We support you in your visa process if needed.
* Saving for your pension: we provide an extra 2% of your monthly base salary.
* 25 vacation days based on a 40-hour workweek.
* Work in a beautiful and modern office and lab with all the necessary equipment you need to deliver a great job.
* Every quarter we organize fantastic social events, where we celebrate the success of Qualinx by going out for a great meal, playing VR games, going bowling, etc.
* At Qualinx we invest in the development of our employees, we offer monthly Lunch & Learn sessions to keep everyone who is interested up to speed.

title: BI Analyst / Product Owner Business Intelligence (f/m/x)
description:
The Nippon Express Group is one of the leading global logistics service providers whose Japanese corporation is headquartered in Tokyo. Our services range from air and ocean freight forwarding to cargo, removal services and warehouse operations. The company has numerous freight centers, warehouses and provides logistics services in over 45 countries on six continents with a global network of over 70,000 employees. The logistics focus is mainly on automotive and fashion industries, pharmaceutical products and further consumer goods. Within the past years Nippon Express has been on a continuous growth path within the EMEA region and we are looking for new talents to join our mission.


We seek a skilled Business Analyst with BI Tooling (Tableau) expertise to join our team. You will be responsible for meeting various stakeholders' data and enabling analytics needs by developing comprehensive dashboards, reports, and visualizations on the (Tableau cloud) platform.


**This role requires a strong understanding of data analysis, and excellent communication skills to support data-driven decisions. This is an excellent opportunity to enhance your skills and contribute to our digitalization journey.**

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Stakeholder Management:** Build strong relationships and effectively manage competing priorities across business units.
* **Dashboard Development:** **”):** Utilize Tableau (Cloud) or similar BI tools to create and manage complex data visualizations and dashboards.
* **Data Analysis:** Gather and analyze data to provide actionable insights that support business objectives.
* **Communication:** Provide comprehensive training and support to the European Business Development division and its business users to enhance data-driven decision-making, ensuring all division requirements are met.
* **Reporting:** Develop reports and dashboards, ensuring they meet the highest standards of accuracy and reliability.
* **Cross-functional Collaboration:** Work seamlessly with diverse teams across functions and geographical locations.
* **Requirements Gathering:** Identify, analyze, and translate complex business requirements into actionable Tableau Cloud dashboards, reports, and visualizations.
* **Tableau Advocacy:** Promote the use of Tableau Cloud and foster a data-driven culture within the organization.

**Requirements**

* You should have a minimum of 2-4 years of initial work experience as a Business Intelligence Analyst/ Project Manager/ Developer for BI Tool Implementation or in a similar role.
* A good understanding of data analytics and business intelligence concepts with a focus on business performance analysis is required.
* You must have experience in creating dashboards and visualizations using Tableau, Power BI, or other BI tools.
* The role is partially a product owner role which requires excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to train non-technical audiences (e.g., Sales Representatives) to expand the adoption of BI/ Tableau dashboards.
* Furthermore, you are efficient in gathering requirements, analyzing data, and delivering actionable insights.
* Capable to work effectively in a matrix organization.
* Self-motivated and proactive, with excellent organizational skills and capable of working autonomously or collaboratively in a team setting.
* Fluency in English is required, other languages are a plus.

**Benefits**

* A permanent position within a leading logistics company
* Motivating tasks within a diverse and international environment
* Great team members who will help you to get onboarded quickly
* Excellent Work-Life-Balance, possibility to Work From Home (hybrid model)
* Various additional benefits

title: Data Analyst I - Security & Fraud Insights
description:
Role Description:
**Role Description:**  

  

We are seeking an experienced Data Analyst to join our talented and highly skilled Security & Fraud Insights team at our global headquarters in Amsterdam. In Security & Fraud, we are dedicated to ensuring our customers, partners, employees, and company are protected while experiencing the world and doing their best work.

  

As a Data Analyst in Security & Fraud Insights, you will leverage your data skills and business acumen to make impactful contributions every day. You will partner with cross-functional teams to track business performance, identify risks and opportunities, and develop high-quality reporting and data sources that support stakeholders with actionable insights.

  

This role specifically involves supporting the successful execution of core control initiatives, including the creation and maintenance of automated reporting for core controls in alignment with the strategic priorities of our Security, Safety & Fraud Department.

  

We are looking for a passionate individual who can deeply understand our business processes, utilize data smartly to generate insights, and drive meaningful change that reduces costs and enhances performance. You will also have the opportunity to gain exposure to security and fraud threats and their impact on the business.


Key Job Responsibilities and Duties:

* Collaborate with teams across various business units, building positive relationships, and translating business needs into actionable reports, dashboards, and analyses.
* Develop and maintain KPIs, dashboards, and reports to help stakeholders understand their segment's performance, identify risks, and pinpoint actionable opportunities.
* Perform ad-hoc analysis and communicate results effectively to stakeholders at all levels.
* Organize and present findings to ensure stakeholders can make informed decisions.
* Develop and maintain data processing workflows, debugging them as necessary.
* Implement data controls and monitoring systems to improve the reliability of data and reports.

 **Role Qualifications and Requirements:**

* Experience in data analysis, with a proven track record in data management, visualization, and ensuring data quality.
* Strong knowledge and experience with data analysis and visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Data Studio, Power BI).
* Proficiency in at least one data analysis language (e.g., SQL, Python, R).
* Experience in designing and implementing key performance indicators.
* Prior experience in a commercial environment, reporting on business performance and operations.
* Ability to translate complex data insights into clear, actionable recommendations for stakeholders.
* Excellent organizational skills, attention to detail, and analytical reasoning.
* Excellent communication skills and the ability to convey complex analysis results clearly and with conviction to all levels of stakeholders
* Strong interpersonal skills with an open and collaborative attitude.
* Knowledge of or background in risk & controls is a plus.

 **Benefits & Perks: Global Impact, Personal Relevance**

  

Booking.com’s Total Rewards Philosophy is not only about compensation but also about benefits. Our Total Rewards strive to make it easier for you to experience all that life has to offer on your terms so that you can focus on what really matters. We offer competitive compensation as well as thoughtful, valuable, and even fun benefits which include:

* Headquarters located in one of the most dynamic and cosmopolitan cities in Europe: Amsterdam.
* Contribute to a high scale, sophisticated, world-class product and see the real time impact of your work on millions of travellers worldwide.
* Be part of a truly international fast paced environment and performance driven culture.
* Full relocation support for you and your family to move to Amsterdam. We have fine-tuned this process by successfully relocating over 300 Technology professionals to Amsterdam in the last year alone!
* Performance-based company that offers 29 vacation days, career advancement, and lucrative compensation, including bonuses and stock potential.
* Discount on Booking.com accommodations with the “Booking Deal” including other perks and benefits.
* Company-sponsored family and social activities to help our employees become integrated with each other and Dutch culture.
* Diverse and creative colleagues from every corner of the world.
* Health, life, and disability insurance\*
* Annual paid time off and generous paid leave scheme including: parent, grandparent, bereavement, and care leave.
* Hybrid working including flexible working arrangements, and up to 20 days per year working from abroad (home country).
* Industry leading product discounts for yourself, friends, and family, including automatic Genius Level 3 status and quarterly Booking.com wallet credit.
* Free access to online learning platforms, development and mentorship programs, and a complimentary Headspace membership
* On-site meals, coffee, and snacks, including healthy and vegan options, daily\*

**#ThinkInclusion: Wellbeing & Inclusion at Booking.com:**

  

Inclusion, Diversity, Belonging, Wellbeing and Volunteering (IDBWV) have been a core part of our company culture since day one. This ongoing journey starts with our very own employees, who represent over 140 nationalities and a wide range of ethnic and social backgrounds, genders and sexual orientations.


Take it from our Chief People Officer, Paulo Pisano: “At Booking.com, the diversity of our people doesn’t just create a unique workplace, it also creates a better and more inclusive travel experience for everyone. Inclusion is at the heart of everything we do. It’s a place where you can make your mark and have a real impact in travel and tech.”


We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable adjustment to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment.


Booking.com is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. We strive to move well beyond traditional equal opportunity and work to create an environment that allows everyone to thrive.
company_description: Making it easier for everyone to experience the world.

title: Data Analyst
Data Analyst
description:
#### **Your mission**


Data, both quantitative and qualitative, is an essential building block of the services and solutions we provide for our clients. Increasingly, our clients express and see the need to measure, monitor and report on circularity. Yet, the how and what are not as clear and standardised as for example on climate and GHG. To that end, we are seeking an ambitious and experienced individual to join our young and ambitious consulting firm as an experienced Data Analyst. In this combined strategic and hands-on role, you will help build a team of skilled data analysts to develop data-driven insights and solutions for our clients. Your responsibilities will include developing and overseeing the end-to-end data analysis process, from data collection and cleaning to analytics and reporting. You will collaborate closely with clients to understand their business objectives and translate them into analytical strategies. Additionally, you will help us develop new methodologies and service offerings in the young field of business intelligence on circular economy performance, with the opportunity to join leading global initiatives and partnerships on framework development and standard setting.

#### **Your profile**


We would like to invite you to apply for this position if you have:

  

* You have 5-10 years of relevant experience
* An educational background in preferably Industrial ecology, environmental analysis or a similar field
* Experience in as a data analyst in, or affinity with working in, a commercial environment
* Knowledge and understanding of Life Cycle Assessment (LCA), Material Flow Accounting (MFA) and related methodologies
* Knowledge and understanding of upcoming legislation such as the EU Corporate Sustainability Reporting Directive (CSRD, CSDD, Taxonomy)
* The ability to work on and apply standards and frameworks such as SBTn, LEAP, GRI and/or CTI
* Experience with applying or working with technical data analyst tools such as programming language, database tools, data visualisation and/or other business intelligence solutions (e.g. Python, PowerBI, Microsoft Excel, SQL, Tableau)
* Leadership skills that allow you to support and advise other data analysts in the execution of their work
* A hands-on mentality and willingness to support the execution of projects when needed
* The ability to show flexibility and adaptability to a fast-paced work environment
* A positive attitude and a team player mentality
* You have excellent written and spoken communication skills in English;


Nice to have  

* Experience in a business environment to work with data, develop KPIs and dashboards
* Ability to understand business requirements and identify relevant data analyses to provide insights that meet business needs.

#### **Why us?**


This is a full-time position (32-40 hours per week, initially a 1-year contract) based in the Netherlands, with our office conveniently located in central Amsterdam. Candidates should be prepared to work primarily from our office and be legally authorised to work in the Netherlands. Salary is competitive, keeping in mind we are an impact-first, startup organisation, based in Amsterdam. \*\*\****This role is only open to people who are legally authorised to work in the Netherlands We do not provide sponsorship \*\*\****  

  

**To apply please respond with your CV and a short motivation letter in which you give an answer to the following 3 questions (max 150 words per answer):**

  

* What excites you most about the opportunity to work with Circle Economy Consulting?
* What is your perspective on the role of data in the transition to a circular economy for businesses?
* What are three things you want us to know about you that are relevant for this position?

**!!!Only applications with responses to the above questions will be considered !!!**  

***Please note : The role has now been re-opened and The new deadline for applications will be the 20th September 2024***#### **About us**

  


Circle Economy Consulting is an impact first consultancy. We focus our expertise and effort to work with forward-thinking leaders and businesses to identify, evaluate and implement circular solutions.

title: Data Architect
description:
**About the Role:**  

**Grade Level (for internal use):** 09
  
  

**The Team:**  

Our Data Architecture team specifies data structures based on the concepts, relationships, taxonomies or classifications that reflect reality. Every day you will work with people from a wide variety of backgrounds, disciplines and geographies, and diverse data sets and metadata-driven capabilities.
  
  

**Responsibilities and Impact:**  

Specify appropriate data structures for various software development projects. Manage metadata in the Data Management System (DMS), the enterprise’s metadata repository.
  
  

Coordinate with the Data Services engineering team on the implementation of data structures and a ssist with database-level performance analysis and troubleshooting
  
  

Deliver training, technical support, and functional support
  
  

Ensure database design and metadata conforms to data management and enterprise standards
  
  

Ensure uniform implementation across platforms and applications
  
  

This position provides a tremendous opportunity to grow personally and professionally. We provide considerable training so you can become comfortable with our proprietary information systems.
  
  

You will collaborate with Scrum Masters, Project Managers, Content Analyst, Developers and DBAs to design solutions based on industry standard methodologies, and use your critical thinking skills to overcome challenges
  
  

**What W e’re L ooking F or :**  

**Basic Required Qualifications:**  

Strong conceptual understanding of relational database concepts and modelling
  
  

Strong Project Management skills, e.g., written and verbal communication, organization, requirements elicitation and consensus-building
  
  

Strong detail-orientation
  
  

Basic understanding of programming concepts
  
  

**Additional Preferred Qualifications:**  

Hands-on experience with at least one RDBMS (MSSQL, PGSQL, Oracle)
  
  

Basic understanding of financial concepts
  
  

Basic knowledge and understanding of S&P Global Market Intelligence database and corporate structure, systems, products, and services
  
  

About S&P Global Market Intelligence
  
  

At S&P Global Market Intelligence, a division of S&P Global we understand the importance of accurate, deep and insightful information. Our team of experts delivers unrivaled insights and leading data and technology solutions, partnering with customers to expand their perspective, operate with confidence, and make decisions with conviction.
  
  

For more information, visit www.spglobal.com/marketintelligence .
  
  

What’s In It For You?
  
  

**Our Purpose:**  

Progress is not a self-starter. It requires a catalyst to be set in motion. Information, imagination, people, technology–the right combination can unlock possibility and change the world.
  
  

Our world is in transition and getting more complex by the day. We push past expected observations and seek out new levels of understanding so that we can help companies, governments and individuals make an impact on tomorrow. At S&P Global we transform data into Essential Intelligence®, pinpointing risks and opening possibilities. We Accelerate Progress.
  
  

**Our People:**  

We're more than 35,000 strong worldwide—so we're able to understand nuances while having a broad perspective. Our team is driven by curiosity and a shared belief that Essential Intelligence can help build a more prosperous future for us all.
  
  

From finding new ways to measure sustainability to analyzing energy transition across the supply chain to building workflow solutions that make it easy to tap into insight and apply it. We are changing the way people see things and empowering them to make an impact on the world we live in. We’re committed to a more equitable future and to helping our customers find new, sustainable ways of doing business. We’re constantly seeking new solutions that have progress in mind. Join us and help create the critical insights that truly make a difference.
  
  

**Our Values:**  

Integrity, Discovery, Partnership
  
  

At S&P Global, we focus on Powering Global Markets. Throughout our history, the world's leading organizations have relied on us for the Essential Intelligence they need to make confident decisions about the road ahead. We start with a foundation of integrity in all we do, bring a spirit of discovery to our work, and collaborate in close partnership with each other and our customers to achieve shared goals.
  
  

**Benefits:**  

We take care of you, so you can take care of business. We care about our people. That’s why we provide everything you—and your career—need to thrive at S&P Global.
  
  

**Our benefits include:**  

**Health & Wellness:** Health care coverage designed for the mind and body.
  
  

**Flexible Downtime:** Generous time off helps keep you energized for your time on.
  
  

**Continuous Learning:** Access a wealth of resources to grow your career and learn valuable new skills.
  
  

**Invest in Your Future:** Secure your financial future through competitive pay, retirement planning, a continuing education program with a company-matched student loan contribution, and financial wellness programs.
  
  

**Family Friendly Perks:** It’s not just about you. S&P Global has perks for your partners and little ones, too, with some best-in class benefits for families.
  
  

**Beyond the Basics:** From retail discounts to referral incentive awards—small perks can make a big difference.
  
**For more information on benefits by country visit:** https://spgbenefits.com/benefit-summaries
  
  

**Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion at S&P Global:**  

At S&P Global, we believe diversity fuels creative insights, equity unlocks opportunity, and inclusion drives growth and innovation – Powering Global Markets. Our commitment centers on our global workforce, ensuring that our people are empowered to bring their whole selves to work. It doesn’t stop there, we strive to better reflect and serve the communities in which we live and work, and advocate for greater opportunity for all.
  
  

-----------------------------------------------------------
  
  

Equal Opportunity Employer
  
S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.
  
  

If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to: EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person.

title: Business Analyst Sustainability Reporting
description:
**Are you enthusiastic about embracing an international and ever-evolving environment where you will play a crucial role in providing essential requirement information to our stakeholders? As a vital connection between stakeholders, you will oversee all external sustainability reporting conducted and facilitated within the Rabobank Reporting Centre. Do you possess knowledge of sustainability reporting or a strong affinity for these processes? We eagerly await your application for this exciting opportunity in Utrecht.**

**You and your job**


Rabobank is looking for a skilled Business Analyst to join our Regulatory Reporting team and focus on sustainability regulatory reporting. This role is crucial in ensuring the accuracy and quality of our data, which forms the foundation for our regulatory reports and senior management decisions. Picture yourself working in an environment where taking on challenges and participating in operational tasks and innovative projects is essential.


As a Finance and Risk reporting specialist, you are at the center of Rabobank Group. All sustainability reporting is handled within the Reporting Centre. You will be working alongside colleagues addressing various regulatory reporting and other data-related challenges. This role allows you to collaborate and communicate with several departments, such as sustainability, control, and data foundation. We strongly believe that working in multidisciplinary teams produces the best results. You will be encouraged to demonstrate initiative when working on innovative projects and improving processes and systems (agile way of working). The team you will join is the Sustainability Squad within Group Functions.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Collect and validate data from various sources, investigate and resolve inconsistencies and errors, prepare reports, and analyse shifts in figures.
* Engage in process improvement, maintain contact with stakeholders, and participate in setting up new reporting processes.
* Address data quality issues structurally and work on big data sets.
* Participate in the interpretation of new regulations and develop reporting solutions.
* Maintain a structured, hands-on approach to work.

**You and your talent**

* Pro-active, analytical, collaborative & result drive.
* Extensive experience with SQL.
* Familiarity with KNIME is advantageous.
* Experience in regulatory reporting is preferred.
* Strong background in data management and ensuring data quality.
* Proven track record in reporting.
* Excellent proficiency in English.

**Working together**

* A dynamic and collaborative work environment.
* Opportunities for professional growth and development.
* The chance to make a significant impact on sustainability reporting.

**To be considered for this position, you must be located in the Netherlands or elsewhere in the EU and have the legal right to work in the Netherlands. We are unable to consider candidates requiring relocation from another country.**

**This is what we offer you.**

* Salary between €3.711 and €5.300 gross per month (scale 8), 36 hours per week (40 hours possible);
* Thirteenth (13th) month's salary and (8% )holiday allowance;
* an extra budget of (11%) of your gross monthly salary to be used at your discretion. Buy extra holiday hours, add more to your pension savings, or payout.
* Hybrid position and working from home Net allowance
* 100 % reimbursement of commuting costs if you travel by public transport! Do you still prefer to travel by car or motorbike? Then choose a commuting allowance;
* A pension scheme, to which your contribution is only 5,5%.
* You can spend a personal budget of €1.400 on activities related to your personal development and career.

**You and the job application process**

* Dino Dzankovic, Recruiter, would be happy to answer any questions about the application procedure via dino.dzankovic@rabobank.nl
* The application process includes screening. Based on the screening procedures in place at Rabobank, we assess whether new staff are reliable enough to work at Rabobank.


Everyone is different, and it is exactly those differences that help us become an even better bank. That's why we want to know who you really are!

title: Azure Data Engineer Tribe External Reporting
description:
**We seek an experienced Azure Data Engineer to join our dynamic and diverse development team. You will focus on developing ETL processes, building robust data models, and ensuring a high-performing back-end for our Azure Synapse solution. This role is crucial in enabling our financial analysts to analyse regulatory reporting data more quickly and efficiently.**

**Where will you be working?** You’ll become part of Tribe External Reporting. This department is critical in maintaining Rabobank’s compliance with financial regulations and standards. The teams within Tribe External Reporting are responsible for the accurate and timely submission of regulatory reports to various financial authorities. By leveraging advanced data analytics and reporting tools, we ensure that our reporting processes are efficient, transparent, and compliant with all regulatory requirements.

**Which squad will you join?** The Analysis & Comparison squad is currently developing a cutting-edge Azure Synapse solution integrated with Power BI dashboards. This solution is designed to revolutionize how our financial analysts access and analyse regulatory reporting data. By joining our team, you will have the opportunity to work on an innovative project, contributing to developing a solution that will significantly enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of our regulatory reporting processes.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Design, develop, and maintain ETL processes using Azure Data Factory and other relevant tools.
* Build and optimize data models to support efficient data analysis and reporting.
* Design and develop SQL queries and procedures to ensure stability and performance.
* Develop and maintain the back-end infrastructure to ensure high performance and reliability.
* Collaborate with data analysts, product owners, and other stakeholders to understand requirements and deliver solutions.
* Implement best practices for data management, security, and governance.
* Troubleshoot and resolve data-related issues and provide ongoing support.

**You and your talent**

* Proven experience (minimum of 4+ years) as an Azure Data Engineer or in a similar role.
* Strong expertise in Azure Synapse Analytics, Azure Data Factory, and PowerBI.
* Proficiency in SQL, Python, and other relevant programming languages.
* Experience with data modeling, ETL processes, and data warehousing.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Strong communication and collaboration skills.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Experience in the financial services industry, particularly in regulatory reporting.
* Experience in Azure Databricks
* Knowledge of data governance and security best practices.
* Certification in Azure Data Engineering or related fields.

**To be considered for this position, you must be located in the Netherlands or elsewhere in the EU and have the legal right to work in the Netherlands. We are unable to consider candidates requiring relocation from another country.**

**This is what we offer you.**

* Salary between €4.292 and €7.307 gross per month (scale 9-10), 36 hours per week (40 hours possible);
* Thirteenth (13th) month's salary and (8% )holiday allowance;
* an extra budget of (11%) of your gross monthly salary to be used at your discretion. Buy extra holiday hours, add more to your pension savings, or payout.
* Hybrid position and working from home Net allowance
* 100 % reimbursement of commuting costs if you travel by public transport! Do you still prefer to travel by car or motorbike? Then choose a commuting allowance;
* A pension scheme, to which your contribution is only 5,5%.
* You can spend a personal budget of €1.400 on activities related to your personal development and career.

**You and the job application process**

* Dino Dzankovic, Recruiter, would be happy to answer any questions about the application procedure via dino.dzankovic@rabobank.nl
* The application process includes screening. Based on the screening procedures in place at Rabobank, we assess whether new staff are reliable enough to work at Rabobank.


Everyone is different, and it is exactly those differences that help us become an even better bank. That's why we want to know who you really are!

title: Data Scientist - Transaction Banking
description:
Data Scientist - Transaction Banking**At a glance**
---------------


Are you a Data Scientist, who is fascinated by the financial sector and eager to explore the world of banking products? Do you want to be part of a team of young and highly motivated Data Professionals, who are entrusted and empowered to make use of data for strategic, operational, and tactical decision making? Does the idea of an autonomous team with the freedom to learn, grow and make impact sound exciting? The Products Data Practice is this and more!

**Your job**
------------

  

In your role as a Data Scientist, you will:

* Expand the scope of Advanced Analytics and AI, developing cases that leverage the latest emerging technologies, fostering an innovative environment
* Engage in complex long-term projects, with focus on continuous delivery in small increments
* Understand different advanced data techniques and identify suitable ones that can help answering the question
* Stay curious and up to date with trends of technologies, advanced analytics, genAI and cloud platforms (Databricks)
* Conduct data experiments on different datasets (products, transactions, channels, customers, CRM/ sales)
* Work both in individual contributor roles (leading project) and in collaboration / co-creating with multiple data scientists, data analysts, data engineers and machine learning engineers
* Extract actionable insights from large data sources, perform recurring or ad hoc analyses / reports
* Act as a data sparring partner with business stakeholders on smart KPIs & reports, with relevant insights for the right audience
* Translate business challenges into data questions, understand underlying processes for various products & services, and connect the dots
* Engage and guide non-technical stakeholders and team members on Advanced Analytics cases
* Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams and manage different stakeholders
* Practice the art of storytelling through numbers and effective visualization techniques
* Focus on continuous improvement and automation of existing deliverables
* Organize your work in a structured manner and effectively communicate to all parties involved
* Be curious, ask enough questions to deep dive and not hesitate to change/ challenge the status quo
* Remain proactive in coming up with ideas to improve/ solve (technical/ business/ data) challenges
**Working environment**
-----------------------


We are the Product Data Practice department, part of the Data Domains of Accounts, Savings & Transactions, and Insurances (AST&I), currently being set up to support implementation of the bank’s federated data governance model. The AST&I Data Domains are within the Transaction Banking product unit, which covers a vast portfolio of products: accounts, payment cards, packages, savings, insurances, open banking APIs, trade finance, digital products like Apple Pay/ Google Pay, and associated sales, business & risk management processes. We contribute significantly to the revenue of the bank, manage different regulatory and operational topics, and contribute to Objectives and Key Results set for the Personal & Business Banking Client Unit, serving about 6 million Personal & Business Banking customers.  

The Products Data Practice department is composed by two Centers of Expertise: 1) The newly formed Advanced Analytics & Artificial Intelligence CoE and 2) Business Intelligence & Analytics CoE. In addition, this department is responsible for our cloud-based data and analytics platform - Transaction Banking Domain Data Store (DDS).  

Our vision is to stimulate an environment where data is vital to everything we do!  

We apply advanced analytics and emerging technologies (like GenAI) to explore, research and gather valuable insights; predict and forecast trends of product’s usage and transactions; optimize processes; define, report & monitor and improve performance ; advise on new proposition designs and duty of care topics; help decide the course of action and setting priorities to achieve great customer satisfaction and vendor relations. We also act as change agents to embed a data driven mindset at all levels of the organization enabling them to harness full potential of the data that we have, thereby strengthening data maturity and literacy in the bank.  

All our Data Scientists that work within AA&AI CoE, have T-shaped profiles and next to data analytics and data science they can play different roles like: Subject Matter Experts, Business Liaisons etc. The Products Data Practice is 25+ people strong (65% Analysts & Scientists + 35% Engineers & modelers) and consists of 7 nationalities which are based in the Netherlands and India. We follow agile principles and work on cross grid and cross functional initiatives while collaborating with other analytics teams, business experts, business developers, product owners, seniors, and leaders – hence providing an excellent opportunity for networking and serving as a knowledge haven. We have developed a culture where entrepreneurial spirit, empathy, element of fun and celebrating successes is truly appreciated. We do this by respecting and living our bank’s values: Care, Courage, and Collaboration!

**Your profile**
----------------


Do you think you are a fit? Check your qualifications:

* Degree in STEM or economics/business, with an analytics focus
* 6-8 years of work experience, with at least 3 years in data science field
* Exhibit high level of proficiency in programming languages such as Python, PySpark, SQL and coding best practices
* Experience with Advance Analytics techniques (Forecasting, Prediction, Cluster Analysis, Machine Learning, Generative AI), and eagerness to learn and develop in that area
* A combination of analytical skills, intellectual curiosity, communication, and reporting skills
* Effective written and verbal communication skills in English (and Dutch)
* Experience with data visualization tools like PowerBI or Tableau
* Great to have: Knowledge of the financial sector and/or banking products
* Great to have : Experience in working on azure/ Databricks/ or similar cloud platforms
* Great to have: Affinity towards technical topics including data and machine learning engineering
* Great to have: Microsoft DP-100 certification (Azure Data Scientist Associate)
* Nice to have: Knowledge of agile methodology, and ability to manage multiple priorities simultaneously
* Nice to have: Microsoft AZ-900 certification (basic knowledge of Azure cloud services)
* Nice to have: Microsoft PL-300 certification (PowerBI Data Analyst)
**We are offering**
-------------------

* The opportunity to pro-actively work on your vitality and fitness
* A competitive salary, fitting to your experience and expertise
* Additional benefit budget of 11%, which you can use to buy flexible working conditions
* A personal development budget of EUR 1.000 per year
* An annual public transportation pass or travel budget, depending on the function
* A solid pension plan
**Are you Interested?**
-----------------------


If this position suits your qualifications and aspirations, then make sure to apply right away. We look forward to speaking with you.

**Equal opportunities for all**
-------------------------------


The success of our organisation depends on the quality of our people and the ideas that they have. Truly surprising insights and innovative solutions for our clients result from an interplay of cultures, knowledge and experience. Diversity is therefore extremely important to our organisation. To ensure that everyone at ABN AMRO can develop their talents, we encourage an inclusive culture in which all colleagues feel engaged and appreciated.

**Disclaimer external recruitment agencies**
--------------------------------------------


External recruitment agencies need to have a signed agreement with ABN AMRO BANK N.V., executed by a Talent Acquisition Specialist, when submitting a resume to a vacancy. No unsolicited services or offers, please.

### **Wij bieden**

* Analytische skills

### **Wij vragen**

* Een toekomstgerichte mindset
company_description: Bij ABN AMRO hebben we een duidelijke purpose: Banking for better, for generations to come. Samen met onze klanten gaan we de uitdagingen van onze tijd aan en geven we vorm aan de toekomst.

title: Data Specialist
description:
**Logistics at full potential**


Do you enjoy working with data, collecting it, analysing it and presenting it in a format that people can understand? Are you passionate about data, to ensure it is fit for purpose and can support ideas moving forward? Then we may have just the role for you! We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our team in Tilburg. This is a fantastic opportunity to contribute to the ongoing success of the team.

 **What you do on a typical day as Data Specialist:**

* As Data Analyst you will work with the operational data coming from the logistics operation. You gather this by working together with colleagues from across our teams
* You process the data and taking into account the KPIs, budgets and various forecasts. Also will your numbers be used for the weekly / monthly figures and various KPI reports
* In consultation with your colleagues within the operational teams, you are working on accurate and correct calculations
* Identifying inefficiencies in operational processes and putting forward proposals for improvement

 **What do you need to succeed as Data Specialist:**

* You have at least a HBO / University diploma. Are you just graduated? Then this role is also open for you!
* Knowledge of Excell is needed, Power BI would be advantageous but not essential
* You are a strong communicator, analytical thinker and like to dive into numbers
* Good command of the English language in word and writing, Dutch is not needed but is a plus
* Accuracy and good attention to detail is how others would describe you

 **What we offer you:**

* Besides a competitive salary and a function with a lot of responsibilities and variety, we will assure you that not a single day is the same
* Just graduated? Then you join our Young Talent program, where you will meet young talents from all our BeNe sites. Together you will get extra courses, guidance and workshops to kickstart your carreer.
* A dynamic and growing organization, with lots of space for personal input and development
* A highly motivated team on site with ambitions to grow and improve every single day
* A pleasant working atmosphere on site and in your department

 **Unlock the potential of your future!**

  

Working at GXO Logistics means working in a dynamic and international organization. A fascinating environment with plenty of room for personal input and development. Employees at GXO Logistics oversee their own success. Whatever your position at GXO Logistics, you will face new challenges every day, which will enable you to develop optimally. We support you in your development, so that you can contribute to the entrepreneurship of our organisation.

  

GXO Logistics offers advanced supply chain solutions for the world's most successful companies in many industries, like e-commerce, food & retail and industrial multinationals. In the BeNe region (The Netherlands and Belgium) GXO BeNe operates from +30 different locations with its headquarters in Eindhoven (NL).

 **Want to know more about GXO Logistics?**  

Watch the video below or visit our website www.gxo.com https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3P7NC8gl3bg  

  

**In short, this is the next place you want to work!**  

For more information, please contact Rianne Koers (Corporate Recruiter), she can be reached via email at rianne.koers@gxo.com  

  

**Interested?**


Apply via the button and leave your recent CV.

  

#LI-RK1

  

GXO is a leading provider of cutting-edge supply chain solutions to the most successful companies in the world. We help our customers manage their goods most efficiently using our technology and services. Our greatest strength is our global team – energetic, innovative people of all experience levels and talents who make GXO a great place to work. GXO is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate, support and thrive on diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We believe that diversity and inclusion in our business is critical to our success as a global company, and we seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. We are an Armed Forces friendly organisation and Disability Confident Leader as part of the Disability Confident Scheme (GIS) and actively welcome applications from people with disabilities.

  

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. All employees may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed.

title: Asset Management Operations, Data Governance, Analyst, The Hague
description:
Asset Management Operations, Data Governance, Analyst, The Hague
AWM delivers innovative investment solutions through a global, multi- product platform that offers clients the advantages that come with working with a large firm, while maintaining the benefits of a boutique. AWM is one of the pre-eminent investment management organizations globally. Critical to the success of AWM is our ability to leverage a global team of talented professionals to define solutions and lead change across the operational infrastructure.
  

  

The AM Operations Global Data Governance team is seeking to add a highly motivated professional to its organization. This team is primarily focused on building & maintaining a scalable Data Governance framework for data attributes published in internal and external reports. The Data Governance team works closely with Operations, Business, Legal, Compliance, Controllers, Technology, and other groups in establishing data pipelines and maintaining data value chains connected to various reporting outputs of the organization.
  

  

With your expertise, our data owners, stewards, and subject matter experts can ensure the integrity of our data throughout its lifecycle. Your contribution will lead to trusted data for our clients, our investment processes, and operations.
  

  

**Responsibilities**
  

* Leverage analytical skills, creative problem solving and project management skills to steer and uplift the existing Data Governance model.
* Organize discussions with key stakeholders to understand how our technology works, thereby empowering you to define specific data attributes, identify the relevant owners, and source system(s) along with Data flows.
* Improve the risk framework for data governance by documenting existing controls, analyzing their suitability, and recommending new controls for implementation.
* Develop strong working relationships with Sales, Legal, Compliance, Controllers, Technology, and other groups in establishing the Data Governance model and keeping it up to date.
* Work with Business Intelligence & Low code Automation solutions to digitize the Data Governance framework and improve efficiency.
* Regularly assess and refine data governance processes and policies in line with the industry best practice to promote continuous improvement.

**Qualifications**
  

* Bachelor's/ Master's Degree (Engineering, Finance, Economics, Business Management)
* Understanding of data governance concepts, principles, and best practices
* Strong analytical and organizational skills
* Excellent communication, both in listening and conveying messages to a wide range of stakeholder groups
* Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy
* Ability to handle multiple projects, deadlines, personalities, and broad based coverage
* Knowledge and understanding of Excel, PowerPoint, Word and adaptability to other software products
* Ability to work in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment
* Knowledge of the investment management industry and GSAM is a bonus
* A basic idea of Business Intelligence and data visualisation tools is a bonus

**ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS**
  

At Goldman Sachs, we commit our people, capital and ideas to help our clients, shareholders and the communities we serve to grow. Founded in 1869, we are a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm. Headquartered in New York, we maintain offices around the world.
  

We believe who you are makes you better at what you do. We're committed to fostering and advancing diversity and inclusion in our own workplace and beyond by ensuring every individual within our firm has a number of opportunities to grow professionally and personally, from our training and development opportunities and firmwide networks to benefits, wellness and personal finance offerings and mindfulness programs. Learn more about our culture, benefits, and people at GS.com/careers.
  

We're committed to finding reasonable accommodations for candidates with special needs or disabilities during our recruiting process. Learn more: https://www.goldmansachs.com/careers/footer/disability-statement.html
  

© The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2023. All rights reserved.
  

Goldman Sachs is an equal employment/affirmative action employer Female/Minority/Disability/Veteran/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity
