title: Onboarding Analyst
description:
Ebury is a hyper-growth FinTech firm, named in 2021 as one of the top 15 European Fintechs to work for by AltFi. We offer a range of products including FX risk management, trade finance, currency accounts, international payments and API integration.

**Onboarding Analyst**



Ebury has high standards when it comes to working with clients. We need to make sure that the clients we serve and the transactions we carry out respect all the legal, regulatory and ethical standards. This means that when we onboard a client, we need to perform a very important screening on the prospect and the transactions this client would like to do via us. And this is where you come in!


**Role Purpose**



The Analyst is responsible for conducting the onboarding review in line with current policy to ensure all Know Your Customer (KYC) requirements are fulfilled. They play a vital role together with the sales team in order to provide a smooth onboarding experience while making sure that our legal and compliance requirements are met.


**Responsibilities**



* Safeguarding Ebury, our existing Clients and prospective Client relationships from financial crime risk including money laundering, terrorist financing, bribery and corruption, fraud, sanctions risk, tax evasion and reputational risk
* Performing anti-financial crime checks as part of the Ebury Onboarding process for corporate clients in compliance with relevant legislative, regulatory and internal requirements
* Comprehensive CDD and EDD checks for corporate clients, including the KYC process, identification and analysis of complex ownership structures, financial statements and transaction patterns
* CDD/EDD analysis across all types of legal entities and business sectors in a variety of jurisdictions with an emphasis on local clients
* Direct contact with clients
* Presentation of Ebury's onboarding requirements to clients in a clear and compliant manner
* Identification of red flags and exposure to financial crime risk, including escalation to Compliance and Senior Management where required
* Making risk-based decisions to onboard or reject applications
* Efficient management of a personal portfolio of onboarding cases
* Proactive follow-up with clients and sales representatives to ensure timely completion of onboarding analysis
* Documenting client files in a structured format compliant with internal requirements
* Identifying opportunities for improvement within the onboarding process
* Assist in preparation and management of data and information required for internal and external audits
* Support ad-hoc projects within the department and wider business as required
* Validation of checks carried out by other members of the team
* Support in training delivery
* Supporting the Supervisor with team management responsibilities


### **Desired Experience/Competencies**



* Fluency in English. Any other language is a plus
* Minimum 1 years of experience conducting CDD and EDD with corporate clients
* Advanced knowledge of red flags and financial crime typologies relevant to the payments and FX space
* Proactive, with the ability to work effectively within a fast-paced and high-pressure environment
* Highly organised, with the ability to work to deadlines, multi-task, and prioritise and re-prioritise workload as needed
* Diligent, with excellent attention to detail
* Effective critical thinking skills, with the ability to find solutions to problems independently
* Strong communication skills, both written and verbal including working alongside the Front Office
* Co-operative, and comfortable working in a team environment, including remote teams
* Curious and engaged, who takes ownership of their own learning journey by asking questions and seeking out new information
* Adaptable, with the ability to cope with changing products, processes and procedures
* Motivated and driven, with a desire to make Ebury a success
* Experience of direct client contact within financial services is a plus


**Why Join Us?**


* Our office provides more than just collective health insurance; it includes an additional gross payment of €140 per month, which covers the majority of the health insurance expenses
* Our retirement plan stands out as it exceeds the standard offerings within Dutch companies. Ebury contributes a significant 12.5% towards the pension plan, which is based on 15% of the pensionable earnings (including fixed salary and holiday allowance), while employees add a modest 2.5%. Moreover, Ebury covers all administration fees as well as premiums for both the survivor's pension and the disability waiver of premiums
* Training and mentoring from some of the world's most experienced and successful compliance professionals
* Career development opportunities
* Spacious and modern office in Amsterdam

  



#LI-GC2



#LI-Onsite

 **About Us**


**Ebury is a FinTech success story, positioned among the fastest-growing international companies in its sector.**



Founded in 2009, we are headquartered in London and have more than 1700 staff with a presence in more than 25 countries worldwide. Cultural diversity is part of what makes Ebury a special place to be. From Sao Paulo to Dubai, Bucharest to Toronto, we enjoy sharing team experiences and celebrating success across the Ebury family.



Hard work pays off: in 2019, Ebury received a £350 million investment from Banco Santander and has won internationally recognised awards including Financial Times: 1000 Europe's Fastest-Growing Companies.



None of this would have been possible without our proudest achievement: our great people. Enthusiastic, innovative and collaborative teams, always ready to disrupt and revolutionise the fast-paced FinTech sector.

  

*We believe in inclusion. We stand against discrimination in all forms and have no tolerance for the intolerance of differences that makes us a modern and successful organisation. At Ebury, you can be whoever you want to be and still feel a sense of belonging no matter your story because we want you and your uniqueness to help write our future.*


*Please submit your application on the careers website directly, uploading your CV / resume in English.*

title: Customer Journey Expert – Business Analist
description:
ING is seeking a **Customer Journey Expert - Business Analyst** to strengthen the Order Management capabilities within CTO Payments & Settlement Services (PSS) and enhance its service offerings.


**About CTO Payments & Settlement Services (PSS)**  

PSS is responsible for developing and expanding ING’s state-of-the-art payment platforms and settlement services. The team focuses on delivering reliable, secure, and compliant payment solutions that meet the evolving needs of ING’s business lines and beyond. PSS operates as an independent unit within ING’s CTO domain, reporting directly to ING’s Chief Technology Officer.

**Your role and work environment**  

As a Customer Journey Expert, you’ll join an agile Business squad within ING, where you’ll work on delivering and enhancing the order management capabilities on a new platform. You’ll collaborate with product experts to build and improve order management functions, supporting the migration and onboarding of new internal ING service consumers.



In this role, you’ll be responsible for managing and defining business requirements for a new market standard in Payments (EPI). Besides requirement management and solution detailing, you’ll also handle non-IT delivery (COPAF), which includes documenting processes, obtaining approvals from Risk, Legal, and Compliance departments, and ensuring a controlled go-live.


**Your key responsibilities**


* Enhance the value proposition by continuously improving customer journeys.
* Ensure compliance with internal and external regulations, maintaining ING’s license to operate.
* Represent the voice of the customer, simplifying solutions and processes, and clearly communicating with clients, stakeholders, and colleagues.

**What you bring**


**For this position we are looking for a Customer Journey Expert with specific experience with payment products in the European market.**

  

**Skills and experience:**


* A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree.
* 3-5 years of proven experience as a business analyst with a strong understanding of the end-to-end payments lifecycle.
* In-depth knowledge of payment products, including Instant Payments, EPI, and IDEAL.
* Familiarity with payment standards such as SEPA, Instant Payments, Domestic, International, RTGS, ISO 20022 for MX, and SWIFT MTs, as well as PSD regulation.
* Strong analytical skills, with the ability to make data-driven decisions.
* Excellent command of English (Dutch is a plus).
* Proficiency in business requirements gathering, process analysis, and technical implementation support.


**Competencies:**


* You’re proactive with a natural drive to deliver results on time.
* You excel as a team player and collaborate effectively with others.
* You’re detail-oriented, while still maintaining a big-picture perspective.
* You’re self-organized, pragmatic, and constantly seeking opportunities for improvement.
* You’re internationally oriented and adaptable to a global working environment.

**What we offer:**

  

* 36 hour work week
* Salary range: €4.240,00 - €5.750,00 based on experience
* Holiday pay and 13th month
* Full pension according to Dutch temp labour CLA
* ZZP is also possible if you are registered with the Dutch Chamber of Commerce. Hourly rate €70,00 - €80,00


**Ready to make a difference? Join us. Applications are open until August 27, 12:00 p.m.**

title: Data Engineer - Freelance Opportunity - Netherlands
description:
Role Assignment


* Job Title: Data Engineer - Regional Business Intelligence
* Department: Business Intelligence & Data Analytics
* Location: Remote/Breda/Eindhoven
* Date: Mid September till Mid December
* Senior (6 -10 ans)

Job Purpose/Goals


* To engineer and manage data flows in snowflake that support the regional Business Intelligence initiatives.

Brief Job Description


* Design, build, and maintain the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources.
* Work with stakeholders to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs.
* Map data structures from Sigma to S4 based on predefined template. Ad hoc you will need to map it together with the local D&A teams.

Key Activities & Responsibilities


* Develop and maintain scalable and reliable data pipelines in snowflake/PowerBi to support analytics and reporting for the regional businesses in PowerBi service.
* Work closely with the Core GDI project team to ensure data quality and consistency.
* Manage data engineering pipelines
* Ensure the performance and reliability of data systems that support PowerBi.

Profile: Knowledge, Skills & Experience


* Experience with Theobald, Qlikview and Qliksense migration to PowerBi
* Knowledge of SAP data architectures of S4 and Sigma
* Proven experience as a data engineer with data architecture, modelling and ETL processes.
* Familiarity with Business Intelligence tools and data warehousing solutions.
* Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment

title: Partner Engineer, Global Strategic Initiatives, Google Cloud
description:
### **Minimum qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence, Data Science and Engineering or other related field or equivalent practical experience.
* 6 years of experience with Data and Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning (AI/ML) workloads, transaction processing, data warehousing, analytics and with data migration strategies and moving production systems either in on-premise/data center environments or migration to cloud scenarios.
* Experience engaging with, and presenting to, technical stakeholders and executive leaders.
* Experience working with Global Strategic Initiatives (GSI).

  

### **Preferred qualifications:**

* Master’s degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence, Data Science and Engineering, or other related technical field.
* Experience in managing multiple stakeholders in a collaborative, fast-paced environment.
* Experience in customer-facing pre-sales or professional consulting in the fields of data and information lifecycle management translating customer business needs into cloud centric solutions.
* Experience in working with partners and (technical) development of Partner Ecosystem.

**About the job**
-----------------


When leading companies choose Google Cloud, it's a huge win for spreading the power of cloud computing globally. Once educational institutions, government agencies, and other businesses sign on to use Google Cloud products, you come in to facilitate making their work more productive, mobile, and collaborative. You listen and deliver what is most helpful for the customer. You assist fellow sales Googlers by problem-solving key technical issues for our customers. You liaise with the product marketing management and engineering teams to stay on top of industry trends and devise enhancements to Google Cloud products.



In this role, you will work as a technical lead to grow and support the Google Cloud partner ecosystem. You will contribute to customer adoption of Google Cloud by assessing our partners technical expertise, connecting the customer with the right partner, and supporting partners as they execute practical and useful solutions. You will help prospective partners understand Google Cloud capabilities, and align with the product marketing and engineering teams to recommend improvements to Google Cloud products. You will help our partners realize the unique value through the proposition of Google Workspace and Google Cloud Platform and help them build solutions and point-of-views. You will work in a team, cross-functionally, and cross regionally with the Engineering, Sales, and Marketing teams to develop new ways to drive Google Cloud growth. You are based in the Netherlands and work as a part of the Belgium, the Netherlands, and Luxembourg (BENELUX) Partner Engineering Team.


Google Cloud accelerates every organization’s ability to digitally transform its business and industry. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology, and tools that help developers build more sustainably. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

**Responsibilities**
--------------------

* Demonstrate product integrations and work with Partner Managers to identify and recruit partners in the market and monitor partner delivery capabilities.
* Help partners to drive a successful pilot, proof of concept or production workloads, create partner technical development plans, aligned to annual planning and drive technical wins of partners and alignment of partners to customer opportunities.
* Develop solution documentation, joint technical articles, webinars, etc. and build solution focused technical assets for internal/external partners.
* Create integration strategies, enterprise architectures, platforms, application infrastructure required to successfully implement a complete solution on Google Cloud.
* Collaborate closely with the Google Customer Engineering team to ensure best possible fit between partner capabilities and customer needs to drive value creation and business outcomes for businesses and organizations through Google Cloud.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

title: Design Engineer – Wiring Harness
description:

dpatel@technosofteng.com

title: System Software Test Scrum Master
description:
**Introduction to the job**


ASML, including its affiliates and subsidiaries, bring together the most creative minds in science and technology to develop lithography machines that are key to producing faster, cheaper, more energy-efficient microchips. We design, develop, integrate, market and service these advanced machines, which enable our customers - the world’s leading chipmakers - to reduce the size and increase the functionality of their microchips, which in turn leads to smaller, more powerful consumer electronics. Our headquarters are in Veldhoven, The Netherlands.


Within ASML, the Development & Engineering (D&E) Software cluster is responsible for the specification and the design of ASML software products.


In this cluster, the department Software Quality & Integration (SQI) maintains the test infrastructure used by software projects, specifies, executes and controls the testing and integration of the various software deliveries into a software release. The software being developed is deployed to the ASML lithography machines at the customers.


There are three test domain teams in SQI department. The test domain teams are responsible to participate in risk assessments, collaborate with several test architects to create new system level regression test scenarios for proper coverage extension, strive to automate all test scenarios to ensure efficient execution. The domain of expertise of the team relevant for this position is system level regression test scope of installation, upgrade/downgrade, software portability (backup/restore) properties of the software. This is a crucial step which all ASML lithography machines at the customers are going through multiple times throughout the year and smooth operation of these steps is crucial to the smooth operation and up-time of ASML systems at the customer.


This team is in close collaboration with a large set of stakeholders within and outside of SQI department. To name some of them, EUV and DUV Twinscan integration and release programs (project leaders), product test architects, software teams test architects, other test domain teams, SQI test execution team, customer support (CS), proto engineers and quality engineers. Test scenarios of the team is used for qualification of software deliveries by a large community with over 2500 active developers and testers. In addition, the team is responsible to build new product introduction (NPI) machine configurations in the SQI test environment (testbenches) which requires solid domain knowledge of ASML lithography machines. The testbenches configured by the team are used by SQI test teams and other D&E software teams to qualify new product software in a valid test environment and increases software quality of the NPI systems.

**Role and responsibilities**


We’re seeking a dynamic and experienced Scrum Master to organize and coach the team to apply agile best practices according to the needs of the team. The successful candidate will have a solid background in agile way of working, scrum master roles and responsibilities, software testing & quality assurance and be capable of guiding a team to ensure on-time completion of tasks with optimal effort. The scrum master will drive the team to continuously improve agile processes and execute ceremonies such as backlog refinements, sprint planning and review, demo and retrospectives in an optimal and efficient way. He/she will assist the team in resolving issues and impediments in daily team operations such that the team delivers committed work items on-time and with quality. In addition, the scrum master will collaborate with the product owner to ensure that the sprint content is in line with the quarterly goals and overall team road map.


As a scrum master, you will:

* Support the product owner to maintain, update and execute the team backlog aligned with the requirements of the stakeholders
* Guide the team in transition towards SAFe agile way of working
* Ensure the team delivers the committed results, improves estimations, tasks have clear Acceptance Criteria and adhere to the Definition of Done
* Continuously work on improving the agile way of working and coach the team members in working agile
* Ensure that all Scrum events take place and are positive, productive, and kept within the timebox.
* Resolve impediments to the domain team’s progress
* Prepare the quarterly status report and present it in the quarterly Agile Release Train (ART) program increment (PI) planning event
* Align with other scrum masters within SQI on a common mission, vision & strategy
* Technical competence & coaching


	+ Ensure the team is able to efficiently use the tooling and test suite within the domain
	+ Coach the domain team to improve their technical skills (automation, coding best practices, domain framework architecture)


As a team member, you will also participate in testing and improving test coverage activities such as:

* Execute the defined system level test set
* When issues are found, raise defects and ensure the delivering project accepts ownership
* Use the test results, to define and perform additional tests to check for more issues
* Provide your assessment: is the software ready for release?
* Participate in the risk assessment of the changes made in the software.
* Together with the domain test architect, product test architects and developers, the risk assessment of the changes made in the software is performed. Focus of the risk assessment for system level testing and qualification is the customer’s point-of-view;
* (Help) determine which test cases must be created (progression) and/or executed (regression) to qualify the software for release to customer.
* Evaluate customer feedback and define – when possible – preventive actions to extend test coverage and improve qualification.
* Support and drive the team to maintain and improve existing test scenarios as well as define and design new test scenarios and cases to increase coverage of software qualification.

**Education and experience**

* Master Level – Technical
* Preferred educated in Computer Science or similar technical area
* Experience in software testing, preferably in complex embedded systems
* Experience as a scrum master in a preferably SAFe agile environment
* Visible experience in creation of system level test cases
* Analytic skills needed for initial investigation of issues found in test
* Experience in technical coaching/mentoring/leading
* Extensive experience with Jira
* Experience in stakeholder management and working in multidisciplinary teams


Pre:

* Experience with test driven development (TDD), and/or behavior driven development (BDD)
* Developing according to a Software Development Life Cycle process
* Linux and/or Unix experience
* Continuous Integration experience
* Experience with Jenkins and GitHub actions
* Python knowledge
* Experience with Robot Framework
* Experience with shell scripting
* Knowledge of Polarion QA
* Experience with Git, Bitbucket

**Skills**


This position might be for you, if you are:

* Enthusiastic, flexible and assertive
* Endowed with strong leadership skills
* Excellent communication skills
* Pragmatic & goal-oriented
* Able to prioritize
* Energetic team player who does not walk away from challenges
* Take initiative and take ownership of issues beyond your formal area of responsibility
* Ready to be employed for at least 2 years
* Ability / willingness to attend additional courses

**Other information**


Please add your complete, recent CV and cover letter for this position to your application.


We can't process your application without the above-mentioned documents.

*This position requires access to controlled technology, as defined in the Export Administration Regulations (15 C.F.R. § 730, et seq.). Qualified candidates must be legally authorized to access such controlled technology prior to beginning work. Business demands may require ASML to proceed with candidates who are immediately eligible to access controlled technology.*

**Diversity and inclusion**
---------------------------


ASML is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is the policy of the company to recruit, hire, train and promote persons in all job titles without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. We recognize that diversity and inclusion is a driving force in the success of our company.


Need to know more about applying for a job at ASML? Read our frequently asked questions.
company_description: ASML provides chipmakers with hardware, software and services to mass produce patterns on silicon, helping to build the electronic devices that keep us informed, entertained and connected.

title: Full Stack Engineer - Leiden
description:
Passionate about improving health outcomes? Interested in a role in AI as it applies to healthcare? If so, join us and make your mark at Envision Pharma Group as we continue to grow the business!



OKRA, proudly part of Envision Pharma Group, is an artificial intelligence company for healthcare. We deliver predictions, suggestions, and explanations to empower life sciences executives and operational teams in complex decision-making to drive the right drug to the right patient with humanized and understandable AI outputs. We are fostering a new generation of Artificial Intelligence (AI) solutions implemented at top Pharma companies.



Our mission is to the get the right treatment to the right patient at the right time, by building the world's most trustworthy artificial intelligence engine. The OKRA platform is live and has already generated millions of actionable insights and predictions.



AI for us is not a data science project. We deploy, monitor, and manage the analytics and we ensure that we operationalize AI products to drive health and patient outcomes. We embrace agile, iteration, and co-creation.



Being part of a collaborative team means there's no limit to what you can achieve. With us, you can be a part of a growing company you want to work for.


**The opportunity**



Join our talented Platform team as a Full Stack Engineer, where you'll play a key role in designing, developing, and maintaining cutting-edge commercial software products. You'll work on a diverse range of projects, implementing solutions across various production environments. This is a dynamic opportunity to leverage your expertise in both front-end and back-end technologies, contributing to innovative software that drives real-world impact.



This is a hybrid working opportunity from our Leiden office.


**Role responsibilities**



How will you make an impact at Envision Pharma Group?


* Diagnose problems and develop solutions in a fast-paced, dynamic environment using Agile development methodologies.
* Leverage knowledge of the software development life cycle and architecture to complete day-to-day tasks.
* Train incoming software development team members in internal procedures and product specifications.
* Act as senior hands-on technical leader with expertise in databases, back-end and front-end development.


**Do you have what we are looking for?**


* 3+ years of applied back-end and front-end experience.
* Experience with Python, ORM, JavaScript and SQL essential.
* Solid knowledge and understanding of the entire software development life cycle.
* Expert in database optimizations.
* Detail and project oriented with a focus on quality, and passion for the work in hand.
* Ability to work independently and with minimal supervision across multiple projects, and to meet deadlines.
* Ability to rapidly grasp and apply complex business and technical concepts.


**Magic happens when people care deeply about what they do!**



We're on a mission to use Artificial Intelligence to transform healthcare as we know it.



We're pioneers. Everyone here is passionate about their impact on our products and teams and ultimately, the world. This is how we became leaders in what we do.



If you're looking for fascinating and complex projects and can thrive on change, you've found the right place.



Join us in bringing AI to life. If you have the experience highlighted above, we would love to hear from you!
company_description: Envision Pharma Group is a leading global technology-enabled strategic solutions partner for the life sciences industry, working with over 200 pharma and biotech companies, including 19 of the top 20.

title: Data Scientist
description:
We deliver parcels every day of the week, serving as the indispensable link between senders and recipients. We connect worlds and as Data Scientist you are crucial to enhance the e-commerce delivery experience and directly contribute to the mission of PostNL.  

  

**Uitdagingen**  


We are seeking a Senior Data Scientist to join our Data Science E-commerce team. In this role, you'll contribute to the development of artificial intelligence and machine learning (AI/ML) solutions that directly impact our mission to become everyone’s favorite delivery service. You'll play a key role in enabling data-driven decision making across the E-commerce department contributing directly to our strategy while mentoring data scientists in the team. If you like a challenge, enjoy thinking outside the box, and have a passion for the latest technologies in machine learning and automation, we want to hear from you.


You will thrive at PostNL if you are result-focused and innovative in providing business value through developing and deploying machine learning solutions, but most of all having a strong understanding of all parts of the machine learning lifecycle.


**What you will work on:**  

* Design and build automated AI/ML solutions for the E-commerce department
* Ensure high-quality data science solutions through testing, best practices, engineering standards, and lifecycle management
* Contribute to the advancement of AI/ML at PostNL in our data chapter
* Achieve impact as a team player, and maintain solid relationships with technical and non-technical stakeholders
  

**Je verantwoordelijkheden**  

**Zichtbaar werk:** You realize the mission and strategy of PostNL with data science solutions that are widely used and appreciated by colleagues within E-commerce.  

**Uitdaging:** You will join a team that is growing in maturity and tackling more complex issues for E-commerce.  

**Goede sfeer**: Collaboration, tackling challenges, and having fun at work are key elements of the positive atmosphere in this team.  

**Vrijheid:** You have the freedom to largely shape your role and working hours.  

**Verantwoordelijkheid**: Je hebt de vrijheid om je functie en werktijden grotendeels zelf in te vullen.  

**Ontwikkelkansen**: There are plenty of opportunities to take courses and grow into other roles or departments within the company.  

  

**Wat breng jij mee?**  

* 3+ years of experience as a Data Scientist or a similar role, with a consistent record of successfully delivering ML solutions
* Strong programming skills in Python
* Experience with data at scale using SQL, Pyspark, Snowflake or similar frameworks
* Knowledgeable about statistical properties of (good) metrics
* Experience building libraries/modules in Python
* Strong understanding of fundamental machine learning concepts
* Experience with containerizing ML workloads using Docker
* Knowledge of reporting/visualisation techniques (e.g., Plotly, Tableau, Power BI, Streamlit, etc.)
* Experience with cloud services in AWS is desirable
* Familiarity with data science frameworks (e.g. Kedro, Sagemaker, Metaflow)
* Willingness to dig deep into problems and behind the scenes data to support troubleshooting and bug fixing
* Experience with API development
* Good English communication skills

  

  

  

**Wat bezorgen we jou?**  

* A salary between €4.280,00 and €6.062,00 gross per month (scale 10) based on a 37-hour workweek
* The possibility to work hybrid with flexible working hours. Do you work two or more days a week from home? Then you will receive a €45 net compensation per month
* 8% holiday allowance and 25 vacation days based on a full-time employment
* Travel allowance for commuting
* A good pension plan through the PostNL Pension Fund
* Training and development opportunities through the PostNL Academy
* Discounts on holidays, events, and products

title: Data Engineer Deep Turnaround
description:
**Nice to know (you)**
----------------------

* We are looking for a Data Engineer to join the Deep Turnaround Team of Royal Schiphol Group.
* Our team is known for its innovative spirit and collaborative approach—where each member plays a pivotal role in optimizing complex multi-airport operations with cutting-edge technology.
* We are going for it: creating the most sustainable and high-quality airports in the world.

**Connecting your world**
-------------------------


As a Data Engineer Deep Turnaround you will be involved in preventing flight delays by integrating real-time data with flight operations using AI-driven solutions. How exactly you accomplish this? That’s up to you. We trust in the way you set the lines and follow them. You put your talents to work at:


* Crafting business logic that seamlessly integrates flight information with our live events (tackling the stream-stream joining challenge) and derives further value out of our raw detections.
* Collaborating with our Data Scientist colleagues to make real-time streaming predictions.
* Handling the ingestion of flight data from multiple airports.
* Taking charge of the intricate multi-airport data landscape—the beating heart of our operations.

  

  

You will be part of utilizing AI-driven computer vision to monitor aircraft turnaround processes in real-time, optimizing efficiency and preventing delays. Join us to be part of a global rollout at major airports.


**You've got this**
-------------------


Schiphol connects your world. With the best people, we make travel safe and responsible. You contribute to this with with your unique talents, such as analysing and double-checking your work (and if necessary that of others) in detail. Also, you are the talent who analyses problems, recognises patterns and reasons logically. The result? Insight and solutions. In addition, for this position you have:

* A bachelor's degree or higher in Computer science / Software engineering or related field.
* 3+ years of relevant software development experience with Python.
* Experience with Git.
* Experience with Docker, Kubernetes, Kafka, and/or Spark.
* Experience with Machine Learning.


**You get this**
----------------

* € 4401 to € 6128 gross per month (Schaal 11).
* A 13th month (year-end bonus).
* An iPhone 14 or Samsung Galaxy S22. The choice is yours.
* The possibility to work 4 x 9 hours in a 36-hour work week.

  

  

These are just some of our terms of employment that come with this position (based on a 36-hour work week). Schiphol Group has even more to offer you. For the complete overview of all terms and conditions of employment, please visit Conditions - Werken bij Schiphol Group.


**About the Team**
------------------


The IT & Data department is creating the airport of the future. We do this using the smartest digital solutions, tools and applications. With state-of-the-art technology, we keep the airport running. Our enthusiastic team works on data-driven improvements in our processes, traveller flows and information provision. This is how we contribute to the best possible experience for travellers, customers and employees at and around the airport.


**Choose your destination**
---------------------------


What are your talents? What dreams do you have? What is your story? We are curious about you and invite you to apply. You can apply by sharing your motivation and resume with us via the application button below.


* We would like to receive your application for this position of Software Data Engineer Deep Turnaround before.
* Do you have questions about the application process? Contact Erwin Schuur, Recruitment Business Partner by sending a message to erwin.schuur@schiphol.nl
* For more information about applying at Schiphol Group: Job application process - Werken bij Schiphol Group.
* For the safety of our passengers and colleagues, a security screening (Certificate of Conduct) is always part of the recruitment process.

**About Schiphol Group**
------------------------


With 3,000 proud colleagues, we go the extra mile to connect the Netherlands with the rest of the world in the best possible way. Innovation, safety and cooperation are at the forefront. Together we give more meaning to travel and contribute to the economy and society. For more than 100 years. In the Netherlands and beyond. By the way, did you know that:


... Schiphol Group owns and operates Amsterdam Airport Schiphol, Rotterdam The Hague Airport and Lelystad Airport? We also have a majority stake in Eindhoven Airport.  

… there were approximately 442,000 aircraft movements to and from Schiphol Airport in 2023?  

... as a Software Data Engineer you will be joining the business area Deep Turnaround?

title: Data Scientist GreenWave
description:
**Nice to know (you)**
----------------------

* We are looking for a Data Scientist to join our GreenWave Team.
* Team GreenWave's mission is to create a seamless and fully predictable passenger flow without any waiting times.
* With 3,000 proud colleagues, we work toward our mission: "the world's most sustainable and high quality airports.

**Connecting your world**
-------------------------


As a Data Scientist GreenWave you will work in one of the few places in the Netherlands where you can literally look out of the window and seeing your software have direct impact. You are part of our operational excellence mission. How exactly you accomplish this? That’s up to you. We trust in the way you Envision the total concept even before it is actually there. You put your talents to work at:


* Work together with the Product Owner and the rest of your multi-disciplinary team translate business problems to sustainable data science solutions.
* Do experimentation to help improve the suggestions for timeslots.
* Experiment on extending the algorithm to include other parts of the Schiphol passenger journey.
* Work with various datasets to implement models in a highly complex environment.
* Take ownership with getting a project from PoC to implementation.

  

  

Working as a Data Scientist for Team GreenWave will allow you to make a real impact on the operational performance by perfectly align demand & capacity.


**You've got this**
-------------------


Schiphol connects your world. With the best people, we make travel safe and responsible. You contribute to this with with your unique talents, such as analysing problems, recognising patterns and reasoning logically. The result? Insight and solutions. Also, you are the talent who analyses and double-checks your work (and if necessary that of others) in detail. In addition, for this position you have:

* Minimum 3-4 years experience as a data scientist using Python.
* Experience in going beyond modeling & prototyping, so also with implementation.
* Pro-active team player with attention to detail. You'll land in a multi-disciplinary team with a product that touches a large part of our organization.
* MSc or PhD in a relevant field, like mathematics, physics, computer science, operations research or econometrics.
* Communicative skills: fluent in English is a must. Knowledge of the Dutch language is a plus.
* Ideally experience in Databricks / Azure.
* Ideally experience with Openshift / Kubernetes.
* Ideally experience with causal interference.


**You get this**
----------------

* € 4744 to € 6582 gross per month (Schaal 12).
* The possibility to work 4 x 9 hours in a 36-hour work week.
* An iPhone 14 or Samsung Galaxy S22. The choice is yours.
* An NS Business Card that fully reimburses travel by public transportation to and from work.

  

  

These are just some of our terms of employment that come with this position (based on a 36-hour work week). Schiphol Group has even more to offer you. For the complete overview of all terms and conditions of employment, please visit Conditions - Werken bij Schiphol Group.

title: Office Support Specialist (15 uur/week)
description:
**Smartvatten** is a dynamic workplace that values strategy, leadership, and collaboration. We help real estate and water utility companies optimize water consumption through monitoring, analysis, leak detection, and data visualization for a sustainable future.

Are you interested in being part of a purposeful job? Say no more; we seek a proactive, attentive part-timer (15 hours/week). The ideal candidate will handle office equipment, manage deliveries, and maintain a well-organized and efficient workspace.

The **Office Support Specialist's** all-around position and day-to-day tasks are focused on ensuring smooth daily operations by managing various office-related tasks, emphasizing supporting and assisting duties.

**What You'll Do:**

* Maintain a current inventory of office any equipment, assess the need for additional equipment, and ensure all devices are functional and available as required
* Sprinkle everyday magic into our workdays, fostering a fun, happy, and productive workplace environment. For example, one potential future project is refurnishing the office while considering cost-effectiveness
* Keep the office clean and organized, take care of communal areas and office plants
* Manage incoming and outgoing mail and packages, ensuring excellent internal distribution of mail and deliveries
* Execute engaging internal events, from creative contests to structured gatherings like local team-building activities, customer lunches, conferences, occasional celebrations, and attending business center community meetings
* Be the go-to person for employee needs and the first point of contact for facility, office, and occupational safety ombudsperson for safety checks and first aid compliance
* Foster a fantastic workplace experience by supporting employees on site (e.g., access keys, parking, bookings), embracing our hybrid work approach, and ensuring our office is a hub of positivity and productivity

**Is it you?**

* High school diploma or equivalent; additional qualifications in office administration or related fields are a plus
* Previous experience in an office management role or other service-focused roles
* **Bilingual Dutch level and fluent English is a must**
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook)
* Proactively can tackle unforeseen challenges and tasks, utilizing problem-solving skills to ensure a smooth and efficient office environment
* Has excellent organizational and multitasking abilities
* Possesses strong interpersonal and communication skills
* Bring innovative ideas to enhance our workplace
* Will thrive from working 1 to 2 days on-site, contributing to a vibrant and collaborative office culture

**Why** **Smartvatten?**

Take a look at More information about our solution & take a look at our career site . We are committed to creating an inclusive workplace where all team members, regardless of gender identity, sexual orientation, or disabilities, are guaranteed equal pay for equal work at every stage of their careers.

* Be an integral part of a global scaling journey
* Comprehensive starter kit including your preferred working tools such as PC or MacBook Air, Phone + phone Subscription Plan
* The opportunity to impact a more sustainable future
* Work-life balance and Flexibility
* You will be part of a company culture that promotes collaboration, compassion, and a positive work environment
* The workplace is located in a convenient area (Science Park 301, Amsterdam)
* Able to network with other companies as we are part of a business center

**Apply Easily by**

* Submitting your application (**HERE: https://jobs.smartvatten.com/jobs/4865742-office-support-specialist-15-hours-week**) using your LinkedIn profile or an English CV. (Application period: 19.08. - 01.09.2024) We are constantly taking a look at the applications. Do not miss the chance by applying later
* Chat: Engage in a 45-minute conversation with Claudia Cervantes, Talent Acquisition, to get an overview of the position and the company
* Big 5 (OCEAN) 10 min assessment for making customized interview questions and makinginformed hiring decisions
* Potentially meet your future closest colleague: Engage in a 45-minute discussion with Nick Hirschstein, Global Partner Manager
* Offer chat with Claudia and Greta Turkama, Head of People and Culture. Discuss the position benefits, perks, and the zero-hour employment contract and when you could start
* Welcome to the Smartvatten team, and start making a positive impact!

We will provide working tools and set up necessary accounts during the pre-onboarding. During the onboarding, we expect you to be a fast learner and organized enough to perform the day-to-day work. During the onboarding, it is crucial to start office-based for 1-3 days, then later based on working tasks hybrid.

Soort dienstverband: Parttime

Salaris: €18,00 - €22,00 per uur

Verwacht aantal uur: 15 per week

Arbeidsvoorwaarden:

* Telefoonplan
* Telefoon van de zaak
* Werk vanuit huis

Werkschema:

* ma-vr

Ervaring:

* kantoorassistente: 1 jaar (Gewenst)

Taal:

* Dutch (Vereist)

Werklocatie: Hybride werken in Amsterdam

Deadline sollicitaties: 01-09-2024

title: SharePoint Consultant
Senior Trade Analyst
description:
At Medtronic you can begin a life-long career of exploration and innovation, while helping champion healthcare access and equity for all. You’ll lead with purpose, breaking down barriers to innovation in a more connected, compassionate world.
A Day in the Life
We are looking for Senior Trade Analyst to join the EMEA Trade Operations team of Medtronic. Within Medtronic, Trade ensures that processes and systems adhere to trade laws and regulations controlling all imports and exports. Medtronic is committed to ensuring Trade Compliant processes and standard controls are in place in line with both the Medtronic Global Trade Compliance standard and the European Authorized Economic Operator (AEO) status.  

  

The person who will take this role will play a key role in the timely delivery of our products to both the DCs and the patients within the EMEA countries. The Sr Trade Analyst will support import broker management, import process development, and supporting AEO compliance tasks. Success in this role will require the ability to think critically and solve problems, a desire to continually improve, and the ability to work effectively in a team.
Responsibilities may include the following and other duties may be assigned:* Supporting implementation of new brokerage lanes for the countries of scope (as needed) and
* Creating, updating, and maintaining import SOPs with each import broker within scope (NL, UK, CH, NO, Canary Islands)
* Financial set-up for new IORs (Medtronic Accounts Payable or Intelligent Audit)
* Tracking monthly KPIs for imports and submitting data to Global Trade team
* Proactive management of import brokers in scope (QBRs, KPI reporting, continuous improvement, remediation on potential gaps inaudit results, etc.)
* Representation set-up as needed (Power of Attorneys, Representation forms, etc.)
* Creating, updating, and maintaining IOR tables within scope
* Supporting the implementation of audit process with import brokers and Audit team
* Working in partnership with Medtronic Deliver to improve pre-alert and NOA performance.
* Providing visibility to the leadership regarding import brokers and escalating challenges as needed
* Supporting AEO Remediation plans


Required Knowledge and Experience:* Bachelor’s degree (preferred degrees within International Trade, Supply Chain, Business administration, Customs, or Law)
* Min 3 years of relevant working experience
* Excellent English communication skills (verbal and written)
* Proficient with MS Excel – data analysis, VLOOKUP, data manipulation, pivot tables, formulas, and macros
* Result orientation by using data, KPI’s/Metrics
* Experience in trade compliance/operations within the EU, Norway, Switzerland and/or the UK.
* Proficient with Power BI – data entry, data relationships, importing and exporting to Excel, and reporting
* Experience with SAP ECC & GTS


Physical Job Requirements  

  

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees assigned to this position, but they are not an exhaustive list of all the required responsibilities and skills of this position.
Benefits & Compensation
Medtronic offers a competitive Salary and flexible Benefits Package  

A commitment to our employees lives at the core of our values. We recognize their contributions. They share in the success they help to create. We offer a wide range of benefits, resources, and competitive compensation plans designed to support you at every career and life stage.  

About Medtronic
We lead global healthcare technology and boldly attack the most challenging health problems facing humanity by searching out and finding solutions.  

Our Mission — to alleviate pain, restore health, and extend life — unites a global team of 90,000+ passionate people.  

We are engineers at heart— putting ambitious ideas to work to generate real solutions for real people. From the R&D lab, to the factory floor, to the conference room, every one of us experiments, creates, builds, improves and solves. We have the talent, diverse perspectives, and guts to engineer the extraordinary.
Learn more about our business, mission, and our commitment to diversity here

title: Business Analyst Credits
description:
Business Analyst Credits**At a glance**
---------------


Are you ready to be a part of the exciting changes happening in ABN Amro's Credits Landscape?


We are seeking individuals who are passionate about learning and developing their skills while designing future-proof end-to-end lending processes within Financing Solutions. ABN AMRO is committed to enriching and renewing the lending landscape by simplifying and accelerating processes to better identify customer risks and serve them transparently. As part of the Credits Capability Grid department, we are digitizing customer data and building a new central credit platform. Your role will be crucial in connecting a diverse range of stakeholders within the bank, identifying business needs and translating them to our IT department.


If you are ready to contribute to the credit landscape of the future and be a part of our mission to serve our customers better, then we want you on our team.  

Join us in building a brighter future for lending!

**Your job**
------------


We are looking for someone to design and continuously improve our new digital end-to-end lending processes. In this position, you will have the opportunity to make a positive impact on the future of lending.


You will be working for the Credits Facility Management team. This is a shared capability team that is responsible for the lifecycle of credit facilities (on boarding, monitoring, maintenance and termination). The challenge is to modernize the technology so that data is available 24/7 and the administration is easily configurable for new requirements. Your role will involve driving requirement gathering from end-users. In order to do this, you will need to align with various Business and IT stakeholders, such as Operations, Finance, Contracting, Risk and other Credit related (DevOps) teams.


As the bridge between end-users and our developers, you will learn the end-to-end journey of corporate credits and the daily tasks of our end-users.  

Examples of day-to-day tasks include:  

* Analysing services, business processes, information/process flows, user and system requirements to identify opportunities.
* Translating product roadmap features into concrete user stories by identifying and prioritizing technical and functional requirements.
* Creating visuals and clear documentation to develop a shared understanding of the topic and improve organizational learning.
* Supporting implementation, helping the development team to deliver quality by collaborating on test design and user acceptance tests.
**Working environment**
-----------------------


We are excited to welcome you to our DevOps team within the Credit Facility Management delivery streams. You will work closely with colleagues from other streams, such as Origination, Business Implementation, Regulatory and subject matter experts from departments such as Operations, Risk and Product Management. Collaboration is key to our success and we are committed to creating a supportive and inclusive workplace culture. DevOps, driven to learn and grow, and eager to contribute to our mission of shaping the future of lending. If you are a team player who enjoys working collaboratively, then we would love to hear from you. Join us in making a positive impact on the world of lending!

**Your profile**
----------------


As a problem-solver, you enjoy tackling complex challenges and providing structure to problems. You take ownership of challenges and can translate requirements into functionalities in collaboration with our IT teams. You are a connector, building bridges and bringing others together. In order to excel at this job, you need to be creative, good at stakeholder management, organized, empathetic towards users, like a challenge and eager to learn about our software and processes.


We welcome candidates of all backgrounds and experiences. We are looking for someone who is eager to learn and can bring a positive attitude to the team. We will provide you with the necessary training and support to excel in the role.


Requirements:  

* Bachelor's or Master's degree in any field.
* Ability to identify solution options and present advice to stakeholders in a convincing and structured manner.
* Experience in business analysis, coordination skills and stakeholder management.
* Affinity towards technology, data structures and querying.
* Knowledge of Credit Lifecycle processes and Credit Facility Management is a must.
* Move easily in a complex stakeholder field and a solid communicator and discussion partner.
* Self-starter with a critical look and positive attitude.

Join us in shaping the future of lending with your problem-solving skills and collaborative attitude. We look forward to hearing from you!

**We are offering**
-------------------

* The gross monthly salary displayed above is based on a 36-hour work week, including vacation pay and benefit budget.
* The Benefit Budget is 11% of your salary. The Benefit Budget allows you to acquire additional employment benefits. If you make no purchases or reservations in the Benefit Shop in a given month, you are paid one twelfth of your Benefit Budget that month.
* Five weeks of vacation per year. You have the option to purchase an additional four weeks per year.
* Personal development Budget of € 1,000 per year, which you can accumulate up to € 3,000.
* Possibility to work from home (in consultation with your team and depending on your position).
* An annual public transport pass with free public transportation throughout the Netherlands.
* An excellent pension scheme.
**Interested?**
---------------


Does this sound like something you’d be interested in? Or would you be interested to discuss our roadmap to get a real impression of our challenges and business transformations? We would very much like to come in contact with you. To find out more, contact Marleen de Haan (Product Owner CFM – marleen.de.haan@nl.abnamro.com), Renee Dorland (Product Owner CFM – renee.dorland@nl.abnamro.com) or Dennis Kornet (Capability Owner CFM – dennis.kornet@nl.abnamro.com).  

Note : you are preferably in the possession of a Dutch working permit and/or living in the Netherlands.

**Equal opportunities for all**
-------------------------------


The success of our organisation depends on the quality of our people and the ideas that they have. Truly surprising insights and innovative solutions for our clients result from an interplay of cultures, knowledge and experience. Diversity is therefore extremely important to our organisation. To ensure that everyone at ABN AMRO can develop their talents, we encourage an inclusive culture in which all colleagues feel engaged and appreciated.

**Disclaimer external recruitment agencies**
--------------------------------------------


External recruitment agencies need to have a signed agreement with ABN AMRO BANK N.V., executed by a Talent Acquisition Specialist, when submitting a resume to a vacancy. No unsolicited services or offers, please.

### **Wij bieden**

* Analytische skills

### **Wij vragen**

* Een toekomstgerichte mindset
company_description: Bij ABN AMRO hebben we een duidelijke purpose: Banking for better, for generations to come. Samen met onze klanten gaan we de uitdagingen van onze tijd aan en geven we vorm aan de toekomst.

title: .NET + Azure Cloud DevOps Engineer
description:
Imagine that you and your colleagues contribute to the financial performance statements of the bank. With the help of your efforts, our financial products will be correctly reflected and managed in our applications on a daily basis. This will expose you to a range of banking processes and financial products in the areas of profit and loss, reconciliations and accounting. Within the *P&L and Balance Sheet Control Applications team* you will play an essential role in developing and managing our applications to be ready for the challenges of today and tomorrow.

**You and your job**


As a .NET + Azure Cloud DevOPS Engineer with security awareness, you are responsible for the production support of our applications, for developing and managing our applications and last but not least for keeping our applications compliant from security perspective.


Our applications are used worldwide by Rabobank colleagues within various departments within the bank, such as: Product Control, Markets, Treasury and Risk Management. At this moment, **most of our applications are on premise and one application is in the Cloud**. Therefore it’s important to have experience and being driven to work on both technological platforms.


You play a vital role in delivering high quality products and services to our customers.


As the profile name says, your role exists out of 3 core activities:

* The development activities: You will maintain and improve processes and functionalities within our applications. On high level, the change requests/ideas for improvement will come from: the direct users of the applications; your Product Owner; your own Scrum team; Rabobank Compliance departments (with a focus on security).
* Operations activities: You will monitor our applications in production and will provide quick response/action in case of operational issues to ensure a stable production environment.
* Security activities: you will write and maintain our security documentation to ensure it is up to date; resolve vulnerabilities in our applications; and keep our applications compliant from security perspective.


Besides the development and operations core activities, it’s expected that you will contribute to business analysis and/or test activities when required. We work according to the scrum/agile methodology.

**Together we achieve more than alone**  

Collaboration is at the heart of everything we do. Within the P&L and Balance Sheet Control Applications team we bring talented people together to deliver reliable financial and management information to the global Wholesale & Rural business lines in a timely, efficient, and professional manner. Reliable financial information is supported by the independent daily valuation of financial instruments in the bank’s trading and banking portfolios and a comprehensive analysis/evidence of the performed controls.


Our Scrum team will consist of a group of about 6 DevOPS engineers, a Scrum Master, a Business Analyst and a Product Owner. The hands-on mentality and cooperative mind-set of our team allows for an open environment where development is stimulated and knowledge is shared. We believe that having a pleasant, respectful and fun atmosphere within the team provides a solid foundation on which we can work together and reach our goals.


Our team is part of the area of Product Control & Accounting W&R which acts as a Centre of Competence and supports various locations around the world such as Utrecht, London, New York, Sao Paulo, Hong Kong and Sydney. As part of the alignment of Rabobank’s strategy and the centralisation of these locations, this position allows exposure to different markets and optimizes the departments support model.

**You and your talent**  

We look for talented individuals that have an affinity for pro-activeness, judgement and decision making, analytical skills, result-oriented work and customer focus. You embrace change, go the extra mile and have you colleagues back. This role as a .NET + Azure Cloud DevOPS engineer with security awareness, will use these skills and allow you to develop yourself. Furthermore, you recognize yourself in the checklist below:

* 5+ years or more working experience as a Senior DevOPS engineer in complex IT landscape: On Prem and in the cloud
* HBO, Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in e.g.: computer sciences
* Agile/Scrum mindset
* Fluent in English, both in speaking and writing
* You are accurate, result-oriented, proactive, independent and a team player with strong problem-solving and analytical skills
* Besides the core DevOPS engineering activities, you are able and willing to do (technical) business analysis and test activities when required
* Experience with keeping systems in line with internal & industry compliancy standards
* You are aware of the developments in your profession and field of expertise, continuously seeking how to bring them to effective use in the organization
* Eager to keep learning new technologies
* A trusted mentor for colleagues, with an open mind and a keen eye for what is needed, bringing the best out of each other and creating great teams
* Experience in or affinity with Finance and Banking is an advantage


In addition, the below knowledge and skills are essential for the role:

* Knowledge of Cloud technologies & Cloud design patterns
* Azure Certifications
* Azure Resource Manager (ARM)
* Knowledge and experience with commonly used Azure resources like Azure Data Factory, SQL server, App services, Vnets
* Knowledge and experience with PowerBI
* Azure DevOps, Yaml pipelines(CI/CD)
* You master C#, ASP.NET MVC, .Net Core and ideally Blazor
* Domain-driven design, Solid Design principle (CQRS model)
* Unit test back and front end developer
* Excellent knowledge of T-SQL
* Databases: SQL Server, good to have a knowledge on database performance tools and experience working with large databases
* Able to manage .NET applications within a Windows environment

**To be considered for this position, you must be located in the Netherlands or elsewhere in the EU and have the legal right to work in the Netherlands. We are unable to consider candidates requiring relocation from another country.**

**This is what we offer you**

* a gross monthly salary between €4.292,- and €6.130,- (scale 9, 36 hours per week (40 hours not possible)).
* 13th month and holiday pay: as of January 1, 2023, the holiday allowance and annual allowance will usually be paid out in 12 equal monthly instalments. Employees have the option once a year to opt for the holiday allowance to be paid out in May and the annual allowance in December.
* an Employee Benefit Budget (11% of your monthly salary). You decide how to spend this budget. This may include purchasing extra leave days, making extra pension contributions, or even receiving a monthly cash pay-out.
* an annual personal development/training budget of € 1.400,-
* 100% reimbursement of commuting costs if you travel by public transport! Do you still prefer to travel by car or motorbike? Then choose a commuting allowance.
* a monthly € 40,- net work from home allowance, based on working from home 5 days per week.
* a monthly € 40,- net internet allowance.
* Attractive pension fund with a personal contribution of only 5.5%. Rabobank will contribute 21.5%.


This is a selection of the terms of employment for a DevOps Engineer based on a 36-hour working week. You can find all terms of employment on rabobank.jobs/en/conditions-of-employment.

**You and the job application process**

* Any questions about working at Rabobank and the process? Dino Džanković, Senior IT Recruiter via dino.dzankovic@rabobank.nl.
* You can find answers to the most frequently asked questions on https://rabobank.jobs/en/faq/
* A background check is part of the process.


Everyone is different, and it is exactly those differences that help us become an even better bank. That's why we want to know who you really are!


#LI-DD1 #vacancy #vacature #DevOps #DevOpsEngineer #ITJobs

title: MLOps Engineer
description:
At Picnic, we're revolutionizing the way people buy groceries with our affordable and sustainable app-only service. We do almost everything in-house, developing cutting-edge technologies and processes to ensure we continue to grow rapidly without missing a beat. If you're a passionate MLOps Engineer, we're offering you the opportunity to join the diverse team at our Amsterdam HQ and make a real difference in our data-driven, scale-up environment.


**In a nutshell**
-----------------



As a MLOps Engineer at Picnic, you'll work on building the tools and infrastructure to help our data scientists quickly build and productionize robust machine learning models.



Working closely with data scientists and analysts, you'll identify opportunities to improve the machine learning lifecycle at Picnic. From tools that improve model experimentation, to automations that simplify model deployment. You will collaborate with other platform teams at Picnic to make sure our tech stack remains aligned with the rest of the Tech team, while building and integrating the solutions that solve the problems unique to machine learning systems.



Check out some of our previous machine learning projects here: https://blog.picnic.nl/tagged/machine-learning


**What challenges await you**
-----------------------------


**Various MLOps-oriented projects to:**


* Make sure our machine learning models are reproducible and fair
* Improve monitoring in order to exercise operational excellence
* Simplify and standardize usage of tools by developing and inner-sourcing Python packages
* Automate machine learning model retraining and deployment


**Your contributions to the platform will power:**


* Recommendation systems: generating useful in-app grocery suggestions for our customers
* Search and suggest
* Fraud and outlier detection
* Predicting delivery drop-off times for our distribution
* Natural Language Processing: create automated systems to categorize and label Customer Success tickets
* Improving operational efficiency in our automated fulfillment center


**You will definitely:**


* Work closely with data scientists to identify opportunities, define use cases, and scope out the requirements
* Own your own project from inception to production
* Develop tools and enhancements for our Data Science Platform

‍ **Technologies you'll use**
---------------------------


* Python (PyTorch, Tensorflow, MLflow, FastAPI - or we build our own packages)
* SQL (Snowflake, Postgres)
* Git
* Docker
* Kubernetes
* Helm
* Terraform

 **Who you are**
---------------


* Master's degree or higher in AI, Computer Science, or a related field
* At least three years of experience in productionizing machine learning models, preferably using Docker and Kubernetes
* Proven track record of scaling development and adoption of machine learning in an organization
* Strong Python skills
* Comfortable with taking responsibility, showing initiative, and working independently
* Ability to think outside the box and an anything-is-possible mindset
* Quality control: commitment to excellence, performance, and efficiency
* ...and for bonus points: you have experience with Terraform

 **Picnic perks**
----------------


**Every expert was once a beginner!**


* You'll get plenty of opportunities to challenge yourself and grow, including the Picnic Tech Academy, Lunch & Learn sessions, and tailored soft skills training. We also offer free professional weekly language courses.


**Make a difference**


* You'll work in an awesome startup environment with the freedom to drive your own projects and create a visible impact.
* Our fully electric vehicles and sustainable business model mean you'll also be contributing to making the world a better place!


**Teamwork makes the dream work**


* With more than 80 nationalities across 3 countries, you'll be part of a diverse company with plenty of cool stuff to get involved with, from board game evenings to after-work drinks to our company ski trip and more!


**You are what you eat**


* You'll get freshly prepared, healthy lunches and snacks (with plenty of vegetarian, vegan, and halal options). Coffee snob? Don't worry, our amazing Picnic barista has you covered.


**Stay healthy**


* Mental health is important. As well as having the option to speak with Picnic colleagues who act as confidential advisors, our collaboration with OpenUp gives you easy access to professional psychologists, along with workshops and materials.
* There are plenty of sports communities and events to get involved with, from tennis to yoga, to climbing!


**Attractive package**


* We offer competitive compensation and a pension plan that looks out for your future self, as well as 25 vacation days per year, so you can recharge your batteries


**Benefits for expats**



It can be daunting starting a new job AND moving to a new country. That's why we offer lots of support for our many expat colleagues, including:


* Relocation package: If you join Picnic from abroad, we'll cover your trip to Amsterdam, sponsor your Visa, and offer you a month of accommodation while you settle in (as long as regulations allow).
* In the Netherlands, we offer support with your first tax report as well as arranging the 30% ruling.
* From health insurance to living arrangements to pet passports, there are always colleagues who've faced the same challenges and are more than happy to help!


**Commitment to equal opportunities**


*Picnic is an equal opportunity employer—this means that all decisions regarding applications will be based on qualifications and merit. Applicants will be regarded independently of age, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, ethnicity, skin color, civil status, religious beliefs, physical or mental disability, or any other factors protected by law.*


*At Picnic, we celebrate and value our differences and are committed to building a safe and inclusive working environment where everyone can be themselves.*
