title: Data Analyst / Business Developer III (ALM/Treasury) (Amsterdam)
description:
Data Analyst / Business Developer III (ALM/Treasury) (Amsterdam)**At a glance**
---------------


Are you a professional who enjoys working on the interface between content and IT? Are you able to fathom complex matters in order to make the right translation between business and IT? Do you get energy from advising and convincing stakeholders of your proposals, and are you able to show execution power during implementation? Then this role might be the perfect match for you!At ABN AMRO we are looking for a hands-on, results-driven Business Analyst / Data Analyst to join our Asset & Liability Management (ALM) Grid department. ALM can be described as a bank within the bank, as our department sits at the heart of the bank and is responsible for managing the bank’s balance sheet in terms of interest rate, liquidity, and capital risks.You’ll be joining a team of versatile engineers and business developers, and together you will be responsible for managing and improving ALM data processes and applications in an Agile and DevOps environment to deliver insights and reports for our stakeholders, who include the Board of Directors and other business segments of the bank, as well as external supervisory authorities like the DNB and ECB. Next to this, you will be involved in preparing and aligning the current solutions of your department to the Finance & Risk future target architecture and IT solution.

**Your work**
-------------


As a Business Analyst / Data Analyst, you are able to look at ALM challenges through the eyes of a stakeholder. You will work on multiple projects where you will initiate, improve and implement the processes, systems and data that your team is responsible for, with the focus on data analysis. You will be able to advise and convince stakeholders of the best approach based on your knowledge and analytical expertise, and work closely with other business and IT developers to achieve the goals of the ALM department.

**Work environment**
--------------------


The ALM Grid department is a diverse, dynamic and international environment. The ALM Grid consists of seven teams which are mainly organized according to the risk type domains (Interest Rate Risk, Liquidity Risk, Funds Transfer Pricing) and the data domain. You will be working in the data domain teams supporting the risk type teams with their data needs. We have an open and social culture, and value interpersonal at least as much as business and technical skills. You will get to work in:

  

* One of the front-running departments of ABN AMRO that takes pride in delivering robust and manageable future-proof solutions using the latest IT standards and technologies
* A multidisciplinary and multicultural self-organizing Agile-Scrum DevOps team (typically 5-9 people per team) that enjoys close cooperation with its stakeholders
* An open and highly autonomous culture where you are responsible for your goals and encouraged to regularly give and receive feedback
* An informal atmosphere with plenty of room for fun (movie/gaming events, team outings & monthly drinks)

  

The stakeholder field of the ALM Grid mainly consists of the ALM department itself, 2nd line ALM, ALM Risk modelling, Risk Reporting and Model Validation. Also, the data sources delivering parties are important stakeholders. In addition, your stakeholders are also the parties which consume the data to meet internal and external requirements. The final ALM reports, insights and analyses are discussed in senior management bodies like ALCO, BRC and ERM.

**Your profile**
----------------


We are looking for someone with a proactive and constructively critical attitude who is not afraid to tackle challenges head on. Besides a healthy knowledge/interest in complex and analytical matters (which characterizes ALM), you should possess the following skill-set:

* HBO / University education
* 5 (or more) years of work experience
* Strong communicator with excellent command of English (both verbal and written)
* Knowledge of banking products and/or ALM processes
* Knowledge of data processing management and ETL
* Experience with Excel, SQL, and/or similar data analysis tools
* Analytical mindset and the ability to quickly grasp complex business flows at a high level
* Supporting and collaborating with stakeholders and other departments
* Drive to improve self and the team
* Organizational sensitivity and able to adopt different styles to optimize effectiveness
* Taking ownership and guide the development team in the right direction

 *We encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet all the criteria.*

**We offer**
------------


A challenging environment offering you the possibility to develop yourself, both context wise regarding the ALM field of expertise, as well as on a personal/ professional level. You will work in the heart of the bank where it all comes together.

  

* The opportunity to be the best you can be, work flexible hours and lots of room to grow both personally and professionally
* A competitive salary, including vacation pay and benefit budget, based on a 36-hour work week (40-hr work week is possible)
* A Benefit Budget which is 11% of your salary. The Benefit Budget allows you to acquire additional employment benefits. If you make no purchases or reservations in the Benefit Shop in a given month, you are paid one twelfth of your Benefit Budget that month
* A personal development budget of EUR 1.000 per year, which you can accumulate up to € 3.000
* 25 days of vacation per year (Based on 40hr work week)
* Possibility to work from home (in consultation with your team and depending on your position)
* An annual public transport pass with free public transportation throughout the Netherlands
* An excellent pension scheme
**Interested?**
---------------


Do not hesitate to approach us for more details, or apply directly! For more information you can contact Asli Aydogdu (Product Owner Data) via asli.aydogdu@nl.abnamro.com or Joost Arendsen (ALM Domain Lead a.i.) joost.arendsen@nl.abnamro.com. We are looking forward to meet you!

**Equal opportunities for all**
-------------------------------


The success of our organisation depends on the quality of our people and the ideas that they have. Truly surprising insights and innovative solutions for our clients result from an interplay of cultures, knowledge and experience. Diversity is therefore extremely important to our organisation. To ensure that everyone at ABN AMRO can develop their talents, we encourage an inclusive culture in which all colleagues feel engaged and appreciated.

**Disclaimer external recruitment agencies**
--------------------------------------------


External recruitment agencies need to have a signed agreement with ABN AMRO BANK N.V., executed by a Talent Acquisition Specialist, when submitting a resume to a vacancy. No unsolicited services or offers, please.

### **Wij bieden**

* Een procesmatige aanpak
* Analytische skills
company_description: Bij ABN AMRO hebben we een duidelijke purpose: Banking for better, for generations to come. Samen met onze klanten gaan we de uitdagingen van onze tijd aan en geven we vorm aan de toekomst.

title: Senior Business Analyst- Oracle EBS
description:
Job Description  

Job Title: Sr Business Analyst-Oracle EBS


Location: Hoofddorp NL


Duration: 6-12 month contract


Working Mode: Hybrid

  


**Mandatory Skill:** Oracle EBS Order Management, Oracle EBS Manufacturing,

  


**Preferred/desired Skill:**

  

Oracle EBS Finance


Working domain experience in Pharmaceutical Manufacturing.


Working experience and solid understanding of Oracle ERP


Working experience in MS Office tools (Teams, Powerpoint, Visio etc)

  


**Job Description:**

  

Work closely with Global and Regional business partners to document business needs and requirements.


Well versed with Process manufacturing, Oracle ERP Finance, Order Management..


Collaborate with business subject matter experts, business users, solution architects, functional specialists to define and document business processes.


Collaborate with management and business operations units to comprehend and document decision support needs.


Collaborate with multi-functional teams to design and develop solutions to address business requirements; design, develop and document test scenarios, scripts and test data to support testing phase.


Coordinate and support testing activities: integration testing, SQA, user testing, validation, etc.


Support creation of training documentation and user training delivery


Assist in developing SOPs, work instructions and other relevant documentation.


Support the troubleshooting and resolution of post-production related issues, document issue resolution, and update documentations.


Communicate verbally and in written form with project team, informing them of potential risks.


Support multi-functional business systems for supply chain: Oracle EBS, Boundary system Integrations, Analytics, and Digital Supply Chain capabilities.


Support the project team with analysis, content build, review, editing and preparation.


Supporting all aspects of the engagement, including the relationship with key client partners


Demonstrating solid skills in the analysis, implementation and controls of assigned deliverables and tasks


Adhere to strong IT Governance and change control process for all system changes in a FDA regulated environment


Bring standard methodologies to deliver solutions through experience driven vision, planning and hands on experience in a regulated GxP environment.


Maintaining awareness of projects or changes to other systems that may affect their applications/systems and ensuring there is no degradation of service.

  


  

  

  

  

Skills
Integration Testing, Oracle Erp, Office Tools, Visio, Methodologies, Ms Office, Documentation, Powerpoint, Oracle  

  

  

About Company
Axiom is a global information technology, consulting and outsourcing company and services provider. Our IT solutions empower organizations and individuals throughout the world to maximize value and quality to succeed in today's challenging business environment. As a fast-growing new economy company, we focus our strengths to offer world-class solutions and services through the convergence of technology, innovation, expertise and experience. We provide software consulting, development and IT-enabled services to clients across the globe. We work towards delivering sustained value creation for customers, employees, industries and society at large. Core offerings include data warehousing, middleware development, product development and web-enablement of legacy applications in verticals like telecom, finance, healthcare, manufacturing, energy & utilities, retail & distribution, enablement of legacy Relentless exploration of technology horizons and a Global Delivery Model that is a judicious combination of onsite, offsite and offshore development, offer a complete range of high-ROI business solutions spanning the consulting, technology, operations and process outsourcing value chain.


We are committed to providing solutions that are simple to use and cost-effective, that meet the specific set of needs defined, and that are adaptable to meet future needs.


Our aim is to work in partnership with our clients to deliver innovative and tailored solutions. Listening to and understanding your issues To deliver benefit—rapidly—to our clients. To create a unique customer focus, both in our relationships with our clients and in our approach. To use our world beating, innovative applications and methodologies to deliver high business value to our clients. Attaining senior level commitment to your project. Collaborative working and transparency. Building the right team for the job. Regular communication and documentation. Respecting the knowledge and experience of your staf.

title: Business Analyst Credits
description:
Business Analyst Credits**At a glance**
  

  

Are you ready to be a part of the exciting changes happening in ABN Amro's Credits Landscape?
  

  

We are seeking individuals who are passionate about learning and developing their skills while designing future-proof end-to-end lending processes within Financing Solutions. ABN AMRO is committed to enriching and renewing the lending landscape by simplifying and accelerating processes to better identify customer risks and serve them transparently. As part of the Credits Capability Grid department, we are digitizing customer data and building a new central credit platform. Your role will be crucial in connecting a diverse range of stakeholders within the bank, identifying business needs and translating them to our IT department.
  

  

If you are ready to contribute to the credit landscape of the future and be a part of our mission to serve our customers better, then we want you on our team.
  

Join us in building a brighter future for lending!
  

  

**Your job**
  

  

We are looking for someone to design and continuously improve our new digital end-to-end lending processes. In this position, you will have the opportunity to make a positive impact on the future of lending.
  

  

You will be working for the Credits Facility Management team. This is a shared capability team that is responsible for the lifecycle of credit facilities (on boarding, monitoring, maintenance and termination). The challenge is to modernize the technology so that data is available 24/7 and the administration is easily configurable for new requirements. Your role will involve driving requirement gathering from end-users. In order to do this, you will need to align with various Business and IT stakeholders, such as Operations, Finance, Contracting, Risk and other Credit related (DevOps) teams.
  

  

As the bridge between end-users and our developers, you will learn the end-to-end journey of corporate credits and the daily tasks of our end-users.
  

Examples of day-to-day tasks include:
  

* Analysing services, business processes, information/process flows, user and system requirements to identify opportunities.
* Translating product roadmap features into concrete user stories by identifying and prioritizing technical and functional requirements.
* Creating visuals and clear documentation to develop a shared understanding of the topic and improve organizational learning.
* Supporting implementation, helping the development team to deliver quality by collaborating on test design and user acceptance tests.

  

**Working environment**
  

  

We are excited to welcome you to our DevOps team within the Credit Facility Management delivery streams. You will work closely with colleagues from other streams, such as Origination, Business Implementation, Regulatory and subject matter experts from departments such as Operations, Risk and Product Management. Collaboration is key to our success and we are committed to creating a supportive and inclusive workplace culture. DevOps, driven to learn and grow, and eager to contribute to our mission of shaping the future of lending. If you are a team player who enjoys working collaboratively, then we would love to hear from you. Join us in making a positive impact on the world of lending!
  

  

**Your profile**
  

  

As a problem-solver, you enjoy tackling complex challenges and providing structure to problems. You take ownership of challenges and can translate requirements into functionalities in collaboration with our IT teams. You are a connector, building bridges and bringing others together. In order to excel at this job, you need to be creative, good at stakeholder management, organized, empathetic towards users, like a challenge and eager to learn about our software and processes.
  

  

We welcome candidates of all backgrounds and experiences. We are looking for someone who is eager to learn and can bring a positive attitude to the team. We will provide you with the necessary training and support to excel in the role.
  

  

Requirements:
  

* Bachelor's or Master's degree in any field.
* Ability to identify solution options and present advice to stakeholders in a convincing and structured manner.
* Experience in business analysis, coordination skills and stakeholder management.
* Affinity towards technology, data structures and querying.
* Knowledge of Credit Lifecycle processes and Credit Facility Management is a must.
* Move easily in a complex stakeholder field and a solid communicator and discussion partner.
* Self-starter with a critical look and positive attitude.

  

Join us in shaping the future of lending with your problem-solving skills and collaborative attitude. We look forward to hearing from you!
  

  

**We are offering**  

  

  

* The gross monthly salary displayed above is based on a 36-hour work week, including vacation pay and benefit budget.
* The Benefit Budget is 11% of your salary. The Benefit Budget allows you to acquire additional employment benefits. If you make no purchases or reservations in the Benefit Shop in a given month, you are paid one twelfth of your Benefit Budget that month.
* Five weeks of vacation per year. You have the option to purchase an additional four weeks per year.
* Personal development Budget of € 1,000 per year, which you can accumulate up to € 3,000.
* Possibility to work from home (in consultation with your team and depending on your position).
* An annual public transport pass with free public transportation throughout the Netherlands.
* An excellent pension scheme.

  

**Interested?**
  

  

Does this sound like something you'd be interested in? Or would you be interested to discuss our roadmap to get a real impression of our challenges and business transformations? We would very much like to come in contact with you. To find out more, contact Marleen de Haan (Product Owner CFM - marleen.de.haan@nl.abnamro.com), Renee Dorland (Product Owner CFM - renee.dorland@nl.abnamro.com) or Dennis Kornet (Capability Owner CFM - dennis.kornet@nl.abnamro.com).
  

Note : you are preferably in the possession of a Dutch working permit and/or living in the Netherlands.
  

  

**Equal opportunities for all**
  

  

The success of our organisation depends on the quality of our people and the ideas that they have. Truly surprising insights and innovative solutions for our clients result from an interplay of cultures, knowledge and experience. Diversity is therefore extremely important to our organisation. To ensure that everyone at ABN AMRO can develop their talents, we encourage an inclusive culture in which all colleagues feel engaged and appreciated.
  

  

**Disclaimer external recruitment agencies**
  

  

External recruitment agencies need to have a signed agreement with ABN AMRO BANK N.V., executed by a Talent Acquisition Specialist, when submitting a resume to a vacancy. No unsolicited services or offers, please.
  

  

Lees meer
  

  

**Wie zijn je collega's?**
  

  

"Al op mijn 29ste mocht ik een Corporate Sales-desk in het buitenland opzetten. Dat is typisch ABN AMRO: je krijgt hier al op jonge leeftijd veel verantwoordelijkheid."
  

Lees het verhaal
  

  

**Mike Otten**
  

Director Corporate Sales, Interest Rates

title: Financial Engineer - AMD Public MAS Strats - Analyst - The Hague
description:
Financial Engineer - AMD Public MAS Strats - Analyst - The Hague**Goldman Sachs Asset & Wealth Management:**
  

As one of the world's leading asset managers, our mission is to help our clients achieve their investment goals. To best serve our clients' diverse and evolving needs, we have built our business to be global, broad and deep across asset classes, geographies and solutions.
  

Goldman Sachs Asset & Wealth Management is one of the world's leading asset management institutions. AWM delivers innovative investment solutions managing close to Two Trillion US Dollars on a global, multi-product platform. In addition to traditional products (e.g. Equities, Fixed Income) our product offering also includes Hedge Funds, Private Equity, Fund of Funds, Quantitative Strategies, Fundamental Equity and a Multi-Asset Pension Solutions Business. Software is engineered in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, adapting to market and customer needs to deliver robust solutions in an ever-changing business environment.
  

**What We Do**
  

Multi-Asset Solutions, "MAS" is an investing group within the Asset Management Division at Goldman Sachs. MAS is responsible for managing customized multi-asset class portfolios and funds, including discretionary mandates for US and international public pension plans, sovereign wealth funds and insurance companies and providing outsourced CIO services. The team is comprised of professionals with deep and varied investment backgrounds who specialize in designing and implementing customized multi-asset class portfolios.
  

Our Engineering and Strategist teams are responsible for building portfolio management and asset allocation tools to help our portfolio managers and clients make critical investment decisions for multi-billion dollar portfolios. We also build quantitative models that underpin our investment philosophy and process.
  

**Who We Look For**
  

We are looking for quantitative engineers to join our Strats team to help with core initiatives to deliver our next-generation digital experience to internal and external users using open source tools and frameworks. Our goal is to build scalable, extensible tools that have immediate impact on a growing user base and will serve our needs in the long term to outperform our competitors. We are a fun, entrepreneurial team that loves coding, investing, and turning our ideas into reality. We are looking for creative, self-driven developers who want to grow and learn from others in a fast-paced environment. The ideal candidate has a strong mix of software engineering and quantitative backgrounds. You have a track record with JavaScript front and back-end frameworks or Python. You enjoy working with end users to understand the problem at hand and help design the solution, and are excited to learn about investment finance and portfolio management concepts. You will engineer software across all phases of the software development life cycle: partnering with MAS investing professionals to design new features, building those features, creating, and running tests, receiving feedback, and delivering enhancements.
  

**Requirements**
  

* Bachelors, Masters or equivalent experience in computer science, mathematics or engineering
* Meaningful experience in, but not limited to, any of the following: Javascript frameworks (React/Angular/Node), MongoDB/NoSQL, SQL, Python
* Strong knowledge of data structures, algorithms and object oriented programming
* Strong communication skills, ability to work on a fast-paced team and collaborate with stakeholders and end users
* Knowledge of or interest in learning investment finance, portfolio theory and analytics (portfolio optimization, simulation or glidepath)

title: Business Developer II (ALM/Treasury)
description:
Business Developer II (ALM/Treasury)**At a glance**
---------------


Are you a professional who enjoys working on the interface between content and IT? Are you able to fathom complex matters in order to make the right translation between business and IT? Do you get energy from advising and convincing stakeholders of your proposals, and are you able to show execution power during implementation? Then this role might be the perfect match for you!

  

At ABN AMRO we are looking for a hands-on, results-driven Business Analyst / Data Analyst to join our Asset & Liability Management (ALM) Grid department. ALM can be described as a bank within the bank, as our department sits at the heart of the bank and is responsible for managing the bank’s balance sheet in terms of interest rate, liquidity, and capital risks.

  

You’ll be joining a team of versatile engineers and business developers, and together you will be responsible for managing and improving ALM data processes and applications in an Agile and DevOps environment to deliver insights and reports for our stakeholders, who include the Board of Directors and other business segments of the bank, as well as external supervisory authorities like the DNB and ECB. Next to this, you will be involved in preparing and aligning the current solutions of your department to the Finance & Risk future target architecture and IT solution.

**Your work**
-------------


As a Business Analyst / Data Analyst, you are able to look at ALM challenges through the eyes of a stakeholder. You will work on multiple projects where you will initiate, improve and implement the processes, systems and data that your team is responsible for, with the focus on data analysis. You will be able to advise and convince stakeholders of the best approach based on your knowledge and analytical expertise, and work closely with other business and IT developers to achieve the goals of the ALM department.

**Work environment**
--------------------


The ALM Grid department is a diverse, dynamic and international environment. The ALM Grid consists of seven teams which are mainly organized according to the risk type domains (Interest Rate Risk, Liquidity Risk, Funds Transfer Pricing) and the data domain. You will be working in the data domain teams supporting the risk type teams with their data needs. We have an open and social culture, and value interpersonal at least as much as business and technical skills. You will get to work in:

  

* One of the front-running departments of ABN AMRO that takes pride in delivering robust and manageable future-proof solutions using the latest IT standards and technologies
* A multidisciplinary and multicultural self-organizing Agile-Scrum DevOps team (typically 5-9 people per team) that enjoys close cooperation with its stakeholders
* An open and highly autonomous culture where you are responsible for your goals and encouraged to regularly give and receive feedback
* An informal atmosphere with plenty of room for fun (movie/gaming events, team outings & monthly drinks)

  

The stakeholder field of the ALM Grid mainly consists of the ALM department itself, 2nd line ALM, ALM Risk modelling, Risk Reporting and Model Validation. Also, the data sources delivering parties are important stakeholders. In addition, your stakeholders are also the parties which consume the data to meet internal and external requirements. The final ALM reports, insights and analyses are discussed in senior management bodies like ALCO, BRC and ERM.

**Your profile**
----------------


We are looking for someone with a proactive and constructively critical attitude who is not afraid to tackle challenges head on. Besides a healthy knowledge/interest in complex and analytical matters (which characterizes ALM), you should possess the following skill-set:

* HBO / University education
* 2 (or more) years of work experience
* Strong communicator with excellent command of English (both verbal and written)
* Knowledge of banking products and/or ALM processes
* Knowledge of data processing management and ETL
* Experience with Excel, SQL, and/or similar data analysis tools
* Analytical mindset and the ability to quickly grasp complex business flows at a high level
* Supporting and collaborating with stakeholders and other departments
* Drive to improve self and the team
* Organizational sensitivity and able to adopt different styles to optimize effectiveness
* Taking ownership and guide the development team in the right direction

 *We encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet all the criteria.*

**We offer**
------------


A challenging environment offering you the possibility to develop yourself, both context wise regarding the ALM field of expertise, as well as on a personal/ professional level. You will work in the heart of the bank where it all comes together.

  

* The opportunity to be the best you can be, work flexible hours and lots of room to grow both personally and professionally
* A competitive salary, including vacation pay and benefit budget, based on a 36-hour work week (40-hr work week is possible)
* A Benefit Budget which is 11% of your salary. The Benefit Budget allows you to acquire additional employment benefits. If you make no purchases or reservations in the Benefit Shop in a given month, you are paid one twelfth of your Benefit Budget that month
* A personal development budget of EUR 1.000 per year, which you can accumulate up to € 3.000
* 25 days of vacation per year (Based on 40hr work week)
* Possibility to work from home (in consultation with your team and depending on your position)
* An annual public transport pass with free public transportation throughout the Netherlands
* An excellent pension scheme
**Interested?**
---------------


Do not hesitate to approach us for more details, or apply directly! For more information you can contact Asli Aydogdu (Product Owner Data) via asli.aydogdu@nl.abnamro.com or Joost Arendsen (ALM Domain Lead a.i.) joost.arendsen@nl.abnamro.com. We are looking forward to meet you!

**Equal opportunities for all**
-------------------------------


The success of our organisation depends on the quality of our people and the ideas that they have. Truly surprising insights and innovative solutions for our clients result from an interplay of cultures, knowledge and experience. Diversity is therefore extremely important to our organisation. To ensure that everyone at ABN AMRO can develop their talents, we encourage an inclusive culture in which all colleagues feel engaged and appreciated.

**Disclaimer external recruitmentagencies**
-------------------------------------------


External recruitment agencies need to have a signed agreement with ABN AMRO BANK N.V., executed by a Talent Acquisition Specialist, when submitting a resume to a vacancy. No unsolicited services or offers, please.

### **Wij bieden**

* Een procesmatige aanpak
* Analytische skills
company_description: Bij ABN AMRO hebben we een duidelijke purpose: Banking for better, for generations to come. Samen met onze klanten gaan we de uitdagingen van onze tijd aan en geven we vorm aan de toekomst.

title: Financial Analyst
description:
SFI Markets is a specialized Fixed Income Sales Trading and DCM boutique based in Amsterdam, the



Netherlands. Focusing mostly on illiquid debt and unique credit situations, we leverage our deep



markets and product knowledge to deliver superior results and services for our clients. We place and



trade all kinds of debt – in the form of bonds or loans – and across all types and categories such as



money markets, rates, credit, EM, project finance or structured products.

  

At SFI Markets, the operations team is the glue that keeps the company together. The team currently



consists of 15 colleagues who are responsible for Legal, Compliance, Finance, Mid-Office, IT and HR and



Recruitment. All colleagues work on different projects, and in a regulated business like ours, there can



be a big overlap between teams. We work in a fast-paced environment where we like to reward our



employees for their output.

  

The Financial Analyst at SFI Markets, responsible for managing financial data and supporting Mid-Office



team. It requires a strong grasp of financial principles, meticulous attention to detail, and superb



organizational skills in collaboration with Mid-Office, Compliance and Front Office teams to support the



company's trading operations.

 **Key Responsibilities**  

Finance Support:  

* Maintain accurate financial records, including transaction details, invoices, and receipts.
* Analyze financial data and performance metrics to provide insights into business trends,


variances, and areas for improvement.  

* Support Mid-Office with settlements, pre-matching trades, solved unsettled trades and P&L.
* Reconcile trading accounts, bank statements, and other financial records regularly.
* Assist in the preparation of annual financial statements and other regulatory reporting


requirements.  

* Identify and implement process improvements to enhance the efficiency and accuracy of


financial operations.  

* Conduct cost-benefit analysis to evaluate business initiatives, capital expenditures, and


operational projects.  

* Identify opportunities for process improvements within the finance function to enhance


efficiency and effectiveness.  

* Ensure compliance with financial regulations and company policies. Assist in the development


and implementation of internal controls.* Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics, or a related field. A master’s degree or



professional certification (e.g., CFA, CPA) is a plus.


* 2-4 years of experience in financial analysis, accounting, or a related role.


* Mid-Office experience is a plus.


* Strong proficiency in financial modeling and data analysis tools (e.g., Excel, financial software,



ERP systems).


* Excellent analytical skills with a keen eye for detail.


* Strong communication skills, with the ability to present complex financial information in a clear



and concise manner.


* Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.


* Experience with financial reporting and budgeting processes.


* Knowledge of financial regulations and accounting principles.

title: Business Analyst – ESG Operational Readiness
description:
ING aims to put sustainability at the heart of what we do, defining new ways of doing business where the planet and people are just as important as economic growth. It's about making progress together, step by step.  

  

With climate change posing an unparalleled challenge to our planet’s health and the sustainability of societies and economies worldwide, ING is committed to contributing to the global transition to a low-carbon, climate-resilient economy. One of the ways ING can make a positive impact on climate action is through our financing efforts. We aim to get a grip on the CO2 emissions of our lending portfolio and guide our customers' sustainable transitions.

**The team**


As part of ING’s commitment to sustainable growth, we are building the ESG Operational Readiness Team within the Global COO Risk Services Organization and are seeking an Business Analyst to join us. You will play a crucial part in the team by actively working on ESG programs for the bank and work with domain experts, and implementation teams across different business lines (Wholesale Banking, Business Banking, and Retail Banking) to ESG data delivery, making them ready for reporting.

 **Roles and responsibilities**

* Oversee data collection activities by collaborating with ESG capability owners across ING to manage the end-to-end data delivery process.
* Refine, implement and operationalize the end-to-end ESG data flow in line with QBR demands, including building a DataMart if needed, collecting data, and ensuring its availability for reporting purposes.
* Enhance data delivery processes, ensuring the quality, consistency, and accuracy of data.
* Refine and implement a global Physical Risk calculation tool for Retail, Wholesale, and Business Banking.
* Foster connections among colleagues, topics, and expertise, maintaining continuous communication with all relevant stakeholders.

**How to succeed**


We hire smart people like you for your potential. Our biggest expectation is that you’ll stay curious. Keep learning. Take on responsibility. In return, we’ll back you to develop into an even more awesome version of yourself.

* Ability to collect, process, and analyze large and complex datasets from various sources.
* Ability to ensure the accuracy and completeness of ESG data, making it ready for reporting.
* Ability to identify more efficient methods for data collection and ingestion.
* Ability to Translate stakeholder requirements into actionable implementation plans.
* Commit to learning new ESG concepts, regulations, and industry best practices in a fast-paced environment.
* Ability to work data-driven and provide insights based on relevant ESG indicators, with curiosity and drive to stay updated on sustainability trends.

**Rewards and benefits**


We want to make sure that it’s possible for you to strike the right balance between your career and your private life. You can find out more about our employment conditions at https://www.ing.jobs/netherlands/Why-ING/benefits.htm


The benefits of working with us at ING include:

* A salary tailored to your qualities and experience
* 24-27 vacation days depending on contract
* Pension scheme
* 13th month salary
* Individual Savings Contribution (BIS), 3.5% of your gross annual salary
* 8% Holiday payment
* Hybrid working to blend home working for focus and office working for collaboration and co-creation
* Personal growth and challenging work with endless possibilities
* An informal working environment with innovative colleagues

**About us**


With 60,000 employees and operations in approximately 40 countries, there is no shortage of opportunities for people with initiative who want to help people take a step ahead in life and in business. Do you want to work at the cutting edge of what’s possible and at the same time ensure you work with integrity and hold the customer’s interests at heart? Do you want to be surrounded by progressive, inspiring, diverse and supportive colleagues? Then there is no better place to invest your talents than at ING. Join us. Apply today.

**Questions?**


Contact the recruiter attached to the advertisement for more information. Want to apply directly? Please upload your CV and motivation letter by clicking the “Apply” button.


Please note, multiple interview steps involving various business stakeholders will be part of the selection process.
company_description: With 9 million account holders, ING is one of the largest and most prominent financial service providers in the Netherlands. We are part of ING Group, a global financial institution.

title: Lab Analyst I
description:
Lab Analyst - Netherlands
ICON plc is a world-leading healthcare intelligence and clinical research organization. We’re proud to foster an inclusive environment driving innovation and excellence, and we welcome you to join us on our mission to shape the future of clinical development
Job Title: Lab Analyst
Location: Assen, Netherland
At ICON, it’s our people that set us apart. Our diverse teams enable us to become a better partner to our customers and help us to fulfil our mission to advance and improve patients’ lives.
Our ‘Own It’ culture is driven by four key values that bring us together as individuals and set us apart as an organisation: Accountability & Delivery, Collaboration, Partnership and Integrity. We want to be the Clinical Research Organisation that delivers excellence to our clients and to patients at every touchpoint. In short, to be the partner of choice in drug development.
That’s our vision. We’re driven by it. And we need talented people who share it.
If you’re as driven as we are, join us. You’ll be working in a dynamic and supportive environment, with some of the brightest and the friendliest people in the sector, and you’ll be helping shape an industry.
We have an incredible opportunity for a Lab Analyst to join the team in Assen, Netherlands.
The Role:* Routine sample processing with different techniques.
* Interpreting and data processing/reporting results and approve or reject sample analysis.
* Identifying deviations and performing investigation under supervision of a lab analyst level 3 or higher.
* Performs (peer) data review for quality control.
* Has a thorough understanding and complies with GxP and other appropriate regulations.
* Identifies and reports irregularities identified with any aspects of work.
* Economically utilizes materials in operation of daily tasks.
* Ensures on-time task completion to support the overall goal of on-time study completion.
* Assists in the organization and housekeeping of the laboratory Training lab analyst level 1 (before a level 1 lab analyst can train, the lab analyst needs to have minimum 1 year of experience).
* In study planning (daily basis).
* Understands the scientific principles behind analysis methods utilized.
* Familiar with the technique: ELISA or Flow Cytometry


What you will need:* Knowledgeable of Bioanalytical or clinical laboratory processes.
* Very detail oriented and performs few mistakes even when performing routine or repetitive tasks.
* Applies process and systems to routine.
* Uses existing techniques to prepare samples for instrument analysis.
* Performs specific and routine sample analysis.
* Solves routine issues. May seek assistance to resolve more complex and difficult issues.
* Erroneous decisions or failure to achieve results will cause reprocessing of samples potentially leading to missed milestones, study failure and subject safety (in case of clinical chemistry lab).


#LI-JS2
Benefits of Working in ICON:
Our success depends on the quality of our people. That’s why we’ve made it a priority to build a culture that rewards high performance and nurtures talent.
We offer very competitive salary packages. And to keep them competitive, we regularly benchmark them against our competitors. Our annual bonuses reflect delivery of performance goals – both ours and yours.
We also provide a range of health-related benefits to employees and their families and offer competitive retirement plans – and related benefits such as life assurance – so you can save and plan with confidence for the years ahead.
But beyond the competitive salaries and comprehensive benefits, you’ll benefit from an environment where you are encouraged to fulfil your sense of purpose and drive lasting change.
ICON is an equal opportunity and inclusive employer and is committed to providing a workplace free of discrimination and harassment. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.
If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application process, or in order to perform the essential functions of a position, please let us know through the form below.
What ICON can offer you:
Our success depends on the quality of our people. That’s why we’ve made it a priority to build a diverse culture that rewards high performance and nurtures talent.
In addition to your competitive salary, ICON offers a range of additional benefits. Our benefits are designed to be competitive within each country and are focused on well-being and work life balance opportunities for you and your family.
Our benefits examples include:* Various annual leave entitlements
* A range of health insurance offerings to suit you and your family’s needs.
* Competitive retirement planning offerings to maximize savings and plan with confidence for the years ahead.
* Global Employee Assistance Programme, TELUS Health, offering 24-hour access to a global network of over 80,000 independent specialised professionals who are there to support you and your family’s well-being.
* Life assurance
* Flexible country-specific optional benefits, including childcare vouchers, bike purchase schemes, discounted gym memberships, subsidised travel passes, health assessments, among others.

Visit our careers site to read more about the benefits ICON offers.
ICON, including subsidiaries, is an equal opportunity and inclusive employer and is committed to providing a workplace free of discrimination and harassment. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.
If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application process, or in order to perform the essential functions of a position, please let us know or submit a request here.
Interested in the role, but unsure if you meet all of the requirements? We would encourage you to apply regardless – there’s every chance you’re exactly what we’re looking for here at ICON whether it is for this or other roles.

title: Senior Consultant - Analytics Consulting
description:
What are we looking for? Lead AI Engineer.  

We are looking for smart, self-driven, high-energy people with top notch communication skills, intellectual curiosity and passion for technology in the Machine Learning Space. Our analysts have a blend of in-depth domain expertise in one or more areas (Retail, CPG, Logistics, Manufacturing, Life Sciences, Finance and Insurance), strong business and technical acumen along with excellent soft skills.  

  

What do we require?
  

To work with clients to understand the issues they face, diagnose problems, design solutions and facilitate solution deployment on the cloud. You can be an individual contributor or lead small teams depending on the project. You will be pivotal to understanding the requirement, problem definition and discovery of the overall solution. You will also have the opportunity to shape value-adding consulting solutions for clients by connecting various functions of cloud components.  

Industry knowledge - Knows advanced concepts of machine learning, has deployed ML/AI solutions in the cloud, has a deep understanding of coding practices, knows how to guide teams on debugging issues, can connect the dots to arrive at a solution and is very good at presentation of the ideas, thoughts and solutions.  

  

Technical knowledge- has expertise in building and deploying AI solutions in the cloud with hands on coding experience in –  

* Python Programming - Expert and Experienced
* DevOps Working knowledge with implementation experience - 1 or 2 projects a minimum
* Hands-On MS Azure/AWS/GCP Cloud knowledge
* Experience in development of Information extraction pipelines (OCR, NLP, text/layout segmentation) using Open-source tools/Models (ex. tesseract, PaddleOCR, etc.) or Deep Neural Network (Yolo, Detectron, etc)
* Experience in fine tuning of pretrained models (pytorch or tensorflow)
* Experience in Data Modeling and Semantic search using sparse and dense indexes. Basic Understanding of LLM indexing tools and libraries (Langchain, LLamaindex, Haystack)
* Experience in Microservices development, API backend development using FastAPI
* MLOps (model/component dockerization, Kubernetes deployment) in multiple environments (AWS, AZURE, GCP). Operationalization of AI solutions to production.
* Relational DB (SQL), Graph DB (Neo4j) and Vector DB (Pinecone, Weviate, Qdrant)
* Guide team to debug issues with pipeline failures
* Engage with Business / Stakeholders with status update on progress of development and issue fix
* Automation, Technology and Process Improvement for the deployed projects
* Setup Standards related to Coding, Pipelines and Documentation
* Adhere to KPI / SLA for Pipeline Run, Execution
* Research on new topics, services and enhancements in Cloud Technologies

  

Responsible for successful delivery of Gen AI and Machine Learning solutions and services in client consulting environments;
  

Define key business problems to be solved; formulate high level solution approaches and identify data to solve those problems, develop, analyze/draw conclusions and present to client.  

Assist clients with operationalization metrics to track performance of AI Models  

Agile trained to manage team effort and track through JIRA  

High Impact Communication- Assesses the target audience need, prepares and practices a logical flow, answers audience questions appropriately and sticks to timeline.  

  

Education and Experience:  

* Master’s degree in Computer Science Engineering or other related fields, with relevant experience in the field of MLOps / AI / Cloud
* Domain experience in Retail, CPG, Logistics, Manufacturing, Life Sciences, Finance or Insurance
* Exposure to US or European overseas markets is preferred


Domain / Technical / Tools Knowledge:  

* Object oriented programming, coding standards, architecture & design patterns, Config management, Package Management, Logging, documentation
* Proficiency with data analysis tools (e.g., SQL, R & Python), database concepts/reporting & Data Science concepts
* Information extraction pipelines (OCR, NLP, text/layout segmentation) using Open-source tools/Models (ex. tesseract, PaddleOCR, etc.) or Deep Neural Network (Yolo, Detectron, etc)
* Pretrained models (pytorch or tensorflow)
* Data Modeling and Semantic search using sparse and dense indexes. LLM indexing tools and libraries (Langchain, LLamaindex, Haystack)
* Microservices development, API backend development using FastAPI
* MLOps (model/component dockerization, Kubernetes deployment) in multiple environments (AWS, AZURE, GCP). Operationalization of AI solutions to production.
* Relational DB (SQL), Graph DB (Neo4j) and Vector DB (Pinecone, Weviate, Qdrant)
* Experience designing and implementing ML Systems & pipelines, MLOps practices
* Exposure to event driven orchestration, Online Model deployment
* Hands on experience in working with client IT/Business teams in gathering business requirement and converting into requirement for development team
* Experience in managing client relationship and developing business cases for opportunities

  

All aspects of employment at Infosys are based on merit, competence and performance. We are committed to embracing diversity and creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Infosys is proud to be an equal opportunity employer

title: Senior Test Automation Engineer
description:
Job Title
Senior Test Automation Engineer
Job Description*At Vanderlande, we design, develop and install baggage handling systems for (large) airports. An important part of these systems is IT software that is used for planning, automated transport, monitoring and control.**Our customers are expecting regular updates and new features. To support this, we have started to make our software easier to deploy and configure and more open to extensions. This requires refactoring, migrating to a new technology stack, and in some cases rebuilding. At the same time, we still need to accommodate new features.*
What are we looking for:
We are looking for a Senior or Specialist Test Automation Engineer in the department of Platform System Integration and QA.
What should you bring along for this role:
As a senior or specialist in Test Automation Engineering (integration) in our team, you are involved in ensuring the seamless integration of various software components. Here are some key tasks associated with this role:* Create (design, develop and improve) automated test scripts that validate the integration points between different modules or systems.
* Knowledge testing frameworks and tools (such as Java, Playwright etc.) to build robust and maintainable test suites.
* Write clean, efficient, and reusable code to ensure long-term maintainability.
* Adhere to best practices for test automation, including naming conventions, code organization, and handling test data. Knows Continuous improvement is key to
* Proactive in identifying, analyzing, and investigating defects or anomalies, and in reaching out to teams to resolve issues.
* Collaborate with developers and QA analysts to identify root causes, propose solutions, to address integration issues and improve overall system quality.
* Work closely with PO, architects, SM and other stakeholders to understand requirements, deadlines and needs of Integration initiatives and team.
* Stay updated on the latest trends, tools, and methodologies related to test automation.


Key qualifications and requirements* ISTQB is an advantage.
* Domain knowledge in logistics, warehousing is a pre/advantage.
* Has experience in Agile SAFE environment.
* Knowledgeable on testing tools with experience in the following:
* Working knowledge of developing/deployment of test systems/frameworks within cloud systems (Azure, AWS, etc.)
* API Testing – Postman, SoapUI (required work experience in at least one option)
* UI Automation Testing: Playwright, Cypress (required work experience in at least one option)
* BDD Framework: Cucumber (Java, JavaScript), Gherkin
* Performance Testing: Gatling (is an advantage)
* Experience in working with GIT (Bitbucket), Jira, QC, docker, CICD (flux or similar), Kafka, etc.


What we offer
In this challenging role, you will have the chance to make a significant contribution to industry-leading projects and be connected to our dedicated people and customers. We offer a position in an informal, international and professional working environment with a lot of scope for personal development. By joining our profitable and growing company you will be able to reach your goals and focus on your future.
This position offers a competitive salary range of € 4056,33 to € 6186,88 gross per month(excluding 8% holiday allowance). Through exceeding performance expectations, you even have the possibility to grow outside this scale.
On top of your fixed salary you’ll receive the following secondary benefits:  

  

* 40 vacation days (20 statutory days and a flexible budget worth 20 days).
* Flexible working hours.
* A hybrid workplace (40% working from home and 60% in the office).
* A Health & Wellbeing budget worth €300,- per calendar year.
* Commuting allowance, including full reimbursement of travel by public transport.
* Working from home allowance.
* Collective pension scheme and discount on additional health insurance.
* On-site company health centres with a gym, physiotherapists and occupational therapists.
* Vanderlande Academy and training facilities to boost your skills.
* A variety in Vanderlande Network communities and initiatives.
* And a great company restaurant and coffee bar with barista.


Contact
Are you interested in this position? Then apply now directly on our workday vacancy link with your resume and motivation letter!
For more information about the position, please contact robin.overweel@vanderlande.com
PS: Due to process compliance, we cannot process email applications. Kindly use the correct vacancy link to apply for this vacancy.
Diversity & Inclusion
Vanderlande is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regards to race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status.
company_description: Vanderlande is the global market leader for future-proof logistic process automation at airports and in the parcel market. We are also a leading supplier of process automation solutions for warehouses

title: Pricing Analyst Commercial Finance Europe - fully remote
description:
**Work Schedule**


Standard (Mon-Fri)**Environmental Conditions**


Office**Job Description**

**Pricing Analyst**
-------------------


The Clinical Diagnostics Division is looking for a Pricing Analyst based in Europe to provide support to the Global Commercial Operations (GCO) organization. In coordination with Finance, the Commercial Organization and Marketing leaders, the Pricing Analyst would lead the pricing processes across various dimensions of the European GCO organization, influencing all pricing decisions and drive the strategies, processes, and systems used to develop, implement, and maintain standard pricing methods.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Be a key part of identifying and crafting price improvement projects and lead the implementation and roll-out of key methods and tools.
* Lead daily pricing operations such as maintenance of list prices and discount matrix.
* Actively work on process improvement to streamline existing processes.
* Develop, automate, and scale data analytics and data visualization to measure business performances, including pricing effectiveness, share gain, customer acquisition / retention, win / loss, etc.
* Own in-depth analysis to narrow down areas of opportunities for price growth and expansion. Identify trends, provide observations, insights and recommendations to answer key business questions and help business decisions.
* Establish, improve, and maintain various tools to support pricing decisions, win/loss analysis, predictive modeling, and other critical analyses
* Partnering with commercial team on frequent pricing requests to drive realized price and be the key gatekeeper to ensure accurate approvals are acquired according to approval matrix.
* Perform ad hoc data analysis for business around customer, product, and market dynamics.

**Qualifications**

**Education**

* BA degree in Finance, Accounting, Management, Economics or related field desired.

**Experience**

* An outstanding candidate with more than 5 years of direct experience, demonstrates strategic and thought ownership in developing new pricing approaches.
* Experience working in Pricing or Finance Functions of a multinational publicly traded company, preferably in the Healthcare or FMCG sector.
* In Vitro Diagnostics experience valuable.

**Knowledge, Skills, Abilities**

* Detail oriented, organized and analytical problem solver with strong commercial orientation and a passion for understanding pricing strategies and handling large data sets.
* Proven ability to operate independently with broad general mentorship against a framework of defined business objectives. Capable to prioritize multiple projects at the same time and shows creativity and innovation in presenting ideas.
* Proficient user of SAP, Power BI, Cognos, Excel, etc.
* The ability to identify process and control gaps and champion improvement initiatives through Practical-Process-Improvement

**What we offer**

title: Lead DevOps Engineer CX
description:
**Lead DevOps Engineer CX**
===========================


Are you skilled in improving frontend customer experiences? Are you on the lookout for a vibrant workplace where your abilities are recognized and valued, within an organization committed to continuous improvement?  

  

If so, then you're the one we're looking for!


**Lead DevOps Engineer CX**

**Fulltime, Eindhoven (NL) Lommel (BE)**




As Lead DevOps Engineer specializing in frontend Customer Experience, your core responsibility is to optimize Renewi's utilization of multiple platforms to ensure a seamless customer journey. Platforms like Sitecore play a pivotal role in managing our digital content and experiences, enabling Renewi to deliver personalized interactions across diverse channels.  



  

Your role encompasses providing support, connecting these channels to the relevant data streams, and developing solutions to meet Renewi's distinct frontend needs. Collaboration is essential as you prioritize tasks alongside a diverse team of Product owners, Agile Architects, Business Analysts, and fellow DevOps Engineers.  



  

Your responsibilities may evolve to encompass overseeing Renewi's entire frontend, shaping the complete digital experience for our customers. As the technical lead, you'll offer guidance to ensure that our frontend solutions are aligned with our business objectives.  



  

Beyond technical expertise, you promote collaboration, and drive continuous improvement. Your workdays are dynamic, filled with challenges and successes as you navigate modern IT landscapes. This role offers an opportunity to excel technically while leaving a lasting impact within Renewi.


**Core tasks**

* Design systems with high levels of availability and scalability.
* Implement and manage continuous distribution methodologies.
* Manage testing across the release lifecycle.
* Facilitate cross functional collaboration and engagement.
* Design, develop, maintain and manage process automation tools.
* Adopt an agile software development methodology.
* Manage continuous integration tool management.




**Compensation & Benefits**


* A salary between €4.200,00 - €6.400,00 gross per month depending on experience.
* laptop, mobile phone and attractive pension plan.
* 27,5 vacation days.
* 1001 online training courses rangin from business English, programming to D&I and management courses.

**Your profile**

* Bachelor or Master Degree in a relevant field or working experience equal to this level.
* Experience with customer facing applications.
* Experience with Sitecore.
* Experience and/ or affinity with Agile way of working and DevOps model.

  



  

**Interested?**


Apply through the apply button. If you have any questions, please get in touch with recruiter Michiel Deinema at Michiel.deinema@renewi.com

title: Data Scientist | Data Engineer | HR Advanced Analytics
description:
Data Scientist | Data Engineer | HR Advanced Analytics**At a glance**
---------------


Are you a big-picture thinker who enjoys building data solutions to accelerate data-driven insights? Do you thrive at the cutting edge of data science and data engineering? Are you a collaborative team player who can inspire others?  

If you are a talented individual who enjoys bridging the gap between data science and data engineering, and believes that good data management lies at the heart of everything, we want to hear from you!  

Data science for human resource management is a dynamic field full of potential. Our team is at the forefront of utilizing data to drive decisions that positively impact both managers and employees. Imagine insights into employee satisfaction, strategies for retention, the influence of hybrid working models, or personalized recommendation systems.  

Because ABN AMRO is transforming its data landscape, and our Human Resources department is at the forefront of this change, we are seeking an individual who can envision and develop future-proof data solutions that will further empower data driven insights for our human resources department. This role will thus span the realms of both data science and data engineering.

**Your job**
------------


We are seeking an individual who thrives on creating future-proof solutions, starting from data science requirements and mapping them to the necessary data. You have a strong ability to design, develop, and maintain efficient data pipelines that flow into data science solutions. You excel at devising ways to enhance data solutions that minimize technical debt and boost efficiency.


You champion the best practices in data management across teams, ensuring that industry standards are effectively applied. You can simplify technical concepts for diverse stakeholders and collaborate seamlessly within a team. You take pleasure in mentoring others and working at the intersection between teams.


You enjoy staying abreast of the latest advancements and trends in data science, data engineering, and related technologies, and share your knowledge with others.


What is in it for you?  

* Concrete goal: creation of data solutions that accelerate HR insights
* Work that will have a direct business impact for our organisation
* Working together with a team of enthusiastic professionals
* Personal freedom to learn and develop
* A hybrid working environment
* Cutting-edge technologies

Join us in shaping the future of human resource analytics at ABN AMRO!

**Working environment**
-----------------------


We offer a dynamic, energetic team of professionals who are critical thinkers and that share the same belief: HR Analytics can truly drive our business!  

The team is recognized inside and outside the bank as a front runner in HR Analytics and evidence-based HR. We are ambitious and we learn every day. We offer an exciting and dynamic work environment with many opportunities for innovation. We provide personal development opportunities and encourage co-working on other HR analytics products like employee listening, dashboarding, and strategic workforce management. Our team works in a hybrid way. This means on average two days a week at the office in Amsterdam.

**Your profile**
----------------


If you recognize yourself in this vacancy and the qualifications below, we hope you apply so we can share a cup of coffee…


Must haves:  

* Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities to translate complex data into actionable insights
* Experience with machine learning algorithms and predictive modelling techniques
* Proficiency in Python, SQL and PySpark programming languages, with the ability to write clean, efficient, and scalable code
* Ability to create, manage, and schedule jobs in Databricks for automated data processing and analytics
* Experience with Databricks notebooks, clusters, and workflows
* Experience in data modelling, including the design and implementation of relational and non-relational databases, ensuring data integrity and performance optimization
* Proven experience in Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) and Extract, Load, Transform (ELT) processes
* An understanding of data warehousing concepts, principles, and best practices

The "nice to haves":  

* Proficiency in using data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar platforms
* An interest in machine learning engineering
* Proven ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams, including IT, and business units
* Good understanding of the Dutch language
* Experience in the financial domain, especially human resources or marketing are a plus
**We are offering**
-------------------

* The gross monthly salary displayed above is based on a 36-hour work week, including vacation pay and benefit budget.
* The Benefit Budget is 11% of your salary. The Benefit Budget allows you to acquire additional employment benefits. If you make no purchases or reservations in the Benefit Shop in a given month, you are paid one twelfth of your Benefit Budget that month.
* Five weeks of vacation per year. You have the option to purchase an additional four weeks per year.
* Personal development Budget of € 1,000 per year, which you can accumulate up to € 3,000.
* Possibility to work from home (in consultation with your team and depending on your position).
* An annual public transport pass with free public transportation throughout the Netherlands.
* An excellent pension scheme.
**Interested?**
---------------


If you find this vacancy interesting and it fits your expectations and qualifications, you can apply online. If you have questions, please contact tanya.compton@nl.abnamro.com (Lead People Analytics).

**Equal opportunities for all**
-------------------------------


The success of our organisation depends on the quality of our people and the ideas that they have. Truly surprising insights and innovative solutions for our clients result from an interplay of cultures, knowledge and experience. Diversity is therefore extremely important to our organisation. To ensure that everyone at ABN AMRO can develop their talents, we encourage an inclusive culture in which all colleagues feel engaged and appreciated.

**Disclaimer external recruitment agencies**
--------------------------------------------


External recruitment agencies need to have a signed agreement with ABN AMRO BANK N.V., executed by a Talent Acquisition Specialist, when submitting a resume to a vacancy. No unsolicited services or offers, please.

### **Wij vragen**

* Een inventieve instelling

### **Wij bieden**

* Analytische skills

title: Technical Support Engineer
description:
Our Implementation & Support department is looking for a new colleague Are you looking to support our customers to the best of your abilities, are skilled in technical troubleshooting a native and web app and have sharp analytics skills to deep dive in root cause, then this is the job for you



Full-time · Delft/Hybrid


About Mapiq



.Mapiq is a workplace experience platform that supports the workplace leader to create a meaningful workplace. This is achieved through real-time data and IoT technology, allowing our customers to make data-driven decisions on their real estate. In recent years we are proud to have helped customers such as PwC, Booking.com, Microsoft, Rio Tinto and Virgin Media O2 in their offices.



Your role at Mapiq



In the current day and age, traditional support can feel very old-fashioned. As our product is maturing, we should show our Support Experience. Adhering to a conversational support model, focused on a support experience in which pro-active and self-serve support options are key, but the human support remains a crucial part. Customers should feel empowered after they have been in touch with Support and feel confident in working with Mapiq in the future.



Therefore, Mapiq is looking for an energetic colleague that can give our customers the best support experience. Our new colleague will be the main contact person for our customers and will act as a 1st and 2nd line support. Requests are diverse from simple functionality questions to diving into the code-base and cracking the cause of a bug, we’re looking for somebody that gets energy in doing both



So, what can you expect as a Technical Support Engineer?


* Analyze and triage in coming tickets.

* Work in a dynamic environment in which you’ll collaborate with peers cross-department.

title: Sr. Solutions Engineer
description:
**REQ: FEQ325R108**



At Databricks, our core values are at the heart of everything we do; creating a culture of proactiveness and a customer-centric mindset guides us to create a unified platform that makes data science and analytics accessible to everyone. We aim to inspire our customers to make informed decisions that push their business forward. We provide a user-friendly and intuitive platform that makes it easy to turn insights into action and fosters a culture of creativity, experimentation, and continuous improvement. You will be an essential part of this mission, using your technical expertise to demonstrate how our Databricks Data Intelligence Platform can help customers solve their complex data challenges. You'll work with a collaborative, customer-focused team that values innovation and creativity, using your skills to create customized solutions to help our customers achieve their goals and guide their businesses forward. Join us in our quest to change how people work with data and make a better world!



You will be reporting to the Manager, Field Engineering.


**The impact you will have:**


* Form successful relationships with clients throughout your assigned territory to provide technical and business value in collaboration with an Account Executive and a Senior Solutions Architect.
* Gain excitement from clients about Databricks through hands-on evaluation and Spark programming, integrating with the wider cloud ecosystem and 3rd party applications.
* Contribute to building the Databricks technical through engagement at workshops, seminars, and meet-ups.
* Become a Big Data Analytics advisor on aspects of architecture and design.
* Support your customers by authoring reference architectures, how-tos, and demo applications.
* Develop both technically and in the pre-sales aspect with the goal of becoming an independently operating Solutions Architect.


**What we look for:**


* Experience, technical customer-facing and with a background in Data Science / GenAI / Machine Learning or Data Engineering.
* You will be working in the following any of the following vertical sectors:
+ Manufacturing,
+ Healthcare Life Cycles
+ Public Sector
+ Financial Services & Insurance
+ Retail / Consumer Packaged Goods (CPG)

* Fluent in English and Dutch both written and spoken
* Familiarity working with clients, creating a narrative, answering customer questions, aligning the agenda with important interests, and achieving tangible outcomes.
* Ability to independently deliver a technical proposition, identify customers' pain points, and explain important areas for business value to develop a trusted advisor skillset.
* Code in a core programming language such as Python, Java, or Scala.
* Knowledgeable in a core Big Data Analytics domain with some exposure to advanced proofs-of-concept and an understanding of a major public cloud platform (AWS, GCP, Azure).
* Experience diving deeper into solution architecture and design.
* The role requires travel to customer sites in the Benelux.
* Travelling approx. 20-30% of the time.
* Nice to have: Databricks Certification
  

**About Databricks**



Databricks is the data and AI company. More than 10,000 organizations worldwide — including Comcast, Condé Nast, Grammarly, and over 50% of the Fortune 500 — rely on the Databricks Data Intelligence Platform to unify and democratize data, analytics and AI. Databricks is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices around the globe and was founded by the original creators of Lakehouse, Apache Spark™, Delta Lake and MLflow. To learn more, follow Databricks on Twitter, LinkedIn and Facebook.


**Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion**



At Databricks, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture where everyone can excel. We take great care to ensure that our hiring practices are inclusive and meet equal employment opportunity standards. Individuals looking for employment at Databricks are considered without regard to age, color, disability, ethnicity, family or marital status, gender identity or expression, language, national origin, physical and mental ability, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, socio-economic status, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.


**Compliance**


**If access to export-controlled technology or source code is required for performance of job duties, it is within Employer's discretion whether to apply for a U.S. government license for such positions, and Employer may decline to proceed with an applicant on this basis alone.**
