title: Software Developer (Mid-level)
description:
SOFTWARE DEVELOPER (MID-LEVEL)
Faber LABS
 * Veemarktkade 8, 's-Hertogenbosch

  
Hey software developer. Are you ready to transform the world of supply chain forever? Nice to meet you, we are Faber LABS. A brand new division of the Faber Group that is launched to digitalize our load carrier business. With endless possibilities for making supply chains more sustainable, transparent and efficient, but about all future proof. We’re looking for skilled software engineers to help us develop our digital products portfolio and achieve our goals. Want to be part of our journey?! Who are we? We are Faber LABS, member of the family-owned Faber Group. At Faber LABS we aim to accelerate digital transformation within logistic supply chains, making them more sustainable, transparent and efficient. Driven by data combined with years of knowledge of supply chains, we will transform the logistic landscape forever. Our goal? Going from your regular load carrier to data-driven load carriers with automated processes and data-driven decision-making that enables us to carry more impact. The possibilities are endless. Are you up for the challenge?

Who you are



As our Software developer, we’re looking for…


* A bachelor’s or master degree in Computer Science, Software engineering, Information Technology, or a related field.
* 3+ years of professional experience in software development.
* Proven experience in React, .net core / C# and Python.
* A keen eye for details & a problem solving mindset
* Of course you are a technical genius, but your also communicative, confident and you take initiative
* A team player with a sense of humor


What we offer



Just as you give your best, we do too. We’re all about a work-life balance, making sure you can be all-in your work, while being all-in with your hobbies, sportive activities or time with family and friends.


* A competitive salary - 4.243,82 to 5.246,91 euro per month depending on experience and skills;
* Everything you need to excel at your job: e.g. laptop and phone
* A hybrid way of working: from our modern office in ‘s Hertogenbosch or your home office;
* Flexible workhoursA lot of freedom and responsibility within the team
* Continuous growth opportunities;
* Inspiring colleagues with creative, analytical and innovative minds from across the globe;
* A chance to build a whole new team, within a brand-new company.


**Our role as Full Stack Developer**
You might have noticed that we have big digital ambitions. As a Software Developer, you'll become member of a product team, working closely with other developers, UX/UI designers, and analysts, all led by a Product Owner. As a mid-level Software Developer, you play a crucial role within the team. You’ll be responsible for the technical quality of the software and serve as a valuable partner to the Product Owner in brainstorming and developing solutions.

title: Business Analyst
description:
BUSINESS ANALYST
Faber LABS
 * Veemarktkade 8, 's-Hertogenbosch

  
Hey, Business Analyst. Are you ready to change the world of supply chain forever? Nice to meet you, we are Faber LABS. A brand-new division of Faber Group that is launched to digitalize our load carrier business models. With endless possibilities for making supply chains more sustainable, transparent and efficient, but above all future proof. We need your Business Analyst skills to help build up this new company and achieve our goals. Challenge accepted? Your role as Business Analyst Maybe you noticed, but we have big ambitions. So, you, as Business Analyst, will play a critical role in bridging the gap between business needs and technical solutions, ensuring that our products meet market demands and drive business growth. To ensure we meet this target, you will be working closely alongside our Product Owners. Within your role you will be responsible for gathering and analysing data, defining requirements, preparing decision making and supporting the Product Owner in the product development lifecycle, so we can achieve our goals, together. Who are we? We are Faber LABS, member of the family-owned Faber Group. At Faber LABS we aim to accelerate digital transformation within logistic supply chains, making them more sustainable, transparent and efficient. Driven by data combined with years of knowledge of supply chains, we will transform the logistic landscape forever. Our goal? Going from your regular load carrier to data-driven load carriers with automated processes and data-driven decision-making that enables us to carry more impact. The possibilities are endless. Are you up for the challenge?

Who you are



We’re looking for…


* A bachelor’s degree in Business Administration or Information Technology;
* 3-5 years’ experience as a Business Analyst, preferably in an agile development environment;
* Proficiency in business analysis tools (e.g., JIRA, Confluence), data analysis tools (e.g., SQL, Excel), and familiarity with product management software;
* Strong analytical & communication skills
* High attention to detail and the ability to collaborate effortlessly within a team environment
* Experience working in (reverse) logistics
* Familiarity with agile methodologies and frameworks (e.g., Scrum, Kanban).
* Understanding of UX/UI principles and practices.


What we offer



Just as you give your best, we do too. We’re all about a work-life balance, making sure you can be all-in your work, while being all-in with your hobbies, sportive activities or time with family and friends.


* A competitive salary of 3.800 to 4.700 euro per month depending on skills and experience;
* Everything you need to excel at your job: e.g. laptop and phone
* A hybrid way of working: from our modern office in ‘s Hertogenbosch or your home office;
* Flexible workhours
* A lot of freedom and responsibility within the team
* Continuous growth opportunities;
* Inspiring colleagues with creative, analytical and innovative minds from across the globe;
* A chance to build a whole new team, within a brand-new company.


* Collaborate with Product Owners
  

o Work in tandem with the Product Owner to define product requirements, user stories and use cases.
* Requirement Gathering
  

o Conduct detailed business analysis, outlining problems, opportunities, and solutions for the business.
* Stakeholder Communication
  

o Engage with stakeholders to understand their needs and translate them into actionable requirements.
* Documentation
  

o Create comprehensive documentation, including business requirements documents (BRDs), user stories, and use cases.
* Data Analysis
  

o Analyse data to identify trends, patterns, and insights that inform product decisions.
  

Support Development Teams
  

o Work closely with development teams to ensure requirements are understood and implemented correctly.
* User Acceptance Testing (UAT)
  

o Coordinate and support UAT activities to ensure the final product meets the business needs.
* Market Research
  

o Conduct market research to stay updated on industry trends and competitor products.
* Continuous Improvement
  

o Identify areas for improvement in product processes and workflows.

title: Senior KYC Subject Matter Officer
Operations Systems Analyst
description:
**Overview**



People. Passion. Pride. This is what has driven our teams since 1833.



Since that time, we have developed to become a critical partner in the global aviation industry, delivering time-critical logistics services at over 290 locations in 65 countries, across 6 continents.



But at the heart of our business is our people.


**Role Purpose**



As part of the candidate's role and responsibilities they will support the business in further enhancing, developing and proving first class training on our business intelligence tools across the region. Participate in the planning, development, design, engineering, integration and testing of our airport operational systems, both existing and new start up locations. As part of our operational digitalisation strategy work with the regional support functions and airline customers in going digital by removing paperwork flight files but also improving internally how we capture all additional revenue services. Project managing the PDA replacement & integration programme and explore possibilities of using AI to continuously improve, drive efficiencies in engagement standards during aircraft turnarounds.



The Operations System Analyst will work in close collaboration with the European IT & Operational teams in the rollout, training, upskilling, integration and continuous development of RSMS, MARs, KRONOS, Read & Sign and Telematics. The successful candidate will be required to effectively manage and liaise with multiple stakeholders.


**What you will be doing**


* Provide regional support in the accuracy and integration of our data analytics through business intelligence
* Become our SME and project lead when integrating operational system
* Manage and deliver our European digital strategy with our key airline partners and airport authorities
* Oversee the PDA Replacement & Integration Programme,including but not limited to the implementation of MDM solutions, 3rd party supplier management, procurement and lifecycle management.
* Look at new IT and digital innovative means to drive continuous improvement (for example AI)
* Work in close collaboration with the European IT & Operational Teams, providing support on RSMS, MARs, M-RSMS, KRONOS, Read & Sign.


Would you like to see more detail on the accountabilities of the role? Please see the attached job description for further information.


**Safety, Security, WellBeing and Compliance:**



You will have a responsibility and duty whilst at work to take reasonable care of the health, safety and wellbeing of yourself and others in accordance with provided information, training, and workplace health and safety rules or procedures. The company is committed to providing a safe working environment for all staff members. In all areas of our business there is a potential risk to the health, safety and welfare to everyone on our sites through the misuse of alcohol and drugs. As such the Company prohibits such misuse and carries out regular testing to enforce our Substance Misuse Policy.



Please see the attached job description for further details on safety, security, wellbeing & compliance.


**What we are looking for**


* A minimum of 7 years operational experience either within Ground Handling or Cargo
* A subject matter expert and at least 3 years hands on experience in Operational Systems such as RSMS & MARs
* Detailed knowledge of how RSMS & MARs works, including all its functionalities with the ability to deliver expert advice and guidance across the region.
* Significant experience and exposure to the MA IT & Operational Systems Set-up and ways of working
* Able to work independently, with minimal supervision


**Diversity**



MenziesAviation are a committed equal opportunity employer and encourage applications for suitably qualified and eligible applicants regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status, pregnancy, and maternity. We strive to create an inclusive working environment, where the different knowledge, perspectives, experiences, and approaches of our global workforce are represented. Where everyone feels valued and can reach their full potential.



Please be aware that as part of our recruitment process, we may look to use a variety of resourcing tools to help us understand your skills and experience in relation to the role. Please feel free to contact to recruiter below, if there are any reasonable adjustments to our process that you would like us to consider.

  


As part of our recruitment process, we will always consider how candidates fit with our values which you can learn more about here.


**Application Instructions**



Is this role ticking all the boxes for you? If so, please click apply now!



Need more detail? Feel free to contact ventseslav.ilev@menziesaviation.com for further information.
company_description: Menzies Aviation is a global provider of passenger, ramp and cargo handling services.

title: Business Analyst SAP MM S/4 HANA
description:
Nissan is one of the largest car manufacturers in the world. Nissan in Europe commits to creating customer value and shifting expectations. Not only by introducing trendsetting cars like the QASHQAI, Juke and LEAF, but also by providing top level service to customers.  

  

Nissan Motor Parts Center (NMPC) is Nissan's master depot in Europe. NMPC supplies spare parts and accessories directly to dealers in Europe and distributors worldwide. From our 90.000 m2 warehouse in Amsterdam we distribute some 160.000 different articles in Europe 24 hours a day.  

  

We are seeking for a Business Analyst SAP MM S/4 HANA to be based at Nissan Motor Parts Center, Amsterdam to be part of the Supply & Distribution Digital Transformation team. The Digital Transformation team is currently leading a large modernization project aiming to replace the current mainframe system by state of the art cloud based software from SAP (S/4 HANA) and Manhattan (Active).
  

  

The project is carried out jointly with the Aftersales business team and our IS department and software integrators.  

  

The Business Analyst SAP MM S/4 HANA will be responsible for the successful implementation of the SAP tool in the role of business process lead in the SAP project stream in close collaboration with the software integrator and business SME's.  

  

**Primary Role and Responsibilities**  

  

Reporting to the SAP Project Manager you will be responsible for:  

* Initiate: support functional scoping process and documentation
* Design: coordinate and document business (user) requirements, participate in functional and detail design and validate that solutions meet operational needs
* Build & Testing: coordinate and support user acceptance testing & end to end testing including custom developments
* Change management: support end-user training / ensure operational readiness
* Implementation: support data migration, cut-over, go-live including troubleshooting (investigate, analyse and solve problems)
* General: act as a liaison between the business functions and the technical team

  

**Qualifications & Skills**
  

* Education Level: bachelor's degree or higher education
* High analytical and problem solving skills
* Relevant experience in SAP MM implementations (3+ years), S4 HANA is a plus
* General supply chain knowledge; experience in Aftersales business is a plus
* Strong communicator in English, both written and verbal
* Team player; feels comfortable to work in a cross functional and multicultural team
* Microsoft Office proficiency (Excel, Word, Outlook, PowerPoint)
* Specific skills: SAP MM functional knowledge, broader SAP knowledge e.g. SD/FI is a plus

  

**About Nissan AMIEO (Africa, Middle East, India, Europe & Oceania)**  

  

Nissan aims to become a truly sustainable company, driving towards a cleaner, safer and more inclusive world.  

  

Sustainability is at the core of Nissan's long-term vision, Ambition 2030. Responding to critical environmental, societal and customer needs, this strategy sets out to deliver electrified models and technological innovation in key markets globally, empowering mobility and beyond. Ambition 2030 supports Nissan's goal which is to be carbon neutral across the life cycle of its products and operations by 2050. The Nissan AMIEO region, with EV36Zero at its centre, is primed to accelerate the shift to an electrified future.  

  

For more information about Nissan's products, services and commitment to sustainable mobility, visit nissan-global.com. You can also follow us on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter and LinkedIn and see all our latest videos on YouTube.  

  

At Nissan, we believe that the differences among us - differences in race, gender, age, mindset, religion, people with disabilities and much more - make us stronger and equip us to better serve our customers and communities. We are committed to creating positive change that ensures transparency and inclusivity throughout the career journey, in order to build teams that create a sense of belonging for all members.  

  

#LI-OV1  

Amsterdam Netherlands
company_description: At Nissan Motor Corporation, we are transforming how people live and drive — and we need passionate innovators to help us create a more sustainable future.

title: Client Service Support Specialist
description:
**Client Service Support Specialist**
=====================================

**Job ID:** R0344955 **Full/Part-Time:** Full-time
  

**Regular/Temporary:** Regular **Listed:** 2024-08-29
  

**Location:** Amsterdam
  

**Position Overview**
---------------------

The core objective of the Client Service Support Manager is to support the RTM Coverage Bankers on the coordination and completion of KYC tasks and processes for clients covered by your Coverage team(s). This includes: (i) working effectively with key stakeholders globally to ensure on-time completion of KYC profiles, (ii) ensure adherence to applicable internal policies and external legal/regulatory frameworks and (iii) managing and facilitating KYC related non-KYC production processes.


**Job Responsibilities**

* Support ACOs on the Account Activity Reviews (AARs) and Expected Nature and Purpose of Relationship (ENPR) process incl. coordinating supporting material to perform AARs / ENPRs
* Support ACOs in the process of New Client Adoption
* Support ACOs on drafting Tax integrity statements
* Support ACOs on drafting Plausibility statements
* Support on preparation of any Front Office related KYC requirement as part of Local Addenda
* Act as local point of contact for KYC systems in use by ACOs and escalate any issues to relevant teams (e.g. Salesforce KYC, dbSleuth, dbCLM etc.)
* Primary contact and escalation point for clients, CLM and second line stakeholders on behalf of the ACO; ownership for a dedicated portfolio of clients
* Integrated member of Corporate Coverage team, supporting ACOs on completion of KYC related subjects incl. new client adoptions, periodic review, event driven reviews and responsibility for the coordination of KYC related tasks assigned to Coverage for a given client portfolio.
* Supportive to the coordination of KYC related tasks assigned to Coverage for a given client portfolio and acting as Effective Client Perimeter Management by supporting ACOs on feedback actions relating to KYC and portfolio reviews including managing and monitoring of KYC pipeline and cases at risk of being overdue/offboarded.
* Ensure data consistency of the Client Perimeter
* Acting as a dedicated Corporate Coverage team representative for coordination with the central KYC Business Execution Teams (BETs) on KYC-related portfolio monitoring activities (incl. ensuring correct ACO allocation/attestation/nomination, support with Red-to-Green processes, review of Offboarding lists, following up on actions pending with Business etc.)
* Give support to the preparation of KYC cases for review in full adherence with Deutsche Bank's Know Your Client Global Policy, Global KYC Key Operating Standards (KOS) and any applicable local addenda
* Working effectively with key stakeholders to facilitate completion of KYC-related tasks using strong influencing skills to ensure the mutually satisfactory resolution of key issues and that the respective responsibilities are understood, agreed and escalated where required
* Interact with various locations globally (including outsourced functions where applicable) in case of incoming KYC-related requests based on sound understanding of DB's global policies and operating principles as well as clients' respective situation.
* Decisions are guided by DB's global policies, procedures and business plan; receives guidance and oversight from Senior ACO (Business) Support
* Work with key stakeholders in CLM and Coverage to follow up and chase complex cases closure in call with AFC where applicable
* Interface with AFC/Sanctions on specific issues of open cases to seek direction to close them soon and to monitor progress
* Support ACOs on monitoring portfolio of NCAs and coordinating with relevant functions KYC process to ensure prompt onboarding
* Solve static data issues
* Ensure consistent and accurate MIS on ACO and Business Unit level
* Participate in local and global projects / calls related to KYC
* Preparation of presentations and client meetings enabling the Coverage Bankers to make efficient use of sales opportunities.

**Qualification & Work Experience required**

* Recognised bachelor (or university) degree and / or 0-2 years of (KYC) experience within the corporate financial services industry
* Experienced in client due diligence on various entity types including Multi National Corporate Clients, Funds and SPVs
* Experience in Business analyses
* Understanding of KYC, Sanctions and screening procedures, including the KYC documentation requirements and sources of information to retrieve KYC information
* Willing to work under time driven deadlines to complete KYC review cases successfully negotiating the rationale where they are right as per policy, with review teams
* Good oral & written communication skills (English is a must) to interact with (senior) management team & clients on regular basis. However, knowledge of other languages applicable to the country/region of work would be an advantage
* A team player to work with Middle Office outreach analysts, review analysts, Compliance, AFC, business line managers and stake holders in various countries
* Ability to build strong relationships with the various stakeholders
* Ability to demonstrate the Bank's values in achieving objectives
* In-depth understanding of Excel, Access and Power Point

**Important Competencies**

* Teamwork
* Tenacity
* Discipline (well-organised, structured way of working)
* Client centricity
* Working under pressure

Our values define the working environment we strive to create – diverse, supportive and welcoming of different views. We embrace a culture reflecting a variety of perspectives, insights and backgrounds to drive innovation. We build talented and diverse teams to drive business results and encourage our people to develop to their full potential. Talk to us about flexible work arrangements and other initiatives we offer.
  

We promote good working relationships and encourage high standards of conduct and work performance. We welcome applications from talented people from all cultures, countries, races, genders, sexual orientations, disabilities, beliefs and generations and are committed to providing a working environment free from harassment, discrimination and retaliation.
  

  

Visit Inside Deutsche Bank to discover more about the culture of Deutsche Bank including Diversity, Equity & Inclusion, Leadership, Learning, Future of Work and more besides.

title: Senior Scrum Master Wholesale & Rural
description:
**Department and Project context**


The Wholesale & Rural (W&R) domain within IT Systems supports the Wholesale and Rural bank (W&R) across the globe. W&R is divided into 3 different tribes: Markets & Treasury, Financing and CBD (Clients, Bankers and Data services). Within the Financing tribe the *Loan Products & Payment area* will focus on our core banking. We will make it easy for our clients to do business with the bank by focussing on simplified operational processes, data value creation, automation of the risk controls and by driving (digital) innovations. The area is also working on strategic programs together with other domains to realize the bank’s digital transformation.


Within the area the various squads are responsible to seamlessly replace the existing local Corporate Banking applications into one single global platform, and to create an Open Banking Layer connecting to the outside world. This all will contribute to the W&R objectives to become a truly client centric bank by enhancing customer experience, reducing costs and operational risks, easing implementation of regulations, increasing efficiency and the ability to innovate. Multiple squads are developing and maintaining the Core Banking Platform and work together in building an accessible, safe and future-proof solution which facilitates standardised and STP processes worldwide with high accessibility for our customers at low costs.

**Your teams: Agency and Lending Squads**


You will be responsible for guiding two squads - Agency and Lending – consisting of developers, business analysts and testers that work on our core banking systems. For the Lending squad, the test-process needs some active guidance and monitoring. For the Agency squad there is a strict deadline for implementing certain epics by the end of this year. Special guidance is needed in facilitating (and coordinating) this implementation process. It can even be the case that Kanban will be the wow till end of this year and you maybe need to split the squad. Also important to help the squads in the use of Azure and maybe even some PMO work in the beginning can be part of your job. Managing dependencies is a crucial part of the role. For the rest, team members are very diverse in backgrounds, experiences and cultures. Most communication will be in English as the end-users, team members and other stakeholders reside on different locations across the globe.


Key responsibilities

* **Scrum Facilitation**: Lead and facilitate Scrum ceremonies, including sprint planning, daily stand-ups, sprint reviews, and retrospectives.
* **Monitor the progress of the team**. Especially in Agency squad some PMO/PL guidance is needed.
* Be **creative and bold** to see what works for the team and decide on that way of working (for example if Kanban wow is a better way forward or split the team if necessary).
* **Guide and coach the squads** on self-organization and cross-functionality so that the team has the focus to achieve the ambitious goals. To this end, you motivate the team and facilitate the collaboration process inside and outside the team;
* Active involvement in managing intra-squad dependencies
* You work closely with the Product Owner; setting a clear scope and goal, techniques for Product Backlog management, product planning, value maximization, agility, facilitating events where requested or necessary;
* **Collaboration**: Foster a culture of collaboration and open communication, promoting transparency and trust within the team and stakeholders.
* **Obstacle Removal**: Identify and remove impediments to the team's progress to ensure a smooth and efficient workflow.
* **Continuous Improvement:** Encourage a mindset of continuous improvement by facilitating retrospective discussions and implementing action items.
* **Stakeholder Engagement**: Work closely with stakeholders to understand their priorities and ensure alignment with the team's goals.

**Your profile**


We are looking for a Scrum Master, who:

* Has significant experience as a Scrum Master in a financial or related industry in a multi-cultural environment
* Has a **natural authority within a team**. A real senior to the team with the power of persuasion.
* Has strong facilitation and communication skills.
* **Is at least Scrum certified (PSM 1)**
* **In-depth Azure knowledge** (for relevant parts of the job)
* Knowledge and experience in testing
* Well organised and can help structuring work of the team
* Has clear communication in English (written and verbal)
* Has some (basic) experience in SQL or Oracle Flexcube (pré)
* Strives to continuously improve yourself, your colleagues and work processes

**Interested?**


Do you want to become the ideal version of yourself? We would love to help you achieve this by focusing firmly on your growth, development, and investing in an environment where you keep learning every day. We give you the space to innovate and initiate. In this way, we offer you numerous opportunities to grow and help you exceed your expectations, to do the right thing exceptionally well, and to therefore grow as a professional. In addition, with us (on the basis of a 36-hour working week), you can also expect:

* A gross monthly salary is scaled in function group 9;
* Up to 90K gross yearly including all benefits based on a 40 hour work week.
* 100% reimbursement of commuting costs if you travel by public transport! Do you still prefer to travel by car or motorbike? Then choose a commuting allowance;
* A pension scheme, to which your contribution is only 5.5%.

**Let's meet**


Are you the person we're looking for? Are you ready to join Rabobank as a Scrum Master and to make a difference to yourself, our customers and to society? We look forward to receiving your application for this vacancy in Utrecht.


Good to know:

* Isabelle Brust, recruiter would be happy to answer any questions about the application procedure via isabelle.brust@rabobank.nl.
* The application process includes screening. Based on the screening procedures in place at Rabobank, we assess whether new staff are reliable enough to work at Rabobank.
* The application process for this vacancy can include an individual assessment.

Your privacy is important to us. Do you want to know more, click on this link.  
* 

Everyone is different, and it is exactly those differences that help us become an even better bank. That's why we want to know who you really are!

**Growing a better world together**


You'll already be aware that Rabobank is a financial services provider for 7.1 million customers in 40 countries. But did you know that we aim to contribute to real change with our 'Growing a better world together' mission? We do so in countless ways, such as:

* Together with the world Wildlife Fund, we’re helping to create a harmonious balance between nature and the agricultural sector in Brazil.
* We make sizeable annual investments in the voluntary sector in the Netherlands. This allows us to support about 1,250 sport and cultural organisations that are a second home to many people.


#LI-IB2
company_description: Voor ons staan jouw ontwikkeling én die van de maatschappij naast elkaar. Daarom willen we in je investeren en werken we samen aan een betere wereld.

title: Data Analyst
description:
Ready to embark on an exciting journey as a Digital Data Analyst at Basic-Fit? We're on the lookout for a proactive, customer-focused self-starter to enhance the experience of millions of web and app users across Europe. Your data-driven insights will shape the future of our digital channels.



What will you do?



You will be a vital part of our dynamic Marketing Department, optimizing the entire eCommerce flow, from initial website exploration to membership sign-ups and app engagement. Your responsibilities will include designing event tracking, ensuring precise data collection, and delivering actionable insights to stakeholders. Collaboration is key, as you will work closely with crossfunctional teams, including eCommerce, app development, UX/UI, and other analysts.



Responsibilities


* Analyse user behaviour and performance metrics to identify trends and opportunities for improvement.
* Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to monitor key KPIs across the mobile app and website.
* Design, execute, and analyse A/B tests to optimize user engagement and conversion.
* Ensure data quality by managing event tracking through Google Analytics.
* Create and manage dashboards in Power BI and Looker Studio.
* Support app and eCommerce projects from concept through completion.


Requirements



We are looking for an analytical thinker with strong business acumen and the ability to translate



complex data into actionable insights.


* Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in a relevant field (HBO/WO)
* 1–3 years of relevant experience
* Proficiency in SQL; experience with Python/R is a plus
* Hands-on experience with the Google Stack (Google Analytics, BigQuery, Firebase, Google Tag Manager)
* Familiarity with Microsoft BI tools (DAX, PowerBI, Databricks) is a plus
* Strong stakeholder management and communication skills
* Enthusiasm for continuous learning and adapting to new technologies


About us:



Basic-Fit is the number one low-cost and high-value fitness brand in Europe. We are determined to make fitness accessible to everyone and a habit people love. Together with our orange team, we deliver affordable fitness solutions at 1400+ clubs across Europe, to almost 4 million members combining our straightforward membership model with top-notch fitness technologies. However, where we are today is just the beginning. In the next years, we aim to further professionalize and continue our growth. We move fast like a start-up, whilst making use of our strong corporate backbone. Our company values can already be found in our name: B(Be), A(Accessible), S(Smart), I(Inclusive), C(Committed).



Basic-Fit is also committed to being an inclusive employer that respects equal opportunities for all. Whether you’re one of our members or employees, the company is attentive to your well-being and celebrates diversity! No matter what you go for, we’re here to support you, and help you to #becomfortable. So you can take on the world!



Are you curious, entrepreneurial, practical, and do you have a playful demeanor? Basic-Fit is the right place for you. Please feel invited to grow with us, to make an impact and to share our mission. Welcome to the Orange Community.



Furthermore, you can expect:


* An informal (you can wear jeans and sneakers if you like), international (many cultures and languages) and friendly, down-to-earth environment;
* Plenty of opportunities for your own initiatives and to make an impact;
* Unlimited access to the online training courses of LinkedinLearning and GoodHabitz;
* Good benefits, including travel allowance, a bicycle plan, discount on additional health insurance, work from home allowance and participation in our pension scheme (Basic-Fit pays 52% of the premium);
* We work hybrid, this means 3 days at the office and 2 days remote by a fulltime workweek;
* Within walking distance of Hoofddorp train station and free parking at our headquarters;
* A beautiful gym (fitness equipment, spinning bikes, virtual group lessons) at our headquarters which you can use anytime.


Apply for this job



Before applying, please make sure you are eligible to work in the Netherlands. Unfortunately, we do not sponsor new work visa or permits for this position. If you already have a sponsorship, it is possible to transfer this sponsorship to Basic-Fit.



If you have any questions, please contact Dorus Wolters, Corporate Recruiter via dorus.wolters@basic-fit.com
company_description: Our mission is to make fitness accessible to everyone and a habit you love.

title: Intelligent Automation Analyst
description:
We bieden je


NS Business card, ook privé te gebruiken


13e maand en vakantiegeld


27 vakantiedagen en 1 Diversiteitsdag


Hybride werken


Waarom NN Group


Meest menselijke corporate


Internationale werkomgeving


Support +20 miljoen klanten


Werken waar en wanneer jij wil


Snel naar:
Wat ga je doen?
Wat wij bieden
Je werkweek
Wat breng je mee
Je collega's
Je werkplek
In our young, international and energetic team of process automation experts, we might be looking for you! Are you a tech-minded and continuously improvement seeking person that wants to be part of NN Group's Intelligent Process Automation team? Then we need your help to support NN’s business units in increasing their efficiency, improving their processes and getting more digital. Come join our small diverse team and make the difference!At NN Group, the Process Management & Innovation team is discovering, implementing and using innovative ways to increase efficiency and optimize business processes in order to make NN’s operations better, faster and cheaper. Modern technologies like intelligent process automation, data analytics, data science and workflow automation are standard tools in your toolbox. Together, our efforts will fuel the transformation to a more digital, data-driven and engaged Finance community that continuously strives to deliver their services better, faster and cheaper.  


Wat ga je doen?


You will take responsibility for the compliant end-to-end delivery and support of our intelligent automations. From initiation (through designing a solution and selecting the right tool and approach) to develop, test, deliver and manage the automation.


Other responsibilities include:

* Act as a sparring partner for your fellow analysts in the domain of process automation
* Identify opportunities in digitization in the processes of our colleagues, and continuous improvement of our own way of working
* Further grow our footprint and impact in NN Group by being an evangelist of intelligent automation


Wat wij jou bieden


NN invests in an inclusive, inspiring work environment and in skills and competences for the future. We match this with employee benefits that are in line with what is needed today and in the future. This way, we offer our employees the opportunity to get the best out of themselves. We offer you:

* Salary between 3.415 to 4.878 depending on your knowledge and experience
* 13th month and holiday allowance are paid with your monthly salary
* 27 vacation days for a 5-day working week and one Diversity Day
* A modern pension administered by BeFrank
* Plenty of training and learning opportunities
* NS Business Card 2nd class, which gives you unlimited travel, also privately. Do you prefer to travel with your own transport? Then you can declare the kilometres travelled
* Allowances for setting up your home office and for internet use


Wat je meebrengt


We are looking for someone with a couple of years of experience in process automation using UiPath preferably with a consultancy and/ finance background. You also have a proactive attitude, you are a self-starter and you have analytical and problem solving skills.

* You have a Bachelor or Master in Finance, (Business) Information management or similar
* You have at least 1.5 year experience in business analysis or development for Intelligent Process Automation
* You have affinity with automation, scripting and maybe you are even into developing software. Preferably you have experience with: Microsoft Azure, UiPath and Python
* You have a natural tendency to be an entrepreneur, a self-starter and to challenge the status quo you are eager to work with and adapt to different cultures
* You are a creative thinker and have a hands-on mentality that gets things done


As an Intelligent Process Automation Analyst your personal qualities will play a decisive role.

  



Carolina Remzetti
Talent Acquisition Specialist Tech & Data  


Wat gebeurt er na je sollicitatie?


1
Je solliciteert
Jouw CV en motivatie worden door de Talent Acquisition Specialist en manager bekeken. Je ontvangt een reactie binnen twee weken.


2
Interview(s) en online assesment
We streven ernaar binnen een week het eerste gesprek in te plannen. Voorafgaand aan je tweede gesprek vragen we je een online assesment te maken.


3
Aanbod
Zijn we een match? Dan ontvang je van ons direct een aanbieding. De Talent Acquisition Specialist loopt samen met jou het aanbod door.


4
Welkom bij NN
Aanbieding geaccepteerd? Gefeliciteerd! Om alles ook administratief goed te regelen starten we de pre-employment screening en sturen we jouw arbeidsovereenkomst toe.
