title: Researcher Fermentation Technology
description:
**Great Job**
-------------


MNEXT forms the bridge between innovation and society together with SMEs. More than 80 employees work at MNEXT (including teacher-researchers from various Avans and HZ courses). In addition, 7 research groups are part of MNEXT: Biobased Construction (both at HZ and Avans), Biobased Resources & Energy, Biobased Building Blocks & Products , Smart Energy, Renewable Energy Carriers, Biobased Transitions and Marine Biobased Chemistry.


Precision fermentation is one of the key technologies in the material transition. To reinforce the development of fermentation research, we are seeking a skilled Systems Modeler with extensive experience in fermentation processes to join our team on a contractual basis. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in systems modelling, bioprocess engineering, and data analysis, and will contribute to the optimization and development of our fermentation processes.


**As a researcher, we envision you to:**
----------------------------------------

* Develop and implement systems models for fermentation processes.
* Analyze and interpret data from fermentation experiments to refine and validate models.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate modelling results into process development.
* Optimize fermentation parameters to improve yield, efficiency, and scalability.
* Prepare detailed technical reports and presentations on modelling outcomes and recommendations.
* Translate your theoretical and technical expertise into practical protocols for broader users, this includes junior technicians and commercial partners.
* Guide internship students with existing/new research projects.
* Participate in existing research projects, conduct research and/or project management tasks.
* Organize meetings with professors and associate professors, researchers, project leaders about possible new projects and lead in funding applications.
* Interact with Avans bachelor and master programs by providing work fields advices, guest lectures and student project ideas.


**Your place as a researcher within Avans**  

The research group is situated within the Center of Expertise MNEXT, a joint undertaking of Avans University of Applied Science and HZ University of Applied Sciences. By conducting applied research with students, teachers, researchers and outside stakeholders, we set the materials and energy transition in motion towards a more sustainable future. The research group is new which means there is ample scope to show initiative and explore new ideas.  

  

*More information about MNEXT's activities can be found on the* *website* *.*


**We offer you**
----------------


An environment where you have the freedom to discover and improve things; This is how we get the best out of you. We facilitate you in your continuous development, with which you then contribute to our further professional and technical professionalization. We also offer you:


* A monthly salary of a minimum of € 4.361 to a maximum of € 6.144 gross for a full-time contract (scale 11 collective labor agreement for higher professional education).
* A year-end bonus, roughly equal to a 13th month.
* An contract for 1 year. If the position functions well and there is sufficient training space, an extension is a possibility.
* A good work-life balance and pleasant workplaces.
* A lot of freedom in your job with the option to work from home.

**You fit right in**
--------------------


As an researcher, you participate in research projects and show others the value of your ideas. You have a great affinity with the interaction between research, education and the professional field and you are enthusiastic about student participation in research. You have experience in guiding internship students and interest in research-education integration. With your strong analytical skills and the ability to interpret complex data sets you demonstrate excellent problem-solving abilities and attention to detail. Avans' vision on applied research appeals to you. You can put things into perspective, are stress-resistant and 'fit' in with the informal and professional atmosphere of Avans University of Applied Sciences. Affinity to or interests in data driven methods such as oxford nanopore sequencing and bioinformatics experience would be a plus. Furthermore you have:


* A master’s degree or higher in Chemical Engineering, Biochemical Engineering, Systems Biology, or a related field.
* Proven experience in systems modelling specifically for fermentation processes.
* Proficiency in modelling software and tools (e.g., MATLAB, R, Aspen Plus, COMSOL).
* Proficiency in programming skills like Python and R.
* Excellent writing and communication skills in English, preferably also Dutch.

**Innovative Avans**
--------------------


Large, but small-scale. Concerned. Personal. That's Avans. Here you can be yourself. We will give you all the space you need with your unique ideas and insights. That suits our learning and enterprising character. We offer optimally flexible education and research in co-creation with the professional field. And we continuously change with the world around us. We want to offer more and more tailor-made solutions, where students partly determine their own learning path. That is our Ambition for 2025. Discover Avans as an employer through these stories.


**Contribute to our research**
------------------------------


Do you see a great role for yourself in further professionalizing our education and research and in contributing to the further development of Avans into a knowledge institution? Please apply no later than 20th September 2024 via the application button. If you have any questions about the content of the position, please contact Miaomiao Zhou, Associate Professor Smart fermentation, via m.zhou1@avans.nl / 088-5256361. Within 2 weeks after closing the vacancy we update you on your application.


*We find our candidates ourselves, therefore we do not deal with acquisition.*

title: Junior Data Analyst
Ecommerce Product and Performance Engineer
description:
**Values & Innovation**
-----------------------


At Under Armour, we are committed to empowering those who strive for more, and the company's values - Act Sustainably, Celebrate the Wins, Fight on Together, Love Athletes and Stand for Equality - serve as both a roadmap for our teams and the qualities expected of every teammate.

  

Our Values define and unite us, the beliefs that are the red thread that connects everyone at Under Armour. Our values are rallying cries, reminding us why we're here, and fueling everything we do.

  

Our pursuit of better begins with innovation and with our team's mission of being the best. With us, you get the freedom to go further - no matter your role. That means developing, delivering, and selling the state-of-the-art products and digital tools that make top performers even better.

  

If you are a current Under Armour teammate, apply to this position on the **Internal Career Site Here.**

**Purpose of Role**
-------------------


Equal parts data scientist, data engineer, and storyteller, the Ecommerce Product and Performance Engineer will construct and manage the KPIs that guide the elements of the European Ecommerce sites.

  

As the Product and Performance Engineer, you will work with our product and analytics teams to develop the metrics that the business will use to measure success and provide the means for key stakeholders to access those metrics through reports, dashboards, and data visualizations.

  

Being the subject matter expert on the data produced and collected relative to the website functions, you will provide the intelligence necessary to extract insights from that data, recognize where data needs are unmet and must be enhanced, and will facilitate the necessary connections to ensure stakeholder visibility and understanding.

  

You will write analytics tagging business requirements for improved tracking as well as new features. You will support the analytics and business teams to measure the visitor experience and the platform and governance engineers to understand the impact of their changes on those measurements.

  

You will troubleshoot processes to prevent tagging issues and improve time-to-resolve for issues that do arise. The ability to write and follow process workflows and create clear documentation are important in this role. This role must be knowledgeable in AA administration of classification rules, processing rules, data feeds/sources, and design of custom variables.

**Your Impact**
---------------

* Support an upcoming platform switch to understand performative results and the impact of key enhancements:
	+ Develop and maintain innovative KPI dashboards for all EMEA owned and operated sites.
	+ Analyse site and KPI performance utilizing multiple analytics systems (included but not limited to Adobe, Qualtrics, Quantum Metric)
	+ Support the business understanding of the results and impact of key initiatives.
	+ Deliver complete and thorough results summary by closely collaborating with the Analytics and technical teams and by understanding the ecommerce performance and up to date business trends.
* Investigate data anomalies/discrepancies to determine their sources and implications. Where needed, formulate change requests to resolve issues and ensure better data accuracy and consistency.
* Ensure data governance.
* Collaborate on the development of the product roadmap and evaluate the return on investment.
	+ Define revenue and KPI opportunities and return on investment for new potential features.
	+ Work with cross-functional teams to develop data driven insights pertinent to user behavior and formulate actionable recommendations to increase conversion or enhance customer experience.
* Assist with the development of A/B testing opportunities.
* General analysis of qualitative and quantitative metrics to detect and give actionable insights to improve our ecommerce site and digital products.
**Qualifications**
------------------

* Proficient at SQL
* Proficient scripting (Python), statistical packages (R, SciPy)
* Deep experience with Analytics tools (Adobe Analytics, Qualtrics, Quantum Metric, Snowflake or similar).
* Previous experience with tag managers like Tealium and Adobe Launch
* Experience with front-end development and Javascript, CSS
* Ability to perform and document beacon tests using Adobe Analytics Debugger, Fiddler, Omnibug, or similar tools.
* Experience in BI tools & Visualization (Tableau, SAP BI, PowerBi or similar).
* Ability to excel in a fast-paced team environment, adapt to shifting urgencies, manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines.
* Deep understanding of online consumer and purchase behavior. Experience in Sport or Fashion industry is a plus.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Excellent organizational skills and effective communication.
* Fluent English spoken and written.
* Experience with ETL tools (Tableau Prep) is a plus.

  

#LI-SB2

**Workplace Location**
----------------------

* **Location:** This individual must reside within commuting distance from our Amsterdam **o**ffice.
* **Return to Work Designation:** Hybrid work (baseline of minimum 2 days a week in-office.
**Relocation**
--------------

* No relocation provided
**Benefits & Perks**
--------------------

* Paid “UA Give Back” Volunteer Days: Work alongside your team to support initiatives in your local community.
* Under Armour Merchandise Discounts
* Health & fitness benefits, discounts and resources- We offer teammates across the country programs to promote physical activity and overall well-being.
* 38 hour working week
* Hybrid work, a minimum of 2 days in the office
* 28 days holiday
* Teammate Resource groups e.g. Green Machine, Sustainability, LGBTQIA+, Women in Leading and Living, Balance for mental health and wellbeing etc.
* Human Performance Institute (Gym) on site
* Local Language course when moving from abroad
**Our Commitment to Diversity**
-------------------------------


At Under Armour, we are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and teammates without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, pregnancy (including childbirth, lactation and related medical conditions), national origin, age, physical and mental disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information (including characteristics and testing), military and veteran status, family or paternal status and any other characteristic protected by applicable law. Under Armour believes that diversity and inclusion among our teammates is critical to our success as a global company, and we seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. Accommodation is available for applicants with disabilities upon request.

title: Data Analyst
description:
CHOOOSE is a climate tech company that provides digital solutions to enable decarbonization programs in hard-to-abate sectors, including aviation, shipping, and logistics. The company has raised $50M from leading venture capital and strategic investors.  

CHOOOSE is the trusted climate partner of global enterprises including Air Canada, Alaska Airlines, British Airways, Flexport, Southwest Airlines, and more. CHOOOSE enables these enterprise partners and their customers to understand their carbon footprints, make more carbon-informed decisions, and support diverse offsetting and insetting solutions.  

We are a mission-oriented and ambitious team, and we are scaling our business and climate action in tandem. We care about one another and our partners. Headquartered in Oslo, Norway, CHOOOSE has remote team members around the globe. We’re looking for the best talent to join the next chapters of the CHOOOSE journey.  

The Data team is responsible for transforming and maintaining quality of external and system data, external facing analytical visualizations and providing insights and business intelligence to internal teams at CHOOOSE. This role will focus primarily on Business intelligence with the goal to empower our internal teams to perform better and the build of external facing visualizations.
### **What you'll do**

* Collaborate with internal stakeholders to streamline data-driven performance management.
* Enabling self-serve metrics and empowering internal teams such as Account Management, Finance, Implementation, Product and Carbon Operations to leverage data to answer their questions.
* Collaborate with the Product team to incorporate external facing visualizations into the CHOOOSE platform.

### **What you'll bring to the table**

* An understanding of querying languages (KQL and SQL)
* An understanding of key data manipulation concepts
* 2-5 years of experience using data visualization tools and performing analysis in tools such as Google Suite and Microsoft Office
* Ability to answer questions and problem-solve through data manipulation and visualizations deriving value for our internal organization
* Solution-oriented mindset, leveraging data to problem solve
* Ability to prioritize and manage multiple stakeholders

**The interview process**  

The interview process will include a series of interviews with CHOOOSE Data team members and internal stakeholders. There will be a case study exercise that will be presented to the CHOOOSE Data team. **Pay, perks, & more**  

We offer a competitive salary, the option to participate in our employee equity program, flexible work hours, and access to 'Spaces' coworking space. Come join a fun and supportive team dedicated to advancing climate solutions and tackling significant challenges. **We value diversity and believe forming teams in which everyone can be their authentic self is key to our success. We encourage people from underrepresented backgrounds and different industries to apply.****Compensation will be based on experience and skill, commensurate with market rates, and will include both salary and equity in CHOOOSE.** **CHOOOSE is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate based on race, color, religion (creed), gender, gender expression, age, national origin (ancestry), disability, marital status, sexual orientation, or military status. We are committed to providing an inclusive and welcoming environment to our employees and welcome input from candidates and employees on how we can enhance our inclusiveness.** *Prerequisite for Employment: CHOOOSE may request to conduct background checks on prospective applicants to verify the information provided in the CV, transcripts, and other documentation. This background check may be carried out by our partner and will not be conducted without the applicant's prior consent. Prospective applicants will receive more information about this.*

title: Data Analyst INSTAGRAMS
description:
Data Analyst INSTAGRAMS**At a glance**
---------------


Are you passionate about data harmonization across Risk Management and Finance? Do you thrive on solving complex problems with your analytical mind and advanced technical skills? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you to join our INSTAGRAMS team!

**Your job**
------------


As a Data Analyst in the Finance & Risk Data Domain team, you will support stakeholders in Finance and Risk by implementing current and future data structures and architectures. Specifically, you will be a part of the Data Quality Assurance (Data QA) team within INSTAGRAMS, working alongside six other members from diverse backgrounds and cultures, all focused on data excellence.  

Please note that INSTAGRAMS is not related to the Instagram social media platform nor the social media data.  

Key responsibilities include:  

* Designing and implementing projects using Microsoft Power Platform.
* Maintaining dashboards, apps, and Power Automate tools on the Self-Service Power Platform.
* Implementing and performing technical activities on Databricks with Python, PySpark, and SQL.
* Developing and implementing solutions on Azure Cloud services.
**Working environment**
-----------------------


You will be part of the dynamic, open, and informal Finance & Risk Data Domain within the Finance & Risk Business Grids (F&RBG). Our team of over 250 international professionals is committed to improving risk data management. We operate using an Agile model across five teams, working together to generate reliable risk data on time by enhancing data quality, systems, and processes.  

You will report to the Product Owner of the DQA team and Lead PO of INSTAGRAMS. Together, you will represent the interests of INSTAGRAMS internally (MT, Finance/Risk, CIO, DFC, DIAL, Business MT’s, etc.) and externally (supervisors).

**Your profile**
----------------


You are an energetic and self-motivated individual with a passion for both strategic thinking and hands-on execution. You understand the end-to-end processes within your organization and are driven to deliver valuable contributions to your clients. You continuously seek to enhance your expertise and skills, learning by doing.  

The ideal candidate will:  

* Hold a master’s degree in computer science, engineering, mathematics, statistics, econometrics, or a related field.
* Have at least 3-5 years of relevant industry experience.
* Be proficient in Power Platform applications such as Power BI, Power Automate, and Power Apps, with a Microsoft PL-300 certification.
* Be skilled in SQL, Python, and PySpark.
* Have knowledge of at least one cloud platform (Azure, AWS, GCP).
* Experience in Databricks is a plus.
* Exhibit strong teamwork, innovation, and goal orientation.
* Possess a can-do attitude and excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
* Embrace an agile way of working.
* Be committed to continuous learning and skill sharing.
* Be comfortable working in a dynamic environment with multiple concurrent projects, effectively prioritizing and managing time.
* Have the capacity to challenge stakeholders and get to the "question behind the question."
* Be knowledgeable in Finance/Risk and reporting processes, with a desire to deepen analytical skills related to reporting, processes, data, and applications.
* Expertise in Banking is a plus.
**We are offering**
-------------------


A challenging environment offering you the possibility to develop yourself, both on contextual level in the Risk Management field of expertise, as well as technical level. There are plenty of career opportunities to grow personally and professionally, which mainly depend on your own ambitions and interests. In addition, we offer:  

* The ability to work flexible hours.
* A good salary and an excellent pension scheme.
* Hybrid-working environment
* A supplementary benefit budget of 11% with which you can buy flexible fringe benefits such as extra days off, a subsidy to cover the costs of a phone or an (electric) bicycle, and salary top-ups.
* A personal development budget of € 1,000 per year.
* Each year you receive 5 ‘Banking for Better’ days which you can spend on personal development or someone else in the society.
* An annual public transport pass with free public transportation throughout the Netherlands.
* The opportunity to pro-actively work on your vitality and fitness.
**Interested?**
---------------


Do not hesitate to approach us for more details, or apply directly!  

For more information contact Can Ersoy, INSTAGRAMS Data Quality Assurance PO, via email: can.ersoy@nl.abnamro.com. We look forward to meeting you!

**Equal opportunities for all**
-------------------------------


The success of our organisation depends on the quality of our people and the ideas that they have. Truly surprising insights and innovative solutions for our clients result from an interplay of cultures, knowledge and experience. Diversity is therefore extremely important to our organisation. To ensure that everyone at ABN AMRO can develop their talents, we encourage an inclusive culture in which all colleagues feel engaged and appreciated.

**Disclaimer external recruitment agencies**
--------------------------------------------


External recruitment agencies must have signed an agreement with ABN AMRO BANK N.V., issued by a Talent Acquisition Specialist, in order to submit CVs. Acquisition is therefore not appreciated.

### **Wij vragen**

* Goede communicatie vaardigheden

### **Wij bieden**

* Analytische skills

title: Market Intelligence Analyst (Delivery)
description:
In this role, you will be central to producing high-quality insights and foresights to our customers to support strategy execution and development. The insights are delivered to our customers through our Market Intelligence platform and in quarterly and yearly sessions in which you will have a big role.


Do you enjoy and enjoy translating data into actionable insights and foresights? Read on!


‍

#### **What You'll Be Doing:**


As a Market Intelligence Analyst, focused on delivery to our clients, you will be responsible end-to-end for high-stakes projects. This includes market analysis, project management, and ensuring the integrity of our data. In this role, you will:

* Utilize various sources such as annual reports and trade databases to uncover key trends that inform strategic decisions.
* Collaborate with the rest of the Market Intelligence Analyst team to structure and execute workstreams effectively.
* Continuously enhance our insight generation processes to maintain the highest level of data accuracy.
* Use your expertise to predict trends and integrate foresights into client strategies.
* Work on projects from inception to completion, ensuring timely delivery and alignment with client expectations and strategic goals.


‍

##### **Projects You’ll Work On:**

* **Market Assessments:** Evaluate market potential for key segments within large agricultural and food companies using public and proprietary data to support strategic planning and investment decisions.
* **Competitive Benchmarking:** Conduct in-depth competitive reviews for major food customers, synthesizing data into strategic recommendations for senior management.
* **High-Stakes Analysis:** Provide critical analytical support that influences key decisions, such as determining the bonus structures for C-suite executives at large multinational clients based on performance data.


‍

##### **What Success Looks Like:**

* **First 30 Days:** Familiarize yourself with our company culture, data systems, and client profiles to integrate effectively into our team.
* **First 90 Days:** Enhance your skills to actively engage in and contribute to quarterly customer discussions, aligning your efforts with our strategic goals.
* **First 180 Days:** Contribute to workstreams in market and competitor analysis and prepare content for customer workshops, showcasing your growing independence and expertise.


‍

##### **Challenges:**

* Efficiently process and refine extensive datasets to maintain data integrity and ensure actionable insights.
* Quickly adapt to the complexities of our operational and analytical tools, becoming proficient in their use.


‍

##### **Key Performance Indicators (KPIs):**

* The impact of your insights on client decision-making processes.
#### **Your Talent:**

* Independent thinker with a strong analytical mindset, eager to take on challenges and drive results.
* Proficient in Excel.
* Proven ability to handle and analyze complex datasets to generate meaningful business insights.
* Demonstrable experience in managing complex projects and stakeholders efficiently.
* Excellent communication skills, capable of explaining complex data in understandable terms.
* Experience working on high-stakes, numbers-focused projects.
* 1 to 5 years of experience working with data, with a degree in Business Administration, Finance, Economics, or similar fields.
#### **Who you'll be working with:**


Miriam
Head of Insights & Strategic Services
Jurre
Junior Analyst
Jakub
Market Intelligence Analyst##### **What We Offer:**

* Competitive salary range of €40,000 - €48,000 annually, including an 8% holiday bonus.
* Performance bonus of up to 10% of your gross salary.
* Hybrid work setup with 2-5 days in the office per week.
* Regular company events like dinners, BBQs, boat trips, and padel tournaments, fostering a vibrant team culture.


‍

#### **Application Process:**

* **Screening Call:** Start your application with a call from our recruiter to discuss your background and fit for the role.
* **Online Skill-Based Assessment**
* **In-Person Interview:** If successful in the initial stages, you'll be invited to our Amsterdam office for an in-depth interview to further assess your fit with our team and culture.
#### **A-INSIGHTS**


A-INSIGHTS is the fastest growing company and market intelligence platform in the market. Trusted and loved by some of the world's largest companies (Bayer, McCain, Ahold, RoyalFrieslandCampina, Gemeente Amsterdam), we combine worldwide publicly available company and market data with the latest domain & tech expertise.


Our goal is to set the international standard for objective company performance insights based on publicly available data.


And our journey is just getting started!


Every day, we make it easy for organizations around the world to make a difference through best-in-class insights and unmatched service. And we don’t plan on stopping anytime soon.


We are building a team of passionate and talented people who are eager to contribute to this growth and help us write our story.

#### **Application Process:**

* **Screening Call:** Start your application with a call from our recruiter to discuss your background and fit for the role.
* **Online Skill-Based Assessment**
* **In-Person Interview:** If successful in the initial stages, you'll be invited to our Amsterdam office for an in-depth interview to further assess your fit with our team and culture.


‍

##### **Ready to apply?**


If this role excites you, apply today via our careers page! Research indicates that some groups, particularly women, are less likely to apply for jobs unless they meet every qualification. If you're passionate about joining us but don't meet all the criteria, we still encourage you to apply. We're excited to see how your unique skills might contribute to our team at A-INSIGHTS.


‍

##### **Have Questions?**


For any inquiries or additional information, please contact Iselde van Beurden, Interim Talent Lead:

* Email: Iselde@theentrepreneurials.com
* Whatsapp: +31 (0)638276027

title: Data Analyst
description:
CHOOOSE is a climate tech company that provides digital solutions to enable decarbonization programs in hard-to-abate sectors, including aviation, shipping, and logistics. The company has raised $50M from leading venture capital and strategic investors.  

CHOOOSE is the trusted climate partner of global enterprises including Air Canada, Alaska Airlines, British Airways, Flexport, Southwest Airlines, and more. CHOOOSE enables these enterprise partners and their customers to understand their carbon footprints, make more carbon-informed decisions, and support diverse offsetting and insetting solutions.  

We are a mission-oriented and ambitious team, and we are scaling our business and climate action in tandem. We care about one another and our partners. Headquartered in Oslo, Norway, CHOOOSE has remote team members around the globe. We’re looking for the best talent to join the next chapters of the CHOOOSE journey.  

The Data team is responsible for transforming and maintaining quality of external and system data, external facing analytical visualizations and providing insights and business intelligence to internal teams at CHOOOSE. This role will focus primarily on Business intelligence with the goal to empower our internal teams to perform better and the build of external facing visualizations.
### **What you'll do**

* Collaborate with internal stakeholders to streamline data-driven performance management.
* Enabling self-serve metrics and empowering internal teams such as Account Management, Finance, Implementation, Product and Carbon Operations to leverage data to answer their questions.
* Collaborate with the Product team to incorporate external facing visualizations into the CHOOOSE platform.

### **What you'll bring to the table**

* An understanding of querying languages (KQL and SQL)
* An understanding of key data manipulation concepts
* 2-5 years of experience using data visualization tools and performing analysis in tools such as Google Suite and Microsoft Office
* Ability to answer questions and problem-solve through data manipulation and visualizations deriving value for our internal organization
* Solution-oriented mindset, leveraging data to problem solve
* Ability to prioritize and manage multiple stakeholders

**The interview process**  

The interview process will include a series of interviews with CHOOOSE Data team members and internal stakeholders. There will be a case study exercise that will be presented to the CHOOOSE Data team. **Pay, perks, & more**  

We offer a competitive salary, the option to participate in our employee equity program, flexible work hours, and access to 'Spaces' coworking space. Come join a fun and supportive team dedicated to advancing climate solutions and tackling significant challenges. **We value diversity and believe forming teams in which everyone can be their authentic self is key to our success. We encourage people from underrepresented backgrounds and different industries to apply.****Compensation will be based on experience and skill, commensurate with market rates, and will include both salary and equity in CHOOOSE.** **CHOOOSE is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate based on race, color, religion (creed), gender, gender expression, age, national origin (ancestry), disability, marital status, sexual orientation, or military status. We are committed to providing an inclusive and welcoming environment to our employees and welcome input from candidates and employees on how we can enhance our inclusiveness.** *Prerequisite for Employment: CHOOOSE may request to conduct background checks on prospective applicants to verify the information provided in the CV, transcripts, and other documentation. This background check may be carried out by our partner and will not be conducted without the applicant's prior consent. Prospective applicants will receive more information about this.*

title: Azure Cloud Support Engineer
description:
Leveraging your passion for data in supporting Rabobank’s data driven ambitions. To support all business initiatives with a need for data (structured and unstructured, high volume and/or streaming), Rabobank has implemented a Global Data & Analytics Platform (GDAP) in the cloud. One of the key characteristics of this GDAP is the concept of self-service: both producers and consumers of data should be able to use the platform in a self-service way. Our team is the single point of entry for the whole enterprise to engage in getting value out of data by using the platform.

  

You advise data producer and consumer teams on how to efficiently make use of this platform. You are the point of contact for teams using the GDAP and assist in setting up their Azure specific resources and advise on topics like data processing, data quality and data governance. You are the analyst with great communication skills focussing on both functional as well as Azure technical requirements.

  

As we are still at the start of our GDAP journey you can contribute in shaping the GDAP by bringing your broad experience in the data domain and translate the feedback of our users into requirements to develop the platform. You can help to further refine the onboarding process of the GDAP and advise the organisation in becoming a Data-as-a-Service organisation.

**Impact**


As an Azure Cloud Support Engineer GDAP you make a difference by:

* Understanding the goals and needs of the business as no other. You are able to understand the question behind the question and translate that into requirements.
* Translating the requirements into solutions using the GDAP. You understand the concepts and solutions forming the GDAP.
* Being the (wo)man in the middle between our tenants (data providers, data producers and data consumers) and the various DevOps-teams of the GDAP. You are able to connect and communicate with a variety of stakeholders.
* Promoting the GDAP in the organization.
* Supporting our tenants with technical questions on Azure and incidents.

**Your talents**


Open communication, working together, providing feedback, being extremely customer focused and working in a structured way are key talents that a support engineer embodies.


Need to have

* At least 2 years of experience as an Azure engineer
* Strong communication skills
* At least certified on Azure Foundation AZ-900 and Azure Data Engineer Associate DP-203
* Willing to develop further in Azure knowledge
* Experience in complex data environments
* Consulting skills
* Experience with working in scrum/agile teams


Nice to have

* Experience in the Financial sector
* Experience with large scale organisations
* Experience in working with development teams as stakeholders
* Microsoft Certified: Azure Administrator Associate (AZ-104)

**Together**


As an Azure Cloud Support Engineer Global Data & Analytics Platform you will be part of the tribe Global Data & Analytics Platform. The tribe Global Data & Analytics Platform is empowering the Rabobank to develop and manage Data & Analytics solutions. Every day the squads of the tribe work on innovative solutions to help the Rabobank reach this goal. The members of the tribe continuously improve themselves and their squads. We openly share our different perspectives and our mistakes and we have an urge to getting things done right. Collaboration is at the heart of everything we do.

**To be considered for this position, you must be located in the Netherlands or elsewhere in the EU and have the legal right to work in the Netherlands. We are unable to consider candidates requiring relocation from another country.**

**This is what we offer you**

* a gross monthly salary between €4.292,- and €6.130,- (scale 9, 36 hours per week (40 hours possible)).
* 13th month and holiday pay: the holiday allowance and annual allowance will usually be paid out in 12 equal monthly instalments. Employees have the option once a year to opt for the holiday allowance to be paid out in May and the annual allowance in December.
* an Employee Benefit Budget (11% of your monthly salary). You decide how to spend this budget. This may include purchasing extra leave days, making extra pension contributions, or even receiving a monthly cash pay-out.
* an annual personal development/training budget of € 1.400,-
* 100% reimbursement of commuting costs if you travel by public transport! Do you still prefer to travel by car or motorbike? Then choose a commuting allowance.
* a monthly € 40,- net work from home allowance, based on working from home 5 days per week.
* a monthly € 40,- net internet allowance.
* Attractive pension fund with a personal contribution of only 5.5%. Rabobank will contribute 21.5%.


This is a selection of the terms of employment for a DevOps Engineer based on a 36-hour working week. You can find all terms of employment on rabobank.jobs/en/conditions-of-employment.


You and the job application process

* Any questions about working at Rabobank and the process? Contact Raphaël Drenthel, IT Recruiter, via raphael.drenthel@rabobank.nl
* We will hold the interviews through a video call.
* You can find answers to the most frequently asked questions on rabobank.jobs/nl/veelgestelde-vragen.
* A security check is part of the process.

title: Financial Analyst
description:
About ViCentra



Worldwide, over 30 million people with diabetes are insulin dependent. This means they need insulin to manage their blood glucose levels. They can either give themselves multiple daily injections, or use an insulin pump, which administers insulin on a continuous basis around the clock.

  



At ViCentra, we’re on a mission to design an insulin pump that delivers not just a best-in-class performance, but also gives our users an experience that empowers and excites them. Something a bit different from the usual medical experience!

  



It’s simple really: people with diabetes are people – not patients.

  



Our philosophy is all about simplicity, helping to carry some of the weight of day-to-day diabetes management for the user, adding a splash of colour and a whole lot of freedom! Kaleido is one of the smallest insulin pumps in the world. We have 10 colour combinations, from bright and joyful to sleek and chic. We want our users to wear their Kaleido proudly. Its size makes Kaleido discreet and easy to wear, so Kaleidoers can forget about diabetes (for a while, at least!) and focus on what truly matters - living life on their own terms!

  



ViCentra was founded in 2013 in the Netherlands, and while we still call Utrecht our home, we’ve now branched out to France and Germany, too. We're gearing up to spread our magic even further, with concrete plans to extend across Europe in 2024. We are CE marked, with in-house development and manufacturing, a state-of-the-art HQ, and a diverse and energetic team hailing from over 30 countries worldwide! We’re backed by heavyweight investors like EQT, INKEF, and Invest-NL, all helping us to launch our rocket ship journey and forge a steady course.

  



We’d love you to travel with us.

  

We’re currently seeking a Financial Analyst to join our talented ViCentra family in Utrecht, The Netherlands. This is a fantastic opportunity to have a varied, interesting role and work within a dynamic, innovative culture; rapidly challenging and broadening your skills and developing your career.

  



The position



As a Financial Analyst at ViCentra, you will be an integral part of a small, dynamic finance team. You will play a crucial role in supporting the financial decision-making process by compiling, analysing and reporting clear, consistent and insightful financial and non-financial information to drive business performance across all business departments.



Your role will cover various responsibilities including business performance tracking, project cost control, budgetary control, FP&A including forecast and budget preparation, in addition to ad-hoc analysis including business cases and assisting with grant applications. In this position you will work hand in hand with department heads in promoting understanding of the financial business performance, ensuring budget compliance and agreeing action plans to manage financial risks and pursue opportunities.



In this position you will also become the recognized expert in all financial systems with regards to database logic. Data extraction and interrogation, and be an active promotor in driving standards of financial and non-financial data quality.

 *The ideal candidate to join our team should have*


* Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Accounting or a related field.
* A minimum of 3 years work experience as financial data analyst, management accounting or comparable role.
* Proven experience of cost accounting, management information reporting, analysis and preparation of budgets and financial projections.
* Experience and effectiveness in working, reporting and communicating in an international and multicultural environment to Senior Management level.
* Experience in a manufacturing, growth / scaling company.
* Exceptional attention to detail.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Affinity with ERP systems.
* Fluency in English, both written and spoken. Dutch language skills are an advantage.
* Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment.
* Strong IT skills, particularly in Microsoft Office (Word & Excel).
* A flexible working attitude and be someone who is willing to go the extra mile to contribute to great team work.
* A positive mindset, being able to think in opportunities rather than problems.
* Ability to focus not only on the day to day aspect, but also on process improvements.
* Pro-active approach with strong time-management skills.

  



What we offer



In addition to a varied and interesting role, you’ll be working in a small, friendly and highly motivated team with excellent career prospects. We are also offering:

  


* Meaningful work
* Autonomy in your work
* A very competitive salary
* 32 days holiday per year (pro rata) + 5 optional purchase days
* A healthy work life balance with flexible hours - 40 hours per week, 8 hours per day to be worked anytime between 7AM-7PM Monday to Friday
* Travel allowance
* Discount on gym membership
* International working environment (30+ nationalities)
* Informal dress code
* Free, on-site parking
* Social events and team lunches, including holiday parties and monthly after work drinks
* Creative office vibe with a picnic area and ping pong table
* A work environment where you can develop your skills, learn from the best and be rewarded for your imagination.

  



Apply today!

  

\*\*We will start interviewing successful candidates without delay, therefore please submit your CV as soon as possible. If we like what we see we will contact you, if we don’t contact you within 4 weeks we’ve probably proceeded with other candidates but don’t lose heart as we might reach out to you if we have a different role or project we think might be a match\*\*

  

If you've got any queries feel free to call +31 (0) 88 250 2900.

  

ViCentra is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age. Due to the international nature of the Company applications are only accepted in English and candidates must also have the right to work in the Netherlands.

  

Agencies: Please note ViCentra is committed to sourcing candidates directly and as such we do not accept speculative CV’s from agencies. We do however work with an approved list of preferred suppliers but in line with our Preferred Supplier List we only pay agency fees where we have a signed agreement in place and a position has formally been placed with the agency by a member of the HR team. We do not pay fees where speculative and unsolicited CV’s are submitted to ViCentra or ViCentra employees. Where this is not observed ViCentra reserves the right to contact these candidates directly and initiate discussions without payment of any agency fee.

title: CRM Business Analyst - Activation
description:
Imagine revolutionizing the future of banking and Making Life Easy from the very first interaction. At bunq, we believe that everyone deserves a bank that's user-centric, transparent, and safe. We want our users to feel this from the moment they first use bunq.



As our CRM Business Analyst - Activation, you'll be at the forefront of this transformation. You'll delve into the signup and trial experiences, uncovering insights that will help us enhance those initial sparks of excitement.

  

Up for the challenge?



Kick off your application by taking our assessment and find out if bunq is your perfect match!  



  

**Take ownership**

  


As bunq's CRM Business Analyst - Activation, you'll have a data-driven eye on our smooth signup and onboarding process. This includes:

* Building dashboards to analyzes and improve our signup CRM campaigns.
* Tracking and improving our users' trial experience using dashboards and heatmaps.
* Creating and maintaining new mobile events with the help of the tech team to personalize CRM campaigns.
* You have strong knowledge in Data Analytics, user onboarding, CRM, and Marketing
* You know how to create or maintain mobile data events
* Affinity with analyzing user behavior and designing product and communication solutions to drive engagement
* You know your way around Mixpanel, Looker, Braze, Hotjar, Segment
* You have excellent communication skills in English

 **Your space to perform**



＄ Salary between €4,090 - €5,015 and the option to gain a quarterly bonus



 Great colleagues that share your mindset



‍ Working hybrid possibilities that only get better with time



 We support growth with bunq Academy and €1500 annual learning budget



 A massive discount with OneFit for your wellbeing



 Travel expenses are covered whether you come walking or by bike, bus or car (though we prefer green choices )



 A Macbook to keep with you while you're with us



 Fabulous in-house chefs cooking delicious lunches:moneybag:An optional pension plan with monthly contribution from bunq



 Monthly contribution to your phone and internet bills



 Friday drinks and other celebrations - bunq style

title: Business Analyst
description:
The COO Risk team is central to managing the Bank's complexity, translating intricate banking exposures into risk-weighted assets and provisions, all while adapting to evolving business goals and regulatory requirements. As part of the Credit Risk Modelling organization, we oversee the entire process from defining credit risk modeling approaches to post-production monitoring. This role offers a unique opportunity to join one of Europe’s leading banks in a key position that fosters collaboration, contribution, and growth. If you're driven to collaborate and deliver results, we’d love to connect with you!
  
  

Tasks
  
  

We are seeking a skilled Consultant to join our Default Remediation and Loss Given Default (LGD) data team. In this role, you will play a crucial part in ensuring the accuracy and completeness of default and LGD-related data for modeling purposes, from initial data capture through to final data delivery. Your responsibilities will be pivotal in aligning with the latest internal and external regulations.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

* Historical Data Analysis: Perform in-depth analysis of historical default data to enhance data quality for the wholesale banking portfolios, including Large Corporates, Commercial Property Finance, Project Finance, Lease, Trade Commodity Finance, and Object Finance.
* Data Collection and Enhancement: Collect, review, and enhance default and LGD data to ensure its completeness and accuracy for use in credit risk modeling.
* Process Development and Implementation: Assist management in developing and implementing new processes and working instructions to streamline data management and ensure compliance with regulatory requirements.
* KPI Tracking and Dashboarding: Take responsibility for tracking key performance indicators (KPIs) and creating dashboards to monitor the effectiveness of remediation processes.
* Support for Ad-Hoc Requests: Provide support to management in handling ad-hoc data requests and help coordinate the planning and backlog of ongoing remediation projects.
* Regulatory Coordination: Help manage and coordinate onsite inspections by regulators, ensuring that all default data and processes meet required standards.
* Cross-Team Collaboration: Work closely with colleagues within COO and the Wholesale Banking (WB) area, ensuring that remediated default data is accurate and complete for building WB credit risk models, including those for RWA, ECAP, and IFRS9.
* Stakeholder Interaction: Regularly interact with GCR account managers and Front Office teams involved with specific problem loans to ensure alignment and accuracy in data used for risk modeling.


Requirements
  
  

* Definition of Default Expertise: Strong working knowledge of new default policies, including forbearance, default indicators, and triggers.
* Transaction Reconciliation: Ability to accurately reconcile transactions (account statements and GL entries) at the facility level, identifying key transactions based on monthly outstanding differences.
* Wholesale Banking Knowledge: Basic understanding of wholesale banking lending products and familiarity with collateral processes, particularly in real estate finance and property validation.
* Process Understanding: In-depth knowledge of front office operations, as well as restructuring and recovery processes within wholesale banking.
* Project Management: Willingness to take on coordinative and project management tasks, ensuring the smooth execution of default data remediation projects.
* NPL Experience: Experience working with Non-Performing Loans (NPLs) and a strong affinity for risk data, particularly in relation to PD, LGD, and EAD models.
* Documentation Skills: Ability to read and interpret loan documentation, identifying terms and conditions related to default events in NPLs, and producing clear, evidence-based documentation.


This is a 6 months contract position.

title: HR Systems Analyst
description:
### **The Job**



The HR Systems Analyst will be responsible for managing, maintaining and improving the Human Resources Information Systems (HRIS) and other HR-related systems or the organization. This role is responsible for implementing and testing systems upgrades, performing data analysis, providing technical support to end-users, maintaining and cleaning, when necessary, the systems and ensuring the smooth operation HR-related software applications. Also, the HR Systems Analyst will work closely with HR leadership to ensure that HR systems meet the organization's needs and comply with legal and regulatory requirements.


### **Responsibilities**


* Manage and maintain the HRIS, including systems upgrades, data accuracy, and system configurations
* Develop and implement procedures and controls to ensure data accuracy and system security and collaborate with Infosec and IT
* Provide end-user support, including troubleshooting, system training and system usage guidance to ensure standardization and optimization
* Collaborate with HR Operations team to develop reports and dashboards in collaboration with the Data team, to track HR metrics, identify areas for improvement and implement these improvements
* Analyze HR data and provide insights to HR leadership to inform HR strategy and decision-making
* Stay current with HR technology trends and make recommendations for new tools or systems that could improve HR processes or productivity
* Ensure HR systems are in compliance with legal and regulatory requirements, such as GDPR, EEOC and SOX
* Serve as a liaison between HR and IT teams to ensure successful integration of HR systems with other systems
* Manage and maintain HR-related software applications, such as SharePoint, Intranet, Zendesk and any other HR systems that may be implemented in the future
* Develop and implement procedures and controls to ensure data accuracy and system security for HR-related software applications.
* Collaborate with the HR team to develop content for HR-related software applications (Nexus, SAP, Sharepoint, Intranet, Zendesk) and ensure that content is up-to-date and relevant.

### **About you**


* You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills
* Excellent communication skills
* Ability to work collaboratively with diverse teams
* Ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities in a fast-paced environment
* Ability to work under pressure
* Ability to adapt and respond to change
* Ability to follow instructions and procedures
* Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration or a related field.
* 3+ years experience in HR specifically HR Technology or a related field
* A minimum 3 years of experience of relevant SAP Success Factors
* Worked in a fast-paced organization (preferably in the tech industry)
* Excellent English communication skills (verbal and written)
* Strong knowledge of HRIS platforms, such as SAP
* Experience with system implementations, upgrades and customizations and the ability to manage projects
* Knowledge of HR processes and policies
* Understanding of HR compliance regulations and data privacy laws

### **5CA O****ffers**


* A remote position at a fast-paced international company with ambitious gaming, e-commerce, and tech clients.
* A diverse and inclusive culture with people from 80+ countries, speaking 25+ languages - where we celebrate everyone's uniqueness.
* Innovative digital tools, and continuous opportunities for learning and development.
* Access to Udemy Business for learning and development.
* Fun employee engagement activities and participation in 5CA employee-lead communities such as 5CA Connect, Pride, 5CA Gamers, Women of 5CA, to name a few.

title: Analyst Digital Infrastructure
description:
Summary:  


Launch your career with NIBC as a Digital Infrastructure Analyst! Dive into deal execution, portfolio management, and strategic projects from day one.  

Job Description:  

About NIBC and the Digital Infrastructure Team
NIBC Bank is seeking a talented and ambitious Analyst to join our growing Corporate Banking team, specifically within the Digital Infrastructure sector. NIBC has been a leader in digital infrastructure debt investments, financing deals ranging from EUR 10-50m. In this sector, we have built a substantial portfolio of fiber and data center investments.
Working at NIBC provides you with the opportunity to be part of an entrepreneurial bank that rewards innovation and talent. Our Corporate Banking team, based in The Hague and London, consists of 20+ colleagues with diverse backgrounds. As part of our team, you will be closely involved in executing new deals, managing our portfolio, and exploring opportunities in this high-growth sector. If you are ready to work on the forefront of financing digital infrastructure, NIBC is the place for you.
To learn more about our Digital Infrastructure team and NIBC, please visit our website: NIBC Bank | Digital Infrastructure
This is what you’ll do
As an Analyst in the Digital Infrastructure team, you will become a core member of our execution and portfolio management team, assisting in origination of new clients from our headquarters in The Hague. You will be actively involved in various stages of transactions, including:* Deal Execution: Assisting in structuring and closing new transactions, including writing credit proposals and supporting negotiations.
* Portfolio Management: Monitoring the performance of existing transactions and ensuring the ongoing management of the portfolio.
* Financial Analysis: Performing detailed market, industry, and company-specific analyses, along with due diligence on potential clients.
* Strategic Initiatives: Contributing to sector-specific projects by working in interdisciplinary deal teams.


Talent Program
Every year, we offer a select group of talented colleagues from the entire bank a spot in our Talent Program. You could be part of this program, too! In this program, you and your fellow trainees (a diverse and international group) will focus on personal and professional development. Working and learning-on-the-job is alternated with targeted training and development activities both developed in cooperation with top ranked business partners. Learning on the job is key in this process, you will be challenged with many hands-on exercises and cases to develop your personal and professional skills.
Pares recently started as a junior analyst in the Talent Program.  

*“NIBC is a perfect place to develop yourself. From day one, you are taken to meet clients, involved in portfolio management, and part of the deal team. Due to the bank's entrepreneurial vision, you also spend a lot of time on market research and setting up new projects, which makes the work diverse. The Talent Program supports this by allowing you to meet many people from other teams and work on a challenging ‘Think Yes Sustainability Challenge.’*
Who do we look for?
We are seeking motivated professionals who are passionate about finance, infrastructure, and making a meaningful impact. Whether you are just starting your career or bringing 0-2 years of experience, we are looking for individuals who are eager to learn, contribute, and grow with us.
NIBC as employer  

Founded in 1945 to finance the visionary entrepreneurs who helped rebuilding the Netherlands after the second World War, NIBC was closely collaborating while professionally supporting companies and individuals in realizing their dreams and goals with a sustainable future in mind. As a midsize bank with a multicultural working environment that is best described as dynamic and ambitious, we share a forward-thinking, can-do attitude with our employees and clients which we call our THINK YES mentality. Our corporate values are Professional, Adaptive, Collaborative and Entrepreneurial. You will have a direct and meaningful impact on both the bank and its clients. By building our company on optimism and mutual trust, and with our THINK YES mentality, NIBC is an enterprising bank that enables ambitions.
Think YES if you…* Have a Master’s degree in Economics, Business Administration, Finance, Law, or a related field.
* Are interested in corporate banking and digital infrastructure.
* Have strong numerical and analytical skills, with the ability to interpret complex data.
* Are eager to learn, with a proactive and solutions-oriented mindset.
* Have strong communication and teamwork skills; and the ability to build relationships with colleagues and clients.


What’s in it for you?
NIBC provides an ambitious environment in which together we strive to create a fantastic workplace and where you feel safe and challenged. Next to this, we offer:* Competitive salary and benefits package.
* Several ways to support your development personally and professionally, by among others:


Personal development budget to spend at your own discretion
Professional budget provided by your manager
In-house training offering* NIBC embraces the Hybrid way of Working. This means that we support working from home as well as encourage our colleagues to come to the office. NIBC's guideline is to spend at least half of the working time at the office;
* Travel expenses or NS Business Card 1st class;
* 32 vacation days;
* Excellent pension scheme (26% NIBC contribution);
* A voucher to improve your home office;
* Two staff associations: YoungNIBC and MyLeisure;
* Vitality program, annual company-wide sports & leisure days;
* Monthly internet allowance;
* Laptop and a company phone;
* Last but not least, a fun workplace in which diversity and inclusion is valued (click here).

  

Will you be our new Talent?
Upload your Cover Letter and CV via the application button. You can upload multiple documents by clicking the upload button again.
Application procedure
Besides getting to know you, we also would like you to get to know us. That's why there will be multiple interviews. We invite you to be curious and ask any questions you may have. An assessment is also part of the procedure.  

Want to know more? Contact us
About the vacancy and procedure: Kirsten.winkel@nibc.com

title: SAP Specialist
description:
Position Summary
The Korean multinational Samsung Group is active in electronics, semiconductor, machinery, chemicals, motors and finance & insurance. Its global headquarters is located in Seoul, South Korea.  

Samsung Electronics is part of the Samsung Group and is the global leader in production and sales of consumer electronics and their core components. Through relentless innovation and discovery, we are transforming the world of televisions, smartphones, personal computers, cameras, home appliances, medical devices, semiconductors and LED solutions. Samsung Electronics employs 260,000 people across 74 countries with annual sales, both in consumer as well as business-to business-markets, exceeding US$143 billion. Our goal is opening new possibilities for people everywhere.  

Samsung Electronics in Europe includes 3 factories, 2 R&D centers, 20 sales subsidiaries, and our Logistics subsidiary Samsung Electronics Europe Logistics B.V.  

Samsung Electronics Europe Logistics BV (hereafter referred to as SELS) is the Central European logistics organization of Samsung Electronics based in Delft, The Netherlands. The objective of SELS is to function as a logistics control tower and financial hub within SEC Europe.
Role and Responsibilities
We are looking for a SAP Specialist to join our team who will continuously review logistics business processes and systems in order to create the most efficient systems, but also evelop & implement new processes and systems to support the business.
Business Processes* Analyse existing business processes and/or systems together with logistics specialist/business analyst in order to have a clear understanding about the operational logistics processes
* Determine operational needs by interpreting functional requirements in order to propose changes in business processes and/or systems
* Propose changes in existing processes and/or systems and gain approval for changes in order to improve operational performance and increase efficiency
* Translate user needs into system requirement and design specifications for developments together with Headquarters development Team
* Troubleshoot any logistics issues and dive into system processes to offer solutions and guide to end users


Projects* Lead and manage small local project teams in order to jointly determine operational needs and create functional requirements
* Propose new processes and/or systems and gain approval in order to improve operational performance and increase efficiency
* Create new processes and/or systems by configuring, testing and implementing relevant SAP module(s)


Interface* Develop and deploy interfaces between SAP and other systems (i.e. WMS, TMS) in order to ensure optimum flow of information, data accuracy and flawless processes


Training and Support* Develop trainings and training materials based on changes in order to construct efficient trainings
* Act as a single point of contact for end users in order to provide basic technical support
* Solve process and/or system disturbances as quickly as possible in order to ensure optimum operational performance


Skills and Qualifications
Soft Skills* Excel expertise
* SAP knowledge, SAP BI
* SAP-Master data management (LE/MM/SD)
* Able to work unsupervised

We offer* A competitive base salary
