title: Senior Analyst, Supply Chain Optimization EMEA
description:
Become a Part of the NIKE, Inc. Team  

  

NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world's best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At NIKE, Inc. it's about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game.  

  

The NIKE, Inc. Supply Chain team is the engine that propels product around the world. Supply Chain experts ensure that every year, almost a billion units of footwear, apparel and equipment arrive at the right place, at the right time. To ensure this complex job goes off without a hitch, Supply Chain teams work with a network of more than 50 distribution centers, thousands of accounts, and more than 100,000 retail stores worldwide - making the impossible happen every single day.  

  

WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR
  

  

We're looking for a Senior Analyst, Supply Chain Optimization with a strong drive to continuously innovate how we best flow our Nike, Jordan, and Converse product s through our multi - node supply chain network. With multi - node we mean our expanding distribution network that Nike EMEA is building to best serve our marketplace across eCommerce, Stores, and Wholesale Partners. You will be a key player in cross-functional projects aiming to optimize inventory management in this network, to increase speed and service to consumers and minimize operational costs.
  

  

You get excited by creating innovative, algorithm-driven, yet simple and flexible solutions that enable dynamic positioning and managing of our inventory in the right location across the multi - node fulfillment network.
  

  

You love an opportunity and can easily switch from the abstract and conceptual to the practical reality of building the supply chain of tomorrow. You get energy about what can be and are able to convey this excitement to others. And you are comfortable with some degree of ambiguity that comes with a large, fast-paced organization .  

  

WHAT YOU WILL WORK ON
  

  

If this is you, you will be part of the Marketplace Supply Chain Multi-node team that drives and co-ordinates Nike's Multi Node strategy deployment and inventory flow across our channels and nodes. The Senior Analyst in the team is our subject matter expert on supply chain flow data, with the ability to simplify complex information and effectively communicate findings. And you will support the design and development of inventory flow solutions to equip our Run & Improve teams with better tools for making choices, and consequently improve our performance on all pillars of Nike's Consumer Promise: Service, Convenience, Sustainability and Profitability.  

  

A typical day/week will see you being involved in one or multiple supply chain innovation projects. It will range from identifying opportunities by diving into the data and providing data-driven recommendations, to working (together) on the design and development of automated and intelligent decision-making solutions. You will have the opportunity to be involved in multiple impactful projects, which will equip our run & improve teams with improved processes & tools to flow our products seamlessly and efficiently through the multi-node network.  

  

In summary, your responsibilities will include to:  

* Generate insights through data evaluation to answer key business questions
* Provide research to balance cost and service while increasing stock turn as input to improvement cases, using descriptive and predictive analytics
* Visualize and communicate the outcomes and the story behind the numbers to stakeholders to create engagement and excitement
* Bring an improvement and innovation mindset to manage and participate in medium to large sized cross-functional projects
* Contribute to advanced analytics and optimization innovations to improve product flow through our multi-node network
* Assist the Multi-node and wider Supply Chain teams through rich operational business intelligence, design and development of support to make the right choice solutions, which simplify transactional work and unlock value creation

  

WHO YOU WILL WORK WITH
  

  

You will be part of the EMEA Supply Chain Multi-Node team, which is part of the Seasonal Excellence organization. Seasonal Excellence is the team that manages the smooth flow of inventory across EMEA to deliver strong Availability, Orderbook health, Working Capital, and logistic efficiency.  

  

Because of the nature of the work, you will be working together closely with our teammates across functions. Amongst others you will be collaborating with our other marketplace supply chain ‘run & improve' and capability-building teams across Nike NDDC (eCommerce), Stores, and Marketplace Partners. And with our Logistics teams who are responsible for the distribution and transportation of our product, where you will work closely with teams such as Network Capacity Optimization (NCO).  

  

In the wider organization key partners on our journey are in Demand & Supply Management, Finance, and Merchandising and Consumer x Marketplace teams. To deliver the data & analytics part of this role, you will work together with Capability Building teams, (Supply Chain) Analytics, and Nike Technology. Both within EMEA as well as with our Global World Headquarters teams based in Portland, USA.  

  

WHAT YOU BRING
  

* Proven experience in Data Analysis & Reporting (Tableau, Snowflake, SQL, Excel, and/or similar tools)
* At least a basic understanding and knowledge of Advanced Analytics methods (Optimization, AI/ML, Python)
* Experience in Supply Chain Planning & Operations, preferably in an Omnichannel Retail context
* Innovation Mindset
* Commercial & Financial Acumen
* Strong verbal and written communication

  

NIKE, Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Nike offers a generous total rewards package, casual work environment, a diverse and inclusive culture, and an electric atmosphere for professional development. No matter the location, or the role, every Nike employee shares one galvanizing mission: To bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete\* in the world.  

  

NIKE, Inc. is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability.  

  

**Benefits**  

  

Whether it's transportation or financial health, we continually invest in our employees to help them achieve greatness - inside and outside of work. All who work here should be able to realize their full potential.
company_description: NIKE, Inc. is the world’s leading designer, marketer and distributor of authentic athletic footwear, apparel, equipment and accessories for a wide variety of sports and fitness activities.

title: Business Analyst Sustainability – Long-Term – Utrecht, Hybrid
description:
**Business Analyst Sustainability – Long-Term – Utrecht, Hybrid**



Levy Professionals is currently looking for Business Analysts with strong experience in data management and regulatory reporting for one of the largest financial institutions in the Netherlands. You will be joining the bank to ensure the foundation of their regulatory reports and senior management decisions by ensuring data accuracy and quality, and improving existing processes with a focus on sustainability.



**Responsibilities**



As a Business Analyst, you will be joining the Reporting Center to handle all sustainability reporting-related affairs. Your key responsibilities will include:


* Collect and validate data from various sources, investigate and resolve inconsistencies and errors, prepare reports, and analyze shifts in figures,


* Engage in process improvement, maintain contact with stakeholders, and participate in setting up new reporting processes,


* Address data quality issues structurally and work on large data sets,


* Participate in the interpretation of new regulations and develop reporting solutions.



**Who are you?**


* 5+ years of experience as a business analyst and other relevant positions,


* Strong experience in data management and ensuring data quality,


* Experience in regulatory reporting,


* Exposure to data analytics tooling (KNIME for ex.),


* Exposure to credit and/or risk processes and databases,


* Knowledge of SQL and Python,


* Strong stakeholders management and communication skills.



**About Levy Professionals**



Since 2000, we have been delivering professional solutions to organizations ranging from tech start-ups to global players. From our offices in Amsterdam and London, we have built an international and local network of experienced salaried professionals, driven by our passion for connecting skills with projects. Over the years we have filled over 1,700 applications and today we have consistently recruited and seconded 250+ professionals from 14 countries who have been deployed on a variety of projects. Our strength is the way we see and treat people. This will always be an important factor in our strategy for the coming years.

title: Senior Analytics Engineer
description:
**About HousingAnywhere**



HousingAnywhere is Europe's largest mid-term rental platform. With Kamernet and Studapart under its umbrella, it represents three fast-growing brands with over 30 million yearly unique visitors combined, 160,000+ properties available for rent and 100,000+ tenants securing their new homes, based on the 2022 performance. HousingAnywhere serves young professionals and students, primarily aged between 18 and 35, connecting them with accommodation providers. Through its advanced technology platform, tenants rent accommodation for 3 to 12 months outside of their country of origin. Headquartered in Rotterdam, HousingAnywhere operates in most European cities and recently expanded to key cities in the US, establishing a presence in over 125 cities. Driven by the mission to enable people to live wherever and however they choose, thanks to a flexible renting experience, the technology scale-up employs 340 professionals globally.

  


**Our mission**



Rent Easy, Live Free.



We are empowering people to live wherever and however they choose. To find comfort and peace of mind on the other side of the world or the other side of town. All while feeling confident and totally at ease, whatever their adventure might involve. We are doing it by creating a new standard of renting. Safe. Harmonious. More options. Less hassle. With the help of our trusted networks of landlords and partners.

  


**Our** **Values**


* Ownership
* We are Enablers
* We are Changemakers
* We are Connectors

  


**The team**



This role will be part of the Analytics Engineering team, which is part of the Data Science & Engineering organisation. This organisation also consists of Data Engineering and Data Science teams. The Analytics Engineering team has the mandate to democratise access to insights by building Data Models in our Enterprise Data Warehouse.

  


**Our Stack**



At HousingAnywhere, our data warehouse is powered by Snowflake. Our data pipelines are built using Stitch and dbt cloud and Airflow. We use Rudderstack as our preferred CDP. We use Tableau as our Visualization tool and Mixpanel for Product Analytics.

  


**Your role & Impact**



Analytics Engineers are responsible for translating data needs from stakeholders into architecting, building and maintaining efficient & reliable data models and pipelines.


* Partner with our business stakeholders, BI analysts and other engineering team members to collect data needs - and translate this into functioning pipelines and data models
* Build, and maintain efficient & reliable data models and pipelines for both external and internal data in partnership with data engineering
* Perform root cause analysis in case of issues in data production processes
* Ensure our colleagues are able to optimally use the data models via documentation, training, and monitoring of best practices

  


**Your profile**


* At least 5 years of experience in building data marts/data models and performing adhoc analysis on large datasets
* At least 2 years of working experience working with dbt
* Strong knowledge in SQL, Data Modelling
* Good business modelling skills to transform stakeholders requirements into an actual data model.
* Software engineering experience in a programming language, preferably in Python.
* Experience using code repositories is highly desirable.
* Experience using a data visualisation tool is a plus.
* Preferable Eu-based candidates.

  


**What's in it for you**


* Diverse international community (46+ nationalities).
* Hybrid working policy with 2 days working from office.
* Unlimited paid holidays, minimum-based not maximum.
* 1,000 EUR personal development budget.
* Complete coverage for commuting.
* Personal equipment, including laptop and ergonomic setup.
* 30% ruling application assistance.
* Gym membership discount with GoVital or OneFit.
* Variable pension scheme.
* Dutch/English classes budget.
* Fun team-building and after-work drinks every Friday.

  


*If you have further questions, please email* *y.kaboorappan@housinganywhere.com*


*By applying to work at HousingAnywhere, you agree to our* *Candidate Privacy Policy*
company_description: We have the mission to help with housing, anywhere. We want to build a safe, efficient and global rental marketplace for anyone looking for or renting out a place. We Care. We Perform. We Evolve.

title: DevOps Engineer Collibra
description:
You will get the opportunity to work in beating heart of data within the Rabobank. You will work together with people who have an insatiable curiosity in technology, data, and self-development. You will heavily invest in your career. You will make memories.

**As a Software Engineer you can make a difference**


Within the Tribe Global D&A Platform you will work in the centre of the data driven enterprise. The tribe contains 4 areas:

* Data Platform
* Analytics Platform
* Governance Platform
* Onboarding and Support


For about 40 squads are divided over these areas. In many of the teams we are working on software engineering. We need your help to design, build and run ground-breaking solutions that are as valuable to our 7 million customers.


You will be working in the Collibra Data Catalog (Atlas) squad that is part of the area “Data Platform”. We empower producers and consumers to easily share data through the Global Data Platform in a governed way. Collibra, as a data marketplace, enables you to publish, discover, and access data products on the Global Data Platform efficiently and securely. The Data Catalog offers a unified view of data across the Global Data Platform.

**You will be responsible for**  

We are looking for experienced Collibra professionals in Rabobank Tribe Global D&A Platform with the ability to build high-quality solutions that fit the needs of our stakeholders. As a software engineer, you play a crucial role in crafting and delivering those solutions, in line with organisational and architectural standards.

**Experience**


Above all we are looking for new colleagues with an insatiable curiosity in data, technology and self-development on a senior level. We don’t look for the sheep with the 5 legs. We believe that if you are a good engineer language doesn’t matter although we do understand everyone has preferences. There is absolutely no need to thick all of below mentioned boxes, but it gives you a good understanding on which technology/frameworks/languages we use:

* Experience in developing simple and complex workflows in Collibra or any BPMN tool.
* Development and implementation of Collibra metamodel customizations.
* Groovy script experience is a must
* Hands-on experience implementing out-of-box and developing custom workflows using Eclipse and Groovy scripting to automate Data Governance processes.
* Experience with data projects such as Master Data Management, Metadata Management, Data Lakes, and other analytical platforms
* Experience in using appropriate Java APIs/REST APIs and Collibra APIs to automate Data Governance activities in Data Governance tool.
* Ability to interact with Business and Technical stakeholders.
* Basic knowledge of Java
* Knowledge in Azure is a plus


Of course, it is a plus if you have experience in the Data Management work field.

**Competences**

* Strong communication skills
* Open communication
* Proactively participate in a multidisciplinary DevOps team where you challenge and debate the decisions of your team members on the presented solutions;
* Working together
* Providing feedback
* Willing to develop further in Azure
* Strong information/data analysis skills
* A customer focused mind-set and having a structured way of working are key talents that a business analyst embodies.
* Quick learner
* Are eager to know more about banking processes, our stakeholders, and their needs;
* Proactively participate in reflection moments to improve our collaboration, processes, value delivery and goals, on both product and team level.
* Show ownership and autonomy with a proactive attitude;
* Enthusiasm and appreciation of achievements and result-driven behaviour;
* Transparency and courage to have in-depth conversations;
* Continuously improving to grow as a team and individual.

**What do we offer?**  

We would love to help you achieve this by focusing firmly on your growth, development, and investing in an environment where you keep learning every day. We give you the space to innovate and initiate. In this way, we offer you numerous opportunities to grow and help you exceed your expectations, to do the right thing exceptionally well, and to therefore grow as a professional. In addition, with us (on the basis of a 36-or 40 hour working week), you can also expect:

* Based on your experience: up to € 6.130,64,- gross per month (scale 9) or up to €7.307,58 ,- gross per month (scale 10)
* Thirteenth month's salary and 8% holiday allowance
* an extra budget of 11% of your gross salary to be used at your discretion. Buy extra holiday hours, add more to your pension savings or ask for part of the extra budget to be paid out.
* a budget of € 750- to set up your home working space and a monthly home working allowance of up to € 40-
* a personal development budget of € 1,400-
* a combination of working from home and at the office
* 100% reimbursement of commuting costs if you travel by public transport
* A pension scheme to which you contribute 3.5%
* 151.2 hours holiday per year + 1 Diversity Day per year
* Relocation belongs to the possibilities


This is a selection of the terms of employment for a Software Engineer based on a 36-hour working week. You can find all terms of employment on rabobank.jobs/en/conditions-of-employment.

 **You and the job application process**


Reply to the vacancy for Software Engineer at Rabobank.

* Any questions about working at Rabobank and the process? Raphaël Drenthel, IT Recruiter, Raphael.Drenthel@rabobank.nl
* We will hold the interviews through a video call.
* You can find answers to the most frequently asked questions on rabobank.jobs/nl/veelgestelde-vragen.
* A security check is part of the process.
* We respect your privacy.

**Growing a better world together**  

You are already aware that Rabobank is a financial services provider for millions of customers in 40 countries. But did you know that we aim to contribute to real change with our “Growing a better world together” mission? We do so in countless ways, such as:

* A third of all the food we purchase is thrown away. Together with Nature & Environment, we’re working to increase awareness among consumers of how to reduce food waste.
* As part of a project with Humanitas, we are helping people who are experiencing financial difficulties to get their household finances in order.
* Together with Vluchtelingenwerk Nederland (the Dutch Council for Refugees), we are helping 1,500 refugees find a suitable job.


Interested? Please contact us.

title: HR Data Analyst (32-40h)
description:
Overview:

Job Description:

As an HR Data Analyst at Applied Medical, you'll be at the heart of our mission, using your data skills to make a real impact. This role is the perfect mix of diving deep into data analysis and creating dashboards that guide smart decisions. If you're detail-oriented, passionate about data, can transform data into insights, and committed to excellence, we want you on our team.  

You'll be key in helping us reach our goals by providing, analyzing, and presenting data to HR team, supporting informed decision-making. You'll collaborate with the HR team and other departments, working on initiatives, projects, setting KPIs, and sharing market trends. *You will be based at our European headquarter in Amersfoort (NL) and will report to the Manager Human Resources Business Partner.* **Responsibilities:**  

* Conduct ad-hoc queries for complex analysis and provide structured analytic data on a regular basis
* Report on KPIs, perform KPI analysis, and ensure organizational goals are met
* Develop and maintain data models to analyze trends in HR data
* Collect, analyze, and synthesize HR data from multiple sources to identify trends, patterns, and insights for reports
* Analyze and present market trends to identify potential issues and opportunities
* Ensure the accuracy and consistency of input data by conducting Data Cleansing and troubleshooting irregularities/ anomalies
* Perform root cause analysis and propose corrective/preventative actions
* Support data governance processes and conduct audit checks on HR data
* Maintain and prepare internal procedures, recommending various improvements to enhance efficiency
* Understand and comply with organizational rules, policies, standards, and national and local regulations


Requirements:
* Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field
* At least 4 years of relevant experience in a similar position
* Experience working in an international environment
* Proficiency in SAP, PowerBI, DAX or Power Query and other relevant reporting and data processing tools
* MS Office-based computer applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook)
* Excellent oral and written communication skills in English and another relevant European language


We Offer:
* An international working environment, fueled by respect and a healthy work-life balance tailored to the business and team member’s needs
* 27 paid vacation days (based on fulltime contract) with option to purchase five additional days
* Optional hybrid model, including home office equipment and a working from home allowance
* Commuting allowance of €0,23/km or an NS Business card subscription
* A wide variety of internal trainings and development possibilities and a tuition program for external trainings
* The opportunity to pro-actively work on your vitality and fitness
* State-of-the-art facilities, including green areas, in-house restaurant and gym
* Additional benefits, such as:
	+ Attractive pension scheme (your contribution at 4%, ours at 12%)
	+ €50 net monthly health insurance contribution
	+ Two (paid) days per year dedicated to volunteering activities
	+ Several fun company events and meaningful initiatives organized throughout the year
	+ A hybrid workplace, where you can work partially from home (except for operational vacancies)


At Applied Medical, we are committed to make a meaningful, positive difference, each and every day. Within our European headquarters in Amersfoort (NL), we develop, manufacture and support the implementation of our advanced medical devices across Europe and the MENA region. Applied’s team members enjoy working in an environmentally friendly and international environment, in which people of diverse backgrounds are valued, challenged, and acknowledged. We support our team members by giving them opportunities of ongoing learning and education, possibilities to take part in community volunteering activities and a variety of onsite exercise classes and health activities.  

If you are passionate about working in an organization that allows you to make decisions based upon what is right for the patient, customer, community and environment, Applied Medical is the place for you. **Interested?**  

Would you like to be part of our expanding team? If the answer is yes, we'd love to get to know you and look forward to hearing from you!
For more information regarding our hiring process, click here. If you have any questions, feel free to contact us via recruitment-eu@appliedmedical.com  

Not the right job for you? Take a look at our other vacancies and follow us on LinkedIn.  

Applied Medical in Europe from Applied Medical on Vimeo.

title: Chapter Lead Analytics Engineering FCFP Domain
description:
Think Forward! Our purpose is to empower people to stay a step ahead in life and in business. We are an industry recognized strong brand with positive recognition from customers in many countries, strong financial position, omni-channel distribution strategy and international network. If you want to work at a place with lots of freedom to innovate, where we believe that you can live by the Agile manifesto without jeopardizing the necessary continuity, compliance and QA measures, where we are committed to deliver stable and secure services to end users, and where we have a 'no nonsense' getting-things done mentality, please read on!


We create advanced analytics applications in the “Financial Crime and Fraud Prevention” (FCFP) domain. We are tackling fundamental, high impact, problems in the financial services industry. We are passionate about protecting both our customers and our society, delivering products that make ING a safer and more compliant bank.


As we continue our growth and establishing the added value data science and machine learning will bring to this transformation journey, we seek a leader for our data science chapter. This means you have to be a hands-on coach. A Chapter lead role splits his/her time 50-50 over engineering and leading a chapter.


**Your key responsibilities**:

* You hierarchically oversee a chapter of 10-12 engineers. This covers the recruiting of new talents, administration, personal development, and evaluation of your Chapter members.
* You inspire and encourage your Chapter members to develop themselves, providing them coaching on both the professional as well as the personal level.
* Support & structure the growth and career trajectories of our outstanding Data & ML Engineers.
* Challenge the status-quo & accelerate our work and capabilities to transition from building models to delivering state-of-the-art data products.
* Enable our squads to make an impact and drive the growing process we undergo as an analytics group.
* Promote advanced analytics approaches in the KYC domain and drive the business transformation together with our key stakeholders.

**What is the role we hiring for?**

* You have at least 10+ years of (global) work experience in Data, Analytics and Machine Learning (methods, technology, data)
* You have experience in architecting & building analytics solutions from prototype to deployment
* You have a proven track record of developing people and knowledge through coaching or mentoring
* You have experience in leading teams to drive results and interact with (senior level) stakeholders
* You are have good oratory and presentation skills
* You have experience in implementing analytics solutions in Agile ways of working
* You have vast experience in understanding complex AI/ML problems and ability to devise best optimal ways of implementation.
* You inspire and encourage your Chapter members to develop themselves, providing them coaching on both the professional as well as the personal level.

**Who should apply?**

* Masters' degree with excellent academic results in the field of Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering or similar.
* Excellent understanding of Data Engineering, Analytics and machine learning applications & algorithms.
* Knowledge of big data tools and frameworks (Hadoop, Spark).
* Experience in data manipulation and transformation using Scala/Python/Spark/SQL
* Familiarity with Business Intelligence reporting & visualization tools e.g. Cognos, PowerBI
* Deployment and provisioning automation tools e.g. Docker, Kubernetes, Openshift, CI/CD
* Strong communication and stakeholder management skills are non-negotiable.

title: Software Engineer- Frontend
description:
**Values & Innovation**
-----------------------


At Under Armour, we are committed to empowering those who strive for more, and the company's values - Act Sustainably, Celebrate the Wins, Fight on Together, Love Athletes and Stand for Equality - serve as both a roadmap for our teams and the qualities expected of every teammate.

  

Our Values define and unite us, the beliefs that are the red thread that connects everyone at Under Armour. Our values are rallying cries, reminding us why we're here, and fueling everything we do.

  

Our pursuit of better begins with innovation and with our team's mission of being the best. With us, you get the freedom to go further - no matter your role. That means developing, delivering, and selling the state-of-the-art products and digital tools that make top performers even better.

  

If you are a current Under Armour teammate, apply to this position on the **Internal Career Site Here.**

**Purpose of Role**
-------------------


Under Armour is seeking a full stack Senior Software Engineer to help architect and build fast, frictionless experiences across the globe as part of our growing Ecommerce Engineering team. The Sr. Software Engineer will hold responsibility for front-end initiatives across multiple platforms. The ideal candidate has a passion for collaboration with cross functional partners, can adapt to technology change and evolution, and is eager to find creative solutions to technical issues.

**Your Impact**
---------------

* Develop high-quality software with a focus on frontend development
* Identify, prioritize and execute tasks in the software development lifecycle
* Build and maintain applications and components
* Communicate clear execution plans to both technical teammates and non-technical business
* Ensure software is up-to-date with latest technologies
**Qualifications**
------------------

* Bachelor's degree with typically 5 years of relevant experience OR Master's degree with typically 3 years of relevant experience OR typically 9 years of relevant work experience without degree
* Strong desire to learn and is quick to pick up new concepts
* Passion for development and ability to dig into solving problems
* Expertise with modern web development - focus on frontend capabilities including React, Typescript, JavaScript, CSS/SCSS, HTML
* Experience working in an agile environment
* Ideal candidate has exposure to some of the following technologies and systems:
	+ NextJS
	+ GraphQL
	+ Tagging & Analytics (ex: Adobe DTM/Launch, Tealium, Google Tag Manager)
	+ Content Management Systems (ex: CoreMedia, Magnolia, Contentful, AEM),
	+ A/B Testing (ex: Adobe Target, AB Tasty, Evergage)
	+ E-Commerce Systems (Salesforce Commerce Cloud, Hybris, Shopify, etc)
**Workplace Location**
----------------------

* **Location:** This individual must reside within commuting distance from ourAmsterdam office.
* **Return to Work Designation:** Hybrid work (baseline of minimum 2 days a week in-office.
**Relocation**
--------------

* No relocation provided
**Benefits & Perks**
--------------------

* Paid “UA Give Back” Volunteer Days: Work alongside your team to support initiatives in your local community.
* Under Armour Merchandise Discounts
* Health & fitness benefits, discounts and resources- We offer teammates across the country programs to promote physical activity and overall well-being.
* 38 hour working week
* Hybrid work, a minimum of 2 days in the office
* 28 days holiday
* Teammate Resource groups e.g. Green Machine, Sustainability, LGBTQIA+, Women in Leading and Living, Balance for mental health and wellbeing etc.
* Human Performance Institute (Gym) on site
* Local Language course when moving from abroad
**Our Commitment to Diversity**
-------------------------------


At Under Armour, we are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and teammates without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, pregnancy (including childbirth, lactation and related medical conditions), national origin, age, physical and mental disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information (including characteristics and testing), military and veteran status, family or paternal status and any other characteristic protected by applicable law. Under Armour believes that diversity and inclusion among our teammates is critical to our success as a global company, and we seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. Accommodation is available for applicants with disabilities upon request.

title: Solution Architect
description:
We are a dynamic and innovative company that offers smart charging solutions, from charge points to charge cards and additional services. We continuously improve our products and optimally serve our customers in the rapidly changing energy sector. We operate in a young, energetic market—and you will notice that immediately! Together we strive for ambitious goals.

  

**The role**



As a Solution Architect at Eneco eMobility, you play a crucial role in designing and implementing scalable Azure solutions that drive operational efficiency and support business growth. Leveraging deep expertise in Microsoft 365 Dynamics CE and F&O, Azure architecture, Bicep for infrastructure as code, Azure containers, Azure Functions, and Azure Cosmos DB you lead the development of robust IT solutions.  

  

You excel in performing cost analysis for cloud architecture solutions, balancing factors such as scalability, future-proofing, and operational efficiency. Collaborating closely with cross-functional teams, you ensure alignment of technical solutions with business objectives, while providing mentorship on best practices and fostering a culture of innovation and continuous improvement.  

  

Your leadership extends to driving architectural decision-making through ADR meetings, documenting key decisions, and guiding and preparing the architectural implementation (together with DevOps Engineer) of monitoring solutions using Azure Monitor and Log Analytics. By championing best practices in DevOps, CI/CD pipelines, and automation frameworks, you contribute to maintaining a reliable and scalable infrastructure that supports Eneco eMobility's mission in the electric mobility sector.  

  

**What are you going to do**

  

* Design scalable Azure solutions using Bicep that meet business requirements and architectural standards, integrating with third-party APIs as needed.
* Design and develop comprehensive solutions integrating Dynamics 365 (CE and F&O), ERP systems, configure Price Quote modules, client-facing portals, mobile apps, and integrations between them.
* Provide technical leadership and guidance to development teams during project lifecycle.
* Lead architecture design of complex Azure solutions using Bicep, ensuring alignment with business goals, technical requirements, and cost targets.
* Define and enforce best practices for Azure architecture, DevOps, and testing methodologies across projects, emphasizing cost-efficient solutions and effective monitoring strategies.
* Collaborate closely with stakeholders to translate business requirements into cost-effective technical solutions that drive business growth.

 **We Offer**



At Eneco eMobility, you come first. You are the driving force. We invest heavily in your personal and professional development – because when you shine, we shine. Therefore, we offer our employees attractive conditions so you can stay energized while you keep your eyes on creating a better future.


* Salary between €4.487 - €7.051 per month based on 40 hours.
* An annual 5% development and vitality budget, including a sports allowance.
* Access to Good Habitz development portal.
* Hybrid working – 2 days at home, 2 days in the office, and 1 day of your choice.
* Home working allowance of €32.50 per month.
* OV free travel subscription (24/7 throughout the Netherlands). With your OV free card, you can also travel privately.
* 27 days of leave + option to purchase 5 extra days per year.
* Working in the heart of Rotterdam, 3 minute walk from Rotterdam Central train station
* Focus on adventure, balance, and fun.

  

Working at Eneco eMobility means working in an organization that seizes opportunities – even those not readily available. What is certain today may be different tomorrow. You get the space to experiment. That's why you clearly love adventure and are willing to roll up your sleeves to 'get the job done'. And although you can work independently, you also know that true impact is made together.  

  

**Your skillset**

  

* You have a drive for continuous learning and self-improvement.
* You have an agile mindset with a focus on building the right things for the business and adopting new technologies.
* You are fluent in written and spoken English, and (willing to learn) Dutch
* You have, or willing to obtain, relevant certifications for Microsoft platforms (like PL600 for Power Platform and/or MB700 for F&O)

  

**You bring experience with (parts of) the following topics:**


* Translate Business requirements by architecting technical solutions using advanced Azure services and capabilities, exclusively utilizing Bicep for infrastructure as code.
* Mastery of Azure networking, security, and governance, including compliance and regulatory requirements.
* Ability to make strategic recommendations balancing cost, complexity, and business needs.
* Designing scalable and resilient solutions using Azure services such as Azure Container Apps, Azure Functions, Azure Cosmos DB, utilizing Bicep for infrastructure as code.
* Understanding Azure networking, security, and governance principles.
* Basic knowledge of CI/CD pipelines and Azure DevOps for automated build, test, and deployment processes.
* Familiarity with automation testing frameworks (e.g., Playwright, Cypress) and performance testing tools (e.g., Azure Load Testing, NBomber).
* Experience in designing and integrating Dynamics 365 CE and F&O APIs and third-party APIs (e.g., partner platforms ) for data exchange and system interoperability

  

Are you interested in joining our journey? Then please apply on this vacancy with your resume and motivation including a salary range indication. Also feel free to apply on this vacancy if you don't thick all the boxes, and can explain why you think the role would be a good fit.

title: Senior Backend Engineer, Telematics
description:
Amsterdam, Netherlands | Engineering | Full-time**Not your everyday company**


Lemonade completely reinvented how insurance works. As a customer-centric tech company, we created an insurance experience that is smart, instant, and delightful.


At Lemonade, you’ll be working with a group of like-minded makers, who get a kick out of moving fast and delivering great products. We surround ourselves with some of the smartest, most motivated, creative people who are filled with positive energy and good karma.


Unlike most publicly traded companies, we’re nimble and efficient. We take pride in the fact that we still think and operate like a startup. We don’t care much about titles and hierarchy and instead focus on innovation, bold moves, and challenging the status quo.


We’re built as a lean, data-driven organization that relies on a common understating of objectives and goals to provide teams with autonomy and ownership. We don’t like spending our days in meetings and we skip committees altogether. At Lemonade, there’s no such thing as going over someone’s head. We have zero tolerance for bureaucracy, office politics, and lean-back personalities.


As a Public Benefit Corporation and a certified B-Corp, we deliver environmental and social impact using our products and tech. Through our Giveback program, we partner with organizations such as the ACLU, New Story, The Humane Society, Malala Fund, American Red Cross, 360.org, charity: water, and dozens of others, and have donated millions towards reforestation, education, animal rights, LGBTQ+ causes, access to water, and more.

**Awarded ‘best workplace’**


Best Workplace and Best-Led Company by Inc. Magazine**“World Changing” by Fast Company**


Recognized as a World Changing Idea by Fast Company Magazine**Ranked #1 Home insurance in America**


Won best renters and homeowners insurance in America by US News, and others**Best Pet Insurance in America**


Rated “Best Overall Pet Insurance” by Better Homes & Gardens**Rated 4.9 on the App Store**


Among the highest rated apps of all time**What you’re applying for**


We’re looking for a senior-level backend engineer to join our Telematics team.


You’ll play a key role in extending and optimizing the telematics platform for Lemonade Car Insurance, helping design and build our data pipelines and services. You’ll help build telematics data from different sensors and sources available for various insurance applications, such as pricing, underwriting, fraud detection and crash analysis

**In this role you’ll:**
------------------------

* Have end-to-end ownership over our sensor-agnostic Car telematics platform, to ensure code quality, performance, and scalability of the product
* Design and extend our sensor-agnostic Car telematics pipelines for processing data from different sources (mobile phones, OBD dongles, connected cars)
* Collaborate with various teams within the organization to ensure optimal use of the data in critical areas such as pricing fairness, fraud prevention, and risk mitigation
* Integrate with various third-party data and fulfillment vendors to enable a delightful and streamlined experience for our customers
* Model and expose the telematics data for diverse applications, from real-time insights to data science and analytics
* Help build our products using microservices written in Typescript (using NestJS) running over Kubernetes
* Leverage our in-house autonomous tools to manage all development flow, from setting up our development environment to creating git branches and deploying services to production
* Coach and mentor other developers and help them elevate their skills

**What you’ll need**
--------------------

* 5+ years experience as a backend engineer
* BSc in Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
* Broad knowledge of modern backend frameworks, tools, and architecture
* Hands-on experience working with high-scale, production-grade asynchronous systems (Kafka / SQS etc.)
* Hands-on experience with AWS or other public cloud providers
* Experience with telematic or other streaming data systems is a major advantage, as are past contributions to open source projects
* Ability to work in an office environment a minimum of 3 days a week
* Enthusiasm about learning and adapting to the exciting world of AI – a commitment to exploring this field is a fundamental part of our culture
**Things to know…**


Lemonade is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusivity. We never discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. If you require reasonable accommodations due to religious beliefs, pregnancy, or disabilities, let us know at any time.

title: Anaplan Model Builder
description:
**Engineering*** **Rotterdam**
* **Senior**
* **HBO**
* **Engineering**
**Highlights**
--------------


Een bruto maandsalaris tussen € 4478,- en € 7142,- afhankelijk van inschaling & werkervaring* nemen aan het nieuwe werken
* Een toeslag van 10,5% van je bruto maandsalaris
  

#REF360S
**Do you want to work within the biggest Anaplan Center of Excellence within the Netherlands? This is the opportunity to be part of this team!**

**Jouw rol als Anaplan Model Builder**
--------------------------------------


*Do you want to work within the biggest Anaplan Center of Excellence within the Netherlands?*

**What will be your biggest impact in this position?**


As a model builder you have contact with the business to properly understand their requirements and use cases so that the model complies with their expectations and processes. And also to spot opportunities to improve their processes.


You are also up-to-date on Anaplan platform developments and think of applications where these developments can be applied at KPN.


With the team you’re working on models which are built in a consistent way so that other developers can pick up models built by other developers.

**What are you going to do?**


Within KPN financial, commercial and operational insights, together with a reliable forecast, are of great importance for the management of the company at group and segment level. We are currently modernizing this process with the implementation of our models on the Anaplan platform. For this transition and further (new) developments, we are looking for a model builder to strengthen our team.


Together with a team of model builders, you ensure that existing forecast and planning models of the business (mainly in Excel) are translated to Anaplan models and you contribute to improving these models, from a technical, process and way-of-working perspective. The models are on an operational, tactical, and strategical level. You will work closely together with the stakeholders and your other Finance Insights & Analytics (FIA) colleagues.


So, do you want to make impact with the team within KPN with (financial) forecasting?
**Dit is je team**
------------------


Within Finance Insights & Analytics you work together with approximately 40 developers, data scientists, data engineers, scrum masters and product owners spread over 5 scrum teams. Those 5 teams are, besides the forecasting team, the Finance analytics, Data, Oracle reporting and Managed dashboarding team.


The forecasting team consists of a product owner, scrum master and 6 model builders. The team is international, diverse and daily language is English. You will be part of a warm and professional team where hard working and fun is combined.


Our main office is in Rotterdam next to the iconic Erasmus bridge. We work hybrid with a minimum of 2 days a week at the office, Mondays in Rotterdam and Thursday in Amsterdam.You’re also able to work from other KPN offices and working from home is also supported.
**Wat breng**
**jij ons?**
--------------------------


For the position of model builder within Finance Insights & Analytics we ask from you:

* Bachelor or master level degree in a relevant field of study
* Experience with building (financial) forecasting models in Anaplan, or similar applications
* Knowledge of and affinity with financial processes in a corporate environment
* The ability to analyze (financial) processes and translate them into model features
* The ability to challenge your stakeholders and team members in looking for the best solutions
* You are able to explain your solution in layman's terms
* Knowledge of data models


**Wat krijg je**
**van ons?**
-----------------------------


Of course, as an employer, we also have a lot to offer you. Here’s what you can expect from us:

* A gross monthly salary ranging from a minimum of €4.478,- to a maximum of € 6.734,- based on a 37-hour work week, offcourse depending on your work experience,
* Flexible working hours up to 40 hours per week, potentially increasing your gross salary by up to 8.5%.
* A 10.5% allowance on your gross monthly salary (including 8% holiday pay).
* A variable bonus scheme of 7% corresponding to scale 11.
* Annual individual and collective salary increases in accordance with our CAO.
* Excellent career development and training opportunities, with a personal training budget of €1500. In fact, we expect you to keep developing yourself!
* A good work-life balance (e.g., 2 days at the office, 3 days at home, transition leave, holiday exchange for a holiday of your religious or cultural preference).
* A home work shop to optimize your home working environment, including a mobile phone and laptop.
* 50% discount on KPN products and services, such as KPN internet.
* A commuting allowance: such as our bicycle allowance of €0.40 per kilometer, or €0.23 per kilometer by car, or full reimbursement for 2nd class public transport. Additionally, you will receive a €10 monthly internet allowance and a home work allowance of €2.35 per day.
* Excellent pension conditions: a total contribution of 23% of your pensionable salary, with KPN contributing 16% and you contributing 7%.


Our belief in technology is strong. It becomes even more powerful when combined with human contact, which is why we look forward to meeting you!


Want to know more? Contact our recruiter Rutger Schröder via rutger.schroder@kpn.com.


At KPN, we have recruitment talent that works smartly together and thus wins. Therefore, acquisition in response to this vacancy is not appreciated.
**Wat gebeurt er**
**na je sollicitatie?**
------------------------------------------


**01**
**Telefonisch contact**
-----------------------


Onze recruiters leren je graag beter kennen en nemen daarom telefonisch contact met je op!
**02**
**Gesprekken**
--------------


Zijn we van beide kanten enthousiast? Dan plannen we een eerste, tweede en eventueel een derde gesprek en/of assesment in.
**03**
**Wij doen jou een aanbod**
---------------------------


Als alle gesprekken goed zijn gegaan, doen we je een aanbod. Een screening kan onderdeel zijn van dit proces.
**04**
**Welkom in het team**
----------------------


Als je blij bent met het aanbod en je het contract hebt getekend, begint jouw onboarding. Welkom bij KPN!
**Zie je een groene toekomst al voor je? Reageer!**
---------------------------------------------------


Firstname


Lastname

CV uploaden

I accept the terms & conditions: SmartRecruiters, KPN.


Verstuur sollicitatie


**Kan ik je ergens mee helpen?**
--------------------------------


### **Sabina Bharati**

title: Sr. IT Infrastructure Engineer
description:
**What We Do****Managing cyber risk, together.**
Forescout delivers automated cybersecurity across the digital terrain. We empower our customers to achieve continuous alignment of their security frameworks with their digital realities, across all asset types – IT, IoT, OT, and IoMT. It is a non-stop journey, managing cyber risk through automation and data-powered insights.
**Job Summary:**
We are currently seeking an experienced and highly skilled Sr. IT Infrastructure Engineer to join our team and play a crucial role in managing our global IT infrastructure.
As a Sr. IT Infrastructure Engineer, you will be responsible for building, automating, and maintaining a scalable and highly available infrastructure. You will work closely with engineering teams to develop, deploy, and maintain our network and technology stack. This role requires a strategic thinker with excellent communication skills, a strong service ethic, and a passion for technology. You will lead projects focused on designing, implementing, and maintaining our global IT Infrastructure.
**Key Responsibilities:*** **Infrastructure Management:**
+ Maintain and support the corporate IT infrastructure across all sites and regions.
+ Ensure system environments are maintained in line with corporate security policies.
+ Manage and monitor the virtual infrastructure, including VMware, virtual servers, and storage systems.
+ Schedule and deploy system and network installations, updates, and upgrades globally.

* **Performance Monitoring and Troubleshooting:**
+ Monitor network performance and automate monitoring functions to prevent outages.
+ Troubleshoot and resolve network and system problems, providing Level 2/3 support as needed.
+ Utilize network diagnostic and analytics tools to identify and address issues.

* **Collaboration and Communication:**
+ Work closely with engineering teams to report issues, lead project deliverables, and provide status updates.
+ Partner with local DevOps teams to ensure seamless integration and support of IT infrastructure.
+ Adhere to corporate configuration and change management policies to ensure successful changes to the network infrastructure.


We encourage you to apply if you meet most but not all the desired skills and experience listed in this job posting. We value competencies, aptitude, and a great attitude as supplement to experience.**Qualifications:*** Minimum of 7 years’ experience in systems
* At least 5 years’ experience in server administration and configuration.
* Hands-on experience with VMware infrastructure and Linux systems admin required.
* Experience with Ansible automation.
* Experience with enterprise backup and storage solutions is advantageous.
* Proficiency with monitoring, network diagnostic, and analytics tools is a plus.
* Experience managing hybrid environments (cloud/on-premises) is an advantage.
* Proven experience deploying and supporting effective patch management solutions.
* Willingness to perform after-hours and weekend work when necessary.

**Skills and Attributes:*** Excellent problem-solving skills with a strong customer service attitude.
* Fast learner, proactive, and able to work independently as well as part of a team.
* Organized, responsible, and able to manage multiple priorities effectively.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, capable of influencing and driving results.

#LI-AO1

title: Team Lead Data Science
description:
**Team Lead Data Science**
As Team Lead Data Science you will work with your team on predicting conversion probabilities for a million households. You will lead the development and implementation of advanced analytics solutions together with your team. And every day at work, you’ll be doing your part for all the charities we support.  

  

Maurits van den Brand, Data Scientist*: “Every day we aim to identify, discover & implement (new) possibilities, based on data intelligence, in order to keep on raising ever more funds for social organisations and causes across the world.”*  

**As Team Lead Data Science, you’ll:**


* Stay up to date with industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in data science and MLOps, and identify opportunities to apply new techniques or technologies to the team’s work.
* Lead and manage a team of 8 data scientists by providing mentorship, guidance, and professional development opportunities.
* Foster a culture of continuous learning, collaboration, knowledge sharing, and innovation within the team.
* Work with other leaders, program managers, engineers, and business stakeholders to turn strategy into value.
* Evaluate potential new talent.
  
**You’d describe yourself as follows:**
* You hold a Master degree in econometrics, computer science, AI or similar with demonstrable work experience Data Science (7+ years) and guiding team members (2+ years).
* A proactive, strategic and creative mindset with strong communication and collaboration skills.
* A critical thinker who always looks for areas of improvement
* Knowledge of statistics and mathematics
* Strong programming skills in Python
  
  

**About us:**
The Postcode Lottery Group is a marketing-driven international non-profit organisation. We operate lotteries to raise funds for a fairer, greener and healthier world. Our players win with their neighbours and generate money for charities together – it’s a win-win!
We’ve raised more than €13.5 billion for thousands of good causes since 1989. We’re the third-largest private charitable donor in the world. Working alongside 1,438 fellow team members in Great Britain, the Netherlands, Sweden, Germany and Norway, you’ll be helping to build a better world every day!  

**About the team:**
The Postcode Lottery Group is building an International Analytics hub to provide our lotteries with the right models, tools, tech, and best-practices to help realize our growth ambition. In this hub you will be working together with business representatives to identify value adding business cases for advanced statistical analytics. You will be working on exciting and challenging BI, data & AI projects that create real impact for the lotteries and our beneficiary organizations.  

**This will make you happy:**
* A monthly salary, a variable year-end bonus and an excellent pension scheme, 28 days’ holiday a year based on a 40-hour week and flexible working hours.
* We believe it’s important that you’re able to keep developing professionally and personally, so we support ongoing training. The Lottery Academy offers a wide range of courses. And there are plenty of opportunities to grow within the organisation.
* You’ll work in our sustainable building within walking distance of Amsterdam Zuid station and you'll get an NS Business Card, which lets you travel for free all over the Netherlands, even outside working hours!
* We like to celebrate our successes with our colleagues and charity partners at well-attended monthly drinks and parties.
* We know exercising and relaxing are good for you. So we offer free boot camp, Pilates and kickboxing classes, and an employee running group that trains for events together. And you’ll enjoy free entry to more than 150 museums, plus theatre and cinema discounts.
* You’ll receive your full salary (100%) during childbirth and parental leave.
* To help you get involved in our charity partners’ work, we offer project visits and talks in our on-site auditorium. You can also volunteer three days a year during working hours, potentially with colleagues.
  
  

**Join us**
We believe an inclusive organisation is the ideal breeding ground for creativity, collaboration and innovation. Employee solidarity is important to us, too. Each of us has a part to play in that – we are the organisation, after all. We strive to make everyone feel at home. That means keeping an open mind and paying attention to each other’s welfare.
Can you see yourself as part of the team? We encourage you to apply – whatever your roots, religion, age, ability to work or life philosophy.
Please send your CV and cover letter to our Recruitment Business Partner (a.i.) Olaf van Gelderen through our recruitment website (werkendoejebij.nl). If you would like more information, please contact Olaf directly on +31 (0)6 19195090.
Please note that acquisition is not appreciated and that we can only consider candidates with a valid working permit for the Netherlands.

title: Senior Python Engineer tribe Credit Analytics
description:
**You will help design, build, and enhance Rabobank's industry-leading models for all loan portfolios. These models are used directly in the loan sales process and regulatory reporting. You will also collaborate closely with teams to translate the architectural vision for the credit risk area into technical solutions in a cloud-based environment. We'd love to hear from you if this sounds like the job!**

**You and your job**


We are looking for senior software engineers for the agile DevOps teams within the department of Credit Analytics. More specifically we are looking for someone who can work independently, who will lead by example and can mentor more junior engineers in and outside the team. You are part of the backbone of the team and a strong support for the solution architect.

**Facts & Figures**

* 36- or 40-hours per week
* 43,822 Rabobank colleagues worldwide

**Top Responsibilities**

You wil be

* helping us to design and build a strong, secure cloud environment in Azure. It's important for you to be familiar with cloud concepts and the development standards necessary to effectively utilize the cloud.
* responsible for designing and developing robust and maintainable systems that allow Rabobank to calculate its credit risk.
* solve problems presented by the cloud, like security, resilience, and scaling
* make sure that you are and remain abreast of the latest market and technological developments and incorporate these in the execution of your development work
* focus on quality practices such as TDD and will guide people in applying this practice

**Together we achieve more than alone**  

We believe in the power of difference. Bringing together people's differences is what makes us an even better bank. So, we are very curious about what you can bring to our team. Working together is the way we work; as 1 passionate, results-driven, and analytical team at Rabobank.


Talking of Rabobank: We are a Dutch bank that operates in 38 countries for over 9,500,000 customers. Together with these customers, our members, and partners we stand side by side to create a world in which everyone has access to enough healthy food. In the Netherlands we work to create a country in which people are happy with how they live, work, and do business.


**You and your talent**  

Within Credit Analytics we value integrity, customer focus, an ‘improvement and embracing change’ mind-set and openness. Customer focus, agile knowledge, collaboration skills are clearly essential for the role of Software Engineer. In addition, it is important that you recognize everything in the checklist below:


In Addition:

* You have completed your Bachelor or Master education
* You have at least 3 years of relevant work experience as Python Engineer
* You are an expert in Python, and you know how to use C#
* It is important that you have experience with:
	+ Azure (release) pipelines
	+ Azure cloud concepts like AKS, ADLS, ACR, ADF, Docker, ARM, azcli
	+ Docker, YAML
	+ Understand and apply basic coding principles like DRY, SOLID, inheritance and clean code
	+ Git
	+ SPECFLOW
	+ TDD
	+ Flexible and constructively critical attitude, strong analytic mind-set, result oriented,
	+ Experience in agile environment, experience with DevOps, SCRUM and LEAN
	+ Affinity and experience (nice to have) with model development
* You can explain features at beginner and advanced level and discuss them with your peers
* You can work with team members (not just developers!) in delivering a better product
* You steer on improving with Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery
* You are comfortable in discussing technical improvements with product owners and ensuring they end up in the sprints
* You have experience setting up test cases for features under development (TDD)

**To be considered for this position, you must be located in the Netherlands or elsewhere in the EU and have the legal right to work in the Netherlands. We are unable to consider candidates requiring relocation from another country.**

**This is what we offer you**

* a gross monthly salary between € 4.292,- and € 6.130,- (scale 9, 36 hours per week).
* 13th month and holiday pay: the holiday allowance and annual allowance will usually be paid out in 12 equal monthly instalments. Employees have the option once a year to opt for the holiday allowance to be paid out in May and the annual allowance in December.
* an Employee Benefit Budget (11% of your monthly salary). You decide how to spend this budget. This may include purchasing extra leave days, making extra pension contributions, or even receiving a monthly cash pay-out.
* an annual personal development/training budget of € 1.400,-
* 100% reimbursement of commuting costs if you travel by public transport! Do you still prefer to travel by car or motorbike? Then choose a commuting allowance.
* a monthly € 40,- net work from home allowance, based on working from home 5 days per week.
* a monthly € 40,- net internet allowance.
* Attractive pension fund with a personal contribution of only 5.5%. Rabobank will contribute 21.5%.

**You and the job application process**

* Any questions about working at Rabobank and the process? Dino Džanković, Senior IT Recruiter via dino.dzankovic@rabobank.nl.
* You can find answers to the most frequently asked questions on https://rabobank.jobs/en/faq/
* A background check is part of the process.


Everyone is different, and it is exactly those differences that help us become an even better bank. That's why we want to know who you really are!

title: Senior Data Engineer Azure
description:
As a data engineer leveraging your passion for data by supporting Rabobank’s data driven ambitions to fruition. Supporting all business initiatives with a need for data (structured and unstructured, high volume and/or streaming). Rabobank is implementing an Enterprise Data Lake platform in the cloud. And you can be a valuable part of it!


Working together is the way we achieve the best results. Our agile squads, within Tribe Data & Analytics, join forces to support the entire organization with data and machine learning solutions. We bring talented minds together to host our complex data systems on Azure, build information factories and to deploy data science solutions to cloud.

**Growing a better world together**


You'll already be aware that Rabobank is a financial services provider for 7.1 million customers in 40 countries. But did you know that we aim to contribute to real change with our 'Growing a better world together' mission? We do so in countless ways, such as:


Together with the World Wildlife Fund, we’re helping to create a harmonious balance between nature and the agricultural sector in Brazil.


We want to share our knowledge about sustainable financial solutions. For example, we offer a discount to corporate clients with a sustainable hallmark.

**Your role**


You get excited by building and deploying big data pipelines in the cloud. In the Squad you work on Azure, where you use cloud native components and value the separation between storage and computing. Data frames are not a new concept to you and you write code in either PySpark or use Azure Data Flow for your ETL needs. Your deployments are automated and you are able to quickly prototype your solutions.

**Your experience and competencies**


You have a couple of years of experience in using the concepts/components in a production environment:

* Azure Data Factory
* Azure Databricks
* Python
* Data modelling and SQL
* Airflow
* Azure Synapse
* API Development on Azure (preferably with python)
* Scripting either PowerShell or bash
* Preliminary knowledge of Java/Scala
* Azure Data Lake Storage
* Azure Functions
* Build and deploy with Azure DevOps (CICD)
* Set up data quality and monitoring
* Develop unit tests (TDD)

**The competences we would like you to have:**

* Eager to learn new techniques
* Enjoy to teach and share knowledge
* Good communication skills
* Strong collaboration with other roles in the Scrum team
* Drive to continuously improve
* Take ownership of the build, run and change process

**To be considered for this position, you must be located in the Netherlands or elsewhere in the EU and have the legal right to work in the Netherlands. We are unable to consider candidates requiring relocation from another country.**

**What we offer you**


A challenging environment for talent in Data. The environment is dynamic, and we are working with new and old technologies. We encourage personal growth and there is room to learn from others. We value hard work, but also to have a lot of fun with each other.

* a gross monthly salary is scaled in function group 8-9; Between € 3.711,55 and € 6.130,64
* a thirteenth month and holiday pay;
* an Employee Benefit Budget (10% or 11% of your monthly salary); you decide how to spend this budget. This may include purchasing extra leave days, making extra pension contributions or even receiving extra cash on a monthly basis;

**You and the job application process.**

* Any questions about working at Rabobank and the process? You can ask our IT Recruiter Raphael.Drenthel@rabobank.nl
* We will hold the interviews through a video call.
* You can find answers to the most frequently asked questions on https://rabobank.jobs/en/faq/ .
* A security check is part of the process.
* We respect your privacy.

title: Product Owner - Data Products CDS
description:
Product Owner - Data Products CDS**At a glance**
  

  

Are you passionate about setting up Data Products within the new Customer Data Domain, part of Customer Data Solutions? Do you want to play a pivotal role in implementing ABN Amro's data strategy? Data is one of our bank's most valuable assets. As we rapidly transition to a digital environment, we're generating a vast amount of relevant data. We're seeking colleagues who are eager to contribute to data solutioning, design, modeling, and value creation. If you are a team player who thrives in an innovative environment and loves to help deliver a trustworthy data ecosystem that adds value, and if you embody a scrum/agile mindset with relevant (direct or indirect) experience in Product Ownership, please apply!
  

  

**Your job**
  

  

As a Data Product Owner in the Customer Data Products team, you'll be instrumental in creating all data products within the CDS Data Office. We transform golden data sources into ready-to-use data products for the rest of the organization. You facilitate a smooth transition from business requirements to user stories.
  

  

You will lead one or more agile teams focused on the continuous development of data-related products, services, and processes. You make informed decisions and ensure clear prioritization to achieve the Data Product team's objectives. The team includes data modelers, business developers and data engineers.
  

  

You will collaborate closely with other (Data) Product Owners and the consumers of your data products. You will report directly to the Lead Data Product Owner and work together to develop a robust future vision to mature our data management capabilities.
  

  

Strong communication skills are essential. You will play a crucial role in enforcing and monitoring a single version of the truth, ensuring all data transformations are performed within the data product teams.
  

  

**Working environment**
  

  

Customer Data Solutions (CDS) is a newly formed department within the COO organisation, we are end-to-end responsible for generic customer processes and all customer and relationship data (Customer and Party data). This data is made available to all authorized internal stakeholders and external parties via data products. The CDS data office consists of four teams: BI & Data Analytics, Customer & Party Data Products (this role), Data Enablement, and the Customer & Party Golden Data Team.
  

  

**The Team: Customer & Party Data Products**
  

  

We are a new and evolving team. We are responsible for delivering Data Products. We create the actual products, solve complex data issues related to Customer Data, and act as advisors.
  

  

**Culture**
  

  

"You can rely on us!" CDS provides the foundation for many processes within the bank, so it's critical that we demonstrate reliability to our stakeholders. We achieve this in an inclusive work environment where everyone feels welcomed.
  

  

**Your profile**  

  

  

* You have an HBO/WO Bachelor's or Master's degree.
* At least 3 years of relevant work experience in the field of change management.
* Strong knowledge of scrum/agile methodologies and can guide the team towards execution.
* Proven people leadership skills.
* Ability to assess stakeholder needs in terms of value and priority and translate them into functional requirements.
* Social, collaborative, curious, and innovative.
* Decisive and demonstrate ownership.

  

**We are offering**
  

  

* The gross monthly salary shown at the top of the page is based on a 36-hour working week, including holiday pay and benefit budget.
* The benefit budget is 11% of your salary. If you do not make any purchases or reservations in the Benefit Shop in a month, you will be paid one-twelfth of your benefit budget for that month.
* Five weeks' holiday per year. You have the option to purchase four additional weeks per year.
* Personal Development Budget of € 1,000 per year. You can save this amount up to €3,000.
* Possibility to work from home (in consultation with your team and depending on your position).
* An annual public transport subscription with free public transport throughout the Netherlands
* An excellent pension scheme.

  

**Interested?**
  

  

Are you interested? Respond online to this vacancy now! For more information, please contact Liesanne Ploeg (Hiring manager)
  

  

**Equal opportunities for all**
  

  

The success of our organisation depends on the quality of our people and the ideas that they have. Truly surprising insights and innovative solutions for our clients result from an interplay of cultures, knowledge and experience. Diversity is therefore extremely important to our organisation. To ensure that everyone at ABN AMRO can develop their talents, we encourage an inclusive culture in which all colleagues feel engaged and appreciated.
  

  

**Disclaimer external recruitment agencies**
  

  

External recruitment agencies need to have a signed agreement with ABN AMRO BANK N.V., executed by a Talent Acquisition Specialist, when submitting a resume to a vacancy. No unsolicited services or offers, please.
  

  

Lees meer
  

  

**Wie zijn je collega's?**
  

  

"Het mooiste aan m'n werk? Dat ik elke dag met zeer diverse, ambitieuze mensen moeilijke strategievraagstukken mag oplossen."
  

Lees het verhaal
  

  

**Carlin Verweijen**
  

Strategy Consultant
  

  

"Mijn werk raakt steeds meer mensen binnen ABN AMRO. De beslissingen die ik neem, doen er dus écht toe."
  

Lees het verhaal
  

  

**Max Philipsen**
  

Data Analist
  

  

"Er is met data nu véél meer mogelijk dan een paar jaar geleden. Daar ligt de uitdaging voor mij."
  

Lees het verhaal
  

  

**Joep Timmermans**
  

Junior Accounting Data Analist
