title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
description:
Senior Machine Learning Engineer**At a glance**
  

  

Are you a technical expert and enthusiastic person who inspires others to create innovative solutions? Then we need your help in making ABN AMRO a personal bank in a digital age!
  

  

How are you going to shape innovation, advancements and projects within your department? Our employees get the freedom to grow and experiment. You support and guide them, so they can become the technical and data savvy experts that contribute to a future-proof bank. When and where you and your team do you work, that is up to you! We work hybrid, which means you and your team can flexibly decide where and when you can work most comfortable and effectively.
  

  

All-in-all, working at ABN AMRO Dialogue Orchestration Grid means that you contribute to projects that matter and impact millions of customers!
  

  

**What does Grid Dialogue Orchestration do?**
  

With our knowledge, skills, and ambition we lead the reinvention of customer interaction and effortless digital processes, whether it be personal, private or business clients. To do this, we orchestrate and enable all digital interactions and experiences for our customers. We leverage data and analytics to deliver pro-active experiences tailored to our customers' needs. Only when we correctly, seamlessly, and effortlessly match our solutions to customers and their intents, can we truly help all our customers first-time right. As a new department (Grid) within ABN AMRO, we are keen to scale up our efforts rapidly to become the personal bank our customers deserve.
  

  

Are you up for the challenge?
  

  

**Your job**
  

  

**Job description**  

  

As an integral part of our Machine Learning Engineering block team, you will be working with other MLEs to enable MLOps capabilities on our central ML platform based on user needs (Data Domains) and create clear guidelines and processes around the subject. You will also work closely with cross-functional teams, including data-scientists, data-engineers and business stakeholders, to ensure the stability, reliability, and security of our platform and models.
  

  

**Working environment**
  

  

You will be part of the Dialogue Orchestration department, which is at the heart of the innovation and growth strategy of our Personal & Business Banking business line.
  

  

The team you are going to be part of, is a multidisciplinary group of ambitious colleagues working with an Agile mindset and with a focus on building and enabling hyper-personalisation use-cases for the bank. In this team we work hard, learn a lot by challenging ourselves every day, while embracing humour for a good atmosphere. Openness, transparency, quality and ownership are key values.
  

  

**Your profile**
  

  

You feel at home in a technical and data savvy environment and find challenge in keeping up to date with the latest technologies. You are a team player and at the same time can progress your work independently. You get enthusiastic from a creative and dynamic working environment.
  

  

Do you think you're a fit? Check your profile:
  

  

**Job function / General Responsibilities**  

  

* Educating yourself and others with the right technical capabilities and the latest innovations
* Mentoring your MLE colleagues on technical craftmanship
* Develop and productionise use cases with Data Scientists, automating tasks where possible i.e. via CI/CD templates, standardized frameworks
* Apply MLOps principles and mentality, e.g. to streamline deployment and post-deployment steps of use cases to central platforms, and iteratively improve the entire model management life cycle as a whole
* Participate in the ideation and design of ML platform with platform engineers
* Create guidelines and mature processes for Data Science teams to use MLOps capabilities
* Experiment and implement new ML capabilities
* Create a collaborative atmosphere in the MLE community of practice

  

**What we are looking for:**  

* 3+ years of experience in building machine learning based solutions, applicants are expected to have some practical experience;
* You are pragmatic and value-focused, e.g. not afraid to work with existing solutions to reduce time-to-market;
* Programming, Python and SQL. Producing high quality Python code.;
* Software engineering, adept in software and ML lifecycle, modern engineering practices;
* You are familiar with the 'tools of the trade', e.g. scripting tools (e.g. bash, unix), Mlflow, Apache Airflow, Git, Docker, Kanban boards etc.;
* Experience with Cloud services and tooling, preferably Microsoft Azure; and ML platforms such as Databricks and Azure machine learning services;

  

**We are offering**  

  

  

* Excellent salary (above is based on 36-hour work week)
* 25 vacation days based on 40 hours (with an optional 14 days extra)
* Personal development budget of € 1,000.00 per year (next to training to keep your knowledge and certifications up to date)
* Benefit budget of 11% (of your salary). You can decide how you want this to be paid out. For example, as extra holiday allowances, a lease bike, or as salary
* Banking for better days. These are days you can work on your personal development or contribute to society
* Good set of facilities for remote working. Good to know, we have adopted a hybrid model of working with 2-5 office days
* Solid pension plan that will set you up for the future

  

**Interested?**
  

  

Are you interested? Then respond to this vacancy. For more information, you can contact **Richard Jansen** at richard.jansen@nl.abnamro.com
  

  

We would like to get to know you!
  

  

**Equal opportunities for all**
  

  

The success of our organisation depends on the quality of our people and the ideas that they have. Truly surprising insights and innovative solutions for our clients result from an interplay of cultures, knowledge and experience. Diversity is therefore extremely important to our organisation. To ensure that everyone at ABN AMRO can develop their talents, we encourage an inclusive culture in which all colleagues feel engaged and appreciated.
  

  

**Disclaimer external recruitment agencies**
  

  

External recruitment agencies must have signed an agreement with ABN AMRO BANK N.V., issued by a Talent Acquisition Specialist, in order to submit CVs. Acquisition is therefore not appreciated.
  

  

Lees meer
  

  

**Wie zijn je collega's?**
  

  

"Er zijn altijd nieuwe systemen en technieken die wij kunnen inzetten bij ons werk. We zijn telkens aan het innoveren, daardoor blijf ik mezelf uitdagen."

Software-ontwikkelaar

IT-engineer (QRM-expert)

title: Senior Scientist
description:
**Scientist/Senior Scientist Organic Chemistry (PhD)****Oss (The Netherlands)****Fulltime**
Synaffix is a biotech company with a clinical-stage platform technology that enables best-in-class antibody-drug conjugates (ADCs), bispecific antibodies and other targeted therapeutics under a technology out-licensing business model. Synaffix was fully acquired by Lonza in June 2023. Aimed at enabling innovative medicines for patients in areas of high unmet medical need, Synaffix has forged a growing number of collaborations with top tier biotech and pharma companies by enabling best-in-class therapeutic candidates for their pipelines.
Prime objective of the R&D group at Synaffix (Lonza Oss) is to provide best-in-class targeted delivery technologies, *i.e.* development of protein conjugation technologies, linkers and payloads. General focus is on cytotoxic ADCs, however other modalities are also being pursued, such as immuno-oncology, targeted gene therapy, neuromuscular disease. A junior/senior scientist will play a key role in realizing and/or giving direction to Synaffix’ R&D agenda. Depending on the candidate's experience, this position may be designated as either a Scientist or Senior Scientist role"
Job description* Possesses expert knowledge of synthetic organic chemistry and/or medicinal chemistry
* Designs and executes complex multi-step total synthesis routes and incorporates state-of-the-art procedures
* Supervises, educates and inspires direct reports
* Performs project management diligently and reshapes where necessary
* Acts as an inspirational team leader and teacher to direct reports
* Generates scientific data within a project through performing experiments, leveraging CRO’s, and managing research associates
* Processes relevant literature to gain scientific project expertise, trouble shoot and to identify new opportunities
* Provides scientific/intellectual input to the company’s research agenda
* Acts as a sounding board for management
* Understands and explains the corporate strategy to peers and/or team
* Sets and delivers on individual and team objectives that support the company strategy
* Communicates professionally in English both verbally and in writing

title: Data scientist with a passion for technology
description:
Are you just as passionate about technology as you are about helping your colleagues grow? Do you have hands-on experience with more programming languages than you can count? Are you keen to make both our code & our team better? Then this may be the role for you.

 **EyeOn**


EyeOn is a focused forecasting and planning consultancy with a global mission: getting business years ahead. What characterizes us is our expertise in planning processes, strength in project management and organizational flexibility. We realize concrete improvements in defined planning processes to establish more efficient processes and achieve better results.

  

EyeOn data science implements quick-wins to industry-leading advanced data science projects: we work a the pace according to our customer's reality. We are experienced in data handling, modelling, visualisation, and digital transformation. We’re not just expert in leading tech and data science but offer dedicated apps to unleash our customer's data destiny. EyeOn solves data science challenges in Honeycomb, our data science platform built on Dataiku technology. To enable our industry-leading forecasting and inventory management approaches, we developed our own proprietary plugins. Honeycomb simplifies collaboration and enables us to run data science projects quickly, effectively, and at the highest quality.

  

This is a hybrid role where Eindhoven would by your office location. EyeOn is working globally for leading multinational orgnizations. Our offices are in Eindhoven, Antwerp, Geneva and Zürich, Düsseldorf, Dublin and New York.

 **Your role**


You are the go-to person for anything technical – whether it’s Python, AWS, Linux or even HTML. You play your part in challenging projects with our global customers. You keep the product development wheels turning, whether it’s for the work we’re doing today or in our product development for next year’s customer-facing applications. Sometimes you may need to do some firefighting, but generally we prefer fire prevention.


You work in a small and diverse team. Together, we ensure our customer projects run smoothly even if transactional data is 100’s of millions of lines, we provide all EyeOn colleagues a great platform to make their daily (work) lives better, and we give our customers cloud applications with tangible business value.


You effectively combine hands-on technical work, coaching colleagues, and customer projects in a variety of roles.

 **Profile**


The ideal candidate profile would look like:

* Master’s degree in engineering, computer science, econometrics and/or equivalent work experience
* Strong (academic) experience in programming
* Strong affinity with technology, data and IT. Knowledge of and development experience in both back-end and front-end technologies.
* Relevant technologies for the role: Python (pandas, numpy, fastapi), Spark, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, HTMX, Vue.js, AWS, SQL, etc. You have deep experience with some of these. You’ve at least heard of the others (and if not, you’ve just now googled them).
* Strong problem identification and problem-solving skills. Ability to articulate this in internal and external communication.
* Affinity with or experience in our domains: supply chain, forecasting, demand planning, supply planning.
* Strong organization skills and high attention to detail.
* Fluent in English

 **Questions?**

Bart Geerts is available for all your questions via bart.geerts@eyeon.nl or via 06-83340107

title: Postdocs, ERC Advanced Grant Project FLEX (m/v/x)
description:
Centrum Wiskunde & Informatica (CWI) has vacancies in the Machine Learning research group for two enthusiastic talented


**Postdocs (m/v/x)**


within Peter Grünwald’s ERC Advanced Grant Project FLEX (FLEXible Statistical Inference).


**Job description**
-------------------


Most statistical methods require that all aspects of data collection and inference are determined in advance, independently of the data. These include when to stop collecting data, what decisions can be made (i.e. accept/reject null hypothesis), and how to measure their quality (e.g. loss function/significance level). This is *wildly* at odds with the flexibility required in practice! It is a leading cause of the *replicability crisis* in the applied sciences.


The project aims to develop novel theory and methods of statistics in which all data-collection and decision-aspects may be unknown in advance, possibly imposed post-hoc. Yet the new theory will provide valid small-sample error control and uncertainty quantification. The theory will be based on far-reaching extensions of *e-values*, *e-processes*, and the *e*-*posterior*, flexible alternatives for p-values and Bayes factors that have been developed over the last five years. Other key topics include *anytime-valid confidence sequences, concentration inequalities, martingales* and *the foundations of statistics* (likelihood principle, complete class theorems).


The vacancies are for two three-year postdocs to do research within the FLEX project.


**Requirements**
----------------


Candidates are required to have completed their PhD in mathematics or computer science, with a strong background in mathematical statistics and/or information theory. It is highly desirable that they have previously worked on at least one of the aforementioned key topics.


Needed qualifications for candidates include proven research talent, strong theoretical background, and good academic writing and presentation skills. Candidates are expected to have an excellent command of English.


**Terms and conditions**
------------------------


The terms of employment are in accordance with the Dutch Collective Labour Agreement for Research Centres ("CAO-onderzoeksinstellingen"). The gross monthly salary for an employee on a full time basis, depending on relevant work experience, ranges from € 4.374 to € 5.331.


The appointment will be for a period of three years.


Employees are also entitled to a holiday allowance of 8% of the gross annual salary and a year-end bonus of 8.33%. CWI offers attractive working conditions, including flexible scheduling.


Please visit our websites for more information about our terms of employment:  

https://www.cwi.nl/jobs/terms-of-employment and  

https://www.nwo-i.nl/en/working-at-nwo-i/jobsatnwoi/


**Information and application**
-------------------------------


All applications should include a detailed resume, motivation letter, and contact details of (at least) three references.


The deadline for the first application round is November 1st 2024. To apply, use the application button at the end of the job text. Applications will be considered in rounds until the positions are filled.


For more information about the vacancy, please contact Prof.dr. Peter Grünwald, email pdg@cwi.nl. For more information about CWI, please visit www.cwi.nl or watch our video about working at CWI.


**Diversity code**
------------------


CWI encourages a diverse workforce: we endeavour to develop talent and creativity by bringing people from different backgrounds and cultures together. We recruit and select based on capabilities and talent. We strongly encourage everyone with the appropriate qualifications to apply for the vacancy, regardless of age, gender, origin, sexual orientation or physical abilities.


**About CWI**
-------------


Centrum Wiskunde & Informatica (CWI) is the Dutch national research institute for mathematics and computer science and is part of the Institutes Organisation of the Dutch Research Council (NWO). The mission of CWI is to conduct pioneering research in mathematics and computer science, generating new knowledge in these fields and conveying it to trade, industry, and society at large.


CWI is an internationally oriented institute, with 160 scientists from approximately 27 countries, an informal atmosphere and short lines of communication. We have an activity committee that organizes after-work activities and an informal women’s network.


CWI is located at Science Park Amsterdam, the home of AMS-IX, that is presently developing into a major location of research in the physical sciences in The Netherlands, housing the sciences of the University of Amsterdam as well as several other national research institutes next to CWI.


**About Research group**
------------------------


To find more information about the CWI Machine Learning group, please visit the group page.

title: Product Owner - Software Scientist
description:
**Work Schedule**


Standard (Mon-Fri)**Environmental Conditions**


Office**Job Description**


Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. is the world leader in serving science, with annual revenue exceeding $40 billion. Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Whether our customers are accelerating life sciences research, solving sophisticated analytical challenges, improving patient diagnostics and therapies or growing efficiency in their laboratories, we are here to support them. Our distributed team of more than 100,000 colleagues delivers an outstanding combination of innovative technologies, purchasing convenience and pharmaceutical services through our industry-leading brands, including Thermo Scientific, Applied Biosystems, Invitrogen, Fisher Scientific, Unity Lab Services and Patheon.

**The Position**
----------------


The Product Owner has a self-propelling role, working as a member of a software development team within the R&D organization, to build a product vision and roadmap that increases value for our customers.


The team works in an agile environment where the SAFe and Scrum frameworks are applied. Together with your team members, you are responsible for the software that control the optical component of our Transmission Electron Microscope (TEM) products, enabling pioneering technics to explore material up to the atomic level.

**Key responsibilities** **include:**
-------------------------------------

* Translate the company’s customer value propositions into meaningful, industry-leading software (sub)products, that delight our customers.
* Drive the innovative development of new products through the design, verification, and validation stages.
* Collect feedback about specific needs by communicating with collaborators on a regular basis and using this information to improve the products.
* Make the product backlog visible and clear.
* Handle incoming bug reports and change requests for the product. Handle customer concerns and blocking issues.
* Drive customer satisfaction by optimizing product performance, improving reliability and stability, continuously balancing the introduction of new features with the implementation of functional and non-functional improvements.
* Support product development budgeting, process improvement and quality assurance on a central component of our product.
* Agree with resource managers on efficient staffing of the development team.

**Requirements:**
-----------------


The ideal candidate for this position enjoys working in a multi-disciplinary technical environment to address sophisticated problems. If you enjoy the development of high-performance integrated systems, this is an excellent opportunity.

* Typically requires at least 3+ years in a software product owner role.
* Typically requires MSc, PDEng or PhD in Physics, or equivalent
* 5+ years of applicable experience in a multidisciplinary high-tech development environment.
* Ability to handle diverse objectives and problems where analysis of situation or data requires an evaluation of identifiable factors.
* Team spirit and excellent interpersonal communicational skills.
* Strong analytical view combined with pragmatic mentality.
* You dare to take initiative, you are curious and fast learning.

**We offer:**
-------------


Opportunity to become a part of successful international company specialized in High-Tech industry.


Possibility to grow in personal skills and professional language.

**We provide trainings and support your development!**
------------------------------------------------------


Our team is working in a modern work environment, and we offer flexibility in terms of working hours.


Still not sure? Come and take a look!
company_description: At Thermo Fisher Scientific, our professionals develop critical solutions—and build rewarding careers.

title: Data Steward
description:
Are you ready to play a crucial role in ensuring data quality within our international network? As a Data Steward at Cross Border Solutions, you'll be responsible for maintaining reliable and consistent data, enabling seamless operations across borders. Join us in shaping the future of international logistics at PostNL.  

  

**Uitdagingen**  


As a Data Steward at Cross Border Solutions, you are responsible for managing and optimizing data crucial to our international logistics operations. You will closely collaborate with various teams to ensure data entry, storage, and usage meet the highest standards. Your role includes establishing and implementing data policies, identifying data quality issues, and developing solutions to address these issues systematically. You play a critical role in ensuring data consistency across different systems and markets. This will make you into a highly visible and valuable asset.

  

**Je verantwoordelijkheden**  

**Visible work**: You ensure our data is always up-to-date and accurate, which is vital for delivering our international logistics services.  

**Challenge**: Work in PostNL's international environment where you harmonize and optimize data from various sources, national and international.  

**Good atmosphere**: Collaborate with a diverse and dedicated team striving for excellence in a fast-paced industry
  

**Freedom**: you'll work from home and at a flex spot in our bustling, state-of-the-art office in the historic Stationspostgebouw (next to Holland Spoor station).  

**Responsibility**: you’ll have a big say in your work and working hours.  

**Development opportunities**: you’ll have plenty of opportunities to take courses and grow into other positions or departments.

  

**Wat breng jij mee?**  


This role demands a proactive mindset, a curious nature, and strong problem-solving skills. With your knowledge of data management principles, data governance you should be able to explain complex issues in a clear and concise manner, apply logical thinking, and effectively follow up with colleagues across teams to ensure progress.
  

  

You also have the following qualities:


* A Bachelor or Master level thinking or degree, preferably in data management, computer science, or a related field.
* At least 3 years of experience in a similar role, preferably in an international logistics environment.
* Experience with tools like SQL and data visualization software.
* Strong communication skills in both English and Dutch (is a plus) and the ability to collaborate with various teams in an international context.

  

**Wat bezorgen we jou?**  


An innovative position and work that affects literally every street in the country. PostNL wants to be the logistics e-commerce platform of the future, delivering special moments faster, smarter and better. With your mindset, you can help PostNL face its challenges head on. You can count on excellent benefits in the process.  

  

The top five benefits of your position are:


* A salary ranging from €4.048,- to €5.578,- gross per month (scale 10) for a 39.25-hour workweek.
* Hybrid working is encouraged and you’ll have flexible working hours. After all, your work-life balance matters to us. Employees who work from home more than two days a week get an allowance of €45 net per month.
* 8% vacation pay and 25 vacation days on a full-time contract
* An NS Business Card for business travel and commuting or Travel allowance for commuting from 6 km each way up to a maximum of 70 km each way.
* Mac or windows laptop and a phone.
* Training opportunities for personal development through Mijn Leerplein

title: Sales & Operations Director - Enterprise Informatics
description:
### **Job Title**


Sales & Operations Director - Enterprise Informatics### **Job Description**


The Sales & Operations (S&OP) Director will lead the Sales and Operations Planning process within our Enterprise Informatics business. The role requires a strategic thinker with strong analytical skills, who can work collaboratively with various departments to balance supply and demand, optimize inventory levels, and achieve company financial targets. This position is located at our Amsterdam office.


Your role:  

o Develop and maintain the S&OP strategy in alignment with organizational goals.  

o Lead the monthly S&OP meetings, ensuring cross-functional participation and decision-making.  

o Collaborate with sales, marketing, product management, finance, and supply chain to gather accurate forecasts and demand signals.  

o Analyze market trends, customer data, and sales pipelines to inform demand planning.  

o Drive continuous improvement in the S&OP process through better analytics, technology, and process refinement.  

o Develop and track KPIs related to inventory turns, service levels, forecast accuracy, and plan adherence.  

o Facilitate communication between all stakeholders to ensure that S&OP decisions are well understood and executed.  

o Prepare executive-level presentations and reports to communicate S&OP outcomes and recommendations.  

o Some travel may be required - 5%


You're the right fit if:  

* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in business or a related field. MBA or advanced degree preferred.
* Minimum of 10 years of experience in sales and operations (preference in Software business), with a significant portion in a leadership role.
* Strong understanding of enterprise informatics, data analytics, and business intelligence tools.
* Proven ability to lead cross-functional teams and drive organizational change.
* Excellent communication, leadership, and interpersonal skills.

Desired Skills:  

* Strategic planning and analytical thinking.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
* Exceptional problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Expertise in data visualization and presentation.
 **About Philips**  

We are a health technology company. We built our entire company around the belief that every human matters, and we won't stop until everybody everywhere has access to the quality healthcare that we all deserve. Do the work of your life to help the lives of others.  

* Learn more about our business.
* Discover our rich and exciting history.
* Learn more about our purpose.

  

If you’re interested in this role and have many, but not all, of the experiences needed, we encourage you to apply. You may still be the right candidate for this or other opportunities at Philips. Learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion here.
company_description: For more than 130 years, we have been creating technologies and innovations that improve people's lives, support healthcare practitioners, and enable better outcomes for everyone.

title: Senior Trader
description:
+ > 5 years

+ 32 - 40 uur
+ Finance

+ €90.000 - €170.000


* Working at the heart of the energy transition in an international trading environment
* Improve trading results through entrepreneurship, data driven trading strategies and team work
* Work in a team of diverse international and cultural background

Why choose Eneco?
Every day we work hard to make our slogan 'sustainable energy for everyone' a reality. With over 2,000 colleagues, we help millions of consumers and many companies switch to sustainable energy with our energy services. We do this with smart, sustainable and affordable products and services. From generation to trading and from storage to sharing and delivery. We are also one of the largest investors in the development of wind farms, large solar roofs and heat networks.

  



Make short- and long-term energy purchasing decisions. The team of traders, commercial analysts and meteorologists ensures that there is enough power and gas every day to meet demand. Of course at the right price and with low risks. On the trading floor, you are primarily responsible for Eneco's first-line risks. Energy has to be purchased for a customer now, even if you don't know everything exactly. This is an intellectual challenge with a clear proposition: Eneco wants to be climate neutral by 2035.


What you’ll do
The Intraday Trading team is responsible for optimizing the results of Eneco within the intraday power market. It is a complex challenge since we have a large and diverse portfolio of customers, sustainable assets and gas-fired power plants. As such we are buying and selling commodities and steering our assets. Our ambition is to get as much renewable energy on the grid as possible, at the lowest possible cost. To facilitate this, we develop a state of the art forecasting and optimization models, interactive visualization, and other forms of decision support.

  

We look for a trader who can make the best buy and sell decisions in the market and steer our assets to the most optimal points. As a trader, you translate market knowledge into profit.


You will be working irregular hours and be part of a shift (early morning-evening, 7 days a week).


Is this about you?
Entrepreneurship, result-oriented and good people skills are competences that you need to have in order to operate in a dynamic continuously improving environment. There are plenty of chances and developments in our current market that needs to be spotted and be acted on. A strong business acumen i.e. recognizing deals that are the most profitable and having the knowhow how to close it is essential and indispensable.


You also bring in:

* You have a Masters' Degree in a STEM subject;
* Meteorological knowledge is a plus;
* You have experience with SQL/Python/Excel/VBA;
* You have an entrepreneurial spirit;
* Previous experience in trading the Intraday markets is a must
* Minimum 3 years of trading experience in power markets, specifically the German one
You’ll be responsible for
You will start in Eneco’s Intraday team where you will develop a vision on European day ahead, intraday, and imbalance power markets. You will share your time between trading and development/optimization.


In short, you will:

* Be responsible for the trading profit/loss, expected to contribute by being highly commercially oriented;
* Optimize the available flexible generation capacity in our portfolio;
* Manage the imbalance exposures of our customers and renewable portfolio within the intraday market;
* Develop and execute profitable trading strategies;
* Be innovative and collaborate with other teams to grow our business.

This is where you’ll work
At Eneco Energy Trade, some 150 colleagues work at the heart of the organization. This is where the supply and demand of energy converge. Where we bundle our own and external energy flows and ensure that there is enough energy to meet demand. The international team consists of several divisions: Sourcing & Pricing, Trading, Portfolio Optimization, Structuring & Organization, Business Development, Energy Operations & IT Management.


What we have to offer
Gross annual salary between €90.000 and €170.000


Including FlexBudget, 8% holiday allowance, and depending on your role a bonus or collective profit sharing.
FlexBudget


Have it paid out, use it to buy extra holiday days or save it up for something nice, it's up to you.
Personal and professional growth


Eneco is fully committed to help you in your personal and professional development.
Hybrid working, at home or in the office


You work 40% at the office and 40% at home. The other day you decide what works best for you.
View more
Work that works for you and the climate
If you decide on a career at Eneco, you are choosing ambition, growth and opportunities. You will have all the space you want to improve yourself and do your job the way that suits you best, which includes having a good work-life balance. You can work to a flexible schedule and work partly from home if your role allows it.
That is how you can work on your own future and on the future of the world. After all, you and your 4,000 colleagues are committed to our mission: climate neutrality by 2035. We assist customers to accelerate their sustainability efforts, devise innovative solutions and seize opportunities with both hands. Are you ready?
The stages of our application procedure:


Stap 1


Your application
Stap 2


We carefully review your application
Stap 3


We invite you for a 1st (online) interview
Stap 4


Sometimes we want to get to know you even better, then there will be an online assessment and a 2nd interview
Stap 5


Yes! If it’s a match and if you agree, the recruiter will happily discuss your job offer
Want to know more about this job function?
Want to know more? Ozlem Bulun, Head of Intraday Trading will happily answer your questions through Ozlem.bulun@eneco.com. For more information on the procedure, you can contact the recruitment team.


For more information about the application procedure please send an e-mail to
randolph.mackay@eneco.com
.
Applying straight away? That is also possible! You can also apply via our recruitment system. Click on the 'apply' button and send us your CV with a motivation letter. You will receive a response as soon as possible.

  

An online assessment and a (pre-) employment screening are part of the selection procedure.

 *Acquisition in response to this advertisement is not appreciated.*
company_description: Werken bij Eneco. Daar zijn heel veel redenen voor.

title: Supply Chain Stores Ops Specialist
description:
Become a Part of the NIKE, Inc. Team  

  

NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world's best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At NIKE, Inc. it's about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game.  

  

The NIKE, Inc. Supply Chain team is the engine that propels product around the world. Supply Chain experts ensure that every year, almost a billion units of footwear, apparel and equipment arrive at the right place, at the right time. To ensure this complex job goes off without a hitch, Supply Chain teams work with a network of more than 50 distribution centers, thousands of accounts, and more than 100,000 retail stores worldwide - making the impossible happen every single day.  

  

WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR
  

  

As our Supply Chain Ops Specialist for our Nike Direct Stores, you always start with the consumer in mind. You will drive operational excellence to serve our Nike Direct Stores Athletes and Consumers through transactional and executional activities across relevant Nike systems, tools and reports to meet financial and operational targets while delivering on Nike's strategy. You utilize operational knowledge, analytical and critical thinking skills to deliver on all pillars of the Consumer Promise (Service, Convenience, Sustainability and Profitability). You bring subject matter expertise on End-to-end Stores supply chain flow and ability to simplify complex information and communicate effectively to leaders and stakeholders across Supply Chain and Nike Direct Stores team. You keep your stores, business partners and stakeholders informed and engaged of risks and opportunities, and you actively partner with your stores and other operational functions, to find optimal supply chain and commercial solutions.  

  

WHAT YOU WILL WORK ON
  

  

You will be responsible for ensuring accurate and timely product flow towards our Nike Direct Stores, by collaborating with Planning, Distribution, Transportation, and directly with our Store/partner teams. You cultivate strong partnerships with external and internal stakeholders to deliver excellent customer service aligned with Nike's strategic vision. You will be a Marketplace Supply Chain (MSC) representative within the Stores cross-functional team and lead and influence peers to maintain a balanced marketplace and effective inventory management. Your responsibilities include performing KPI root cause analysis, contributing to performance updates, providing expertise in scenario planning, and driving continuous process improvement through innovation and transformational initiatives.  

  

WHO YOU WILL WORK WITH
  

  

You will work in a cross-functional agile environment that spans across EMEA and services the Nike Direct Stores MSC needs. While being part of the MSC Stores team, reporting into MSC Supply Chain Stores Manager, you will partner closely with Allocation, Sales, Merchandising, Planning and Finance. Besides, you will daily connect with your stores, partners, carrier network and Nike's logistical functions.  

  

WHAT YOU BRING
  

* Supply Chain and/or Retail Experience: Demonstrated relevant and solid experience within Supply Chain and/or Retail related functions, with a consumer-centric mindset. Wide and deep understanding of Supply Chain Management and general retail business knowledge.
* Stakeholder management: established experience in developing excellent working relationships with key partners, bringing the right people together and facilitating leadership decisions.
* Process Improvement: Innovative mentality and proven track record in leading and delivering process improvement for the organization.
* Analytical skills: strong experience in KPI management, root cause analysis and scenario planning with the ability to translate complex data sets into business insights through visualization (e.g., graphs, tables). Having advanced skills in MS Office (e.g., Excel) and reporting tools (Cognos, Tableau) and ERP Systems (SAP) is preferred.
* Communication skills: Strong written and verbal communicator, ability to translate complex supply chain issues into concise insights, sharing information with and influencing senior stakeholder, bringing recommendations and facilitating decision making.
* Vision & Leadership: Self-starter, with an ambition to drive change, and ability to clearly communicate and influence various levels within a matrix structure and multinational teams.

  

NIKE, Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Nike offers a generous total rewards package, casual work environment, a diverse and inclusive culture, and an electric atmosphere for professional development. No matter the location, or the role, every Nike employee shares one galvanizing mission: To bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete\* in the world.  

  

NIKE, Inc. is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability.  

  

**Benefits**  

  

Whether it's transportation or financial health, we continually invest in our employees to help them achieve greatness - inside and outside of work. All who work here should be able to realize their full potential.
company_description: NIKE, Inc. is the world’s leading designer, marketer and distributor of authentic athletic footwear, apparel, equipment and accessories for a wide variety of sports and fitness activities.

title: IoT Software Engineer
description:
**Opportunity/Job Purpose:**

The IOT Software Engineer has a crucial role in design, development, maintenance, and support of an IoT telematics product. This product collects and dashboards data from diverse company products and customers. The engineer ensures seamless integration of hardware and cloud infrastructure working in multidisciplined teams. The engineer's expertise in cloud platforms, programming languages, and reporting is essential for driving the company's IoT initiatives forward.

The incumbent will be expected to demonstrate creativity, commercial grasp, design rigour and self-starting attributes. **maxwell+spark** fosters a diverse, fast paced, progressive work environment with a multidisciplinary approach to engineering without micro-management. The candidate should have an affinity for such working conditions and be able to rise to the occasion. The role will be based in Rotterdam, The Netherlands.

**Role and responsibilities will include:**

* Engage with customers to specify reporting and visualisation requirements
* Develop metrics according to customer needs
* Implement report generation using python to query a SQL database
* Provide 2nd line customer support
* Specify visualization of metrics
* Configure dashboards and generate automatic reports per customer requirements.
* Develop and implement API architectures
* Collaborate with other experienced firmware and hardware design engineers
* Create innovative new designs and features on an IoT telematics system by evolving existing products or creating entirely new products.
* Be able to characterize 3rd party machines, components and field environments.
* Manage users and user experience for internal and external customers.
* Generate documentation to describe software, electrical, and electronic systems.
* Lead or participate in testing or certification for new products.
* Manage mini projects including planning, budgeting, management of other engineers and suppliers.

**Educational and Experience Requirements:** 

* HBO (Bachelor’s Degree) in Computer Science or a relevant field.
* Minimum of 5 years’ relevant work experience.
* Experience in programming and data analysis, preferably using Python
* Experience in cloud services such as AWS / Azure and IoT applications.
* Experience with data analysis and visualisation tools such as Plotly, matplot lib
* Understanding of databases and time-series data
* Experience with RESTful API development and implementation
* Web development experience such as JavaScript, HTML, CSS is advantageous
* Knowledge of C++ and CAN Bus is advantageous

**Skill Requirements:**

* Ability to specify and develop metrics
* Hands-on experience with Wi-Fi/Bluetooth, GPS and Cellular IOT systems.
* Proficiency in cloud platforms such as AWS/Azure, ideally within the IoT domain.
* Interest and understanding of telematics, data gathering and analysis.
* Strong technical writing and communication skills.
* Ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team.
* Strong alignment with the company’s values: simplicity, powered growth, reliability, innovation and teamwork.

**What you can expect from us:**

* Full-time employment (40 hours per week) based on a 12-month contract, with a possibility of extension.
* A competitive salary, depending on experience, skills and qualifications.
* 8% holiday allowance, calculated on gross salary and paid monthly.
* Travel Allowance.
* Participation in the PMT Pension Fund.
* 22 days of paid leave. The number of paid leave days is increased after 2, 4 and 7 years of service.
* Travel reimbursement.
* Being part of a fast growing greentech company in the Netherlands, with room to learn, change roles and grow with us.
* Further studies are encouraged and supported.

**About us:** 

For more information about **Maxwell+Spark**, visit our website at www.maxwellandspark.com

Job Type: Full-time

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Test Engineer
description:
Test Engineer

  

**Date:** Sep 3, 2024


**Location:** Netherlands - ’s-Hertogenbosch


**Company:** Super Micro Computer


**Job Req ID: 25233**
**About Supermicro:**

Supermicro® is a Top Tier provider of advanced server, storage, and networking solutions for Data Center, Cloud Computing, Enterprise IT, Hadoop/ Big Data, Hyperscale, HPC and IoT/Embedded customers worldwide. We are amongst the fastest growing company among the Silicon Valley Top 50 technology firms. Our unprecedented global expansion has provided us with the opportunity to offer many new positions to the technology community. We seek talented, passionate, and committed engineers, technologists, and business leaders to join us to drive accelerated growth and technology-led innovation in the global marketplace.
**Job Summary:**

As a global leader in server technologies, Supermicro has been growing extremely fast in many key markets such as Cloud Computing, Big Data, HPC, AI and Storage, etc. To meet the market demand, Supermicro is developing end to end enterprise IT solutions with compute, storage, networking all integrated into full rack or multi-rack level systems. Test Engineer plays an important role in testing and deploying rack system solutions for data center and enterprise customers.
**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**
* Preform the server level and cluster level tests, write the failure reports for testing.
* Maintain the lab networks, clusters, VPN and other devices deployed in the lab.
* Able to work with other engineers to resolve issues for hardware.
* Implement active lab policies, support ISO compliance and inventory control.
* Able to configure switches and routers and install new programs for customers.
* Maintain the hardware inventory, provide the inventory report monthly.
**Qualifications:**
* Strong Linux and windows operating system experience,
* Strong skills in writing failure reports for server/cluster level tests.
* Experience with lab or production hardware, network setups, and switch configuration.
* Experience with inventory control and asset management are a plus.
* Familiar with TCP/IP protocol stack, DHCP, NFS and other application level protocols are a plus.
* Familiar with server test tools, lab management software, and scalable storage are a plus.
* Familiar with visualization technology and cloud computing are a plus.
* Cisco CCNA, AWS or GCP certificates are a plus.
* Positive attitude, desire to learn, time management, and strong interpersonal skills are a plus.
* BA/BS degree plus 2+ years in related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
**EEO Statement**

Supermicro is an Equal Opportunity Employer and embraces diversity in our employee population. It is the policy of Supermicro to provide equal opportunity to all qualified applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status or special disabled veteran, marital status, pregnancy, genetic information, or any other legally protected status.
company_description: Supermicro is a Fortune 1000 company headquartered in the heart of Silicon Valley.

title: Data Science Consultant
description:
Netherlands Data Science Eindhoven Hybrid
As a Data Science Consultant at TMC, you will have the opportunity to work on exciting projects with clients across various industries such as finance, healthcare, automotive, and manufacturing.

  


About The Member Company
We are a global high-tech consultancy company with a team of entrepreneurial engineers, scientists, and digital experts from around the world. Together we form a fast-growing and proud community. We offer consultancy services to high-profile clients globally in diverse service areas, such as:


* Technology & Engineering
* Energy & Renewables
* Life sciences & Pharma
* Digital & IT
**About this vacancy**
----------------------


* Develop and deploy data science and machine learning models to solve complex business problems.
* Analyze large datasets to extract actionable insights, trends, and patterns.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their business needs and design data-driven solutions.
* Present findings and insights to both technical and non-technical audiences.
* Continuously stay updated with the latest technologies, algorithms, and methodologies in data science.
* Guide clients in building data strategies and identifying key opportunities for data-driven improvements.
* Design and implement data pipelines and ensure best practices in data management and governance.
* Contribute to the innovation and growth of the data science team at TMC by sharing knowledge and mentoring junior consultants.


**What we expect from you**
---------------------------


* Master’s or PhD in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
* 3+ years of experience in a data science or machine learning role, preferably in a consulting environment.
* Proficient in programming languages such as Python or R, and familiar with data manipulation libraries (Pandas, NumPy, etc.).
* Strong understanding of machine learning techniques (e.g., regression, classification, clustering, deep learning).
* Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Matplotlib, Seaborn).
* Familiarity with big data platforms (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) and cloud environments (AWS, Azure, GCP) is a plus.
* Excellent communication skills and ability to work with cross-functional teams.
* A proactive mindset with a passion for innovation and continuous learning.


**What you can expect from us**
-------------------------------


TMC is an international high-tech consultancy company that brings expertise to their clients in order to support them with the realization of their technological challenges. As such, TMC is operating as an expert center at the disposition of its clients and we help them to be more competitive in an ever more global and faster changing technological world.


At TMC we believe that people are the driving force behind technological innovation. That is why we want to create the best possible conditions for tech talents to thrive in. We offer you a challenging and stimulating work environment in which you can be the director of your own career.


As an Employeneur you are part of our TMC family. Next to our outstanding technical expertise, fun and engagement are meaningful parts of our culture.


The 5 basic principles of **employeneurship**
A long-term working relationship
Enjoy the security of a long-term contract and a stable source of income while getting the opportunity to work at diverse projects.


Individual profit sharing
Full transparency. That’s it. For each of your projects, you know your hourly rate, your costs, and your individual performance-based profit sharing, all in order to stimulate your inner entrepreneur.


Business cells
Our employeneurs are grouped in business cells based on their technical expertise. They are small, focused and function as high-grade knowledge networks. And as buzzing communities of close colleagues.


YOUniversity
Every employeneur drives their own career. Together, we make a plan for personal and professional growth. Receive personal coaching and an extensive training budget to keep developing yourself and deliver outperformance at our clients.

  

The Entrepreneurial Lab
Work on your technical dreams in our lab. Collaborate with others in multidisciplinary teams to unlock out-of-the-box thinking and innovative ideas as well as entrepreneurial skills.
company_description: At TMC we believe it's people who drive technology. Our Employeneurship model creates the best conditions for technical talents to do so.

title: Post-doc Position in Cognitive Neuroscience: "How Arousal Fluctuations Shape Perception"

title: Information Analyst
description:
Description


**Are you looking for a job where you can make a difference and work in a non-profit? Would you like to be a part of an ambitious and international organisation on the cutting edge of science?** Then this position might be right up your alley.**The EBMT is a non-profit medical and scientific organisation** **which hosts a unique patient registry** **providing a pool of data to perform studies and assess new trends.**
Our mission **Save and improve the lives of patients** **with blood-related disorders.**  

Your mission  

 Responsible for the **accuracy of data** by implementing and maintaining **quality protocols,** leveraging **programming skills** for system updates, and collaborating on **data governance policies.**  

Responsibilities and Tasks **EBMT Registry maintenance:*** **Liaise with vendor/third parties** to ensure adequate maintenance of the infrastructure of the EBMT Registry.
* Assist EBMT members with **data reporting tasks, data quality activities, and data analysis.**
* **Implement tools** to streamline error checking and error correction. Provide support in the implementation of software for database-to-database electronic transmission of data.
* **Update and maintain** electronic data collection forms in the New Registry Solution.
* Regular reviews of the database functioning and identifying (possible) problems and risks.

 **Quality assurance*** Create documents, reports, and SOPs to **document all processes.**
* **Support in ensuring** **database security** and compliance with the latest developments.
* Periodically undertake **data quality audits.** Improvement of the quantity and quality of the data submission together with the data operations team.

 **EBMT Registry Training*** Occasional training for data managers and physicians in member centers on Data Quality and Registry tools.
* Support training new EBMT Registry team members in EBMT Registry processes.


Requirements


* **Fluent in English, excellent oral and written skills.**
* Bachelor's degree in IT or related area.
* **Strong experience in SQL, PL/SQL, Excel, R or Python.**
* 3-5 years of experience in **Tableau, MicroStrategy, Looker or similar** in an **administrator role** or comparable.
* Good communication skills. Ability to communicate effectively with people in a multicultural environment. Analytical thinking, strong problem-solving skills. Proactive. Team player. Work efficiently under pressure and meet deadlines.
* Willingness to travel (because of the nature of our organisation with offices in Europe and our annual meeting, travel might occasionally be part of the job).

  

Desirable  

* Postgraduate in IT (MSc) or similar.
* Experience working with standardized data models, preferably OMOP.
* Experience with Amazon Web Services or similar.

Familiarized with Clinical knowledge and medical data (ideally HSC transplant programs and new cell therapies), translating the requirements from physicians into the system.  
* 

  

What we offer* **Be part of a non-profit society where you can make a difference**
* Work alongside a **multicultural and diverse international team**
* **Based in Leiden or surroundings - attendance to EBMT offices 2 days per week and working remotely 3 days.**
* Full-time position (36 hours/week)
* **Flexible working hours** (starting from 8 am to 10 am and finishing accordingly).
* 1-month probation period.
* **Temporary contract for 12 months (possibility to renew the contract if both parties agree).**
* 25 days of vacation per year
* Salary: scale 10.3 (3.856 euros) - 10.6 (4.346 euros) euros gross/month depending on the experience, excluding end-of-the-year payment and 8% holiday remuneration.

  

Additional benefits (once the probation period is over)  

* Travel allowance for commuting on office days
* Some foreign travel
* Support in training and professional development
* A pension arrangement with the National Civil Pension Fund

title: Senior Applied Scientist, Privacy Engineering
description:
**About the Team**  

  

Our mission is to make Uber the industry model for consumer privacy through differentiated, highly scalable, and extensible products and services, engineering standards, policy, and open communications. We are focusing on building both a privacy technology platform and user-facing products that give our users more control over their data, build trust, advance data privacy, and enable our business.
  

  

Lead efforts within the organization to drive the development and AI/ML-based solutions in support of user-facing products, downstream services, or infrastructure tools and platforms used across Uber.
  

  

**About the Role**  

  

Lead efforts to develop and evaluate large-scale traditional machine learning models, optimize retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) systems, fine-tune large language models (LLMs), and implement agentic workflows. This role requires a strong foundation in both traditional machine learning and advanced LLM technologies.
  

  

**What you will do*** Develop and evaluate large-scale machine learning models systems in production.
* Propose, design, and analyze large scale online experiments
* Define and implement metrics to measure product performance
* Present findings to business and executive audiences
* Collaborate with engineers and product managers to implement ideas and plan future roadmaps
* Optimize retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) systems for enhanced performance and relevance.
* Fine-tune large language models (LLMs) to improve predictive accuracy and operational efficiency.
* Implement agentic workflows to streamline processes and enhance decision-making.

**Basic Qualifications*** Ph.D., MS or Bachelors degree in Statistics, Economics, Operations Research, Computer Science, Engineering, or other quantitative field
* If Ph.D or M.S. degree, a minimum of 2+ years of industry experience as an Applied Scientist or equivalent
* Knowledge of underlying mathematical foundations of machine learning, statistics, optimization, economics, and analytics
* Hands-on experience building and deployment ML models.
* Knowledge of experimental design and analysis
* Experience with exploratory data analysis, statistical analysis and testing, and model development
* Ability to use a language like Python or R to work efficiently at scale with large data sets
* Proficiency in technologies in one or more of the following: SQL, Spark, Hadoop

**Preferred Qualifications*** Knowledge in modern machine learning techniques applicable to privacy and recommender systems
* Advanced understanding of statistics, causal inference, and machine learning
* 5+ years of industry experience as an Applied Scientist or equivalent.
* Experience designing and analyzing large scale online experiments
* Experience working with large scale data sets using technologies like Hive, Presto, and Spark
* Experience with synthetic data generation.
* Proficiency in fine-tuning and optimizing large language models (LLMs).
* Experience in retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) systems.
* Familiarity with agentic workflows and their applications in machine learning and AI systems.
company_description: We reimagine the way the world moves for the better.

title: Commercial Analyst (German Speaking)
description:
Ebury is a hyper-growth FinTech firm, named in 2021 as one of the top 15 European Fintechs to work for by AltFi. We offer a range of products including FX risk management, trade finance, currency accounts, international payments and API integration.

**Position Overview**



Ebury is looking to hire a Commercial Analyst to be based in our Amsterdam offices, working with our front office teams.



You will join the Sales Acceleration team and help to develop innovative, data-driven processes, tools and dashboards that support the commercial team in growing revenues and improving the client experience.



You will work closely with local leadership, leverage data analytics tools, and contribute to the development and execution of sales acceleration initiatives.



We are looking for a candidate that is comfortable with data and logical thinking, but crucially, is also able to summarise and communicate complex ideas to strong and outgoing personalities with confidence.



You will have to deliver key projects across but not limited to;


**Key Responsibilities**


* Partnering with the commercial leadership to drive insights on team performance and revenue strategy by providing critical analyses
* Supporting the expansion of Ebury's data toolkit: transforming our data and sharing insights to commercial leadership on revenue generation, product utilisation, credit offering, front office activity + performance management and more
* Sales Analytics: Collect, analyse, and interpret sales data to identify trends, patterns, and areas for improvement. Develop key performance indicators (KPIs) and dashboards to track sales performance and provide actionable insights to sales leadership for Netherlands and Germany (with potential for expansion)
* Sales Process Optimisation: Collaborate with the sales team to assess and enhance existing sales processes, including lead generation, qualification, pipeline management, and forecasting. Identify bottlenecks and implement strategies to streamline workflows and improve efficiency
* Sales Enablement: Support the development and implementation of sales enablement programs, ensuring sales representatives have the necessary tools and resources to effectively engage with prospects and close deals
* Data Analysis and Reporting: Prepare regular reports and presentations on Front Office performance, pipeline metrics, and revenue forecasts. Analyse data to identify opportunities for revenue growth, customer segmentation, and cross- selling/up-selling initiatives
* CRM Management: Maintain and optimise the Customer Relationship Management (CRM) system, ensuring accurate and up-to-date customer and sales data. Provide training and support to the sales team on CRM usage and best practices
* Process Automation: Identify opportunities for sales process automation and collaborate with the technology team to implement appropriate tools and systems. Streamline workflows and eliminate manual tasks to improve sales team productivity
* Market and Competitive Analysis: Conduct market research and competitive analysis to identify industry trends, competitive positioning, and customer needs. Provide insights to the sales team for better targeting, positioning, and differentiation
* Collaboration and Communication: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including marketing, product, and finance, to align sales acceleration initiatives with overall business objectives. Collaborate with sales managers to ensure effective implementation and adoption of sales strategies


**Qualifications And Skills**


* Bachelor's degree in business, finance, economics, or a related field
* Multilingual with fluency in Dutch, English and German is a requirement
* Proven experience as a sales analyst or a similar role, preferably within the financial services industry
* Strong analytical skills and proficiency in data analysis tools, such as Excel, Salesforce, SQL or similar CRM systems
* Solid understanding of sales processes, pipeline management, and lead-to- revenue lifecycle
* Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex data and insights to non-technical stakeholders
* Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking abilities being able to deliver actionable insights
* Detail-oriented with a high level of accuracy in data analysis and reporting
* Proactive and self-motivated with the ability to work independently and prioritise tasks
* Collaborative mindset with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams

**About Us**


**Ebury is a FinTech success story, positioned among the fastest-growing international companies in its sector.**



Founded in 2009, we are headquartered in London and have more than 1700 staff with a presence in more than 25 countries worldwide. Cultural diversity is part of what makes Ebury a special place to be. From Sao Paulo to Dubai, Bucharest to Toronto, we enjoy sharing team experiences and celebrating success across the Ebury family.



Hard work pays off: in 2019, Ebury received a £350 million investment from Banco Santander and has won internationally recognised awards including Financial Times: 1000 Europe's Fastest-Growing Companies.



None of this would have been possible without our proudest achievement: our great people. Enthusiastic, innovative and collaborative teams, always ready to disrupt and revolutionise the fast-paced FinTech sector.

  

*We believe in inclusion. We stand against discrimination in all forms and have no tolerance for the intolerance of differences that makes us a modern and successful organisation. At Ebury, you can be whoever you want to be and still feel a sense of belonging no matter your story because we want you and your uniqueness to help write our future.*


*Please submit your application on the careers website directly, uploading your CV / resume in English.*
