title: Business Analyst
description:
We are looking for a proactive and talented Commerce Integration Business Analyst to spearhead our initiatives in optimizing business processes and integrating essential systems. In this role, you will identify opportunities for improvement, develop comprehensive integration plans, and ensure their successful execution. If you possess a strong analytical mindset and a proven history in business analysis, we encourage you to apply and contribute to taking our operations to the next level.


**About the role**
------------------


As a Commerce Integration Business Analyst you will engage with project stakeholders, whether customers or end users, to gather and specify their business needs. Your ability to understand and compile user requirements will be crucial for our development teams or suppliers when implementing standard solutions. You will act as a solution architect, delivering IT solution architectures that support various business solutions across Landal. Collaborating with key stakeholders, including the Information Architect, Data Officer, and Technical Architect, you will ensure alignment and coherence in our architecture.


Using your exceptional communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills, you will support the development or implementation process, ensuring that project deliverables meet specifications and exceed expectations.


**What you going to do**
------------------------

* Architecture and design of IT part for the business processes and related IT tools;
* Creates architecture designs and applying them in High Level Designs;
* Designs solutions based on agreed constraints;
* Applies relevant compliancy, privacy and security requirements;
* Supports realization and implementation of solutions;
* Source of information for all technical inquiries about the solution;
* Impact analysis of solution scenarios.

  


**Who you are**
---------------

* Excellent level of competence in solution design and requirements specification
* Explicit knowledge and experience in the Financial domain is a definite advantage.
* Experience with Agile ways of working is a definite advantage.
* Ability to prioritise effectively and achieve results.
* Capable of operating to tight schedules in a demanding environment with set deadlines and challenging plans.
* Good communication skilled both with IT- and non-IT colleagues
* Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Information Technology, Computer Science, or related field.
* Minimum of 5 years of experience as a Business Analyst, solution architect preferably in a holiday park operation or technology environment.


We leverage a variety of technologies and platforms to enhance our operations and integration capabilities:


* System integration projects, including API and middleware technologies.
* Commerce platforms (e.g., Magento, Sitecore), mobile app, CRM systems like SF, IAM, booking engine etc..
* RESTful APIs, SOAP, XML, JSON, and other integration protocols.
* Cloud-based integration platforms (e.g., MuleSoft or Dell Boomi.)

**This is what we offer**
-------------------------


Together, we strive to offer our guests and colleagues the best. If you join us, your contributions will be rewarded with:


* One-year contract with a one-month probation period, potential for permanent employment.
* Bonus scheme.
* 27 vacation days, with an option to purchase 10 extra days.
* Flexible working hours and remote work options.
* Home office allowance of €2.35 per telecommuting day.
* Travel expense reimbursement at €0.23 per kilometer, or full coverage for public transport.
* Extensive training opportunities, both online (150+ e-learnings) and offline.
* Enrollment in the Recreation Pension Fund, retirement age 67, with premium split equally.
* Paid additional maternity and parental leave.
* Various collective insurances, including complimentary continuous travel insurance for you and your family.
* Favorable employee booking discounts.
* A full-time position at Landal consists of a 38-hour workweek, equivalent to a 5-day workweek. If you have a part-time position, your salary and vacation days will be calculated on a pro-rata basis.


Starting in January 2025, your workplace will be our new office in Amsterdam Amstel. Until then, you will work from our offices in The Hague or Goes. Of course, remote work is possible, but it is desirable that you work in the office at least three days a week.

title: Senior Inspectorate Business Analyst (P-4)
company: Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons
description:
**About Us**
------------

  



  

The Inspectorate Division is responsible for the efficient and effective deployment of inspection teams to both military and commercial facilities around the world, as required by the Chemical Weapons Convention (CWC). The Division maintains readiness to conduct Challenge Inspections and Investigations of Alleged Use, and to deploy the Rapid Response and Assistance Mission (RRAM) to Member States, as needed, in the event of a chemical incident.

**General Information**
-----------------------

* **Contract Type**  

Fixed-term Professional
* **Grade**  

P4
* **Total Estimated monthly remuneration depending on post adjustment and family status: USD**  

9,962
* **Closing Date**  

04/10/2024

**Responsibilities**
--------------------

### **Job Summary**


The Programme Control and Monitoring Branch (CMB) ensures the implementation of programmatic deliverables and manages INS’s operational financial resources.


CMB continually pursues efficiencies and ensures that the INS remains flexible, agile and resourceful in the allocation of financial resources.


CMB is also responsible for monitoring all relevant data, formulating follow-up actions, setting and revising related standard operating procedures (SOPs) and other quality management files to strengthen the standardisation and preparedness of all routine and non-routine missions.

### **Main Responsibilities**


Under the supervision of the Head of the Programme Control and Monitoring Branch, the main function of the Senior Inspectorate Business Analyst is to support the execution of programmatic activities of the Inspectorate Division (INS), ensuring a fully integrated management of INS operational resources.  

  

**General**

* Demonstrate the core values of the OPCW in the execution of your duties.
* Maintain confidentiality in accordance with the Manual of Confidentiality Procedure (MCP).
* Assist the Head of CMB in achieving the responsibilities and objectives of the Branch.
* Maintain and develop professional competence: complete required training and ensure that relevant knowledge and expertise is current.
* Support Knowledge Management activities.
* Undergo any special duties and tasks as directed by the Inspectorate Management Team.

 **Specific**


Under direct supervision of the Head, Programme Control and Monitoring Branch, the Senior Inspectorate Business Analyst:

* Supports the administration, planning, programming/budgeting, and implementation, monitoring and evaluation of the work programme and priorities of the Branch.
* Provides business analysis, risk identification and mitigation, and efficiency enhancement for all INS Missions and Trainings.
* Acts as coordinator and focal point for CMB information systems applications.
* Assists the Head of CMB, to lead the work of the Branch in such a way that it contributes to promoting and ensuring coordinated and synergised work planning and delivery across the branch nurturing a joined up working culture and practices.
* Undertakes any special duties and tasks as assigned, such as assisting the Inspectorate Management Team (IMT) on technical issues and providing HQ-support to mission and training activities; international duty travel to be undertaken as per the requirement of the assignment.

**Qualifications and Experience**
---------------------------------

### **Education**

**Essential**


Advanced University degree (Master’s degree or equivalent) in public administration, business administration (MBA), economics, engineering, or related field. A first-level degree (Bachelor’s or equivalent) in combination with qualifying experience (minimum 9 years) in the specified fields may be accepted in lieu of the advanced university degree.


**Desirable**

* Courses and training in areas like statistics, financial modelling, computer programming, and data science are an asset.
* Professional certification in programme and/or project management is desirable.
* Development of business analysis, budgeting and forecasting, business strategizing, planning, and monitoring, variance analysis, reporting and defining business requirements for stakeholders.

### **Knowledge and Experience**

**Essential**

* At least seven years of relevant experience in programme management, where at least three years are spent with management and leadership responsibility. Ideally, the experience would have been gained in an international organisation, multi-stakeholder environment or multilateral institution involving:
	+ Preparation of strategies, formulation of business models.
	+ Management of programmes in line with results-based principles
* Experience working with large data sets to produce implementation statistics, identify trends and report results.
* Experience in using of financial modules for an Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system.
* Proficiency in data analysis, data modelling and relevant experience in the use of Information Technology tools.
* Experience and familiarity with relevant tools, software, and methodologies.
* Experience working with networks, database, and other technology.
* Experience working in an environment that handles classified information.

**Desirable**

* Experience formulating budgeting and forecasting models, planning, and monitoring, variance analysis, and developing costing methodologies.
* Experience in the use and implementation of ERP systems in particular budgetary module(s), associated budgetary processes and reporting.
* Experience developing and implementing Results-Based Management.
* Experience of bilateral technical assistance and capacity building programmes or capacity-building in the area of emergency response and preparedness.

### **Skills and Competencies**

* Excellent and proven planning, organisational, coordination, negotiation, and problem-solving skills.
* Strong analytical and conceptual skills in analysing and interpreting operational issues, assessing assistance needs and determining priorities, formulating options, and proposing and implementing solutions.
* Demonstrated experience developing and managing capacity-building and other assistance programs, including training, and in mobilising resources from donor states for such capacity-building programs.
* Political awareness and developed strategic thinking skills are critical for this post.
* Demonstrated leadership and management skills, achieve results, and learn lessons and manage knowledge; a capacity for people management, team building, and staff development would be an asset.
* Excellent inter-personal and communication skills with demonstrated ability to apply tact and accuracy and to present information clearly and logically both in writing and verbally.
* Solid information technology skills including proficiency in Microsoft desktop packages (including Power Bi).
* Ability to ensure an effective work structure to maximise productivity and achieve section goals.
* Ability to coordinate the work of others, forge collaboration with other work units, work to tight deadlines and handle multiple concurrent activities.
* Proven ability in establishing and maintaining effective working relationships with people of different national and cultural backgrounds.

### **Languages**


Fluency in English is essential and a good working knowledge of one of the other official languages (Arabic, Chinese, French, Russian, and Spanish) is desirable.

**Additional Information**
--------------------------


This fixed-term appointment is for the duration of two years with a six-month probationary period, and is subject to the OPCW Staff Regulations and Interim Staff Rules.

  

The OPCW is a non-career organisation with limited staff tenure. The total length of service for Professional staff shall not exceed 7 years.

  

The mandatory age of separation at the OPCW is 65 years.  



  

The Director-General retains the discretion to not make any appointment to this vacancy, to make an appointment at a lower grade, or to make an appointment with a modified job description. Several vacancies may be filled.

  

Only fully completed applications submitted before the closing date and through OPCW CandidateSpace will be considered. Only applicants under serious consideration for a post will be contacted.  



  

Fixed-term staff members participate in the OPCW Provident Fund. A monthly staff contribution is met with a doubled amount by the OPCW under the provisions for social security. As the OPCW is exploring membership of the United Nations Joint Staff Pension Fund (UNJSPF), staff participation in the Provident Fund may be replaced by participation in the UNJSPF effective 1 January 2025.  



  

Applications from qualified female candidates are strongly encouraged.

  



OPCW General Terms and Conditions

 **Important notice for applicants who are currently insured under the Dutch Social Security system**


Although headquartered in the Netherlands, the OPCW is not a regular Dutch employer but a public international organisation with its own special status. Please be advised that if you are currently insured under the Dutch Social Security system, you will be excluded from this system as a staff member of the OPCW. You will consequently be insured under the organisation’s system. The above also applies to your dependents unless they are employed by a regular Dutch employer, they are self-employed in the Netherlands, or are receiving Dutch social security payments.


Please refer to the website of the Ministry of Social Affairs and Employment for more information about the possible consequences for you and your dependents, such as exclusion from ‘AWBZ’ and ‘Zorgverzekeringswet’ coverage: ‘Werken bij een internationale organisatie’.

title: Principal Consultant Workday Finance
description:
**Your role:**


What makes Cognizant a unique place to work? The combination of rapid growth and an international and innovative environment! This is creating a lot of opportunities for people like YOU — people with an entrepreneurial spirit who want to make a difference in this world. At Cognizant, together with your colleagues from all around the world, you will collaborate on creating solutions for the world's leading companies and help them become more flexible, more innovative and successful. And this is your chance to be part of the success story.  

As a Principal Consultant, you will “bridge the gap” between the business and technical teams by solving complex Workday intersystem problems. They will guide clients through the transformation, implementation, and operation phases of a Workday implementation.

  

  

**Responsibilities:**


* Guide the client through facilitated design sessions and configuration decisions based on best practices and an understanding of the client’s unique business requirements at all stages of the project
* Regularly engage and support the client through all phases of the project, ensuring a smooth transfer from legacy systems to the Workday Finance solutions
* Perform multiple tasks under limited direction, while regularly keeping the client, your project team and your Engagement Manager abreast of changes or progress related to the project
* Willingness to take a leadership position on a project, or as a Cognizant or Workday Product Partner Lead and/or Delivery Assurance Reviewer
* Display your hands-on expertise of the software, including iLoading client data, moving configuration from tenant to tenant, and configuring business processes and security
* Utilize your technical aptitude to convert and map data sources into data conversion templates via iLoads
* Act as a mentor to fellow consultants and analysts, including providing support for shadow assignments
* Actively participate in update training and internal opportunities to share one’s skills and learnings with others within the organizations
* Drives and makes decisions regarding tactical direction of project workstreams

  

  

**What you will bring to the team:**

* 5+ years of Workday functional implementation experience
* 5 years of finance software experience
* 5 years implementing functional solutions with ERP or SaaS software
* Experience in gathering business requirements, designing and prototyping, testing and implementing practical business solutions under multiple deadlines
* Demonstrated functional experience in Financial Management

  

  

**What we offer:**


* A competitive salary based on your qualities and experience
* Access to Udemy, Cognizant Academy digital libraries for your continuous learning
* NS business card to cover your commute expenses
* 25 days of paid holiday per year
* A laptop and a smartphone
* A pension scheme
* Organization driven by technology – we have a tremendous technology backbone
* Open, ‘can do’ team spirit and international environment that encourages making your ideas reality!

  

  

**Diversity and Inclusion at Cognizant:**

At Cognizant, we believe diversity and inclusion are at the heart of our ability to execute successfully and consistently over the long term. We recognize that our people are our most important asset. We strive to create an environment where all associates feel comfortable to be themselves, feel accepted and can therefore thrive both personally and professionally. We continue to drive D&I throughout our organization to unlock the insights, imagination and innovation of our associates, as well as reflect the diversity of our clients and communities. We are a Dutch and European Top Employer and continually drive employment recognition and engagement through employee friendly policies and affinity groups such as “Women Empowered”, “Embrace LGBTQ+” and “Race Equality Network”. For more information, see https://careers.cognizant.com/global/en/diversity-and-inclusion

company_description: Headquartered in Teaneck, New Jersey, Cognizant Technology Solutions helps the world's leading companies build stronger businesses through their consultation services and other business solutions.

title: Product Owner RM Tools (Revenue Margin Growth)
description:
Function/Region: Commerce – Global H/O (Amsterdam)  

Reports to: Senior Director RMG  

Direct Reports: 2x Business Analysts focused on deploying Promo Advisor in the OpCo's.



Job Purpose  

The Product Owner will lead the transformation of Promo Advisor, an AI-enabled tool designed to enhance promotional effectiveness by providing insights and recommendations. The role involves defining business requirements for the tool's development, enabling efficient review of promotional performance, and offering actionable insights for future promotional planning. Responsibilities also include developing content and materials to build Promo Advisor capabilities, overseeing deployments, and managing various stakeholders.



Key Responsibilities:



Promo Advisor Development:


* Set the vision and outline the strategic importance of Promo Advisor.
* Collect and define functional and non-functional business requirements.
* Align with Global Analytics on the prioritization of the development roadmap.
* Validate and sign-off on development deliverables from Global Analytics.
* Shape and develop the change management and capability-building approach to ensure user adoption.
* Lead the development of a training program to enable users to unlock the full value of Promo Advisor.


Promo Advisor Deployment:


* Define the deployment roadmap of Promo Advisor in collaboration with Regions and OpCo's.
* Continuously improve the standard engagement and deployment approach for Promo Advisor.
* Oversee and support Business Analysts during engagement and deployment of Promo Advisor in OpCo's.


Stakeholder Management:


* Manage various stakeholders related to the development and deployment of Promo Advisor within FORCE Global D&T Regions and OpCo's.


Experience & Profile:


* Demonstrated experience in RMG (and preferably other commercial functions) within FMCG.


* Experience with data-driven tools and advanced analytics.


* University/Master's Degree


* 5-10+ years of relevant experience.


* Experience with business and/or technical transformational programs.


* Proven experience with change management and capability building.



Functional Skills:


* Profound knowledge of promotional management.
* Strong project and people management skills
* Strong stakeholder management and strategic mindset with solid analytical skills.



Key Leadership Expectations:


* Demonstrates all HEINEKEN behaviors (Shape, Connect, Develop, Deliver) at a high level, with a strong emphasis on Shape and Connect.

Communication Skills:


* Effectively manage relationships with various stakeholders (with conflicting interests) up to the MT level.


* Ensure alignment through clear and concise communication.


* Challenge stakeholders on deliverables and maintain a convincing and collaborative approach.

Note: This is a local position with a local contract based at Heineken's Head Office in Amsterdam. The application deadline is 19/10/2024, or sooner if we receive a sufficient number of applications.

title: Test Engineer
description:
USP’S
**Waarom jij deze**
**baan wil**
--------------------------------

Ambitieus
We hebben een winnaarsmentaliteit. Dus willen we elke dag nog beter zijn, maar wel op een maatschappelijk verantwoorde manier.


Agile werkwijze
Door deze werkwijze kunnen we continu meebewegen met de veranderende kansspelmarkt en het medialandschap. Zo werken we sneller en slimmer!


Complex techlandschap
In alles wat wij doen zit data en technologie verweven. We werken met de nieuwste high-end technieken en dat maakt Nederlandse Loterij een hightechbedrijf.


**Jouw speelveld**
------------------


What makes our teams successful? That's the right team setup as well as our data-driven mentality. To make the right decisions, you need insight into up-to-date information. That's why data is integrated into all teams within Nederlandse Loterij.



Thanks to your efforts, existing and new information systems are tested for desired functionalities. In this way, you directly contribute to a happy, healthy and sporty Netherlands. As a Test Engineer you score by:


* review/interpret specifications in refinement sessions.
* define logical and physical test cases based on the prepared specifications.
* plan and organize the test activities together with business analysts, developers, business representatives and suppliers.
* draft test scripts for manual and automated tests and build, expand and continuously adjust automated test sets.
* analyze, report and follow up on findings and issues and explain results to suppliers/developers.


This is probably also something you’d like to know: we encourage it if you identify improvements and make actionable suggestions for improvement.


**Samen werken, samen winnen**
------------------------------


Nederlandse Loterij is the reliable gambling organisation in the Netherlands. It has 8 strong brands. We are the market leader, experts and stand for responsible, fair and safe gambling. Almost all of our revenue goes to a happy, healthy and sporty Netherlands. In addition to being a gambling organisation with a social approach, we are an employer. We work with more than 500 top talents within our organisation.



Because we work together and win together, we always have reason to cheer. Within the Technology team, we help each other to perform and we aim for joint success! Our differences make us strong together. Movement? That's in our DNA. You and your colleagues feel at home in an environment where no day is the same. Bi-weekly we have an functional day where we brainstorm and work on innovation together. So we can learn, grow and have fun as a team.


  
**Jouw talent**
---------------


The various people who work here like to be on the move, develop themselves on a personal and/or professional level, and strive for profit. That makes everyone within Nederlandse Loterij a top talent. Your talent is the sum of:


* a Bachelor’s degree or higher in a technical field, such as computer science or information technology.
* TMAP/ISTQB certified.
* at least 3 to 6 years of experience as Tester (experience with functional testing is a must).
* experience working with the following tools: JIRA/Confluence, API tools, Robot Framework and GitHub/Jenkins/Azure DevOps. Experience with Ci/Cd is good to have.
* experience with working in a complex Service Oriented Architecture environment.
* proven knowledge of and experience in automated testing of back-end systems (API testing).


Furthermore, for this vacancy, you are a teamplayer, actively work with different peers, teams and stakeholders, such as Product Owners and Architects.


**Jouw score**
--------------


As a Test Engineer we offer you:


* a salary between €4.200,- and €5.900,- gross per month, depending on your experience
* a position for 32 - 40 hours per week
* a bonus scheme
* you can enjoy a healthy and varied lunch in our corporate restaurant for €3,25


Our office in Rijswijk is effectively where you do your work, but you mainly work in a place that best suits what you do. See below for other terms and conditions of employment.


##### **Reiskostenvergoeding**


De kosten die je maakt met OV of eigen vervoer om naar kantoor te komen? Die worden volledig vergoed.


##### **Extra voorzieningen**


Je krijgt een laptop, telefoon en een thuiswerkplek.


##### **Pensioen**


Je bouwt een goed pensioen op. Opbouwpercentage 1,75% per jaar. Eigen bijdrage 6,15% van pensioen grondslag.


##### **Hybride werken**


Afhankelijk van het team waarin je zit, werk je soms vanuit ons modern ingerichte kantoor in Rijswijk en soms vanuit huis of een andere plek waar jij het liefste je werk doet.


##### **Werkgeverschap van nu**


We vinden het belangrijk dat je blij wordt van onze arbeidsvoorwaarden. Zo vullen wij bijvoorbeeld het salaris tijdens het 5 weken durende partnerverlof aan tot 100%.


##### **Vakantie**


Je krijgt 30 vakantiedagen op basis van een fulltime dienstverband, €1.000,- flexibel budget en 8% vakantiegeld.


##### **Sportschool**


Onbeperkt gebruik van onze sportschool.Onze personal trainer staat voor je klaar.


##### **Ontwikkelingsbudget**


Met een jaarlijks opleidingsbudget tot €2.000,- kan jij flink investeren in jouw persoonlijke ontwikkeling. Dit stimuleren we.


NOG MEER VOORDELEN
**Arbeidsvoorwaarden**
----------------------


Onze sollicitatieprocedure
**Kom in beweging**
-------------------


Solliciteer
We moedigen je vanaf de zijlijn aan.


Telefonische kennismaking
Even aftasten van beide kanten.


Eerste gesprek
Een eerste gesprek via Teams of op kantoor, dat is een goed begin.


Tweede gesprek
We leren elkaar nóg beter kennen. Tijdens een gesprek op ons kantoor in Rijswijk en wie weet een case.


Aanbod
Een onweerstaanbaar aanbod dat past bij wat jij kan en gaat doen.


De aftrap
The game is on. Laten we samen werken en samen winnen.


### **Charissa Broekhuis**


#### **Corporate recruiter**


 charissa.broekhuis@nederlandseloterij.nl
company_description: Waar heel Nederland wint, dat is onze missie. Nederlandse Loterij draagt bij aan een gelukkiger, gezonder en sportief Nederland.

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
**Senior Data Engineer**


As a Senior Data Engineer at Everfield, you will leverage your expertise and experience to:

* Continuously improve scalability and stability of our data platform called the Lakehouse
* Create new data pipeline solutions on various data sources (ERP, CRMs, etc.)
* Improve existing solutions to improve value add for various stakeholders


This role is hybrid from either Amsterdam area or Cracow area.

 **About Everfield**


Everfield buys, builds, and grows European vertical market and specialist software companies, providing them with the tools they need to move to the next level. Our mission is to foster ambition, fuel growth, and unlock opportunities for Europe’s software ecosystem.


Companies in the Everfield ecosystem follow a decentralised model, maintaining their team, brand, and offices, while focusing on what they do best - building products and supporting customers. Everfield provides support in talent acquisition, HR, and a team of experts in building and growing European B2B SaaS companies consult on financial and operational topics from. Founded in 2022, Everfield has an ecosystem presence in 7 countries, and growing.

 **About the team:**


You’ll be working as part of the Business Intelligence (BI) team as the fourth member. Currently the team consists of a Lead Data Engineer, a Data Analyst and a hands-on team lead. The BI team creates value for various stakeholders (CEO, Finance, COO, Sales, Marketing, and Everfield’s portfolio companies), by creating insights, delivering analysis, automating reporting processes and improving data quality.

  

The team builds pipelines with **Azure Synapse Analytics** to ingest the data into our data platform, uses **Azure Databricks** for data transformation and **Power BI** for data visualization. For analytics the team also uses **Python** and **SQL**.

  

The scope of the team is expected to scale with the company’s growth and maturity level. Everfield will scale from 20 portfolio companies currently, to approximately 90 companies in the next 4 years.

 **Our way of working:**

* Sprints of 2 weeks
* Ops duty every other week
* On average 2 releases per sprint
* Weekly refinement sessions
* Evaluation/ retrospective every month

 **What you will do:**


Adhere to the DevOps methodology by:

* Collaborate with the Lead Data Engineer and Team Lead in Azure DevOps to plan and prioritize tasks.
* Develop data pipelines in Azure Synapse Analytics, along with data ingestion and process scripts using PySpark and Pandas, while managing version control through Git.
* Create unit tests, test your own work and review work of colleagues (via Pull Requests), to ensure quality control.
* Enhance and maintain deployment pipelines to facilitate smooth releases to end users.
* Monitor the data platform (including data pipelines, ingestion/processing jobs, and alerts), while continuously improving logging and monitoring practices.

 **What we are looking for:**

**Hard Skills**


Required:

* 3+ year of experience as **Data Engineer**, and 5+ years of professional experience within Data or related fields.
* Expert in **PySpark** and **Pandas** for data processing.
* Experience with **Azure Synapse Analytics**, **Azure Data Factory**, or **Azure Fabric** (Data Factory) for managing data pipelines.
* Strong knowledge of **SQL** and **data modeling** (especially star schema).
* Familiarity with **financial systems** such as ERP, NetSuite, SAP, or similar.
* Experience working in an **Agile Scrum** environment.


Nice to Have:

* Experience with **Databricks** for advanced analytics.
* Knowledge of **Power Query** and **Power BI** for data visualization.
* Experience deploying Azure resources like **Azure SQL Server** and **Azure Web Apps**.
* Experience with **CRM** systems and **customer** **data**.

**Soft Skills**

* **Independent Worker**: Ability to operate autonomously while contributing effectively to team goals.
* **Business Acumen**: Strong understanding of business and economic principles, with an ability to apply them in a data context.
* **Analytical Mindset**: Excellent problem-solving and critical thinking skills.
* **Collaborative**: Actively seeks alignment with team members and participates in planning sessions.
* **Quality-Focused**: Committed to reviewing both your own work and that of others to maintain high standards.
* **Strategic Planner**: Consider alternative solutions and refine features before implementation.
* **Purpose-Driven**: Demonstrates a deep understanding of tasks, ensuring they align with business objectives.

**What’s in it for you?**

* Grow your career in a fast-paced and growing organization.
* Enable exponential growth by designing a world class data platform.
* Working with the latest Data Engineering & Data Modeling technologies.
* Long term career opportunities.
* Working from home for up to 4 days per week.
* Flexible work environment with offices around Europe (Netherlands, UK, Spain, France, Poland, Germany).

**Recruitment process:**


Here’s what you can expect and who you will speak to during the interview process.

* Feedback to your application until 17th of September the latest
* Initial call with Talent Acquisition Lead Maria
* First interview with Hiring Manager Tom
* Second interview with Lead Data Engineer Pim
* Third interview, a case study assessment preferable on site
* Final interview with CFO Franklin


This role is hybrid from either Amsterdam area or Cracow area. Including yourself, the team will be four people.

**We look forward to reviewing your application!**

title: Product Analyst
description:
sennder is Europe’s leading digital freight forwarder. In a traditional industry, we are moving fast to digitize and automate all road logistics processes. We move trucks with courage and the power of data to unlock endless and sustainable capacity at exceptional quality. Get to know us better by reviewing our\\*\\* \\*\\*presentation.
  
  

We are a growing team looking for a Product Analyst in the Product department to help us on our journey to revolutionize road freight logistics. The role is located in our Amsterdam office.
  
  

WHAT YOU WILL DO …
  
  

As product analyst at sennder, your foremost priorities are to enable the product team to make the most data-informed decisions possible, and to lead the product team in measuring the impact of their work. Embedded within the product department, you’ll interact on a regular basis with product managers and engineers in our Berlin, Amsterdam, and Barcelona offices. You will report to the product analytics manager.. In this role, you will …
  
  

* Manage the front-end data lifecycle, from defining event names and behavior to using product analytics tools to analyze the data.
* Conduct comprehensive quantitative analyses of customer behavior for product managers and product leadership to guide strategy and decision-making.
* Lead validation analysis (A/B experiments, quasi-experiments, time-series, and qualitative) in collaboration with product managers to validate the work they do has the desired impact.
* Empower the product team to explore and use data themselves through data democratization efforts.
* Support product leadership in making informed decisions by providing ad-hoc analysis and reports on product metrics.
* Be part of a small, high-performing team in one of the most exciting departments in the company.


WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR …
  
  

* Minimum of 2 years of experience as a Product Analyst, Data Analyst or similar.
* Advanced knowledge of SQL, Python or R.
* Experience in data visualization using tools like Amplitude, Looker, or similar.
* Experience conducting correlation and regression analyses.
* Experience in employing statistical analysis and doing experiments in a B2B context.
* Proficient in generating insights from data, and explaining these to both technical and non-technical audiences.
* Excellent stakeholder management skills and experience of interacting with diverse groups of stakeholders of varying seniority levels from different verticals.
* Fluency in English - written and spoken.


WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT…
  
  

At sennder, we want to maximize the individual potential of all employees and reinforce an inclusive culture and environment of continuous learning that empowers people to succeed as a team. In addition to humility, we value commitment, team spirit and respect to build fruitful collaboration across teams. Learn more about who we are on
  
  

* Fast growth scale-up with an international team of 1000+ people, 74+ nationalities spread across 11 European offices. With English as our common language, we are able to work together.
* Learning and development on the job and with the support of a bi-annual review process, learning allowance, high potential programs, sennder onboarding academy, and internal trainings.
* Various opportunities to connect with colleagues through regular team events and company get-togethers such as our highly anticipated sennder .
* Prioritize employee engagement and mental well-being by fostering a supportive environment through the Likeminded platform and conducting regular employee satisfaction surveys.
* Hybrid work model where you seamlessly merge virtual productivity and in-office collaboration with your colleagues.
* Commuter allowance to assist employees with their daily travel expenses and a one-time home office benefit to ensure that you're properly equipped wherever you work.
* Competitive compensation package including objective-based bonus, referral reward, and in some cases virtual option plan.


We value humility and we're as interested in your character as we are in your talent. Please apply, even if you feel you only meet part of our listed criteria. Diversity drives our innovation and we offer a collaborative, dynamic, and international work environment. Just be yourself. We are excited to meet you and for you to join us in shaping the future of the logistics industry in Europe.
  
  

If you have any questions or need special accommodation please reach out to us at ta@sennder.com. As soon as you apply your journey with sennder begins.

title: Support Analyst EDI
description:
Apollo Tyres Ltd is an international tyre manufacturer and the leading tyre brand in India. The company has multiple manufacturing units in India and a unit each in The Netherlands and Hungary. The company markets its products under its two global brands – Apollo and Vredestein, and its products are available in over 100 countries through a vast network of branded, exclusive and multi-product outlets.

**Job Title**: Support Analyst EDI  

**Location**: Amsterdam  

**Reports to (Position)**: Div Head Digital Product Management  

**Department/Function**: Sales Excellence

 **Description of the work area:**  

As Support Analyst for EDI you will be part of our Sales Excellence department. As part of your role you ensure that the electronic data interchange (EDI) with our Customer is functioning optimally. With this you will support the organization’s commercial operations by providing a reliable, efficient, and secure method for exchanging business documents electronically. In this role you will work closely with our digital IT and customer care teams across Europe. The role can be based out of Amsterdam (Netherlands) or Gyöngyöshalász (Hungary).

**What will be your role in more detail?**  

* Implement and maintain robust EDI systems.
* Commercial Process Support: Integrate EDI systems with commercial processes such as order processing, invoicing, and shipping. Collaborate with commercial teams to align EDI capabilities with business needs.
* Vendor and Partner Coordination
* Training and Support: Provide training and support to internal teams on EDI processes and systems to make them grow about the process and the technicity and progressively become power users
* Identify and implement improvements to EDI processes and systems.
* Reporting and Analysis: Generate and analyze reports on EDI activity and performance. Use data to identify trends, issues, and opportunities for process improvement.


  

**Do you have what it takes? (requirements)**  

* Technical Skills:
* EDI Standards Knowledge: Understanding of EDI standards such as ANSI X12, EDIFACT, and XML .
* EDI Software Proficiency: Experience with EDI software tools and platforms (e.g., IBM Sterling, SPS Commerce, GXS among others).
* ERP Systems Knowledge: Familiarity with ERP systems (SAP) and their integration with EDI.
* Master Data skills and basic knowledge in ERP system.
* Data Mapping and Translation: Skills in data mapping, translation, and transformation processes.
* Technical Troubleshooting: Ability to diagnose and resolve technical issues related to EDI systems.
* Communication Skills: Good verbal and written communication skills for interacting with internal teams, vendors, and partners.
* Analytical Skills: Strong problem-solving and analytical abilities to assess and address EDI system performance and issues.
* Customer Focus: Strong focus on meeting the needs of internal and external customers.

  

**What can you expect? (benefits)**  

* A dynamic and innovative environment
* Colleagues from all over the world
* A competitive compensation packages
* Participation in learning & development activities
* At least 24 holidays, holiday allowance, end year bonus and pension plan
* Hybrid work policy and support for home office set up

  

**Why join us?**  

We take pride in our commitment to being an equal opportunity employer, creating a workplace where diversity is celebrated, and talent thrives. It’s our belief that every individual brings unique perspectives that contribute to our success. Join our Sales Excellence team and be a part of an inclusive, dynamic, and innovative environment.  

  

Make a significant impact as we 'move' the world forward together.

title: Business Analyst - Data Sourcing
description:
Business Analyst - Data Sourcing**In het kort**
  

  

Does the idea of working in a team contributing to the strategic goal of the bank to have one source of truth for Risk and Finance excite you? Are you energised by the challenge of contributing to multiple critical initiatives with Data at their core? If so, then the role of Business Consultant F&R Data Sourcing is an interesting position for you!
  

  

**Je werk**
  

  

The Finance & Risk Data Sourcing team within the Data Domain is one voice of sourcing for the stakeholders in Finance and Risk towards reporting entities and data domains. As a Business Consultant, you need to understand financial products and how they are reflected in the systems of the bank. We are looking for an analyst with experience in the financial products and reporting related to these products. You will be liaising with stakeholders from different entities in the Bank in order to get the correct and prioritized integrated datasets onboarded to our Finance and Risk Data Domain. You are proactive in investigating requirements, supporting the creation of functional mappings and coordinating solutions for gap closures. You work with different data models and link them together for sourcing purposes. You will be the linking pin between the data user and the data owner to connect the data need to the data source. You will be working on the transition from the current way of sourcing to implement sourcing according to the Federated Data Governance Model.
  

  

**Werkomgeving**
  

  

The Finance & Risk Data Domain is part of Finance & Risk Business Grids (F&RBG), and plays an active role for all the Finance and Risk departments. We employ 250+ international professionals with different backgrounds who are driven to bring data management to a structurally higher level. Our aim is to generate reliable finance and risk data on time. We do this by improving the risk data itself, data systems and data processes. We work with an Agile operating model. Our Data Department Finance & Risk consists of 5 teams where the atmosphere is dynamic, open and informal.
  

  

You are part of the Finance & Risk Data Domain and will work in one of the teams of F&R Data Sourcing. You will report to the Expert Lead/Product Owner Entity Data Product & Data Distribution.
  

  

**Je profiel**
  

  

You have an interest and experience in delivery of (parts of) Data Platforms within Finance. You are a passionate, hard-working professional with an eye for details. You are able to execute assignments independently as well as interact directly with stakeholders when it comes to day-to-day matters.
  

  

Do you think you fit in with us? Check your profile:  

  

  

* You've successfully completed a higher professional education (Bsc.) or degree (WO/Msc.)
* 7-10 years of relevant work experience in a data domain, preferably in an Finance Reporting or Risk Management environment.
* You have in-depth exposure to the various banking products and can participate in data modelling activities combining this knowledge to the current and future sourcing models as they evolve
* You have knowledge of Data Management, including sourcing, transformation and preferably data lineage
* You are able to analyse data quality based on the agreed upon sourcing instructions and can recommend improvements to both the instructions and the quality checks where necessary
* You are a strong communicator with excellent stakeholder management.
* You are capable of giving and asking for feedback.
* You have worked in and/or with Scrum/DevOps teams.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English.
* PowerBI and SQL skills will be an added plus.

  

**Wij bieden**
  

  

A challenging environment offering you the possibility to develop yourself, both on contextual level in the Finance field of expertise. There are plenty of career opportunities to grow personally and professionally, which mainly depend on your own ambitions and interests. In addition, we offer:
  

* The gross monthly salary displayed above is based on a 36-hour work week, including vacation pay and benefit budget.
* The Benefit Budget is 11% of your salary. The Benefit Budget allows you to acquire additional employment benefits. If you make no purchases or reservations in the Benefit Shop in a given month, you are paid one twelfth of your Benefit Budget that month.
* Five weeks of vacation per year. You have the option to purchase an additional four weeks per year.
* Personal development Budget of € 1,000 per year, which you can accumulate up to € 3,000.
* Possibility to work from home (in consultation with your team and depending on your position).
* An annual public transport pass with free public transportation throughout the Netherlands.
* An excellent pension scheme.

  

**Interesse?**
  

  

Do not hesitate to approach us for more details, or apply directly! For more information contact Ivo Timmerman Expert Lead/Product Owner Entity Data Product & Data Distribution, via email: ivo.timmerman@nl.abnamro.com. We look forward to meeting you!
  

  

**Gelijke kansen voor iedereen**
  

  

Het succes van onze organisatie staat of valt met de kwaliteit van onze mensen en de ideeen die zij hebben. Echt verrassende inzichten en innovatieve oplossingen voor onze klanten ontstaan door een samenspel van culturen, kennis en ervaring. Daarom is diversiteit voor onze organisatie ontzettend belangrijk. Om ervoor te zorgen dat alle collega's binnen ABN AMRO hun kwaliteiten kunnen ontplooien, stimuleren we een inclusieve cultuur waarin iedereen zich betrokken en gewaardeerd voelt.
  

  

**Disclaimer externe recruitmentbureaus**
  

  

Externe recruitmentbureaus dienen een overeenkomst met ABN AMRO BANK N.V. te hebben getekend, uitgegeven door een Talent Acquisition Specialist, om cv's te mogen indienen. Acquisitie wordt daarom niet op prijs gesteld.
  

  

Lees meer
  

  

**Wie zijn je collega's?**
  

  

"Aan het begin van de coronacrisis hoefde een groot deel van onze klanten tijdelijk geen rente en aflossing over hun lening te betalen. Het voelt goed om ondernemers die het zwaar hebben te helpen."
  

Lees het verhaal
  

  

**Sander Cremers**
  

Portfolio Manager Financial Risk
  

  

"De financiële gegevens van alle afdelingen bundelen we tot begrijpelijke rapportages. Zo adviseren we het management over de financiële positie van het bedrijf."
  

Lees het verhaal
  

  

**Rosalie Tulen**
  

Junior Controller
  

  

"Je merkt heel duidelijk dat ABN AMRO in beweging is. Er zijn continu nieuwe projecten aan de gang, waarvan een groot deel met duurzaamheid te maken heeft."
  

Lees het verhaal
  

  

**Niels Vlaming**
  

Reporting Specialist
  

  

"Er is met data nu véél meer mogelijk dan een paar jaar geleden. Daar ligt de uitdaging voor mij."
  

Lees het verhaal
  

  

**Joep Timmermans**
  

Junior Accounting Data Analist
  

  

"De manier van denken is belangrijker dan direct alle antwoorden paraat te hebben. Het gaat er meer om wat je doet als je de antwoorden niet hebt."
  

Lees het verhaal
  

  

**Anna Zadorozhnaia**
  

Senior Data Scientist
Job ID 7250

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
Senior Data Scientist**At a glance**
  

  

ABN is looking for a Senior Data Scientist to improve our customers experience providing a more personalized touch in their day-to-day banking.
  

  

**Your job**
  

  

The candidate is expected to fulfil the following responsibilities fully independent and with great ownership.
  

* Design the analysis: explicitly plan the analysis, anticipate and address competing explanation, determine the best way to evaluate the intended results.
* Conduct analysis: wrangle and explore the data appropriately, visualize and present the exploration results; develop/apply and devise appropriate algorithms; work as a thought data and algorithms lead; identify and integrate new datasets that can be leveraged through the product capabilities; work closely with the data engineering team to strategize and execute the development of data products; help solve various problems and make a true impact across various business units and domains.
* Business implementation: Discover the needs of the business/user; package technical work for diverse audiences; navigate the business organization structure; build a business network ; communicate analytic solutions to stakeholders and implement improvements as needed to operational systems.
* Engineering integration: Develop data pipelines from and to different (cloud and no-cloud) locations; make work compatible with the operationalisation stack; apply hands-on knowledge of the MLOps practices; co-create solution architectures; bring analytical models into production by collaborating with the engineers, co-create solution architectures.
* Way of working (WoW): Shape and enforce the WoW of the team and align it with other teams; work independently; collaborate with others; continuous improvement mindset; Lead complex use case: Lead complex projects, particularly XFN (cross-functional) projects; helping and influencing the grids (tribes) in the business line and the business units to prioritize their roadmap for more data driven solutions.
* Build the profession: Present in internal meetings and knowledge sharing sessions, as well as external conferences, meetups, workshops, encourage the team and staff; able to mentor and lead other data scientists.

  

**Working environment**
  

  

The CoE is a comprehensive data & analytics team part of Customer and Digital Experience (CDE) in ABN AMRO. Within Customer & Digital Experience the online platforms are being created and built that offer all the digital products of ABN AMRO. All these developments and products are powered by the data & analytics of our CoE.
  

  

We strongly believe that online banking should be easier, faster, more delightful, and more personal to create sustainable long-term relationships with our customers. To do so, we develop suitable solutions that give our customers greater financial control. With a vast amount of data at hand, together with our unique usability lab as test-station we build digital services in an agile way that surprise customers and help them move forward. At Customer & Digital Experience you get the freedom and responsibility to improve our products & services. In other words, we encourage you to release your creativity and put it into practice. The environment is similar to a start-up atmosphere - feel free to wear your sneakers.
  

  

**Your profile**
  

  

The ideal candidate is expected to:
  

* Have a master's degree in computer science, engineering, mathematics, statistics; econometrics or related field;
* 7+ years of relevant industry experience
* Be able to analyse problems and strategize for better solutions
* Be comfortable in both a leadership and team-player role
* Be a creative problem solver who thrives when presented with a challenge
* Be goal-oriented, organized team player
* Good interpersonal skills and communication
* Expert in a wide arsenal of statistical, machine learning, deep learning and operation research techniques to help solve different classes of problems; having a deep knowledge of the models, their pitfall, knowing what types of transformations work best with them, being able to recommend, coach and convince other data scientists on the right technical approach, being able to balance between the model quality and the speed of delivery;
* Must have experience in defining and running experiments in the context of online marketing, being able to draw causal reasoning, evaluate the results and present to business stake holders;
* Comfort working in a dynamic environment with several ongoing concurrent projects; able to prioritize, and manage time effectively
* Experience with coaching and mentoring junior data scientists
* Up-to-date on the latest industry trends; able to articulate trends and potentials clearly and confidently
* Proficiency in using SQL, Python and PySpark.
* Knowledge of at least one of the cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, GCP)
* Experience in Banking and/or e-Commerce is a plus.

  

**We are offering**
  

  

We offer you a challenging position in a professional environment in which you get the opportunity to be the best version of yourself. You will be able to gain a lot of knowledge of the financial field and further develop your data science skills. We also offer the possibility to general and (specific) data science trainings. We offer you excellent terms of employment and benefits:
  

* A good monthly salary based on a 40-hour working week
* A position that offers a lot of opportunities for professional development
* The ability to work flexibly
* We help you to stay fit & vital
* An additional benefit budget of 11%, with which you can buy flexible terms of employment
* A personal development budget of € 1,000 per year
* An annual public transport ticket for unlimited travel
* A good pension scheme
* A great organization with a great work culture
* Interesting work and challenging projects
* A team that likes to help, supplement and strengthen each other

  

**Interested?**
  

  

Are you interested? Please respond to this vacancy now. For more information about the role, please contact Valerio Ciotti, Team Lead Data Science (valerio.ciotti@nl.abnamro.com). For more information about the recruitment process, please contact Nicay Hertogs (nicay.hertogs@nl.abnamro.com).
  

  

**The interview process**  

  

In the application we expect the candidate to highlight in their cover letter relevant experience of implementation of previous experiments and use cases.
  

  

First interview (1 hour): we will get to know each other during the first interview. Aim of the interview is to assess the level of seniority and the fit with the team. We will also spend some time explaining what we are working on.
  

  

Second interview (1 hour): There is a take home assignment. This is a modelling/data analysis, machine learning assignment designed to take a couple of hours to complete. Based on the outcome of the use case, we will invite you to present your results and test your technical knowledge on ML and statistics.
  

  

Third interview (45 min): Cultural fit and your interest in working in ABN.
  

  

**Equal opportunities for all**
  

  

The success of our organisation depends on the quality of our people and the ideas that they have. Truly surprising insights and innovative solutions for our clients result from an interplay of cultures, knowledge and experience. Diversity is therefore extremely important to our organisation. To ensure that everyone at ABN AMRO can develop their talents, we encourage an inclusive culture in which all colleagues feel engaged and appreciated.
  

  

**Disclaimer external recruitment agencies**
  

  

External recruitment agencies need to have a signed agreement with ABN AMRO BANK N.V., executed by a Talent Acquisition Specialist, when submitting a resume to a vacancy. No unsolicited services or offers, please.

title: Chapter lead Finance & Risk Data Domain Azure / Databricks
description:
Chapter lead Finance & Risk Data Domain Azure / Databricks**At a glance**
  

  

Are you a technical expert who inspires others to create innovative and quality solutions? Then we need your help in making ABN AMRO a personal bank in a digital age!
  

One of our strategic goals is to become a data-driven organization, so we can get to know our clients even better and serve them in a better way. As a chapter lead, you contribute to these goals by focusing on the IT craftmanship within your department. You stay up-to-date on the latest developments and you mentor your team members in becoming technical experts.
  

Our Engineers get the freedom to grow and experiment. You support and guide them so that they can grow their technical expertise that contributes to a future-proof bank. When and where you and your team do your work is up to you! We work hybrid, which means you can flexibly decide where and when you can work most comfortably and effectively.
  

As Chapter Lead, you will work at the department Finance & Risk Data domain. We operate on multiple data platforms like the Risk Analytics Platform and the CoDaC Platform, two Azure platforms used for credit risk data modelling purposes and non-financial risk analysis and reporting. Besides that we have platforms for Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) use cases, our FinTax platform to work on Tax authority regulatory requests and we are solving reconciliation challenges with our Finance & Risk Data Domain Store.
  

  

**Your job**
  

  

You will combine working as Data Engineer with your role as Chapter Lead. About 60% of the time, you will work in your own Scrum Team but also closely with Data Engineers and Data Analysts in other teams on designing and developing future-proof IT solutions of high quality.
  

The rest of the time you will manage your chapter.
  

  

This includes:
  

* Educating yourself and others with the right technical capabilities and the latest innovations.
* Mentoring your Chapter members on technical craftsmanship.
* Actively participating in knowledge gaining and sharing by joining triangles, circles, communities and events.
* Proper alignment with stakeholders. For example, informing leadership on the alignment you have with the Solution Engineer on the technological landscape and lifecycle.
* Working in an Agile environment and advocating the Agile and CICD processes.
* You mentor your Chapter, evaluate technical assessments, do interviews and ensure that new employees are properly onboarded.
* Take care of the HR processes to facilitate all aspects relating to the influx, development, performance and outflux of employees.
* Create and foster a healthy working environment and an inclusive culture for your Chapter.

  

**Working environment**
  

  

The Finance & Risk Data Domain is a young department within Finance. We are an ambitious and international group of people. We have embraced an Agile way of working where we strive towards a flat organization with self-organizing teams that have the autonomy to make quick decisions. The atmosphere in the teams and the department is open and informal. You will work in a diverse & inclusive team with many different nationalities, and a good balance in maturity. We work hard, but we also know how to have fun!
  

  

You will work in a fast paced and accessible environment. We love to share knowledge and to challenge each other, for example by sharing our expertise in our blog, during the events of our Engineering community and by organizing hackathons.
  

  

**Your profile**
  

  

You feel at home in a technical environment and are always up to date on the latest technologies. At the same time, you are people-minded and an inspirator. You get enthusiastic from creative and innovative solutions, and you inspire others to get started with these new opportunities.
  

Do you think you're a fit?
  

  

Check your profile:
  

* Expert in data engineering
* Experienced with cloud solutions and infrastructure (preferably Azure)
* Hands on with building data solutions with Big Data and Orchestration tooling (i.e. Databricks, Spark and Airflow)
* Deep understanding of data processes, data pipelines (ETL), and data lifecycle
* Good understanding of and experience with DevOps and CI/CD practices
* Experience with coaching and mentoring your less experienced team members in their design and development activities
* You have knowledge of and are interested in the latest IT-trends, both within and outside your area of expertise (Cloud, API, Open Banking, CI/CD, SOA, etc.)
* Having relevant certifications like Azure DP-203, PCAP for Python and Databricks Associate Data Engineering is a plus
* Fluent in English

  

**We are offering**
  

  

You are given every opportunity and independence to demonstrate your professional expertise in a no-nonsense environment and to further develop yourself. We attach great value to personal development and thereby offer you many training and development opportunities.
  

  

In addition:
  

* A Hay 10-12 salary.
* The freedom to optimize your performance in a flexible working environment.
* Possibilities for flexible working hours and good facilities for remote working.
* A supplementary benefit budget of 11% with which you can buy flexible benefits (including vacation days, mobile phone, (electric) bicycle and additional salary).
* 25 vacation days.
* Apart from the departmental training budget for the department you will receive a personal development budget of € 1.000 per year which can be save up to a maximum of € 3.000.
* An annual public transport pass.
* A generous pension scheme.
* Banking for better days. These are days you can use for your personal development or on which you can contribute to society.

  

**Interested?**
  

  

Are you interested? Then respond to this vacancy!
  

  

We would like to get to know you!
  

  

**Equal opportunities for all**
  

  

The success of our organisation depends on the quality of our people and the ideas that they have. Truly surprising insights and innovative solutions for our clients result from an interplay of cultures, knowledge and experience. Diversity is therefore extremely important to our organisation. To ensure that everyone at ABN AMRO can develop their talents, we encourage an inclusive culture in which all colleagues feel engaged and appreciated.
  

  

**Disclaimer external recruitment agencies**
  

  

External recruitment agencies must have signed an agreement with ABN AMRO BANK N.V., issued by a Talent Acquisition Specialist, in order to submit CVs. Acquisition is therefore not appreciated.
  

  

Lees meer
  

  

**Wie zijn je collega's?**
  

  

"Er zijn altijd nieuwe systemen en technieken die wij kunnen inzetten bij ons werk. We zijn telkens aan het innoveren, daardoor blijf ik mezelf uitdagen."
  

Lees het verhaal
  

  

**Aaron Kieboom**
  

Software-ontwikkelaar
  

  

"Wiskunde gaat over problemen oplossen met logica, niet over getallen. In mijn werk gaat vooral om het menselijk gedrag achter de cijfers. Dat voorspel ik met de modellen die ik bouw."
  

Lees het verhaal
  

  

**Bartjan Happel**
  

IT-engineer (QRM-expert)
  

  

"We hebben zo veel technieken en programmeertalen in huis. En we ontwikkelen steeds weer nieuwe producten. Als IT'er kun je bij ABN AMRO onmogelijk vastroesten."
  

Lees het verhaal
  

  

**Benthe Hagemeijer**
  

IT engineer Tikkie
  

  

"Wereldwijd is ABN AMRO een van de drie grootste clearing-partijen. Toch is ons team niet enorm, dát maakt het zo uniek om hier te werken."
  

Lees het verhaal
  

  

**Marcus van Bergen**
  

Software Engineer

title: Quantitative Credit Risk Analyst
description:
Quantitative Credit Risk Analyst**At a glance**
---------------


P&BB BC&E is focussing on Self Directed Lending to provide an automated, digitized and futureproof lending journey. This proposition is supported by a Program Lending approach, Program Lending is a highly automated way of originating, assessing, maintaining and collecting credits. Program Lending portfolios are supported by advanced levels of automation and decision support systems, based on application and behavioural scoring models, as well as flexible and comprehensive Management Information Systems.

**Your job**
------------


You will be responsible that the Program Lending Life cycle is pro-actively managed. You analyse data obtained from complex data files, combine data with other sources, and interpret this to obtain valuable information for the business. You develop models and use them to visualise bottlenecks or specific opportunities. You produce reports, opinions and analysis in which you draw conclusions and make recommendations for senior management and relevant risk committees.

**Working environment**
-----------------------


Based on a long-term vision we are working on optimization and growth of the SME Program Lending portfolios. Starting point of Program Lending is a strategic plan, a product program. This product program covers all parts of the credit life cycle. The credit life cycle is pro-actively managed to assess risks and determine commercial opportunities. To ensure a well- managed program lending experience end state solutions are being planned. In the meanwhile the current Program Lending portfolios needs to be managed ensuring a proper risk return is in place and growth plans are aligned with a moderate risk intake.

* We like people think of their feet and make things happen. Don’t wait for instruction and let’s get the things done.
* We want to hire people who are seeking to deeply understand our customers and their context based on factual data and analytics.
* We love working with people who are open-minded, bring diversity and jump at the opportunity to build a great team together.
**Your profile**
----------------


Qualifications and Skills:

* University of applied sciences (HBO) or academic (WO) degree
* At least 5 years of experience within banking
* A thorough understanding of Program/Retail Lending including the model landscape
* Passionate about analytics and data, experienced with BI tooling
* Good stakeholder management
* Great communicator in English
* Highly motivated and ambitious
**We are offering**
-------------------


We want you to help us to further shape the future of program lending and truly enable entrepreneurs to make an impact in society. We like to learn from your experiences and personal perspective on our challenges. We offer you the opportunity to work in a dynamic environment where there is room for growth within and outside of your expertise.

* The opportunity to be the best you can be, work flexible hours and lots of room to grow both personally and professionally
* The opportunity to pro-actively work on your vitality and fitness
* A personal development budget of EUR 1.000 per year
* An annual public transportation pass
* A solid pension plan
**Interested?**
---------------


Does this sound like something you’d be interested in? Send us your application as soon as possible. To find out more, contact Alexander Ackema, Head of Risk & Program Lending SME +31 630497899.

**Equal opportunities for all**
-------------------------------


The success of our organisation depends on the quality of our people and the ideas that they have. Truly surprising insights and innovative solutions for our clients result from an interplay of cultures, knowledge and experience. Diversity is therefore extremely important to our organisation. To ensure that everyone at ABN AMRO can develop their talents, we encourage an inclusive culture in which all colleagues feel engaged and appreciated.

**Disclaimer external recruitment agencies**
--------------------------------------------


External recruitment agencies must have signed an agreement with ABN AMRO BANK N.V., issued by a Talent Acquisition Specialist, in order to submit CVs. Acquisition is therefore not appreciated.

### **Wij vragen**

* Een motiverende kracht

### **Wij bieden**

* Analytische skills
company_description: Bij ABN AMRO hebben we een duidelijke purpose: Banking for better, for generations to come. Samen met onze klanten gaan we de uitdagingen van onze tijd aan en geven we vorm aan de toekomst.

title: Market & Business Analyst
description:
**Organisation**

**Position**


Market & Business Analyst

**Vacancy ref**


83586

**Based in**


Zoetermeer

**Business area**


Renewables

**Contract type**


Staff

**Closing date**


20/09/2024


  
Vacancy information

**Market & Business Analyst**



We are **Seaway7**, a diverse group of team players, change makers and leaders in the delivery of offshore wind projects. What we do makes a difference to our planet and the future, by bringing sustainable, renewable energy to the world.



We are looking for a full-time **Market & Business Analyst** to join our **Commercial** **Department** in **Zoetermeer, The Netherlands**.



The **Market & Business Analyst** will report to the Market Analysis & Business Planning Manager, who is part of the Chief Commercial Officer’s department.



The **Market & Business Analyst** role is very diverse with significant exposure to senior management. The role amongst others includes the delivery of market and strategy analyses to support management decisions as well as the preparation of numerous reports and presentations. The role involves engagement with many global stakeholders with the commercial organization, including preparation of business-critical information for senior management.

  


**What you will be doing**


* Conduct market analyses to identify key market trends.
* Benchmark internal data with external market research and provide variation analyses.
* Develop supply/demand models and forecasts on the construction vessels market.
* Ensure that senior management and key stakeholders are fully informed about implications of research and monitoring models.
* Internally maintain the technical part of the CRM tool (Client 365) (including testing, proposing improvements, etc.) and monitor the CRM database with a focus on data quality and integrity.
* Track, investigate and register the financial and operational performance of peer competitors (competitor analysis).
* Track and register the financial and portfolio performance of clients (client analysis).
* Support senior management with relevant market and strategy presentations, including.
* Participate in the short-term and long-term strategic planning of Seaway7.
* Support Business Development and Tendering with relevant market, country and client presentations.
* Automate commercial reporting using Power BI and creating dashboards for management.
* Transfer current Power BI database to a new Power BI database due to IT development changes.
* Develop and ensure the delivery of the Annual Budget Plan and subsequent monthly forecast and reporting.
* Work closely with Finance and Project departments to ensure alignment on finance for forecasting

  


**What you will bring to the team**



It’s the commitment and enthusiasm of our people that gives us our energy to create change and make an impact for the future. And we want you to bring your personality, skills and experience, powering us to be leaders in offshore wind.


* A bachelor’s degree in Finance, Business Administration or Engineering combined with an enthusiasm for data management and a commercial business interest.
* 3-4 years working experience within a complex market environment.
* High proficiency in English language.
* Able to prepare high quality, engaging presentations and reports suitable for a senior audience review
* Highly developed social and communication proficiencies, enabling articulate interactions across the organization's hierarchy
* Able to seek and obtain information from diverse sources
* Experience with data management and commercial mindset
* Operating with the highest standard of integrity, preserving the confidentiality of the information available with the role
* Able to be responsive in an environment of continuous improvements
* Proficient user Microsoft Office tools (especially Microsoft Excel)
* Advanced user of data management and data visualization tools (PowerBI)
* Capable of progressing tasks autonomously with minimal supervision.
* Technical background or interests with exposure to maritime or offshore industry is preferred.


At times, there may be specific qualifications we’re looking for, but we also recognise the power of transferrable skills, so if you feel you have some of the relevant skills and experience we’re looking for, we want to hear from you.

  


**What we can offer you**



We offer the opportunity to create a future to be proud of, for generations to come. Whatever the role, wherever the location, everyone plays a part.



And when we say everyone, we mean everyone. Because we believe that it’s our team spirit that makes us special. Whether we’re getting stuck in, overcoming a challenge, or celebrating a success, we always do it together.



Alongside this, we’re continually creating the environment for you to be at your best – in and outside of work. This includes:


* **Career development** – access to a range of learning opportunities, as well as being part of a culture that encourages growth and development.
* **Flexible working** – everyone has commitments, responsibilities and passions outside of work. With a range of patterns available including hybrid, part-time or flexitime working, let’s discuss how we make time for what matters to you.
* **A holistic benefits package** – we pride ourselves in offering a wide range of benefits that support your financial, emotional, and physical wellbeing.

  


**The next steps**



If you would like to apply for this role, simply click the ‘Apply’ button found on this page.



You may be prompted to set up a profile with us. It’s quick and easy to do. Or, if you have already created a profile with us, simply log in and submit your application.



Once you have submitted your application, we will be in touch as soon as possible with next steps.



To find out more about Seaway7, please visit our website.



You can also follow us on our social channels, LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram and YouTube.
