title: Data Engineer
description:
**Palm is a company that welcomes applicants from all backgrounds!**

*Join us at Palm, a well-funded, early-stage fintech startup, on a mission to guide the world’s money flows. As part of our founding team of treasurers, finance specialists, and engineers, you'll help build a world-class treasury management system for enterprises.*

*Are you ready to build and own the data intra function from the ground up? Based in Amsterdam or Stockholm and open to mostly remote work? We want to hear from you!*

 **About Palm engineering**


Engineering at Palm today consists of a team of five engineers with diverse engineering and cultural backgrounds. We are located in Amsterdam and Stockholm, mostly working remotely with frequent gatherings in one of our locations or at off-sites where it is warmer and sunnier ️


The engineering team has been working together since November 2023 so there is still a lot of opportunities for high impact work as well as playing an important role in further shaping the engineering organisation and culture.


Palm Engineering is defined by our principles:



* **Bias to Action:** In the face of uncertainty, we prototype fast and often.


* **Open Communication:** We courageously voice concerns to realign our direction as needed.


* **Passion for Challenges:** We love the problem and embrace challenges.



In order to achieve this we lean on a culture of collaboration and knowledge sharing, where curiosity, respect and openness are some of our guiding principles. We truly value diversity and are happy to have our perspectives challenged. And of course, let’s have fun together!

**Our tech stack**

* **Data Pipelines:** Python, BigQuery
* **Database:** PostgreSQL
* **Cloud:** GCP
* **Version Control:** Git
* We are continuously iterating and exploring technologies as we go - so there’s more to come!

**How will you make an impact?**


After receiving a strong customer response of our data-intensive features, we now want to elevate them to the next level. In this role, you will be responsible for setting up the foundation for Palm's data infrastructure, collaborating with our ML engineer to deploy ML models and data pipelines to production, developing internal tools for various stakeholders to interact with data, and building infrastructure to monitor and improve performance. You’ll likely bring in new technologies to accomplish this.


Your role will involve close collaboration with engineers, designers, and founders (who bring expertise from Fintech & Treasury) to determine how Data can best serve Palm’s customers.

**Our wish list**


We are looking for a proactive and eternally curious person with a love for learning new things. The successful candidate will have experience maintaining production-level ML solutions and possess solid software engineering and ML principles. Strong Python and SQL skills are essential. You will likely have 5+ years of experience in software engineering, data science, or machine learning, including at least 2 years in data engineering or MLOps. We highly value the ability to collaborate effectively, a clear sense of ownership and clear communication. Experience with GCP would be a nice bonus, but it's not required.

 **Benefits of working at Palm**

* **Travel:** Meet all your new colleagues at quarterly offsites - the last 3 were in Lisbon, Stockholm & Amsterdam.
* **WeWork Membership:** Work from home is our go-to - we love spending time with friends and family instead of commuting. We have WeWork memberships for when you want to escape into the city.
* **Stock Options:** Own a large chunk of Palm and reap the rewards as you help us grow the company to a global player.
* **Pension & Health Insurance**: Best-in-class local insurances and pension schemes so you don't have to worry.
* **Wellness Stipend:** 500 EUR in annual wellness benefits - gyms, massages, you name it.

title: Data Engineer
description:
Data Engineer**At a glance**
---------------


Are you looking for an exciting work in the area of data and integration, then we have the right opportunity for you. We offer high quality data engineering with realtime, batch and streaming integration capability to grow.


We have a large application landscape that deals with million of records (incoming and outgoing). Azure based components are created to integrate the time critical CRM SAAS applications with multiple other systems via Realtime, batch and streaming interfaces. Data driven methodology is used to drive the innovation.


Are you a technical expert with strong data engineering background and enthusiastic person who inspires others to create innovative solutions?


Then we need your help, in making ABN AMRO a personal bank in a digital age!

**Your job**
------------


You will be part of the Data and Integration team in the CRM GRID, who's main goal is to create an data innovations and enterprise integration layer for connecting and transferring data to Microsoft dynamics SAAS Application and other syetems of the bank.


In this role, you will be developing and implementing data pipelines , Streaming based integrations that deliver/consume data from multiple sources, apply needed transformations and transfer the data to target systems. You will be responsible for developing and reviewing software solutions that are deployed in the Azure Cloud using a variety of technologies such as: ADLS, ADF, Databricks, Azure Functions, Apache Kafka, COSMOS,etc. among others.


You will be part of diverse Agile/Scrum DevOps team and have end-to-end responsibility, on behalf of the business and clients, for developing, managing, and maintaining functionalities in the CRM area.


API's and Streaming are nice to have requirements.

**Working environment**
-----------------------


At ABN AMRO, we strive to be a personal bank in a digital age. That strategy is also brought to life in how we work ourselves. Hence, we offer hybrid working as the new normal. This offers you the flexibility to decide when and where can work most comfortably and effectively. Of course, we offer you the right resources you need to set up a good home office. For example, an ergonomic chair, desk, and laptop.

**Your profile**
----------------


You feel being data engineer from your heart and comfortable with technical environment and are always up to date on the latest technologies. Do you think you're a fit? Check your profile:

* Good data engineering skills with Azure knowledge. DP-203 is also preferred.
* Experience in working with Azure in large scale environments.
* Knowledge on designing and developing applications in the Azure Cloud.


Tooling:

* Big Data Technologies: Apache Spark, Databricks
* Programming Languages: Python, Scala, SQL
* Cloud Technologies: Microsoft Azure
* Workflow Automation: , Azure Data Factory, Databricks Workflows
* Database: MySQL, Azure SQL Databases
* Azure Cosmos DB, streaming, azure functions (can be learned)

  

Soft skills:

* English proficiency
* Working experience with Scrum/Agile principles
* Good communicator.
**We are offering**
-------------------

* The Benefit Budget is 11% of your salary. The Benefit Budget allows you to acquire additional employment benefits. If you make no purchases or reservations in the Benefit Shop in a given month, you are paid one twelfth of your Benefit Budget that month.
* Five weeks of vacation per year. You have the option to purchase an additional four weeks per year.
* Personal development Budget of € 1,000 per year, which you can accumulate up to € 3,000.
* Possibility to work from home (in consultation with your team and depending on your position).
* An annual public transport pass with free public transportation throughout the Netherlands.
* An excellent pension scheme.
**Equal opportunities for all**
-------------------------------

**Disclaimer external recruitment agencies**
--------------------------------------------

### **Wij bieden**

* Analytische skills

### **Wij vragen**

* Een creatief brein
company_description: Bij ABN AMRO hebben we een duidelijke purpose: Banking for better, for generations to come. Samen met onze klanten gaan we de uitdagingen van onze tijd aan en geven we vorm aan de toekomst.

title: BACK-END JAVA DEVELOPER (JAVA 17+, SPRING BOOT, JPA/HIBERNATE, SQL, REST)
description:
Waarom Werken bij Qualogy?


Direct een vast contract als IT-consultant
Opleidingsbudget van €1500 - €2500 bij dienstverband
Inspirerende interim IT-opdrachten
  
10056
For our client in Amsterdam we are looking for a **Back-end Java Developer (Java 17+, Spring Boot, JPA/Hibernate, SQL, REST)**

  

We are looking for a DevOps engineer who likes to level up our team.


We work Agile in DevOps squads whom are fully responsible for their application from A to Z, this means that feedback and fast learning is a critical part of your day to day job. We believe that feedback is essential for growth and put high value on effective feedback skills. We have an open


culture to facilitate this and short lines to ensure support for valuable feedback. This requires that you work intensely together with your college's inside and outside your squad.

 **Team/application description**


The Account Information System stores all account data, including transaction information. It processes internal and external account statements, and services this to other systems. The applications are based upon Spring Boot, built and deployed from an Azure DevOps pipeline into a private OpenShift cloud.


The team uses Azure DevOps for their daily work (issue tracking & CICD).

 **Expected technical skills**


Java 17+ with hands-on experience


Spring Boot 3


JPA/Spring Data JPA/Hibernate


SQL


Experience with SCRUM and embracing it


REST


JUnit and Mockito


Docker & Containerization

 **Preferred skills**


Understanding and applying the SOLID principles


OpenShift/Kubernetes knowledge is a plus


Azure DevOps knowledge is a plus


Microsoft SQL Server experience is a plus


SOAP Webservices is a plus


Grafana (dashboard maintenance) is a plus

 **Knowledge**


Devops responsibilities: you build it, you run it


We expect work delivered with full test coverage


We also expect new features to be reviewed & tested by peers

 **Soft skills**


English language professional level


Dutch language is a plus


Communication skills while being a team player: get over yourself and be ready to discuss, explain, argue and reach a consensus in a constructive, friendly and fun way.


Transparency, multiple eye reviews are enforced. Even Rockstars will have to explain what they are doing.


Result oriented and focused: the backlog is big, finish stories. The perfect way is not the only way, nor is a rush job.


Problem solver, be able to handle a complex cloud microservice system with lots of configuration.


  
**WAT GAAT ER GEBEUREN?**
-------------------------


1
Jij reageert op een openstaande opdracht


Ontvangen! Binnen 3 werkdagen krijg jij een reactie van ons.


2
Op de koffie bij onze accountmanager


Zodra de opdrachtgever heeft aangegegeven dat ze het zien zitten, kom je kennismaken met onze accountmanager. Die vertelt jou alles over de opdrachtgever, de opdracht en de technische omgeving.


3
Kennismaking bij de opdrachtgever


Je gaat op locatie langs bij de opdrachtgever om kennis te maken.


4
Aan de slag!


Zijn de opdrachtgever én jij blij met de match? Dan ga je aan de slag! Wij nemen contact met je op om de laatste administratieve zaken te regelen.

title: Data Center Critical Facilities Engineer Level V
description:
**Who are we?**


Equinix is the world’s digital infrastructure company®, operating over 250 data centers across the globe. Digital leaders harness Equinix's trusted platform to bring together and interconnect foundational infrastructure at software speed. Equinix enables organizations to access all the right places, partners and possibilities to scale with agility, speed the launch of digital services, deliver world-class experiences and multiply their value, while supporting their sustainability goals.

  


Joining our operations team means that you will be at the forefront of all we do, maintaining critical facilities infrastructure as part of a close-knit team delivering best-in-class service to our data center customers. We embrace diversity in thought and contribution and are committed to providing an equitable work environment that is foundational to our core values as a company and is vital to our success.



Data Center Critical Facilities Engineer Level V
We are currently seeking a dynamic and experienced individual for the role of Critical Facilities Engineer Level V(5). In this role, you will have the opportunity to take a leading position within the team and use your technical expertise to guide and develop others. You will act as a support for your supervisors and lead by example, playing the pivotal role of coach to those who need it on the team.


Alongside this, your responsibilities are to maintain and ensure the technical operation of all key infrastructure within the Equinix data centres, ensuring that preventive and corrective maintenance is carried out in a timely and correct manner. You will work closely with subcontractors and be a point of technical reference for those around you.


If you are a motivated and focused professional who thrives on change and is looking to inspire and develop others, this is the perfect opportunity for you.


Your tasks include:

* Coaching of the team in both technical and soft skills
* Acting as a support to tasks delegated by your supervisors manager
* Being a point of contact for others taking onboard others different needs and communication styles
* Maintenance of the Technical Facility Management infrastructure (electrical, mechanical, security, control systems, fire and security systems)
* Monitoring alarms and responding to notifications
* Performing preventive and corrective maintenance
* Analyzing failures and proposing improvements to increase infrastructure availability
* Taking proactive actions and documenting work orders in the Asset Management System (Maximo)
* Operating the technical infrastructure safely and efficiently
* Participating in various projects from modification to new construction, including drafting technical specifications, evaluating quotes, and providing advice for contract awards
* Coordinating work according to Equinix procedures
* Providing daily, weekly, and monthly status reports to the Technical Facility Manager
* Training new employees and sharing knowledge within the CFE team
* Supporting new installations (customer installations)
* Ensuring procedures are followed to achieve the highest level of service

**Your profile:**

* Minimum completed MBO education (preferably in a technical field)
* Keen to upskill and develop leadership qualities
* Demonstrable work experience as a maintenance technician, facility manager, or service engineer
* Proficiency in both Dutch and English (spoken and written)
* Service-oriented and solution-focused
* Willingness to work on-call shifts
* Experience in project management
* Motivated and flexible
* Based in Amsterdam

**What We Offer:**

* A competitive salary based on knowledge and experience.
* 27 days of leave with the option to purchase 3 additional days.
* A pension scheme.
* A share savings program with a discount scheme.
* Lunch provided on location.
* Comprehensive support for personal development and growth, both in terms of time and financial resources.


Equinix is committed to ensuring that our employment process is open to all individuals, including those with a disability. If you are a qualified candidate and need assistance or an accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.


Equinix is an Equal Employment Opportunity and, in the U.S., an Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to unlawful consideration of race, color, religion, creed, national or ethnic origin, ancestry, place of birth, citizenship, sex, pregnancy / childbirth or related medical conditions, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital or domestic partnership status, age, veteran or military status, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, political / organizational affiliation, status as a victim or family member of a victim of crime or abuse, or any other status protected by applicable law.
company_description: Equinix is the world’s digital infrastructure company, operating 200+ data centers across the globe and providing interconnections to all the key clouds and networks.

title: Assistant Professor in Data and Artificial Intelligence
description:
**Job description**
-------------------


We are looking for suitable candidates with passion for AI research and education. Priority will be given to candidates with a strong research track record and teaching experience in areas such as Explainable AI, AI for Text mining, NLP and LLMs, and AI robustness and reliability.


**Data and AI cluster (DAI)**


You will join the team of the Data and Artificial Intelligence cluster. At DAI we study foundations of AI for the present and the future. We design new AI methods, develop AI algorithms and tools with a view at expanding the reach of AI and its generalization abilities. In particular, we study foundational issues of robustness, safety, fairness, trust, reliability, tractability, scalability, interpretability and explain ability of AI.


Currently, DAI includes six research groups: Uncertainty in AI, Generative AI, Data Mining, Databases, ML for Physical Sciences, and Automated ML. The cluster consists of 3 full professors, 3 associate professors, 12 full-time assistant professors and 7 part-time and adjunct assistant professors affiliated with industry labs including DeepMind, Wayve, TomTom, Oracle labs. The cluster houses 50+ PhD candidates and postdocs, 8 AI Engineers and support staff.


DAI research is regularly published at top AI journals and conferences such as IJCAI, AAAI, ICML, ECMLPKDD, ICDM, NeurIPS, VLDB, and SIGMOD among others. Recently our work was recognized with the best paper awards, including Best Research Paper Award at VLDB 2024, SIGMOD 2023 (Research Highlight Award and Best Industry Paper Award), Best Demo Paper Award of IEEE ICDE 2023, IDA 2023 Runner-up Frontier Prize, Best Paper Award of LoG 2022, and Best Research Paper Award IEEE DSAA 2022 among others. Please refer to https://dai.win.tue.nl/newsitems/ for other highlights.


DAI is active in foundational and application-inspired research supported by NWO, H2020, other funding bodies and industry (ASML, KPN, Philips, TomTom, Rabobank). Example projects can be found at https://dai.win.tue.nl/researchprojects/.


DAI is actively involved in teaching in the Bachelor, Master and postgraduate level education of students in AI, Data Science and Computer Science. An overview of courses can be found at https://dai.win.tue.nl/courses/ and examples of MSc thesis projects at https://dai.win.tue.nl/masterprojects/. We regularly attract many talented students who are interested both research and engineering focused education. Their work receive recognition through publications and university and national level best MSc thesis awards.


Please do not hesitate to approach members of DAI at ECMLPKDD 2024 and NeurIPS 2024 to discuss our research, education and working environment.


**Job requirements**
--------------------

* Motivated researcher with a PhD in machine learning, data mining, or other relevant field.
* Ability to conduct high-quality academic research reflected in demonstratable outputs.
* Motivated to teach, contribute to teaching processes, and to develop excellent teaching skills.
* Strong cooperation skills.
* Effective communication and leadership skills, including coaching and mentoring of students and staff, leading a project or chairing a group.
* Excellent (written and verbal) proficiency in English.

**Conditions of employment**
----------------------------


A meaningful job in a dynamic and ambitious university, in an interdisciplinary setting and within an international network. You will work on a beautiful, green campus within walking distance of the central train station. In addition, we offer you:


* An 18-month contract as Assistant Professor which can become permanent after 12 months on the same employment level upon successful evaluation.
* The opportunity to focus your career on education, research and/or impact. You can develop your personal ambitions and objections within the strategic objectives of the university.
* As an Irène Curie Fellow, you are entitled to a substantial start-up package to kick-off your career.
* Salary in accordance with the *Collective Labour Agreement* for Dutch Universities, scale 11 (min. €4492, max. €6148 gross per month).
* A year-end bonus of 8.3% and annual vacation pay of 8%.
* A dedicated mentoring program to help you get to know the university and the Dutch (research) environment.
* High-quality training programs for academic leadership and teaching.
* An excellent technical infrastructure, on-campus children's day care and sports facilities.
* Partially paid parental leave and an allowance for commuting, working from home and internet costs.
* A Staff Immigration Team is available for international candidates, as are a tax compensation scheme (the 30% facility) and partner career support.

**Information and application**
-------------------------------

**About us**

Eindhoven University of Technology is an internationally top-ranking university in the Netherlands that combines scientific curiosity with a hands-on attitude. Our spirit of collaboration translates into an open culture and a top-five position in collaborating with advanced industries. Fundamental knowledge enables us to design solutions for the highly complex problems of today and tomorrow.  

  

We believe that diversity broadens our research scope and enhances the quality of our education. Our Irène Curie Fellowship aims to advance talented female researchers, in order to thrive and be successful in top positions in science, contributing to the societal goal of promoting equal opportunities. The program addresses the aspirations and needs of women in industry, academia, and research institutes in order to support their ambition to become a professor at our university.  

  

**Information**

Do you recognize yourself in this profile and would you like to know more? Please contact prof. dr. Mykola Pechenizkiy, m.pechenizkiy@tue.nl or +31 40 247 4977.  

  

Visit our website for more information about the application process or the conditions of employment. You can also contact Hella Ploegmakers, Senior Recruiter, h.a.m.ploegmaker@tue.nl or +31 643559625.


Are you inspired and would like to know more about working at TU/e? Please visit our career page.


**Application**


This vacancy is part of the Irène Curie Fellowship and is currently only open to female candidates.


We invite you to submit a complete application.  

The application should include a:


* Cover letter in which you describe your motivation and qualifications for the position.
* Curriculum vitae, including a list of your publications and the contact information of three references.
* Description of your scientific interests and plans (1-2 pages).
* Statement of your teaching goals and experience (1-2 pages).


We look forward to receiving your application and will screen it as soon as possible. The vacancy will remain open until the position is filled.

title: Senior Consultant - Data Governance Platform Engineer
description:
We have an exciting opportunity for a Data Governance Platform Engineer position within our Digital Engineering team. As a key member of our team, you will play a significant role in delivering innovative data governance solutions to our clients. Our newly built Digital Engineering team is highly focused on Cloud, Software, Data and user experience engineering and is experiencing rapid growth within our organization. By joining this dynamic team, you will have the opportunity to contribute to cutting-edge projects and play a key role in driving the success of our clients, particularly within the financial sector. Our goal is to become the go-to end-to-end technology partner for the largest financial institutions and organizations, positioning ourselves on the speed dial of decision-makers in the industry.

 ***The opportunity*** *- What future are you building towards?*


At EY, we offer a unique opportunity to build a career as a digital engineer. Join Digital Engineering Team and contribute to shaping a better working world through the power of technology and innovation. Utilize your expertise and collaborate with global teams as you work on impactful projects and play a crucial role in solving complex challenges. We are seeking a skilled and versatile Data Governance Platform Engineer to join our team. The successful candidate will be responsible for developing, implementing, and maintaining data governance applications. Your expertise in Python, Data Governance Tooling (Collibra), micro-services, DevOps, cloud platforms, and Java will be key in driving our projects to success. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, ensuring the development and delivery of high-quality, scalable, and secure software solutions.

 ***Responsibilities*** *– How can you make a lasting impact in a rapidly changing world?*

* Develop and maintain data governance platforms (Collibra), APIs, and databases to support client projects and initiatives.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design technical solutions and ensure seamless integration between data governance tooling and data platforms like Azure, AWS, GCP, Snowflake, etc.
* Implement scalable and efficient code in languages such as Java, .NET, or Python, while adhering to industry best practices and coding standards.
* Contribute to the entire software development lifecycle, including requirements gathering, software design, testing, deployment, and maintenance.
* Identify and resolve technical issues and challenges, ensuring high-quality and reliable software deliverables.

 ***Job requirements*** *– Where do you start if you want to change the world?*

* Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Information Science or a related field.
* Proven experience as a code development, including hands-on coding and development in Java/Python and a data governance tool (Collibra)
* Proficiency in database management systems, such as SQL or NoSQL.
* Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git), software testing methodologies, and agile development processes.
* Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to handle complex technology challenges.
* Strong communication and collaboration skills to effectively work with cross-functional teams.
* Experience with at least one cloud platform (Azure, AWS or GCP).

 **Preferred qualifications**

* Knowledge of microservices architecture and related frameworks (e.g., Spring Boot / Flask).
* Knowledge of Microsoft Purview
* Understanding of DevOps principles and tools for continuous integration and deployment.
* Knowledge of Datawarehouse
* Certified Data Management Professional (e.g. DAMA or DCAM)
* Knowledge of Infrastructure as Code

 **Already interested? Apply now!**

 ***What we offer*** *– Is everything that counts being counted?*


We offer you an attractive employment package that rewards individual and team achievements:

* + Vitality: the choice is yours. An online session with an external vitality coach, practical tips on topics such as nutrition, energy, sleep and mindset, a discount at Healthcity and/or a voucher card to rent a padel court.
	+ Flexible working: you decide where and when you work in consultation with your team. At home, at the office, at the client or from another European country (up to 20 working days per year).
	+ Home office arrangement: to optimize your home office, EY provides the following resources for you: office chair, sit/stand desk, an external monitor, a desk lamp, a (Bluetooth) headset, and a large external keyboard.
	+ Birth leave: EY will pay 100% of the birth leave, in the case of an additional birth leave, EY will pay 70% of the salary.


For a full overview of our employment package click here: Hoe het is om bij ons te werken | EY – Global | EY - Nederland

 ***The Office***


Our office in Amsterdam is located in the Zuidas, a bustling area where many businesses are situated. In our Cross Towers, Anouchka welcomes up to 1.000 people every day upon arrival. Haven't had breakfast yet? Taib will make his special smoothie for you or simply a delicious cappuccino. During the lunch break, the team of Hans and Mehdi will be ready with a fresh lunch for you. For a breathtaking view of Amsterdam, head to the 22nd floor. Collaborating takes on a new meaning with the Wavespace. This high-tech environment brings clients and colleagues together virtually from all over the world!

 ***Recruitment procedure*** *– How can you prepare for a long life together?*


the selection procedure exists out of 2 interview rounds and an assessment

  

Due to laws and regulations, and because EY (and in some cases its clients) has high demands on the reliability and integrity of its employees, every new employee will be screened. Depending on your rank the pre-employment screening could contain the following: Certificate of Conduct (in Dutch: VOG) or - if requesting a Dutch VOG is not possible - Criminal Background Check of the country you are currently living or have lived during the last five years, integrity questionnaire, verification of ID, diploma’s and/or work experience and consultation of the Dutch insolvency registry.
company_description: At EY, we are committed to building a better working world.

title: Personal Trainer
description:
Ultimate Performance (U.P.) is the only international Personal Training business in the world. We are widely regarded as the fitness industry’s leading Personal Trainers from providing the most consistent high-level results, transformations and lifestyle changes time and time again.

We are currently looking to expand our fantastic team of Personal Trainers at our U.P. Amsterdam gym!

You can be as green and new to the industry as they come. Our goal would be to educate and mould you as one of the future leaders of U.P., just as we have already done with some of the Trainers who joined us as Juniors on our first Junior Training Scheme in 2012.

We are a meritocracy and only care about your ability to get the job done and your overall potential.

ATTITUDE IS EVERYTHING. Aptitude can be taught but you do need to look hard at yourself before you apply to U.P. We are not an easy company to work for because we demand that you deliver your very best performance every single time. This is the U.P. way and it is a non-negotiable quality that we are looking for.

Alongside the right attitude, to even be considered for one of our coveted positions, we are looking for individuals who can demonstrate:

* Relentless hard work.
* That you are not frightened to reflect inwards and examine your motives.
* That you seek out and continue to learn from your own mistakes.
* An investment in others.
* Ambition and persistence in your desire to better yourself.
* The ability to provide U.P. clients’ a great service and high professional standards.

So, if you are interested in a role that will allow you to:

* Work alongside some of the leading trainers in the fitness industry as a team.
* Work in a culture where results - not numbers - are the name of the game. We take care of the sales and marketing so you have the time to focus on what matters as a Trainer.
* Take part in a full education program while also being provided your own mentor.
* Have the support and guidance to build a genuine career within the fitness industry, so that you can grow into the right long-term role for you.
* Deliver personal training through our own company app, while we continue to work behind the scenes to revolutionize the technology available to you as a Trainer.
* Be pushed to never accept anything less than your very best.
* Be provided with the possibility to travel around the world.

Then hit APPLY today to be considered and discuss further with the U.P. team!

Salary: EUR 27,450

OTE: EUR 28,500 - 35,000

*U.P. does not provide Personal Trainer qualifications and so requires all applicants to have already attained their Level 3 Diploma in Personal Training, or equivalent qualification.*

*Please note that all U.P. Trainers need a valid right to work, therefore we ask queries around this within the application process to determine whether sponsorship consideration is required by Ultimate Performance. It poses no potential limitation to your application.*

*Your data will be stored by Ultimate Performance and will be used by our HR and recruitment teams for the purpose of managing your application. You can find out more about how we use your data during our recruitment process here: https://ultimateperformance.com/terms-conditions*

\**Hours: full-time, including early mornings and late evenings in your first year of service.*

*Advertised earnings are reflective of the advertised U.P. location’s OTEs for Junior Trainer roles in the local currency, dependent on the Junior level offered if successful.*

*We have been made aware of fraudulent entities around the world claiming to represent Ultimate Performance. We will never request your bank details within an application or request an exchange of money to apply for a role at U.P. If you see a role advertised for Ultimate Performance requesting payment or to provide bank details then please DO NOT apply via that channel. Please do not hesitate to contact us directly if you have any concerns.*

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: €28.900,00 - €46.700,00 per year

Application Question(s):

* What is your gender identity? (This question does not contribute to the decision-making process and is strictly just for reporting purposes, and you can decline to answer)
* What is your Instagram handle?

License/Certification:

* Personal Training certificate (Preferred)

Work authorization:

* Netherlands (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Junior Financial Controller
description:
Abstraction is a game development studio aiming to deliver cutting-edge game experiences. We’re known for our work on technically demanding projects on world-class IP like Halo, Dune, Mass Effect and Baldur’s Gate, and have worked on more than 60 shipped titles to date.  

The studio is proud to count its partner companies such as BioWare/EA, 343/Microsoft, Funcom, Sega, Paradox Interactive, Perfect World and Aspyr Media. Besides co-development and adaptation projects, we’re working on our own original IP projects.


As our **(Junior) Financial Controller**, you will be responsible for overseeing the accounting and financial reporting functions. In addition, you will ensure that the company's financial practices are sound, compliant, and aligned with overall business objectives. Finally, you will be responsible for the month closing process.


Do you have an interest or passion for games? This could be a great opportunity to explore and develop your skills further.


**Role Impact**


In this role, you'll be much more than your job title. You will:

* **Cultivate Collaboration**: Enhance our team culture through active participation and open communication.
* **Ignite Innovation**: Bring fresh, creative ideas that challenge conventional thinking.
* **Embody Our Values**: Live our core values and inspire others by example.
* **Encourage Growth**: Share your knowledge, fostering both individual and team development.


Your contribution will extend beyond tasks and targets; it's about making a lasting, positive difference in our workplace and community.

**What Will You Be Doing At Abstraction**

* **Financial Administration:** Be responsible for financial administration duties, including: management of creditors, debtors, and the general ledger, as well as ensuring accuracy and efficiency in our financial operations.
* **Month-end and Year-end Close:** Support in the month-end and year-end close processes, including journal entries, reconciliations, and accruals.
* **Financial Reporting**: Contribute to the preparation of the annual report.
* **Financial Analysis**: Analyze monthly and quarterly financial data and disclosures to identify trends and opportunities for financial performance improvement.
* **Internal Controls and Compliance:** Ensuring all internal reports and procedures comply with accounting standards.
* **Budgeting and Forecasting:** Support in the preparation of budgets and forecasts, to predict future financial performance.
* **Management reporting:** Assist in the preparation of financial management reporting and support with the project administration system.
* **Ad Hoc Projects:** Contribute to special projects and initiatives, such as process improvements, system implementations, and strategic analyses.
* **Process Improvements:** Streamline and enhance administrative processes to improve efficiency, reduce costs, and increase productivity.

 **What You Will Bring Along**

* Relevant HBO/BSc in finance or/and accounting
* 2-3 years of relevant experience
* Advanced knowledge of related disciplines (accounting, external reporting, tax)
* Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and experience with financial software (Exact)
* Resourceful and proactive attitude, hands-on mentality
* Fluent verbal & written communication skills in English (Dutch nice to have!)
* Very good communication and interpersonal skills
* Detail Oriented & Analytical

 **What We Offer:**

* An autonomous job within a professional and informally organized company
* A competitive salary
* A lot of room for personal development and taking responsibility
* Travel expenses allowance and/or work-from-home allowance
* Possibility to work hybrid/onsite

*We are dedicated to fostering an inclusive and equitable work environment where all individuals, regardless of their background, are encouraged to thrive, and we empower all team members to bring their unique perspectives to the table.*

title: SAP BTP Basis Platform Engineer
description:
Eindhoven, Netherlands


Relocation friendly


Other Packaged Software


Cross Industry Solutions


06/09/2024


Req. VR-107963


  
##### **Project description**

The SAP Platform Engineer (PE) is a key-role in the Generic Application Platform organization and acts on mainly tactical as well strategical level.
  

The PE owns the technical application landscape and drives the optimization and standardization by designing the landscape, using ASML's infrastructure building blocks and adhering to ASML's security policies. The PE works closely with internal and external service providers, the Architect, Product Owners within the ART and the business ART's to realize these goals and achieving operational excellence.
  

  

This also includes ensuring that the infrastructural roadmap is developed in a sustainable and integral manner. The PE is end-to-end responsible for the delivery of changes and responsible for the RUN/Operations of assigned platforms.


##### **Responsibilities**


The PE takes full responsibility on the SAP Platform (Run / Continuity / Quality) and take full ownership of end2end delivery of non-standard changes/features across SAP platforms.


Landscape Owner:


Identify and define technical application requirements and it's ecosystem(s), including Disaster Recovery and Backup configuration and testing of application / application data


Draft, review and own high level technical design documents with optimal use of standard technology (catalog) components


Design application integrations/interfaces and identify data streams (e.g. firewall rules)


Ensure secure access to environments (e.g. External service providers)


Define and supervise technical application life-cycle roadmap and plan for your systems


Optimizing life-cycles of individual applications and infrastructure components (whilst minimizing business impact)


Control the technical application landscape by supervising (operations done by Service Providers or DevOps Teams)


Implement monitoring (end to end) and reporting (technical) of application performance, availability and capacity


Participate as 3rd level subject matter expert to identify and solve (high prio) incidents on application landscape (cross team) and advice on actions to be taken


Validate root cause analysis provided by external supplier


Application landscape security level (patching, security groups, firewall rules, SW security/vulnerabilities, hotfixes, etc.)


Correct registration of application landscape components and their relationships within the CMDB


Detect critical deficiencies and recommend solutions for improvement


Manage delivery of application landscape components according to agreed specifications and quality criteria


Architecture / Integration


Architectural mapping of application components during application life cycle to infrastructure based on standard building blocks


Ensure compliance with applicable architectural guidelines as well as IT policies (eg security)


Help to improve and setup architecture standards


Work closely with service providers and architects on designs of new technologies and capabilities, with focus on simplicity


Feature Owner:


Take part in the Intake, analysis, design, planning, Go-Live and organize the delivery of the required solutions and features


In close communication with the Product Owner about new features and with the Scrum Master about planning and impediments


Act as the linking pin between service providers and the IT ART's / Business ART's and advice in delivering projects and changes


Verifies the designed solutions with our System Architect


Engage with external infrastructure service providers and internal infrastructure providers as well AZURE cloud and BTP experts


Ordering of (new/changed) infrastructure services and standard technology components through standard catalog


The installation, upgrade and maintenance of applications and its infrastructure


Take SAP License management into account before new implementations


##### **Skills**


Must have


Security Bridge or comparing experience


Certificates and security keys (Linux / SAP)


Minimum of 5


7 years of experience on core SAP security design, analysis, configuration, compliance, and implementation (multiple projects is a plus)


Minimum of 5


7 years of experience with SOD conflict resolution


Minimum of 5


7 years of experience in multiple SAP modules/ solutions


Minimum of 2


4 years of experience with GRC tools


concepts of Emergency Access and Risk Analysis


Knowledge of Sarbanes-Oxley (SOx) and GDPR is a plus


Knowledge of Identity and Access Management systems is a plus


Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and experience


Nice to have


Strategic thinking


Excellent communication skills


Shows initiative and ownership


Quality driven


Takes responsibility to deliver


Owns the workload end-to-end


Planning and organization of work both in traditional Service model as in Agile environment


##### **Other**


Languages


English: C1 Advanced


Seniority


Senior

title: Assistant Controller
location: Capelle aan den IJssel, ZH, NL
description:
**Company Description** **Are you an experienced Assistant Controller ready for a new challenge in a dynamic work environment? Then we are looking for you! As an Assistant Controller, you play a crucial role in supporting our financial processes and ensuring the financial health of our organization. You will have the opportunity to apply your expertise in analyzing financial data, preparing reports, and optimizing our administrative processes. Do you want to contribute to the success of our team? Then check out our vacancy and apply today!**

  

**Company**  

At Roll Group, we offer our clients full-service factory-to-foundation solutions for some of the world's most demanding heavy lifting and special transport projects both on land and at sea. We aim to bring added value to our clients and to successfully accomplish projects we can be proud of.


Each project is unique and demands state-of-the-art equipment and experienced professionals for safe and efficient execution. Our diverse fleet of modern, multifunctional vessels and cutting-edge land equipment offers versatile loading methods including Roll-On / Roll-Off, Float-In / Float-Out, and Lift-On / Lift-Off.

  

**Position**  

As an Assistant Controller you ensure collecting, organizing, analyzing, and reporting financial data for the purpose of directing the organization. The Assistant Controller works for several assigned legal companies and supports these according to local legislations.

  

**Key responsibilities**

* Prepare timely and accurate monthly closing of all legal companies.
* Prepare financial statements.
* Prepare payroll journal entries.
* Prepare VAT returns.
* Prepare sales invoices.
* Prepare balance sheet specification.
* Prepare financial audit documentation.
* Participate in assigned financial improvement projects and other initiatives.
* Review costs and revenues of subsidiaries on accuracy and completeness.
* Review and analysis of expenses and revenues
* Review of weekly payment runs
* Performs other related duties as necessary or assigned by manager or supervisor.

  

**Your qualifications**

* Intermediate Vocational Education (Business Administration, Business Economics, Accounting, Controlling) or equivalent.
* 3-5 years of relevant experience in a similar position.
* Proficiency in using accounting software, Twinfield experience will be a plus.
* Advance Microsoft Office applications, particularly in Excel
* Good command of spoken and written English is required.
* Strong interpersonal and project management skills and able to communicate well in a multinational working environment.
* Detail-oriented and well-organized individual with analytical mind
* Responsible, independent, self-motivated, able to handle tight timeline with strong problem-solving skills.

  

**What we offer**  

Challenging and varied work (full-time) at a fast-growing international company. With plenty of flexibility and freedom, including hybrid working 2 days a week. We offer a competitive salary (based on your availability, knowledge and experience), 8.33% holiday pay, premium-free pension and WIA insurance(s), and you participate in our Roll Group bonus scheme. You’ll also get 28 days of annual leave and we offer free lunch at work.

  

**Our selection process**  

The recruitment procedure will include two face-to-face interviews, possibly back-to-back. Your terms of employment and benefits package will be discussed at a subsequent meeting. We aim to finalize the entire process within 4 weeks.

  

**We want to hear from you**  

You’re one click away from a career filled with excitement and opportunity. Send us your application via the button to the right.

*Acquisition from recruitment agencies regarding this vacancy is not appreciated.*

title: Lead of Pilot Plants & UFSC Site Leader
Director Portfolio Management
description:
The Portfolio Director leads the Portfolio team consisting of a manager and analysts. You and the portfolio team oversee and manage a portfolio of properties owned and operated by the platform. This involves optimizing the performance of each property, ensuring they meet financial goals, proposing and together with colleagues implementing strategies for asset enhancement, monitoring market trends, and mitigating risks associated with property ownership and management. Essentially, the Portfolio Director reports into the COO and on the financial performance of the assets in the portfolio, discovers and analyses underlying drivers of this performance and proposes strategies to enhance operational, financial and value creation KPIs in the portfolio. The Portfolio Manager then works with the wider team to ensure implementation of agreed measures.

**Requirements**

**Portfolio management**

* Develop and together with colleagues implement strategic portfolio management plans for the assets, aligning with overall business objectives and shareholder requirements.
* Monitor and analyse asset performance, including financial performance, occupancy rates, lease expirations, and market trends.
* Conduct financial analysis, including revenue forecasting, expense management, and budgeting, to optimize asset performance and maximize returns.
* Oversight of the financial models across different assets to monitor asset and deal level returns (cash flow forecasts with a focus on both operational assumptions and the capital structure of a business)
* Determine the financial viability of refurbishment and other strategic projects.
* Onboarding of new acquisitions into the existing investment portfolios.
* Actual v Budget analysis and detailed analysis on performance v market indicators and macro environment.
* Propose creative financing solutions on each asset and assist in negotiating and executing new debt packages where required.
* Signal to senior management the need for corrective measures when early warning signs exist on performance issues.

**Reportin**g

* Prepare and co-ordinate regular financial reports and presentations for senior management and shareholders, providing insights into asset performance and market trends.
* Communicate regularly with stakeholders to provide updates on asset performance, investment strategies, and market developments.

**Risk management & Compliance**

* Monitor project and fund compliance with regulatory requirements
* Identify and mitigate risks associated with asset ownership.
* Monitor changes in regulations and industry standards, implementing appropriate measures to maintain compliance and mitigate risks.

**Team Leadership**

* Motivate and inspire team members and colleague; foster a positive, inclusive, and collaborative work environment in which team members can perform and develop to the best of their abilities.
* Establish performance goals and objectives for team members, conduct regular performance evaluations, and provide constructive feedback to support their professional growth and development.
* Uphold ethical standards and promote compliance with organizational policies, procedures, and regulatory requirements among team members.

**QUALIFICATIONS**

+ Bachelor's degree in Real Estate, Finance, Business Administration, or other quantitative studies. Masters degrees such as a Master of Business Administration (MBA), Master of Finance (MFin), or Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) is strongly preferred.

**EXPERIENCE**

* 10+ years’ experience of transaction, portfolio or asset management experience in a commercial and residential (bed-based) real estate sector, demonstrated track record of underwriting and asset and portfolio managing complex real estate investments across Europe.
* 5 years’ experience in a leadership role
* Background at a Real Estate or Private Equity fund with ideally Residential experience.
* Track record in Investor Reporting and financial fund management.
* Comprehensive knowledge of real estate markets, investment strategies, and asset classes.
* Demonstrated ability to analyse and interpret complex documents, spreadsheets and financial data sets and respond effectively to sensitive inquiries.
* Fluency in working English is mandatory, additional language(s) is/are an asset (esp. Dutch, Spanish, German, Italian).

**KEY PERSONAL SKILLS & TRAITS**

* Analytical Skills: Ability to analyse complex financial data, market trends, and operational metrics to make informed decisions and optimize asset performance.
* Financial Acumen: Strong understanding of financial concepts, including revenue forecasting, expense management, budgeting, and financial modelling, to maximize returns and mitigate financial risks.
* Problem-Solving Skills: Capacity to identify issues, develop creative solutions, and implement corrective measures to address performance issues and mitigate risks.
* Time Management and Attention to Detail: Proficient in working under tight deadlines with a high level of attention to detail, both in numerical analysis and written reports. Capable of managing several projects in parallel with minimal supervision, ensuring accuracy and efficiency in all tasks.
* Negotiation Skills: Proficiency in negotiating complex agreements, including lease negotiations, debt packages, and investment deals, to ensure optimal terms and maximize returns.
* Interpersonal Skills: Strong interpersonal skills to build and maintain relationships with stakeholders, including investors, tenants, colleagues, and regulatory authorities.

title: Senior Associate Supply Chain (GMP) (33521)
description:
Job description


**Orion Group Life Sciences are looking for a Senior Associate Supply Chain (GMP) EMEA Global Distribution Operations for our Multinational Pharmaceutical/Biotechnology client based in Breda. Initial 12-month contract, with high possibility of extension. This is a hybrid position, where you are expected to work at least 2 days per week from the office.**

**Main Responsibilities**

* Act as business process owner for track and trace activities on our client's Finished drug product (FDP):
	+ Perform daily oversight over track and trace activities.
	+ Liaise with the regional business process owner as counterpart.
	+ Own related distribution Quality Management documents.
	+ Train staff and develop training material.
	+ Present performance of related Key Performance Indicators to senior leadership audience.
	+ Serve as Supply Chain Subject Matter Expert for audits when requested.
* Perform daily analysis of Alerts received from the National Medicines Verification Organization (NMVO).
* Own monthly and quarterly EU FMD Alert trend reporting process.
* Own, investigate and close distribution complaints at the required first-time right level.
* Continuously drive improvements and standardization EMEA global distribution operations business processes.
* Support with Customer master data (CMD) updates in ERP system.
* Communicate with related topics with Local Service Providers (LSPs).
* Other:
	+ Represent Global Distribution in cross functional project teams.
	+ Identify and initiate process and system improvements.

**Requirements**

* Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Supply Chain or related.
* Minimum two years of experience in a similar position in a highly regulated industry.
* Good understanding of Good distribution practices.
* Experience in working in an international environment, ability to liaise/communicate effectively with cross-functional teams and different cultures.
* Experience working with external parties and improving processes.
* Fluency in English, both in oral and written communication.
* Result focused and proven ability to deliver results.
* Accurate and paying attention to detail.
* Motivated, persistent, eager to optimize, drive for excellence.
* Problem solver with high sense of responsibility.
* Oversee processes beyond own department.
* Technical writing skills.
* Process and system oriented.
* Compliance mindset.
* Continuous improvement mindset and open to change.
* Strong analytical skills.
* Strong Problem Solving skills.


If you would like to have a confidential conversation regarding this opportunity please reach out to Tim Browaeys, tim.browaeys@orioneng.com or contact Tim on 0044 7593448607


#opportunity #multinational #pharmaceutical #biotechnology #supplychain#associate #EMEA #global #distribution #operations




Our role in supporting ***diversity*** and ***inclusion***  

As an international workforce business, we are committed to sourcing personnel that reflects the diversity and values of our client base but also that of Orion Group. We welcome the wide range of experiences and viewpoints that potential workers bring to our business and our clients, including those based on nationality, gender, culture, educational and professional backgrounds, race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, and age differences, job classification and religion. In our inclusive workplace, regardless of your employment status as staff or contract, everyone is assured the right of equitable, fair and respectful treatment.

title: UFS - Chief Experience Officer (CXO), Vice President
description:
**Note: Deadline for applying is 23.59 the day before the Job Posting End Date.**

**UNILEVER IS LOOKING FOR A UNILEVER FOOD SOLUTIONS (UFS) CHIEF EXPERIENCE OFFICER (CXO), VICE PRESIDENT**


Location: Weena, Rotterdam – the Netherlands


Local conditions apply


Full-time/Part-time


Function: Customer Development


For the recruitment of this position, we would like to emphasize that local conditions apply to the position and for this vacancy in principle we will first consider candidates based in the Netherlands. If you are based outside of the Netherlands and you are interested to apply, please feel free to do so but we can only take your application on if a decision is made to also recruit outside of the Netherlands.

**ABOUT UNILEVER FOOD SERVICE**

  

Act like a founder, accelerate your growth, stay ahead of the curve, enjoy the growth: JOIN US


Unilever Food Solutions (UFS) is an independent Global Business Unit, which is the 5th largest BU in Unilever. UFS is ~20% of Nutrition BG and operates in 76 markets with a Turnover of about €3 Bn. We have a compelling ambition: To be a €5 Bn business by 2030, becoming the leader in digital selling in the food service industry, the best solution provider for our Operators and the planet, and a Winning People Engine.


UFS operates with a different business model that has a greater emphasis on chefs and field sales to drive demand creation with operators in a B2B setting. UFS is a unique business within Unilever, with a constant focus on executional excellence and consistent productivity improvements leading to significant value creation and enabled by rich expertise in the professional foodservice channel.


UFS is the place where we are all striving to be Chefs supporting Chefs! At UFS we have an entrepreneurial culture with a commitment to speed, simplicity and trust, whilst having a hunger to grow – both our business and our people. UFS also proudly commits to high employee engagement every year with Univoice scores ahead of Unilever across all dimensions.


It is the place where you can be a risk taker, test and iterate, and be a trendsetter. You can think and work like an owner of our own business and be ahead of the curve. With the purpose of “We free you to love what you do” and the DNA “having empathy for the people we serve and the expertise to meet their needs 24/7” you will become a part of a “People-to-People organisation.”


You will work explore new opportunities, big and small, that will make our business grow faster. You will continuously learn, unlearn, relearn, and challenge yourself to accelerate your development in an end-to-end business and in end-to-end roles.


At UFS, we are committed to fostering a culture of trust and unity with our empowered One Team One Goal approach, with a passion for winning and nurturing a culture pf psych safety where people can shape their career adventures. We aim to achieve resilient performance and sustainable success, winning together as one resilient, dynamic team.

**BACKGROUND ON THE ROLE**


More than just its sustained business success, UFS has become an industry leader whose models are studied and replicated by other players like its Pull and Push model, Solution Selling, etc.

  

Now is the moment to open another chapter and plan its 2030 vision and journey. Foreseeing an even more VUCA environment towards 2030, building the “BEST and MOST PERSONALIZED EXPERIENCE” for our customers enabled by AI throughout the whole customer relationship journey would provide a way for UFS to navigate uncertainty by focusing on creating lasting, meaningful interactions that resonate with customers’ value beyond product expectation and differentiate us even further from competitors.

**JOB SCOPE**


The Chief Experience Officer (CXO) of UFS is responsible for identifying and interpreting the core customers’ needs, overseeing and optimizing the customer experience, revolving around strategically designing, managing, and improving every interaction and touchpoint across various channels and liaison with other leadership team members and teams to enhance satisfaction, loyalty, business performance and foster Customer Experience as a DNA within the organization.

 **MAIN JOB RESPONSIBILITIES**

**Customer Experience Strategy**

* Identify and align on who is the primary Customer & their core needs / experience to serve, which also means what UFS is famous for. (For example Professional Chefs are Condiments decision makers who always seeking Menu / Recipes Inspiration).
* Develop the customer experience (CX) strategy with focus on primary customers and with Roadmap in core Markets / Countries.
* Define Core Customer Experience’s Jobs to be done prior to Business Jobs to be done and brings view of 2 angles Goal in the place (Customer Experience and Organizational Goal).

**Key Platforms Identification and development**

* Identify and align the key platforms where Primary Customers (professional chefs) would love to find solutions & interact across markets.
* Define and develop each key platform’s role in the customer journey and deeply engage customers by offering best solutions / inspirations from UFS, and thus exchange with more information / behavioral data. (e.g.: WeChat, Facebook, UFS.com, etc.).
* Key platforms development roadmap in core Markets / Countries.

**Data Strategy Development**

* Identify and align 1st party data’s importance in UFS Data strategy and customer experience strategy development.
* Develop Data collection, acquisition strategy (esp. 1st party data) together with the key platforms’ development strategy.
* Integrate Data and optimize sharing between internal departments and data openness strategies of external partners.

**“Personalized” at a scale and Customer Journey Development via AI**

* Identify key customer personas with alignment across the organization.
* Map out customer Persona journeys from a Customer Action (CA) point of view to understand pain points, opportunities for improvement, and moments of truth.
* Personalized at a scale with new technologies adoption (e.g. Personalization engines, Automation/AI tools eg. content creation, etc.) that can improve CX and operational efficiency.

**Omni-Channel Integration**

* Define key touchpoints and ensure consistency in experience across all channels (online, offline, mobile, etc.).
* Integrate the online & offline touchpoints, and omni-channels to offer a seamless and personalized journey.
* Evolve OTM & Contact Strategy accordingly to focus on higher life-time value customers and serve with right timing at right channel / touchpoints with right content.

**BE a customer representative / ambassador in the business**

* Gather and analyze Voice of Customer (VoC) across touchpoints and channels including but not limited to customer data (e.g.: 1st party data, CMI reports, Ask Rosana), feedback, and insights to inform decision-making and improve offerings.
* Be a customer ambassador to keep business strategy always relevant, updated and timely response to the fast-changing needs from our customers.

**Performance Metrics and Reporting**


Establish KPIs and metrics across business to measure the effectiveness of CX initiatives and track progress over time. Besides Satisfaction KPI (NPS, CSA), Performance metrics also includes Platforms Engagement (MAU / Duration / Page views), Growth Metrics (Users#, Acquisition Cost), Content Metrics (Views, Interaction likes/comments/shares), Security Metrics (Incidence, Response time), Data Metrics (Volume, Quality, Integration) etc.

 **EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS**

The Chief Experience Officer should play the role of a “Catalyst” within the business, the “Designer”of great customer experience, the “Orchestrator”of various elements and departments and the “Champion”of CX inside and outside the business.

**Customer Experience (CX) Strategy**

* Solid experience in developing and executing comprehensive CX strategies that align with business goals and enhance customer satisfaction.

**Customer Advocacy & Industry Expertise**

* Acting as a champion for customers within the organization, advocating for their needs and preferences in all strategic decisions.
* Familiarity with industry trends, customer expectations, and competitive landscape is valuable.
* Significant experience in senior executive or leadership roles within customer experience, marketing, product management, or related fields is crucial.

**Leadership and Management**

* Strong leadership experience of leading multi-culture global team.
* The ability to articulate a compelling vision to inspire and motivate teams, drive change, and foster a customer-centric culture within the organization.

**Technological and AI Proficiency**

* Familiarity with digital technologies, CRM systems, and analytics tools that support customer experience initiatives.
* Have sufficient knowledge of applying AI to drive Business growth

**Communication, Collaboration and Influencing Skills**


Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to effectively collaborate and influence stakeholders across departments.

**WHAT DOES UNILEVER OFFER**

  

Unilever is the place where you can be yourself and bring your purpose to life with the work that you do – creating a better business and a better world. We offer an exciting & dynamic work environment where you can make things happen. Furthermore, we offer some great reward and benefits!

* Attractive total remuneration package; excellent company pension, bonus, share scheme.
* Flexible cross-disciplinary career opportunities and a wealth of training opportunities & wellbeing resources whenever and wherever.
* Plenty of company-paid holidays to further ensure your work-life balance is maintained.
* We encourage an inclusive culture, which comes to life with interchangeable public holidays, paid paternity leave of 6 weeks and our transgender policy.
* Under the Hybrid Working principles, you will be expected to spend a minimum of 40%-60% in the office or at customers, suppliers or partners to connect and collaborate. For the time you work from home, we will ensure you are well equipped. When you are at the office , you can enjoy our tasty canteen with prepped food and own products.
* Informal culture and being the first one trying our new products.
* My Fitness Plan (reduction on your Fitness Subscription).
* Home work allowance
* Company laptop and mobile phone
* Green Mobility Policy.

 **EXCITED?**


Join Unilever and our team! To apply, you must do so online. Please do not forget to upload your CV and a motivation letter. Your application will be reviewed against our requirements and we will be in touch shortly after the closing date to provide you with an update on the status of your application.


Looking forward to meeting you!


Please note this is a Direct Search led by Unilever. Applications from agencies will not be accepted, nor will fees be paid for unsolicited CVs.

*Equal Opportunity Employer: Unilever is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, disability, age, parenthood, pregnancy or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against.*

*By highlighting the gender diversity at the workplace, Unilever encourages women equally men to apply. If you look for a job after a long career break or after any type of leave, do not hesitate to apply.*

*Please save a copy of this vacancy for personal use as it will disappear from the website after closing of the role.*
