title: Global Data Architect Innovate, Plan, Make & Deliver
description:
**Date:** Sep 5, 2024


**Location:** Amsterdam, NL


**Company:** AkzoNobel


**About AkzoNobel**


Since 1792, we’ve been supplying the innovative paints and coatings that help to color people’s lives and protect what matters most. Our world class portfolio of brands – including Dulux, International, Sikkens and Interpon – is trusted by customers around the globe. We’re active in more than 150 countries and use our expertise to sustain and enhance the fabric of everyday life. Because we believe every surface is an opportunity. It’s what you’d expect from a pioneering and long-established paints company that’s dedicated to providing sustainable solutions and preserving the best of what we have today – while creating an even better tomorrow. Let’s paint the future together.

  


For more information please visit www.akzonobel.com

  


© 2024 Akzo Nobel N.V. All rights reserved.


**Let's paint a picture of the role**
-------------------------------------



To address the growing complexity of our data landscape, we’ve established a Master Data Management (MDM) Center of Excellence (CoE). This team will focus on our data to drive efficiency and growth across the organization. As our data volume increases, a well-structured data management strategy is essential.


The MDM CoE is seeking an experienced Global Data Architect Innovate, Plan, Make & Deliver to solve challenges. This expert will work on our overall Data Management maturity.


**Responsibilities**
--------------------

* **MDM CoE Support:** Manage or support activities for assigned Data Domains across MDM Foundation, Projects, and Analytics.
* **Process Improvement:** Drive standardized processes and tools to enhance delivery quality, optimize costs, ensure compliance, and improve customer experience.
* **Roadmap Development:** Assist GPOs in building data, reporting, and analytics roadmaps.
* **MDM Strategy:** Communicate and implement the MDM vision, strategy, and roadmap.
* **Controls & Maintenance:** Implement controls for MDM operations, including downstream system impacts.
* **Data Dictionary:** Develop a data dictionary with naming conventions and governance.
* **Data Quality:** Lead data quality efforts, including setting standards, data cleansing, and monitoring.
* **KPIs & Compliance:** Develop KPIs to monitor compliance in the Global MDM Dashboard.
* **Governance & Escalation:** Act as the Single Point of Contact for data domains, organize governance, and manage issue escalation.
* **Change Management:** Serve as a change agent for MDM, driving commitment and awareness.
* **Standardization:** Align master data standards across systems, focusing on innovation and reducing costs.
* **Collaboration:** Foster teamwork across organizational boundaries and manage multiple complex assignments.
* **Customer Service:** Ensure strong customer service and support while managing dynamic priorities.
* **International Awareness:** Adapt to cultural differences with an international mindset.
**What do you need to have to be successful in this role?**
-----------------------------------------------------------


* **Education:** Post-graduate in Business, Accounting, Finance, Economics, IT, or equivalent experience.
* **Experience:** 10+ years overall, with 7-8 years in process-related functions and data support.
* **Systems Knowledge:** SAP knowledge. Strong IT/system configuration knowledge and implementation experience.
* **Project Management:** Experience in project/program management, with certification preferred.
* **Process Expertise:** Skilled in implementing standardized E2E business processes.
* **Business Interaction:** Experience working with operational customers, including senior management.
* **Data Improvement:** Proficient in process and data improvement, using root cause analysis.
* **Complex Environments:** Experience in complex IT and business environments.
* **Regulatory Understanding:** Knowledge of external regulatory and industry best practices.
* **Data Design:** Designs data models using best practices and business insights.
* **Cross-functional Partner:** Recognized as a credible partner across teams and functions.
* **High Quality & Deadlines:** Consistently meets deadlines with high-quality work.
* **Communication:** Strong communicator and change agent, fostering dialogue across stakeholders.
* **Travel:** Available for moderate travel.
**What does AkzoNobel offer in return?**
----------------------------------------



It’s a two-way street. This means that we offer not only a competitive salary but also believe in a healthy work-life balance.


* Above average number of annual holidays: 30 days
* Participation in the AkzoNobel pension plan.
* STI bonus
* Travel allowance, NS business card or a lease car with parking spot.
* Hybrid way of working.
* Being part of events and networking platforms.
* Paint with a discount.


We aim to create a sense of belonging, where everyone can share their diverse backgrounds, participate in events, and connect through networking platforms.


**More information on how to apply**
------------------------------------



We welcome your online application via https://careers.akzonobel.com/.


It is essential for this role that you live in the Netherlands or India (nearby Pune) and that you have a very good understanding and experience of SAP.


The recruitment process includes a selection of the best applications received through the system, interview rounds and further steps. An online assessment and an employment screening might be part of the selection process.


If you have questions about the role or interview process, please contact Berber Wegener at berber.wegener@akzonobel.com



At AkzoNobel we are highly committed to ensuring an inclusive and respectful workplace where all employees can be their best self. We strive to embrace diversity in a context of tolerance. Our talent acquisition process plays an integral part in this journey, as setting the foundations for a diverse environment. For this reason we train and educate on the implications of our Unconscious Bias in order for our TA and hiring managers to be mindful of them and take corrective actions when applicable. In our organization, all qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability.


Requisition ID: 42501
company_description: AkzoNobel has a passion for paint coatings. We're experts in the proud craft of making paints and coatings, setting the standard in color and protection since 1792.

title: Scientific Advisor
description:
**Site Name:** Netherlands - Amersfoort  

**Posted Date:** Sep 5 2024**Key Responsibilities**
========================


External focussed

* Develop and expand networks in the vaccines and infectious disease area across the Netherlands and GSK as a whole.
* Be a spokesperson at internal and external scientific events and provide expertise in the field of vaccinology and infectious disease control to ensure their informed decision are based on latest scientific data & knowledge.
* Contribute to the development of and participate in appropriate meetings (advisory board meetings, scientific workshops, investigator meetings, expert meetings, and CME meetings).
* Develop and maintain up-to-date knowledge of the therapy areas by reviewing the literature, discussions with key opinion leaders and key stakeholders, participating in cross functional interactions, attending scientific congresses, etc.
* Supporting GSK sponsored scientific research and clinical studies. Ensure the right approval processes of GSK supported studies (ISSs), and the follow up during the life cycle of the research project.
* You prepare portfolios of data and input into product submissions for influential bodies such as the ZorgInstituut, Gezondheidsraad, RIVM, GGD.
* Provide Medical advice in all aspects of GSK’s business for the vaccines area


Internal focussed

* You work closely with marketing, commercial, market access, communications, regulatory, and clinical colleagues on pre-launch planning, including strategic evidence planning, evidence generation and external expert engagement plan.
* You have a key role in the planning and development of medical, promotional and educational campaigns and (multichannel) materials, including ensuring the medical accuracy and compliance with the product license and the relevant Codes of Practice
* You provide analyses and reviews of GSK products, therapy areas and competitor products, making recommendations, providing input for current and future strategic direction.
* You prepare and deliver presentations for sales force training programmes and other materials and briefing sessions, ensuring scientific data and medical concepts are understood and promotional strategy is consistent with scientific data.
* You develop scientific tools (eg scientific platform content, presentation of new data, therapy area reviews, product monographs, slide sets, training packages etc) as appropriate to business and customer needs.
* Key role in the areas of Scientific communication, Medical Governance, management of Grants & Donations, management of safety and pharmaceutical quality issues.
* You are responsible for coordinating GSKs response to complaints from bodies such as the IGJ or CGR, competitor companies, or medical professionals – this will typically involve engaging members of the extended brand team.
* For vaccines sponsored studies, you serve as Local Medical Lead (LML) and provide local support to the study design; manage all local medical activities required before study start, during the study and after study completion and analysis.
* Maintain an open and trustful work environment where constructive feedback is used as a tool to support each individual and provide opportunities to develop and evolve.

**Why you?**
============

**Basic Qualifications :**

***We are looking for professionals with these required skills to achieve our goals:***
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

* Scientific Master in Life-Sciences, Medical or Pharmacy degree or equivalent, with an advanced degree and/or certification.
* Significant experience in successfully engaging in scientific exchange with external experts.
* Excellent presentation and communication skills to represent the company in a professional manner at medical, scientific and public events.
* Excellent teamplayer.
* Excellent performance working in an environment with urgency and high expectations.
* Fluent in Dutch & English.

**Preferred Qualifications :**

***If you have the following characteristics it would be a plus:***
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

* PhD
* Scientific expertise in vaccinology, immunology and/or infectious diseases.
* Experience with launching a medicine or vaccine in a new therapy area.
* Medical background and a working knowledge of the legal and regulatory environment for medicines promotion & scientific communication.


#LI-GSK

**Why GSK?**

**Uniting science, technology and talent to get ahead of disease together.**

GSK is a global biopharma company with a special purpose – to unite science, technology and talent to get ahead of disease together – so we can positively impact the health of billions of people and deliver stronger, more sustainable shareholder returns – as an organisation where people can thrive. We prevent and treat disease with vaccines, specialty and general medicines. We focus on the science of the immune system and the use of new platform and data technologies, investing in four core therapeutic areas (infectious diseases, HIV, respiratory/ immunology and oncology).


Our success absolutely depends on our people. While getting ahead of disease together is about our ambition for patients and shareholders, it’s also about making GSK a place where people can thrive. We want GSK to be a place where people feel inspired, encouraged and challenged to be the best they can be. A place where they can be themselves – feeling welcome, valued, and included. Where they can keep growing and look after their wellbeing. So, if you share our ambition, join us at this exciting moment in our journey to get Ahead Together.


If you require an accommodation or other assistance to apply for a job at GSK, please contact the GSK Service Centre at 1-877-694-7547 (US Toll Free) or +1 801 567 5155 (outside US).


GSK is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, age, disability, genetic information, military service, covered/protected veteran status or any other federal, state or local protected class.

**Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies**


GSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GSK. GSK shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.


Please note that if you are a US Licensed Healthcare Professional or Healthcare Professional as defined by the laws of the state issuing your license, GSK may be required to capture and report expenses GSK incurs, on your behalf, in the event you are afforded an interview for employment. This capture of applicable transfers of value is necessary to ensure GSK’s compliance to all federal and state US Transparency requirements. For more information, please visit GSK’s Transparency Reporting For the Record site.

title: Revenue Operations Specialist
description:
**Your Mission**

  


As a Revenue Operations Specialist with a focus on Partnership motion at Tellent, you will play a critical role in architecting and optimizing partnership operations.


You will work closely with other teams, including Customer Success, Sales, Marketing, Partnerships and Product, to optimise processes, improve customer experience, and drive customer satisfaction. This role requires a blend of analytical insight, operational expertise, and hands-on execution to ensure our customers continue to experience value and achieve their desired outcomes with our solutions.

 **Your Team**  

  

You will join a central team of 4 RevOps professionals, responsible for optimising inputs and outputs of the revenue funnel and report into the VP of Revenue Operations.

 **12-Month Journey**

  

**First 3 months:** Learn about the company's products, systems, and current processes. Begin assessing existing processes and tools, particularly around partnership operations. Start building relationships with key stakeholders across departments.

  

**After 6 months:** Begin implementing initial process improvements and project initiatives. Work on your first project related to the partnership. Take ownership of reporting for partnerships and other assigned areas.

  

**After 12 months:** Develop and implement processes to enhance efficiency and productivity. Lead ongoing improvements in systems and processes, based on data-driven insights.Fully own processes related to partnerships and support in other revenue operations.

 **What you'll do:**


* Develop and elevate the Partnership Operations: Analyze and refine partnership processes to drive efficiency and effectiveness. Implement tools and systems to enhance productivity, including forecasting & reporting.
* Collaborate with Partnership and other Teams: Partner with Partnership, Customer Success, Sales, Marketing, and Product teams to align processes with business objectives. Co-own partnership metrics, forecasting, and performance analysis with the RevOps team.
* Ensure CRM & Partnertack Data Accuracy and Hygiene: Work with Partnership team to maintain accurate CRM & Partnerstack data hygiene and integrity. Regularly audit and update customer information to ensure data accuracy.
* Design and Implement Process Improvements
* Generate Data Insights and Analysis: Translate complex data sets into actionable recommendations and insights for decision-making. Generate standard recurring customer health reports, renewal forecasts, and churn analysis.
* Serve as Subject Matter Expert and Main Point of Contact
* Collaborate in Strategic Initiatives and Track Project Progress

 **What You’ll Bring:**


* +2 years of experience in a similar role or in a SaaS company with an understanding of revenue processes.
* Critical Thinking and Problem-Solving: Ability to analyze complex data and processes to identify areas for improvement.
* Excellent communication skills with the ability to convey complex concepts.
* Comfortable navigating dynamic environments and managing stakeholders.

  


**Why Tellent ?**


* Flexibility to work from home and from our beautiful canal-side office in Amsterdam, OR in the heart of Paris
* Flexible remote policy
* Lunch vouchers - Swile (FR)
* Reimbursement of 50% of public transportation (Pass Navigo) 50% (FR)
* 33 paid vacation days per year (FR) or 25 paid holiday days (NL) + 2 wellbeing days.
* Work from anywhere for 4 weeks/year.
* **Learning budget** allocated per year
* **Travel budget** allocated per year to meet your colleagues in different countries
* **Home office setup budget** to make your remote work more convenient.
* International environment

 **About Tellent:**

  


Tellent, a premier Talent Management Suite, enables People teams to improve the full employee lifecycle with a cutting-edge Applicant Tracking System, Human Resources Information System, and Performance Management Software – all in one place.  

  

With 300+ talented employees operating from six global locations, we've empowered over 7,000 organisations across 100+ countries with our leading HR tech solutions – Recruitee, KiwiHR, and Javelo. We have a growing network of over 300 partners, all committed to one vision: guiding all People leaders to create a better world of work.  

  

**Have we caught your attention? ️**  

  

If you’d like to be part of this incredible journey, please apply directly - we're looking forward to speaking to you!  

  

*Tellent is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and welcome applications from underrepresented groups and encourage people of all backgrounds to apply. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, neurodiversity, or status as an individual with a disability.*

title: Digital PR Specialist (French)
description:
We are Leads.io **—** the world’s #1 tech-driven lead generation agency. With a determination to become an ever-better growth catalyst for our clients, we are on the lookout for fresh faces to join our team! Do you have what it takes to join Leads.io?

**Key responsibilities:**


Leads.io is in search of a French Digital PR Specialist to complement our dynamic work environment. In this role, you will be expected to create content that attracts links to our websites. You will create compelling articles by:

* Conducting in-depth research;
* Interviewing experts;;
* Conducting original research data studies;
* Comparing different opinions;
* Finding relevant data, facts, figures, or newsworthy stories in various ways.

**Other responsibilities are:**

* Reaching out to journalists, bloggers, editors, and other influential individuals to build connections and pitch your articles;
* Creating and pitching reactive digital PR campaigns based on trending topics;
* Creating and pitching proactive digital PR campaigns based on potentially interesting topics, even if they're not currently trending, turning your article into a breaking news story;
* Reporting on your campaigns, reflecting on lessons learned, and optimizing future campaigns;
* Collaborating with peers to improve campaign strategies.

**About Leads.io**


Leads.io is your technology-driven partner in effective lead generation. As a global team spread out across eleven offices in nine countries, our mission is to provide empowering business solutions on a global scale. By delivering high-quality leads through diverse channels such as Facebook, Instagram, TikTok, display, native, paid search and organic, Leads.io aims to elevate our clients' ventures to new heights of success.


As a team of result-oriented experts in marketing, technology, strategy, and content, we remain committed to excelling at our craft with every step we take. We think big, act fast, and confidently pave the way for the future. Through a dedication to personal excellence, teamwork, and accountability, Leads.io fosters an environment in which you can shape your path to success whilst engaged in a dynamic and successful company environment.

**Requirements**

**Your qualifications**

* You have 4 years experience in media, preferably journalism (you don't have to be an experienced Digital PR Specialist)
* You know what topics are newsworthy in France, what's trending, what publications to outreach to and what data sources to use
* You are fluent in French, both verbally and in writing, as creating content will be a significant aspect of the job
* You are fluent in English, both verbally and in writing, to effectively communicate within Leads.io
* You possess a commercial attitude and have good communication skills

As Leads.io, we take great pride in our diversity and inclusivity as a hallmark of our success. For this reason, we ensure that all candidates from all backgrounds will receive fair consideration irrespective of their race, gender, faith, religion, or disability. We invite all qualified and motivated individuals to take a chance at joining our team!

**Benefits**

* Salary range EUR 2.500 - 3.100
* 25 holidays per year with 8% holiday pay
* Hybrid working/working from home allowance
* An open and inclusive culture that fosters personal growth and initiative
* Knowledge sessions hosted by internal and external experts
* Flexible working hours
* Provided equipment (Macbook, mouse/keyboard)
* Access to mental health support through OpenUp is offered anonymously and without cost
* The opportunity to work fully remotely for up to a month per year from a location of your choice

**Excited? Wait until you see our cultural values!**

*✨ Trust –* At Leads.io, we emphasize accountability and transparency, setting the foundation for genuine partnerships.


✨ *Own it –* Ownership entails having pride in both your work and yourself. We each aim to take a personal initiative in improving our business, so being the best version of yourself is the best-case scenario for us.


✨ *Grow smart –* Our vision is to become a global frontrunner in lead generation. We are committed to continually scaling our business whilst also growing as individuals in the process.


✨ *Thrive as a team –* We believe that teamwork is a key ingredient to obtaining outstanding results. While holding personal work ethics in high regard, we also encourage a working environment that is both social and more enjoyable through teamwork.


Our recruitment process is designed to ensure the best fit. It comprises a phone meeting to discuss qualifications, followed by an assessment, two interviews for skills and cultural alignment. If successful, we will extend a formal offer. Upon acceptance, you'll embark on your exciting journey with Leads.io.

title: Production Planner Shift Support
description:
Introduction


Are you challenged by executing efficient logistic disturbance support in order to secure a swift time-to-market for ASML’s products? For the next challenging years ahead, we need to strengthen our shift support team!


Job Mission


We organize, coordinate and provide information to resolve second line logistical disturbances for the TF FAB.  

We flexibly provide administrative support for TF FAB. We are back up for TF FAB logistics during out of office hours.


Production Planning Shift Support is responsible for supporting the TF Production Planning team with all logistical tasks needed to meet the machine output plan (MPS). Working in a two shift schedule the key responsibilities are to provide high-end solutions in case of material disturbances, challenge and align with stakeholders on preventing them and shortening the disturbance lead time by ownership and a proactive attitude.


Job Description


The main task of Production Planning Shift Support is to solve material DN’s (Disturbance Notifications). These are ad hoc material requests of our factory, that need to be fulfilled in the shortest period of time possible with the least impact for the whole factory as possible.


The requests occur when a material is rejected or for another reason not usable or available for the factory operator. Mostly second line support for the requests where no stock is available in the general ASML warehouse. Our team checks with the Operational Supplier Coordinators if and when the supplier can deliver. Other solution directions could be different ASML warehouses, service stocks or parent materials.


Shift support need to come with creative and short term solutions to make sure the impact on the factory is minimal and always take the cost aspect into consideration towards the solution.

* Manages the logistics process of the factory by initiating warehouse requisitions, monitoring the progress and limiting logistical disturbances to affect the machine output plan (MPS).
* As a Natural Team member contributing with high-end impact scenario’s and solutions in case of (possible) production delay.
* Analysis and optimization: Knowledge of different planning parameters (for example safety time, safety stock), so in times of changing environment the planning-method can be adjusted.
* Initiative and active input in improvement processes due to the central position and valuable knowledge in processes by nature of the job.
* Data integrity & parameter setting: Understand and maintain the Material-Master data and system behavior and take action in case of discrepancies.
* Reporting and communication: Anticipate on problems and communicate these problems with the different departments (Natural Team) to resolve them together.


Education


Bachelor's degree /Bachelor work level


Experience

* 3/5 year experience in material handling / CRL, or production planning is a pre
* Knowledge of SAP (R3) (or similar) ERP is required, preferably in high-tech environment


Personal skills

* Positive, structured, well organized team player
* Stress resistant and able to plan and set priorities
* Comfortable to work in a two shift support schedule (6:30-15:30/15:00-00:00) and every three weeks in te weekend. (one day off during the work week)
* Motivated and creative problem solver
* Proactively search for and implement improvement opportunities
* Transfer continuous improvement skills with practical applications to the team
* Plenty of initiative, power of persuasion, strong communicator
* Knows how to achieve the impossible, lean way of thinking


Context of the position


The Production Logistics organization within the Twinscan Factory manages the flow of material from supplier into the clean-room. The Production Planning department is responsible for the planning of all build operations within the factory. The Production Planner Shift Support reports to the Production Planning Team Leader and works closely with specialists in Manufacturing, Supply Chain, Warehouse, Material Handling and Global Logistics Services. This function gives you the opportunity to develop yourself and the processes and grow with and within ASML.

**Diversity and inclusion**
---------------------------


ASML is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is the policy of the company to recruit, hire, train and promote persons in all job titles without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. We recognize that diversity and inclusion is a driving force in the success of our company.


Need to know more about applying for a job at ASML? Read our frequently asked questions.
company_description: ASML provides chipmakers with hardware, software and services to mass produce patterns on silicon, helping to build the electronic devices that keep us informed, entertained and connected.

title: Accounts Receivable Specialist (m/f/d)
description:
**Company Description** **About Redcare Pharmacy:**


As Europe’s No.1 e-pharmacy, Redcare Pharmacy is powered by passionate teams and cutting-edge innovation. We strive to create a healthy, collaborative work environment where every employee feels valued and inspired to contribute to our vision "Until every human has their health” . If you’re seeking a career that offers purpose and aligns with your values, join us and start your #Redcareer today.

 **Job Description** **About the role:**


Would you like to join a great team, in an inspiring and modern environment?

  

Our state-of-the-art Head Office in Sevenum offers a canteen where you can enjoy a hot meal during lunch together with some colleagues. Or if you prefer, you can use our lounge area, play table tennis or table football with colleagues. You can even use our on-site fitness gym! Ideal for blowing off some steam and allowing you to come back refreshed and focused after your break.

  

Redcare Pharmacy is Europe’s leading online pharmacy, dedicated to providing quality pharmaceutical products and services to our customers. With our core business thriving, we are expanding into offering additional marketing services for our business partners. To support our Accounting team and facilitate this B-to-B service, we are now looking for an experienced Accounts Receivable Specialist.

  

The Accounts Receivable Specialist will play a crucial role in managing the Accounts Receivable Administration for Redcare Pharmacy. Reporting to the Manager Accounts Receivable, the specialist will be responsible for processing sales invoices, maintaining customer communication, and supporting month-end closing activities.

 **About your tasks:**

* Ensure accurate and timely processing of customer invoices.
* Monitor and collect overdue debtors, taking actions on significant risk issues to minimize Days Sales Outstanding (DSO). This means that you communicate with debtors regarding outstanding invoices both in writing or by telephone.
* Maintain customer master data.
* Handle inquiries from customers and sales teams, research and respond to more complex questions and escalating complex issues as necessary. This could include errors that occur, which can potentially cause complications down the line. In such cases, it's important to thoroughly investigate these errors, identify their source, and pro-actively come up with solutions to rectify them. This often requires maintaining a clear understanding of the overall process and working closely with internal teams to address the issues effectively.
* Responsible for reconciling Accounts Receivable sub-ledger to general ledger as part of the month end closing process.

 **About you:**


You enjoy researching and responding to more complex issues and you address customers in a friendly manner. However, you also know how to achieve results with outstanding invoices.

* 3-5 years of relevant experience in an international organization.
* You have excellent English skills. Additionally, since many of our colleagues speak German, it would be beneficial if you have good German skills as well.
* Affinity with numbers and ability to analyze data.


Please be aware that due to legal requirements, we can only consider applications from candidates who are citizens of the European Union (EU) member countries or who have a work permit for the Netherlands.

 **About your benefits:**

* **Work-life balance:** Do you value picking up your children from daycare on time? You have the option to start your day earlier and leave accordingly. Or vice versa, prefer to sleep in a bit longer? Then you can begin work 1 or 2 hours later. We provide flexible working hours that you can coordinate with your team.
* **Home office:** Sometimes, working from home offers uninterrupted focus for a specific task or the opportunity to attend your son's soccer practice on Wednesday afternoons. We offer the opportunity to work (partially) from home.
* **Health:** We value promoting your health and therefore offer an on-site fitness room for unlimited use. Additionally, mental health is also a priority. Everyone may need support at times, for example, during the loss of a loved one or when providing care for a relative. This can have a significant impact, and therefore we offer “Likeminded” free of charge to our employees. Here, you can schedule an online appointment with a psychologist within 2 days if needed, completely anonymously.
* **Company pension:** Your future is important, which is why we offer a premium-free pension plan for our employees. Redcare Pharmacy covers the full costs of the pension plan.
* Other: In addition to holiday pay, we offer travel allowance and 28 vacation days per year.

  

#yourcareer
company_description: Hi, we’re Redcare Pharmacy. We are the one-stop pharmacy guiding people through health.

title: PMO Excellence Specialist
description:
*Prodrive Technologies is a world-leading company in the design and manufacturing of high-quality electronics and mechatronic systems.*  

*We specialize in delivering innovative solutions across various industries, including automotive, healthcare, semiconductor, and renewable energy.*



As part of our further professionalization, a PMO Center of Excellence has recently been established to drive excellent project, program, and portfolio management across PT’s Business Lines and R&D.


**PMO Center of Excellence (CoE)**



The PMO Center of Excellence:



* Drives the direction and strategy of project management competency for the organization.


* Ensures PM competency development of all PM staff and the expansion of PM knowledge across the organization through learning and development initiatives.


* Acts as a central hub for project management best practices, project management systems, standards, guidance, and tools.


* Ensures continuous improvement of the internal PM practices and related business processes.


* Provides advisory and coaching support to PM staff and project stakeholders on the application of the PM practices.


* Acts as champion and advocate for the PM best practice.

  


**PMO Excellence specialist**



We are looking for an experienced project manager/PMO expert to reinforce our central PMO CoE.
  

The candidate will work up to 40% of the time as a Project Manager in one of our Business Lines.  

  

**Key responsibilities:**



Co-create & deploy a new standard for excellence in project execution


* Improve and implement project management standards and processes, e.g. related to project planning, finance, risk management, reporting, change control
* Develop, deploy, and maintain new tools and templates
* Creating training materials and instructions
* Provide training (train-the-trainer)


Drive discipline in execution


* Drive process and tool usage and data accuracy
* Supports continuous embedding of our business processes
* Drive compliance with internal and external regulations
* Organize and plan steer meetings, drive a timely and thorough preparation of documentation by PM, maintain minutes of the meeting
* Create management reports for portfolio steering


Continuous improvement


* Act as a contact person for improvement initiatives
* Drive a culture of continuous improvement
* Bridge the gap between business processes


**Personal Skills**


* Takes ownership, gets things done and pro-actively drives improvement
* Excellent communicator, being able to influence without hierarchical power, and creative in managing a large and diverse range of stakeholders
* Ability to guide, coach, and advise at all organizational levels to effect sustainable change
* Comfortable with high speed of change and uncertainty
* Maintains personal effectiveness and people focus under pressure
* Team player who enjoys working in multidisciplinary and multicultural teams with the ability to work independently.

**Profile**
-----------

* Master’s degree (MSc) in technical and/or PM direction
* 5-10 years of working experience as a PM(O) expert or experience as a Project Manager in a complex, multi-disciplinary environment
* Experience with the stage gating process and gate reviews
* Experience with the implementation of change and improvement projects
* Experience in leading a team and individual people is a preference

**The Prodrive Technologies Mindset**
-------------------------------------

### **Responsibility**


You don’t just go to work, you feel responsible for your project

### **Flexible**


You decide when, where and how much you want to work

### **Manufacturing**


You like to think about manufacturability when designing

### **Initiative**


You don’t sit and wait, you have a hands-on mentality

**What we offer**
-----------------

* Perfect environment for those eager to develop themselves and take full responsibility for a project.
* Many opportunities for personal and professional development, along with the flexibility to explore diverse roles across various projects.
* A young and dynamic culture which stimulates innovative thinking and taking initiatives.
* Personal budget just for you to learn new things. Your growth is our priority.
* Flexibility of a 24/7 work environment with provided lunch, dinner, and access to our company gym.
* Personalized development plan to craft your future.
* You will receive essential tools if these are necessary to perform your job (i.e. iPhone and laptop).
* On-campus sports facilities enable you to incorporate exercise seamlessly into your work routine.
* A performance-driven salary that grows with your accomplishments.
* Unlock the opportunity to become a shareholder and entrepreneur within the company.
* Travel allowance based on the days you are actually at Prodrive Technologies.
* Work-life balance with at least 33 vacation days per year.
* Access a retirement plan.

**Application steps**
---------------------

* Your journey with us starts with a swift review of your application by one of our recruiters.
* In some cases, if we see a potential fit, you will receive an exclusive link to our online aptitude test to assess if you’re up for the challenge.
* We will schedule a personal interview not only to determine if your skills match the job, but also to see if there is a spark between you and Prodrive Technologies.
* To complete the application journey we will send you a suitable offer and once you sign, we can welcome you to the Prodrive Technologies family.
company_description: Do you have a passion for technology? We create technologies that are essential links in the systems which form the basis for today’s and tomorrow’s world.

title: Accounts Receivable Specialist - Maternity Cover
description:
**Values & Innovation**
-----------------------


At Under Armour, we are committed to empowering those who strive for more, and the company's values - Act Sustainably, Celebrate the Wins, Fight on Together, Love Athletes and Stand for Equality - serve as both a roadmap for our teams and the qualities expected of every teammate.

  

Our Values define and unite us, the beliefs that are the red thread that connects everyone at Under Armour. Our values are rallying cries, reminding us why we're here, and fueling everything we do.

  

Our pursuit of better begins with innovation and with our team's mission of being the best. With us, you get the freedom to go further - no matter your role. That means developing, delivering, and selling the state-of-the-art products and digital tools that make top performers even better.

  

If you are a current Under Armour teammate, apply to this position on the **Internal Career Site Here.**

**Purpose of Role**
-------------------


For temporary backfill of our teammate who is currently absent for longer period of time, we are looking for a highly motivated Accounts Receivable Specialist who is able to effectively manage the Accounts Receivable portfolio for the BENELUX area and ensure that all customer payments are received in line with agreed payment terms. The right candidate will be a team player with strong communication skills, a can-do attitude and a passion for the UA brand.  

**This role will be based in Amsterdam, reporting directly to the Manager Accounts Receivable and will have an average duration of 12 months.**

**Your Impact**
---------------

* Manage the general ageing of the Accounts Receivable portfolio for the wholesale accounts in the Benelux area and achieve overall corporate targets.
* Frequent telephone and email communication with customers as part of the general cash collections process.
* Ensuring proper maintaining of the customer master database, especially managing the addresses, VAT ID numbers, contact persons and their email addresses and Direct Debit data,
* Work closely with the claims and dispute department enabling them to resolve any occurring dispute or claim.
* Support the cash application specialist by obtaining customer payment information in a timely manner.
* We reserve the rights to allocate customers from other areas.
* Other financial and administrative support duties deemed necessary.
**Qualifications**
------------------

* 1-2-year post-education experience, preferably in an Accounts Receivable position.
* College level education.
* Fluent in Dutch and English languages.
* Experience in SAP preferred.
* Knowledge of Excel.
* Strong numerical skills, high attention to detail.
**Workplace Location**
----------------------

* **Location:** This individual must reside within commuting distance from our Amsterdam office.
* **Return to Work Designation:** Hybrid work (baseline of minimum 2 days a week in-office.
* **Travel:** IE- 5-10% of the year
**Relocation**
--------------

* No relocation provided


#LI-KC1


#LI-HYBRID

**Benefits & Perks**
--------------------

* Paid “UA Give Back” Volunteer Days: Work alongside your team to support initiatives in your local community.
* Under Armour Merchandise Discounts
* Health & fitness benefits, discounts and resources- We offer teammates across the country programs to promote physical activity and overall well-being.
* 38 hour working week
* Hybrid work, a minimum of 2 days in the office
* 28 days holiday
* Teammate Resource groups e.g. Green Machine, Sustainability, LGBTQIA+, Women in Leading and Living, Balance for mental health and wellbeing etc.
* Human Performance Institute (Gym) on site
* Local Language course when moving from abroad
**Our Commitment to Diversity**
-------------------------------


At Under Armour, we are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and teammates without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, pregnancy (including childbirth, lactation and related medical conditions), national origin, age, physical and mental disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information (including characteristics and testing), military and veteran status, family or paternal status and any other characteristic protected by applicable law. Under Armour believes that diversity and inclusion among our teammates is critical to our success as a global company, and we seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. Accommodation is available for applicants with disabilities upon request.
