title: QA Engineer
description:
At APC we're looking for a QA Engineer to join our team.



Full-time · Amsterdam


**About Us**
------------



Amsterdam Platform Creation (APC), founded in 2020, supports fintech firms that deliver best-in-class financial related services. Our experienced and talented experts help these firms in becoming better and growing into something bigger. We believe that the whole is greater than the sum of its parts. We provide assistance in all aspects of platform commercialization, including development, design, UX-design, technical implementation, and on/offline advertising to optimize the client funnel. The main company we are working for/with at the moment is Woolsocks.


**About Woolsocks**



Woolsocks is a financial services application that empowers its members to make the most of their money while leading the way for socially conscious behaviour. Woolsocks is built around multiple themes and offers various financially related services.



Today there are endless opportunities to save money, but it’s easy to miss out on them. We believe technology can help you spend less and save more. That’s why we created Woolsocks. A smart app that helps you find personalized saving opportunities that suit you best and help put more money in your Woolsocks.

  

**About the Job**
-----------------



If you think that “one programming language is not enough”, feel like the best technology is the one that fits the purpose, have a self-starter attitude and tech-driven curiosity, know that a good opinion must be shared, you can proceed with reading.



We are looking for a 3+ years experienced QA Software Engineer who will be responsible for designing and implementing our QA Automation and Performance Testing Framework ready to deal with mobile application testing and a highly decoupled cloud-based micro services mesh.


**What You Will Be Doing**
--------------------------


* Define, design and implement the QA Automation and Performance Testing Frameworks
* Define the automation methodologies, strategies, standards, tools, best practices for automation processes
* Participate in all phases of QA testing including: System (functional and non-functional), Integration, Regression, Smoke, Exploratory, Performance, Data verification and Acceptance testing.
* Continuously streamline and improve the testing life cycle to ensure test planning, execution, and reporting are effective and coordinated.
* Analyse testing results to enhance future test plans and scenarios. (Including metrics and benchmarks to gauge improvement).
* Design, build and execute automated test scripts for mobile applications based on software requirements and functional specifications.
* Integrate QA automation within the CI/CD pipeline
* Work in an Agile cross-functional team
* Continuous learning and researching for identifying shortcomings and opportunities for test strategies
* Have fun with your team


**What Will Help You Succeed?**
-------------------------------



Being an expert in:


* Tests Automation in any one of the modern scripting or compiled languages: (Python, JavaScript, Java, Kotlin, Objective-C, Swift, C++)
* Software quality (SQA) methodologies and practices
* One or more Testing Automation Frameworks: Detox, Cypress, Appium, Robotium, Selenium, Cucumber
* All the phases of QA testing: System (functional and non-functional), Integration, Regression, Smoke, Exploratory, Performance, Data verification and Acceptance testing.


Being experienced in:


* Mobile/Web Test automation
* Testing, defect reproducing and tracing in a Distributed Environment
* Testing Strategies in a Microservice Architecture
* GDPR best-practices for testing
* Continuous integration concepts
* Backend (APIs, Databases) and UI testing and automation required.
* Security fundamentals; authentication, authorization, cryptography
* Event-driven architecture and technologies
* Automated CI/CD solutions (e.g. Jenkins)
* Cloud technologies (preferably GCP)
* Containerization and container orchestration technologies (preferably K8s)


**We offer**
------------


* **A big challenge**. Start with a blank page.
* **An exciting adventure**. Feels good to do something that you don’t know yet, right?
* **Great colleagues**. You can’t choose your family, but you can choose your colleagues!
* **Variety**. You will work for APC and all its portfolio brands. Every day is different!
* **Transparency**. You don’t execute the roadmap; you are part of it. No office politics here!
* **Momentum**. We move at lightning speed.
* **Entrepreneurship**. Become a self-starter.
* **Work hard, play harder**. We get it done and pop champagne.
* **Good compensation**. Great skills come with great benefits.

title: Azure Platform Engineer
description:
As a Cloud Engineer for the Azure Platform Team (Team Titan) in the area of Engineering Platforms, which is part of the Tribe Tech4Engineering, you participate in shaping the future of our global Cloud transformation. You make a difference and real impact by driving the adoption of Cloud-Native Application Designs within Rabobank. As a team, you work together with the DevOps teams. By doing so, we can bring services to our customers faster, more reliably, and more securely.


Join our team at Rabobank, where innovation meets diversity in cloud computing. We’re a tight-knit group of professionals dedicated to aiding other teams on their journey to the cloud and offering a secure Azure Platform. We’re on the lookout for an Azure Cloud Platform Engineer who’s not just technically proficient but also a perfect fit for our unique team culture.  

  



**About Team Titan:**


Team Titan is one of the three Azure teams and focuses mainly on Compute services and the following Azure services:


* **Azure Container Apps**
* **Azure Container Instance**
* **Azure Container Registry**
* **Azure Function App**
* **Azure Webapp**
* **Event Grid and Event Hub**
* **Azure API Management**
* **And more**

Our mission is to provide a robust and secure Azure platform that empowers DevOps teams to innovate and deliver value efficiently. We work closely with these teams to lower their cognitive load and support their cloud journey.


**As a Cloud Platform Engineer within the Area Engineering Platforms, you can help bring about this change by:**


* Developing, managing, and maintaining the Azure Platform for Rabobank
* Building various security automation, designing solutions, and making a real difference at Rabobank by contributing to the long-term goals of Engineering Platforms
* Undertaking diverse responsibilities and initiatives, with full autonomy
* Growing your knowledge of the complete Azure Cloud technology stack (network, security, functions, containers, data, etc.) with a focus on storage
* Driving automation by utilizing CI/CD pipelines and Infrastructure as Code
* Ensuring that all services delivered are compliant according to the bank
* Driving innovation with new technology
* Helping DevOps teams in their journey to the Cloud
* Helping DevOps teams lower their cognitive load
* Delivering support and direction to DevOps teams
* Sharing knowledge to increase competence within the DevOps teams
* Participating in a standby shift that will rotate within the team

**How do we work within our team:**


Working together with an agile mindset is the way we work. Our team joins forces with other (Azure) teams within the Area Engineering Platforms to make all Cloud infrastructure and automation processes faster, more agile, and more secure. We provide a secure and easy way for DevOps teams within the bank to leverage the Azure Cloud. In addition, we have weekly contact with the DevOps teams to understand their challenges and share knowledge. We lower their cognitive load so teams can quickly and easily accelerate delivering value for their stakeholders. Rabobank is transitioning to a Cloud-first environment, which is providing a lot of fun challenges and opportunities.  

  



**What do you bring to the table:**


We are looking for new colleagues who can prove they are (Azure) Platform Cloud Engineers with an insatiable curiosity in (Azure) Cloud Engineering, technology, innovation, and self-development on a medior/senior level. We believe that if you are a good Platform Cloud Engineer, it is logical that customer orientation, team collaboration, enthusiasm, and an unstoppable hunger for new knowledge are indispensable for this function. In addition, it is important that you recognize the skills and capabilities on the checklist below:  

  



**People and cultural skills and capabilities:**


* Good communication skills
* English proficiency in speech and writing
* True team player with a goal-driven mindset
* Eager to keep learning new technologies
* Agile and DevOps mindset
* Not afraid to engage in experimentation
* Able to adopt new technology and introduce new ideas
* Able to initiate and maintain cross-functional collaboration
* Contribute to psychological safety within the team and be respectful
* Work towards constructive conflict resolution
* Participate in a learning culture
* Lower the Cognitive Load by minimizing the mental effort required by DevOps teams to understand the platform’s capabilities
* Ensure the platform is easy to use, thus encouraging adoption across the organization
* Focus on complex, specialized tasks that require deep expertise, such as algorithm development or data science
* Encourage the sharing of expertise and resources among teams
* Provide services to another in a self-service fashion, reducing the need for constant communication
* Provide documentation to help teams understand how to use the services
* Coach, mentor, and educate teams and engineers to become more autonomous

**Process skills and capabilities:**


* CI/CD: Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery
* Minimum of 2 years of experience with Agile Way of Working (Scrum & Kanban)
* Minimum of 2 years in the DevOps way of working
* Experience in incident response handling and processing
* Experience in risk and mitigation processes
* Ability to eliminate technical debt
* Experience with security processes and compliance governance
* Experience with On-demand Self-service
* Ability to measure services and monitoring
* Experience with loosely coupled architecture
* Embrace the everything as code principle

**Technical skills and capabilities:**


* Minimum bachelor’s degree in a relevant direction (B ICT)
* Substantive knowledge of (Azure) Cloud technologies & Cloud design patterns
* Minimum of 2 Azure certifications (Solutions Architect and/or Azure Administrator and/or DevOps Engineer and/or Azure Security Technologies)
* Minimum of 2 years of experience with Azure development
* Experience with at least one of the following programming/scripting languages: Bash and/or PowerShell
* Experience with Azure DevOps practices, Git, and Yaml pipelines
* CI/CD: Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery configuration, usage, and maintainability
* Azure Resource Manager (ARM) or Azure Bicep
* Knowledge and experience of Cloud-native development
* Knowledge and experience with commonly used Azure resources like Azure Web App, SQL server, Azure Function App, App registration
* Knowledge and experience of Azure Active Directory
* Knowledge and experience of Azure policies
* Knowledge and experience with commonly used Azure resources like Azure Web Apps
* Skills to troubleshoot and fix issues in a running cloud application (highly preferred)
* Azure Function Apps, Azure Logic Apps, Azure Service Bus, Azure API Management
* Azure Virtual Machines, Azure Bastion, Azure Bot Service
* Azure Container Apps, Azure Container Registry, Azure Event Grid/Hub

**It is a plus if you also have:**


* Knowledge of Self-service API’s, event-driven architecture, and serverless architecture.
* Knowledge and experience with Azure Networking concepts like VNET, Subnets, NSGs, and Private Endpoints
* Knowledge of container technologies like Docker, Azure Container Apps, Azure Container Instance, Azure Container Registry
Knowledge and experience with programming to build a backend cloud application  
* 

  

**Growing a better world together**


You are already aware that Rabobank is a financial services provider for millions of customers in 40 countries. But did you know that we aim to contribute to real change with our “Growing a better world together” mission? We do so in countless ways, such as:


* A third of all the food we purchase is thrown away. Together with Nature & Environment, we’re working to increase awareness among consumers of how to reduce food waste.
* As part of a project with Humanitas, we are helping people who are experiencing financial difficulties to get their household finances in order.
Together with Vluchtelingenwerk Nederland (the Dutch Council for Refugees), we are helping 1,500 refugees find a suitable job.  
* 

**What do we offer?**  

We would love to help you achieve this by focusing firmly on your growth, development, and investing in an environment where you keep learning every day. We give you the space to innovate and initiate. In this way, we offer you numerous opportunities to grow and help you exceed your expectations, to do the right thing exceptionally well, and to therefore grow as a professional. In addition, with us (on the basis of a 36-or 40 hour working week), you can also expect:

* Based on your experience: up to max € 90.000,00 incl all benefits (40 hours) depending on your experience.
* Thirteenth month's salary and 8% holiday allowance
* an extra budget of 11% of your gross salary to be used at your discretion. Buy extra holiday hours, add more to your pension savings or ask for part of the extra budget to be paid out.
* a budget of € 750- to set up your home working space and a monthly home working allowance of up to € 40-
* a personal development budget of € 1,400-
* a combination of working from home and at the office
* 100% reimbursement of commuting costs if you travel by public transport
* A pension scheme to which you contribute 3.5%
* 151.2 hours holiday per year + 1 Diversity Day per year

Relocation belongs to the possibilities  
* 

This is a selection of the terms of employment for a DevOps Engineer based on a 36-hour working week. You can find all terms of employment on rabobank.jobs/en/conditions-of-employment.  



**You and the job application process**


Reply to the vacancy for Lead Platform Engineer Azure at Rabobank.

* Any questions about working at Rabobank and the process? Lois Hageman, IT Recruiter, marie-louise.hageman@rabobank.nl
* We will hold the interviews through a video call.
* You can find answers to the most frequently asked questions on rabobank.jobs/nl/veelgestelde-vragen.
* A security check is part of the process.

We respect your privacy.  
* 

**Growing a better world together**  

You are already aware that Rabobank is a financial services provider for millions of customers in 40 countries. But did you know that we aim to contribute to real change with our “Growing a better world together” mission? We do so in countless ways, such as:

* A third of all the food we purchase is thrown away. Together with Nature & Environment, we’re working to increase awareness among consumers of how to reduce food waste.
* As part of a project with Humanitas, we are helping people who are experiencing financial difficulties to get their household finances in order.
* Together with Vluchtelingenwerk Nederland (the Dutch Council for Refugees), we are helping 1,500 refugees find a suitable job.


Interested? Please contact us.

title: Marketing Specialist
description:
* Netherlands
* 4539
* Employee Regular Full Time
**Job Description**
-------------------

**Overview**  

Marketing Specialist – Food and Beverage EMEA


NL Based – Breda area / Remote (Dutch Speaking)

  



Are you looking to take a major step forward into marketing, working in a high growth tech company? Are you ready to work in a fast-paced environment and eager to learn more about B2B marketing?


We are looking for a creative, ambitious and performance driven individual to join our global marketing team based in the Netherlands.

  



**The Role**


Aptean’s Global Marketing Team is recruiting for a Marketing Specialist to join our EMEA Food and Beverage team. You’ll be responsible for supporting the execution of Account Based Marketing demand generation campaigns to the food and beverage sector in the Benelux region to build both brand awareness and quality leads to fuel the sales pipeline. You’ll work closely with marketing team members, product and sales teams to deliver virtual and in-person events, create and execute integrated campaigns across the marketing mix, and support the creation of local content. You will be supported by the best learning platforms to accelerate your growth and develop your business and functional skills, as part of other programs to accelerate your career plan at Aptean. The candidate will need to have a growth mindset willing to lean and innovate, be well organised, able to juggle multiple activities effectively, and have excellent communication and writing skills in both Dutch and English language.

**Principal Duties and Responsibilities**


Reporting to and working closely with the Marketing Manager for Benelux your primary duties will include:
* Execution of themed and vertical ABM multi-channel marketing campaigns that incorporate email distribution, digital advertising and paid social programmes.
* Assist in organizing events and webinars where they are either hosted by Aptean or one of our media or industry association partners.
* Co-ordinate content syndication programmes selecting appropriate content to drive the best outcomes.
* Collaborate with our design team, inhouse and local writers, to create and update a range of compelling content aligned to our brand and that can be published via various online channels.
* Support Dutch website improvement initiatives helping to build website traffic and increase page engagement through relevant content.
* Assist with translation and localization requirements for regional campaigns within the EMEA team.


You will also be expected to:* Stay well-informed on marketing trends, emerging technologies and industry topics that will help us to market more effectively to our target market.
* Build collaborative relationships with the global marketing team, sales and product management.
* Nurture and develop your skills through self-learning, learning by doing, coaching and special projects assignments.

 **Candidate Profile: You are / have**

* A Native Dutch speaker but fluent in spoken English and with a high level of grammatical accuracy in written English.
* Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent.
* Minimum 2-4 years B2B marketing experience in a corporate environment.
* A keen interest for business development through multi-channel marketing and brand building – in particular the use of digital channels such as Google, LinkedIn and websites matched with intent data and personalization through 6sense and Mutiny platforms.
* Excited about building a career in a fast moving and innovative technology sector.
* A naturally curious nature, eager to learn, with a positive ‘can do’ attitude.
* Good communication skills.
* Good time management - Organised enough to work on multiple projects simultaneously and understand the importance of hitting deadlines.
* Proven ability to follow plans/directions but with confidence to apply input and ideas.
* Self-motivated and are confident working independently or collaboratively.
* Commitment to teamwork and able to operate in an international environment.
* Experience of Adobe programs (Photoshop and Illustrator) would be an advantage.
* Experience of email marketing platforms, ideally Marketo, would be an advantage.

  



About Us


Aptean is a private equity backed software company that connects companies in specific industries with specialized software solutions. In today’s fast-paced, highly competitive economy, organizations don’t have time to waste forcing homegrown software, spreadsheets, and one-size-fits-all solutions to do things they were never designed to do. Aptean is on a mission to end those workarounds with streamlined industry-specific software solutions. That’s why over 6,500+ highly specialized organizations in more than 20 industries and 80 countries rely on us to simplify their everyday operations.


If you are looking for a company where you can give your best, work collaboratively, and build your career, we encourage you to apply!


Aptean, Inc., is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. In accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws we do not tolerate discrimination or harassment against any applicant for employment or employee with Aptean because of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or any other group status protected by applicable law.

title: Sales Executive Holiday Inn Express Deventer (PT)
description:
**Sales Executive (Part-Time, 3 Days a Week)**


Combine your passion for hospitality & sales as a **Sales Executive** at the **Holiday Inn Express & Suites Deventer**, part of **IHG Hotels & Resorts**. In this dynamic role, you will play a crucial role in driving business growth by identifying new sales opportunities, building strong relationships with clients, and promoting our hotel services. We at Holiday Inn Express & Suites Deventer, managed by Cycas Hospitality, have a dedicated team that get to be their true selves so that they can deliver positively OUTRAGEOUS service.


**What will you do?**


***Revenue:***


* Seeking conference, corporate and group business ensuring full communication with the sales manager to convert into business.
* To conduct pro-active sales activities.
* To be fully aware of the physical product as well as additional sales opportunities to maximise revenue.
* To always understand the department’s financial requirements.


***People:***


* Participate in hotel promotional activities.
* Ensure that you and all team members have a sound knowledge of the local area regarding history, places of interest and special events and where further information can be obtained.


***Guest Experience:***


* Provide guests with information (e.g. loyalty programmes, area attractions, restaurants, facility information) to enhance guest experience.
* Interact with guests and build account profile.
* Develop and maintain relationships with key clients and outside contacts to produce group and/or convention business, to include room sales, food and beverage sales and catering/banqueting services.
* Assist with conventions and/or business group activities at the hotel and coordinate with other hotel level departments to facilitate services agreed upon by the Sales Office and prospective clients.


***Responsible Business:***


* Taking responsibility for the reactive side to sales within the hotel
* Work alongside the operational hotel teams to ensure client expectations are communicated and ultimately met.
* Identify new sales opportunities and identify new customers and attract them to the business with all the tools provided.
* Ensures that current and prospective client databases are maintained that files are kept current and accessible and that timely sales reports are submitted to the Director of Sales.
* Regularly follow up with clients and maintain accurate and updated information.
* Respond to client calls and special requests, ensuring that specific information is captured such as final details, dates, times, and hotel room requirements.
* Communication to appropriate departments all pertinent information requirements and special needs for arriving VIP’s, large groups, and other key guests.
* Monitor guest satisfaction on a regular basis, both pre-and post-event.


**Who are we looking for?**


* Proven experience in sales, preferably in the hospitality industry.
* Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.
* Strong customer service orientation and ability to build rapport with clients.
* Ability to work independently as well as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.
* Dutch and English is mandatory


**What we offer you:**


* Salary range according to Horeca CAO
* Travel allowance.
* Free parking
* Cycas smiles Reward & Celebration program.
* The best project you will ever work on is you! So let us help you grow with our guidance and training possibilities.
* Employee rate in over 6000 hotels!


Cycas Hospitality is a GIFT for any hospitality professional. Over the past 16 years we have created an innovative hotel management company.


Join us at an exciting time as we grow and develop not only our portfolio but also our people. At Cycas we work hard, and we make working hard look fun. This is your opportunity to shine and be a part of something great. If you believe you have what it takes and want to be a part of our team, then we want to hear from you!

title: Tourism Management Lecturer
description:
Tourism Management
 Vlissingen
 0,8 fte (32 uur)
 4.013-6.114
 WO
 15 sep. 2024
*Size: 0.8 fte (32 hours)*  

*Location: Flushing*

 **Do you enjoy bringing your knowledge and skills across? Are you the kind of teacher that helps our students and the study programme develop further? Are you the right fit? Then apply for the vacancy of Lecturer Tourism Management at HZ University of Applied Sciences.**

**Your work as a Lecturer in Tourism Management**
-------------------------------------------------

  

From day one, you will be part of a small, ambitious and innovative team. With your team, you know how to upskill and achieve your potential. Coaching students and helping them with their professional development, is just the challenge for you, for instance by designing education in a practice-oriented way. You have an eye for social trends and an innovative and inquisitive attitude. You are a team-player, committed and have an open style of communication. Passion for education, teaching and coaching young full-time students is what drives you. This manifests itself in a student-focused, collaborative and positive attitude.


The Tourism Management study programme is part of the Business, Vitality & Hospitality domain. The Tourism Management programme is taught in English, with a strong focus on hostmanship, guest experience and change management.

**Are you the right fit?**
--------------------------

  

You see students as individuals and realise that it is important to understand their personal needs and interests. You ensure that your students enter the professional field and are well-prepared and that they can put their knowledge into practice. Maintaining contact with the professional field is also part of your job. You coach and motivate your students. And you determine the learning pathway together with the student. Our programme is an international program, so teaching in English is no problem for you. Your communication skills and sense of responsibility help turn our students into good professionals. In short; inspire, excite and challenge the new generation. In addition:

  

* You have a completed Bachelor's and above that we prefer a Master's degree in a relevant field;
* You have affinity with and experience in higher education;
* You have relevant work experience in the field of tourism;
* You are a good student coach and communicate clearly;
* You have good planning and organisational skills and are result-oriented;
* You have well-developed teaching and coaching skills;
* You have an excellent command of English.

**Grow with us**
----------------

  

We believe that future-proof education starts with our employees. Therefore, in addition to a pleasant, vibrant and informal working environment, we offer you:

* A temporary appointment for one year in the position of Lecturer. Renewal of this appointment is subject to personal performance and formative space;
* A gross monthly salary between € 4,013.22 and € 6,114.87 for full-time employment (scale 11 cao-hbo);
* Support in obtaining a basic qualification in didactical competence if you do not have one already (in the second contract year);
* 8.3% end-of-year bonus, 8% holiday allowance and possibly an allowance for travel expenses and/or allowance when working remotely;
* About 53 days off if you work full-time;
* Every opportunity to work on your personal and professional development;

Fun activities organized by HZ Fun, HZ Sport and HZ Cult as well as the opportunity to work out at the HZ Vitality Center.  
* 

**Working at HZ University of Applied Sciences: the personal university of applied sciences**
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

  

Together with about 600 staff members and 5,000 students, we dedicate ourselves daily, with innovative education and research, to our mission; contributing to a better world.


Working at HZ means working in a vibrant community where there is plenty of room for unique ideas and the development of your talents so that you can grow. Doors are always open, so you can drop in on colleagues just like that. Because at the end of the day, we do it together. Whether you work as a teacher, caretaker, marketing officer, ICT specialist, HR advisor or financial manager: together we contribute to a better, sustainable world. That is the strength of our personal University of Applied Sciences.

**Apply**
---------

  

Are you the enthusiastic Tourism Management Lecturer we are looking for? Then apply no later than the 15th of September 2024 via the application button below. Would you like more information first? Paul van ‘t Veer, manager of the study programme, to be reached at +31 6-3007 6435, can tell you all about this position.


Interviews will take place on the September 23 afternoon and September 24 afternoon. If you pass the first round of interviews, we will ask you to give a demonstration lecture to our students afterwards.


Are we both convinced that we are a good match? Then you will start in your new role as a Tourism Management Lecturer as soon as possible.

 *At HZ University of Applied Sciences, we recruit our new colleagues ourselves*


### **Enthousiast?**
**Waar wacht je nog op?**




Je hebt nog 9 dagen om te sollicteren!

title: CTA3
description:
ICON plc is a world-leading healthcare intelligence and clinical research organization. We’re proud to foster an inclusive environment driving innovation and excellence, and we welcome you to join us on our mission to shape the future of clinical development.  

The Clinical Trials Associate is responsible for assisting clinical study teams in the execution of clinical trials and on-time delivery of clinical trial milestones.

 **What you will be doing:**  

* Establish and maintain the Trial Master File (TMF) in inspection-ready state
+ May communicate directly with sites to drive collection and review of essential documents throughout the study
+ Ensure accurate and timely review and filing of clinical trial related materials
+ Assist QC reviews of study, country, and site files, including issue resolution
+ Produce reports and status metrics as requested

* Establish and maintain the Clinical Trial Management System (CTMS)
+ Maintain accurate and up-to-date site, vendor and internal study team contact information
+ Track study progress and produce reports and status metrics as requested
+ Assist Investigational Product reconciliation activities

* Assist study team by performing administrative tasks as needed
+ Schedule meetings, either onsite or remote by means of virtual conferencing system
+ Prepare meeting agendas, minutes, and track action items
+ Operate and navigate within clinical trial systems including but not limited to Electronic Data Capture (EDC), SharePoint Online, eTMF and CTMS

* May assist with the creation and maintenance of documents and plans for assigned clinical studies, including but not limited to training materials, study binders, plans, presentations, and reports
+ Ensure timely distribution of clinical trial related materials

* Assist in activities associated with company-sponsored site quality audits as well as regulatory authority inspections
* Works under general supervision in performing regular job duties and receives general instructions on new assignments
* Assist in vendor oversight and vendor contact management.
* 
+ Performs all duties and responsibilities in accordance with CFR, GCP/ICH Guidelines, SOPs, and other applicable guidelines.
+ This position may involve travel for training or study needs, as applicable.

 **You are:**

* A minimum of 1-year clinical operations experience, preferably within the pharmaceutical or biotechnology industry (global experience preferred)
* Basic knowledge and understanding of Essential Documents, CFR and/or GCP/ICH
* Proficiency with technological systems (Microsoft Office, Excel, PowerPoint, SharePoint Online, eTMF and CTMS (Veeva Vault Clinical preferred), EDC (Electronic Data Capture), Zoom, OneNote)
* Fundamental understanding of filing systems and organizational tools
* BS/BA or equivalent preferred, or relevant and qualifying training/experience
* Fluently Dutch and English

**What ICON can offer you:**  

  

Our success depends on the quality of our people. That’s why we’ve made it a priority to build a diverse culture that rewards high performance and nurtures talent.
  

  

In addition to your competitive salary, ICON offers a range of additional benefits. Our benefits are designed to be competitive within each country and are focused on well-being and work life balance opportunities for you and your family.  

  

Our benefits examples include:
* Various annual leave entitlements
* A range of health insurance offerings to suit you and your family’s needs
* Competitive retirement planning offerings to maximise savings and plan with confidence for the years ahead
* Global Employee Assistance Programme, TELUS Health, offering 24-hour access to a global network of over 80,000 independent specialised professionals who are there to support you and your family’s well-being
* Life assurance
* Flexible country-specific optional benefits, including childcare vouchers, bike purchase schemes, discounted gym memberships, subsidised travel passes, health assessments, among others

  

Visit our careers website to read more about the benefits of working at ICON: https://careers.iconplc.com/benefits  

  

At ICON, diversity, inclusion & belonging are fundamental to our culture and values. Our rich diversity makes us more innovative which helps us better serve our people, patients, customers, and our communities. We're proud of our diverse workforce and the work we’ve done to become a more inclusive organisation. We’re dedicated to providing an inclusive and accessible environment for all candidates. ICON is committed to providing a workplace free of discrimination and harassment. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application process, or in order to perform the essential functions of a position, please let us know through the form below.
  

  

https://careers.iconplc.com/reasonable-accommodations  

  

Interested in the role, but unsure if you meet all of the requirements? We would encourage you to apply regardless – there’s every chance you’re exactly what we’re looking for here at ICON whether it is for this or other roles.

title: Educationalist
description:
#### **Functiebeschrijving**


Within the GSMS master team we are looking for an Educationalist to enhance our educational programmes. Your key responsibilities will include designing and implementing new courses within the selective master programmes Clinical and Psychosocial Epidemiology (CPE) and Molecular Medicine and Innovative Treatment (MMIT), maintaining and improving the quality of existing courses through the PDCA cycle, and creating lifelong learning course modules (micro-credentials) for PhD students and industry professionals as part of a new project funded by Pharma NL.
  

  

You will be embedded within the GSMS master team and will closely work with the programme manager, academic directors of the master programmes and experts within the UMCG and industry.  

  

**Core activities are:**  

* Development and organization of new courses at MSc, PhD and professional level.
* Aligning educational goals with teaching methods, assessment, and target audience per course (in collaboration with the teachers).
* Implement new teaching strategies in the courses (for example reverse classroom teaching, online lectures, use of AI etc.).
* Evaluation of the progress of the new developments.
* Reporting on the outcomes.

#### **Wat vragen wij**


The candidate we are looking for is a proactive, customer-oriented educationalist who fits the following profile:  

* A relevant academic education.
* Experience with development and coordination of educational programmes, and with aligning educational goals with teaching methods and assessment.
* Experience with developing e-modules and lifelong learning is a plus.
* Team player who is able to collaborate with various stakeholders involved in the educational programmes.
* Strong organizational and project management skills.
* Good proficiency in English and excellent communication skills, both in oral and written communication.
* Proven interest in educational innovations.


  

The UMCG has a preventive Hepatitis B policy. You may be required to build up sufficient protection against Hepatitis B before you can be appointed. Vaccination is provided by the UMCG if necessary.
#### **Wat bieden wij**


* An international and dynamic environment with dedicated colleagues in the Graduate School of Medical Sciences of the UMCG.
* Supervision by and regular meetings with the programme manager, academic directors, and coordinators of the pharma-NL project.


  

This is a full-time appointment of 36 hours per week for a year with the possibility of an extension. Your salary will be a maximum of € 5.010,- gross per month (scale 9), depending on your qualifications and relevant experience, based on a full-time appointment.
  

In addition, the UMCG will offer you 8% holiday pay, and 8.3% end-of-year bonus. The conditions of employment comply with the Collective Labour Agreement for Medical Centres (CAO-UMC). The starting date is as soon as possible.
#### **Meer informatie**


Neem voor meer informatie contact op met:  

Meike van der Veen, MSc, telefoonnummer + 31 6 552 573 91  

#### **Solliciteren**


Please use the the digital application form at the bottom of this page - only these will be processed. You can apply until **17 september 2024**.  

Within half an hour after sending the digital application form you will receive an email- confirmation with further information.

title: Learning Specialist
description:
**Purpose**

The Learning Specialist actively supports the reinforcement of a learning culture within Medline by developing and managing learning initiatives.

**How can you help us?**

* Collaborate with stakeholders to identify learning needs and design effective learning solutions, ensuring their alignment with organisational goals and contributing to overall success.
* Collaborate with the HR department to analyze the current skills gap and develop a comprehensive plan to address and fulfill the identified gaps
* Provide advice and guidance to business partners on learning strategies and content.
* Develop learning programmes with a blended learning approach tailored to meet the needs of adult learners.
* Establish and document processes and guidelines to streamline learning initiatives, ensuring consistency and efficiency in the development and delivery of learning solutions.
* Support HR in developing training and/or learning initiatives on people management related content.
* Support the coordination and preparation of the yearly Sales meeting.
* Stay up to date with industry trends and best practices in learning and development and incorporate them into the design of learning solutions.

**Are you our match?**

* Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience (appr. 5 years) within the Learning field.
* Familiar with various learning methodologies, such as ADDIE, Bloom's Taxonomy, and instructional design principles.
* Knowledgeable in adult learning theories and best practices, with an understanding of how to effectively engage and motivate adult learners.
* Demonstrates creative thinking and innovative problem-solving abilities.
* Possesses excellent interpersonal, communication, and relationship-building skills across all levels.
* Capable of achieving results in a fast-paced, dynamic, and demanding environment.
* Demonstrates strong organisational skills and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
* Fluent in English; proficiency in additional European languages is advantageous.
* Affinity with the medical industry and/or knowledge of European healthcare systems is a plus.
* Experience with Articulate 360 is an advantage.

**We have everything covered:**

* A comprehensive introduction by experienced colleagues - An individually tailored onboarding plan and fixed contacts so you can be off to a great start.
* Company pension plan - We increase our contributions to your pension plan throughout your employment because setting you up for a successful retirement is important to us.
* 26 days of vacation – We also focus on personal development
* A range of training opportunities - We actively support you in your professional development
* Fresh fruit, free coffee, bi-weekly team lunch and other benefits, such as Medfit Wellness Centre - So that your physical well-being is taken care of
* Employee Assistance Programme – So that your mental well-being is taken care of
* Flexible working options - To make your work flexible and productive
* International working environment - Our European headquarters is truly diverse.

*Medline is committed to reducing our carbon footprint, developing responsible products, supporting our employees and local communities, and promoting high ethical standards internally and among our supplier partners. Click* *here* *to discover what Medline is doing to make healthcare more sustainable for people and the planet.*

title: Lecturer Leadership
description:
**General**


You will join a multidisciplinary team of professionals in a challenging and friendly environment. The school community is international, which means both the educational programme and all business communication are in English. Hotelschool The Hague has developed an excellent reputation over 90 years; the result of the structured & innovative educational programme and the experience and quality of our staff, instructors, and lecturers.

 **General** **function description**

* You will teach, train, coach and assess both Dutch and international students in leadership and communication skills
* Areas of focus within communication include giving and receiving feedback, giving
  

presentations, demonstrating assertiveness in dealing with difficult guests, and practising proactive communication within teamwork
  

	+ Leadership skills are focused on the development of the students’ emotional intelligence and ability to deal with adversity within the context of leadership, including the training of motivating employees, progress and appraisal interviews and meeting skills.
* You will be developing and improving courses that are closely linked to real-world (hospitality)management practices.
* Two to four times per year, you will guide students through a week-long outdoor leadership development programme.
* You are a professional and motivating trainer who is able to encourage young adults to achieve excellence.
* You are flexible and an active team player willing to cooperate and contribute towards the university’s success.
* You feel at home in an English speaking dynamic and international academic environment

  


**Candidate profile**


You have/are:

* a Master’s degree
* a minimum of 4 years work experience in training communication, leadership and management skills, at least a part of which is within an international environment.
* several years of teaching experience or proven affinity with teaching i.e. considerable experience in training and coaching based on agile methods and/or relationship management
* analytical and conceptual skills
* an excellent command of the English language (C1-level)
* very good social and communication skills
* insight into and knowledge of current developments in management
* management experience
* knowledge of the hospitality industry is a plus
* an ability to work independently with a proactive attitude towards problem solving
* insight into and knowledge of current developments in management is a plus as is
  

management experience as well as knowledge of the hospitality industry
* an enthusiastic approach to education with an emphasis on coaching students to deal with real-world professional assignments

**Remuneration**


Hotelschool The Hague offers a salary based on scale 11 the labour agreement of Universities of Applied Science (CAO HBO) with a range between€ 4.234,29 and€ 5.936,77 per month, depending on your professional experience and qualifications.


In addition, Hotelschool The Hague offers:


* A 13th month;
* An excellent package of fringe benefits;
* Employees with a 40-hour working week are entitled to 428 hours (53 days) of leave annually with retention of salary;
* Excellent opportunities for further personal development;
* Compensation towards your health insurance expenses;
* Option to make use of group discounts for multiple insurances;
* Travel allowances for commuting to and from work;
* A pension plan through ABP;
* Most importantly you would work for an organisation that strives to have a positive impact on society, helping to develop future leaders in the hospitality industry.
  




**Additional information**


Hotelschool The Hague works with a 40-hour workweek. The starting date for this position is as soon as possible depending on the notice period of the applicant.


The work location for this position can be either our Campus in Amsterdam and/ or Campus The Hague.  

  

Additional information can be provided by Ms Berenbaum (Program Manager Bachelor) through email: c.berenbaum@hotelschool.nl  

  

An English language proficiency test may be part of the selection procedure. Upon receiving an offer, a certificate of conduct (VOG) is required.

 **How to apply**


We look forward to receiving your English CV and motivation letter.  

To apply please select the apply button,and send your cv and motivation letter to the attention of Menno Koeslag, HR Advisor


  
Department
Bachelor Year 1-4
Locations
The Hague/ Amsterdam
Salary based on fulltime employment July 2024

title: CRISTAL, Sentinel-3 and Sentinel-3 NGO Lead Space Segment Engineer
description:
Apply now »


CRISTAL, Sentinel-3 and Sentinel-3 NGO Lead Space Segment Engineer


**Job Requisition ID:** 18885
**Date Posted:** 5 September 2024
**Closing Date:** 26 September 2024 23:59 CET/CEST
**Publication:** Internal & External
**Type of Contract****:** Permanent
**Directorate:** Earth Observation Programmes
**Workplace:**Noordwijk, NL
**Grade Band****:** A2 - A4  

**Location**  

ESTEC, Noordwijk, Netherlands
**Description**

Lead Space Segment Engineer for the CRISTAL (Copernicus polaR Ice and Snow Topographic ALtimeter), Sentinel-3 (Sentinel-3C/D) and Sentinel-3 Next Generation Optical missions. The post covers the activities relating to:  


* phases C/D/E1 for the first CRISTAL satellite and the recurrent satellites of CRISTAL, including storage where applicable;
* phases D/E1 for Sentinel-3 C/D satellites, including storage;
* phases A/B/C/D/E1 for Sentinel-3 Next Generation Optical (S3NGO) satellites.

  


You will report to the relevant Satellite Engineering and AIV managers regarding all technical and programmatic matters and will work within the relevant project teams. You will be technically responsible, in particular, for the development of the space segment engineering and relevant sub-systems, and the AIV/AIT definition and implementation. Your responsibilities will include proactively monitoring the platform industrial procurement within the project(s).  


You will interface with and receive support from other engineers working on the projects, as well as from specialised technical support from the Directorate of Technology, Engineering and Quality (D/TEC).
**Duties**

Your main tasks and responsibilities will include:  


* contributing to the management of the industrial activities by leading the specification, design, procurement, development, and verification/acceptance of spacecraft, platform and equipment hardware, including ground support equipment, throughout the project lifetime, from ITT to flight commissioning;
* monitoring the industrial progress and design evolution at spacecraft, platform and equipment levels, ensuring it remains consistent with the technical and programmatic requirements, in full coherence with the system requirements and operational interfaces;
* consolidating and maintaining the satellite internal/external interfaces and engineering technical budgets, including the definition of the interfaces to the launcher;
* monitoring industrial verification activities, including definition and implementation of the development AIV and AIT processes, to ensure proper verification, including resolving non-conformances, and supporting the assessment of deviations and waivers;
* coordinating with PA and AIT during integration and testing activities for the resolution of activity deviations;
* contributing to the autonomy and operability concept and supporting the FDIR definition when requested;
* supporting the Ground Segment and Operations teams in the execution of their activities, including SVTs;
* supporting storage and de-storage activities, including preparation, maintenance and verification of system and equipment performance during de-storage;
* providing support to launch campaign preparation and execution and to the platform in-orbit operations up to the end of commissioning;
* providing regular reporting to project management and identifying technical risk areas, proposing and monitoring mitigation measures;
* contributing to the management of the schedule and proposing schedule risk mitigation actions;
* monitoring the industrial preparation for launch and coordinating in-flight spacecraft commissioning and verification activities in collaboration with project and ground teams;
* coordinating various project engineering domains to cover the procurement of the hardware under your responsibility;
* coordinating specialised engineering support from the ESA Directorate of Technology, Engineering and Quality in the relevant areas under your responsibility.

  


Your duties may also include supporting other activities within your field of competence in the Projects Department of the Directorate of Earth Observation Programmes.
**Technical competencies**
Multidisciplinary technical knowledge and experience in your area of responsibility, in particular regarding space segment engineering, including related PA standards
Knowledge and experience in spacecraft design, development, integration and verification
Knowledge and experience in spacecraft launch campaign, LEOP and commissioning definition and execution
Experience of managing technical interfaces between subsystems in an ESA project team environment and/or within the industrial consortium
Experience working in a project environment on the procurement and monitoring of industrial activities
Knowledge and experience of complex project schedule and risk management processes**Behavioural competencies**

Result Orientation  

Operational Efficiency  

Fostering Cooperation  

Relationship Management  

Continuous Improvement  

Forward Thinking  

  

For more information, please refer to ESA Core Behavioural Competencies guidebook
**Education**

A master’s degree in a relevant engineering discipline is required.  


**Diversity, Equity and Inclusiveness**  

ESA is an equal opportunity employer, committed to achieving diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. We therefore welcome applications from all qualified candidates irrespective of gender, sexual orientation, ethnicity, beliefs, age, disability or other characteristics. Applications from women are encouraged.
At the Agency we value diversity, and we welcome people with disabilities. Whenever possible, we seek to accommodate individuals with disabilities by providing the necessary support at the workplace. The Human Resources Department can also provide assistance during the recruitment process. If you would like to discuss this further, please contact us via email at contact.human.resources@esa.int.  

  

**Important Information and Disclaimer**  

In principle, recruitment will be within the advertised grade band (A2-A4). However, if the selected candidate has less than four years of relevant professional experience following the completion of the master’s degree, the position may be filled at A1 level.
Applicants must be eligible to access technology and hardware which is subject to European and US export control regulations.
During the recruitment process, the Agency may request applicants to undergo selection tests. Additionally, successful candidates will need to undergo basic screening before appointment, which will be conducted by an external background screening service, in compliance with the European Space Agency's security procedures.
Note that ESA is in the process of transitioning to a Matrix setup, which could lead to organisational changes affecting this position.
The information published on ESA’s careers website regarding working conditions is correct at the time of publication. It is not intended to be exhaustive and may not address all questions you would have.  


**Nationality and Languages**  

Please note that applications can only be considered from nationals of one of the following States: Austria, Belgium, the Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Ireland, Italy, Luxembourg, the Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, the United Kingdom and Canada, Latvia, Lithuania, Slovakia and Slovenia.
According to the ESA Convention, the recruitment of staff must take into account an adequate distribution of posts among nationals of the ESA Member States\*. When short-listing for an interview, priority will first be given to internal candidates and secondly to external candidates from under-represented Member States\*.
The working languages of the Agency are English and French. A good knowledge of one of these is required. Knowledge of another Member State language would be an asset.
* Member States, Associate Members or Cooperating States.

title: Mechanical Team Lead
description:
Arup, our innovative spirit compels us to express our ingenuity in unique ways — engineering, planning, designing, and consulting on many of the most renowned projects in the built environment. We aim to deliver technical excellence, innovation, and value to clients, while maintaining our core mission of shaping a better world. The firm opened its first office over 75 years ago and now employs 17,000 people globally. Since its founding in 1946, members of Arup have developed transformative ways of solving complex engineering problems, from Sydney Opera House, Paris Centre Pompidou, Beijing’s Birds Nest, Munich Allianz Arena, Sagrada Familia in Barcelona, Apple’s HQ in Cupertino, Francis Crick Institute in London, Amsterdam’s Haut. Adapting to the ever-changing environment, our work is focused on ambitiously reimagining a sustainable and resilient future for cities. We do that by investing heavily in our people, internal research, and putting purpose before all else.

  

Arup has been named in Glassdoor's Top 10 best places to work. Are you driven by having a sense of purpose, thrive on leading high-performing teams in shaping a better world? Do you believe that sustainability should underpin everything we do in built environment? Then this role is for you!

  

**Mechanical Team Lead**



We are looking for a leader that will grow and develop our team and empower the next generation of leadership. You will engage with our Clients and demonstrate Arup differentiators through leading project delivery, and apply innovative design strategies to achieve high level of energy performance and low carbon footprint in the built environment.

  

**Responsibilities**


* Leading and developing a team of mechanical engineers with a focus on sustainable design.
* Manage current and future performance of the team by managing work and developing and mentoring the team for growth
* Responsible for the recruitment, performance, development, morale and motivation of specified staff.
* Promoting learning from successes and problems within the group and across the firm.
* Extensive experience with HVAC and plumbing systems in buildings, sustainable, Low Carbon and innovative strategies on projects
* Leading mechanical system design and management for large, complex projects – coordinating with other Arup disciplines and external Architects within tight time and budget constraints.
* Attend meetings and communicate with clients to establish their needs and discuss design issues with them.
* The development and implementation of mechanical team plan in line with business strategy; contributes to the development of the business strategy.
* Market facing, business development capabilities, and experience with putting fees and proposals together.
* Capable of procuring work and identifying potential opportunities.
* Responsible and accountable for client relations (internal and/or external).
* Represents Arup in the industry nationally and internationally, e.g., think tanks, standard committees and conferences.


**Your technical and personal competencies**


* Master’s degree in Mechanical Engineering
* Technical skills: 13+ years of industry experience with focus on sustainable design
* Strong knowledge of engineering fundamentals, deep experience in project delivery
* Passion for sustainable, Low Carbon and innovative strategies on projects
* Technical understanding of energy modelling.
* Understanding of BIM and Revit MEP
* Ability and enthusiastic to develop and mentor junior team members in their career development, including technical and soft skills
* Experience of knowledge transfer and capacity building with client teams and internal teams, supporting their learning and capability building as a key outcome
* Proven capability to easily “tune in” to the client organisations we are working with – their values and their character.
* Experience in putting fees together.
* Ability to network effectively, internally and externally, to promote Arup and establish/maintain client relationships.
* Excellent planning and organization skills required for fast-paced environments.
* Ability to manage project change and ambiguity.
* Highly motivated, inquisitive, proactive and willing to take on new challenges.
* Collaborative, helpful, “can-do”, and Client focused attitude.


**About Working at Arup**  

At Arup, you will work alongside some of the most talented people, in an employee-owned company that puts sustainable development at the heart of our work.  

You’ll get to work on projects in the Netherlands, and world-wide, that push people’s expectations of what’s possible… from inspiring buildings to projects that will shape our future and help us mitigate the impact of climate change.  

Lear more about working at Arup here: take-the-leap


* We offer you an Arup contract with a competitive salary and good fringe benefits such as an excellent pension and travel expenses, OV chipcard 1st class, even travelling by bike is covered.
* At Arup, you work in an international environment that enables you to share knowledge and experience with the whole world. In addition, there are short- and long-term opportunities to work in one of our offices abroad
* Arup is an independent, employee-owned company. Employees at Arup are shareholders of the organisation and are eligible for the Global Profit Share programme. This means that as an employee you will receive a profit share twice a year.
* A relatively large part of our capital is reinvested in training and research. These budgets are available to all employees.
* We have our own Arup University with internal and external training courses to keep you constantly developing.
* Arup arranges all facilities so you can work ergonomically and responsibly from home.
* And last but not least, the opportunity to create impact in our society with the next level regenerative buildings.


**Shape your time with us**  

At Arup we provide an immersive onboarding experience, allowing you to get to know your colleagues and understand the Arup culture, supported by an ongoing programme of social and cultural events. We provide a range of flexible working options. Arup strongly encourages continuous professional development and provides access to many training opportunities through our own Arup University and external vendors.


**Interested?**  

If you are interested and would like to join us, please apply online!


**Our commitment to equality, diversity and inclusion**  

Arup is committed to creating an inclusive working environment based on merit, fairness and respect. One that encourages talented people of any background to produce their best work of the highest quality. As a humane organisation, we embrace the skills, abilities and knowledge, that only a diverse and inclusive workforce can provide, to create solutions, and give advice, that improves society as a whole. We encourage all qualified candidates regardless of gender, disability, family or parental status, racial, ethnic or social origin, religion, belief, or sexual orientation. During the recruitment stages, we can take specific measures to accommodate candidates with special needs. We welcome applicants of all ages.
