* Strong knowledge of various media (besides film also digital experience) and understanding of photo and video equipment, techniques.
* Ability to quickly orient within a matrixed marketing organization and hit the ground running.
* Outstanding organizational, project management, problem solving (critical thinking) and time-management skills.
* Collaborative, diplomatic, helpful in attitude, and resilient in the face of ever-changing demands.
* Resourceful, self-motivated, responsive and efficient - ability to organize and manage multiple projects simultaneously whilst meeting quality/brand standards & deadlines; flexible but assertive.
* Expert communication skills, both written and verbal, to keep a team of cross-functional individuals informed and on track through all phases of production process. Fluency of English is a must.
* Passionate self-starter with a proven ability to work independently, multitask, and meet deadlines.
* Experience succeeding in a fast-paced growth environment involving time-sensitive, complex projects.
* Build, manage and maintain healthy internal & external partner relationships (no dependencies with any supplier).
* Knowledge on content management (DAM) & user rights management
* Software proficiency with Microsoft Office, Keynote/PowerPoint and Adobe Suite

title: Coordinator Account Operations
description:
**Join the Innovators in Electronics!**  

Murata's technologies, products and solutions are used everywhere, contributing to a safer, healthier and more efficiently connected world.  

As a global high tech house we are challenging ourselves every day to develop electronics solutions enabling innovations and shaping the future.  

Whether you are an experienced professional or a new graduate, you will find great opportunities to contribute, learn, and develop alongside a talented, diverse global team.


**Job Purpose**
---------------


Take care of the day-to-day processes with the customer in order to achieve the highest possible levels of service to maintain our quality accreditations and maximize customer satisfaction.


**Responsibilites and Tasks**
-----------------------------


* Order administration: in order to ensure correct and timely deliveries to the customer and to ensure correct pricing:  

	+ Order entry, rescheduling and expediting via internal system
	+ Ensure correct placing of purchase orders
	+ Adjust and improve purchase orders (change, improvement, escalation)
	+ Monitor and control reservation controlled items (CBM, Ceiling, etc.)
* Keep Customer Cross Reference files up-to-date in line with agreed contracts and quotations:  

- Invoicing, credit/debit- and selfbill handling: ensure a timely payment and balancing of stock and return shipments
* Stock control: have a good balance between meeting customer requirements by avoiding slow moving and excessive stock:  

- Monitor local and consignment stock levels, and take any corrective actions necessary together with the Sales team to minimize the slow-moving-, excessive- and obsolete stock levels
* Master file maintenance: facilitate the day-to-day running of the customer’s account:  

	+ Maintain accurate customer information, in order to have a clear record of customers’ specific requirements
* Customer Relationship: join customer visits depends on necessity:  

	+ Support Sales actively in terms of Logistic/SCM issues and customer visits
* Internal Relationship: facilitate the smooth communication and positive cooperation between CS and other Murata departments:  

	+ Follow processes in line with documented procedures within the job’s authorization levels
**Required Knowledge/Experience**
---------------------------------


* Secondary school level or comparable commercial education in connection with the appropriate professional experience (3 years)
* Advanced experience in ERP systems (USSO/AS400, SAP, etc.)
* Basic commercial Skills
* Good English and local language skills in speaking and writing
* Basic skills in standard software (MS Office, etc.) and Murata specific software
* Basic product knowledge
* Basic knowledge in Quality Management
* Basic communication skills (active listening, conflict management)
* Ready for business trips
* Basic negotiation skills


**What we have to offer you:**


* Possibility to work 40% of your time remotely
* Stable work environment, with focus on personal and professional development
* Work together with highly skilled and experienced professionals
* Well structured and personalized onboarding program
* Being part of a global leader that contributes to the advancement of society
* Possibility to participate in our Corporate Social Responsibility activities
* Positive work atmosphere and an open door mentality
* Frequent company events arranged by our Social Club
company_description: Starting as a one-man start-up in 1944, Murata has grown into a global market leader in passive electronic components, connectivity solutions and power conversion with more than 80.000 employees.

title: Communications Officer 4TU Centre for Engineering Education
description:
Communications Officer 4TU Centre for Engineering Education
 Apply Now
Job description


The 4TU Centre for Engineering Education (4TU.CEE) is looking for a communication officer who can help operationally and strategically communicate and promote our activities and results. Are you creative and proactive? Do you have experience with branding an organization? Do you have an interest in working in higher education? Then this position might be for you. We expect our communication officer to take about 12-16 hours weekly on average, with some variation depending on the activities organized and the time of the year. It is possible to work from any of our four universities as a home base (Delft, Wageningen, Twente, Eindhoven), hybrid or completely remote.



The 4TU.Centre for Engineering Education (4TU.CEE) is the Dutch centre of expertise for university teachers and researchers with questions and ambitions in the domain of engineering education innovation and research at our four universities of technology. 4TU.CEE aims to jointly inspire stimulate, support, and disseminate effective and high-quality engineering education through scientific research and the application of evidence-informed innovations within the engineering education domain.



You will work in close collaboration with the 4TU.CEE Board members, a dedicated team of engineering education experts from the four universities. We currently would like to evaluate our communication strategy and streamline the communication processes in line with our Strategic Agenda 2026-2029 (in development). Of course, the daily communication tasks continue during this update. You are both executing and improving the process at the same time. More particularly you will work on:


* Branding 4TU.CEE and disseminating the project results of our centre; Assisting in the development of 4TU.CEE reports or publications, including editing texts and selecting photos or other visual materials; Managing and updating the 4TU.CEE website and other social media; Leading the development of the content, lay-out, and distribution of the 4TU.CEE electronic newsletter (every 2 months) and 4TU.CEE blog;
* Co-organizing 4TU.CEE events together with the program coordinators, academic leads, and project leads; Creating and disseminating communication around specific organized events, such as website texts, brochures, subscription pages on website, emails, promotion via screens at the universities (typically 1 or 2 events each month); Making sure that the 4TU events are known widely and that there is a nice audience attending;
* Advising the Board on the 4TU.CEE’s communication strategy; Managing and maintaining the 4TU.CEE corporate identity; Acting as a reference point and contact for questions about communication and correct use of 4TU.CEE house style, logos, and templates;
* Strengthening our local and (inter)national networks and communities, also to detect opportunities for collaboration and dissemination;
* Coordinating and supporting junior communication colleagues or student assistants in their communication tasks;
* Managing the 4TU.CEE email account and making notes of the 4TU.CEE board meetings (every 2-3 months); Providing input for the board’s agenda on communication matters.


Requirements


* You are an experienced (> 5 years).
* Creative, analytical, collaborative, and proactive communication professional.
* At least HBO level with a hands-on mentality and skillset and a strategic view on the branding of an institute like 4TU.CEE.
* You have experience or a proven interest in working in higher education.
* You are fluent in English, and preferably also in Dutch.
* It is a plus when you have prior experience with Content Management Systems (CMS).


Conditions of employment


* Duration of contract is 1 year with prospect for extension.
* A job of 11.4-15.2 hours per week.
* A salary based on the CAO for Dutch Universities with a minimum of €3.377,- and a maximum of €4.640,- gross per month based on a fulltime contract (38 hours), plus 8% holiday allowance and an end-of-year bonus of 8.3%.
* An excellent pension scheme via the ABP.
* The possibility to compile an individual employment package every year.
* Discount with health insurers.
* Flexible working week.
* Every year, 232 leave hours (at 38 hours). You can also sell or buy additional leave hours via the individual choice budget.
* Plenty of opportunities for education, training and courses.
* Partially paid parental leave
* Attention for working healthy and energetically with the vitality program.


From 1 September next, a salary increase of 3.7% applies due to a Collective Agreement amendment, followed by an additional 1% increase on 1 January 2025. In addition, most employees employed on 1 September 2024 will receive a one-off payment of €300 gross based on full-time employment.


TU Delft (Delft University of Technology)


Delft University of Technology is built on strong foundations. As creators of the world-famous Dutch waterworks and pioneers in biotech, TU Delft is a top international university combining science, engineering and design. It delivers world class results in education, research and innovation to address challenges in the areas of energy, climate, mobility, health and digital society. For generations, our engineers have proven to be entrepreneurial problem-solvers, both in business and in a social context.



At TU Delft we embrace diversity as one of our core values and we actively engage to be a university where you feel at home and can flourish. We value different perspectives and qualities. We believe this makes our work more innovative, the TU Delft community more vibrant and the world more just. Together, we imagine, invent and create solutions using technology to have a positive impact on a global scale. That is why we invite you to apply. Your application will receive fair consideration.



Challenge. Change. Impact!


University Corporate Office - Department of Communication


Impact for a better society: this is TU Delft’s mission. As marketing and communication professionals, we are proud to contribute to this goal every day. We guide our 28,000 students on their engineer journey from students to professionals at work in society. In science communication we share research results and highlight important issues in the societal themes of Climate Action, Energy Transition, Digital Society, Resilient Cities & Mobility and Health. Through TU Delft Campus we build connections with companies and policy makers in our innovative ecosystem, accelerating the rate at which research outcomes meet purpose in society. And under the motto #BetterTUgether, we help our almost 8,000 TU Delft colleagues connect. Together we are strengthening the TU Delft brand, which stands for groundbreaking research, excellent education and pioneering innovations.


Additional information


For more information on the position, please contact Remon Rooij (chair 4TU.CEE), r.m.rooij@tudelft.nl.



Please include the following information in your motivation letter:


* Your experience that makes you a good fit for this position / job requirements
* Your (additional) value and skills that make you stand out
* Your aim and/or ideas for your personal development


Please include the following information in your CV:


* 2 examples of earlier communication work
* 2 references with contact information


Application procedure


Are you interested in this vacancy? Please apply no later than **27 September 2024** via the application button and upload your motivation (maximum of 1 A4) and CV.



There will be 2 rounds of online interviews with members of each TU. The second round may include an assignment related to the position.


* You can apply online. We will not process applications sent by email and/or post.
* A pre-Employment screening can be part of the selection procedure.
* Please do not contact us for unsolicited services.


FACULTY/DEPARTMENT### **University Corporate Office – Communication**

JOB TYPE### **Marketing and communications**

SCIENTIFIC FIELD### **not applicable**

HOURS PER WEEK### **11.4-15.2**

SALARY### **€ 3.377,00 - € 4.640,00**

DESIRED LEVEL OF EDUCATION### **Higher professional education**

VACANCY NUMBER### **TUD05699**


Apply Now

title: Human Resources Coordinator
description:
**Job Number** 24155958  

**Job Category** Human Resources  

**Location** Aruba Marriott Resort & Stellaris Casino, L.G. Smith Boulevard # 101, Palm Beach, Aruba, Aruba VIEW ON MAP  

**Schedule** Full-Time  

**Located Remotely?** N  

**Relocation?** N  

**Position Type** Non-Management  



**Human Resources Coordinator**

  



Create and maintain filing systems. Create and type office correspondence using a computer. Distribute and route mail. Order and track Human Resources office supplies and forms. Answer phone calls and record messages. Create new employee personnel file. Assist walk-in candidates with application procedures. Maintain space designated for completing applications and ensure it is clean, well maintained, and accessible to individuals with disabilities. Respond to questions, requests, and concerns from employees and management regarding company and Human Resources programs, policies and guidelines. Inform Human Resources management of issues related to employee relations within the division or property. Maintain confidentiality and security of employee and property records, files, and information. Ensure accurate maintenance of all employee records and files (e.g., interview documents, I-9's).

  



Follow all company policies and procedures; ensure uniform and personal appearance are clean and professional; maintain confidentiality of proprietary information; protect company assets. Report accidents, injuries, and unsafe work conditions to manager. Welcome and acknowledge all guests according to company standards. Speak with others using clear and professional language; prepare and review written documents accurately and completely; answer telephones using appropriate etiquette. Develop and maintain positive working relationships with others; support team to reach common goals; listen and respond appropriately to the concerns of other employees. Ensure adherence to quality expectations and standards. Enter and locate work-related information using computers and/or point of sale systems. Move, lift, carry, push, pull, and place objects weighing less than or equal to 10 pounds without assistance. Perform other reasonable job duties as requested by Supervisors.

  



PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS


Education: High school diploma or G.E.D. equivalent.


Related Work Experience: At least 1 year of related work experience.


Supervisory Experience: No supervisory experience.


License or Certification: None

JW believes our associates come first. Because if you’re happy, our guests will be happy. JW Marriott associates are confident, innovative, genuine, intuitive, and carry on the legacy of the brand’s namesake and company founder, J.Willard Marriott. title: Associate Customer Care Specialist
description:
What if the work you did every day could impact the lives of people you know? Or all of humanity?
At Illumina, we are expanding access to genomic technology to realize health equity for billions of people around the world. Our efforts enable life-changing discoveries that are transforming human health through the early detection and diagnosis of diseases and new treatment options for patients.
Working at Illumina means being part of something bigger than yourself. Every person, in every role, has the opportunity to make a difference. Surrounded by extraordinary people, inspiring leaders, and world changing projects, you will do more and become more than you ever thought possible.
Why Us
Illumina are a global leader in genomics – an industry at the intersection of biology and technology. At the most fundamental level, we enable our customers to read and understand genetic variations. We strive to make our solutions increasingly simple, more accessible, and always reliable. As a result, discoveries that were unimaginable even a few years ago are now becoming routine – and are making their way into patient treatment.
Why you
You have a customer solution experience and looking for a new opportunity or you have a customer care mindset with a passion to make a difference in human health, then we would like to hear from you.
You are fluent in English and any additional European language is a plus.
If you want to push boundaries and join a culture fueled by innovation, collaboration and openness, this role could be for you. If you want a brilliant, fast-paced, dynamic, and mission-driven environment, then Illumina is the place for you.
The role
As Customer Care Coordinator, you will be based at Illumina’s Customer Operations Center in Europe, based in Eindhoven. This is a key role in our organization where no day will be the same!
You will be supporting our customers and company sales representatives. You will work with accuracy and efficiency and manage the high value order process while supporting sales by maintaining positive customer relations.
You will have a responsive, flexible, and adaptable approach and you will be using multiple systems such as Salesforce.com, SAP, MS Office Suite.
Responsibilities will include* Incoming case triage in our CRM system Salesforce.com.
* Process customer high value orders in an efficient and timely manner according to the customer specifications and per compliance regulations.
* Review and release incoming orders via our online ordering platform MyIllumina.com.
* Build productive collaborative working relationships with our Customers and Internal departments (Contracts, Account receivables, Quotes, Finance, Sales, Field Service & Support)
* Assist in responding to customer inquiries and provide the best suitable solution to their needs.
* Perform other duties as assigned.


Preferred background, skills, and experience* Ability to adapt and learn systems and processes quickly.
* Strong interpersonal and customer care skills.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills.
* Understand and deploy key internal business processes.
* Experience independently solving problems and working effectively in a team environment.
* Detailed and quality oriented.
* Fluent in English and any additional European language is a plus.


What can you expect?
With Illumina you can expect a highly competitive salary accompanied by a market leading benefits package. You will be part of the global leader in the Sequencing industry where you will find robust growth opportunities and career development within Illumina.
Our team members are bright, energetic, and dedicated—they are the driving force behind our innovation and impact. To attract the best and brightest, we offer a competitive employee benefits program. We view it as a smart investment in our people, one that recognizes the tremendous value they bring to our business every day. At Illumina, we push boundaries. We think beyond the conventional. We dream big. With the energy of so many bright and accomplished people, the opportunities are endless.
All job offers with Illumina are subject to a valid VOG (Code of Conduct). Failure to be able to supply this might result in the retraction of any job contract.
#INDEUR
#LI-EMEA  


Illumina believes that everyone has the ability to make an impact, and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to providing employment opportunity regardless of sex, race, creed, color, gender, religion, marital status, domestic partner status, age, national origin or ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, pregnancy, military or veteran status, citizenship status, and genetic information.
company_description: Illumina is a global leader in genomics – an industry at the intersection of biology and technology. We are improving the future of human health by unlocking the power of the genome.

title: EHS Specialist
description:
**Why Valvoline Global Operations?**

  

Valvoline Global is a worldwide leader in automotive and industrial solutions, creating future-ready products and best-in-class services for partners around the globe. Established in 1866, we introduced the world’s first branded motor oil, claiming our position as The Original Motor Oil. As an affiliate of Aramco, one of the world's largest integrated energy and chemicals companies, we continue to invest strategically and expand globally, driving unparalleled product innovation and sustainable business solutions.

 **Our corporate values of care, integrity, passion, unified, and excellence** shape everything we do. Living out our values is what makes our company, our employees, our partners, our customers, and the communities we serve great.

  

When you join Valvoline Global, you join a culture that is committed to: treating all people with care, operating with integrity, striving for excellence in everything we do, showing passion about delivering on our commitments, and being unified in all our enterprise endeavors.

 **Job overview**

* <span 55="" helvetica="" roman="">Responsible for creating and maintaining an environment that drives continuous improvement in the areas of Environment, Health and Safety. Lead the implementation of and assure compliance with Valvoline EHS policies and local regulations applicable to the region.
* <span 55="" helvetica="" roman="">Provide leadership, professional knowledge and technical expertise in the administration and support of regulatory compliance, permitting, policy and program development and training to multiple supply chain facilities.
* <span 55="" helvetica="" roman="">Developing and driving programs that continuously improve employee safety performance in the region to world class standards;
* <span 55="" helvetica="" roman="">Guiding company wide EHS-related objectives and supporting execution of EHS-related initiatives;
* Developing and implementing regional and local EHS management systems and maintenance of applicable certifications of such systems (e.g., RC14001, ISO45001, ANSI Z10, etc.) within the assigned region.

 **What you'll be doing...**

 **Compliance**


Track/analyze local regulatory changes and provide local direction on compliance issues. Coordinate sustainability and environmental permits/processes

**Risk management**


Identifying and evaluating hazards, prioritizing the associated risks, and thereby managing measures that lead to acceptable (safety) conditions with costs and yield.

**Management of processes and systems**  

Maintain and continuously improve the (EHS) management systems in accordance with the primary process of Valvoline, to support a safe and environmentally friendly work situation. Coordinate purchasing requests regarding EHS related topics.

**Incident investigation**


Carrying out conducting effective root cause analyses for incidents and trends. Support in defining effective control measures.

**Transferring knowledge, attitudes and ethics**


Transferring knowledge, attitudes and ethical awareness and acting as a coach and counselor in safety and environmental issues, to enable individuals to fulfill their role and take responsibility

**Stakeholder management**


Make trade-offs about building relationships with stakeholders and involving and influencing them in the concern for safety.

**Culture and behavior**


Involving people and the organization to coach them effectively (during changes) for a positive safety result.

**Auditing and inspection**


Conducting and managing safety audits, in which facts and evidence are tested against legislation and standards, and inspections.

**Information collection / analysis and effective advice**


Retrieve Environmental and Sustainability, as well as Health and Safety information from the processes within the organization, analyze it and report on it to support decisions on an operational and tactical level.

 **Other responsibilities...**

* **Port Facility Security Officer (PFSO)**

Activity: the PFSO is responsible for supervising compliance with the set security measures.


Think of: ISPS, Principles of security, Port Security Measures, Port Facility Plan, Port Security Committee, Port Facility Assessment, Declaration of Security, Measures levels 2 and 3, Access control, Training requirements.

* **Prevention officer Dordrecht/ Klundert**

(Global EHS manager EMEA is back up for Klundert as being a SEVESO location)


Activity: To (co-) draw up and implement the Risk Inventory and Evaluation (RI&E).


Advising and working closely with the works council / staff representation on the measures to be taken for a good working conditions policy.

* **BNO Coordinator Dordrecht**

Activity: Coordinate training and execution of the BHV checklists, keep BHV up to date in number of participants

 **What you'll bring...**


4 year degree in engineering and/or safety.


5+ years in EHS, preferably with multi-site and some management experience

 **Preferably**:

* HVK certificate

 **Knowledge**

* Solid understanding of risk assessment and control methodologies
* Basic knowledge of formal auditing practices
* Working knowledge of comprehensive EHS management systems such as RC14001, ISO45001, or ANSI Z10

 **Skills**

* Excellent communication skills that enable to act at different levels (internal and external).
* Local regulatory codes safety, health and environment.
* ISO management systems such as VCA, 9001, 14001 and 45001
* Demonstrable extensive experience with Office / Word, Excel and Outlook, Teams, administrative processes
* Professional command of the Dutch & English language

  

Valvoline Global provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. Are you good at what you do? Join us.

  

The Company has put a process in place to make its recruitment process accessible to any and all users. Reasonable accommodations will be provided, upon request, to applicants with disabilities in order to facilitate equal opportunity throughout the recruitment and selection process. Please contact Human Resources at 1-800-Valvoline or email 1-800Valvoline@valvoline.com to make a request for reasonable accommodation during any aspect of the recruitment and selection process. The contact information is for accommodation requests only; do not use this contact information to inquire about the status of applications.

**Requisition ID: 807**

**#LI-LD1**

title: Coordinator Paid Social
description:

We’re creative minds crafting strategies that not only attract attention but also build meaningful connections. We win awards and aim for perfection. **The Vibe**: In this adventure, you will be playing around with the latest and greatest tools, from AR to AI. Your expertise will help us navigate the bustling world of social media advertising, and explore platforms like Meta, TikTok, Snapchat, Pinterest and YouTube. Under the wing of our Paid Social and Programmatic Manager, you’ll be spinning stories and creating campaigns that get our tribe – the sneakerheads – hyped.
Responsibilities:
**Your Toolkit:*** Design campaigns that aren’t just ads; they’re drops that everyone wants to cop.
* Collaborate with the cool kids on the block (our marketing team) to make sure our message is as fresh as our kicks.
* Analyze the buzz from our campaigns and figure out how to break the internet next time.
* Stay fresh to the ever-changing game of paid media, especially when it comes to ruling social media.
* Speak up in team discussions with ideas that are outside the box – because who likes being boxed in?

* Teamwork makes the dream work, and you’re all about that collaboration life.
* A growth mindset that’s all about leveling up yourself and the squad.
* A degree in something smart like business marketing, economics, or business informatics – we dig that.
* Details? You spot 'em like limited edition drops.
* Communication skills so on point, they’re practically viral.
* Hungry to learn and always ready to take on the next challenge.
* If you know your way around Google Analytics, that’s a bonus track on your mixtape.
* Project management is your hidden talent, making sure every campaign is straight fire.

 **Why You’ll Love It Here:*** We are a team dedicated to pushing boundaries and creating new paths. And you’re going to be a part of it.
* Work with a squad who are as passionate about the sneaker game as you are.
* Learn and grow with resources that are all about bringing excellence and setting trends.
* Be a part of the sneaker culture, where collaboration is key, and innovation is our language.

**Ready to Join the Crew?**: Send your resume that shows us your flavor. We’re stoked to see how you’ll bring your A-game to help us connect with the sneaker community and keep us at the top of our game!
Benefits:
* Recognition, inclusion and belonging in a diverse environment.
* 25 holidays and flexible working (hybrid position, in office 2 days p/w)
* Employee Discount on in-store and online products
* Casual Sneaker Culture
* Learning & Health/Wellbeing programs
* Career development and growth in an ambitious international team
* Travel reimbursement
* Pension Plan
* Discounted Collective Health plans
* Activities organized by our Social Committee

title: Junior HR Admin Specialist
description:
**Job no:** 574771  

**Work type:** Full time  

**Location:** Amsterdam, The Netherlands  

**Categories:** Administration, Entity Management  

**Office Location:** Amsterdam  


**About TMF Group**  

TMF Group is a leading provider of critical administrative services, helping clients invest and operate safely around the world. We provide legal, financial and employee administration through TMF Group’s teams in 120 offices.

  


**About the role:**



The HR Admin Specialist provides a coordinated HR admin support function to our local and/or global clients that supports their overall business objectives and priorities.

  



The HR Admin Specialist is responsible for delivering tasks in the consistent and effective manner applying policies, programs, procedures, and practices aligned with the Global HR Admin service. The job holder has to provide basic HR administration operational knowledge as well as HR systems basic understanding and knowledge on HR compliance. Motivation for further technical learning, in depth understanding of delegated tasks and personal growth is prevailing factor.

  


**Key responsibilites:**


* First line of contact for Clients and colleagues on HR Admin related matters and questions – accountable for overall service delivery for Clients, identifying risks and opportunities for retention and growth.
* Day-to-day support in HR Administration such as on- and offboarding, employee data changes, absence registration, access to portals, 30%-facility applications, Work permit applications, UWV request and follow up.
* Support and drive initiatives to improve client satisfaction.
* Liaise with statutory bodies and 3rd party provides to resolve issues on Client´s behalf.
* Provide HR compliance by maintaining Statutory in country portals on client´s behalf.
* Updating HR databases (e.g. Workday, Horizon, etc.).
* Preparing and amending HR documents and templates, i.e. employment contracts, offer letters, employee life cycle documents, certificates etc.
* Keep up to date on labor policies, compliance & procedures and ensuring correct communication and implementation for clients.

  



Qualifications


* A finished MBO/HBO degree in Law and/or Economics, Human Resources, Business Administration or another related field, or willing to follow HR related education;
* Minimum 1 year of experience in an international organization as HR Coordinator, HR Administrator, HR Generalist or similar;
* Ability to engage with clients and understand their goals and needs;
* You are service oriented, responsible, pragmatic, collaborative, a problem solver and a strong communicator;
* Strong coordinating skills, being able to keep track of several different workflows in a high-paced work environment;
* Problem solving attitude.
* Contribute to team success by being team player.
* You are fluent in both English and Dutch;
* Proficient in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint;


**Advertised:** 03 Sep 2024 W. Europe Daylight Time  

**Applications close:** 31 Oct 2024 W. Europe Standard Time
company_description: We make a complex world simple!

title: Privacy Officer
description:
**Privacy Officer**  

DLL is not your average financial services company. In fact, we are above average in almost every way. With an employee engagement score of 85% (compared to the 72% industry average), it sure seems like we are doing something right.



We collaborate with manufacturers, suppliers, and businesses in more than 30 countries to enable the acquisition of equipment, technology and software that companies need to contribute meaningfully to their communities. We believe in partnering with our customers to develop innovative and sustainable financial solutions that deliver meaningful value to the world.



At DLL, we are committed to making sure that all people, regardless of their race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, age, religion, physical characteristics, or mental abilities, feel welcomed and encouraged to be their authentic selves. We strive to create an inclusive environment that is reflective of the communities in which we operate. Come see what all the excitement is about.



Hence DLL also values to protect people’s privacy, ensures their safety, dignity, and other fundamental rights and freedoms such as freedom of thought and expression. The DLL Global Privacy Office ensures that there are policies, standards, procedure, and training and awareness related to privacy principles that ensure these values within DLL. The Global Privacy Office also monitors the implementation of privacy principles to make certain these values are adequately addressed in our operational business processes and privacy risks. The Global Privacy Office provides privacy advice to pro-active and when needed on how to treat risks in alignment with the regional Privacy Coordinators.



As a Data Privacy Officer, you will be a subject matter expert and support delivery on key components of the work of the DLL Global Privacy Office.



Find out more here about how you can unleash your full potential at DLL

 **Day to day:**  

* Support to improve the maturity towards a robust Data Privacy risk management program for DLL – identifying risks, working with the business to devise mitigations and monitoring their effectiveness.
* Communicate about data privacy and promote the Global Privacy Office’s messaging, including creating educational material, raising awareness through various initiatives and providing training (and training materials) for use across the company’s product developers, IT and commercial colleagues.
* Manage Global Privacy Office tasks including operating the privacy risk assessment methodology; assign ownership of obligations; evaluating requirements and providing practical and business operation focused advisory to the business; and action plan(s) to address gaps.
* Support the implementation of the Global Privacy policies and procedures to enable the effective identification and management of privacy risks.
* Provide assistance to the Senior Data Privacy Officers in regard to any regulatory events related to Data Privacy and any responses to regulatory guidance.
* Participate in our communication and reporting to management and other key stakeholders. Support in further enhancement of the privacy management information and reporting to enable effective oversight of the privacy and data protection control framework.
* Monitor changes in laws, rules and regulations relating to Data Privacy risk management and work with legal to interpret such changes.
* Participate in relevant regulatory examinations and internal audits including addressing all findings and recommendations in a timely manner.
* Build relationships, have reasonable dialogues with stakeholders and improve the Global Privacy Office connection with the operational business. Cooperate smoothly with stakeholders including colleagues within the compliance team. Understand the DLL business and its IT landscape to be able to recognize applicable requirements in your privacy advice.
* Provide balanced privacy advice to business.
* An effective change agent bringing fresh ideas and approaches which add value to the business.
* Support to mature to improve the ways of working in our privacy management platform (OneTrust).


**All members enjoy**

* Two working days per year volunteering for a local charity.
* Health and Wellness program including healthy food, free health checks, fun health & vitality activities.
* Flexible hours with possibility to work from home
* Career development opportunities: online learning, member development programs.
* Click this link for an overview of all the benefits in your region.


“We lead the way in meeting the need for flexibility and transparency which our customers increasingly expect”

 **Essentials:**  

* A bachelor's degree
* Data Protection certification (or equivalent) or extra years of experience
* At least 5-7 years working experience
* At least 3 years in privacy and data protection
* Extensive knowledge of privacy regulations and regulatory expectations
* Project management experience in a privacy and data protection environment
* Technical/IT affinity
* Experience in multi-national company
* Passionate about privacy
* Team player


**Extras:**


* Being able to successfully make, or understand the required translation from Privacy Policy to operational business process requirements via the relevant knowledge and experience gained during your career
* IT background or Information security background
* Compliance, Audit or (Information) Risk management
* Legal background
* Data Management knowledge
* Seen privacy implementations at multiple companies
* High level knowledge of business processes (financial sector core business processes and/or supporting function business processes at any multinational)
* Experience of embedding policies, procedures and processes into a multi-national organization
* High emotional intelligence
* Likes to engage and work with people
* Ability to take responsibility and be proactive on new matters and projects
* Positive, innovative and enthusiastic

  

**Choose wellbeing**  

DLL’s wellbeing ambition is to educate, equip and empower members to build connections, manage their mental, emotional, physical and financial wellness and maintain balance between work and the other priorities that make up their lives.



Our four wellbeing categories are as follows:


* Connection – Build meaningful connections with other DLL members
* Health – Manage mental, emotional and physical health
* Finance – Provide learning opportunities to help members achieve personal financial health
* Lifestyle – Maintain balance between work and life priorities


These are the things that matter to our members and the wellbeing of our members matters to DLL

 **Settling in**  

At DLL, we are many things. We are team members, family members, community member. We are members of society, members of different cultures and nationalities. Members of change. We each have different beliefs, different passions, different viewpoints, talents and interests. We come from different backgrounds, cultures, nationalities and histories.



But for all of our differences, we share one thing in common: each of us are members of DLL.



Our company was founded in the Netherlands. But today we are truly a multinational business. Our unique culture is rooted in higher collaboration, less hierarchy and an honest directness that enable us to integrate, ideate and innovate across country lines.



Many companies say they are European, American, Asian or Australian, at DLL we are all these places and more.



We are a cross-culture collaborative – an interconnected network – that comes together every single day with one goal in mind: **Partnering for a better world.**

 **Good to know:**  

* Deadline for application: September 22nd (Due to high volume of applications this requisition may close prior to posted close date)
* The selection process may involve an assessment.
* Applications via email will not be reviewed. Please apply online via our career website.
* DLL’s referral program applies
* #LI-DENNIS
* For more information, please contact our Talent acquisition partner Dennis van Hoof via dennis.vanhoof@dllgroup.com


DLL appreciates the time you spend applying to our openings. We advise only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted. Hiring subject to successful completion of a background check.



DLL is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection processes and work environments. If contacted for an employment opportunity, please advise Human Resources if you require accommodation in accordance with our values and all applicable legislation.

title: Grant Coordinator Volta
description:
###### **Department**


Renewable Chemistries
###### **Office**


Science Park
###### **Location**


Amsterdam

  






**Grant Coordinator Volta**
===========================


**Who are we?**



Avantium is an innovation-driven pioneer in the emerging industry of renewable and sustainable chemistry. We offer unique technological solutions to reduce plastic waste, new chemical processes for the bio-based economy and R&D equipment and services to accelerate the development of new catalytic processes.



Most of the materials and chemicals used in modern daily life – such as plastics, packaging, furniture and clothing – are based on fossil resources like oil, gas and coal. Changing this paradigm is an ambitious goal but also a promise for a better future. This is why we at Avantium, work on developing practical solutions to accelerate the transition to a fossil-free world. We do this by focusing on innovative plant-based chemicals and materials as well as aiming to convert carbon dioxide (CO2) to a valuable resource for sustainable products.



Avantium’s Volta technology is a platform technology that uses electrochemistry to convert CO2 to high value products and chemical building blocks. We are looking for a new colleague to take up the role of coordinator for the European subsidy projects WaterProof and HICCUPS, as well as potential future grant projects.


**What will you do?**



The Grant Coordinator is responsible for ensuring that all involved parties achieve the goal / product / deliverable within agreed tolerances. Your main focus is to work closely together with the scientific coordinator and ensure timely completion of all grant deliverables and milestones. You will prepare, guide and proof-read internal and external documents required by the grant. The Grant Coordinator is the contact person for both academic as well as commercial partners and will monitor and guide the stream of material and information and ensure that all necessary legal documents are in place to facilitate the work that is required by the project.



Responsibilities:


* Managing (coordinating and/or executing) the projects and ensure that deliverables are met within timelines, budget, quality and scope. This work is performed together with Scientists and/or Engineers.
* Writing and preparation of non-technical deliverables.
* Reporting to EU funding body on the project progress and representing the interests of the grant project.
* Schedule and host consortium meetings twice per year per project.
* Ensure that all persons associated with the program are aware of, and comply with, grant requirements and rules – escalate with relevant persons if risk of non-compliance is observed.
* Develop, maintain and revise policies and procedures for all phases of the grant management.
* Support other grant and commercial projects on reporting and dissemination tasks where needed.
* Managing Grant and Collaboration agreements to ensuring all terms and conditions of grant contracts are met, and handling any necessary amendments or extensions.
* Acting as the primary point of contact for all grant-related inquiries and correspondence.
* Assisting with Grant Proposalsincluding identifying potential grant opportunities that align with the organization’s mission and projects, reviewing the grant proposals, developing budgets and ensuring compliance with grant requirements.


**What do you bring?**


* MSc with minimum 3 years work experience and project management experience
* At least 1 year of experience in grant research and administration
* Background in science or engineering is an advantage
* Amenable to work in a dynamic environment where priorities shift frequently
* Competences:
	+ Professional sensitivity
	+ Structured and result-oriented
	+ Inventive and flexible
	+ Excellent communication skills to effectively interact with stakeholders and prepare and review grant proposals
	+ Excellent proficiency in both written and spoken English

**What do we offer?**



At Avantium, you can make a difference, proving together that the sky is the limit. Being a small organisation, we encourage people to look beyond the obvious to reach our targets. Career opportunities come from personal drive and ambition and are rewarded through a competitive compensation package, flexibility and personal development in a multicultural company operating worldwide. We offer 25 vacation days, daily catered lunch provided in the office, pension schedule and unlimited access to our online learning platform.


**Interested?**



If this description matches your skills or interest, apply now using our online application form. You can reach our Corporate Recruiter Kylie Hoffman at kylie.hoffman@avantium.com or send a message to recruitment@avantium.com. We will be happy to show you the innovative world of Avantium.



This vacancy is based at our Science Park location.

title: Strategic Programme Readiness Coordinator
description:
About the Role
To manage the Readiness activities of projects or initiatives of low to medium complexity/risk/business significance to SWIFT in line with the company's strategy and plan, in close cooperation with all relevant groups
Strategic Programme Readiness Coordinator, Hybrid
We’re the world’s leading provider of secure financial messaging services. We are the way
the world moves value – across borders, through cities and overseas. No other organisation
can address the scale, precision, pace and trust that this demands, and we’re proud to
support the global economy.
We’re unique too. We were established to find a better way for the global financial community
to move value – a reliable, safe and secure approach that the community can trust,
completely. We’re always striving to be better and are constantly evolving in an everchanging landscape, without undermining that trust. Nearly five decades on, our vibrant
community reflects the complexity and diversity of the financial ecosystem. We innovate
diligently, test exhaustively, then implement fast. In a connected and exciting era, our
mission has never been more relevant.
Are you a good project or programme coordinator who wants to be actively engaged in, and contribute to strategic programmes? Do you have a passion for making sure a company is operationally ready for new services?
Join the Technology Platform Readiness team to help ensure SWIFT will be ready to operate and support new key initiatives and strategic programmes.
Our team is engaged in a variety of commercial, strategic and/or internal key initiatives. You will be working with other Agile teams throughout the company to coordinate transversal activities to achieve the goals set by the programme team or key stakeholders.
What to expect
In this role you will be managing Technology Platform Readiness activities of programmes, initiatives or projects of medium complexity, risk and business significance to SWIFT in line with the company's strategy and plan, in close liaison with all relevant departments or Agile teams.
As a dynamic Readiness Manager, you will be responsible for the following:* Lead the Technology Platform Readiness of major commercial, strategic and/or infrastructure programmes/initiatives/projects
* Actively engage with key stakeholders in Technology Platform, Customer Experience, Products, Innovation and other groups within SWIFT
* Represent Technology Platform operational teams in each phase of a programme/initiative/project and ensure their requirements are taken into account
* Follow-up on the development, testing and deployment of these requirements with the appropriate development teams and squads
* Identify and manage risks, escalate issues and help define solutions and follow-up actions when appropriate
* Provide clear and precise updates to Senior Management of Technology Platform and other key stakeholders
* Communicate timely and clearly to all impacted operational teams
* Engage and lead virtual teams to develop and execute the Operational Readiness plans for these groups
* Ensure Operational Readiness Tests are prepared, planned and executed timely


These assignments will help you also grow and learn about the different products and services delivered by SWIFT to its community.
What will make you successful
We are seeking professionals with:* University degree in IT/engineering/science/economics/MBA or equivalent qualification/experience
* At least 5 years in project or program management, or equivalent roles requiring strong coordination of complex activities of a large number of (remote) teams in different time zones across the organization.


Preferred qualifications:* Experience in an Operational environment is a strong plus.
* Proficient knowledge of Office, Collaboration and Reporting tools (e.g. MS Teams, Confluence, Jira, SharePoint, Office tools, ...)
* Experience in effective interaction with, and reporting to senior leadership is a plus.
* Experience with SWIFT and understanding its Products and Services is a plus.
* Experience in working with Agile teams is a plus.


What we offer* We put you in control of your career
* We give you a competitive package
* We help you perform at your best
* We help you make a difference
* We give you the freedom to be yourself


We give you the freedom to be yourself. We are creating an environment of unique individuals—like you—with different perspectives on the financial industry and the world. A diverse and inclusive environment in which everyone's voice counts and where you can reach your full potential.
If you believe you require a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, please contact us to request accommodation.
Don't meet every single requirement? At Swift, we are dedicated to building a workplace where people can bring their full selves and ideas to the team, so if you are excited about this role, we encourage you to apply even if you do not meet every single qualification.  

What we offer
We put you in control of career
We give you a competitive package
We help you perform at your best
We help you make a difference
We give you the freedom to be yourself *We give you the freedom to be yourself. We are creating an environment of unique individuals – like you – with different perspectives on the financial industry and the world. An environment in which everyone’s voice counts and where you can reach your full potential regardless of* *age, background, culture, colour, disability, gender, nationality, race, religion**, sexual orientation, or veteran/military status.*

title: Retail Sales Coordinator
description:
Passion - you have it. For people, the EV revolution, our products, and align with our sustainable mission to improve the society we live in. Your passion is energetically fueled through social exchange and by providing an exceptional buying experience. Sounds like you?

**The opportunity**


As Retail Sales Coordinator, you will coordinate all operational & tactical activities within in the Retail Sales channel, consisting of new car sales and used car sales. Our Direct Sales business model enables us having a comprehensive lead management process, knowing our customer from first meeting up to purchase and retaining. You will contribute to further developing this process and to create the best possible buying experience for our customers while maximizing our Retail sales results. Moreover, you will participate in developing our Pre-owned Polestar program and will be working with Polestar partners to optimize Pre-owned sales, while monitoring and influencing our Residual Values (RV).

  



**The responsibilities**


Retail Sales (new car sales)  

* Responsibility for achieving the set Retail Order target, monitor performance and report to the Manager Retail Sales on results and needed actions to improve Retail Sales performance. In example preparing a new tactical campaign or proposition
* Ensure retention by developing offers to connect used car sales to new car sales
* Assist the Manager Retail Sales by preparing the Retail Sales budget
* Collect input, identify gaps and report improvements to the Manager Retail Sales and work together with internal stake holders for the continuous development of our online sales channel, including the back-end systems & processes
* Ensure operational performance for the white label products Polestar leasing & Polestar finance by working together with our partners
* Monitor, report and improve the competitiveness of the white label products Polestar Leasing & Polestar Finance
* First point of contact for customer facing staff (CE Team, Spaces & Handover Center) to support them in selling cars & delivering a seamless customer experience Lead Management (new & used car sales)
* Oversee all lead follow up activities; provide customer facing staff with the relevant tools to convert a lead into a sale Polestar Automotive Netherlands
  

Remarketing (used car sales)  

* First point of contact for customer facing staff (CE Team, Spaces & Handover Center) for all Remarketing related activities
* Support new car Retail Sales by leveraging our trade-in program
* Support Polestar Remarketing Partners
* Monitor and report on pricing for Pre-owned Polestars and their Residual Value level
* Ensure fulfilment of Polestar Pre-owned standards across operations through regular audits and provided training

  

General  

* Report on the KPI’s on retail sales performance, lead management and remarketing
  


**The ideal candidate**

In order to succeed in this role, and at Polestar in general, there are a few characteristics you'll need to have. Tenacity. Flexibility. Curiosity. The ability to take the initiative, to meet deadlines and requirements, and to abandon ideas when they're not feasible. You are a team player

  

In addition, you'll need the following qualifications:

* Experience with data analysis, market sales analysis and lead management
* Experience with vehicle remarketing is an advantage
* (Automotive and / or Luxury goods) Retail experience is a strong advantage
* Knowledge from and general interest in e-commerce (it helps if you know what CRO, UX & UI means)
* Digital native: excellent knowledge of MS Office and Salesforce or the eagerness to quickly learn is a strong advantage
* Stakeholder management
* Excellent communication skills
* Fluent in Dutch and English, both written and spoken

Polestar is an international company, with various nationalities represented. Therefore both Dutch and English are used in written and spoken communication. And though we have a global presence, we maintain a part of the start-up mentality that saw us grow so rapidly. Expect a fast-paced, exciting environment. Change happens often at Polestar. But so does progress.

 **The process**


If the above matches your ambitions, be sure to apply. Our selection process commences in the second half of September and is ongoing, and the position will remain open until it’s filled.


The Polestar journey is an electric one.

title: Senior Design Architect (12+ years of experience)
description:
Senior Design Architects (12+ years of experience)



PLEASE NOTE: Applying to this posting means your application will be added to our candidate pool. We will contact you only when suitable opportunities arise. Your application will be handled in accordance with GDPR.

  


Full-time · Amsterdam



As a Senior Architect with strategic oversight, you are at the forefront of ensuring the seamless execution of projects, guiding the design and effective team coordination. Your primary orientation is creative direction behind the architectural piece. Ideally, you have large-scale project experience and great sense for aesthetics.



The role extends to active involvement in acquisition processes, adept contract handling, and the formulation of comprehensive fee proposals. In formal meetings, you serve as the representative of the office, making decisions of a complex and sensitive nature.



UNStudio is committed to taking a human – and planet – centric approach to all our work. Our commitment to creating a more impactful built environment drives us to think unconventionally. From cities to airports, from buildings to bridges, from experiences to brands and products, our teams generate fresh ideas and innovation solutions to some of the most pressing societal issues.



We want to challenge the status quo and collaborate with our clients, partners, industry experts to contribute to a greener, healthier and smarter built environment so that users are enabled to foster stronger future communities.


**The Position:**



As a Senior Architect at UNStudio, you are the maestro orchestrating projects to success — your expertise covers design, technical intricacies, and team coordination. You don't *only* design, there's more to it.



You're not ''just'' in meetings; you are actively shaping decisions in the spotlight, applying your strategic finesse. Your deep understanding of organizational dynamics, politics, tactics, and finance is your strategic advantage in navigating project complexities.



In risk management, you're the guardian, identifying threats and collaborating with Associate Directors to create innovative and strategic solutions. Your role is an exciting journey where your expertise drives UNStudio's success, ideal for experienced professionals seeking a dynamic challenge.

**The Requirements:**


* Master’s degree or equivalent in Architecture / combined with a Bachelor Engineering BBE is a plus
* At least 11+ years of experience as an Architect and/or Project Coordinator within a dynamic, international environment
* Familiar with all phases of design with a focus on design development, construction documentation and construction
* Knowledge of large scale complex (mixed use) consultant coordination
* Fluent in English (presenting, speaking, reading, writing)
* Experience with Rhino BIM workflow is a very big plus


We look forward to receive your CV/resume + portfolio + short motivation letter.
When you work at UNStudio


* You have the opportunity to work on high profile, challenging global projects
* You are part of a creative, fresh, professional and academic working environment
* The city centre of Amsterdam is on your doorstep: one of the world's most beautiful cities
* Research is an integrated and valued part of your daily work
* You have the opportunity to initiate and develop research projects with external companies and institutions
* Your experience is highly valued, but your innovative and entrepreneurial attitude is ranked highest
* You work in a young international team that is highly ambitious, collegial and social, made up of recently graduated architects, experienced senior architects and everything in-between
* You design through discovery, and learn on the job
* You get as much creative freedom as you are willing to take
* You find yourself in a responsible position as soon as you are ready
* Friday Afternoon Drinks are always waiting for you
* Our annual Summer and Winter Events have become legendary
* You have 30 annual holidays, with a holiday allowance in addition to your annual salary

title: Junior Wholesale Coordinator
description:
-This position will be located in our new HQ NL in Almere- We’re looking for a Junior Wholesale Coordinator for our E-Commerce department, focused on Wholesale. Hunkemöller collaborates with various wholesale partners such as Zalando, About You, Asos and Nordstrom, just to name a few. The core task is to support the team across the entire fashion season: from the start when we present the new collection and collect the orders to the delivery of the orders and the in-season management of stock. You do this by combining solid account management and with high operational excellence.  

You’ll support the team with these daily and seasonal tasks:

* Responsible for all the back-office sales support of the assigned to the silver/bronze wholesale accounts.
* Develop an effective relationship with partners as well as internally with various stakeholders such as marketing, buying and logistics and finance
* Implement, monitor and report on sales, marketing and promotions performance incl. exclusive collaborations
* Product allocation in SAP, process preorder and reorders in SAP, stock/orders management, master data enrichment, pricing and sales administration
* Working closely with logistics to arrange shipments of ordered goods and purchase order details needed
* Ensure quarterly orderbook is complete and processed in the ERP system, confirmed to the wholesale partners and purchase orders are processed internally
* Manage in-season sell-through strategy as well as identifying sales opportunities
* Prepare per quarter the Buying season, including preparation of the showroom and assortment overviews


Our perfect candidate has the following:

* You’re passionate about E-Commerce &/or wholesale and gained in a sales support (B2B) function
* Enthusiastic and looking for a challenge
* You have a Bachelors’ degree (minimum requirement)
* Your results-driven and will need English language skills (written and verbal); as well as the ability to build relationships and to optimise your commercial insights and critical
* You’re an analytical thinker and highly numerate. You’re also able to work flexibly & independently within deadlines
* Microsoft Office Skills: maintain and improve spreadsheets, data validation and analysis, proficient use of vlookups and index match as well as pivot tables


Hunkemöller strives to be a much loved, social & inclusive brand. A place where people love to work, are proud of the brand, and where we create true brand ambassadors. Working in a passionate, energetic, design-led and performance-driven environment where our key customer persona 'Shero' sits at the heart of everything we do. Hunkemöller is certified TOP EMPLOYER of the Netherlands 2024, which underlines our people initiatives and achievements.


Together Tomorrow – Join a Retailer that's on the move to be better for our planet, better for people, better together! From diversity & inclusion, reducing waste, to product care and how we work with our suppliers, our Together Tomorrow initiative reflects what we do and helps drive change across our business. Ready to help us achieving our ambitious goals? Where ever you'll start working with us, if in Stores or our HQs, you can contribute!


Apply now with your CV (in English) or LinkedIn profile only.


For this role, we're not looking to work with external agencies.

**Gijs van Engelen**  

**Chief Digital Officer**  


"We are digitally driven and powered by data; a simple statement yet fundamental to the success of any retail organization. Digital leadership will be about being visionary and leading a market where most sales and profit are from digital channels and, of course, creating a World-Class shopping experience whatever the channel or journey." **Get familiar with our application process:**  

  

* **10 seconds Application**
Send your application! Our tip: no motivation letter required; we have something much better - see step 2!
* **Video Interview on-demand**
We hire for attitude, hence why we're looking forward getting to know you even better!
* **Live interview(s)**
Get invited to chat with us...
* **Offer**
Land your dream job with us!
* **Hired**
Welcome to Hunkemöller - You'll sign your digital contract and are ready to start.
* **Onboarding & Development Journey**
Start your career - kick off with our Onboarding & grow your talents.
**Your benefits if you join a TOP EMPLOYER:**  

  

* **Internal Learning Platform**
* **Flexible Working Hours**
* **Dynamic and Fast-Paced Environment**
* **Restaurant on site with freshly-made food**
* **Lifestyle Workshops**
* **Collective Company Insurance Discount**
* **Support in Travel Expenses**
* **Community Events**
* **Pension Support**
* **Staff Discount**
* **Performance Reviews**
* **Hybrid Working Module & Home Office Allowance**

title: Coordinator Composition Department
Capacity Controller
Customer Service Coordinator
company: De Haan en Partners Verhuizingen BV
description:
We're looking to expand our team with an enthusiastic:

**Customer Service Representative – Moving Industry** 

Are you someone who loves organizing and coordinating, and do you get excited about working in a dynamic environment? Then this is the job for you!

**Who are we?**

Our family business has been around since 1777, helping a wide variety of clients all over the world. We are proud of our group of dedicated employees who meticulously handle moves for (international) companies, expats, and private clients.

**What will you do?**

As a Move Coordinator at De Haan & Partners Verhuizingen, you are the driving force in the moving process. Once the client agrees to the quote, you will take over and ensure the move goes smoothly from start to finish. You are the link between the client, our internal departments, foreign partners, and customs, making sure everything runs like clockwork. No two days are the same; from coordinating national and international moves to managing costs and maintaining customer contacts, you thrive on variety and challenge!

**Who are we looking for?**

You are an energetic go-getter who:

· Has a bachelor's level of thinking and working. Experience is not a must, but a proactive attitude is. We especially encourage people from the hospitality, retail, transport and logistics, event sector, and other dynamic environments to apply; however, everyone with a proactive attitude is welcome!

· Possesses strong social and communication skills in both Dutch and English. Additional language skills are a plus!

· Is assertive, customer-focused, and solution-oriented. You enjoy building relationships and convincing clients.

· Excels in planning and organizing, with attention to detail and a structured way of working.

· Enjoys working both independently and as part of a team, and is not easily stressed.

Are there things you're not yet skilled at? No problem! No one is born with experience. If you are open to learning new things, we are happy to help you develop.

**What do we offer?**

At De Haan, you will have a challenging role within the international moving industry, with plenty of opportunities for personal development. You will work with an enthusiastic and motivated team committed to quality. After the first period in which you learn the tricks of the trade, it will be possible to work one or two days a week from home. We offer a competitive salary, depending on your experience and skills and several secondary benefits, in example (fiscal) corporate fitness.

Job Types: Full-time, Temporary  
Contract length: 12 months

Work Location: In person

title: IT Support
Group Sales Coordinator
description:
**Are you a highly** **organised** **and detail-oriented administrative professional with a passion for the hospitality industry?**


Hotel Co 51 is seeking a dedicated **Group Sales Coordinator** to join our team in Amsterdam. As a key member of our Group Sales department, you will provide essential administrative support to our sales team, ensuring the smooth operation of our group booking processes.

**Your Role:**

* **Administrative Support:** Provide comprehensive administrative support to the Group Sales team, including contract preparation, data entry, and report generation.
* **Contract Management:** Accurately and efficiently create and manage group contracts, ensuring compliance with company standards.
* **Data Management:** Maintain accurate records of group inquiries, bookings, and correspondence.
* **Communication:** Effectively communicate with internal and external stakeholders to ensure seamless operations.
**Key Responsibilities:**

* Prepare and process group contracts, ensuring accuracy and adherence to legal requirements.
* Enter and maintain group booking data in the property management system (Opera).
* Generate reports on group sales performance and activity.
* Manage the group email inbox, responding to inquiries and distributing leads as required.
* Provide administrative support for sales team meetings and events.
* Collaborate with hotel operations to ensure smooth group arrivals and departures.
**Skills and Experience:**

* Strong organisational and time management skills.
* Excellent attention to detail and accuracy.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and property management systems (Opera preferred).
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Previous experience in an administrative role within the hospitality industry is preferred.

If you are a highly organised and motivated individual with a strong attention to detail, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.


INDFOH

title: Front Office Supervisor | Fulltime | NH Utrecht
description:
Our hotel is perfectly located; next to the Central Station, Beatrix theater and the Jaarbeurs. Our guests can walk straight through the shopping center Hoog Catharijne into the city center. Our hotel is the largest hotel in Utrecht and we have a nice mix of business and leisure guests. During the week we welcome many conference-, meeting- and trade fair guests. In the weekend we mainly welcome guests who enjoy leisure activities. In short, every day is full of surprises. New colleagues are instantly welcomed into our team, and we have welcomed many colleagues from other NH hotels for the next step in their career. We often work together with our cluster hotel NH Centre Utrecht (Janskerkhof) and it could happen that you are also scheduled to work there occasionally. Another opportunity to broaden your horizon, isn’t that great?


"Every employee is equally important." – Chastity, Front Office Supervisor

**What will we offer you?**

* Free online & offline training organized by our own University.
* End of year bonus (up to 100% of monthly gross salary) & refer-a-friend bonus (500 EUR).
* Employee rates differing from 36 euros in all our hotels worldwide, 30% discount in the F&B outlets, and Friends & Family discount up to 25%. Various discounts in (web)shops.
* Team building events, trips and holiday parties.
* The opportunity to grow within our company worldwide.
* Salary based on your experiences starting from Horeca CLA scale 6.
  


**What’s in it for us?**

  

* Helping guests puts a big smile on your face. The 'always a pleasure' mentality is second nature for you, and you are happy go the extra mile for our guests;
* You are a 'Natural Host' and have some years' experience as a receptionist. Experience as Desk Manager/Shift Leader/Supervisor is an advantage;
* You are good at setting priorities, you have a good command of the Dutch and English language, you are accurate, and knowledge of computer systems is a plus;
* You enjoy variety in your work and working hours and working in a team gives you energy.


**A day in the life of a Front Office Supervisor**  

06:45 You arrive, in uniform, with a cup of coffee or tea in the back office. Your colleague from the night shift takes care of the handover.  

07:00 You start your checklist, and, in the meantime, you keep an eye on your colleagues at the desk and support where necessary.  

08:00 You have checked today's arrivals and communicated the details to the other departments.  

10:00 In the absence of your manager, you attend the morning meeting. After the meeting you go back to the front office and in between the phone calls, you also process the incoming emails and work your way through the 'morning rush'.  

12:00 Enjoy your lunch with colleagues from other departments.  

13:00 You check whether there are still guests pending to check out and continue with your checklist until all is done.  

14:00 You make sure the handover is updated for the evening shift.  

14:45 The evening shift has arrived, and you make sure they know everything they need to know to begin their shift.  

15:00 Time to go home!
Are you the one we are looking for? Apply now!


Minor Hotels Europe & Americas is committed to an inclusive working environment in which everyone is valued and encouraged equally, therefor we warmly welcome people from all horizons & personal abilities
company_description: NH Hotel Group is an international hotel chain with nearly 400 hotels in 30 different markets, including top destinations in cities such as Amsterdam, Frankfurt, Barcelona, London, New York and Rome.

title: Groups & Events Executive
description:
Is organizing really your thing? We are looking for a Groups & Events Executive to join our team in Leonardo Royal Hotel Amsterdam.

As a Groups & Events Executive you work together with the team on the organization and planning of groups and events. This includes meetings, conferences, dinners, but also other events such as drinks, (theme) parties and chamber groups.

**SOME RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Maximizing turnover and guest satisfaction through a quick and adequate response to requests, converting requests and organizing a successful event.
* Commercial insight and strategic implementation of group and event pricing and planning.
* Clear communication, verbal and written, with customers and internal departments regarding agreements and execution of the events.
* Managing meetings and events from A to Z
* Proper contractual handling, guaranteeing deposits and co-responsible for correct invoicing
* Coordinating menu arrangements for clients that maximize revenue potential for the hotel while serving client needs.

**WHAT MAKES YOU THE PERFECT ADDITION TO OUR TEAM?**

* You have at least 1 year of experience in Event Management.
* You have an HBO working and thinking level and preferably have completed a Hospitality-related course (Higher Hotel School, Facility Management, NHTV).
* You have experience with both social and business events. Do you also have experience with hybrid events? That's a great advantage!
* You have experience with Opera Sales & Catering.
* You have good knowledge of the Dutch and English language, spoken and written.
* You have a creative and positive mindset and 'you do not take “no” for an answer'.
* You are professional, service-oriented and a real team player!
* You have good communication skills and make new contacts easily and quickly.
* You can think strategically, have numerical insight and are able to lead.
* You have your own transport.

**LEONARDO ROYAL HOTEL AMSTERDAM**

The newest hotel of our company is located directly at the Overamstel metro station. The location of this 4-star superior hotel is ideal: 5 minutes from the Zuidas and the RAI, 10 minutes from the city center and 20 minutes from Schiphol Airport. The hotel has 18 floors and 490 rooms with a fresh, innovative design and high quality modern equipment. The 1,200 square meters of conference space is spread over 11 meeting rooms and a gigantic ballroom; the perfect location for large events and conferences! Leonardo Royal Hotel Amsterdam is the largest hotel of the entire Leonardo company in Europe. Beautiful views over the city and the most refined dishes in LEO'S International Flavors restaurant make guests say 'Now we're talking'!

**WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU (ADDITIONAL TO A GREAT TEAM)?**

* We offer you a supplement of 15% in the weekends and 70% travel allowance if you live further than 10 kilometers from your work, with a maximum of € 10.71 per day.
* Working overtime? This can be paid out, but you can also choose to save it for some extra time off.
* Eager to learn? We offer training courses from the Leonardo Development Lab!
* Ambitious? You can work on your personal development and grow with us!
* We think your health is important! That is why you can visit Open Up 24/7, the online platform for mental health.
* Do you want to buy products such as an (electric) bicycle or telephone with a reduced price? This is possible with an average of 40% tax reduction via FiscFree!
* Night away? As an employee, you can exclusively use our global discount program!
* And enjoy an overnight stay including dinner and breakfast at the hotel where you are working during your 'Know Where You Work' experience.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Work authorization:

* Netherlands (Required)

Work Location: In person
