title: Meeting & Event Specialist | Fulltime | NH Conference Centre Koningshof
description:
**Speaking and writing Dutch on a professional level is a requirement for this position**

 **NH Conference Centre Koningshof has it all. In the surroundings of the hotel, our guests can walk and cycle in the beautiful countryside. For our business guests we offer everything you can think of for a successful meeting or large event. This diversity of events makes every day an adventure. We appreciate every talent, and we motivate and encourage all colleagues to go the extra mile for our guests. It is for a good reason that some colleagues have been working with us for many years and see the team as one family.**

**Our hotel is situated in the green heart of Brabant, just a few minutes away from Veldhoven and close to the city of lights Eindhoven. The hotel was originally a monastery used for teaching. Nowadays, this location is still used to train and share knowledge, not only with our guests, but also with our employees.**

**"The sky is the limit at NH Conference Koningshof." – Karim, Banqueting Employee**

**What’s in it for you?**

* **Free online & offline training organized by our own University.**
* **End of year bonus (up to 100% of monthly gross salary) & refer-a-friend bonus (500 EUR).**
* **Employee rates differing from 36 euros in all our hotels worldwide, 30% discount in the F&B outlets, and Friends & Family discount up to 25%. Various discounts in (web)shops.**
* **Team building events, trips and holiday parties.**
* **The opportunity to grow within our company worldwide.**
* **Salary based on your experiences starting from Horeca CLA scale 6.**

**What’s in it for us?**

* **Helping guests puts a big smile on your face. The ‘always a pleasure’ mentality is second nature for you, and you are happy go the extra mile for our guests;**
* **You have strong communication skill and you are someone who knows how to convince guests to book with us and upselling is your forte;**
* **You are flexible, accurate, and you are a real team player;**
* **In this position you always have a clear overview, you have a commercial attitude, and you always think one step ahead;**
* **In addition, you have excellent communication skills, both with guests and with other contacts, operational departments, and the GEM Office, you have a perfect command of the Dutch and English language.**

**What are you going to do?**  

**As Meeting & Events Specialist you are responsible for sales and organizing events in NH conference Centre Koningshof. At Meeting & Events you can think of meetings, conferences, weddings, gala dinners and much more. You are responsible for sales and all the associated negotiations, as well as the further preparations to make sure every events is a success. You are the point of contact for the contact person of the event and you ensure that everything is tightly organized to guarantee guests a unique experience in your hotel. In addition, you ensure clear communication with colleagues from the operational departments and you contribute to the service level in the hotel.**

**Finally, you are also the event manager during major events, during these events you will make sure the entire evens runs smoothly and you act as the connector between the operational departments and the contact person.**

**Are you looking for a new challenge? Apply now!**

**Minor Hotels Europe & Americas is committed to an inclusive working environment in which everyone is valued and encouraged equally, therefor we warmly welcome people from all horizons & personal abilities.**

title: Event Host/Hostess (M/F) - Amsterdam, Netherlands
description:
**Job Summary**

An Events Host/Hostess is responsible for ensuring that all events clients are extremely satisfied throughout their event, constantly exceeding guest expectations by proactively anticipating their needs, beginning with the set up process prior to the event, all the way through the conclusion and take-down process of the event.

**Duties and Responsibilities**

**General**

* Gathering all essential event and staffing information prior to event start.
* Communicating with event manager about event timing and client´s special requests.
* Oversee the set up of all stations and work areas per client specification.
* Be able to understand all client specific responsibilites and duties.
* Be able to understand and client instructions, manuals and information needed in for any particular products or services offered by the client.
* Create a professional connection with the event guests and VIPs in all event assignments.
* Make sure the ending of the event is a pleasant experience
* Maintain a clean and organized work area including event spaces, and the care of event storage items
* Ensure guests leave eager to return always extending a friendly farewell

**Responsible For:**

* Providing product / service information to guests visiting booths.
* Representing our clients and taking care of their guests.

**Requirements:**

* Positive attidude.
* Elegant looking, fashionable and stylish.
* At least 172 cm / 5´8 in height and above for Hosts and 170 cm / 5,7 in height and above for Hostesses.
* Must be willing to work a variety of day, night, and weekend shift.
* Must demonstrate the ability to work under pressure while multitasking
* Extremely friendly
* Must be able to read, write, and have strong communication skills in the English. Knowledge of a second or third languare a plus!
* Must possess a positive service orientated attitude towards all guests and employees
* Must be able to move around the venue quickly and easily
* Must be able to speak clearly and listen attentively to teammates and guests, occasionally in a loud environment

**To apply:**

Please provide the following together with your application: **(ONLY APPLICANTS WITH BELOW REQUIREMENTS WILL BE ENTERTAINED)**.

* One current head and bodyshot (selfies will do)
* Height
* Age
* Eye Color
* Hair Color
* Instagram account

Soort dienstverband: Parttime, Freelance / zzp, Projectbasis

Salaris: €13,00 - €16,00 per uur

Werkschema:

* Dagdienst
* Flexibele werkuren
* Ploegendienst
* Weekendbeschikbaarheid

Ervaring:

* Microsoft Office: 1 jaar (Gewenst)
* Ervaring als gastvrouw/gastheer: 1 jaar (Gewenst)

Taal:

* Englisch (Gewenst)
* Nederlands (Gewenst)
* Engels (Gewenst)

title: Dutch Freelance Proofreader
description:
We are Spotzer Digital, an international marketing and technology agency based in Amsterdam, the Netherlands. We create websites, blogs, and other SEO content for small to medium businesses across the globe. We are looking for multiple Dutch proofreaders (freelance) who can start immediately, work remotely, and help us deliver insightful, creative copy to our business clients.

 **What you will be doing**:



Proofreading website copy for small business websites across a variety of industries. One order could be for a landscaper, then for a mechanic, then for a florist. You will mostly be writing directly onto the CMS, therefore some technical knowledge may be required. Basic training will be provided in the form of instructional documents and email support, where needed.



There will be no design required – you just write and edit the text in the web template.

 **Task Overview**:



We are seeking a freelance Dutch proofreader to collaborate with an AI tool to refine and polish Dutch text for web pages and blog posts. Your primary responsibilities will include correcting grammar, typos, spelling, and punctuation errors in Dutch content. You may also need to write 1-2 lines in Dutch to meet the required word count for each page. Additionally, you will replace repetitive text with original content, write alt text for images, and ensure that metadata aligns with SEO and product specifications.

* Native-level proficiency in Dutch, with a strong command of grammar, spelling, and punctuation.
* Experience proofreading and editing web pages and blog posts.
* Ability to write concise, original content in Dutch when needed.
* Familiarity with SEO practices, including writing alt text for images and optimizing metadata.
* Proficiency with proofreading and editing tools.
* Attention to detail and ability to ensure content meets brand and product specifications.
* Ability to work independently and meet deadlines.

  

Payment ranges from €5 - €8 for one page of 250 words depending on the work. If your work stands out and makes a good impression, you may be eligible for higher rates and more varied work.

 **How to apply**: If you're interested, simply submit your CV and cover letter.



We look forward to your application!

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
#### **DevOps Engineer**



You are a DevOps engineer specialist, fascinated by tech stacks and working with newest technologies. With this attitude, you are an ideal fit for us!

 **What's your move**

  




You will work in an international and geographically distributed team with cultural diversity and interact with other DevOps engineers, product owners and product managers. You play a vital role in our agile team. With your passion, you take Swisscom to the next level. Thanks to your experience, you are establishing and enforcing state of the art DevOps practices for us.

 **Why you succeed**

  

**Technical Skills**


* Java 8 or higher related technologies
* REST APIs, Spring, Spring Boot, Microservices
* Experience with Angular (preferred) or other Javascript frameworks
* Experience with NgRx state management a plus
* CI/CD (Pipeline know-how)
* Experience with AWS or other cloud environments is a plus
* Knowledge of Kotlin is a plus
* Experience with MongoDB/MariaDB or similar types of DB is a plus


**Soft Skills**


* Communicative, active contributor who enjoys teamwork as much as sharing ideas and expertise
* Professionally proficient in English
* Open to change and demonstrate a blameless feedback culture
* Enthusiasm for and experience working in an Agile environment is a plus
* Open-minded behaviour, thinking out of the box
* Motivated and curious to learn
* Willing to take responsibility end-to-end, beyond implementation - You build it, you run it


**Want to know more about us?**



We are serving the Swiss market as Switzerland’s leading IT & Telecom company. Thus, we are actively driving digitalization and networking, and tapping new paths for our customers and our employees. We do not know what the future is going to look like, but we definitely have the opportunity to shape it. To do so we are and act trustworthy, committed and curious.

  

Since 2019, we have been building up the coolest DevOps Center with a wonderful office at the World Trade Center in the heart of Rotterdam. We are currently recruiting IT passionate professionals who are keen on developing high-quality software, have an agile mindset and appreciate the collaboration with motivated colleagues from all over the world.

 **What's in it for you?**


*Work environment*


* Agile way of working, multi-cultural work environment promoting work-life balance
* Autonomy, flexibility, opportunity and growth
* Cool office space in the World Trade Center Rotterdam!
* Office and team events to build a stronger Swisscom community


*Allowances*


* Full relocation support (Housing, settling in, etc.) for you and your family
* Telephone/internet allowance and contribution to health insurance
* Paid training days and access to Swisscom learning platforms
* Commuting and home office allowance
* Gym subscription, Tax advice, and language course


*Leaves policy*


* Work from abroad possibility for a fixed term
* Care, bereavement, maternity and paternity leaves
* 25 days paid vacation days plus Dutch national holidays
company_description: Swisscom ist das führende Telekommunikations- und eines der führenden IT-Unternehmen der Schweiz mit Sitz in Ittigen nahe der Hauptstadt Bern.

title: Technical Consultant
description:
Our growing Professional Services team is looking for Technical consultants who are equally at home when it comes to customer communication as to working with technologies.

 **Products you’ll be working on**



You will be dealing with products aimed at helping our diverse recruitment and HR industry customers. These products range from search and match needs (semantics) to automated chatbots, pushing the boundaries of how we connect employers to candidates.

  

**Responsibilities**



As a Technical Consultant you’ll help our customers integrate our solutions into a diverse range of applications. You will lead onboarding meetings, create technical designs and see through implementation. Talking to customers and coordinating a successful delivery is key in your role. You’ll also have to deal with technical troubleshooting, ranging from configuration errors to product defects.  



  

**What can you expect?**


* Helping out customers with the optimal configuration of our chatbot platform. Including managing conversation flows, conditional routing and actions to external API’s with a low code platform.
* Serve as a second-line technical support specialist, addressing and resolving escalated issues.
* Design, develop, and maintain chatbot solutions with our home grown chatbot management system.
* Work collaboratively with big corporate sized clients to customize chatbot flows and logic according to specific business needs.
* Collaborate with internal teams to integrate new features and improvements based on client feedback and technical requirements.
* Implement custom scripts (Python)

  

**Who you are:**


* A true problem solver with the ability to prioritize and think in processes.
* You value good communication and you possess a high sense of ownership.
* You have a background in IT and experience with technical consulting or support (having this experience in a SaaS environment is a plus).
* You worked in a similar role in a business to business context.
* You are familiar with: SOAP APIs, REST APIs, HTML, XML, JSON, Python, Linux and command line tools.
* You have an understanding of integrations with external systems.
* You have experience with troubleshooting and debugging software.
* You are fluent in English. Fluency in Dutch, German or French is a plus.
* Basic knowledge of Salesforce (objects, field mappings, APEX jobs) is a plus.

 **What you'd like to see in your new job:**


* A fair salary
* A yearly bonus based on your and the company's performance.
* Joining a fast growing, motivated and international team that consists of 40 different nationalities.
* 28 days of holiday leave.
* Holiday allowance and participation in a solid pension plan.
* Hybrid working.
* Travel allowance and compensation for your internet costs at home.
* A home office allowance to create a suitable workplace at home.
* A place at our comfortable and brand new office in Amsterdam Noord, with free quality lunches, snacks and drinks: whatever you fancy, our kitchen has it all!
* Participating in our yearly week-long company wide hackathon (Innovation Week) but also joining meet-ups, training courses, scientific conferences and team/company trips.
* This position is based in Amsterdam - we do not offer relocation for this role.

 **About us:**



Textkernel is widely regarded as the international leader in providing Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning and Semantic Technology that empowers organizations to optimally understand, connect and analyze all their data around people and jobs. We enable thousands of recruitment & staffing agencies, employers, job boards, HR software vendors and outplacement & redeployment agencies worldwide to work smarter and more effectively by creating efficiencies in the HR and recruitment process.



Textkernel is headquartered in Amsterdam, with offices in Frankfurt, Paris, Enschede, Eindhoven and teams in the US and the UK. As a group we are currently around 250 strong. We are small enough to make you matter but big enough to have a very recognizable impact on the market, supported by solid infrastructure. Ready to embark on this thrilling journey with us? Please apply and let's shape the future of labor market analytics together!

 **Recruitment process**



It all starts with an intake call with our Talent Partner. Afterwards we will share a technical assignment and a short personality assessment with you. Next you will discuss your assignment with the hiring team during an interview. In general our recruitment process takes about 2 weeks.

 *Applications from freelancers, employment agencies, and recruitment agencies are not wanted at this time.*

title: Breakfast Cook
description:
***What is in it for me?***

  

* A fulltime starting salary between €2.300 - €2.600,- per month.
* A stylish, dynamic, international working environment;
* A unique opportunity to be part of a fun, friendly and enthusiastic team;
* Special discounted (staff) rates for 9000+ Marriott hotels worldwide for you, your family and friends!
* Personal coaching & training to support you in your day-to-day job
* Career opportunities within the Corendon group;
* Space for own initiative;
* A you know where you work day, so you will receive 1 overnight stay for 2 people and can enjoy a delicious dinner;
* We organize many social activities, such as our Associate Appreciation Week, an annual Staff Party, Friday afternoon drinks and Team outings,
* Free use of our own gym.
* **AMAZING** discounts with Corendon tour operator, from all-inclusive holidays up to 2 FREE flight tickets per year
* Special discount. Not only for you, but for your friends and family too!
* Want to try out one of our Mondi restaurants? We will give you 25% discount on your total bill.
* Need some time to recharge? We have our own spa and wellness which you can enjoy with a huge discount. Also, you will get 2 massages for FREE per year.

***Join the Corendon family as our brand new Breakfast Cook!***



We are searching for you as our brand new breakfast cook for one of our 3 hotels in the Amsterdam area. Corendon has 3 hotels in the Netherlands:


* Corendon Village Hotel (Badhoevedorp)
* Corendon City Hotel (Amsterdam Nieuw West)
* The College Hotel, Autograph Collection by Marriott (Amsterdam Oud Zuid)



Please mention in your application when you have a preference for a specific hotel. We look forward to meet you but first we will tell you a bit more about the job.

 **What does your job include?**

  


As a Breakfast Chef, you will be responsible for contributing to the preparation and presentation of breakfast dishes while maintaining a high level of service in an open kitchen environment.

  

* Building strong relationships with colleagues and adhering to the company's values of Openness, Honesty, and Respect (OER principle) are essential.
* Additionally, you will be expected to follow the company's sustainability policies and assist with other tasks as assigned by the Sous Chef and Executive Chef to maximize business opportunities.
* You are Flexible, also in the weekend!
* You are an earlybird and can start working from 05:00am
* You have a passion for cooking, you have all-round knowledge of various dishes and you can't wait to show your talents in the kitchen;
* You are service-oriented, hospitable and social;
* You work independently and in a team;
* You know how to identify problems, recognize important information and make connections. You identify possible causes and come up with concrete solutions

title: Technical Specialist I - Technical Retail Support Parts - German
description:
Recruiter

**Joep Smeets**  

joep.smeets@mercedes-benz.com
Company Information


The Mercedes-Benz Customer Assistance Center is an international multicultural organization and an integrated part of Mercedes-Benz Cars Marketing & Sales. In our offices in Maastricht we think and act globally and assume a leading role for the Mercedes-Benz Customer Assistance Centers all over the world. 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, 365 days a year, we ensure our customers’ mobility with our roadside assistance. Additionally, we take care of all kinds of enquiries about passenger cars and vans during our opening hours. For our customers we are maybe the most important connection to the Mercedes-Benz brand. That’s why we live the brand’s most important promise: “The best or nothing”.
Function Description


Within the Retail Services department, we are responsible for technical enquiries about parts for Mercedes-Benz passenger cars and vans. The supported entities are the Retailers. Furthermore, the specialist role is to liaise with internal and external partners for resolving complex issues. The Technical Retail Support Parts 1st level is the first point of contact for delivering support in regards to technical parts enquiries based on the Xentry Portal Parts job. The supported entities consist of the Mercedes-Benz retail organization in several European countries.  

  

Tasks and Responsibilities:* Handles delegated technical parts topics from Mercedes-Benz Workshops
* Handles escalated topics from markets / leadership team
* Supports sub-level operational departments and sub-teams with advanced troubleshooting knowledge and techniques, demonstrating operational best practice to all contact partners within MBCAC and the Mercedes-Benz Group
* Appropriate usage of available resources and documentation of business related activities in relevant system (e.g. ticketing system)
* Proactively and continuously monitor workload to ensure timely investigation and response to support requests
* Is able to provide feedback to business partner influencing product specification and policy
* Is able to signal process change requirements to business partners
* Uses out-of-the box thinking to develop alternative solutions when established processes are not sufficient
* Ensures quality improvements within supported services
* Proactively steers analytical reasoning and problem solution amongst colleagues

Job Requirements

* Excellent knowledge of German, both spoken and written
* Excellent knowledge (spoken and written) of English
* Excellent communication skills (B2B)
* Expert skills in technical support and problem solving
* Minimum 2 years of experience within similar area of business is a must
* An engineering or mechanic background is required
* Ability to work with technical drawings in 2D and 3D applications is a requirement
* Ability to work according given processes
* Experienced to work with (technical) automotive catalogs and databases
* Checks and corrects erroneous data content in systems where encountered or prompts responsible party to amend
* Knowledge in applications of the Xentry portal like VeDoc, Parts Information etc.

  

On a personal level* You are a team player
* Advanced affinity with the automotive technology and / or electronic equipment
* Analytical thinker with a structured approach towards work
* Able to put yourself into the shoes of a Mercedes-Benz workshop and serves accordingly
* Strong flexibility towards unknown problems and situations based on vast personal experience and accrued knowledge
* ‘Can-do’ and proactive attitude and customer centric approach
* Uses expert knowledge, training and experience to translate problems into solutions
* Open communication style and a culture of feedback
* Does not search for responsibility, but takes it
* Able to set priorities and acts accordingly together with team members
* Is capable of handling expert tasks in combination with regular workload without raising the personal stress level

Compensation


We offer you a job in a multi-cultural, young and informal international working environment with interesting conditions, both primary and secondary:* Lucrative relocation package. If applicable, you will also be reimbursed for first arrival, housing fee, and moving costs.
* 200 vacation hours (based on full time employment)
* Holiday allowance: 8% of annual salary
* Competitive performance based salary growth
* Company result oriented bonuses
* Collective health insurance at discounted rates
* Pension plan without any personal ‘’money’ contribution
* Transportation plan: free bike every 3 years or; free public transport or; contribution to fuel costs
* A “tailor made” individual development plan

Contact Info


Please upload your CV and Letter of Motivation (English only) and any other documentation that adds value to your application.  

  

Due to data privacy reasons we cannot accept any applications sent by email. Please be so kind to use the link provided.

title: Technical Specialist I - Technical Retail Support Parts - Spanish
description:
Recruiter

**Joep Smeets**  

joep.smeets@mercedes-benz.com
Company Information


The Mercedes-Benz Customer Assistance Center is an international multicultural organization and an integrated part of Mercedes-Benz Cars Marketing & Sales. In our offices in Maastricht we think and act globally and assume a leading role for the Mercedes-Benz Customer Assistance Centers all over the world. 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, 365 days a year, we ensure our customers’ mobility with our roadside assistance. Additionally, we take care of all kinds of enquiries about passenger cars and vans during our opening hours. For our customers we are maybe the most important connection to the Mercedes-Benz brand. That’s why we live the brand’s most important promise: “The best or nothing”.
Function Description


Within the Retail Services department, we are responsible for technical enquiries about parts for Mercedes-Benz passenger cars and vans. The supported entities are the Retailers. Furthermore, the specialist role is to liaise with internal and external partners for resolving complex issues. The Technical Retail Support Parts 1st level is the first point of contact for delivering support in regards to technical parts enquiries based on the Xentry Portal Parts job. * Expert skills in technical support and problem solving
* Minimum 2 years of experience within similar area of business is a must

On a personal level* You are a team player

Compensation

title: Partner Success Coordinator
description:
*Are you ready for what’s next?**Come explore opportunities within Brunswick, a global marine leader committed to challenging conventions and innovating next-generation technologies that transform experiences on the water and beyond. Brunswick believes “Next Never Rests™,” and we offer a variety of exciting careers and growth opportunities within united teams defining the future of marine recreation.*
About Fliteboard
Growing from start-up to establishing a global brand following and a loyal community of customers spanning 90 countries.
We’re on a mission to build the world’s most loved electric water-sports brand, offering the most remarkable product and customer experience and innovating towards cleaner and quieter waterways.
About the role
The purpose of the Partner Success Coordinator is to represent the face of Flite to our partners and be their key to a great collaboration with Flite. In this dynamic and multi-layered role, you will be responsible for building loyal and supportive relationships with our partners, supporting their technical support needs, and converting those relationships into opportunities for longterm growth as a Flite partner. Alongside the territorial sales managers, you will be their main contact as their trusted advisor, aiding and guiding on operational, support, product-related issues and best practices that drive their success.
What you’ll love* Working together with a talented and diverse team
* Being part of a business that is passionate about building a loyal community around the world and prides itself on looking after its customers
* Growth and development opportunities
* Fliteboarding!


Responsibilities* Directly supporting our partners with any technical inquiries.
* On-boarding new Commercial Partners and assisting in keeping their information accurate and up to date.
* Managing Commercial Partner Accounts and ensuring their success through regular checking ins on technical and marketing support and where necessary evaluating the progress of our partners with regards to agreements made.
* Account orders & repeat orders in cooperation with local Sales team.
* Ensuring that our partners are always up to date with the newest instructions and resources available to them in cooperation with our Service Team and Marketing Team
* In-depth understanding of the technical side of all Fliteboard products to support internal and external stakeholders.
* Occasional technical on-boarding and training of all EMEA Service Partners, including refresher and technical level upgrade.


You’d be great at this job if you:* have a minimum of two to three years of experience in a similar role
* thrive in a fast-paced environment and are solution oriented
* are customer obsessed and excellence driven
* are technically minded and curious about how things work.
* have excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* ideally have experience with the water sports industry
* have a collaborative mindset but can also work autonomously


What we can offer* Competitive salary and bonus
* EAP for all global employees - we value well-being
* Birthday Leave - have a day off on us!

*Next is Now!*  

*We value growth and development, recognizing that people come with a wealth of experience and talent beyond just the technical requirements of a job. If your experience is close to what you see listed here, please still consider applying. Diversity of experience and skills combined with passion is a key to innovation and inspiration. Therefore, we encourage people from all backgrounds to apply to our positions. Please let us know if you require accommodations during the interview process.* *Brunswick is committed to providing a workplace that offers equal employment opportunities based solely on merit. Therefore, discrimination based on race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other protected status under applicable local, state or federal law is not tolerated.*
Brunswick and Workday Privacy Policies*Brunswick does not accept applications, inquiries or solicitations from unapproved staffing agencies or vendors.*
#Brunswick Corporation

title: Board Coordinator Corporate Office
description:
### **Function**


Do you want to make a difference and contribute to creating a better world? Are you interested in developing your skills and knowledge, while putting your ideals to work? Join us, we are a frontrunner in ethical banking and global impact investing, and we need people like you to make change happen.



We believe that money can change the world for the better. In fact, our organisation was founded on this belief. Our mission is to create a society that protects and promotes the quality of life of all its members with human dignity at its core.



To strengthen our Corporate Office Team we are looking for a Board Coordinator Corporate Office


**Board Coordinator Corporate Office (32 hours)**



Together with your colleague Board Coordinator, you support the Boards of Triodos Bank, i.e. the Executive Board and Supervisory Board, and Stichting Administratiekantoor Aandelen Triodos Bank (SAAT) by applying your excellent planning and preparation skills.



You are responsible for the practical aspects of the Board meetings in close collaboration with the Corporate Secretary and two Deputy Corporate Secretaries.



You enjoy arranging (international) management meetings in a dynamic environment with a sense of humour and positive attitude while maintaining oversight and professionalism.

### **Profile**

**Take action**





* Arranging all practical aspects of the Supervisory Board and its committees’ meetings such as Outlook invitations, organisation and distribution of documents, (international) logistics and catering, as well as the logistics for the Board of SAAT
* Back-up for your colleague Board Coordinator: arranging all practical aspects of the weekly Executive Board meetings and retreats, and International Management Council (IMC) meetings, such as agenda/topic planning, Outlook invitations, organisation and distribution of documents, logistics and catering
* Scheduling of ad hoc Board meetings, calls and working sessions
* Point of contact for practical and administrative requests from the Supervisory Board and the Corporate Office team in general
* Taking care of financial administration and payment of remuneration of the members of the Supervisory Board and SAAT


**This is you**





* Accurate, consistent and proactive problem solving
* High level of trust and discretion. Able to work with highly confidential information
* Ability to perform well in a dynamic environment at a strategic level
* A team player, able to manage expectations, but also able to work independently
* When under pressure, you maintain your flexibility and your sense of humour
* Able to work with colleagues at all levels within the organisation
* Quickly familiarise yourself with new topics or assignments


**This is complemented by**





* MBO+ level educated preferably as a secretary or office manager
* Excellent communication skills both in English and Dutch
* Computer skills and experience with MS Office
* Systems and technology savvy
* Ideally experience with iBabs or similar meeting tool


**The team**





You are part of the Corporate Secretary Department that consists of two Board Coordinators, two Deputy Corporate Secretaries, the Business Manager COE and the Corporate Secretary. You will also work closely together with the Management Assistants of the Executive Board.

### **Offer**

**What we offer you**





**An inspiring work culture**  

The most important thing about working with us is that you are part of a community that is changing the world for the better. We are constantly improving our work culture to create conditions where every person can thrive, so you are able to:





* find a sense of meaning in your work
* create positive energy and impact with your co-workers
* build mutual trust and respect in working relationships
* enjoy fulfilment at a professional and personal level
* 

**A comfortable working environment**

  

Our award-winning sustainable head office is based in Driebergen-Zeist, the Netherlands at the Reehorst Estate, just a 3 minutes’ walk from the train station. Combined with working from home, it is an inspiring place to work and connect with your colleagues. One of the interesting facts about it is that we can completely take the building apart and move it to a new location.





**And of course, great remuneration and working conditions**





* a salary appropriate to the position, our remuneration policy and your experience
* an attractive pension policy
* a mobility card (including free private travels)
* flexible working hours and the opportunity to work from home
* reimbursement of a company bicycle to the max of € 1,500
* 30 holiday days with a 40-hour working week, plus the option of buying 2 weeks of extra holiday days
* extra leave to contribute to voluntary work
* a range of education and training opportunities
* the option to join our collective health insurance
* a working from home allowance per home office day
* suitable home office equipment up to € 750 every 5 years


**Sounds interesting?**

  

If you feel that you want to make a difference, don’t hesitate to join the Triodos community by applying for this role.



Everyone is welcome and our culture is built with human dignity at its core. We believe in equity and diversity, and we know how valuable everyone’s individual perspectives are. We strive to create an environment in which all co-workers and our broader community can feel safe and included.





**The closing date for applications is: 22 september 2024**





If the role interests you but you still have some questions, please connect with us. If there are any additional adjustments you may need during the application process, please email: Maaike van der Meer**, Corporate Secretary, via email maaike.vandermeer@triodos.com.**



We also don’t want to miss out on candidates who feel they don’t exactly match the job description, so if this is a role that sounds interesting to you, and you feel you could add value, please apply.


**Who we are**

  

Triodos Bank is a leading expert in sustainable banking, founded in 1980 in the Netherlands, with branches in Belgium, Germany, United Kingdom, and Spain.  

Triodos Investment Management is a globally recognised leader in impact investing, that currently manages 20 funds invested in both Europe and emerging markets.

  

Triodos Regenerative Money Centre is our business unit launched in 2019 with the explicit goal of restoring and regenerating nature and society.

  

We are a **certified B** Corp since 2015. B Corp is a growing global community of successful and sustainable companies that create positive social impact and change.

  

We are also one of the founders of **The Global Alliance for Banking on Values**, a global network of independent banks using finance to deliver sustainable economic, social, and environmental development.


**www.triodos.com** | **www.triodos-im.com** | **www.triodosfoundation.n**
company_description: Triodos Investment Management is a wholly owned subsidiary of Triodos Bank, one of the world's leading sustainable banks.

title: HR Service Coordinator (m/f/d) 32-40 hours / week
description:
**Company Description** **About Redcare Pharmacy**


As Europe’s No.1 e-pharmacy, Redcare Pharmacy is powered by passionate teams and cutting-edge innovation. We strive to create a healthy, collaborative work environment where every employee feels valued and inspired to contribute to our vision “Until every human has their health”. If you’re seeking a career that offers purpose and aligns with your values, join us and begin your #Redcareer today.


We offer more than just a workplace – we provide an inspiring environment where your professional growth is supported and encouraged. We believe in fostering the ambitions of our employees and support your personal and professional development. As we continue to grow, you will have the opportunity to grow too!


In addition to joining a great team, you will be working in a modern work environment. We offer a canteen where you can enjoy a hot meal and we strive to have lunch together with the HR team on a daily basis, which adds to the team spirit and is more fun! During breaks, you can use our lounge area, play table tennis or table football with colleagues or even use our on-site gym. Ideal for blowing off some steam and allowing you to come back refreshed and focused after the break.

 **Job Description** **About the role**


At the heart of our mission are the people we serve, and we're on a journey to build and optimize our HR Service department, putting people at the forefront of our focus.


We are seeking an HR Service Coordinator who embodies the core essence of our company: a commitment to people. Your role will extend far beyond paperwork, for colleagues, you are an accessible and reliable person they can turn to with all HR related issues. As an HR Service Coordinator, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the seamless execution of HR processes. You will be responsible for creating contracts, preparing onboarding and offboarding processes, registering employee data in Workday, and supporting various HR functions. Your expertise will contribute to the efficient and effective management of our human resources operations.

 **About your tasks**

* Ensure accurate and effective employee administration throughout the entire employee lifecycle
* Provide guidance and advice on HR matters related to law, regulations and policies
* Register and maintain accurate employee data in Workday, ensuring data integrity and confidentiality.
* Employee Support: Provide guidance and support to employees on HR-related matters, fostering a positive work environment.
* Stay updated on HR trends and legal requirements to ensure RedCare Pharmacy remains a compliant and competitive employer
* Drive and support alignment of all processes, policies and procedures with the team and the business, proactively identify and respond to business threats and opportunities.

  

**Qualifications** **About you**


Taking initiative comes naturally and you love working independently. Our ideal candidate possesses a profound people-centric approach and a friendly demeanor while also having the ability to anticipate and maintain a clear overview of tasks. You easily find solutions to seemingly impossible situations, and know how to create (temporary) workarounds to optimize business processes whilst looking for sustainable solutions.


Please be aware that due to legal requirements, we can only consider applications from candidates who are citizens of the European Union (EU) member countries. If you are not an EU citizen, you must possess a valid work permit for The Netherlands.

* A Bachelor’s degree in the field of HR is preferred
* Several years of relevant experience within an international environment
* Proficiency in MS Office applications (Word, Excel, Outlook, Powerpoint) and HRIS
* Strong language skills in both English and German; knowledge of Dutch is a plus
* Knowledge of employment legislation and HR administration processes


To apply, please submit your CV in Dutch or English.

 **Additional Information** **About your benefits**

* **Work from Home:** If your job does not require you to be present in the office, we can arrange the place you work from individually - even for up to 20 days a year anywhere in the EU.
* **Corporate pension plan:** Your future is important to us, which is why we offer an excellent and premium free company pension plan.
* **Mental Health:** Get quick and professional help from psychologists of Likeminded if you feel overwhelmed in private or professional life. Anonymous and free of charge.
* **Sport:** We offer an in-house fitness room as well as a free gym membership. During your breaks you have the choice between our comfortable relaxation room or some exercise at the table tennis table.
* **Personal development:** We are happy to promote your professional future with us and offer various training courses in our company and with external partners.

 **#yourcareer**
company_description: Hi, we’re Redcare Pharmacy. We are the one-stop pharmacy guiding people through health.

title: Senior Account Technology Strategist - Education
description:
Microsoft is on a mission to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. Our culture is centered on embracing a growth mindset, inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. By doing so, we create life-changing innovations that impact billions of lives around the world. You can help us to achieve our mission.**Account Technology Strategist Education**
===========================================


This strategic, leading role helps our Education customers with their unique challenges, designing the strategy and architecture to accelerate strong educational outcomes and ultimately contribute to a brighter future for students and educators alike. The Account Technology Strategist acts as a Chief Technology Officer for our Education clients, interacting with both educational and IT decision-makers to illustrate how Microsoft can help them meet their business and IT objectives. One of the goals is to expand influence and drive innovation for different departments and domains within educational institutions in the Netherlands.  

Education is a cornerstone of society and a key priority for Microsoft. We believe in the transformative power of technology to improve learning experiences, foster inclusive education, and prepare students for the jobs of the future. Our commitment is to support educational institutions in their journey to digital transformation, ensuring that the next generation is well-equipped with the skills and knowledge they need.  

In today's fast-evolving educational landscape, challenges such as teacher shortages and the need for flexible and personalized learning solutions are increasingly prominent. The Account Technology Strategist (ATS) is expected to work closely with schools and universities to develop and implement innovative solutions that address these issues. This includes leveraging technology to enhance teaching effectiveness, creating personalized learning pathways, and ensuring that institutions can meet the diverse needs of their students. Through strategic partnerships, building technical roadmaps, and a deep understanding of the education sector, the ATS will play a pivotal role in driving positive change and creating lasting impact.**Responsibilities**
--------------------

### **Digital Transformation Strategy**


Understand the education sector, including industry trends and specific customer goals. Utilize Microsoft solution areas and partner solutions to build a 3-Horizon roadmap that enables the customer’s digital transformation and innovation agenda. Expand Microsoft relationships with educational institutions into strategic digital transformation partnerships.### **Technology & Industry Thought Leadership**


Reimagine the role of technology as a partner in business and innovation to drive the digital transformation agenda of our Education customers. Help them understand the impact of emerging and strategic technologies and inspire & influence them to see Microsoft technologies as the main enabler of educational innovation and societal impact. Bridge the value of technology with the challenges and gaps that the education industry currently face.
### **Business & Enterprise Architecture**


Driving valuable partnerships with education customers to create a long-term strategy that links the business, technology, and educational needs of our customers to enable their educational transformation strategy and drive sustainable change. Sharing your broad knowledge of the Microsoft Platform, our competition, and the industry to create a vision of how Microsoft can be the customer’s best partner to take their business to new heights.### **Technology Sales**


Orchestrate technology sales activities to drive the digital transformation vision and roadmap of our Education customers with Microsoft technologies. Plan and orchestrate solution proposals and coordinate technology sales teams and customer account teams to provide the right solution to the customer.
### **Account Leadership**


Be a Change Agent internally and externally to inspire and ideate about the possibilities that innovative technologies provide to drive the educational strategy and priorities of our customers. Own and strengthen the collaborative relationship with C-level, educational, and technology executives. Create an inclusive and supportive environment for your account team to be successful, embracing Microsoft’s philosophy of ‘come as you are, do what you love’!### **Orchestration**


Ability to manage and lead a diverse virtual matrix of teams across all areas of Microsoft To summarize the role: you are the CTO of Education for a sub-set of our most relevant customers working in strong collaboration with the Education Account Executives, the specialists and the Customer Success Account Managers to help the customer innovate with technology.**Qualifications**
------------------

### **Required/Minimum Qualifications**

* Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or a related field
* Ability to build long-term Trusted Technology Relationships that result in solid and meaningful Strategic Technology conversations.
* In-depth knowledge of customers’ Technology environments within the Education industry.
* Experience in managing and leading a diverse virtual matrix of teams within a large organisation.
* Language: Dutch speaking/ writing (Level B2 upwards), English proficiency.

### **Additional or Preferred Qualifications**

* Several years of experience in the Education & research industry.
* Several years of experience in technical consultancy to drive digital transformation, and/or using technology to drive customer business outcomes.
* Microsoft certifications are highly recommended (Azure fundamentals, Microsoft Data Fundamentals, Microsoft Security Fundamentals).
* technical consulting, technical consultative selling, business consulting, practice building, or related technical/sales experience OR equivalent experience.

  


Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.
company_description: Our mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more.

title: Associate Director, Insurance Product
description:
**The Company**  

Cover Genius is a Series E insurtech that protects the global customers of the world’s largest digital companies including Booking Holdings, owner of Priceline, Kayak and Booking.com, Intuit, Uber, Hopper, Ryanair, Turkish Airlines, Descartes ShipRush, Zip and SeatGeek. We’re also available at Amazon, Flipkart, eBay, Wayfair and SE Asia’s largest company, Shopee. Our partners integrate with XCover, our award-winning insurance distribution platform, to embed protection for millions of customers worldwide each year.

Our team and products have been recognized with dozens of awards including by the Financial Times which ranked Cover Genius as the #1 fastest-growing company in APAC in 2020. Our diverse team across 20+ countries and many language groups commit itself to diverse cultural programs, in particular “CG Gives” which makes social entrepreneurs out of us all and funds development initiatives in global communities. **Our People are**
Bold, Authentic, Purposeful and Inspired **Our People are not**
Perfect, Traditional, Complacent or Cautious **About the Role**  

As Associate Director, Insurance Product within our EMEA Insurance Team, you will own and lead the development and optimisation of CG’s product proposition across all verticals. Key goal is to develop innovative yet standardised product propositions with our insurance partners that can be seamlessly rolled out / scaled and that maximise revenue. In addition, you will be responsible for reviewing all aspects of existing products to review commercial performance and regulatory compliance with a view of making recommendations to improve overall performance.  

To drive success in this role, you will have extensive product / underwriting experience, strong commercial acumen, a good understanding of General Insurance and a track record in developing and placing innovative product solutions. You will lead product discussions with insurer partners and collaborate with our Partnerships and Partners Services teams to ensure products meet Partner objectives.
### **What will your day look like? You will...**

* Working with the Global Solutions team to lead the development of new and innovative product propositions across all verticals that maximise revenue
* Leading product development discussions with insurer partners and influencing them to support new products
* Undertaking detailed product reviews to identity growth initiatives with distribution partners
* Developing Product Governance Framework to ensure products are regularly reviewed against key commercial and compliance KPIs and updating senior team on performance and recommendations
* First line of compliance defense with product reviews, claims feedback loop and fair value assessments
* Manage team in the region and ensure timely delivery of priorities
* Drive an innovative and disruptive culture within the business and with our partners while ensuring the highest standards of conduct are maintained

### **To help us level up, you'll ideally have:**

* Ideal candidate will possess a minimum of 7 years experience in the insurance market at a broker, insurer or MGA with a focus in developing innovative product propositions / underwriting
* At least 2 years of experience with regard to controlled and sound business practice, administrative and managerial skills, and general and specific professional knowledge in the MGA field
* Track record in developing innovative product propositions that disrupt markets and maximise revenue
* Experience in influencing insurers through data and compelling presentations to adopt product innovations
* Ability to communicate complex ideas in a clear, concise manner both verbally and in writing
* Problem solving and advocating for customer solutions
* Experience working in producing business in multiple markets around the world is an advantage
* Demonstrate experience in product entry strategies, product designs and growing revenue
* Being analytical and comfortable manipulating data to identify product optimisation opportunities


Cover Genius not only cares about being the best in our industry, we care about our team. We’re a business that understands life can be fluid and so we flex to ensure we provide the environment to suit that. What does that mean?* Flexible Work Environment - we are outcome focussed and understand that for our people to perform at their best flexibility is critical.


* Employee Stock Options - we want our people to share in our success, we reward them with ownership for their contribution in creating a world-class company.

* Work with like-minded people who are passionate about both the work we're doing and giving back. Our CG Gives programs enables us to all become philanthropists through our peer recognition and rewards system.


* Social Initiatives - pictures speak a thousand words!

  

Sound interesting? If you think you have the best composition of the above, send us your resume and let's chat!* *Cover Genius promotes diversity and inclusivity. We don't tolerate discrimination, demeaning treatment of anyone, or harassment due to race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or any other legally protected status.*
company_description: Cover Genius is the insurtech for embedded protection. Together, we protect the global customers of the world’s largest digital companies.

title: Cross Functional Development Representative (German/French Speaking)
description:
**Cross Functional Business Development Representative** **(German/French)**  

  

**What You Can Expect**  

  

As a Business Development Representative, your purpose is to identify and pursue new business opportunities. This entry-level combination sales role involves both inbound and outbound calls from inbound leads. You'll build and maintain meaningful customer relationships, drive sales growth, and contribute to the overall success of the company. Your proactive approach and strategic mindset will be instrumental in expanding our market presence.  

  

**About The Team**  

  

The Zoom sales team is a dynamic force driving the company's success. With a focus on delivering cutting- edge communication solutions for clients across all sectors, the team passionately engages with clients worldwide.  

  

**What You Will Be Doing**

  

* Carrying out inbound and outbound activities daily between calls, emails, social selling, direct mail, video messages
* Achieving quarterly qualified opportunity quotas
* with our Sales teams to prioritize and select accounts to target
* Communicating with C-level and VP-level Executives to address business needs
* Maintaining and updating Salesforce.com regularly
Leveraging a wide range of sales tools to complete tasks efficiently  
* 

**What We’re Looking For**

  

* Be able to build partnerships and work collaboratively with others to meet shared objectives
* Have 1-2 years of sales experience
* Have excellent customer service skills and sales acumen
* Have an eagerness to learn and adapt
* Have the proven ability to meet performance goals, consistently delivering happiness to customers
* Be passionate about personal and professional growth within the sales domain
* Be willing to take on new opportunities and tough challenges with a sense of urgency and enthusiasm
* Be able to rebound from setbacks and adversity when facing difficult situations
* Professional level fluency in German and French is preferred

**Ways of Working**  

Our structured hybrid approach is centered around our offices and remote work environments. The work style of each role, Hybrid, Remote, or In-Person is indicated in the job description/posting.

**Benefits**  

As part of our award-winning workplace culture and commitment to delivering happiness, our benefits program offers a variety of perks, benefits, and options to help employees maintain their physical, mental, emotional, and financial health; support work-life balance; and contribute to their community in meaningful ways. Click Learn for more information.

**About Us**  

Zoomies help people stay connected so they can get more done together. We set out to build the best collaboration platform for the enterprise, and today help people communicate better with products like Zoom Contact Center, Zoom Phone, Zoom Events, Zoom Apps, Zoom Rooms, and Zoom Webinars.  

We’re problem-solvers, working at a fast pace to design solutions with our customers and users in mind. Here, you’ll work across teams to deliver impactful projects that are changing the way people communicate and enjoy opportunities to advance your career in a diverse, inclusive environment.

 **Our Commitment**  

We believe that the unique contributions of all Zoomies is the driver of our success. To make sure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience we never discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status. Zoom is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.


We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives including qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records and any qualified applicants requiring reasonable accommodations in accordance with the law.


If you need assistance navigating the interview process due to a medical disability, please submit an Accommodations Request Form and someone from our team will reach out soon. This form is solely for applicants who require an accommodation due to a qualifying medical disability. Non-accommodation-related requests, such as application follow-ups or technical issues, will not be addressed.
company_description: Planning, development and sales of game software and mobile application contents

title: Solution Sales Executive - ESG & Sustainability - Benelux
description:
The Solution Sales Executive is responsible for obtaining new business and customer expansion sales opportunities from Executive-level buyers and influencers in either private or publicly traded companies. Solution sellers are focused on a specific portfolio of Workiva solutions and collaborate with other Workiva sales teams to deliver multi-solution sales.
Successful candidates will build relationships and identify Workiva products and solutions that meet customer needs to drive customer acquisition within an assigned territory. Sales growth is attained through new customer subscriptions, professional services, delivery and training.
This solution sales role will be focused on Workiva’s ESG and Sustainability solutions for the Benelux region.
What You’ll Do* Actively seek out sales opportunities in collaboration with peer Sales teams, Inside Sales, and Partnerships to generate qualified sales pipeline
* Utilize information gathered during the needs analysis phase to deliver a compelling demonstration of the Workiva platform
* Skillfully address customer objections - removing obstacles - and finding solutions to various client challenges
* Lead the sales process naturally - guiding it to a close by effectively showcasing Workiva's value proposition
* Regularly and promptly update customer relationship management tools to report customer contacts
* Provide consistent and accurate forward-looking information through pipeline analysis to forecast sales
* Develop and execute a sales strategy with purposeful action to secure the sale
* Rally internal support to pursue an account and optimize internal resources
* Prioritize selling activities and ensure timely follow-through
* Maintain a strong understanding of Workiva products through a commitment to ongoing training and a growth mindset


What You'll Need
Minimum Qualifications* 4+ years experience in a related role - enterprise technology or similar complex solution sales
* Undergraduate Degree or equivalent combination of knowledge and related career experience


Preferred Qualifications* Understanding of the Software as a Service (SaaS) business model
* Ability to demonstrate complex software applications
* Strong business acumen and an ability to understand complex business challenges
* Executive presence and an ability to communicate at the most senior level
* Ability to identify and understand the power of influencers versus buyers and how to navigate the nuances of each during the sales cycle.
* Ability to manage multiple complex sales cycles simultaneously
* Ability to negotiate pricing with a focus on retaining value
* Capability for achieving (and exceeding) sales quota targets


Travel Requirement & Working Conditions* Up to 30% travel for regular customer meetings and events
* Reliable internet access required for any period of time working remotely and not in a Workiva office


Workiva is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We believe that great minds think differently. We value diversity of backgrounds, beliefs, and interests, and we recognize diversity as an important source of intellectual thought, varied perspective, and innovation. Employment decisions are made without regard to age, gender identity, race, religion, disability status, sexual orientation, or any other protected characteristic.
Workiva is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities. To request assistance with the application process, please email talentacquisition@workiva.com.
Workiva employees are required to undergo comprehensive security and privacy training tailored to their roles, ensuring adherence to company policies and regulatory standards.
#LI-LC1
company_description: Workiva Inc. (NYSE: WK) simplifies complex work for thousands of organizations worldwide.

title: Lead, Social Media Activation
description:
**Values & Innovation**
-----------------------


At Under Armour, we are committed to empowering those who strive for more, and the company's values - Act Sustainably, Celebrate the Wins, Fight on Together, Love Athletes and Stand for Equality - serve as both a roadmap for our teams and the qualities expected of every teammate.

  

Our Values define and unite us, the beliefs that are the red thread that connects everyone at Under Armour. Our values are rallying cries, reminding us why we're here, and fueling everything we do.

  

Our pursuit of better begins with innovation and with our team's mission of being the best. With us, you get the freedom to go further - no matter your role. That means developing, delivering, and selling the state-of-the-art products and digital tools that make top performers even better.

  

If you are a current Under Armour teammate, apply to this position on the **Internal Career Site Here.**

**Purpose of Role**
-------------------


The Social Media Lead will play a pivotal role in driving Under Armour’s brand presence and engagement across the EMEA region. This role is dedicated to connecting with our community through innovative and impactful social media strategies that resonate with athletes, influencers, and consumers alike. By activating our athletes and influencers and creating compelling social content, you will help elevate Under Armour’s brand story, ensuring that our message of performance and innovation reaches and inspires audiences across the region.

  

Under Armour is seeking a dynamic and innovative Social Media Lead to join our EMEA team in Amsterdam. In this role, you will be the driving force behind our social media strategy, focusing on activating Under Armour athletes and influencers, owning social content briefs, and leading the social activation plan for our brand and product campaigns. You will play a crucial role in amplifying our brand presence across EMEA, ensuring that Under Armour continues to push the boundaries of performance and innovation.

**Your Impact**
---------------


Growth & Engagement:

* Oversee the growth and engagement of Under Armour’s regional social media handles. Utilize data-driven strategies to expand our audience and deepen engagement, ensuring our social presence is vibrant and impactful.

  

Athlete Social Activation:

* With the partnership of Sports Marketing team, Lead and execute the social media activation of Under Armour athletes across the EMEA region.
* Create compelling social content that resonates with both the athletes' audiences and the broader Under Armour community.

  

Influencer Activation:

* Identify, engage, and activate key influencers who embody the Under Armour brand ethos.
* Develop influencer strategies that drive engagment and conversion across all relevant social platforms.
* Collaborate with influencers to create authentic, high-impact content that aligns with our brand values and campaign goals.

  

Social Content Brief Ownership:

* Take ownership of social content briefs, ensuring all content aligns with the brand’s tone, style, and campaign objectives.
* Work closely with creative teams and agencies to develop innovative social media content that drives engagement and brand loyalty.
* Ensure consistency in messaging across all social channels and content pieces.

  

Campaign Social Activation Planning:

* Develop and implement social media activation plans for brand and product campaigns across the EMEA region.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate social media efforts with broader marketing initiatives.
* Monitor and analyze campaign performance, using insights to optimize and refine social media strategies.
**Qualifications**
------------------

* University degree in Marketing, Sports & Business or related field
* Minimum of 5 years of relevant marketing experience in a fast-paced, product-oriented, consumer-driven company and previous leadership experience
* Proven experience in a social media communication, preferably within the sports industry
* Strong understanding of the social media landscape, preferably within the UK, France, Spain and Germany
* Demonstrated ability to manage athlete and influencer social activations
* Experience in creating and executing successful social media campaigns and content strategies
* Exceptional communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively across various departments
* Excellent project management skills with the ability to juggle multiple projects and deadlines
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and translate it into actionable strategies
* Experience working with or managing external agencies
**Workplace Location**
----------------------

* **Location:** This individual must reside within commuting distance from our Amsterdam office.
* **Return to Work Designation:** Hybrid work (baseline of minimum 2 days a week in-office.
**Relocation**
--------------

* No relocation provided


#LI-KC1


#LI-HYBRID

**Benefits & Perks**
--------------------

* Paid “UA Give Back” Volunteer Days: Work alongside your team to support initiatives in your local community.
* Under Armour Merchandise Discounts
* Health & fitness benefits, discounts and resources- We offer teammates across the country programs to promote physical activity and overall well-being.
* 38 hour working week
* Hybrid work, a minimum of 2 days in the office
* 28 days holiday
* Teammate Resource groups e.g. Green Machine, Sustainability, LGBTQIA+, Women in Leading and Living, Balance for mental health and wellbeing etc.
* Human Performance Institute (Gym) on site
* Local Language course when moving from abroad
**Our Commitment to Diversity**
-------------------------------


At Under Armour, we are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and teammates without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, pregnancy (including childbirth, lactation and related medical conditions), national origin, age, physical and mental disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information (including characteristics and testing), military and veteran status, family or paternal status and any other characteristic protected by applicable law. Under Armour believes that diversity and inclusion among our teammates is critical to our success as a global company, and we seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. Accommodation is available for applicants with disabilities upon request.
