title: MarCom
description:
### **Job Features**


Job Category Senior  

About TPV Technology
TPV Technology is an internationally-renowned PC monitor, TV and Digital Signage Displays manufacturer. TPV serves as an original design manufacturer for some of the best-known TV , PC and Digital Signage Displays brands in the industry and distributes its products worldwide under its own brands AOC and Envision. In addition, the company designs, produces and sells Philips-branded monitors, TV's and AVA products, Digital Signage Displays and mobile phones through a license agreement with Philips via its subsidiaries TP Vision and MMD. As an example, the company brings high-quality TV sets to the market: smart and easy to use with sophisticated styling. TPV believes in creating products that touch the human senses and are within reach of all consumers in the markets they operate in. As a leader in the hotel industry, their hospitality TV division serves most the world's major international and national hotel groups, as well as individual hotels, hospitals, cruises and other professional facilities.

  

  

About TP Vision
TP Vision is a consumer electronics key player in the world of audio visual digital entertainment. TP Vision concentrates on developing, manufacturing and marketing Philips branded TV sets (Europe, Russia, Middle East, South America, India and selected countries in Asia-Pacific) and audio products (all around the Globe). We do this by combining the innovative Philips brand heritage with our design expertise, operational excellence, flexibility and speed of TPV Technology. With these combined strengths, we bring high-quality TV sets to the market: smart and easy to use with sophisticated styling. We believe in creating products that offer a superior audio and visual experience for consumers. With Philips TVs, TP Vision is a global leader in the hospitality market. TP Vision is the exclusive brand licensee of Philips TVs for the above listed countries and, on the global stage for the Philips audio products.TP Vision employs close to 2,000 people in several locations around the globe and is 100% owned by TPV, one of the world’s leading monitor and LCD TV manufacturers, selling and marketing Philips branded TVs in China. TPV has been able to drive its growth over the years by leveraging its economies of scale and core competencies in R&D, manufacturing, logistic efficiency and quality.

  

  

Responsibility**Branding :**


* Ensure that the Philips brand and identity is adhered to in all communication channels. Oversee accuracy of marketing materials and provide formal sign off if necessary.

  


**Marketing assets :**


* Brief and oversee the work of internal and external agencies, such as designers, production agencies and printers, who will deliver much of the content/deliverables.
* Creation of omni channel asset packages (digital, trade, e-com)
* Drive toolkit implementation across Europe within defined marketing processes, KPIs and follow up with key stake-holders.

  


**Budget management / KPI monitoring and internal reporting:**


* Understanding and acting on the main drivers for content/deliverable effectiveness in order to drive MROI including setting planning KPIs and targets and post-delivery reporting.
* Work within an approved budget, project planning . Set up needed KPIs and follow up on them.
* Working with multiple agencies and contractors and evaluates the performance of these vendors as appropriate.

  


**Digital Media Campaigns and Partnerships:**


* Lead the creation, execution, and optimization of digital media campaigns in collaboration with partners, ensuring alignment with overall brand and marketing objectives.
* Work closely with partners to create engaging content and promotional assets for digital platforms, driving fan engagement and expanding the brand’s reach within the sports community.

  


  

What Do We Offer You* Competitive reward package
* Fast moving, dynamic growth ambition environment
* Ability to broaden design portfolio working for a great brand and attractive products
* Joining a growing, truly international team
* Opportunity to further develop and strengthen broad skills, knowledge, and network
* Ability to implement new ideas and changes and have impact


  

Education And Related Experience* Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing or Communication
* 3 years of experience in Marketing/Communications in regional (multi country org. set up)
* Excellent project management skills and experience working with agencies on corporate level; the ability to successfully manage multiple projects running at the same time
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills, stakeholder management skills within and outside the company, and within multicultural diverse organizations
* Have proven experience of managing creative projects; on time delivery of assets, copy, deliverables across various communication channels
* Strong knowledge of marketing communications, preferably experience with consumer electronics industry or relevant durable retail experience
* Experience in digital marketing would be a strong advantage
* Excellent command of English language (written and verbal). German, French, Dutch or Spanish is a plus
* Critical thinker with strong problem-solving skills
* Entrepreneurial drive for growth
* Ambitious, pro-active, high drive for getting-things-done
* Able to work in dynamic fast changing business environment
* Able to occasionally travel (off site productions, photoshoots, industry events)


  

More Info
If you enjoy working with knowledgeable, energetic and success-oriented people, for a company that both challenges and respects it's professionals, and you’ve got what it takes to be a great MarCom - Brand Activation Manager, TV Europe, then apply today. Please contact Victoria Starovoitova (Corporate Recruiter) at info@careersattpvision.com and include your English CV with a short motivation.



Acquisition as a result of this job posting is not appreciated!

title: Director Customer Care
description:
Overview:
**Summary of Position**  

This position is responsible for the direction of end-to-end customer support for all banners in Europe in partnership with the NA and APAC teams working towards enterprise solutions. Directing internal and external support groups to not just ensure a high level of service but define our customer centric operating model in line with our strategic direction to put our customer first and lead the industry in support and experience standards. Budgetary ownership of customer support, tooling and coordinating end customer support needs for stores, online, escalations and launch support.  


Responsibilities:
**Tasks & Responsibilities**
----------------------------

* Provide insight that supports the strategic vision and planning in the customer support architecture for an omni-channel retailer and ensure alignment with the global strategic objectives for customer service
* Define and optimize the customer service lifecycle and map the customer support journey with a focus on metrics
* Design, implement and analyze reports related with Customer Service
* Drive customer success culture and effectively act as an internal customer advocate at the senior/executive level, exposing the customers pain points and opportunities at high levels in the organization with recommendations for improvement
* Partner with support resources across multiple functions and centers of expertise (Product, IT, Marketing etc) to effectively deliver and support solutions
* Work cross functionally to share best practices and analyze and modify processes and policies to improve overall customer support experience
* Manage, coach and develop large international internal and external teams of 80+ associates to deliver the ultimate customer support experience
* Develop and implement internal and external support services for end users
* Negotiates with and selects external vendors and service offering ensuring budgetary control
* Manage and maintains 3rd party relationships and evaluates these based on performance, SLA and expected Customer Service
* Define processes and measure to improve the internal and externals workflows of customer service and experience
* Collaborate within and across FL to build strong customer loyalty and satisfaction programs

  

Qualifications:
**Candidate Profile**
---------------------

  

* BSc or higher in Business, science, technology or related skills and experience
* At least 10 + years of experience in international FMCG organizations with customer support and/or Customer satisfaction
* 5+ experience of leading large teams, onsite and remote
* Fluent in English, preferable knowledge of another European language.
* Familiarity and or use of Zendesk or similar platforms a plus.
* Process management background is a plus (i.e. Six Sigma, ITIL)
* Excellent communication skills
* Strong understanding of customer expectations globally
* Ability to work under pressure, tight deadlines and with own initiative
* Strong analytical skills
* Experience managing large expense budgets

Foot Locker is entitled to assign other duties than those associated with the position as described above, if such would be in the best interest of the Company.


Benefits:
**Benefits*** Recognition, inclusion and belonging in a diverse environment.
* 25 holidays and flexible working (hybrid position, in office 2 days p/w)
* Employee Discount on in-store and online products
* Casual Sneaker Culture
* Learning & Health/Wellbeing programs
* Career development and growth in an ambitious international team
* Travel reimbursement
* Pension Plan
* Discounted Collective Health plans
* Activities organized by our Social Committee
company_addresses:
330 W. 34th St.
New York NY, United States 10001
company_description: Headquartered in New York, New York, Foot Locker is a leading retailer of athletic shoes and apparel, serving customers around the world.

title: Associate Sales Engineer UK&I - Netherlands based
description:
Job Description


At Juniper, we believe the network is the single greatest vehicle for knowledge, understanding, and human advancement the world has ever known.


To achieve real outcomes, we know that experience is the most important requirement for networking teams and the people they serve. Delivering an experience-first, AI-Native Network pivots on the creativity and commitment of our people. It requires a consistent and committed practice, something we call the Juniper Way.

**Join Juniper Networks and be part of the AI Revolution!**

  



Juniper Networks is revolutionizing the way the world connects. We're not just about building networks; we're about creating meaningful connections through the industry’s first AI-Native Networking Platform.



At the heart of this digital transformation, our Sales Engineers are the technical experts who help our customers unlock the full potential by leveraging solutions for Cloud, AI-Ops, operational simplicity, and service-assurance enabled architectures.



If you enjoy real-world application of knowledge to seek solutions to problems, Sales Engineering is an extraordinary place to be!

  



Are you willing to unleash your potential?

  


**About the Role:**



Our Associate Sales Engineering Program is your gateway to an exciting career in tech! Get hands-on experience, learn from some of the brightest minds in the industry, and start building the future—both for yourself and our customers.



As you grow with us, you’ll become the technical lead who works with our customers to understand their IT challenges and you will design solutions that make a real difference. Your passion for technology will excite our customers and deliver exceptional outcomes that they will love.

  


**Who We’re Looking For:**



If you’re a recent graduate eager to dive into the world of networking and explore innovative technologies like AI/ML, Automation, IoT, multi-cloud, and 5G, then Juniper’s Associate Sales Engineering Program is the perfect place for you!



This is more than just a job—it’s a launchpad for your career. You'll gain real-world experience, develop your skills, and have the opportunity to advance within the world’s leading AI-Native Networking company.

  


**What You’ll Do:**



Over the course of 12 months, you’ll build a strong foundation in networking concepts and hone your pre-sales skills by working across various areas of our Sales Engineering organization. Here’s a glimpse of what you’ll be doing:

  


* **Program Enhancements:** Help deploy best practices that shape our future.
* **Partner Inquiries:** Respond to technical questions from our partners and help them succeed.
* **Collaboration:** Team up on projects that deepen your product knowledge and expertise.
* **Customer Engagement:** Attend and assist with onsite presentations, solution demos, and more.
* **Technical Support:** Prepare responses to customer proposals and follow up on their questions.
* **Lab Work:** Develop proof-of-concept configurations and see your ideas in action.
* **Training & Workshops:** Lead sessions that empower others with your newfound knowledge.
* **Innovate:** Continuously learn and build solutions that truly meet customer needs.

  



By the end of the program, you’ll be ready to tackle pre-sales challenges with confidence and creativity. Juniper Sales operates in an agile, high-velocity capacity that sets and beats records almost daily; your unique abilities and ideas will help us to continue making a difference!

  


**Program Highlights:**


* **Kick-off:** Start in November 2024, with 12 weeks of foundational training.
* **Hands-On Labs:** Apply your learning through practical, real-world experiences.
* **TechSummit:** Engage with thought leaders and dive deeper into tech.
* **Guest Speakers:** Gain insights from industry experts.
* **Milestones:** Earn certifications as you progress through the program.
* **Sales Kick Off (SKO):** Be part of our major annual event.
* **Accelerated Career Growth:** Dive into a full-time role where learning and impact go hand in hand. Over the first 12 months, you’ll gain hands-on experience while continuously growing your skills.
* **Exciting Future Opportunities:** After the initial 12 months, you’ll be able to explore and pursue job openings within Juniper that align with your passions and strengths, allowing you to shape your own career path.

  


**Are You a Good Fit?**


* You’re passionate about learning new technologies and understanding how things work.
* Thriving in a fast-paced, dynamic environment excites you.
* You’re great at managing your time and adapting to changing priorities.
* You’re a team player who’s ready to learn and grow with your peers.

  


**Minimum Qualifications:**


* Recent bachelor’s or master’s degree in a relevant field like Engineering or Computer Science.
* Up to two years of experience as a Sales Engineer or Network practitioner.
* Strong communication skills—both written and spoken.
* **Fluency in English is required.**
* You must have the right to work in the Netherlands

  


**Preferred Qualifications:**


* Basic knowledge of computer networking solutions.
* Familiarity with cloud networking and OS virtualization is a plus.
* Experience with Python or other scripting languages is a bonus.

  


**Other Information:**


* English is the working language at Juniper.
* Relocation options are available.

  


**How to apply:**


**Interested candidates are required to submit a motivation letter (1 page) together with their CV, explaining why you want to participate in this program, your relevant skills and experiences, and how you believe this opportunity aligns with your personal and professional goals.**

 **ABOUT JUNIPER NETWORKS**


Juniper Networks challenges the inherent complexity that comes with networking and security in the multicloud era. We do this with products, solutions and services that transform the way people connect, work and live. We simplify the process of transitioning to a secure and automated multicloud environment to enable secure, AI-driven networks that connect the world. Additional information can be found at Juniper Networks (www.juniper.net) or connect with Juniper on Twitter, LinkedIn and Facebook.

**WHERE WILL YOU DO YOUR BEST WORK?**


Wherever you are in the world, whether it's downtown Sunnyvale or London, Westford or Bangalore, Juniper is a place that was founded on disruptive thinking - where colleague innovation is not only valued, but expected. We believe that the great task of delivering a new network for the next decade is delivered through the creativity and commitment of our people. The Juniper Way is the commitment to all our colleagues that the culture and company inspire their best work-their life's work. At Juniper we believe this is more than a job - it's an opportunity to help change the world...

**INCLUSION AND DIVERSITY AT JUNIPER**


At Juniper Networks, we are committed to elevating talent by creating a trust-based environment where we can all thrive together. We know from experience that people from underrepresented groups often do not apply for roles they do not feel they meet all the criteria for. If you think you have what it takes, but do not necessarily check every single box, please consider applying. We’d love to speak with you.

**Additional Information for United States jobs:**

**ELIGIBILITY TO WORK AND E-VERIFY**


In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification form upon hire.


Juniper Networks participates in the E-Verify program. E-Verify is an Internet-based system operated by the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) in partnership with the Social Security Administration (SSA) that allows participating employers to electronically verify the employment eligibility of new hires and the validity of their Social Security Numbers.

* Information for applicants about E-Verify / E-Verify Información en español: This Company Participates in E-Verify / Este Empleador Participa en E-Verify
* Immigrant and Employee Rights Section (IER) - The Right to Work / El Derecho a Trabajar


E-Verify® is a registered trademark of the U.S. Department of Homeland Security.


Juniper is an Equal Opportunity workplace and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate in employment decisions on the basis of race, color, religion, gender (including pregnancy), national origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, disability, genetic information, age, veteran status, or any other applicable legally protected characteristic. All employment decisions are made on the basis of individual qualifications, merit, and business need.
company_description: At Juniper, we make the advanced technologies that give organizations the power to connect, solve problems, and capture opportunities.

Wherever you are in the world, whether it's downtown Sunnyvale or London, Westford or Bangalore, Juniper is a place that was founded on disruptive thinking - where colleague innovation is not only valued, but expected. The Juniper Way is the commitment to all our colleagues that the culture and company inspire their best work-their life's work. At Juniper we believe this is more than a job - it's an opportunity to help change the world...

**INCLUSION AND DIVERSITY AT JUNIPER**


At Juniper Networks, we are committed to elevating talent by creating a trust-based environment where we can all thrive together. We know from experience that people from underrepresented groups often do not apply for roles they do not feel they meet all the criteria for. If you think you have what it takes, but do not necessarily check every single box, please consider applying. We’d love to speak with you.

title: Associate Sales Engineer South Europe - Netherlands based
description:
Job Description


At Juniper, we believe the network is the single greatest vehicle for knowledge, understanding, and human advancement the world has ever known.


To achieve real outcomes, we know that experience is the most important requirement for networking teams and the people they serve. Delivering an experience-first, AI-Native Network pivots on the creativity and commitment of our people. It requires a consistent and committed practice, something we call the Juniper Way.

**Join Juniper Networks and be part of the AI Revolution!**

  



Juniper Networks is revolutionizing the way the world connects. We're not just about building networks; we're about creating meaningful connections through the industry’s first AI-Native Networking Platform.



At the heart of this digital transformation, our Sales Engineers are the technical experts who help our customers unlock the full potential by leveraging solutions for Cloud, AI-Ops, operational simplicity, and service-assurance enabled architectures.



If you enjoy real-world application of knowledge to seek solutions to problems, Sales Engineering is an extraordinary place to be!

  



Are you willing to unleash your potential?

  


**About the Role:**



Our Associate Sales Engineering Program is your gateway to an exciting career in tech! Get hands-on experience, learn from some of the brightest minds in the industry, and start building the future—both for yourself and our customers.



As you grow with us, you’ll become the technical lead who works with our customers to understand their IT challenges and you will design solutions that make a real difference. Your passion for technology will excite our customers and deliver exceptional outcomes that they will love.

  


**Who We’re Looking For:**



If you’re a recent graduate eager to dive into the world of networking and explore innovative technologies like AI/ML, Automation, IoT, multi-cloud, and 5G, then Juniper’s Associate Sales Engineering Program is the perfect place for you!



This is more than just a job—it’s a launchpad for your career. You'll gain real-world experience, develop your skills, and have the opportunity to advance within the world’s leading AI-Native Networking company.

  


**What You’ll Do:**



Over the course of 12 months, you’ll build a strong foundation in networking concepts and hone your pre-sales skills by working across various areas of our Sales Engineering organization. Here’s a glimpse of what you’ll be doing:

  


* **Program Enhancements:** Help deploy best practices that shape our future.
* **Partner Inquiries:** Respond to technical questions from our partners and help them succeed.
* **Collaboration:** Team up on projects that deepen your product knowledge and expertise.
* **Customer Engagement:** Attend and assist with onsite presentations, solution demos, and more.
* **Technical Support:** Prepare responses to customer proposals and follow up on their questions.
* **Lab Work:** Develop proof-of-concept configurations and see your ideas in action.
* **Training & Workshops:** Lead sessions that empower others with your newfound knowledge.
* **Innovate:** Continuously learn and build solutions that truly meet customer needs.

  



By the end of the program, you’ll be ready to tackle pre-sales challenges with confidence and creativity. Juniper Sales operates in an agile, high-velocity capacity that sets and beats records almost daily; your unique abilities and ideas will help us to continue making a difference!

  


**Program Highlights:**


* **Kick-off:** Start in November 2024, with 12 weeks of foundational training.
* **Hands-On Labs:** Apply your learning through practical, real-world experiences.
* **TechSummit:** Engage with thought leaders and dive deeper into tech.
* **Guest Speakers:** Gain insights from industry experts.
* **Milestones:** Earn certifications as you progress through the program.
* **Sales Kick Off (SKO):** Be part of our major annual event.
* **Accelerated Career Growth:** Dive into a full-time role where learning and impact go hand in hand. Over the first 12 months, you’ll gain hands-on experience while continuously growing your skills.
* **Exciting Future Opportunities:** After the initial 12 months, you’ll be able to explore and pursue job openings within Juniper that align with your passions and strengths, allowing you to shape your own career path.

  


**Are You a Good Fit?**


* You’re passionate about learning new technologies and understanding how things work.
* Thriving in a fast-paced, dynamic environment excites you.
* You’re great at managing your time and adapting to changing priorities.
* You’re a team player who’s ready to learn and grow with your peers.

  


**Minimum Qualifications:**


* Recent bachelor’s or master’s degree in a relevant field like Engineering or Computer Science.
* Up to two years of experience as a Sales Engineer or Network practitioner.
* Strong communication skills—both written and spoken.
* **Fluency in Italian and English is required.**
* You must have the right to work in the Netherlands

  


**Preferred Qualifications:**


* Basic knowledge of computer networking solutions.
* Familiarity with cloud networking and OS virtualization is a plus.
* Experience with Python or other scripting languages is a bonus.

  


**Other Information:**


* English is the working language at Juniper.
* Relocation options are available.

  


**How to apply:**


**Interested candidates are required to submit a motivation letter (1 page) together with their CV, explaining why you want to participate in this program, your relevant skills and experiences, and how you believe this opportunity aligns with your personal and professional goals.**

**ABOUT JUNIPER NETWORKS**


Juniper Networks challenges the inherent complexity that comes with networking and security in the multicloud era. We do this with products, solutions and services that transform the way people connect, work and live. We simplify the process of transitioning to a secure and automated multicloud environment to enable secure, AI-driven networks that connect the world. Additional information can be found at Juniper Networks (www.juniper.net) or connect with Juniper on Twitter, LinkedIn and Facebook.

**WHERE WILL YOU DO YOUR BEST WORK?**


Wherever you are in the world, whether it's downtown Sunnyvale or London, Westford or Bangalore, Juniper is a place that was founded on disruptive thinking - where colleague innovation is not only valued, but expected. We believe that the great task of delivering a new network for the next decade is delivered through the creativity and commitment of our people. The Juniper Way is the commitment to all our colleagues that the culture and company inspire their best work-their life's work. At Juniper we believe this is more than a job - it's an opportunity to help change the world...

**INCLUSION AND DIVERSITY AT JUNIPER**


At Juniper Networks, we are committed to elevating talent by creating a trust-based environment where we can all thrive together. We know from experience that people from underrepresented groups often do not apply for roles they do not feel they meet all the criteria for. If you think you have what it takes, but do not necessarily check every single box, please consider applying. We’d love to speak with you.

**Additional Information for United States jobs:**

**ELIGIBILITY TO WORK AND E-VERIFY**


In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification form upon hire.


Juniper Networks participates in the E-Verify program. E-Verify is an Internet-based system operated by the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) in partnership with the Social Security Administration (SSA) that allows participating employers to electronically verify the employment eligibility of new hires and the validity of their Social Security Numbers.

title: Business Analyst
description:
We are looking for a proactive and talented Commerce Integration Business Analyst to spearhead our initiatives in optimizing business processes and integrating essential systems. In this role, you will identify opportunities for improvement, develop comprehensive integration plans, and ensure their successful execution. If you possess a strong analytical mindset and a proven history in business analysis, we encourage you to apply and contribute to taking our operations to the next level.


**About the role**
------------------


As a Commerce Integration Business Analyst you will engage with project stakeholders, whether customers or end users, to gather and specify their business needs. Your ability to understand and compile user requirements will be crucial for our development teams or suppliers when implementing standard solutions. You will act as a solution architect, delivering IT solution architectures that support various business solutions across Landal. Collaborating with key stakeholders, including the Information Architect, Data Officer, and Technical Architect, you will ensure alignment and coherence in our architecture.


Using your exceptional communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills, you will support the development or implementation process, ensuring that project deliverables meet specifications and exceed expectations.


**What you going to do**
------------------------

* Architecture and design of IT part for the business processes and related IT tools;
* Creates architecture designs and applying them in High Level Designs;
* Designs solutions based on agreed constraints;
* Applies relevant compliancy, privacy and security requirements;
* Supports realization and implementation of solutions;
* Source of information for all technical inquiries about the solution;
* Impact analysis of solution scenarios.

  


**Who you are**
---------------

* Excellent level of competence in solution design and requirements specification
* Explicit knowledge and experience in the Financial domain is a definite advantage.
* Experience with Agile ways of working is a definite advantage.
* Ability to prioritise effectively and achieve results.
* Capable of operating to tight schedules in a demanding environment with set deadlines and challenging plans.
* Good communication skilled both with IT- and non-IT colleagues
* Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Information Technology, Computer Science, or related field.
* Minimum of 5 years of experience as a Business Analyst, solution architect preferably in a holiday park operation or technology environment.


We leverage a variety of technologies and platforms to enhance our operations and integration capabilities:


* System integration projects, including API and middleware technologies.
* Commerce platforms (e.g., Magento, Sitecore), mobile app, CRM systems like SF, IAM, booking engine etc..
* RESTful APIs, SOAP, XML, JSON, and other integration protocols.
* Cloud-based integration platforms (e.g., MuleSoft or Dell Boomi.)

**This is what we offer**
-------------------------


Together, we strive to offer our guests and colleagues the best. If you join us, your contributions will be rewarded with:


* One-year contract with a one-month probation period, potential for permanent employment.
* Bonus scheme.
* 27 vacation days, with an option to purchase 10 extra days.
* Flexible working hours and remote work options.
* Home office allowance of €2.35 per telecommuting day.
* Travel expense reimbursement at €0.23 per kilometer, or full coverage for public transport.
* Extensive training opportunities, both online (150+ e-learnings) and offline.
* Enrollment in the Recreation Pension Fund, retirement age 67, with premium split equally.
* Paid additional maternity and parental leave.
* Various collective insurances, including complimentary continuous travel insurance for you and your family.
* Favorable employee booking discounts.
* A full-time position at Landal consists of a 38-hour workweek, equivalent to a 5-day workweek. If you have a part-time position, your salary and vacation days will be calculated on a pro-rata basis.


Starting in January 2025, your workplace will be our new office in Amsterdam Amstel. Until then, you will work from our offices in The Hague or Goes. Of course, remote work is possible, but it is desirable that you work in the office at least three days a week.

title: CRM Business Analyst - Activation
description:
Imagine revolutionizing the future of banking and Making Life Easy from the very first interaction. At bunq, we believe that everyone deserves a bank that's user-centric, transparent, and safe. We want our users to feel this from the moment they first use bunq.



As our CRM Business Analyst - Activation, you'll be at the forefront of this transformation. You'll delve into the signup and trial experiences, uncovering insights that will help us enhance those initial sparks of excitement.

  

Up for the challenge?



Kick off your application by taking our assessment and find out if bunq is your perfect match!  



  

**Take ownership**

  


As bunq's CRM Business Analyst - Activation, you'll have a data-driven eye on our smooth signup and onboarding process. This includes:

* Building dashboards to analyzes and improve our signup CRM campaigns.
* Tracking and improving our users' trial experience using dashboards and heatmaps.
* Creating and maintaining new mobile events with the help of the tech team to personalize CRM campaigns.
* You have strong knowledge in Data Analytics, user onboarding, CRM, and Marketing
* You know how to create or maintain mobile data events
* Affinity with analyzing user behavior and designing product and communication solutions to drive engagement
* You know your way around Mixpanel, Looker, Braze, Hotjar, Segment
* You have excellent communication skills in English

 **Your space to perform**



＄ Salary between €4,090 - €5,015 and the option to gain a quarterly bonus



 Great colleagues that share your mindset



‍ Working hybrid possibilities that only get better with time



 We support growth with bunq Academy and €1500 annual learning budget



 A massive discount with OneFit for your wellbeing



 Travel expenses are covered whether you come walking or by bike, bus or car (though we prefer green choices )



 A Macbook to keep with you while you're with us



 Fabulous in-house chefs cooking delicious lunches:moneybag:An optional pension plan with monthly contribution from bunq



 Monthly contribution to your phone and internet bills



 Friday drinks and other celebrations - bunq style

title: Analyst II - Information Security
description:
**Start your journey with BCD: Grow, connect, collaborate and celebrate with our global team**

 **Analyst II – Audit, Risk and Solutions, Information Security (Remote)**

*Full-time, United Kingdom, Finland, Poland, Spain, Norway, Sweden, Italy, Netherlands & Luxembourg*

  

The Security Analyst II – Solutions and Risk will provide guidance and oversight for compliance requirements, conduct internal audits, and research, understand, and communicate legal, regulatory, and contractual security requirements related to the BCD Travel M&E organization. The Analyst II will support and enforce security controls in alignment with the established Security policies, guidelines, and leading best practices. The Analyst II will also be aware of business needs and will work to maintain the presence of security controls throughout the BCD Travel operating environment.

  

The individual will possess good oral and written communication skills and can leverage skills and expertise within information security to develop and convey the appropriate message internal and external to BCD Travel.

 **As an Analyst II – Audit, Risk and Solutions, Information Security, you will**

* Use a teaching/education approach to help users understand their risks and better protect information and systems
* Evaluate and implement methods to continually improve security and assist the business with reducing risks
* Be familiar with the security requirements and controls needed to maintain the business operations
* Identify and communicate threats and vulnerabilities that could impact business operations
* Develop and communicate remediation plans capable of reducing risk to the organization
* Identify, classify, and respond to threats using industry-leading practices and following data classification
* Create, review, and maintain content for information security documentation (policies, procedures, standards, and guidelines)

 **About you**

* Bachelor’s Degree (B.A., B.S.) or equivalent combination of education and experience in Information Security, Computer Science, Management Information Systems, International Business, or related curriculum
* You have relevant general Information Technology experience
* Strong organizational, time management, decision-making, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills
* Security industry relevant certifications such as CISA, CIA, CISM, CISSP, HISP, PMP
* Experience with ISO 9001:2000 and ISO 27001:2005 requirements
* Aptitude to prioritize and load balance-sensitive projects concurrently

 **Get to know BCD M&E:**  

At BCD Meetings & Events (BCD M&E), we provide more than meeting and event planning and execution. We are in the business of creating impactful human connections that matter. Connections that inspire, motivate and change behavior for our customers. As the world's most trusted and innovative meetings and events agency, BCD M&E cultivates a culture of people, passion and purpose to drive business forward.

  

  

Headquartered in Chicago, with locations in 50+ countries across the world, BCD M&E's team of 1,500+ people are committed to driving success for our customers, our business and ourselves.

  

  

See if you belong at bcdme.com.

 **About us**  

We’re a market leader in travel management: We help people and companies travel smart and achieve more, and our clients include some of the world’s best-known and most innovative business and consumer brands. We operate in more than 100 countries, and the majority of our 10,000+ people work virtually (because a 10-second commute usually makes awesome sense). We’re committed to sustainability and to driving success for our customers, our business and ourselves. Learn more about BCD Travel.

 **Your life at BCD**


Working at BCD means connecting, collaborating and celebrating. You’ll be part of a virtual, dynamic and flexible work environment that fosters a good work-life balance so you can focus on what makes you happy. But don’t just take our word for it! Hear why people join BCD and more about the great perks of Life at BCD.

 **You’ll be offered**

* Flexible working hours and work-from-home or remote opportunities
* Opportunities to grow your skillset and career
* Generous vacation days so you can rest and recharge
* A compensation package that feels fair to you, including mental, physical, and financial wellbeing tools
* Travel industry professional perks and discounts
* Work From Anywhere program: you have the potential to work remotely in another country for up to 60 days per year!
* An inclusive work environment where diversity is celebrated

 **Ready to join the journey? Apply now!**  

*We’re dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace. If you’re excited about a role, but your experience doesn’t align perfectly, we encourage you to apply. You may be just the right candidate for this or other positions.*
