title: Market & Business Analyst
description:
**Organisation**

**Position**


Market & Business Analyst

**Vacancy ref**


83586

**Based in**


Zoetermeer

**Business area**


Renewables

**Contract type**


Staff

**Closing date**


20/09/2024


  
Vacancy information

**Market & Business Analyst**



We are **Seaway7**, a diverse group of team players, change makers and leaders in the delivery of offshore wind projects. What we do makes a difference to our planet and the future, by bringing sustainable, renewable energy to the world.



We are looking for a full-time **Market & Business Analyst** to join our **Commercial** **Department** in **Zoetermeer, The Netherlands**.



The **Market & Business Analyst** will report to the Market Analysis & Business Planning Manager, who is part of the Chief Commercial Officer’s department.



The **Market & Business Analyst** role is very diverse with significant exposure to senior management. The role amongst others includes the delivery of market and strategy analyses to support management decisions as well as the preparation of numerous reports and presentations. The role involves engagement with many global stakeholders with the commercial organization, including preparation of business-critical information for senior management.

  


**What you will be doing**


* Conduct market analyses to identify key market trends.
* Benchmark internal data with external market research and provide variation analyses.
* Develop supply/demand models and forecasts on the construction vessels market.
* Ensure that senior management and key stakeholders are fully informed about implications of research and monitoring models.
* Internally maintain the technical part of the CRM tool (Client 365) (including testing, proposing improvements, etc.) and monitor the CRM database with a focus on data quality and integrity.
* Track, investigate and register the financial and operational performance of peer competitors (competitor analysis).
* Track and register the financial and portfolio performance of clients (client analysis).
* Support senior management with relevant market and strategy presentations, including.
* Participate in the short-term and long-term strategic planning of Seaway7.
* Support Business Development and Tendering with relevant market, country and client presentations.
* Automate commercial reporting using Power BI and creating dashboards for management.
* Transfer current Power BI database to a new Power BI database due to IT development changes.
* Develop and ensure the delivery of the Annual Budget Plan and subsequent monthly forecast and reporting.
* Work closely with Finance and Project departments to ensure alignment on finance for forecasting

  


**What you will bring to the team**



It’s the commitment and enthusiasm of our people that gives us our energy to create change and make an impact for the future. And we want you to bring your personality, skills and experience, powering us to be leaders in offshore wind.


* A bachelor’s degree in Finance, Business Administration or Engineering combined with an enthusiasm for data management and a commercial business interest.
* 3-4 years working experience within a complex market environment.
* High proficiency in English language.
* Able to prepare high quality, engaging presentations and reports suitable for a senior audience review
* Highly developed social and communication proficiencies, enabling articulate interactions across the organization's hierarchy
* Able to seek and obtain information from diverse sources
* Experience with data management and commercial mindset
* Operating with the highest standard of integrity, preserving the confidentiality of the information available with the role
* Able to be responsive in an environment of continuous improvements
* Proficient user Microsoft Office tools (especially Microsoft Excel)
* Advanced user of data management and data visualization tools (PowerBI)
* Capable of progressing tasks autonomously with minimal supervision.
* Technical background or interests with exposure to maritime or offshore industry is preferred.


At times, there may be specific qualifications we’re looking for, but we also recognise the power of transferrable skills, so if you feel you have some of the relevant skills and experience we’re looking for, we want to hear from you.

  


**What we can offer you**



We offer the opportunity to create a future to be proud of, for generations to come. Whatever the role, wherever the location, everyone plays a part.



And when we say everyone, we mean everyone. Because we believe that it’s our team spirit that makes us special. Whether we’re getting stuck in, overcoming a challenge, or celebrating a success, we always do it together.



Alongside this, we’re continually creating the environment for you to be at your best – in and outside of work. This includes:


* **Career development** – access to a range of learning opportunities, as well as being part of a culture that encourages growth and development.
* **Flexible working** – everyone has commitments, responsibilities and passions outside of work. With a range of patterns available including hybrid, part-time or flexitime working, let’s discuss how we make time for what matters to you.
* **A holistic benefits package** – we pride ourselves in offering a wide range of benefits that support your financial, emotional, and physical wellbeing.

  


**The next steps**



If you would like to apply for this role, simply click the ‘Apply’ button found on this page.



You may be prompted to set up a profile with us. It’s quick and easy to do. Or, if you have already created a profile with us, simply log in and submit your application.



Once you have submitted your application, we will be in touch as soon as possible with next steps.



To find out more about Seaway7, please visit our website.



You can also follow us on our social channels, LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram and YouTube.



#LI-LM1

title: Financial Analyst
description:
About ViCentra



Worldwide, over 30 million people with diabetes are insulin dependent. This means they need insulin to manage their blood glucose levels. They can either give themselves multiple daily injections, or use an insulin pump, which administers insulin on a continuous basis around the clock.

  



At ViCentra, we’re on a mission to design an insulin pump that delivers not just a best-in-class performance, but also gives our users an experience that empowers and excites them. Something a bit different from the usual medical experience!

  



It’s simple really: people with diabetes are people – not patients.

  



Our philosophy is all about simplicity, helping to carry some of the weight of day-to-day diabetes management for the user, adding a splash of colour and a whole lot of freedom! Kaleido is one of the smallest insulin pumps in the world. We have 10 colour combinations, from bright and joyful to sleek and chic. We want our users to wear their Kaleido proudly. Its size makes Kaleido discreet and easy to wear, so Kaleidoers can forget about diabetes (for a while, at least!) and focus on what truly matters - living life on their own terms!

  



ViCentra was founded in 2013 in the Netherlands, and while we still call Utrecht our home, we’ve now branched out to France and Germany, too. We're gearing up to spread our magic even further, with concrete plans to extend across Europe in 2024. We are CE marked, with in-house development and manufacturing, a state-of-the-art HQ, and a diverse and energetic team hailing from over 30 countries worldwide! We’re backed by heavyweight investors like EQT, INKEF, and Invest-NL, all helping us to launch our rocket ship journey and forge a steady course.

  



We’d love you to travel with us.

  

We’re currently seeking a Financial Analyst to join our talented ViCentra family in Utrecht, The Netherlands. This is a fantastic opportunity to have a varied, interesting role and work within a dynamic, innovative culture; rapidly challenging and broadening your skills and developing your career.

  



The position



As a Financial Analyst at ViCentra, you will be an integral part of a small, dynamic finance team. You will play a crucial role in supporting the financial decision-making process by compiling, analysing and reporting clear, consistent and insightful financial and non-financial information to drive business performance across all business departments.



Your role will cover various responsibilities including business performance tracking, project cost control, budgetary control, FP&A including forecast and budget preparation, in addition to ad-hoc analysis including business cases and assisting with grant applications. In this position you will work hand in hand with department heads in promoting understanding of the financial business performance, ensuring budget compliance and agreeing action plans to manage financial risks and pursue opportunities.



In this position you will also become the recognized expert in all financial systems with regards to database logic. Data extraction and interrogation, and be an active promotor in driving standards of financial and non-financial data quality.

 *The ideal candidate to join our team should have*


* Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Accounting or a related field.
* A minimum of 3 years work experience as financial data analyst, management accounting or comparable role.
* Proven experience of cost accounting, management information reporting, analysis and preparation of budgets and financial projections.
* Experience and effectiveness in working, reporting and communicating in an international and multicultural environment to Senior Management level.
* Experience in a manufacturing, growth / scaling company.
* Exceptional attention to detail.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Affinity with ERP systems.
* Fluency in English, both written and spoken. Dutch language skills are an advantage.
* Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment.
* Strong IT skills, particularly in Microsoft Office (Word & Excel).
* A flexible working attitude and be someone who is willing to go the extra mile to contribute to great team work.
* A positive mindset, being able to think in opportunities rather than problems.
* Ability to focus not only on the day to day aspect, but also on process improvements.
* Pro-active approach with strong time-management skills.

  



What we offer



In addition to a varied and interesting role, you’ll be working in a small, friendly and highly motivated team with excellent career prospects. We are also offering:

  


* Meaningful work
* Autonomy in your work
* A very competitive salary
* 32 days holiday per year (pro rata) + 5 optional purchase days
* A healthy work life balance with flexible hours - 40 hours per week, 8 hours per day to be worked anytime between 7AM-7PM Monday to Friday
* Travel allowance
* Discount on gym membership
* International working environment (30+ nationalities)
* Informal dress code
* Free, on-site parking
* Social events and team lunches, including holiday parties and monthly after work drinks
* Creative office vibe with a picnic area and ping pong table
* A work environment where you can develop your skills, learn from the best and be rewarded for your imagination.

  



Apply today!

  

\*\*We will start interviewing successful candidates without delay, therefore please submit your CV as soon as possible. If we like what we see we will contact you, if we don’t contact you within 4 weeks we’ve probably proceeded with other candidates but don’t lose heart as we might reach out to you if we have a different role or project we think might be a match\*\*

  

If you've got any queries feel free to call +31 (0) 88 250 2900.

  

ViCentra is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age. Due to the international nature of the Company applications are only accepted in English and candidates must also have the right to work in the Netherlands.

  

Agencies: Please note ViCentra is committed to sourcing candidates directly and as such we do not accept speculative CV’s from agencies. We do however work with an approved list of preferred suppliers but in line with our Preferred Supplier List we only pay agency fees where we have a signed agreement in place and a position has formally been placed with the agency by a member of the HR team. We do not pay fees where speculative and unsolicited CV’s are submitted to ViCentra or ViCentra employees. Where this is not observed ViCentra reserves the right to contact these candidates directly and initiate discussions without payment of any agency fee.

title: Business Analyst -Credit Risk
description:
The COO Risk team is central to managing the Bank's complexity, translating intricate banking exposures into risk-weighted assets and provisions, all while adapting to evolving business goals and regulatory requirements. As part of the Credit Risk Modelling organization, we oversee the entire process from defining credit risk modeling approaches to post-production monitoring. This role offers a unique opportunity to join one of Europe’s leading banks in a key position that fosters collaboration, contribution, and growth. If you're driven to collaborate and deliver results, we’d love to connect with you!
  
  

Tasks
  
  

We are seeking a skilled Consultant to join our Default Remediation and Loss Given Default (LGD) data team. In this role, you will play a crucial part in ensuring the accuracy and completeness of default and LGD-related data for modeling purposes, from initial data capture through to final data delivery. Your responsibilities will be pivotal in aligning with the latest internal and external regulations.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

* Historical Data Analysis: Perform in-depth analysis of historical default data to enhance data quality for the wholesale banking portfolios, including Large Corporates, Commercial Property Finance, Project Finance, Lease, Trade Commodity Finance, and Object Finance.
* Data Collection and Enhancement: Collect, review, and enhance default and LGD data to ensure its completeness and accuracy for use in credit risk modeling.
* Process Development and Implementation: Assist management in developing and implementing new processes and working instructions to streamline data management and ensure compliance with regulatory requirements.
* KPI Tracking and Dashboarding: Take responsibility for tracking key performance indicators (KPIs) and creating dashboards to monitor the effectiveness of remediation processes.
* Support for Ad-Hoc Requests: Provide support to management in handling ad-hoc data requests and help coordinate the planning and backlog of ongoing remediation projects.
* Regulatory Coordination: Help manage and coordinate onsite inspections by regulators, ensuring that all default data and processes meet required standards.
* Cross-Team Collaboration: Work closely with colleagues within COO and the Wholesale Banking (WB) area, ensuring that remediated default data is accurate and complete for building WB credit risk models, including those for RWA, ECAP, and IFRS9.
* Stakeholder Interaction: Regularly interact with GCR account managers and Front Office teams involved with specific problem loans to ensure alignment and accuracy in data used for risk modeling.


Requirements
  
  

* Definition of Default Expertise: Strong working knowledge of new default policies, including forbearance, default indicators, and triggers.
* Transaction Reconciliation: Ability to accurately reconcile transactions (account statements and GL entries) at the facility level, identifying key transactions based on monthly outstanding differences.
* Wholesale Banking Knowledge: Basic understanding of wholesale banking lending products and familiarity with collateral processes, particularly in real estate finance and property validation.
* Process Understanding: In-depth knowledge of front office operations, as well as restructuring and recovery processes within wholesale banking.
* Project Management: Willingness to take on coordinative and project management tasks, ensuring the smooth execution of default data remediation projects.
* NPL Experience: Experience working with Non-Performing Loans (NPLs) and a strong affinity for risk data, particularly in relation to PD, LGD, and EAD models.
* Documentation Skills: Ability to read and interpret loan documentation, identifying terms and conditions related to default events in NPLs, and producing clear, evidence-based documentation.


This is a 6 months contract position for a senior consultant

title: HR Data Analyst (32-40h)
description:
Overview:

Job Description:

As an HR Data Analyst at Applied Medical, you'll be at the heart of our mission, using your data skills to make a real impact. This role is the perfect mix of diving deep into data analysis and creating dashboards that guide smart decisions. If you're detail-oriented, passionate about data, can transform data into insights, and committed to excellence, we want you on our team.  

You'll be key in helping us reach our goals by providing, analyzing, and presenting data to HR team, supporting informed decision-making. You'll collaborate with the HR team and other departments, working on initiatives, projects, setting KPIs, and sharing market trends. *You will be based at our European headquarter in Amersfoort (NL) and will report to the Manager Human Resources Business Partner.* **Responsibilities:**  

* Conduct ad-hoc queries for complex analysis and provide structured analytic data on a regular basis
* Report on KPIs, perform KPI analysis, and ensure organizational goals are met
* Develop and maintain data models to analyze trends in HR data
* Collect, analyze, and synthesize HR data from multiple sources to identify trends, patterns, and insights for reports
* Analyze and present market trends to identify potential issues and opportunities
* Ensure the accuracy and consistency of input data by conducting Data Cleansing and troubleshooting irregularities/ anomalies
* Perform root cause analysis and propose corrective/preventative actions
* Support data governance processes and conduct audit checks on HR data
* Maintain and prepare internal procedures, recommending various improvements to enhance efficiency
* Understand and comply with organizational rules, policies, standards, and national and local regulations


Requirements:
* Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field
* At least 4 years of relevant experience in a similar position
* Experience working in an international environment
* Proficiency in SAP, PowerBI, DAX or Power Query and other relevant reporting and data processing tools
* MS Office-based computer applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook)
* Excellent oral and written communication skills in English and another relevant European language


We Offer:
* An international working environment, fueled by respect and a healthy work-life balance tailored to the business and team member’s needs
* 27 paid vacation days (based on fulltime contract) with option to purchase five additional days
* Optional hybrid model, including home office equipment and a working from home allowance
* Commuting allowance of €0,23/km or an NS Business card subscription
* A wide variety of internal trainings and development possibilities and a tuition program for external trainings
* The opportunity to pro-actively work on your vitality and fitness
* State-of-the-art facilities, including green areas, in-house restaurant and gym
* Additional benefits, such as:
	+ Attractive pension scheme (your contribution at 4%, ours at 12%)
	+ €50 net monthly health insurance contribution
	+ Two (paid) days per year dedicated to volunteering activities
	+ Several fun company events and meaningful initiatives organized throughout the year
	+ A hybrid workplace, where you can work partially from home (except for operational vacancies)


At Applied Medical, we are committed to make a meaningful, positive difference, each and every day. Within our European headquarters in Amersfoort (NL), we develop, manufacture and support the implementation of our advanced medical devices across Europe and the MENA region. Applied’s team members enjoy working in an environmentally friendly and international environment, in which people of diverse backgrounds are valued, challenged, and acknowledged. We support our team members by giving them opportunities of ongoing learning and education, possibilities to take part in community volunteering activities and a variety of onsite exercise classes and health activities.  

If you are passionate about working in an organization that allows you to make decisions based upon what is right for the patient, customer, community and environment, Applied Medical is the place for you. **Interested?**  

Would you like to be part of our expanding team? If the answer is yes, we'd love to get to know you and look forward to hearing from you!
For more information regarding our hiring process, click here. If you have any questions, feel free to contact us via recruitment-eu@appliedmedical.com  

Not the right job for you? Take a look at our other vacancies and follow us on LinkedIn.  

Applied Medical in Europe from Applied Medical on Vimeo.

title: Lab Analyst I
description:
Laboratory Analyst - Netherlands
ICON plc is a world-leading healthcare intelligence and clinical research organization. We’re proud to foster an inclusive environment driving innovation and excellence, and we welcome you to join us on our mission to shape the future of clinical development
Job Title: Laboratory Analyst
Location: Assen, Netherland
At ICON, it’s our people that set us apart. Our diverse teams enable us to become a better partner to our customers and help us to fulfil our mission to advance and improve patients’ lives.
Our ‘Own It’ culture is driven by four key values that bring us together as individuals and set us apart as an organisation: Accountability & Delivery, Collaboration, Partnership and Integrity. We want to be the Clinical Research Organisation that delivers excellence to our clients and to patients at every touchpoint. In short, to be the partner of choice in drug development.
That’s our vision. We’re driven by it. And we need talented people who share it.
If you’re as driven as we are, join us. You’ll be working in a dynamic and supportive environment, with some of the brightest and the friendliest people in the sector, and you’ll be helping shape an industry.
We have an incredible opportunity for a Lab Analyst to join the team in Assen, Netherlands.
The Role:* Routine sample processing with different techniques.
* Interpreting and data processing/reporting results and approve or reject sample analysis.
* Identifying deviations and performing investigation under supervision of a lab analyst level 3 or higher.
* Performs (peer) data review for quality control.
* Has a thorough understanding and complies with GxP and other appropriate regulations.
* Identifies and reports irregularities identified with any aspects of work.
* Economically utilizes materials in operation of daily tasks.
* Ensures on-time task completion to support the overall goal of on-time study completion.
* Assists in the organization and housekeeping of the laboratory Training lab analyst level 1 (before a level 1 lab analyst can train, the lab analyst needs to have minimum 1 year of experience).
* In study planning (daily basis).
* Understands the scientific principles behind analysis methods utilized.
* Familiar with the technique: ELISA or Flow Cytometry


What you will need:* Knowledgeable of Bioanalytical or clinical laboratory processes.
* Very detail oriented and performs few mistakes even when performing routine or repetitive tasks.
* Applies process and systems to routine.
* Uses existing techniques to prepare samples for instrument analysis.
* Performs specific and routine sample analysis.
* Solves routine issues. May seek assistance to resolve more complex and difficult issues.
* Erroneous decisions or failure to achieve results will cause reprocessing of samples potentially leading to missed milestones, study failure and subject safety (in case of clinical chemistry lab).


#LI-JS2
Benefits of Working in ICON:
Our success depends on the quality of our people. That’s why we’ve made it a priority to build a culture that rewards high performance and nurtures talent.
We offer very competitive salary packages. And to keep them competitive, we regularly benchmark them against our competitors. Our annual bonuses reflect delivery of performance goals – both ours and yours.
We also provide a range of health-related benefits to employees and their families and offer competitive retirement plans – and related benefits such as life assurance – so you can save and plan with confidence for the years ahead.
But beyond the competitive salaries and comprehensive benefits, you’ll benefit from an environment where you are encouraged to fulfil your sense of purpose and drive lasting change.
ICON is an equal opportunity and inclusive employer and is committed to providing a workplace free of discrimination and harassment. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.
If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application process, or in order to perform the essential functions of a position, please let us know through the form below.
What ICON can offer you:
Our success depends on the quality of our people. That’s why we’ve made it a priority to build a diverse culture that rewards high performance and nurtures talent.
In addition to your competitive salary, ICON offers a range of additional benefits. Our benefits are designed to be competitive within each country and are focused on well-being and work life balance opportunities for you and your family.
Our benefits examples include:* Various annual leave entitlements
* A range of health insurance offerings to suit you and your family’s needs.
* Competitive retirement planning offerings to maximize savings and plan with confidence for the years ahead.
* Global Employee Assistance Programme, TELUS Health, offering 24-hour access to a global network of over 80,000 independent specialised professionals who are there to support you and your family’s well-being.
* Life assurance
* Flexible country-specific optional benefits, including childcare vouchers, bike purchase schemes, discounted gym memberships, subsidised travel passes, health assessments, among others.

Visit our careers site to read more about the benefits ICON offers.
ICON, including subsidiaries, is an equal opportunity and inclusive employer and is committed to providing a workplace free of discrimination and harassment. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.
If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application process, or in order to perform the essential functions of a position, please let us know or submit a request here.
Interested in the role, but unsure if you meet all of the requirements? We would encourage you to apply regardless – there’s every chance you’re exactly what we’re looking for here at ICON whether it is for this or other roles.

title: Analyst, Finance EMEA
description:
Become a Part of the NIKE, Inc. Team  

  

NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world's best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At NIKE, Inc. it's about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game.  

  

Today, the opportunities for growth across NIKE, Inc.'s business portfolio offer more potential than ever. Nike Finance employees play a key role in that progress by identifying and capitalizing on opportunities to drive value for every Nike shareholder. They manage accounting and reporting for Nike's multi-billion-dollar global investment portfolio, debt and equity instruments, and other Treasury activities. They strategize, forecast, audit, analyze, budget, research and lead important decisions. Across Nike's diverse geographies and businesses, Finance employees deliver far more than just the numbers.  

  

Become a Part of the NIKE, Inc. Team  

  

NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world's best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and build. Its culture thrives by accepting diversity and exciting creativity. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and dreamers. At Nike, it's about each person bringing skills and passion to an exciting and constantly evolving game!  

  

Today, the opportunities for growth across Nike's business portfolio offer more potential than ever. Nike Finance plays a leadership role in these opportunities by providing expertise and insight to drive near-term profitability, strategic investment for long-term growth, and risk management in an evolving macroeconomic environment. We plan, account, and report for Nike's multi-billion-dollar portfolio businesses across diverse categories and geographies, while handling the company's investment portfolio. Our people and culture distinguish us as a best-in-class finance team that lives its interpersonal mission: to drive and deliver value to every Nike shareholder.  

  

WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR  

  

As our EMEA NDDC Finance Analyst, you will partner with the EMEA NDDC business team, bringing to bear their functional expertise to identify and complete opportunities for delivering increasingly more profitable growth in the EMEA NDDC business. You will also be a strategic thought partner in evaluating financial returns of the EMEA NDDC business.  

  

Being a key business partner on a cross-functional team, you will provide insights that drive actions and impact the business. You will need to demonstrate strong digital discernment, a team attitude, a can-do mentality, a strong analytical skills, and the ability to take analytical insights and translate these into clear and simple action items and recommendations.  

  

WHAT YOU WILL WORK ON
  

* Giving to the strategic direction of our Digital business by actively interpreting and reviewing financial results and providing informative analysis to continuously improve business performance
* Supporting financial planning and analysis, budgeting, and forecasting for the Digital business to generate plans that incorporate strategic business plan objectives and appropriate assumptions
* Supporting in the continuous development of business reports and reporting processes to ensure we are reporting and analyzing relevant KPIs
* Driving continuous improvement of our processes and systems allowing us to gain a better understanding of our actual performance and drive efficiency
* Performing profitability and investment analysis on short- and long-term business opportunities that aid in the decision-making process and help improve profitability

  

WHO YOU WILL WORK WITH  

  

The role reports into the Director, Finance Digital Commerce EMEA, and will work directly with the Digital Commerce Business team and EMEA FP&A Finance teams.  

  

WHAT YOU BRING
  

* 4+ years directly meaningful work experience; a confirmed expertise in financial planning and analysis in an international environment, with a passion for Nike and Digital. Knowledge of Accounting and US GAAP is a plus
* Ability to deliver results against tight and sophisticated timelines, navigate large amounts of information and "connect the dots" from various data sources and collaborators
* Strong communication skills, ability to communicate sophisticated concepts and ideas in a simple way and influence collaborators across the organization
* Strong analytical skills and strategic attitude
* Team player attitude, proven positive energy, confidence, integrity, and passion for the Brand
* Excellent command of English, both written and spoken

SAP/Tableau knowledge is strongly preferred  
* 

  

  

PLEASE NOTE, RELOCATION IS NOT OFFERED FOR THIS POSITION  

  

NIKE, Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Nike offers a generous total rewards package, a casual work environment, a diverse and inclusive culture, and an electric atmosphere for professional development. No matter the location, or the role, every Nike employee shares one galvanizing mission: To bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete\* in the world!  

  

NIKE, Inc. is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability.  

  

NIKE, Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Nike offers a generous total rewards package, casual work environment, a diverse and inclusive culture, and an electric atmosphere for professional development. No matter the location, or the role, every Nike employee shares one galvanizing mission: To bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete\* in the world.  

  

NIKE, Inc. is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability.  

  

**Benefits**  

  

Whether it's transportation or financial health, we continually invest in our employees to help them achieve greatness - inside and outside of work. All who work here should be able to realize their full potential.

title: Senior Data Engineer Data Factory
description:
**Nice to know (you)**
----------------------

* As a Senior Data Engineer at Schiphol, you see the direct impact of your work. You develop solutions for real-time challenges, such as optimizing wait times and dynamically routing passengers, enhancing the overall airport experience.
* The Central Data Factory team is known for its strong collaboration with various departments. We create robust data pipelines that ensure data integrity and safety, contributing to a data-driven culture within Schiphol.
* With 3,000 proud colleagues, we work toward our mission: "the world's most sustainable and high quality airports.

**Connecting your world**
-------------------------


As a Data Engineer, you will help us build a production grade cloud environment. In this role, you will closely work together with our Core Data Platform team, various (internal) business stakeholders and multiple data providers. How you achieve results in this? That’s up to you. We trust in the way you can distinguish between main and secondary issues and make connections. You put your talents to work at:


* Identifying the integration requirements of several data sources.
* Designing, implementing, and testing cloud based (Azure) data intensive applications,
* Collaborating with Lead Engineers, Data Architects & Enterprise Architects for technical solutions,
* Helping team members with technical questions, and
* Coaching junior team members.

  

  

The Central Data Factory team is a team of data engineers within Data, AI & Analytics (DnA), whose primary purpose is to establish robust data pipelines for retrieving data from internal and external sources, and eventually send it to the Core Data Platform. The team works closely with different departments within Schiphol, some of them are AI, BI, IoT, Data Governance and some more.


**You've got this**
-------------------


Schiphol connects your world. With the best people, we make travel safe and responsible. You contribute to this with with your unique talents, such as taking the initiative to make improvements. Also, you are the talent who approaches problems as a challenge and finds a good solution for them at lightning speed. In addition, for this position you have:

* 5+ years experience with data-driven solutions, including production data-pipeline deployment and management.
* Strong Scala, Java, or Kotlin skills (2+ years hands-on experience preferred).
* Experience with message brokers (e.g., Kafka, Azure EventHub).
* Proficiency in data processing frameworks (e.g., Spark, Flink, Beam) for batch and streaming pipelines.
* Understanding of logging and monitoring importance (preferably Splunk, OpenTelemetry).
* 1+ year experience with cloud platforms (preferably Microsoft Azure).
* Familiarity with DevOps technologies (e.g., Kubernetes, Docker, Helm).


**You get this**
----------------

* € 5173 to € 7176 gross per month (Schaal 13).
* A 13th month (year-end bonus).
* The possibility to work 4 x 9 hours in a 36-hour work week.
* An NS Business Card that fully reimburses travel by public transportation to and from work.

  

  

These are just some of our terms of employment that come with this position (based on a 36-hour work week). Schiphol Group has even more to offer you. For the complete overview of all terms and conditions of employment, please visit Conditions - Werken bij Schiphol Group.


**About the Team**
------------------


The IT & Data department is creating the airport of the future. We do this using the smartest digital solutions, tools and applications. With state-of-the-art technology, we keep the airport running. Our enthusiastic team works on data-driven improvements in our processes, traveller flows and information provision. This is how we contribute to the best possible experience for travellers, customers and employees at and around the airport.


**Choose your destination**
---------------------------


What are your talents? What dreams do you have? What is your story? We are curious about you and invite you to apply. You can apply by sharing your motivation and resume with us via the application button below.


* Do you have questions about the application process? Contact Erwin Schuur, Recruitment Business Partner, by sending a message to erwin.schuur@schiphol.nl or by calling.
* For more information about applying at Schiphol Group: Job application process - Werken bij Schiphol Group.
* For the safety of our passengers and colleagues, a security screening (Certificate of Conduct) is always part of the recruitment process.

**About Schiphol Group**
------------------------


With 3,000 proud colleagues, we go the extra mile to connect the Netherlands with the rest of the world in the best possible way. Innovation, safety and cooperation are at the forefront. Together we give more meaning to travel and contribute to the economy and society. For more than 100 years. In the Netherlands and beyond. By the way, did you know that:


... Schiphol Group owns and operates Amsterdam Airport Schiphol, Rotterdam The Hague Airport and Lelystad Airport? We also have a majority stake in Eindhoven Airport.  

… there were a total of 61.7 million travellers from and to Schiphol Airport in 2023?  

... as a Senior Data Engineer will be joining the business area Data, AI & Analytics (DnA)?

title: Anaplan Model Builder
description:
**Engineering*** **Rotterdam**
* **Senior**
* **HBO**
* **Engineering**
**Highlights**
--------------


Een bruto maandsalaris tussen € 4478,- en € 7142,- afhankelijk van inschaling & werkervaring* nemen aan het nieuwe werken
* Een toeslag van 10,5% van je bruto maandsalaris
  

#REF360S
**Do you want to work within the biggest Anaplan Center of Excellence within the Netherlands? This is the opportunity to be part of this team!**

**Jouw rol als Anaplan Model Builder**
--------------------------------------


*Do you want to work within the biggest Anaplan Center of Excellence within the Netherlands?*

**What will be your biggest impact in this position?**


As a model builder you have contact with the business to properly understand their requirements and use cases so that the model complies with their expectations and processes. And also to spot opportunities to improve their processes.


You are also up-to-date on Anaplan platform developments and think of applications where these developments can be applied at KPN.


With the team you’re working on models which are built in a consistent way so that other developers can pick up models built by other developers.

**What are you going to do?**


Within KPN financial, commercial and operational insights, together with a reliable forecast, are of great importance for the management of the company at group and segment level. We are currently modernizing this process with the implementation of our models on the Anaplan platform. For this transition and further (new) developments, we are looking for a model builder to strengthen our team.


Together with a team of model builders, you ensure that existing forecast and planning models of the business (mainly in Excel) are translated to Anaplan models and you contribute to improving these models, from a technical, process and way-of-working perspective. The models are on an operational, tactical, and strategical level. You will work closely together with the stakeholders and your other Finance Insights & Analytics (FIA) colleagues.


So, do you want to make impact with the team within KPN with (financial) forecasting?
**Dit is je team**
------------------


Within Finance Insights & Analytics you work together with approximately 40 developers, data scientists, data engineers, scrum masters and product owners spread over 5 scrum teams. Those 5 teams are, besides the forecasting team, the Finance analytics, Data, Oracle reporting and Managed dashboarding team.


The forecasting team consists of a product owner, scrum master and 6 model builders. The team is international, diverse and daily language is English. You will be part of a warm and professional team where hard working and fun is combined.


Our main office is in Rotterdam next to the iconic Erasmus bridge. We work hybrid with a minimum of 2 days a week at the office, Mondays in Rotterdam and Thursday in Amsterdam.You’re also able to work from other KPN offices and working from home is also supported.
**Wat breng**
**jij ons?**
--------------------------


For the position of model builder within Finance Insights & Analytics we ask from you:

* Bachelor or master level degree in a relevant field of study
* Experience with building (financial) forecasting models in Anaplan, or similar applications
* Knowledge of and affinity with financial processes in a corporate environment
* The ability to analyze (financial) processes and translate them into model features
* The ability to challenge your stakeholders and team members in looking for the best solutions
* You are able to explain your solution in layman's terms
* Knowledge of data models


**Wat krijg je**
**van ons?**
-----------------------------


Of course, as an employer, we also have a lot to offer you. Here’s what you can expect from us:

* A gross monthly salary ranging from a minimum of €4.478,- to a maximum of € 6.734,- based on a 37-hour work week, offcourse depending on your work experience,
* Flexible working hours up to 40 hours per week, potentially increasing your gross salary by up to 8.5%.
* A 10.5% allowance on your gross monthly salary (including 8% holiday pay).
* A variable bonus scheme of 7% corresponding to scale 11.
* Annual individual and collective salary increases in accordance with our CAO.
* Excellent career development and training opportunities, with a personal training budget of €1500. In fact, we expect you to keep developing yourself!
* A good work-life balance (e.g., 2 days at the office, 3 days at home, transition leave, holiday exchange for a holiday of your religious or cultural preference).
* A home work shop to optimize your home working environment, including a mobile phone and laptop.
* 50% discount on KPN products and services, such as KPN internet.
* A commuting allowance: such as our bicycle allowance of €0.40 per kilometer, or €0.23 per kilometer by car, or full reimbursement for 2nd class public transport. Additionally, you will receive a €10 monthly internet allowance and a home work allowance of €2.35 per day.
* Excellent pension conditions: a total contribution of 23% of your pensionable salary, with KPN contributing 16% and you contributing 7%.


Our belief in technology is strong. It becomes even more powerful when combined with human contact, which is why we look forward to meeting you!


Want to know more? Contact our recruiter Rutger Schröder via rutger.schroder@kpn.com.


At KPN, we have recruitment talent that works smartly together and thus wins. Therefore, acquisition in response to this vacancy is not appreciated.
**Wat gebeurt er**
**na je sollicitatie?**
------------------------------------------


**01**
**Telefonisch contact**
-----------------------


Onze recruiters leren je graag beter kennen en nemen daarom telefonisch contact met je op!
**02**
**Gesprekken**
--------------


Zijn we van beide kanten enthousiast? Dan plannen we een eerste, tweede en eventueel een derde gesprek en/of assesment in.
**03**
**Wij doen jou een aanbod**
---------------------------


Als alle gesprekken goed zijn gegaan, doen we je een aanbod. Een screening kan onderdeel zijn van dit proces.
**04**
**Welkom in het team**
----------------------


Als je blij bent met het aanbod en je het contract hebt getekend, begint jouw onboarding. Welkom bij KPN!
**Zie je een groene toekomst al voor je? Reageer!**

title: Sr. IT Infrastructure Engineer
description:
**What We Do****Managing cyber risk, together.**
Forescout delivers automated cybersecurity across the digital terrain. We empower our customers to achieve continuous alignment of their security frameworks with their digital realities, across all asset types – IT, IoT, OT, and IoMT. It is a non-stop journey, managing cyber risk through automation and data-powered insights.
**Job Summary:**
We are currently seeking an experienced and highly skilled Sr. IT Infrastructure Engineer to join our team and play a crucial role in managing our global IT infrastructure.
As a Sr. IT Infrastructure Engineer, you will be responsible for building, automating, and maintaining a scalable and highly available infrastructure. You will work closely with engineering teams to develop, deploy, and maintain our network and technology stack. This role requires a strategic thinker with excellent communication skills, a strong service ethic, and a passion for technology. You will lead projects focused on designing, implementing, and maintaining our global IT Infrastructure.
**Key Responsibilities:*** **Infrastructure Management:**
+ Maintain and support the corporate IT infrastructure across all sites and regions.
+ Ensure system environments are maintained in line with corporate security policies.
+ Manage and monitor the virtual infrastructure, including VMware, virtual servers, and storage systems.
+ Schedule and deploy system and network installations, updates, and upgrades globally.

* **Performance Monitoring and Troubleshooting:**
+ Monitor network performance and automate monitoring functions to prevent outages.
+ Troubleshoot and resolve network and system problems, providing Level 2/3 support as needed.
+ Utilize network diagnostic and analytics tools to identify and address issues.

* **Collaboration and Communication:**
+ Work closely with engineering teams to report issues, lead project deliverables, and provide status updates.
+ Partner with local DevOps teams to ensure seamless integration and support of IT infrastructure.
+ Adhere to corporate configuration and change management policies to ensure successful changes to the network infrastructure.


We encourage you to apply if you meet most but not all the desired skills and experience listed in this job posting. We value competencies, aptitude, and a great attitude as supplement to experience.**Qualifications:*** Minimum of 7 years’ experience in systems
* At least 5 years’ experience in server administration and configuration.
* Hands-on experience with VMware infrastructure and Linux systems admin required.
* Experience with Ansible automation.
* Experience with enterprise backup and storage solutions is advantageous.
* Proficiency with monitoring, network diagnostic, and analytics tools is a plus.
* Experience managing hybrid environments (cloud/on-premises) is an advantage.
* Proven experience deploying and supporting effective patch management solutions.
* Willingness to perform after-hours and weekend work when necessary.

**Skills and Attributes:*** Excellent problem-solving skills with a strong customer service attitude.
* Fast learner, proactive, and able to work independently as well as part of a team.
* Organized, responsible, and able to manage multiple priorities effectively.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, capable of influencing and driving results.

#LI-AO1

title: Postdoc In Information Systems in the Built Environment
description:
**Job description**
-------------------


The Department of the Built Environment invites applications for a dynamic Postdoctoral position within the Information Systems in the Built Environment group. This role centers on pioneering Multi-Ontology AI-based Facility Digital Twins, integrating cutting-edge AI techniques—including machine learning, reinforcement learning, and transfer learning—into research and educational frameworks.


**Key Responsibilities:**


* Conduct ontological research focusing on spatial dynamics, inter-process interactions (e.g., shared resources and power consumption), and human operator behaviors.
* Enhance and transform Industry 5.0 initiatives by prioritizing worker engagement, perception, and accessibility, recognizing the critical role of the human element in technological advancements.
* Prepare the methods and tools developed for manufacturing environments in this ontological research for subsequent application to urban scales.
* Apply the developed technologies and systems to both existing and new building stocks to enhance resilience and sustainability in response to climate action demands.


**Impact:**


* Your contributions will directly support climate action initiatives by utilizing the information systems and technologies developed in this research to address challenges within the built environment at various scales, with an emphasis on sustainability and environmental impact.


You will be an integral part of a vibrant research group dedicated to pushing the boundaries of information systems in the built environment. This position is designed to appeal to a broad range of applicants, ensuring a balanced focus on both technical and social dimensions of the role.


**Job requirements**
--------------------

* Motivated researcher with a PhD in Architecture, Urban Planning, Computer Science, Information Systems, Environmental Science, or a comparable domain.
* Ability to conduct high-quality academic research, reflected in demonstrable outputs.
* Proven experience with human-centric data, urban big data, and complex data visualization systems.
* Demonstrated research expertise in AI techniques (ML, transfer learning, Natural Language Processing, large language models) applied to climate change actions and the built environment.
* Experience in utilizing ontological frameworks to structure and analyze human-centric data, including conceptual structuring, entity and relationship modeling, and integration with information systems in the built environment.
* Experience in performative design and planning initiatives, along with stakeholder collaboration for informed decision-making processes.
* Experience in large-scale participation, e-participation, and digital governance to collect data and support informed decision-making.
* UI/UX experience is appreciated for developing tools to support decision-making.
* Strong interdisciplinary collaboration skills and the ability to work effectively within diverse research teams.
* Excellent teamwork skills, with a passion for coaching PhD and Master's students and working in a dynamic, interdisciplinary environment.
* Demonstrated ability to manage complex projects to successful completion on schedule.
* Excellent proficiency in English (written and verbal), with strong communication and leadership skills.

**Conditions of employment**
----------------------------


A meaningful job in a dynamic and ambitious university, in an interdisciplinary setting and within an international network. You will work on a beautiful, green campus within walking distance of the central train station. In addition, we offer you:


* Full-time employment for 6 months.
* Salary in accordance with the *Collective Labour Agreement* for Dutch Universities, scale 10 (min. €4,020 max. €5,278).
* A year-end bonus of 8.3% and annual vacation pay of 8%.
* High-quality training programs on general skills, didactics and topics related to research and valorization.
* An excellent technical infrastructure, on-campus children's day care and sports facilities.
* Partially paid parental leave and an allowance for commuting, working from home and internet costs.
* A TU/e Postdoc Association that helps you to build a stronger and broader academic and personal network, and offers tailored support, training and workshops.
* A Staff Immigration Team is available for international candidates, as are a tax compensation scheme (the 30% facility) and a compensation for moving expenses.

**Information and application**
-------------------------------

**About us**

Eindhoven University of Technology is an internationally top-ranking university in the Netherlands that combines scientific curiosity with a hands-on attitude. Our spirit of collaboration translates into an open culture and a top-five position in collaborating with advanced industries. Fundamental knowledge enables us to design solutions for the highly complex problems of today and tomorrow.  

  

**Information**

Do you recognize yourself in this profile and would you like to know more?  

Please contact the hiring manager Bige Tunçer, Professor, b.tuncer@tue.nl.


Visit our website for more information about the application process or the conditions of employment. You can also contact Kevin Caris, Hr advisor, k.t.caris@tue.nl.


Are you inspired and would like to know more about working at TU/e? Please visit our career page.


**Application**


We invite you to submit a complete application using the apply-button.  

The application should include a:


* A cover letter, which explains why you believe you are a good fit for this position.
* A detailed curriculum vitae, which includes a list of three persons (name, affiliation, and contact information) who are willing to provide letters of reference.
* List of three self-selected ‘best publications’.


We look forward to receiving your application and will screen it as soon as possible. The vacancy will remain open until the position is filled.

title: Supply Chain Stores Ops Specialist
description:
Become a Part of the NIKE, Inc. Team  

  

NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world's best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At NIKE, Inc. it's about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game.  

  

The NIKE, Inc. Supply Chain team is the engine that propels product around the world. Supply Chain experts ensure that every year, almost a billion units of footwear, apparel and equipment arrive at the right place, at the right time. To ensure this complex job goes off without a hitch, Supply Chain teams work with a network of more than 50 distribution centers, thousands of accounts, and more than 100,000 retail stores worldwide - making the impossible happen every single day.  

  

WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR
  

  

As our Supply Chain Ops Specialist for our Nike Direct Stores, you always start with the consumer in mind. You will drive operational excellence to serve our Nike Direct Stores Athletes and Consumers through transactional and executional activities across relevant Nike systems, tools and reports to meet financial and operational targets while delivering on Nike's strategy. You utilize operational knowledge, analytical and critical thinking skills to deliver on all pillars of the Consumer Promise (Service, Convenience, Sustainability and Profitability). You bring subject matter expertise on End-to-end Stores supply chain flow and ability to simplify complex information and communicate effectively to leaders and stakeholders across Supply Chain and Nike Direct Stores team. You keep your stores, business partners and stakeholders informed and engaged of risks and opportunities, and you actively partner with your stores and other operational functions, to find optimal supply chain and commercial solutions.  

  

WHAT YOU WILL WORK ON
  

  

You will be responsible for ensuring accurate and timely product flow towards our Nike Direct Stores, by collaborating with Planning, Distribution, Transportation, and directly with our Store/partner teams. You cultivate strong partnerships with external and internal stakeholders to deliver excellent customer service aligned with Nike's strategic vision. You will be a Marketplace Supply Chain (MSC) representative within the Stores cross-functional team and lead and influence peers to maintain a balanced marketplace and effective inventory management. Your responsibilities include performing KPI root cause analysis, contributing to performance updates, providing expertise in scenario planning, and driving continuous process improvement through innovation and transformational initiatives.  

  

WHO YOU WILL WORK WITH
  

  

You will work in a cross-functional agile environment that spans across EMEA and services the Nike Direct Stores MSC needs. While being part of the MSC Stores team, reporting into MSC Supply Chain Stores Manager, you will partner closely with Allocation, Sales, Merchandising, Planning and Finance. Besides, you will daily connect with your stores, partners, carrier network and Nike's logistical functions.  

  

WHAT YOU BRING
  

* Supply Chain and/or Retail Experience: Demonstrated relevant and solid experience within Supply Chain and/or Retail related functions, with a consumer-centric mindset. Wide and deep understanding of Supply Chain Management and general retail business knowledge.
* Stakeholder management: established experience in developing excellent working relationships with key partners, bringing the right people together and facilitating leadership decisions.
* Process Improvement: Innovative mentality and proven track record in leading and delivering process improvement for the organization.
* Analytical skills: strong experience in KPI management, root cause analysis and scenario planning with the ability to translate complex data sets into business insights through visualization (e.g., graphs, tables). Having advanced skills in MS Office (e.g., Excel) and reporting tools (Cognos, Tableau) and ERP Systems (SAP) is preferred.
* Communication skills: Strong written and verbal communicator, ability to translate complex supply chain issues into concise insights, sharing information with and influencing senior stakeholder, bringing recommendations and facilitating decision making.
* Vision & Leadership: Self-starter, with an ambition to drive change, and ability to clearly communicate and influence various levels within a matrix structure and multinational teams.

  

NIKE, Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Nike offers a generous total rewards package, casual work environment, a diverse and inclusive culture, and an electric atmosphere for professional development. No matter the location, or the role, every Nike employee shares one galvanizing mission: To bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete\* in the world.  

  

NIKE, Inc. is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability.  

  

**Benefits**  

  

Whether it's transportation or financial health, we continually invest in our employees to help them achieve greatness - inside and outside of work. All who work here should be able to realize their full potential.

title: Test Engineer
description:
Test Engineer

  

**Date:** Sep 3, 2024


**Location:** Netherlands - ’s-Hertogenbosch


**Company:** Super Micro Computer


**Job Req ID: 25233**
**About Supermicro:**

Supermicro® is a Top Tier provider of advanced server, storage, and networking solutions for Data Center, Cloud Computing, Enterprise IT, Hadoop/ Big Data, Hyperscale, HPC and IoT/Embedded customers worldwide. We are amongst the fastest growing company among the Silicon Valley Top 50 technology firms. Our unprecedented global expansion has provided us with the opportunity to offer many new positions to the technology community. We seek talented, passionate, and committed engineers, technologists, and business leaders to join us to drive accelerated growth and technology-led innovation in the global marketplace.
**Job Summary:**

As a global leader in server technologies, Supermicro has been growing extremely fast in many key markets such as Cloud Computing, Big Data, HPC, AI and Storage, etc. To meet the market demand, Supermicro is developing end to end enterprise IT solutions with compute, storage, networking all integrated into full rack or multi-rack level systems. Test Engineer plays an important role in testing and deploying rack system solutions for data center and enterprise customers.
**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**
* Preform the server level and cluster level tests, write the failure reports for testing.
* Maintain the lab networks, clusters, VPN and other devices deployed in the lab.
* Able to work with other engineers to resolve issues for hardware.
* Implement active lab policies, support ISO compliance and inventory control.
* Able to configure switches and routers and install new programs for customers.
* Maintain the hardware inventory, provide the inventory report monthly.
**Qualifications:**
* Strong Linux and windows operating system experience,
* Strong skills in writing failure reports for server/cluster level tests.
* Experience with lab or production hardware, network setups, and switch configuration.
* Experience with inventory control and asset management are a plus.
* Familiar with TCP/IP protocol stack, DHCP, NFS and other application level protocols are a plus.
* Familiar with server test tools, lab management software, and scalable storage are a plus.
* Familiar with visualization technology and cloud computing are a plus.
* Cisco CCNA, AWS or GCP certificates are a plus.
* Positive attitude, desire to learn, time management, and strong interpersonal skills are a plus.
* BA/BS degree plus 2+ years in related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
**EEO Statement**

Supermicro is an Equal Opportunity Employer and embraces diversity in our employee population. It is the policy of Supermicro to provide equal opportunity to all qualified applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status or special disabled veteran, marital status, pregnancy, genetic information, or any other legally protected status.
