title: IoT Software Engineer
description:
**Opportunity/Job Purpose:**

The IOT Software Engineer has a crucial role in design, development, maintenance, and support of an IoT telematics product. This product collects and dashboards data from diverse company products and customers. The engineer ensures seamless integration of hardware and cloud infrastructure working in multidisciplined teams. The engineer's expertise in cloud platforms, programming languages, and reporting is essential for driving the company's IoT initiatives forward.

The incumbent will be expected to demonstrate creativity, commercial grasp, design rigour and self-starting attributes. **maxwell+spark** fosters a diverse, fast paced, progressive work environment with a multidisciplinary approach to engineering without micro-management. The candidate should have an affinity for such working conditions and be able to rise to the occasion. The role will be based in Rotterdam, The Netherlands.

**Role and responsibilities will include:**

* Engage with customers to specify reporting and visualisation requirements
* Develop metrics according to customer needs
* Implement report generation using python to query a SQL database
* Provide 2nd line customer support
* Specify visualization of metrics
* Configure dashboards and generate automatic reports per customer requirements.
* Develop and implement API architectures
* Collaborate with other experienced firmware and hardware design engineers
* Create innovative new designs and features on an IoT telematics system by evolving existing products or creating entirely new products.
* Be able to characterize 3rd party machines, components and field environments.
* Manage users and user experience for internal and external customers.
* Generate documentation to describe software, electrical, and electronic systems.
* Lead or participate in testing or certification for new products.
* Manage mini projects including planning, budgeting, management of other engineers and suppliers.

**Educational and Experience Requirements:** 

* HBO (Bachelor’s Degree) in Computer Science or a relevant field.
* Minimum of 5 years’ relevant work experience.
* Experience in programming and data analysis, preferably using Python
* Experience in cloud services such as AWS / Azure and IoT applications.
* Experience with data analysis and visualisation tools such as Plotly, matplot lib
* Understanding of databases and time-series data
* Experience with RESTful API development and implementation
* Web development experience such as JavaScript, HTML, CSS is advantageous
* Knowledge of C++ and CAN Bus is advantageous

**Skill Requirements:**

* Ability to specify and develop metrics
* Hands-on experience with Wi-Fi/Bluetooth, GPS and Cellular IOT systems.
* Proficiency in cloud platforms such as AWS/Azure, ideally within the IoT domain.
* Interest and understanding of telematics, data gathering and analysis.
* Strong technical writing and communication skills.
* Ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team.
* Strong alignment with the company’s values: simplicity, powered growth, reliability, innovation and teamwork.

**What you can expect from us:**

* Full-time employment (40 hours per week) based on a 12-month contract, with a possibility of extension.
* A competitive salary, depending on experience, skills and qualifications.
* 8% holiday allowance, calculated on gross salary and paid monthly.
* Travel Allowance.
* Participation in the PMT Pension Fund.
* 22 days of paid leave. The number of paid leave days is increased after 2, 4 and 7 years of service.
* Travel reimbursement.
* Being part of a fast growing greentech company in the Netherlands, with room to learn, change roles and grow with us.
* Further studies are encouraged and supported.

**About us:** 

For more information about **Maxwell+Spark**, visit our website at www.maxwellandspark.com

Job Type: Full-time

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: DevOps Lead
description:
**Job ID:** R0008148


**Date posted:** 03/09/2024


**Company description**  

You see things a little differently. So do we. We believe that what you value is more important than what your CV says. We offer positions that will challenge your skills and let you grow. Come see things a little differently with us.  

  

The world is changing and the IKEA business is changing with it. For IKEA though, one thing will always remain the same our vision to create a better everyday life for the many people.


We are strengthening and developing our competences in order to meet the needs and dreams of the many people around the world. And to be accessible and relevant, wherever and whenever they wish to meet IKEA.

 **About Inter IKEA Systems B.V.**


Inter IKEA Systems B.V. owns the IKEA Concept and is the worldwide IKEA franchisor. We are specifically responsible for the IKEA strategic framework, ensuring that the IKEA Concept is updated, relevant, implemented and followed-up – together with all IKEA trademark users.


How do we do this? By enabling people across the IKEA value chain, and creating unique content to develop the IKEA business. Here are some examples of our different assignments:

* Develop solutions that will ensure a unique and successful meeting with IKEA customers.
* Lead the work around when and how IKEA expands in the world, enabling one common way of working with high impact at a low cost.
* Create the preconditions to strengthen the IKEA Culture and develop the right competences to meet customer and business needs.


An important part of our success is our unique culture and open working environment. Together, we create a workplace where everyone feels free to be themselves – to experiment, try new ways, and dare to ask, “What if…?” We believe in everyday personal growth and offer the opportunity to develop your career globally.  

  

With our renewed business idea, the appetite for insights has never been greater! The IKEA Insights team is in high demand to bring the outside-in perspective needed to reach more people, making great design available to everyone.  

  

IKEA Insights is a global team and has the assignment to contribute to IKEA people, making well-founded decisions based on actionable and timely insight. This means creating Insight solutions fuelled by data and tailored to different business needs. These solutions are currently divided into Customer Experience Insight, Strategy & Market Insight, and Brand & Range Insight. Each of these three areas develops and operates Insight products used by IKEA people across our value chain.

 **Job description**  

Are you someone who likes to do things differently and wants to be part of a force for positive change for people and the environment?  

  

We’re looking for a curious DevOps Lead to join our journey in creating solutions for a better tomorrow. You’ll be part of the product focused Insights Data & Technology Team that contributes to Insight products that help shape IKEA’s experiences, strategy and plans. These products cover:


How People Live  

Insights Platform  

Brand and Range Performance  

Customer Experience  

Strategic Market Insight  

Competitor Insight


As the DevOps Lead, you will leave your mark in many ways! The DevOps Lead is a critical role within the digital transformation that IKEA is currently undergoing, so there is no more exciting time to join us than now. As a hands-on DevOps Lead you will:

* Introduce and ensure correct tooling and process in our build pipelines.
* Optimize our time to delivery for requested changes in our digital products and systems
* Remove tooling barriers and complexity in order to maximize efficiency in our software development
* Develop and maintain our build pipelines
* Coach and develop our digital product teams in DevOps practice
* Work close with our product teams, making sure our systems and solutions are testable and easy to deploy
* Work towards a digital landscape where our systems and solutions are flexible and enabled for a/b testing and continuous deploy and delivery
* Ensure that the digital product teams have the tools and processes in order to monitor our production environments.
* Ensure reusability of product components and contribute to relevant tech communities across IKEA.
* Define and document best practices and strategies regarding application deployment and infrastructure maintenance.
* Develop and implement technical efforts to design, build and deploy Azure / AWS applications at the direction of lead architects, including large-scale data processing, computationally intensive statistical modelling and advanced analytics.

 **Qualification**  

* If you want to be part of a curious, creative environment that’s open to taking risks, this may be your new home.
* As DevOps Lead, you will have solid software engineering skills across full stack development, with a track record of developing, maintaining and operating digital (analytics) products. Experience around data processing, integration, modelling and visualization will be highly regarded.
* You’ll bring a minimum of 3+ years of experience in a similar role as well as a demonstrated breadth of knowledge across digital technology, digital infrastructure, IT services and product operations.
* You will apply what you know, bringing your Python and ETL systems (like Snaplogic, Airflow, Azure Data Factory) experience in a Microservices & DevOps-focused environment. You'll support the creation of business products by combining data and Web technology with the help of architecture frameworks and tools like Github, Docker, Kubernetes, AKS. Ideally, you will have experience working with cloud-based and advanced analytics technologies (like MS Azure, Terraform, Databricks or others) and will be comfortable working in an agile environment.

  

**More Information**  

This position is full-time (32-40 hours per week) and is located in Delft (NL). Some travel may be required and in this role and you will be reporting to the Insights Data & Technology Manager.  

  

Please send your application (CV) in English to us by Friday 20th September 2024. We really want to get to know you, so make sure you tell us why you want to work at IKEA and why you would be a good fit for this role.  

  

At IKEA, we always recruit based on values, competence, potential and diversity.

title: Operational Logistics Advisor (FO)
description:
**Job Brief**
-------------



As an FO, you serve as the functional manager for the Logistics Coordinators in the country programs and at HQ level you work as part of a cross-matrix team.



**MSF is an international, independent medical humanitarian organization. We are a non-profit, self-governed****worldwide movement of more than 63,000 people.**  


**We provide emergency medical** **assistance** **during armed conflict, natural disasters, outbreaks of deadly diseases****and** **assist** **those who are excluded from healthcare. MSF delivers care based on need and when we see** **injustice, we** **speak out. We are an organization that** **remains** **impartial, knowledgeable, and effective, and this is what****makes the difference between life and death.**  


**People are our priority. At Médecins Sans** **Frontières** **(MSF)/** **Artsen****zonder****Grenzen****, we are committed to an****inclusive culture that encourages and supports the diverse voices of our employees. We****encourage diverse****applicants including individuals of all gender identities, ages, sexual orientations, nationalities, races,** **religions, beliefs****, social and marital status, people with different abilities and all other** **diversity** **abilities****.**  


With immediate effect, our Logistics department is looking for an:  


**Operational Logistics Advisor** **(****F****O****)**

*(**Based in Amsterdam**)*  

As an FO, you serve as the functional manager for the Logistics Coordinators in the country programs and at HQ level you work as part of a cross-matrix team. The FO represents Logistics as a part of the Operational Support Team (OST) managed by an Operational Manager. The FO responsibilities include fostering strong relationships with country programs, understanding field operations and the role of Logistics support, and organizing necessary specialist support from the Field Support Unit (FSU). The FO ensures the adaptation of policies and procedures to local contexts while providing guidance to maintain acceptable standards of logistics, safety and technical support. An FO validates HQ trip reports and ensure the alignment between field support with HQ operations. Your tasks involve developing and implementing mission-specific logistics strategies, offering expert advice, and mentoring Logistics Coordinators. Additionally, you work closely with other team members and international partners to align strategies and contribute to the development of new tools and policies. Regular and timely field visits and potential gap-fill for Logistics Coordinators are also expected.  


As this role is based in Amsterdam, the ideal candidate should either already be based in The Netherlands or willing to re-locate to The Netherlands.  


**Main** **responsibilities**



* You are the focal point for Logistics Coordinators in assigned country programs, as well as the single point of contact for the Operations Manager, regarding logistics. You maintain an effective relationship with the missions you are assigned to, you are aware of the challenges in the field, and you organise the support to fulfil those needs. You keep yourself informed about development in the logistics/ technical area, inside and outside MSF.
* You steer and guide the tailoring of general policies, strategies, procedures and guidelines to the local situation. You provide advice and ensure the responsiveness, agility, quality, efficiency, and availability of logistics/technical support.
* You monitor the quality of the logistic processes and results in the country programs and ensure the appropriate level is attained.
* You validate all HQ trips reports and recommendations related to the field logistics in assigned portfolio.
* You work closely together with the other OST team members, securing alignment of all actions and keeping an overview.
* You represent Operations / Country Missions in the Logistics department, and Logistics department in Operations. You assure that HQ input and involvement in field support is well organized, functioning and aligned, and that, as a consequence, HQ speaks with “one voice”.
* You are expected to spend significant time in the field and replace LogCos when required.

  


**Specific tasks**



* Vision of Logistics within assigned portfolio of countries in regard to mission Operational & Technical Logistics / Supply Chain strategy, Missions specific Logistics policy framework: validation, development, implementation and compliance in collaboration with CMT and Log dept
* Mission specific expert advice including sharing of best practices, including transversal topics e.g., vaccination, NFI’s etc.
* Validation/ support in development and implementation of mission-specific policies, logistical strategies/ tactical approaches, support structuresand service level definition, in the area of logistics, made specific to the mission
* Coaching and mentoring of LogCo’s
* Advice to Operations regarding logistics, including proposed course of action in crisis situations
* Alignment of strategy and services with counterparts in other MSF sections and international organizations.
* Contribution to the development of new tools, equipment and/ or policies
* Reports and expert advice and enable decision making on Applied security, Air Operations, Technical Logistics and Supply chain management.
* Validation of all HQ trips reports and recommendations related to the field logistics in assigned portfolio.
* Expert advice and guidance on transversal operational logistics themes and / or topics.

  


**Candidate Profile**

* Higher vocational/ BSc/ MSc in (an area related to) Logistics.
* **Current or** **previous** **MSF experience of 5-7 years' experience as Logistics Coordinator or Head of Mission in the field (>5** **missions in positions like Log team Leader, Log/Admin, Deputy** **LogCo****, All-round Log)****.**
* In-depth knowledge of the domains within logistics (including technical logistics (biomedical, IT, construction), SC management, air operations, operational logistics, water and sanitation).
* Strong data literacy skills, including proficiency in tools like Excel and Power BI for data analysis and visualization is a strong asset.
* Excellent communication skills in **English** **& French** (written and spoken) are essential.
* You are willing to travel up to 40% of the time for annual field visits, short-term gap-fills and emergencies.

  


**C****o****mpetenc****ies**

* Results and quality orientation
* Planning and Organizing
* People Management and Development
* Initiative and Innovation

  


**We offer**  


A full-time appointment (based on a 40-hours workweek) for one year with renewal option based on satisfactory performance appraisal.  


A gross monthly salary in scale 16 with a current salary range between € 4,085-5,624 gross per month. The exact salary depends on relevant work experience.  


Other benefits:

* 30 paid vacation days annually, contingent upon full-time employment status.
* A premium free pension where MSF covers 100% of the monthly pension contribution
* 8% holiday allowance, paid out with the salary once a year in May
* Commuting allowance (terms and conditions apply) & work from home allowance
* Hybrid working option
* L&D will support you with a variety of learning and development opportunities with internal and external trainings and courses
* Discounted daily lunch at the office
* An environment that fosters diversity, with colleagues from around the world representing various cultures and background

  


**Application**

If you recognise yourself in this profile, we welcome you to apply directly via our website and upload a ***letter of motivation + Curriculum Vitae*** **(in English) as one combined document.**  


The closing date for applications is**22****September 2024** at 23:59 CET.  


**Information**

For more information about the recruitment procedure, please contact Recruiter, Ali Hamdan – ali.hamdan@amsterdam.msf.org  


**\*\*\*****No agencies please****\*\*\***

title: Team Lead Data Science
description:
**Team Lead Data Science**
As Team Lead Data Science you will work with your team on predicting conversion probabilities for a million households. You will lead the development and implementation of advanced analytics solutions together with your team. And every day at work, you’ll be doing your part for all the charities we support.  

  

Maurits van den Brand, Data Scientist*: “Every day we aim to identify, discover & implement (new) possibilities, based on data intelligence, in order to keep on raising ever more funds for social organisations and causes across the world.”*  

**As Team Lead Data Science, you’ll:**


* Stay up to date with industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in data science and MLOps, and identify opportunities to apply new techniques or technologies to the team’s work.
* Lead and manage a team of 8 data scientists by providing mentorship, guidance, and professional development opportunities.
* Foster a culture of continuous learning, collaboration, knowledge sharing, and innovation within the team.
* Work with other leaders, program managers, engineers, and business stakeholders to turn strategy into value.
* Evaluate potential new talent.
  
**You’d describe yourself as follows:**
* You hold a Master degree in econometrics, computer science, AI or similar with demonstrable work experience Data Science (7+ years) and guiding team members (2+ years).
* A proactive, strategic and creative mindset with strong communication and collaboration skills.
* A critical thinker who always looks for areas of improvement
* Knowledge of statistics and mathematics
* Strong programming skills in Python
  
  

**About us:**
The Postcode Lottery Group is a marketing-driven international non-profit organisation. We operate lotteries to raise funds for a fairer, greener and healthier world. Our players win with their neighbours and generate money for charities together – it’s a win-win!
We’ve raised more than €13.5 billion for thousands of good causes since 1989. We’re the third-largest private charitable donor in the world. Working alongside 1,438 fellow team members in Great Britain, the Netherlands, Sweden, Germany and Norway, you’ll be helping to build a better world every day!  

**About the team:**
The Postcode Lottery Group is building an International Analytics hub to provide our lotteries with the right models, tools, tech, and best-practices to help realize our growth ambition. In this hub you will be working together with business representatives to identify value adding business cases for advanced statistical analytics. You will be working on exciting and challenging BI, data & AI projects that create real impact for the lotteries and our beneficiary organizations.  

**This will make you happy:**
* A monthly salary, a variable year-end bonus and an excellent pension scheme, 28 days’ holiday a year based on a 40-hour week and flexible working hours.
* We believe it’s important that you’re able to keep developing professionally and personally, so we support ongoing training. The Lottery Academy offers a wide range of courses. And there are plenty of opportunities to grow within the organisation.
* You’ll work in our sustainable building within walking distance of Amsterdam Zuid station and you'll get an NS Business Card, which lets you travel for free all over the Netherlands, even outside working hours!
* We like to celebrate our successes with our colleagues and charity partners at well-attended monthly drinks and parties.
* We know exercising and relaxing are good for you. So we offer free boot camp, Pilates and kickboxing classes, and an employee running group that trains for events together. And you’ll enjoy free entry to more than 150 museums, plus theatre and cinema discounts.
* You’ll receive your full salary (100%) during childbirth and parental leave.
* To help you get involved in our charity partners’ work, we offer project visits and talks in our on-site auditorium. You can also volunteer three days a year during working hours, potentially with colleagues.
  
  

**Join us**
We believe an inclusive organisation is the ideal breeding ground for creativity, collaboration and innovation. Employee solidarity is important to us, too. Each of us has a part to play in that – we are the organisation, after all. We strive to make everyone feel at home. That means keeping an open mind and paying attention to each other’s welfare.
Can you see yourself as part of the team? We encourage you to apply – whatever your roots, religion, age, ability to work or life philosophy.
Please send your CV and cover letter to our Recruitment Business Partner (a.i.) Olaf van Gelderen through our recruitment website (werkendoejebij.nl). If you would like more information, please contact Olaf directly on +31 (0)6 19195090.
Please note that acquisition is not appreciated and that we can only consider candidates with a valid working permit for the Netherlands.

title: Assistant Professor in Data and Artificial Intelligence
description:
**Job description**
-------------------


We are looking for suitable candidates with passion for AI research and education. Priority will be given to candidates with a strong research track record and teaching experience in areas such as Explainable AI, AI for Text mining, NLP and LLMs, and AI robustness and reliability.


**Data and AI cluster (DAI)**


You will join the team of the Data and Artificial Intelligence cluster. At DAI we study foundations of AI for the present and the future. We design new AI methods, develop AI algorithms and tools with a view at expanding the reach of AI and its generalization abilities. In particular, we study foundational issues of robustness, safety, fairness, trust, reliability, tractability, scalability, interpretability and explain ability of AI.


Currently, DAI includes six research groups: Uncertainty in AI, Generative AI, Data Mining, Databases, ML for Physical Sciences, and Automated ML. The cluster consists of 3 full professors, 3 associate professors, 12 full-time assistant professors and 7 part-time and adjunct assistant professors affiliated with industry labs including DeepMind, Wayve, TomTom, Oracle labs. The cluster houses 50+ PhD candidates and postdocs, 8 AI Engineers and support staff.


DAI research is regularly published at top AI journals and conferences such as IJCAI, AAAI, ICML, ECMLPKDD, ICDM, NeurIPS, VLDB, and SIGMOD among others. Recently our work was recognized with the best paper awards, including Best Research Paper Award at VLDB 2024, SIGMOD 2023 (Research Highlight Award and Best Industry Paper Award), Best Demo Paper Award of IEEE ICDE 2023, IDA 2023 Runner-up Frontier Prize, Best Paper Award of LoG 2022, and Best Research Paper Award IEEE DSAA 2022 among others. Please refer to https://dai.win.tue.nl/newsitems/ for other highlights.


DAI is active in foundational and application-inspired research supported by NWO, H2020, other funding bodies and industry (ASML, KPN, Philips, TomTom, Rabobank). Example projects can be found at https://dai.win.tue.nl/researchprojects/.


DAI is actively involved in teaching in the Bachelor, Master and postgraduate level education of students in AI, Data Science and Computer Science. An overview of courses can be found at https://dai.win.tue.nl/courses/ and examples of MSc thesis projects at https://dai.win.tue.nl/masterprojects/. We regularly attract many talented students who are interested both research and engineering focused education. Their work receive recognition through publications and university and national level best MSc thesis awards.


Please do not hesitate to approach members of DAI at ECMLPKDD 2024 and NeurIPS 2024 to discuss our research, education and working environment.


**Job requirements**
--------------------

* Motivated researcher with a PhD in machine learning, data mining, or other relevant field.
* Ability to conduct high-quality academic research reflected in demonstratable outputs.
* Motivated to teach, contribute to teaching processes, and to develop excellent teaching skills.
* Strong cooperation skills.
* Effective communication and leadership skills, including coaching and mentoring of students and staff, leading a project or chairing a group.
* Excellent (written and verbal) proficiency in English.

**Conditions of employment**
----------------------------


A meaningful job in a dynamic and ambitious university, in an interdisciplinary setting and within an international network. You will work on a beautiful, green campus within walking distance of the central train station. In addition, we offer you:


* An 18-month contract as Assistant Professor which can become permanent after 12 months on the same employment level upon successful evaluation.
* The opportunity to focus your career on education, research and/or impact. You can develop your personal ambitions and objections within the strategic objectives of the university.
* As an Irène Curie Fellow, you are entitled to a substantial start-up package to kick-off your career.
* Salary in accordance with the *Collective Labour Agreement* for Dutch Universities, scale 11 (min. €4492, max. €6148 gross per month).
* A year-end bonus of 8.3% and annual vacation pay of 8%.
* A dedicated mentoring program to help you get to know the university and the Dutch (research) environment.
* High-quality training programs for academic leadership and teaching.
* An excellent technical infrastructure, on-campus children's day care and sports facilities.
* Partially paid parental leave and an allowance for commuting, working from home and internet costs.
* A Staff Immigration Team is available for international candidates, as are a tax compensation scheme (the 30% facility) and partner career support.

**Information and application**
-------------------------------

**About us**

Eindhoven University of Technology is an internationally top-ranking university in the Netherlands that combines scientific curiosity with a hands-on attitude. Our spirit of collaboration translates into an open culture and a top-five position in collaborating with advanced industries. Fundamental knowledge enables us to design solutions for the highly complex problems of today and tomorrow.  

  

We believe that diversity broadens our research scope and enhances the quality of our education. Our Irène Curie Fellowship aims to advance talented female researchers, in order to thrive and be successful in top positions in science, contributing to the societal goal of promoting equal opportunities. The program addresses the aspirations and needs of women in industry, academia, and research institutes in order to support their ambition to become a professor at our university.  

  

**Information**

Do you recognize yourself in this profile and would you like to know more? Please contact prof. dr. Mykola Pechenizkiy, m.pechenizkiy@tue.nl or +31 40 247 4977.  

  

Visit our website for more information about the application process or the conditions of employment. You can also contact Hella Ploegmakers, Senior Recruiter, h.a.m.ploegmaker@tue.nl or +31 643559625.


Are you inspired and would like to know more about working at TU/e? Please visit our career page.


**Application**


This vacancy is part of the Irène Curie Fellowship and is currently only open to female candidates.


We invite you to submit a complete application.  

The application should include a:


* Cover letter in which you describe your motivation and qualifications for the position.
* Curriculum vitae, including a list of your publications and the contact information of three references.
* Description of your scientific interests and plans (1-2 pages).
* Statement of your teaching goals and experience (1-2 pages).


We look forward to receiving your application and will screen it as soon as possible. The vacancy will remain open until the position is filled.

title: Sales Support Administrator
description:
Sales Support Administrator

  

**Date:** Sep 5, 2024


**Location:** Netherlands - ’s-Hertogenbosch


**Company:** Super Micro Computer


**Job Req ID: 25215**
**About Supermicro:**

Supermicro® is a Top Tier provider of advanced server, storage, and networking solutions for Data Center, Cloud Computing, Enterprise IT, Hadoop/ Big Data, Hyperscale, HPC and IoT/Embedded customers worldwide. We are amongst the fastest growing company among the Silicon Valley Top 50 technology firms. Our unprecedented global expansion has provided us with the opportunity to offer many new positions to the technology community. We seek talented, passionate, and committed engineers, technologists, and business leaders to join us to drive accelerated growth and technology-led innovation in the global marketplace.
**Job Summary:**

Supermicro Computer is looking for a Sales Support Administrator who can be the direct contact for Supermicro's field sales team and provide support by processing orders, monitoring inventory, and following up on ETA with purchasers. If you have prior order processing experience and you thrive in a high volume, fast paced environment, then we want you to be a part of the Supermicro team!
**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**
* Respond to inquiries such as order status, shipment schedules, account applications, co-op applications, product availability, and pricing
* Assist the sales team with data entry tasks as well as backup for other team members when needed
* Work cross-functionally with production, accounting, and RMA to keep track of assembly order schedules, and to expedite and pending repair orders
* Arrange sales meetings and prepare presentations
* Help process orders, expedite orders, assist on RMA's
* Assist product marketing information for email blasts or other marketing activities with the BV office
* Generate sales and forecasting reports on a monthly and quarterly basis


**Qualifications:**  

* High School Diploma required, AA degree preferred
* 1-2 years’ tech industry experience preferred
* Strong attention to detail
* Effective organizational skills
* Excellent communication, presentation, and negotiation skills
* Proven ability to effectively identify and resolve issues
  

**Salary Range**
**EEO Statement**

Supermicro is an Equal Opportunity Employer and embraces diversity in our employee population. It is the policy of Supermicro to provide equal opportunity to all qualified applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status or special disabled veteran, marital status, pregnancy, genetic information, or any other legally protected status.

title: MARKETEER
company: Spinnin' Records and Warner Music Benelux
description:
***ABOUT SPINNIN’ RECORDS***


*spinnin' records is one of the world's best-known dance music labels, with artists such as kshmr, tiësto, lum!x, alok, mike williams, lucas & steve, timmy trumpet, and many more on its roster. the label specializes in electronic music and manages the largest online dance community in the world, with more than 12 million followers on social media. in addition, the label has its own youtube channel with spinnin' tv, counting beyond 30 million subscribers and over 17 billion views. we are a growing international company and offer the unique opportunity to be part of it and join our team.*


***WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR***

We are searching for a Marketeer (all genders) to join the marketing team within Spinnin' Records. In this role, you will be responsible for creating and executing release & brand strategies for national and international projects. You can translate our artist' vision of their music-storytelling-into a strategic and innovative plan. When creating those, you use data & market trends and work closely with in-house teams and the artists / managers. You oversee keeping track of budgets, planning, monitoring achieved results, and adapting action points to keep the project moving forward.

 **YOU ARE ABLE TO:**


* Market and manage assigned national and international artist projects
* Initiate well-thought-out marketing and release plans for our artists with a focus on dance music, algigning with the artists branding stratigy and goals, based on audience- and artist-centric data.
* create and execute big and unique marketing ideas, hand in hand with all departments within spinnin’ (such as social media, pr, a&r, streaming, and brand partnerships) and ensure a flow of content for each artist and track.
* Creative a creative vision and narrative for a project, and translate this into campaign activations.
* Maintain an overview of deadlines, data insights, kpis, project budgets, and campaign goals.
* Create weekly marketing and release reports for internal and external stakeholders and ensure results and information are shared. communication is key.
* Work closely with artists and their representatives and keep them updated on all relevant Information surrounding each release.
* Oversee the creation and distribution of creative assets and marketing tools.
* Establish and continuously grow your network within the music industry.


**WHO YOU ARE**


* You’re deeply passionate about dance and electronic music with experience within the music industry.
* You have a bachelor's / master’s degree or equivalent (hbo level in dutch).
* You have minimum of 3-5 years work experience in a marketing role.
* You’re a multi-faceted creative thinker, great communicator, and team player.
* You have a high understanding of data based marketing, digital trends, online/social media platforms, and the dsp landscape.
* You are excellent at translating strategy and initial goals into specific action points and keep your cool when working with budgets and timelines.
* You’re a strong communicator with the ability to enthuse, inspire and motivate other.
* You know how to prioritize you’re work and focus on what drives results.
* You’re stress resistant and adapt well to change within a fast-moving industry.


**WHAT WE OFFER**


* The chance to do what you are passionate about and join our global community.
* An open, collaborative culture with training and development opportunities.
* Travel allowance / 20 Go Visit Days after 6 months (Working Abroad).
* Great team activities and legendary parties.
* 24 vacation days + extra days off.


**LOCATION**


* Amsterdam - On site position

title: Finance Officer
description:
Created in 2014, Excelya is a people-centered Contract Research Organization (CRO) that excels with care.



We offer a personal and authentic experience within a young, ambitious health company on the path to becoming the clinical research leader in Europe thanks to our 900 Excelyates. Our unique one-stop provider service model – leveraging full-service, functional service provider and consulting – allows our Excelyates to evolve through a diverse array of projects. In collaboration with preeminent experts, Excelya advances scientific, managerial and human knowledge to improve the patient journey.



For our team members, excelling with care means benefitting from a stimulating professional environment that encourages personal, intellectual, and operational participation so that together we can be the best in our field. We commit to giving each Excelyate the means to express their natural talents, develop their full potential and invest their unique selves in our unique project.

  


**The Role :**



Excelya Group has embarked on an ambitious growth strategy which has led to a significant ongoing transformation of the business.



As such, the Group has already developed strong finance processes and tends to develop them any further.



To support the development of the company, we are currently hiring a finance officer (assistant controller) reporting to the Benelux Finance Manager.



This position is based in the Netherlands.



Finance plays a key role in correct bookkeeping and compliance but also on supporting decision-making at a senior level, highlighting key financial issues and risks to be considered, and overall ensure business leaders developing their track to growth and profitability.



You shall embrace Excelya Values (Audacity/ Care & Energy) and make them alive in the daily life of the Finance community .


**Responsibilities :**


* Review and control the P&L of the Netherlands, Belgium and UK and Germany
* Accounting and bookkeeping, in cooperation with local accounting firms
* run future financial projections: budgeting and forecasting of the Business lines
* Liaise with your colleague in Germany
* Reporting to Operations and General Managers
* Ad-hoc report financial support for the strategic plan
* Enhancement of reporting


**Missions :**


**Operational Finance and Accounting**


* Reviewing of the work produced under the accounting tasks
* Statutory reporting
* Control quality of accounting data on a monthly close schedule
* Invoicing
* Accounts Payable
* Cash management
* Other administrative processing
* General Ledger and trials balance
* Inter-company transactions


**Business Partnering**


* Drafting management reports (for the Resourcing business line mainly)
* Support business in their Finance related needs, and be an advisor
* Track and analyze business activity
* Control and challenge data quality in the ERP


**Financial & Project Controlling**


* Help manage the forecast/reforecast/outlook/landing process
* Work closely with FP&A Central


**Projects**


* Participate in the ongoing implementation of a financial tooling
* Lead/participate on ad hoc analysis and projects


**Skills and Experience :**


* Strong experience in finance and accounting
* Business partner approach: help operational understand financial data and forecast their activity
* English: able to work effectively with stakeholders across the globe and to present content to senior executives
* MS Excel proficiency
* Excat Globe, scansys and Synergy will be a big advantage
* Comfortable with data, systems and software
* Adaptable, pro-active and good communicator
* Autonomous
* Fluent in English
* Ideally Dutch spoken


**Join us for a challenging career!**



We offer you an attractive package including a string bonus scheme. Furthermore, in the context of our rapidly expanding organization, we offer you the opportunity to play an important part in this strong and unique development in Europe of the first independent CRO!



Become an Excelyate!



Excel with care!


  
### **Summary**


* Type of job:  

Full-time
* Location:  

The Netherlands
* Capability:  

Finance


### **Contact**


**Ludivine LELONG-BONNARIC**  

Talent Acquisition Officer

title: Category Assistant Clothing
description:
Ambitious for a challenging job in the dynamic and international world of the product media? Have you gained already a few years of experience at a category department, product environment (or similar) an do you want to develop yourself further at the European market leader in our industry? Then we have a great job for you!



An interesting phase to join, because PF Concept started in 2023 with the launch of a new positioning and Go-to-Market strategy. This also means that we have organized our product categories in a different way, in order to strengthen our position in the market and to serve our B2B customers even better.



Reporting to the category manager, you are the administrative rock that they will lean on. You will connect with our buying office in Shanghai on behalf of the BU’s for new product data and item validation. You will work closely with the category manager, GBS team, compliance team and Decoration team in Poland to make sure all relevant product data is available at the time of launch.


### **What are you going to do?**



Your colleague, who is a category manager, wants to add a new item to the range of clothing products for which he or she is responsible. In their quest for and the development of the new fashion trends in the field of clothing products, he/she needs support from the category assistant. You are their support and rock in all things administrative!



You collect and send samples for deco testing to our branch PF Logo Express in Poland: they take care of the decoration of all products; you support in making competitive analyses and you coordinate various courier shipments to be send to our headquarter/deco facility. Because we need a photo of each product, you send samples for photoshoots. All in all, you will be working with a lot of different departments to make sure our products can be launched correctly on time.



And when the new product is finally approved and will be included in the range, you ensure that the new item with the corresponding product information is entered into our systems. And of course, you also immediately arrange for the price lists to be updated in Excel.



This job has 2 main responsibilities, 2/3 of your time you will support the category manager on clothing. The other 1/3 of your time, you will be supporting the entire soft goods (clothing, bags, home textiles, umbrellas) categories on admin related tasks.



Responsibilities on clothing:


* Take responsibility for translating new products from product brief into PO ready.
* Assist the category manager in fittings, including sample validation.
* Provide input to category manager to build up technical specifications.
* Coordinate with category manager to ensure product development schedules are maintained.
* Support the category manager in competition analysis.
* Support category manager in sales analyses.
* Support in various marketing related tasks.

Responsibilities on soft goods:


* Send samples for decoration testing.
* Work with quality/compliance teams on product compliance and ensure new products meet legal requirements.
* Handle all product questions from sales and back offices.
* Coordinate all sustainability admin tasks related to several certifications such as GRS,GOTS, BCI, BSCI.
* The other task assigned by superior.

### **Who are you?**


* Degree in textiles such as AMFI or TMO.
* You have at least 1-2 years of experience in category management in a textile company.
* Your English communication and presentation skills are outstanding.
* You have a problem-solving mentality.
* Proven capability to adapt to new systems and willingness to learn.
* Strong administrative skills.
* Attention to detail.

### **Our offer to you!**



Besides a pleasant working atmosphere, a place to grow your talents, a flat organization with an open culture, where one’s own input and initiative is rewarded, we offer you:


* Good salary that matches with the knowledge and experience you bring;
* Annual bonus to celebrate our success, when we achieved our results;
* Laptop and the option to work partially from home fully equipped and with extra budget for a good working place;
* 25 (or more) holidays, a premium-free pension, money to celebrate your birthday, travel allowance for every kilometer you travel and more;
* Extensive learning and (personal) development possibilities, including a wide range of online courses via Goodhabitz;
* Allowances to keep you fit and healthy, free fruit and every day different lunch options available at rock bottom prices;
* A dynamic and inspiring world of product media products and gifts which you can buy in our own shop;
* Never a dull moment!

### **Who we are?**



We are bringing people a smile every day! Ever received a Moleskine notebook with your employer's logo on it, bought a T-Shirt or worn a bracelet at famous pop or dance festivals, received a coffee mug with an inspirational text or other printed gift? Big chance it came from PF Concept. In fact. Every day you probably come across something from PF Concept and that makes people happy.



We are the European market leader with a revenue of >€ 250M in the dynamic and inspiring world of product media with top brands such as: Camelbak, Case Logic, Mepal, K’arst, Moleskine, Parker, Thule, Waterman and own labels such as Tekio and Elevate. A world that is changing rapidly and where developments such as speed, innovation, digitization and sustainability are extremely important. PF Concept is at the forefront of these developments.



PF Concept, headquartered in the Netherlands (Roelofarendsveen), operates industrial printing, production and warehouse facilities in the UK and Poland, and we offer an extensive and unparalleled range of more than 10.000 different product media products. We operate business to business, so finished products find their way to end customers via one of our 15,000 resellers across Europe.



PF Concept is part of the Polyconcept Group, the global market leader of product media products operating on five continents and selling to over 100 countries with a revenue up to $ 1 bln.


### **What do we stand for!**



We have a clear vision, mission and values. We empower confidence and pride with every brand awareness to our customers and to you!



Together with about 2,000 dedicated and enthusiastic team members in Europe we take pride in what we do and always strive to find the most innovative and creative solutions for our customers with sustainable and meaningful products.



We have a number of competencies that belong to our (new) team members. First and most important one is that we put our (internal) customers central in our thoughts and actions and that we provide optimal support to them. We always go for the best performance and are curious about new opportunities and possibilities.



Every day a little better and stronger than the day before, that is what we aim for. We are a reliable partner for our customers and each other. In addition, we think forward about what we do and want to do, but above all we also have a down to earth view of things. And last but not least: we are convinced that optimal cooperation and mutual respect is the best basis for our success.



We also believe that everybody has a talent, no matter who you are, what you will do, where you come from or what identity or orientation you have. We offer you an open, equal and healthy working environment, in which you are stimulated and motivated to (further) develop your talents, offer growth opportunities and use your full potential. You are welcome!


### **Are you our new colleague?**



That would be great! Send your CV and motivation to hr.nl@pfconcept.com and we will get in touch with you asap.

title: HR Administrator (HRIS Superuser)
description:
**HR Administrator (HRIS Superuser)**

**This is NewCold**  

NewCold is service provider in cold chain logistics with a focus on the development and operation of large, highly automated cold stores. NewCold strives to be crucial in the cold chain of leading food companies, by offering advanced logistic services worldwide. We use latest technology that empowers our people, to handle food responsibly and guarantee food safety in a sustainable way. We challenge the industry, believe in long-term partnerships, and deliver solid investment opportunities that enable next generation logistic solutions.


NewCold is one of the fastest growing companies in cold chain logistics. We are expanding our teams to support this growth. More information on NewCold can be found on www.newcold.com and our social media.

**About the vacancy:**


The HR Administrator (HRIS Superuser) performs administrative and coordinative HR tasks and works as the dedicated Superuser of our HR Information Systems (Cornerstone & eLoomi). You are an integral part of the Dutch Corporate HR team and the contact person for multiple stakeholders in the HR team locally and abroad.


Main tasks & responsibilities:

* Collects, processes and manages all local personnel data and ensures accurate and concise records during all phases of the employee journey
* Supports recruitment and onboarding efforts administratively
* Schedules internal and external trainings in close cooperation with the L&D department as well as trainers and participants
* Compiles and maintains various HR & Learning Reports generated by the HRIS’s
* Gains a deep understanding of our HRISs and develops into the Superuser role, making sure that data and organizational structures are mapped correctly and are maintained
* Ensures the systems are being prepared for the yearly performance management, succession planning as well as compensation rounds, course offerings are up to date, and functionalities are being explained to employees and managers (user support)

 **What are we looking for?**

* Bachelor’s degree in HRM, business administration or comparable subjects
* Experience in a comparable HR role, such HR Administrator, HR Officer, etc.
* First experiences as an HRIS Superuser are a big plus
* Structured and detail-oriented way of working
* IT affinity and interest in learning to use and administer new HR Software Applications
* Professional communication skills
* Fluent in English, any other European language is a plus

**Are you up for the job?**  

If you are interested in this vacancy and would like to apply, please make sure that you leave your CV in English. Suitable candidates will be invited for a first interview with the hiring manager, a second interview will follow with a wider group of NewCold team members.

**Why would you want to work for NewCold?**  

With the prospect of many new construction projects all over the world in the very near future, NewCold offers the opportunity to join a young but powerful company in the field of logistic services. We have the ambition and the potential to rapidly become the market leader in the field of modern and automated cold storage with additional supply chain services such as transport and distribution. Although our proposition comprises an attractive benefits and compensation package, the (international) scope and impact of the position may appeal to you even more.

***Can we welcome you on board as our new HR Administrator (HRIS Superuser) and help continue our successful growth?***

title: Marketing & Recruitment Master
description:
### **Specifications of this job**


#### **Position**


Marketing & Recruitment Master
#### **Area**


Randstad
#### **Type of contract**


Permanent
#### **Experience**


3 years
### **Who We Are:**



Welcome to Greater! A place where big ideas are our bread and butter and creativity flows like coffee on a Monday morning! We’re all about shaking things up in ICT Consultancy and we need a superstar who’s ready to help us shine even brighter. If you’re a marketing whiz with a knack for finding the best talent out there, we’ve got a seat with your name on it.


### **The Role:**



Are you a marketing guru with an eye for talent? Do you dream about recruitment campaigns that stop people mid-scroll? If yes, keep reading! As our Marketing & Recruitment Master you’ll be the mastermind behind our brand’s voice and the secret weapon in our hunt for top-notch talent. You’ll craft and execute strategies that make people say, “I want to work there!” while ensuring Greater stays at the top of everyone’s must-watch list.


### **What You’ll Be Doing:**


* **Crafting Epic Strategies:** Dream up and roll out marketing plans that get us noticed, loved, and followed—by both customers and potential hires.
* **Recruitment Magic:** Turn job seekers into job finders with recruitment campaigns that make Greater the place everyone wants to work.
* **Brand Wizardry:** Keep our brand fresh, fun, and fabulous across all platforms, making sure we’re always the talk of the town (in a good way).
* **Number Crunching (but fun!):** Dive into data to see what’s working, what’s not, and how we can be even Greater (pun intended).
* **Building Alliances:** Network like a pro with industry movers, shakers, and talent pools—because you know it’s all about who you know.
* **Content Creation:** Write, post, film, and snap content that not only turns heads but keeps them nodding in approval.
* **Event Planning (Party Time!):** Plan and host events that bring our brand and culture to life, whether it’s a virtual webinar or an IRL job fair.

### **What You Bring to the Table:**


* A bachelor’s degree in Marketing, HR, Business, or something equally awesome.
* At least 3 years of experience in marketing, recruitment, or similar.
* You’re a social media maven who knows their way around digital tools and trends.
* Creative ideas are your jam, and you’re not afraid to think outside the box (or throw the box away altogether).
* You love digging into data as much as you love a good brainstorming session.

### **Why You’ll Love It Here:**


* **Creativity First:** We’re all about big ideas and bold moves. If you’ve got them, we want to hear them!
* **Grow With Us:** We’re committed to helping you level up with plenty of opportunities to learn and grow.
* **Team Vibes:** Work with a team that’s as passionate and driven as you are (and knows how to have fun along the way).
* **Awesome Perks:** Competitive pay, great benefits, and a work environment that’s anything but boring.
#### **The benefits**


* Greater salary.
* Join workshops, training, courses, seminars, or technical sessions in our own Greater Academy. Collect as many certificates as you want or train your own team members!
* Guidance throughout your career with our performance management.
* An open-door policy. We value your initiatives, feedback and ideas, any time.
* A great atmosphere and a solid team. We regularly lunch together, have drinks, go on legendary team events (abroad) and dare each other in a game of pool or darts in the break area.
* Anniversary payment. For if you love to stick with us for a while.
* 28 holidays.
* You also get the days off in between Christmas and New Year. Do you prefer to work? We’ll pay extra if you do!
* A lease car/bicycle leasing program, or NS-Business Card.
* Study allowance, pension scheme, and collective insurance.
* HQ in Schiphol-Rijk.

title: Senior Global Consultant
description:
Provides advice to management to enable strategic / tactical decision making and execution, based on a good understanding of the organisation's strategy, way of working and business architecture as well as an outside-in perspective. Diagnoses problems, designs solutions, methods and tooling to operationalise solutions, and to contribute to transformations.

**The** **team**


The Global Consulting team is part of the Global Change & Transformation organisation, which is the central hub within ING for consultants, change execution professionals and process experts.

**Roles and R****esponsibilities**


As Global Consultant you:

* Tackle complex business challenges based on a deep understanding of our strategy, organisation and external trends and developments
* Deliver advice to support decision making and enable execution – highlighting the qualitative and quantitative impact of different scenarios
* Design and co-create methods and tooling to empower senior stakeholders to prioritise and deliver on their purpose
* Translate change demands into implementable solutions and ensure the acceptance
* Bring an outside perspective on development of craftsmanship and methodology and stay up to date with key trends and developments relevant for our industry
* Act as an expert who contributes to the development of the relevant expertise
* Create alignment across different areas of the bank on strategic themes

**How to succeed**


We hire smart people like you for your potential. Our biggest expectation is that you’ll stay curious. Keep learning. Take on responsibility. In return, we back you to develop into an even more awesome version of yourself.


You're an experienced consultant with excellent problem solving skills, are analytical and able to bring structure to complex business issues; you know how to achieve goals in a large complex organisation; you build and maintain relationships with your senior stakeholders; you act strategically.

*Specific skills sought* *include:*

* Ability to act autonomously, think and act out of the box and take accountability
* Strong resilience; ability to navigate through ambiguity
* Ability to take responsibility and make impact based on facts and data; have the courage to question and make decisions
* Strong organisational sensitivity; deep understanding of the underlying issues, opportunities and dynamics of the organisation
* A strong and persuasive communicator
* Motivated to provide training and coaching on the job to fellow consultants within ING, initiates and contributes to the consulting community and Group Change & Transformation
* Ability to collaborate and build relationships with a wide range of senior stakeholders across the organisation – leading to high impact/urgency assignments for self and team


You adhere to the ING values and your behaviour is aligned to these values.

*Track record and experience:*

* Master’s degree
* At least 10 years professional experience in management consultancy (ideally big 4), bringing a thorough understanding of consultancy methodologies and functional / technical subject matter expertise relevant to ING
* Is able to deliver individually and/or by managing a medium sized team
* Strong affinity with agile way of working
* Team player
* Experience in financial sector is a pre, bringing knowledge and experience of financial industry activities, processes, key products, support tools
* Excellent level of English (written and spoken), Dutch is an advantage

**Rewards and benefits**


We want to ensure you can strike the right balance between your career and private life. You can find out more about our employment conditions at https://www.ing.jobs/netherlands/Why-ING/benefits.htm. The benefits of working with us at ING include the following:

* A salary tailored to your qualities and experience
* 24-27 vacation days, depending on the contract
* Pension scheme
* 13th-month salary
* Individual Savings Contribution (BIS), 3.5% of your gross annual salary
* 8% Holiday payment
* Personal growth and challenging work with endless possibilities
* An informal working environment with innovative colleagues
* Work Agile, so new ideas come to life faster

**About** **us**


With 60,000 employees and operations in approximately 40 countries, there is no shortage of opportunities for people with initiative who want to help people take a step ahead in life and business. Do you want to work at the cutting edge of what’s possible and simultaneously ensure you work with integrity and hold the customer’s interests at heart? Do you want to be surrounded by progressive, inspiring, diverse, and supportive colleagues? Then there is no better place to invest your talents than at ING. Join us. Apply today.

title: Master Data Specialist
description:
**Company Overview:**  

Founded in 1998, United Legwear & Apparel Co. (ULAC) is a global designer, manufacturer, and distributor of apparel, legwear, bodywear, bags, backpacks, headwear, and accessories. As a joint venture partner of PUMA North America and licensee of various renowned brands such as Hurley, Skechers, Ted Baker, Scotch & Soda and more, ULAC operates globally with headquarters in New York City and offices in various locations, including the Netherlands (Amsterdam & Hoofddorp).  

Our mission is to treat our stakeholders with respect, integrity, and fairness while delivering high-quality products. Our core values, Unity, Loyalty, Advancement, and Charity, guide our operations.  

  

**Learn more at** www.unitedlegwear.com**.**  

  

 **Join Our Team as a Master Data Specialist at United Legwear & Apparel Europe!**  

Are you passionate about ensuring the accuracy, consistency, and integrity of data? Do you have a keen eye for detail and love collaborating with cross-functional teams? If so, we have the perfect role for you!  

  

 **Location:** **Hoofddorp, Netherlands**  

 **Position: Master Data Specialist**  

 **Type: Full-Time**  

**Work Arrangement:** Hybrid (minimum of 3 office days per week)  

  

**About the Role:**  

As our Master Data Specialist, you will be the backbone of our data management efforts. Your primary responsibility will be to oversee the governance and management of master data across our European team. This role is crucial in supporting key business processes and decision-making through accurate and reliable data. You will work closely with departments like IT, Operations, Sales, and Finance, and align with our US data team to streamline and optimize data management strategies.  

  

**What You’ll Do:*** **Master Data Governance:**
	+ Develop and implement master data management (MDM) policies, standards, and procedures.
	+ Ensure compliance with data governance policies and establish governance councils as needed.
* **Data Quality & Integrity:**
	+ Monitor and enhance the quality of master data.
	+ Conduct regular data audits, cleansing activities, and implement quality metrics.
* **Data Management:**
	+ Oversee creation, maintenance, and validation of master data records.
	+ Manage data lifecycle processes and ensure proper integration across systems.
* **Stakeholder Collaboration:**
	+ Work with various business units to understand and meet their data needs.
	+ Provide training and support on master data management practices.
* **Project Management:**
	+ Participate in and manage data-related projects ensuring timelines and deliverables are met.
* **Continuous Improvement:**
	+ Identify process improvements and implement best practices.
	+ Stay updated with the latest trends in data management.

  

**What You Bring:*** Proven experience in master data management or a similar role.
* Strong understanding of data governance, quality, and management practices.
* Experience with data management tools and technologies (e.g., MDM software, ERP, data quality tools).
* Experience working in ERP environments, specifically with Exenta from Aptean is a big plus.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
* Ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines effectively.
* A proactive approach to problem-solving and continuous improvement.
* Must hold valid work authorization for the Netherlands, without the need for employer sponsorship

  

**What you'll get from us**:
* Join a passionate team working at our beautiful showrooms in Hoofddorp
* Dress to impress with 28% employee discounts on our webshop and VIP access to sample sales for friends & family, showcasing our latest collections at discounted rates
* ️ Enjoy our delicious freshly prepared lunch meals for just 3.90, along with all-day coffee, drinks, and snacks to keep you energized and refreshed
* ️ Discounted access to ClassPass, empowering you to explore a variety of fitness and wellness classes for a balanced lifestyle!
* Unlimited usage of Open-up, our Health & Wellbeing provider, offering 1-1 sessions with certified psychologists and lifestyle coaches, as well as access to informative masterclasses.




dh7ATHXQON

title: Integration Specialist
Program Director
description:
PROGRAM DIRECTOR
Faber LABS
 * Veemarktkade 8, 's-Hertogenbosch

  
Hey Program Director! Are you ready to use your leadership, communication and organizational skills to transform the world of supply chains forever? Nice to meet you, we are Faber LABS. A brand-new division of Faber Group that is launched to digitalize our load carrier business models. With endless possibilities for making supply chains more sustainable, transparent and efficient, but above all future proof, we need your Program management skills to achieve our goals Challenge accepted? Who are we? We are Faber LABS, member of the family-owned Faber Group. At Faber LABS, we aim to accelerate digital transformation within logistic supply chains, making them more sustainable, transparent and efficient. Driven by data combined with years of knowledge of supply chains, we will transform the logistic landscape forever. Our goal? Going from your regular load carrier to data-driven load carriers with automated processes and data-driven decision-making that enables us to carry more impact. The possibilities are endless. Are you up for the challenge?

Who you are



As our Program Director, we’re looking for…


* A bachelor’s degree in Business, Information Technology, or a related field; Master’s degree preferred.
* Proven experience in leading programs and managing Project Managers and PMOs.
* Strong knowledge of agile methodologies and project portfolio management (PPM) practices including tooling (eg, JIRA).
* Exceptional leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to think strategically and execute methodically.
* Experience with digital tools and technologies relevant to the organization’s industry.
* Certification in project management (e.g., PMP, PgMP) and agile (e.g., Scrum Master, SAFe) is a plus.


What we offer



Just as you give your best, we do too. We’re all about a work-life balance, making sure you can be all-in your work, while being all-in with your hobbies, sportive activities or time with family and friends.


* A competitive salary of 8000 to 9800 euro per month depending on skills and experience
* Everything you need to excel at your job e.g. laptop and phone.
* A hybrid way of working: from our modern office in ‘s Hertogenbosch or your home office
* Continuous growth opportunities
* Inspiring colleagues with creative, analytical and innovative minds from across the globe
* A chance to build a whole new team, within a brand-new company


**Your role as Program Director**
Maybe you noticed, but we have big ambitions. As an experienced Program Director, you lead and oversee our total digital transformation program. This role is critical to ensuring the successful delivery of complex, cross-divisional digital initiatives that align with our ambitions. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record in managing large-scale projects, excellent leadership skills, and the ability to collaborate effectively across departments  

  

* **Strategic Leadership:**


o Build the Program Management Office and lead programs and projects that are part of our digital transformation
o Align digital initiatives with the organization’s business objectives and strategic goals.
o Foster a culture of innovation, continuous improvement, and agile thinking within the PMO and across the organization.
* **Program Management:**


o Oversee the planning, execution, interdependencies and delivery of the organization’s portfolio of digital projects and programs.
o Ensure all projects and programs are managed consistently and are aligned with the organization's goals.
o Monitor and report on the progress, risks, and issues of digital initiatives to senior leadership.
* **Agile and PPM Maturity:**


o Enhance the overall project portfolio management (PPM) maturity within the organization.
o Implement and refine methodologies, processes, and tools to improve project and program delivery.
* **Stakeholder Engagement:**


o Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including IT, operations, product, and finance, to ensure successful delivery of digital initiatives.
o Act as a liaison between senior leadership and project teams to ensure alignment and effective communication.
* **Resource Management:**


o Manage and allocate resources effectively to ensure the successful delivery of programs and projects.

title: Senior Product Analyst
description:
**Open in all locations: France, Germany, the Netherlands, and the United Kingdom**

  

We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Senior Product Analyst to join our Product team. As a Senior Product Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of our platform by leveraging data and insights to drive product development and enhance user experiences. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to identify opportunities for enhancement, make informed recommendations, and contribute to the strategic direction of our two sided marketplace platform. This role requires a deep understanding of data analysis, market trends, and a strong ability to work with other analysts in the team to communicate findings effectively to stakeholders.

 **Key Responsibilities:**

* **Data Analysis and Insights**
	+ Collect, clean, monitor and analyse data to identify trends, patterns, and user behaviour.
	+ Develop and maintain dashboards and reports for key product metrics.
	+ Conduct A/B tests and experiments to evaluate the impact of product changes.
	+ Provide actionable insights to guide product development and enhancements.
* **Understanding User Behavior**
	+ Deeply understand user behaviour, needs, and pain points on both sides of the marketplace.
	+ Create user personas and journey maps to inform product design and development.
	+ Collaborate with UX/UI designers by providing data-driven insights that can be used to optimise user interfaces
* **Product Strategy**
	+ Collaborate with Product Managers to define product goals and KPIs.
	+ Participate in product roadmapping and prioritise features and improvements based on data analysis.
	+ Assist in defining and tracking success metrics for product launches.
* **Cross-functional Collaboration**
	+ Work closely with Engineers, Designers, and Marketing teams to ensure data-driven decision-making.
	+ Communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.
* **Continuous Learning**
	+ Stay up-to-date with industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in data analysis and product analytics.
	+ Continuously improve data collection processes and tools.

* Bachelor's or Master's degree in a related field (e.g., Data Science, Statistics, Business Analytics).
* 5+ years of experience with at least 3+ years of experience as a Product Analyst.
* Proficiency in data analysis tools and languages such as SQL, Python, or R.
* Strong knowledge of data visualisation tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Looker).
* Experience with A/B testing, experiment design, and statistical analysis.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills.
* Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced, cross-functional team environment.
* A passion for data-driven decision-making and product improvement.

### **Why you’ll enjoy working at the Instapro Group**


**You can make an Impact.** Joining Instapro Group is an opportunity to help crack the code in one of the last big industries to become digital-first. We’re leaders in our markets, yet small enough for everyone to make a real difference.


**We care**. We don’t believe in one size fits all. Whether it’s flexibility in your working hours, your location, or opportunities to advance and grow, you’ll find a supportive and open culture designed to help our team members thrive.

  


These are the benefits you'll enjoy:

  

* Highly competitive salary package
* Hybrid work environment
* Hybrid allowance/benefit
* Eligibility to receive an equity award
* Temporary work from abroad policy
* Mental health support
* Regular team and social events
* Further benefits depending on location

  

These are the values that guide everything we do:


* **We put integrity first**. We are authentic, transparent and respectful.
* **We are all stewards.** We are stewards of the company on behalf of all stakeholders.
* **We follow the evidence.** We are objective, evidence-based and pragmatic in our decision-making.
* **We never stop learning.** We are open-minded and curious.
* **We win together.** We collaborate and earn trust with our colleagues.
* **We are inclusive.** We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive company.



Read our values in full here

  


Interested in applying? Submit your application below and we will get back to you.

title: Material Handler
description:
**Working with Us**  

Challenging. Meaningful. Life-changing. Those aren't words that are usually associated with a job. But working at Bristol Myers Squibb is anything but usual. Here, uniquely interesting work happens every day, in every department. From optimizing a production line to the latest breakthroughs in cell therapy, this is work that transforms the lives of patients, and the careers of those who do it. You'll get the chance to grow and thrive through opportunities uncommon in scale and scope, alongside high-achieving teams rich in diversity. Take your career farther than you thought possible.  

  

Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives. Read more: careers.bms.com/working-with-us .  

  

**At Bristol Myers Squibb, we are inspired by a single vision - transforming patients' lives through science. In oncology, hematology, immunology and cardiovascular disease - and one of the most diverse and promising pipelines in the industry - each of our passionate colleagues contributes to innovations that drive meaningful change. We bring a human touch to every treatment we pioneer. Join us and make a difference.**  

  

Cell Therapy is one of the most groundbreaking new forms of cancer treatments being studied today. With therapies only in their infancy and BMS's continued investment in our Cell Therapy capabilities, the growth potential of this science, your career, and the ability to help patients are incredible.  

  

The Netherlands is home to our first European Cell Therapy facility, located at the Leiden Bio Science Park, the largest life sciences cluster of The Netherlands. This new state of the art facility is focused on commercial manufacturing with capabilities for multi-product Cell Therapy manufacturing. You can become part of this exciting journey. Check out this video if you want to know more about it!  

  

**Position Summary**  

  

Leiden Site is seeking a dynamic team member to join a highly motivated team of Materials Management and Supply Chain professionals. You are comfortable in a fast-paced environment with a minimal amount of direction and able to adjust workload based upon changing priorities. You will be responsible for providing material movement and logistical support to internal and external customers in support of cellular therapeutic manufacturing during process transfers, routine production, and technology improvements. The Materials Handler will be adhering to Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), regulatory requirements and company policy while performing job functions.  

  

**Key Responsibilities*** Executes internal and external temperature controlled Material requests across multiple unit operations under cleanroom conditions.
* Completing (electronic) documentation required by process transfer protocols, standard operating procedures, and batch records.
* Responding to system and equipment alarms during inside / outside office hours in rotating schedule
* Assisting in setting up warehouse operations equipment/fixtures and support facility and equipment commissioning activities.
* Performing tasks in a manner that is consistent with departmental and corporate safety policies, quality systems and GMP requirements.
* Additional duties, tasks and responsibilities as assigned by Senior Management.

**Qualifications & Experience*** Relevant education or experience in Science, Facilities and Engineering on VMBO / MBO level.
* Experience in a cGMP warehouse environment and understanding of Materials Management.
* General dangerous goods experience and certifications are a plus.
* Experience with receiving, temperature storage, issuance, and inventory control practices including cycle counting, and rejected/expired material disposition.
* Experience in cold chain logistical movement of time critical and temperature sensitive biologics.
* Knowledge of Freight forwarder and courier direct shipments and associated documentation requirements.
* Use of material handling equipment - electric and/or manual.
* Flexibility to work a shift structure, on call hours and irregular hours (incl. weekends)


Why You Should Apply?  

  

If you come across a role that intrigues you but doesn't perfectly line up with your resume, we encourage you to apply anyway. You could be one step away from work that will transform your life and career.
  

  

**Uniquely Interesting Work, Life-changing Careers**  

With a single vision as inspiring as Transforming patients' lives through science™ , every BMS employee plays an integral role in work that goes far beyond ordinary. Each of us is empowered to apply our individual talents and unique perspectives in an inclusive culture, promoting diversity in clinical trials, while our shared values of passion, innovation, urgency, accountability, inclusion and integrity bring out the highest potential of each of our colleagues.  

  

**On-site Protocol**  

  

BMS has a diverse occupancy structure that determines where an employee is required to conduct their work. This structure includes site-essential, site-by-design, field-based and remote-by-design jobs. The occupancy type that you are assigned is determined by the nature and responsibilities of your role:
