Site-essential roles require 100% of shifts onsite at your assigned facility. Site-by-design roles may be eligible for a hybrid work model with at least 50% onsite at your assigned facility. For these roles, onsite presence is considered an essential job function and is critical to collaboration, innovation, productivity, and a positive Company culture. For field-based and remote-by-design roles the ability to physically travel to visit customers, patients or business partners and to attend meetings on behalf of BMS as directed is an essential job function.
  

  

BMS is dedicated to ensuring that people with disabilities can excel through a transparent recruitment process, reasonable workplace accommodations/adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Applicants can request a reasonable workplace accommodation/adjustment prior to accepting a job offer. If you require reasonable accommodations/adjustments in completing this application, or in any part of the recruitment process, direct your inquiries to adastaffingsupport@bms.com . Visit careers.bms.com/ eeo -accessibility to access our complete Equal Employment Opportunity statement.
  

  

BMS cares about your well-being and the well-being of our staff, customers, patients, and communities. As a result, the Company strongly recommends that all employees be fully vaccinated for Covid-19 and keep up to date with Covid-19 boosters.
  

  

BMS will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records, pursuant to applicable laws in your area.  

  

If you live in or expect to work from Los Angeles County if hired for this position, please visit this page for important additional information: https://careers.bms.com/california-residents/
  

  

Any data processed in connection with role applications will be treated in accordance with applicable data privacy policies and regulations.

title: Marketing Specialist
description:
* Netherlands
* 4539
* Employee Regular Full Time
**Job Description**
-------------------

**Overview**  

Marketing Specialist – Food and Beverage EMEA


NL Based – Breda area / Remote (Dutch Speaking)

  



Are you looking to take a major step forward into marketing, working in a high growth tech company? Are you ready to work in a fast-paced environment and eager to learn more about B2B marketing?


We are looking for a creative, ambitious and performance driven individual to join our global marketing team based in the Netherlands.

  



**The Role**


Aptean’s Global Marketing Team is recruiting for a Marketing Specialist to join our EMEA Food and Beverage team. You’ll be responsible for supporting the execution of Account Based Marketing demand generation campaigns to the food and beverage sector in the Benelux region to build both brand awareness and quality leads to fuel the sales pipeline. You’ll work closely with marketing team members, product and sales teams to deliver virtual and in-person events, create and execute integrated campaigns across the marketing mix, and support the creation of local content. You will be supported by the best learning platforms to accelerate your growth and develop your business and functional skills, as part of other programs to accelerate your career plan at Aptean. The candidate will need to have a growth mindset willing to lean and innovate, be well organised, able to juggle multiple activities effectively, and have excellent communication and writing skills in both Dutch and English language.

**Principal Duties and Responsibilities**


Reporting to and working closely with the Marketing Manager for Benelux your primary duties will include:
* Execution of themed and vertical ABM multi-channel marketing campaigns that incorporate email distribution, digital advertising and paid social programmes.
* Assist in organizing events and webinars where they are either hosted by Aptean or one of our media or industry association partners.
* Co-ordinate content syndication programmes selecting appropriate content to drive the best outcomes.
* Collaborate with our design team, inhouse and local writers, to create and update a range of compelling content aligned to our brand and that can be published via various online channels.
* Support Dutch website improvement initiatives helping to build website traffic and increase page engagement through relevant content.
* Assist with translation and localization requirements for regional campaigns within the EMEA team.


You will also be expected to:* Stay well-informed on marketing trends, emerging technologies and industry topics that will help us to market more effectively to our target market.
* Build collaborative relationships with the global marketing team, sales and product management.
* Nurture and develop your skills through self-learning, learning by doing, coaching and special projects assignments.

 **Candidate Profile: You are / have**

* A Native Dutch speaker but fluent in spoken English and with a high level of grammatical accuracy in written English.
* Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent.
* Minimum 2-4 years B2B marketing experience in a corporate environment.
* A keen interest for business development through multi-channel marketing and brand building – in particular the use of digital channels such as Google, LinkedIn and websites matched with intent data and personalization through 6sense and Mutiny platforms.
* Excited about building a career in a fast moving and innovative technology sector.
* A naturally curious nature, eager to learn, with a positive ‘can do’ attitude.
* Good communication skills.
* Good time management - Organised enough to work on multiple projects simultaneously and understand the importance of hitting deadlines.
* Proven ability to follow plans/directions but with confidence to apply input and ideas.
* Self-motivated and are confident working independently or collaboratively.
* Commitment to teamwork and able to operate in an international environment.
* Experience of Adobe programs (Photoshop and Illustrator) would be an advantage.
* Experience of email marketing platforms, ideally Marketo, would be an advantage.

  



About Us


Aptean is a private equity backed software company that connects companies in specific industries with specialized software solutions. In today’s fast-paced, highly competitive economy, organizations don’t have time to waste forcing homegrown software, spreadsheets, and one-size-fits-all solutions to do things they were never designed to do. Aptean is on a mission to end those workarounds with streamlined industry-specific software solutions. That’s why over 6,500+ highly specialized organizations in more than 20 industries and 80 countries rely on us to simplify their everyday operations.


If you are looking for a company where you can give your best, work collaboratively, and build your career, we encourage you to apply!


Aptean, Inc., is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. In accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws we do not tolerate discrimination or harassment against any applicant for employment or employee with Aptean because of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or any other group status protected by applicable law.

title: Account Executive, Mid-Market | France
description:
**Who we are is what we do.**


Deel and our family of growing companies are made up of global teams dedicated to helping businesses hire anyone, anywhere, easily.


The team comprises over three thousand self-driven individuals spanning over 100 countries, and our unified yet diverse culture keeps us continually learning and innovating the platform and products for customers.


Companies should be able to hire the best talent anywhere in the world, so we are building the best platform to make that a reality. Our market-leading technology, expertise, and global team are crucial to the platform’s success. We deliver the best products and features in our space, enabling millions of jobs worldwide and connecting the global workforce with the best companies and opportunities.

**Why should you be part of our success story?**


A 30-mile hiring radius should no longer dictate how companies hire because exceptional talent lives everywhere. Deel sees a world without hiring borders and endless talent that pairs perfect candidates with great companies.


We offer global teams all the tools they need to hire, onboard, manage, pay, and scale at full speed. We aim to foster a diverse global economy by building a generational platform that seamlessly connects companies with talent worldwide.


After our successful Series D in 2021, we raised another $50M in 2023, doubling our valuation to $12B. There’s never been a more exciting time to join Deel — the international payroll and compliance market leader.

**What you’ll do at Deel**

* Grow and own a targeted account list
* Develop a territory plan for acquiring new business
* Manage the customer buying journey from start to finish, providing guidance and subject matter expertise to prospective customers
* Meet or exceed monthly and yearly revenue targets
* Continuously develop a robust sales pipeline through individual outreach, collaborating with your sales development representative, and managing inbound prospects
* Keep CRM system up to date with customer information, forecasts, and pipeline data so we can learn more about our business and our sales process

**Some key qualifications**

* EMEA located only
* 3+ years sales experience, with a minimum of 1 year selling into the Mid-Market segment in Europe
* Strong prospecting and solution selling experience is essential
* A proven track record of developing a greenfield territory, executing across the full sales cycle, and adding net new logos
* Experience in cross-functional teams to ensure Customer Success and Satisfaction
* Desire to work for a fast-paced startup and take on increasing levels of responsibility
* Fluency in French and English

**Total Rewards**


Our workforce deserves fair and competitive pay that meets them where they are. With scalable benefits, rewards, and perks, our total rewards programs reflect our commitment to inclusivity and access for all.

**Some things you’ll enjoy**

* Provided computer equipment tailored to your role
* Stock grant opportunities dependent on your role, employment status and location
* Additional perks and benefits based on your employment status and country
* The flexibility of remote work, including WeWork access where available


At Deel, we’re an equal-opportunity employer that values diversity and positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of race, religion, sex, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, pregnancy or maternity or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

*Unless otherwise agreed, we will communicate with job applicants using Deel-specific emails, which include @**deel.com* *and other acquired company emails like @**payspace.com* *and @**paygroup.com**. You can view the most up-to-date job listings at Deel by visiting* *our careers page**.*  

  

*Deel is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to cultivating a diverse and inclusive workplace that reflects different abilities, backgrounds, beliefs, experiences, identities and perspectives.*  

  

*Deel will provide accommodation on request throughout the recruitment, selection and assessment process for applicants with disabilities. If you require accommodation, please inform our Talent Acquisition Team at recruiting@deel.com of the nature of the accommodation that you may require, to ensure your equal participation.*

title: Facilities Engineer III
description:
### **Job Description**


At Gilead, we’re creating a healthier world for all people. For more than 35 years, we’ve tackled diseases such as HIV, viral hepatitis, COVID-19 and cancer – working relentlessly to develop therapies that help improve lives and to ensure access to these therapies across the globe. We continue to fight against the world’s biggest health challenges, and our mission requires collaboration, determination and a relentless drive to make a difference.  



Every member of Gilead’s team plays a critical role in the discovery and development of life-changing scientific innovations. Our employees are our greatest asset as we work to achieve our bold ambitions, and we’re looking for the next wave of passionate and ambitious people ready to make a direct impact.  



We believe every employee deserves a great leader. People Leaders are the cornerstone to the employee experience at Gilead and Kite. As a people leader now or in the future, you are the key driver in evolving our culture and creating an environment where every employee feels included, developed and empowered to fulfil their aspirations. Join Gilead and help create possible, together.  

  

**Job Description**  



At Gilead, we’re creating a healthier world for all people. For more than 35 years, we’ve tackled diseases such as HIV, viral hepatitis, COVID-19 and cancer – working relentlessly to develop therapies that help improve lives and to ensure access to these therapies across the globe. We continue to fight against the world’s biggest health challenges, and our mission requires collaboration, determination and a relentless drive to make a difference.  



Every member of Gilead’s team plays a critical role in the discovery and development of life-changing scientific innovations. Our employees are our greatest asset as we work to achieve our bold ambitions, and we’re looking for the next wave of passionate and ambitious people ready to make a direct impact.  



Job Description

**About Kite Pharma, A GILEAD Company**


Today, Kite Pharma is the leader in cell therapy. We are advancing a pipeline of oncology therapies centered on what we believe is the power of cell therapy to fundamentally change the way cancer is treated. As we extend our global reach with a new, state-of-the-art facility in Hoofddorp, we need colleagues interested in change, in challenge, and in building a new future together. Join us and discover your sense of purpose.


We are seeking a highly motivated individual for the role of Facilities Engineer III in the Engineering team within the Facilities and Engineering department. As a Facility Engineer, you will ensure Kite’s systems (facility, utilities, and equipment) operate efficiently and comply with regulatory requirements. You will oversee projects, quality record management, coordinate with external vendors, and support the maintenance, calibration and drawing management processes. You will join a team in which employees of all backgrounds and experiences are respected. The team consists of 7 Facility Engineers, and you will be reporting to the Sr. Manager Engineering.


In your role, you will:

* Ensure Kite’s systems (facility, utilities, and equipment) operate in the most efficient and safe manner and comply with applicable laws, codes, and procedures.
* Lead or participate in the change management process to support system design, performance, and continuous improvement.
* Establish and maintain maintenance and calibration plans throughout the systems’ lifecycle.
* Identify critical spare part for systems.
* Support the management of system documentation & drawing to ensure they are maintained throughout the system’s lifecycle.
* Lead or support cross-functional facility-related projects, such as expansions, upgrades, or new equipment installations.
* Collaborate with external vendors and service providers for systems’ maintenance and upgrades, including managing service agreements.
* Implement risk management into the facility, utilities, and equipment activities.
* Monitors the overall performance and reliability of systems.
* Support or oversee quality records, including change controls, deviations and CAPA.
* Participate in regulatory inspections and audits, providing engineering expertise and technical support.
* Coordinate with Facility Engineers and teams across the Kite Network to share best practices, lessons learned and standardize processes.


Your profile:

* Minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering, Biochemical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Biotechnology, or a related field.
* At least 6 years of relevant work experience preferably in a cGMP commercial manufacturing environment and understanding of regulatory requirements.
* Proven troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.
* Strong team player.
* Experience with data trending and analysis.
* Ability to read and interpret technical drawings such as PFDs, floor plans, P&IDs and electrical schematics.
* Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills.
* Demonstrated ability to learn quickly, adapt to change, and transition between projects with ease while providing support and expertise where needed.
* Strong attention-to-detail and good organizational skills.


**For jobs in the United States:**
-----------------------------------


As an equal opportunity employer, Gilead Sciences Inc. is committed to a diverse workforce. Employment decisions regarding recruitment and selection will be made without discrimination based on race, color, religion, national origin, gender, age, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, genetic information or characteristic, gender identity and expression, veteran status, or other non-job related characteristics or other prohibited grounds specified in applicable federal, state and local laws. In order to ensure reasonable accommodation for individuals protected by Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, the Vietnam Era Veterans' Readjustment Act of 1974, and Title I of the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990, applicants who require accommodation in the job application process may contact careers@gilead.com for assistance.


For more information about equal employment opportunity protections, please view the ‘Know Your Rights’ poster.


NOTICE: EMPLOYEE POLYGRAPH PROTECTION ACT  

YOUR RIGHTS UNDER THE FAMILY AND MEDICAL LEAVE ACT  

PAY TRANSPARENCY NONDISCRIMINATION PROVISION


Our environment respects individual differences and recognizes each employee as an integral member of our company. Our workforce reflects these values and celebrates the individuals who make up our growing team.


Gilead provides a work environment free of harassment and prohibited conduct. We promote and support individual differences and diversity of thoughts and opinion.

**For jobs in France:**
-----------------------


Conformément à la Loi « Informatique et Libertés » (06/01/78), nous vous informons du fait que les données personnelles renseignées pourront faire l'objet d'un traitement informatique par Gilead et pourront être transmises aux Organismes Sociaux. Par ailleurs, vous disposez d'un droit d'accès, de rectification et de suppression des données vous concernant. Vous pouvez exercer ce droit en contactant: FranceDataPrivacy@gilead.com

title: Finance Business Partner (Netherlands)
description:
Overview: **Role:** Finance Business Partner**Location:** Utrecht, Netherlands - Hybrid/Flexible**Role ID:** 2024-2461 **Our vision is to create a safe and sustainable world.**
Ricardo plc is a global strategic, environmental, and engineering consulting company. With over 100 years of engineering excellence and employing close to 3,000 employees in more than 20 countries, we provide exceptional levels of expertise in delivering leading-edge and innovative cross-sector sustainable products and solutions. Every day, we enable our customers to solve the most complex and dynamic challenges to help achieve a safe and sustainable world.  

We are currently looking for a Finance Business Partner to join our office in Utretcht, Netherlands. This role will liaise closely with the transactional team and take direction from the Senior Finance Business Partner responsible for the financial operations of the region. **Role Objective**  

The successful candidate will be responsible for the accuracy and reporting of the project performance metrics (revenue & margin) for the Region and Business Management. This includes the provision of key project based reporting, contract management and data reconciliations for revenue recognition / Project Status Report (PSR). **Key Responsibilities*** Overall responsibility for the accuracy of the management accounting suite of reports for the cluster(s).
* Provide business partner support to the cluster through targeted reporting, support for utilisation management, project structure (tax etc.) and Bid Pack assistance.
* Manage the results analysis process in line with the monthly timetable the agreed cluster review actions and risks & opportunities.
* Manage the forecast and budget processes including insights into the orderbook and pipeline phasing, utilisation trends and variance analysis.
* Provide FP&A services through the delivery of cluster reporting, project support, variance analysis.
* Oversee the periodic review and accuracy of project forecasts, including the sign off the revenue, EAC and margin relating to the monthly result.
* Coordinate the Project Review process, including maintenance of PSR information such as finish dates, project managers and review notes.
* Manage the completion of the internal governance requirements including monthly ACC and ICQ.
* Responsible for the provision of the External Order Intake (EOI) data and its reconciliation to MSD.
* Provide specialist financial and commercial assistance to the BD and Ops community in the preparation of bid pack estimates.
* Oversee the review process for CAT 4 projects including the monthly forecast update and completion of the half yearly reporting template.
* Undertake adhoc project and variance analysis work as required and provide leave / overload support.

**Behavioural Competencies*** External Focus - Builds an externally focused culture.
* Settings Goals & Priorities - Sets priorities to achieve business goals and informs direction of business area.
* Working in Teams - A key player in building and maintaining positive team culture.
* Managing and Driving Performance - Continuously drives performance / builds a high performing team.

**Required Technical Competencies*** Accounting or relevant tertiary qualifications

**Working here**
You will be warmly welcomed into our workplace where every voice matters. We are diverse thinkers and doers, coming together to create a culture of inclusion. We will support you to find your place.  

We will encourage you to use your passion and expertise to make a positive impact through the projects you work on. Your knowledge and desire to bring about change will be invaluable in helping deliver innovative solutions that support communities across the globe in becoming safer and more sustainable. **Work life balance**
We offer flexible approaches to work, whether that is working from home, being in the office, or as a hybrid worker. We're happy to discuss flexible working arrangements. Wellbeing is at the core to our culture, allowing employees to flourish and to achieve their full potential. **Benefits**
We want you to know how much you are valued. Your remuneration and benefits package will reflect that. You will receive a range of benefits which include support for your physical and mental health. **Diversity, Equality, and Inclusion statement**
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person's potential, and we'll help you reach yours. We have an ambitious diversity, equality, and inclusion approach as explained here. We value diversity; recognising that a more diverse workforce creates a richer and more varied working environment. Diversity also drives innovation, by allowing us to offer our clients the best consultancy service that we can. As part of our commitment to engage positively and pro-actively with all our employees and to ensure an inclusive culture, we are a recognised as a 'disability confident' employer. **Next steps**
Once you have submitted your application a member of our Recruitment Team will be in touch. Please be aware that the timing can vary dependent on the volume of applications that we receive for each role and in some cases, we may start to review applications prior to the closing date.  

Ricardo is a Disability confident employer please advise the recruitment team via recruit@ricardo.com if you require any adjustments to support you throughout the recruitment process.  

#LI-JT1

title: DevOps & Cloud Engineer
description:
Ready to make an impact in a dynamic and fast-growing SaaS startup? Do you thrive on building robust cloud infrastructures and driving automation? Join **Ecocharting** and help us shape the future of sustainability reporting in Europe!

**About Ecocharting**

At **Ecocharting**, we're on a mission to set the standard for sustainability reporting. We empower businesses of all sizes to achieve transparency in their environmental, social, and governance practices. With growing demand for our solutions, we are excited to expand our team with a talented **DevOps & Cloud Engineer**!

**Job Description**

As a **DevOps & Cloud Engineer**, you will design, implement, and manage our cloud infrastructure and DevOps processes. You will be responsible for ensuring the scalability and security of our AWS environment. Building and optimizing CI/CD pipelines and automating deployments is an important aspect of your role. Collaborating closely with the development team, you will drive our DevSecOps strategy, manage containerization with Docker and Kubernetes, and maintain robust monitoring and logging systems to guarantee performance and uptime. Your work will directly support our goal of delivering top-tier, reliable solutions to our clients.

**What We're Looking For:**

* Passion for cloud technologies and automation.
* Strong experience with AWS, Docker, Kubernetes, and CI/CD tools.
* Enthusiasm for DevOps practices and continuous improvement.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and a proactive mindset.
* A collaborative spirit and clear communication skills.

**What We Offer:**

* A dynamic role in a mission-driven startup.
* Flexible working hours and the ability to work remotely.
* A supportive and energetic team environment that values growth and innovation.
* Great benefits like a 13th month, extra vacation days, and more.

Ready to Join Us?

If you’re excited about using your DevOps skills to make a difference, apply today. Let’s create a more sustainable future together!

**Ecocharting** respects your privacy. All application data will be treated confidentially and used only for the recruitment process.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: From €3.500,00 per month

Work Location: Hybrid remote in 3533 HG Utrecht

title: Plant Design Expert
description:
WHAT'S THE ROLE?


Plant Design Expert will be acting as a single point of contact for a set of global / regional large accounts (EPCs such as McDermott, Aker, Wood, Fluor etc. and General Contractors) to assist them in creating a digital twin for Hilti Portfolio of products (MEP and structural supports, fire protection for penetrations and cable management solutions) in their selected Plant design software primarily Aveva E3D/ PDMS, Intergraph S3D, Bentley Microstation and Autodesk Plant3D. You will act as a technical support specialist to our sales team in the acquisition of large projects and acts a Plant design Administrator in the execution of the project. You will be based in a regional Project Management Office but will support large global projects and collaborate with a global team to ensure both short term and long-term readiness of solutions.


WHO ARE WE?


Hilti is where innovation is improving productivity, safety and sustainability in the global construction industry, and beyond. Where strong customer relationships are creating solutions that build a better future. Where there is pride and a sense of belonging across our 120 locations, carrying right into our lives and homes. Where people are exploring possibilities, leveraging their potential, owning their personal development and growing lasting careers.


WHAT DOES THE ROLE INVOLVE?


* Aligns with the PMO Head within the region and the Global Plant Design Business Owner on Project pipeline ahead and define the priorities.
* Supports Construction Project Managers and Business Developer in the project acquisition phase by explaining and demonstrating our plant design offer (3D catalogues / libraries and Smart Plug-ins) to address the account specific requirements.
* Partners with the customer’s Plant Design Administrators and Model Automation Leads to ensure necessary testing on our solutions can be performed and ensure that the catalogue holds.
* Leads the setting up of libraries and plug-ins for Hilti and Oglaend Modular supports, Firestop and Cable Management solutions.
* Acts as a single point of contact in case of challenges in installation of catalouges and supports troubleshooting on SW versions in case of conflicts.
* Trains the customer modelers and designers on using our libraries and plug-ins.
* Creates bespoke assemblies in case of customization required for project or account specific solutions.
* Internally within the organization, trains the sales and business development teams in the regions on the offer and capabilities of plant design solutions.
* Documents all customer facing activities in Salesforce and Clickup.
* Consolidates feedback from customers on challenges in existing offer and opportunities for a better solution to the Global Plant Design Business Owner.
* Partners with the Development team to support testing of libraries and documents features requests in Jira.
* Supports business development teams to share best practices and success stories on plant design projects and execution.

**''80% of our management positions are filled internally.''**

WHAT DO WE OFFER?


Show us what you’re made of and we’ll offer you opportunities to move around the business – to work abroad, experience different job functions and tackle different markets. It’s a great way to find the right match for your ambitions and achieve the exciting career you’re after.
  

  

We have a very thorough people review process, unlike any we know of in any other business. We screen everyone in the company in a yearly career performance matching process. It means we can pair talent with opportunities - developing our people in their current roles or challenging them to work in new ways or in new places. It’s how we find the right fit and further our teams personally and professionally.


WHAT YOU NEED IS:


* Degree in engineering or equivalent technical diploma
* Experience with or within EPC, Engineering Consultant, Contractors and work on Energy projects preferred.
* Minimum 5-10 years’ experience in Aveva PDMS/E3D, Integraph SP3D, Bentley, Autodesk P3D
* Experience as an Administrator preferred but not mandatory
* Good understanding of engineering practices & project execution concepts
* Strong understanding of current engineering design, drafting applications and engineering data integration software packages
* You have strong interpersonal skills to successfully perform in a global matrix environment, excellent stakeholder management skills, strong strategic, analytical and conceptual skills
* You are fluent in English (additional local languages are an asset)
* International travel activity 15 – 20%

WHY SHOULD YOU APPLY?


We have an excellent mix of people and some of our best account managers joined us with no experience of the construction industry. So, if you’ve never worked in sales or construction, that’s fine with us. Success at Hilti is down to teamwork and ability, no matter what your background.


**APPLY NOW**


**Share****Save****Be Where You Belong**
-----------------------

Find your future in a market-leading business with a truly caring and performance-driven culture.


**Who We Are**


**Explore your strengths**
--------------------------

Here at Hilti, we focus on potential over track record, giving you the chance to build on your strengths and grow your skills


**Who We Are**


**Build a better future**
-------------------------

Ever since our foundation, we have focused on innovation to drive our success and help build a better future for our customers.


**How We Work**

title: Senior Team Lead Data Management & Reporting (remote, m/f/d)
description:
Born from a single question, innovation is in our DNA. Having recently celebrated our 10-year anniversary, we are a diverse and quality-conscious company, which has set itself the goal of transporting temperature-sensitive medicines in a more reliable and sustainable way. Long story short, we help save lives and preserve the environment.


Our goal? To continue to advance towards zero loss in the pharma supply chain, worldwide.


If you are an experienced and versatile Senior Team Lead Data Management & Reporting with strong skills in designing, building, and maintaining scalable data pipelines, databases, and data workflows, while ensuring data quality, security, and compliance - this could be the role for you:

**Here's what you'll do:**

* Lead the data management team in the design and implementation of a new data architecture
* Build up an high-performance team of data / AI engineers, data scientists and reporting specialists
* Develop and communicate a clear vision for the company's data architecture and strategy
* Oversee the design, development, and maintenance of scalable data solutions and data pipelines
* Lead the development and implementation of AI and machine learning initiatives
* Ensure seamless integration of data from various sources into a unified system
* Support in the implementation of robust data quality and governance practices
* Support leadership in planning, designing, and executing projects
* Propose roadmap for technological development of applications (e.g., architecture, AI deployments)
* Develop and manage comprehensive reporting systems in close collaboration with business stakeholders
* Monitor and optimize the performance of data systems and applications
* Maintain thorough documentation of data processes, architectures, and methodologies
* Provide technical leadership and mentorship to the data management team
* Drive innovation in data management practices and tools to improve the team's effectiveness
* Promote a culture of continuous improvement and the adoption of new technologies and methodologies
* Conduct and lead regular 1-on-1s and team meetings, performance reviews and annual appraisals

**Requirements**

**This is what you'll need:**

* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, a related field or relevant working experience
* Proficiency in data engineering tools and technologies (SQL, Python, DAX, Spark, …)
* Ability to develop and implement strategic visions for data architecture and AI capabilities
* Experience with deployment of AI solutions
* Experience with IoT data and telemetry data is a plus
* Prior experience leading and managing data management teams
* Ability to understand business concepts quickly and communicate with stakeholders across the org
* Strong verbal and written communication skills to convey technical concepts and project updates clearly

**Benefits**

**What we can offer you:**

* Remote working
* Flexible working hours for work/life balance
* Interdisciplinary and varied projects
* Diverse and global work culture/ environment
* Possibility to work for an environmentally conscious company
* Unique opportunity to actively shape processes

**Why SkyCell:**


We are looking for people who challenge the status quo and thrive on making a difference to people and the world around us. That’s where our SkyMind Cloud Development team play a pivotal role and you could be a part of it.


SkyMind’s Cloud Development team builds a next-generation visibility platform that allows our customers (mainly pharma companies, but also logistics service provider) to monitor the temperature and position of their shipments in real-time. They combine this with sophisticated risk assessment capabilities, alert functionality and simulation models that allow predictions of potential issues, e.g., because a container was forgotten on a runway in Dubai. The team use modern, standard technology, constantly optimize our development processes, and have close and direct interaction with our product management function.

**We are Innovative Award Winners:**


We’re driven by our core values and guided by our collaborations, purpose, and employees. Our commitment to changing the face of medical supply chains, making them safer, more secure, and more sustainable resonates strongly with every one of our employees; we’re therefore incredibly proud to have been certified as a Great Place to Work alongside being awarded a sustainability rating of Platinum by EcoVadis.


If you would like to know more about us, visit www.skycell.ch and search #WeAreSkyCell on LinkedIn.


To become part of our journey and make a difference – click apply and we will be in touch!


Please contact Lucy Slough, Senior Talent Acquisition Specialist if you have any questions (hr@skycell.ch).

*SkyCell AG is proud to be an equal opportunities employer, we celebrate and support diversity and are passionate about creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, colour, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics.*

*For this position we only consider direct applications*

title: Global Head of Channels & Alliances
description:
**Help us bring people and businesses together**
Our SaaS platform enables multi-location brands and businesses to boost their online presence. From big to small, from Adidas to ZenPark, our client base contains some of your favourite brands as well, we bet. **The Past, Present & Future** **The Past:** Uberall was founded in 2013 by David Federhen and Florian Hübner, two longtime friends with a vision to improve customer experience across the online and offline worlds. They created a platform that connected companies with local customers in the digital-first moment. **The Present:** We're on a mission **to empower businesses to thrive locally**, and believe every business deserves success, regardless of size or location. Simply put, our location marketing platform exists to help our customers get found online and connect with customers through search, discovery, engagement, and conversion. **The Future:** We're a growing company with a bright future, and our journey to become the global leader in location marketing is well underway. We have a passionate and diverse team, a comprehensive, intuitive platform, and a clear vision for the future. We're looking for talented and passionate people (like you \uD83D\uDC4B) to join us on our journey.  

  

**You and us**  

We are approaching 400 Uberallers, with 50+ different nationalities, who live and breathe our three core values:  

\uD83C\uDF35 GROW TOGETHER* DEMONSTRATE PASSION & PERFORMANCE


✊ BE BOLD & DRIVE CHANGE  

So, what are you waiting for? If you're passionate, driven, and ready to be bold, we want you on our team! Apply now and let's grow together.\uD83D\uDE80  

As the Global Director of Channels & Alliances for Uberall, you will be the driving force behind the development and management of our partner ecosystem. Your role will include overseeing the Global Partner Acquisition Team while nurturing and expanding strategic relationships with digital agencies, systems integrators (SIs), key technology platform partners (e.g., Google, Apple, Microsoft, SAP), and mid-sized SaaS MarTech providers to spearhead joint go-to-market (GTM) initiatives.
### **Your responsibilities:**

* Lead and Develop a High-Performing Team: Recruit, hire, train, and coach both new and existing team members, ensuring a high level of performance and growth.
* Strategic Partner Engagement: Cultivate, manage, and enhance relationships with global and regional partners at the VP and C-Level, ensuring alignment with Uberall's strategic objectives.
* Process Optimization and Best Practices: Establish and refine processes, create best practices, and develop scalable models for global GTM initiatives to drive consistent success.
* GTM Leadership: Actively participate in and drive your team's joint GTM activities, ensuring the alignment of pipeline and revenue goals with the Global Direct Sales motion.
* Senior Stakeholder & Escalation Point: Serve as the senior stakeholder in both internal and customer-facing engagements, providing a clear escalation path for critical issues.
* Cross-Functional Alignment: Work closely with Sales Leadership to ensure seamless integration of partner strategies into broader sales goals.
* Mentorship and Coaching: Provide hands-on coaching and professional development for Partner Managers and the broader sales team, fostering a culture of continuous learning and excellence.
* Sales Development & Forecasting: Conduct weekly forecasts, manage sales development goals, and ensure the team meets or exceeds metrics and quota targets.
* Cross-Functional Collaboration: Collaborate proactively with Sales, Marketing, Recruitment, HR, and Customer Success teams to ensure comprehensive and successful partner engagements.

### **Ideal profile:**

* Extensive Leadership Experience: 7+ years of management experience leading a channel partner team, with a strong background in enterprise or mid-market software sales.
* Channel/Partner Management Expertise: 3-5 years of direct experience managing partnerships with digital agencies, systems integrators, and strategic technology platforms.
* Proven Success in High-Growth Environments: Demonstrated ability to grow, coach, and scale diverse, high-performing partner teams in fast-paced settings.
* Data-Driven Decision Making: A strong analytical mindset, utilizing data to identify trends, drive performance, and optimize partner strategies.
* Effective Communication & Leadership: A highly effective communicator who is curious, empathetic, and able to inspire confidence and action at all levels of the organization.
* Executive Presence: A confident yet humble leader with prior experience engaging with executive-level customers and partners.
* Willingness to Travel: Availability to travel up to 33% of the time to support partner and team initiatives across the Globe.
* Technical Proficiency: Experience with Salesforce, Google Workspace, and other common office productivity tools.

**What we offer:**  

\uD83D\uDC9C **A mission with meaning and purpose** At Uberall, we foster genuine connections between local businesses and people. Our diverse team allows us to win together with our partners, co-workers, and customers. Speaking of our customers, they’re some of the most recognizable businesses in the world.  

\uD83D\uDE01 **A truly human culture** We’re famous for our culture. Uberallers live by our values of mutual respect and boldness. We’re open, collaborative risk-takers with a whole lot of passion and grit.  

\uD83E\uDD38\uD83C\uDFFD‍ ️ **Flexibility** **to** **fit** **your** **lifestyle** Want to come to an office for collaboration? We’ve got space for you in Berlin, Amsterdam, Barcelona, Detroit, and London. We also offer co-working access in Montreal, Paris, LA and San Diego. Prefer to work remotely? Fine by us! Bonus points if we meet your pets in a video call. If working from another country is legally possible for you and within a reasonable time zone, we happily support work-ations.  

\uD83D\uDCB8 **A piece of the pie** Our pay & perks are competitive, and you better believe we review them on the regular to make sure they stay that way. We grow together, so of course all Uberallers are part of our long-term incentive program through VSOP/ESOP.* **Emotional and intellectual connection** Events and alignment sessions - YES and YES. With the team, cross-functions, regional, you name it - we love bringing people together. Uberallers share a LOT of hobbies. Whatever you’re into – reading books, baking, heavy metal, fostering kittens . . . you’ll find kindred spirits on our team.

  

\uD83E\uDDD8 **Health and Wellness** We prioritize your wellness with generous holiday time, paid parental and circumstantial leave, and individualized health and wellness opportunities depending on your location.* ️ **All-access pass** Get immersed in Uberall from day one. Your onboarding is packed with a deep dive into our values, insights into all our departments, and a chance to ask the CEO anything. We come together monthly for our town hall and product showroom so you’re always in the know.

  

\uD83C\uDF35 **Everyday growth** We support you on your non-stop learning journey. We offer development dialogues, live workshops on topics like resilience and feedback, and a Leadership Academy to make sure our leaders have all the tools to bring out the very best in teams. We also invest in your growth with a learning grant program reinforcing our commitment to fostering a culture of continuous learning.  

\uD83D\uDDA5 **Top-of-the-line** **tech** MacBook Pro, magic mouse, 2nd screen . . . Need anything else? Let the People & Culture team know.  

Remember our "**Grow Together**" value from the beginning of the ad? **We mean it.**  

\uD83C\uDF35\uD83C\uDFD4✊  

Everything starts with getting in touch. The best way to express your interest is by applying online. We will be carefully reading your profile and can't wait to hear from you.  

In the meantime, let our "life@uberall" social accounts give you some real-life impressions.  

\uD83D\uDC65 **Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Belonging:**  

At Uberall, we believe inclusion unlocks the potential of diversity. It’s right there in our number one core value – Grow Together. Sure, we’re approaching 400 unique people with over 50 nationalities working in 30 different countries, but we’re all Uberallers. That means we’re collaborative, open-minded, and assume positive intent in everything we do. We don’t judge, and we don’t exclude.  

Our flexible ways of working are designed to make sure each and every Uberaller belongs and thrives, no matter their background, abilities, or lifestyle. We don’t just think inclusion makes us stronger, we KNOW it.

title: Sr. HR Specialist (Contractor)
description:
Crocs, Inc. (NASDAQ: CROX) is a world leader in innovative casual footwear for men, women and children. The company offers several distinct shoe collections with more than 300 four-season footwear styles. All Crocs™ shoes feature Croslite™ material, a proprietary, revolutionary technology that gives each pair of shoes the soft, comfortable, lightweight, non-marking and odor-resistant qualities that Crocs wearers know and love. Crocs fans "Get Crocs Inside" every pair of shoes, from the iconic clog to new sneakers, sandals, boots and heels. Since its inception in 2002, Crocs has sold more than 200 million pairs of shoes in more than 90 countries around the world.


**Introduction on the role:**


**Location: Hoofddorp – Hybrid (3 days office, 2 days home)**


**Fulltime 40h, EUR 50-60 per hour (depending on experience)**


**Duration: 3 months**


**Must have KVK set up – self-employed status**


**Start: ASAP**



The Sr. HR Specialist serves as a main resource for Crocs' employees contacting our HR Service Center. You will answer employee queries via the HR Service Desk, emails and chats providing information regarding company specific HR policies and/or procedures, while following the Crocs and locally relevant guidelines. Inquiries may include, but are not limited to; employee benefit plans, paid time off, assistance navigating our systems, employee life cycle questions and payroll related questions. In some cases, issues may be raised to internal resources, including COEs and HRBPs for further research and resolution. Through processing of data and responding to many different inquiries, you will develop a solid understanding of HR policies and procedures.


**What will you do?**


* Responds to inquiries and resolves matters including, but not limited to, HR policy and procedure, employee benefits including health and wellness benefits, leave management, employee life cycle, support on immigration procedures including 30% ruling and visa extension application.
* Serve as the administrator for the HR system (Success Factors) and HR Service Desk. Record and track employee data, such as promotions, terminations, new hires, compensation and organization changes.
* Prepares supporting documentation for new hires, terminations and any employee life cycle changes
* Prepares external documentation for Unemployment Agencies, Health Insurance etc.,
* Assists employees and Managers navigating SuccessFactors self-service application.
* Reviews policies, procedures & internal resource materials, through work experience develops knowledge of all subjects handled by HR Shared Services in a continuous learning environment and rotation.
* Conduct auditing and maintenance of employee files
* Administers Leaves of Absence according to specific leave laws
* Ensures accurate & timely data transfer to the Payroll Team
* Other administrative duties as required.


**Who are you?**


* **5+** **years of****experience** **as a HR** **administrator,** **specialist** **or** **generalist**
* Knowledge of Dutch labor law and immigration procedure.
* Ability to multi-task and be flexible in a fast-paced, constantly evolving environment
* Excellent communication (written & oral), and interpersonal skills
* Focused attention to detail along with developed organizational skills
* Employee experience oriented and follow-through skills including patience and comfort engaging with challenging situations
* Ability to maintain strict confidentiality
* Experience with working with **Success****F****actors is** **a must**


**What do we offer?**


* A job within a unique environment with a 'startup dynamic' under the umbrella of a fast growing and solid global brand.
* 40 hours per week, in-office and remote combined
* Fun workplace, innovating working environment.
* And so much more!


Sounds pretty amazing right? Well, what are you waiting for?!


*We value diversity and provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.*

title: HR Advisor
description:
#### **Support**

Are you an HR professional who gets energy from working with people and supporting colleagues? Do you enjoy dealing with HR issues within the legal world? In this all-round HR position you will have the opportunity to work and develop yourself at all levels of the HR field. What level are you at in your career? We find that less important. We look at your interests and capabilities with you. We then determine the content of the position together. Are you ready to take on the challenge at Poelmann van den Broek attorneys ?
**28 hours****Hbo****Nijmegen****3,505.60 and 5,007.64****About this position**
-----------------------



As an HR consultant, you will work on current HR topics. Here you can think of recruitment and selection of staff, absenteeism, diversity, talent management and supervising assessment interviews. You will also cast a critical eye over current HR processes within the office, such as personnel management and the onboarding of new colleagues. You have short lines of communication with the director, the board, attorneys and the colleagues of team Support. Together you will arrive at the best approach, ensuring that processes run smoothly.


### **Your focus**



As an HR advisor, you are an important lynchpin in the organization. In addition to your daily work as a human resources consultant, you have an eye for everyone's interests. You are responsible for developing and implementing an effective HR policy that matches the dynamics of the legal profession. Your HR expertise enables you to create support for an integrated HR approach with impact and persuasiveness.


### **Your profile**



We are not looking for the sheep with five legs. This sheep does not exist. We are looking for a pleasant HR advisor with whom we can work well together. We will decide together what your position will look like. You have a Bachelor's degree in the HR field and at least 3 years of specific work experience in a business environment. Your knowledge of HR-related laws and regulations and strategic innovations is up-to-date. Furthermore, you are a pleasant interlocutor, have good communication skills and are able to interact at different levels. You are proactive, think in solutions and know how to find a balance between the interests of the organization and those of the employees. Because you naturally position yourself centrally and visibly, employees know how to find you with all kinds of basic and complex questions. Your coaching skills and listening ear will be greatly appreciated.


#### **This makes it extra fun**


* A salary between €3,505.60 and €5,007.64 gross per month (depending on age and work experience) based on 40-hour (full-time) employment, according to job group 8.
* 25 vacation days based on a 40-hour work week.
* Maximum of 3 mandatory leave days, 2 of which are at the employer's expense.
* Work-from-home opportunities and compensation.

**This is how you stay sharp**
------------------------------



With us, you can make the most of your talents. That is why we have developed a talent management program. This program gives you the opportunity, even if you already have a lot of work experience, to continue to develop. Together with your 'buddy' you regularly discuss your ambitions and development questions. We are happy to help you with this.


### **Babs****Nijhuis**

### **Recruiter**


**Questions about this vacancy?**
---------------------------------


#### **Ask your question to Babs**


**085 - 049 09 22****b.nijhuis@pvdb.nl****Our office between the lines**
--------------------------------

### **No lawyer language**

We speak the same language as our customers, which are almost all business owners. So no fancy talk and long-winded texts. (Legal) advice on an A4, that idea. But then, of course, ironclad advice.
### **Sharper on sustainable**

We always advise our clients with an eye to the future. And so we also look at our own actions. How sustainable are we now and can we be better? For example, less printing, more planting. Your ideas are more than welcome.
### **Croissants and apple turnovers**

Something sweet with coffee, we just love that. That also means we like to exercise. Because that gown, while it is wide, with all those croissants and apple turnovers, we want the scales to stay balanced. Just like the relationship between personal and work.
### **Legendary outings**

From free mibo to office cabaret, we like to make it fun. If someone is going to do the Seven Hills Run, a few colleagues join in like this. We also go skiing together every year. And if you prefer to skip these outings? Even then you will feel at home with us.
**Your application in pictures**
--------------------------------


Yes! Is that your thought when you see our job posting? Then here is a sneak peek of the first steps on your career path with us. We don't select by name, but by content.





### **We will call or email you within 3 business days.**

### 

### **A 2nd interview may be followed by an assessment.**

### **You happy? We happy? Let's go!**

### **Feel welcome even before your first day of work.**

### **Breaking in is something we do thoroughly.**

### **We stay sharp. How do you want to grow?**

**Enthusiastic?**
-----------------


#### **Everyone is welcome**



We strive to be an equal opportunity employer. As such, we are committed to equal employment opportunities to the fullest extent. This is because we believe that we achieve the best results when we bring together different personalities, perspectives and backgrounds.


#### **Cup of coffee?**



Have you become curious after reading this vacancy? Then we warmly invite you to come and have a cup of coffee with Arjan without any obligation.



You may also apply directly, of course. Gladly even! Please use the form to do so.

title: Human Resources Coordinator
description:
**Job Number** 24155958  

**Job Category** Human Resources  

**Location** Aruba Marriott Resort & Stellaris Casino, L.G. Smith Boulevard # 101, Palm Beach, Aruba, Aruba VIEW ON MAP  

**Schedule** Full-Time  

**Located Remotely?** N  

**Relocation?** N  

**Position Type** Non-Management  



**Human Resources Coordinator**

  



Create and maintain filing systems. Create and type office correspondence using a computer. Distribute and route mail. Order and track Human Resources office supplies and forms. Answer phone calls and record messages. Create new employee personnel file. Assist walk-in candidates with application procedures. Maintain space designated for completing applications and ensure it is clean, well maintained, and accessible to individuals with disabilities. Respond to questions, requests, and concerns from employees and management regarding company and Human Resources programs, policies and guidelines. Inform Human Resources management of issues related to employee relations within the division or property. Maintain confidentiality and security of employee and property records, files, and information. Ensure accurate maintenance of all employee records and files (e.g., interview documents, I-9's).

  



Follow all company policies and procedures; ensure uniform and personal appearance are clean and professional; maintain confidentiality of proprietary information; protect company assets. Report accidents, injuries, and unsafe work conditions to manager. Welcome and acknowledge all guests according to company standards. Speak with others using clear and professional language; prepare and review written documents accurately and completely; answer telephones using appropriate etiquette. Develop and maintain positive working relationships with others; support team to reach common goals; listen and respond appropriately to the concerns of other employees. Ensure adherence to quality expectations and standards. Enter and locate work-related information using computers and/or point of sale systems. Move, lift, carry, push, pull, and place objects weighing less than or equal to 10 pounds without assistance. Perform other reasonable job duties as requested by Supervisors.

  



PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS


Education: High school diploma or G.E.D. equivalent.


Related Work Experience: At least 1 year of related work experience.


Supervisory Experience: No supervisory experience.


License or Certification: None

  



*Marriott International is an equal opportunity employer. We believe in hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive, people-first culture. We are committed to non-discrimination on any protected basis, such as disability and veteran status, or any other basis covered under applicable law.*

  

Marriott Hotels strive to elevate the art of hospitality, innovating at every opportunity while keeping the comfort of the oh-so-familiar all around the globe. As a host with Marriott Hotels, you will help keep the promise of “Wonderful Hospitality. Always.” by delivering thoughtful, heartfelt, forward-thinking service that upholds and builds upon this living legacy. With the name that’s synonymous with hospitality the world over, we are proud to welcome you to explore a career with Marriott Hotels. In joining Marriott Hotels, you join a portfolio of brands with Marriott International. **Be** where you can do your best work, **begin** your purpose, **belong** to an amazing global team, and **become** the best version of you.

JW Marriott is part of Marriott International's luxury portfolio and consists of more than 100 beautiful properties in gateway cities and distinctive resort locations around the world. JW believes our associates come first. Because if you’re happy, our guests will be happy. JW Marriott associates are confident, innovative, genuine, intuitive, and carry on the legacy of the brand’s namesake and company founder, J.Willard Marriott. Our hotels offer a work experience unlike any other, where you’ll be part of a community and enjoy true camaraderie with a diverse group of co-workers. JW creates opportunities for training, development, recognition and most importantly, a place where you can pursue your passions in a luxury environment with a focus on holistic well-being. Treating guests exceptionally starts with the way we take care of our associates. That’s The JW Treatment™. In joining JW Marriott, you join a portfolio of brands with Marriott International. **Be** where you can do your best work, **begin** your purpose, **belong** to an amazing global team, and **become** the best version of you.

title: Financing & HR Administrator
description:
Position: Employee (definite period of employment contract) related to Financing and HR Administrator

Company Profile:

Daedong was founded in 1947 and has led the development of Korean agriculture for over 75 years. We have recorded countless ‘firsts’ in history to become the No. 1 agricultural machinery company in Korea. And now we challenge ourselves to lead future agriculture with Smart Agricultural Machine, Smart Mobility and Smart Farm. Continuous challenge and innovation, and our will to contribute to society through agricultural development - this is the DNA of Daedong.

Job Summary:

The Financing & HR Staff plays a critical role in supporting both financial and human resource functions within the organization. This hybrid position involves managing essential financial processes, such as budgeting, payroll, financial reporting, and expense management, while simultaneously overseeing HR activities like recruitment, onboarding, employee records, and compliance with labor laws. The position requires strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and the ability to manage multiple tasks efficiently in both finance and human resources.

Key responsabilites of the job:

· Financial Responsibilities:

1) Assist in budget preparation and financial forecasting.

2) Manage and process payroll in a timely and accurate manner.

3) Maintain financial records and ensure they are compliant with legal and internal policies.

4) Support month-end and year-end close processes.

5) Monitor company’s financial performance and create financial reports as required.

6) Handle accounts payable and receivable, including invoice processing and collections.

· Human Resource Responsibilities:

1) Assist with recruitment activities including job postings, screening, and interviewing candidates.

2) Manage employee records, ensuring data is accurate and up-to-date.

3) Handle employee onboarding and offboarding processes.

4) Maintain compliance with labor laws and HR policies.

5) Address employee queries related to payroll, benefits, and policies.

6) Support performance appraisal and development planning processes.

Educational and physical recuirements:

· A person with a degree in Finance or Business Administration.

· A person who can speak English and Dutch.

· Experience in developing and implementing strategic and business plans.

· Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills.

· Strong analytical, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills.

· Able to excel in high-pressure situations.

· Proficient in Microsoft Office

Annual salary can be discussed for experienced workers.

Soort dienstverband: Fulltime

Salaris: Vanaf €3.100,00 per maand

Werkschema:

* ma-vr

Werklocatie: Fysiek

title: HR Business Partner I
description:
We are looking for the right people — people who want to innovate, achieve, grow and lead. We attract and retain the best talent by investing in our employees and empowering them to develop themselves and their careers. Experience the challenges, rewards and opportunity of working for one of the world’s largest providers of products and services to the global energy industry.

**Job Duties and Qualifications**
---------------------------------

* Under broad direction, understands and translates business data and needs to deliver effective, regional or global HR services for a business unit.
* Consults with local leadership on report generation and interpretation of HR data and aligns HR metrics to business metrics.
* Coaches and counsels leaders on people management and the impact of business decisions.
* Collaborates and consults with management and other HR functions to proactively determine and deliver relevant and impactful HR solutions to regional or global business challenges.
* Analyzes HR and business trends in order to provide feedback to the Centers of Excellence (COEs), HR Service Centers, HR Business Partners and business unit leaders on the efficient and effective delivery of HR products and services.
* Shares business expertise with COEs in order to develop HR solutions, programs, and services that will further increase business effectiveness and productivity.
* Collaborates with COE and HRBP leads to support the implementation of new HR strategies, policies, plans, and procedures.
* Supports succession planning and leadership development for a business unit.
* Supports management in the timely and effective resolution of employee relations issues.
* Requires completion of an undergraduate degree in Business Administration, Human Resources Management, or other related discipline and a minimum of three years of experience.
* Master's degree and Professional HR Certification preferred.
**Halliburton is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, citizenship, marital status, sex/gender, sexual preference/ orientation, gender identity, age, veteran status, national origin, or any other status protected by law or regulation**.

 **Location**


Columbusstraat 19, Emmen, , 7825 VP, Netherlands

**Requisition Number:** 191893  

**Experience Level:** Experienced Hire  

**Job Family:** Human Resources  

**Product Service Line:** Human Resources  

**Full Time / Part Time:** Full Time

Compensation is competitive and commensurate with experience.

title: HR and Recruitment officer
description:
Are you passionate about people and eager to kickstart your career in HR? Do you have a growth mindset, a keen eye for detail, and a strong desire to learn and develop in a dynamic environment? If the answer is yes, then we are looking for you!

 **What are you going to do?**



We are looking for an enthusiastic HR Officer with a focus on recruitment to join our Talent team at SparkOptimus in Amsterdam, with the flexibility to work remotely for 2 days a week. In this role, you’ll play a crucial part in our talent acquisition efforts, while also gaining hands-on experience in a wide range of HR operations. Your primary goal will be to support the recruitment process, manage HR coordination tasks, and contribute to the overall success of our Talent team.



You’ll coordinate the recruitment process from job postings to interview scheduling and job offers, ensuring a positive experience for candidates. You’ll also handle HR operations such as drafting contracts, managing visa applications, and maintaining accurate employee records. This role is perfect for someone at the start of their career who is eager to learn and grow in the HR field.

  

* Assist in coordinating the end-to-end recruitment process, including job postings, sourcing, and interview scheduling.
* Support HR operations, such as preparing employment contracts, processing visa applications, and maintaining accurate employee records.
* Contribute to the onboarding process, helping new hires transition smoothly into the company.
* Collaborate with the Talent team to support various HR initiatives and projects.
* Provide support to employees with HR-related questions, ensuring they have a positive experience.
* Help organize and coordinate Talent team activities and events.
* Continuously seek opportunities to learn and develop within the HR field.


You are passionate about people, detail-oriented, and excited about starting your career in HR. You bring a positive, can-do attitude to everything you do and are ready to grow with us.

 **Who we** **are**

*You’ve never heard of SparkOptimus? No problem.*

  


Since 2010, SparkOptimus has established itself as a leading European digital consultancy, guiding over 350 clients across more than 25 countries through over 1,000 successful projects. Our expertise lies in the digital, sustainable, and (Gen) AI landscapes, and providing tailored strategic consultancy that bridges the gap between vision and execution, ensuring our clients not only conceptualize innovative strategies but also implement them effectively. We actively support social organizations such as RefugeeHelp and SOS Kinderdorp, demonstrating our commitment to broader social responsibility. With headquarters in Amsterdam and hubs in Düsseldorf and Zürich, we manage over 160 projects annually for clients including Bol.com, eBay, IKEA, and Heineken.

  



**Why you should join** **us**

* Endless growth, learning, and development opportunities within an internationally operating company with purpose.
* The chance to gain hands-on experience in both recruitment and HR operations.
* A very positive work environment in a young, dynamic, and informal team.
* A supportive and friendly team to help you develop in the role.
* Enjoy daily delicious and healthy breakfast, lunch, and snacks.
* Work from our office in the center of Amsterdam.
* Participate in regular company events and team activities throughout the year.
* Collaborate with a team of dedicated professionals.
### **Requirements**

* Minimum HBO working and thinking level, with a focus on Recruiting, HR or Psychology
* A passion for people and an eagerness to start and grow your career in HR.
* Strong organizational skills, accuracy, and attention to detail.
* Excellent command of English, both written and verbal.
* Good command of Office365 and an interest in learning HR software.
* A proactive and positive attitude with a growth mindset.
* Flexible approach to working hours, not limited to the typical 9-5.
* Availability to work at least 3 days in our office in Amsterdam, with Friday being our mandatory office day.

title: HR Administrator Romanian
description:
We are looking for Romanian speaking employees to join our team!


You probably know us, Action. That nice store where you can buy the craft supplies for the children at an affordable price, load your basket full just before the new school year starts, or score the right tools for that too long delayed chore at home. Did you also know that we have a large HR department and more than 70,000 employees working for us for which a lot of administrative work has to be done? Curious about the administrative work of our HR department? Nice, we are curious about you!**This is your daily action**
-----------------------------

  

  

For our international head office, we are looking for colleagues who can help take care of the personnel administration of the countries where we are now active in, namely: the Netherlands, Belgium, Germany, France, Luxembourg, Austria, Poland, Czechia, Italy, Slovakia, Spain and Portugal. Within our personnel administration we work with four teams, each of which is responsible for the HR administration of their respective countries.


The HR administration department is the backbone of Action’s employee management across Europe. Each country team in the department is responsible for overseeing all administrative aspects of the employee lifecycle, from hiring and onboarding to timekeeping and contract changes. In terms of hiring, the country teams are responsible for drafting contracts, verifying new hire information, and providing a smooth onboarding experience, making a crucial first impression on new colleagues. For time management, they ensure that all hours worked are accurately recorded in the system, that salaries are correctly calculated and paid, and that absenteeism is properly registered, ensuring compliance with local labor laws. Lastly, each team manages any changes during an employee’s tenure, such as role transitions or address updates, and handles all related documentation, including employer statements and work permits.**This is you**
---------------

  

  

Helping your colleagues gives you energy and accurately performing the HR administration is a challenge that appeals to you. Action has an international character, which means that you form an international team with your colleagues. It therefore helps if your command of English is sufficient. This way you can discuss the challenges of the day with your colleagues and participate in the monthly international online pub quiz. Furthermore, we believe that the following things will help you:

* Completed MBO or university education, preferably in the direction of HR or administration
* 0-3 years administrative experience
* Good knowledge of English and Romanian
* Do you also speak the language of one of the other countries where we operate? Then that is a big advantage!
**What we offer**
-----------------

  

  

Surprisingly much! From our international headquarters in the Netherlands you have an impact on what happens in our stores across Europe. We welcome more than 15 million customers every week in more than 2,500 stores in 12 European countries. We have great growth ambitions. For Action and for you. Because our growth means that you can always take new steps. A different position, an interesting innovation project, new skills: you can continue to develop as a professional. And all this in a culture where our shared values are truly lived: customer focus, teamwork, simplicity, discipline, cost conscious and respect.


Did you know that you can also count on us for:

* A hybrid work model
* A temporary contract with the intention of offering you a permanent contract in the long term
* 24 days of holiday and the option to buy 5 extra days (based on full time employment)
* 15% staff discount on your purchases at Action
* Travel allowance and work from home allowance
* A company laptop
* Extensive education and training at our own Action Academy
* A good pension scheme and collective health insurance
**How we contribute to society**
--------------------------------

  

  

If you only know Action from the stores, a world will open up for you when you come and work with us. We work hard to make a positive impact on society and the environment. Did you know, for example, that we sponsor more than 2,500 children worldwide who grow up in an SOS Children's Village? That our team reflects the diversity of our customers, including 155 different nationalities? That we purchase 94% of our wood products and 100% of our cotton sustainably? And that almost all our stores only use energy-efficient LED lighting? Yes, that is also Action. Curious about what other initiatives we’re facilitating? Join our team and find out for yourself.**Interested?**
---------------

  

  

We are proud to be an inclusive employer, and we warmly invite anyone who recognises themselves in the vacancy to apply. So take action and respond to this vacancy now!


What happens next:

* Response to your application from our recruitment team within 14 days (and usually earlier)
* First interview with your future manager
* Second interview with your future colleagues
* Welcome to Action!


Throughout the process, your recruiter is your permanent point of contact and is available to answer any questions you may have.

title: HR Advisor and Management Assistant
description:
Job Description:

For our **Distribution Center** in **Helmond,** we are looking for an **HR Advisor and Management Assistant.**  

  

**Your meaningful purpose**  

Provide excellent assistance to employees and managers and support smooth running of the HR activity in our Distribution Center. **What will you do?*** Advise and coach Supervisors and Teamleaders according to the HR policy
* Advise Supervisors and Teamleaders in absenteeism and employment condition.
* Developing employee relations (specially with warehouse operators) to increase employee engagement
* Lead some assistant tasks for HR Business Partner and DC Director
* Managing payroll preperation
* Managing on- and offboardingprovcess

Qualifications:
**What qualifications will make you successful?*** HBO Diploma in HR

 **Who will you report to?**  

  

HR Business Partner.  

#LI-DM4**Let us learn about you! Apply today.** **You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled.**  


About Our Company:

At Schneider Electric we're committed to creating a workplace that gives you not just a job but a **meaningful** purpose in joining our mission to bring energy and efficiency to enable life, progress and sustainability for all.

€34.2bn global revenue
