This extends to our Candidates and is embedded in our Hiring Practices.* *You can find out more about our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion* *here* *and our DEI Policy* *here* *Schneider Electric is an Equal Opportunity Employer. It is our policy to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion,* *color**, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct.*

title: HR Specialist / Office Administrator
description:
**HR Specialist / Office Administrator**
========================================

**POSITION SUMMARY**
====================


The HR Specialist / Office Admin is responsible for performing a wide variety of administrative and HR-related duties that ensure our department runs efficiently. This role works closely with our global HR team to support our global footprint and specifically the Rotterdam office. A high degree of professionalism and discretion is required, and the ability to recognize best practices and approach when representing company policies and employee needs. Key areas of involvement are recruiting/selection, onboarding, support of compliance, HRIS administration, employee events, business meetings, office administration, and training coordination.

**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES**
========================

***HR related tasks:***
=======================

* Enter/Maintain Employee information into HRIS System
* Maintain standard reports, dashboards, key HR metrics within our HRIS system
* Assist HR team with key areas of Selection/Recruiting/Onboarding
* Administer online job postings and work in various recruiting platforms for job boards: Indeed, LinkedIn, etc.
* Assist with Benefit and Worker’s Comp Administration
* Review and coordinate key compliance areas of HR to ensure accurate, consistent information: compliance postings, job descriptions, HR file storage, policy updates, File Retention, Leave Administration, Payroll documents, Holiday Schedules, etc.
* Maintain/Audit employee files – hard copy and/or electronic – secure and confidential
* Assist with the development and ongoing updates with Employee Handbooks
* Assist with preparing internal communications
* Coordinate and handle logistics of meetings, employee events, and training
* Support recruitment process for Europe and Asia, including coordination of recruitment agencies when needed, job postings, education/internship relationships, etc.
* Align with recruitment process; maintain and optimize existing ATS
* Manage onboarding process, prepare necessary documents and execute timely and accurately
* Conduct new hire orientation and ensure smooth, informative onboarding experience
* Develop positive employee interactions
* Work on health and safety regulations; track BHV trainings in the Netherlands. Understand application of law requirements in various countries and implement relevant procedures
* Manage periodical medical check-ups.
* Register / deregister sick employees.
* Assist HR Generalist with payroll and all other duties as required

***Office management related tasks:***
======================================

* Support facilities management for European office locations – leases, vendors, maintenance, etc.
* Maintain relationships with landlords to promptly communicate and resolve issues.
* Manage vendor relationships and contracts (break room food delivery, cleaning services, water dispenser supplier, office supplies, etc) and serve as a main point of contact
* Coordinate/Participate in corporate and office events

**SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE, ABILITIES**
================================

* Organized, detail-oriented, and solutions oriented
* Ability to follow and develop internal processes
* Knowledge of Employment Law, Basic Compliance, Payroll, and General HR Practices
* Willingness to learn and develop new skills; open to changing responsibilities
* Superior oral and written communication skills with the ability to adjust communication style based on the audience.
* Ability to maintain a high degree of confidentiality in all tasks; experience managing confidential information is required
* Must possess a high degree of professionalism with excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to develop rapport, trust, and positive working relationships with all employees.
* Demonstrate ability to complete all tasks with a high degree of accuracy, attention to detail, and follow-up.
* Work calmly and effectively in a fast-paced environment
* Ability to Travel
* Flexibility - Adaptable

**MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS**
==========================

* University Degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field preferred
* 3+ years of relevant experience
* Fluency in **English and Dutch** is required; French would be a plus
* Proficient in MS Office applications, including PowerPoint, Excel, Outlook, and Word; experience with HRIS and ATS is desired.
* Experience with Adobe, Employee Forms, Surveys, Charts, Reporting, and regular manipulation of HR related data

title: HR Officer
description:
Do you have experience managing a well-organized HR administration? Do you thrive on a successful and accurate payroll cycle? Do you enjoy building a strong HR team? Then we are looking for you!


**What does your day look like?**
---------------------------------


As a member of our HR team, your workday naturally starts with a good cup of coffee or tea! You log in and check the incoming tasks in our HR information system, COBRA. You filter out the priorities, such as reporting sickness and recovery, and schedule the remaining tasks for a later time. By now, your HR colleagues have also arrived at the office, and you have a brief and efficient morning stand-up. Together, you form the HR team of KRANENDONK!



As an HR Officer, you are responsible for overseeing HR policies and play a crucial role in various HR activities. Your focus is primarily on administrative tasks: drafting new contract proposals with accompanying pro forma calculations, preparing and managing onboarding and offboarding processes, processing and confirming changes to employment terms, coordinating and scheduling HR and recruitment interviews, conducting telephone screenings based on applications, managing the monthly payroll administration for both domestic and international employees, and ensuring the timekeeping records are in perfect order.



You are a real go-getter and are not intimidated by a bit of chaos! While drafting an employment contract for a new colleague, someone might walk in with an urgent question. You provide immediate assistance and then dive back into the administration, all while ensuring the process is safeguarded for the future.



At the end of the day, you receive an email from our HR Manager with a request to invite a candidate for a second interview. You check the calendars, confirm availability with the Team Leads, and send out a meeting request. After reserving the meeting room, you tidy up and get ready to head home.



**What can you expect?**
------------------------


What connects us every day is our culture and the way we work together. A place where you can discover and experiment. And you can always fall back on others if you don't know. A company who is serving customers around the globe for delivery of highly reliable automated welding- and cutting solutions and after sales support.



At KRANENDONK we put people first. Here you work together with a team of experts, you work every day with the latest techniques, with the aim of helping our customers move forward. Because you grow together!


**What are you bringing?**
--------------------------


* A completed education in the field of HR; for example, Human Resource Management or Personnel Management
* Availability for 40 hours per week
* A professional, driven, and above all, independently minded candidate
* Excellent command of the English language, both written and spoken
* You have no trouble establishing and maintaining contact
* Experience with Windows and Office. Experience with an HR personnel and payroll system is a plus
* Do the following keywords apply to you? Integrity, empathy, reliability, accuracy, organization, and attention to detail!
**What do we offer?**
---------------------


Will you become our HR Officer at KRANENDONK? Then we offer you a role at the top of industrial automation, dedicated to serving our global customers. Our company building in Tiel offers all the facilities you would expect from a modern company building. Fresh fruit, coffee, tea and soft drinks are of course not missing during your workday.



You will also receive a competitive salary based on your experience. In addition, we offer a generous travel allowance and an excellent pension plan. Moreover, you’ll find plenty of camaraderie with your new colleagues here. We have monthly drinks, legendary parties, the most enjoyable team activities, and an informal atmosphere.


**We are happy to take the next step together with you!**
---------------------------------------------------------


**Excited? We’d love to hear from you.** Send your CV directly to KRANENDONK . We will get in touch with you within three working days.



For more information or questions about the HR Officer position, you can contact Jennifer van Bavel, HR Officer, at +31 344-623944 or via email at j.van.bavel@kranendonk.com.

title: HR Business Partner
description:
Flow Traders is looking for a HR Business Partner to join our EMEA HR team based in our Amsterdam office. The role will focus on coaching and guiding managers on all employee-related topics, as well as playing a key role in the design and execution of Flow Traders' people strategy. You will act as an enabler of success across the organization. You will work closely with regional leadership and the Head of HR to uphold our company culture and cultivate a strong, symbiotic relationship between HR and the business.  

  

The Amsterdam HR team currently comprises 7 colleagues: 3 HR Business Partners, 2HR Generalists, 1 Reward and Policies Specialist, all of whom report into the Head of HR. We also have local HR colleagues in our international offices, with all HR Team Leads reporting into the Global Head of HR and Recruitment, who is based in Amsterdam. As Flow Traders has differentiated themselves from competitors through a very employee-centric company culture, the HR department has a crucial role in maintaining this aspect and taking it to the next level. Our team focuses on the operational part of HR, but also on various projects concerning employee motivation, satisfaction and retention.

  


#### **What you will do**


* Actively support our Heads of Trading in the day-to-day business and workforce/capacity planning
* Deliver HR-related strategic insight to the business
* Coach and guide managers on all employee-related topics such as: talent development, performance management practices and conversations, engagement and absence management, sick leave, HR data reporting, etc.
* Manage all employee relations scenarios: independently address inquiries, develop solutions, provide guidance to Management and/or employees, and ensure timely resolutions
* Drive the successful execution of HR Projects within established timelines, ensuring consistent application across the organization, and identifying areas of improvement
* Analyze and interpret workforce metrics on a regular and ad-hoc basis with a focus on continuous process improvement

  


#### **What you need to succeed**


* University Degree in HRM, Business Administration or similar
* 2+ years of working experience as HRBP (ideally in an international environment)
* Fluent written and spoken English communication skills as well as professional level Dutch communication skills
* In-depth knowledge of, and experience with, Dutch Labour Law and legal requirements
* Proficient skills in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, etc.) and solid working experience with HR systems; general aptitude to learn new systems
* A passion for engaging and empowering employees at all levels
* A strong sense of urgency and the ability to organize and prioritize multiple competing tasks, with a focus on results and a pleasant employee experience
* The ability to challenge the status quo to drive the business forward
* The ability to understand and translate function strategy and objectives into talent and culture actions and develop clear steps for the Management to execute upon
* Strong analytical and numeric skills; able to synthesize data to net out the key points
* Available for a minimum of 32 hours per week

  


*Flow Traders does not accept unsolicited resumes from any professional staffing or search firms. All resumes, and any other information identifying potential candidates, submitted to any employee at Flow Traders via-email, the Internet or directly without a valid and signed search agreement will be deemed free to contact by Flow Traders without any restrictions and no placement fee of any kind will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by Flow Traders.*

title: Senior HR Advisor
description:
We are AVer Europe - your partner in intelligent technological solutions for business and education. With over 20 years of research, development and manufacturing excellence, AVer is a proud recipient of numerous international design, innovation, application, and service awards centered on exceptional product usability, reliability and customer satisfaction, sustaining our market leadership position as a reflection of our drive to craft quality products and services.

Spanning 4 separate continents with 15 international offices serving over 100 countries through 700 employees worldwide, our far-reaching international presence and extensive network of reliable distribution channels continue to empower us to serve our customers on a global scale with unsurpassed service and dedicated support.

**Your role:**

As a full-time Senior HR Advisor, you'll provide essential support to the Directors and team, focusing on HR activities such as recruitment, onboarding, talent development, performance management and employee relations. You'll also manage compliance and payroll processes. Additionally, you'll play a key role in fostering our company culture and managing local labor relations. Help us attract, develop, and retain a motivated workforce.

* Develop and implement effective HR processes and systems to support organizational needs and ensure compliance.
* Manage the HR budget and strategic workforce planning to align with business goals.
* Support the implementation of Global HR strategies and build strong partnerships with internal and external stakeholders.
* Respond to HR inquiries and manage requests efficiently, ensuring timely resolution of issues.
* Ensure accurate payroll submissions and generate reports on HR metrics for management review.
* Facilitate onboarding processes and drive talent management programs to enhance employee development.
* Oversee employee relations and wellness initiatives to foster a positive workplace.
* Guide managers on HR best practices, performance management, and disciplinary actions.

**About you:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field
* Minimum 5 years of HR generalist experience
* Proven knowledge of regulatory obligations and compliance
* Knowledge of Dutch employment law and regulations
* Ability to manage difficult situations and conflicts with empathy and emotional intelligence
* Fluent in English and Dutch (both written and spoken).

**Benefits**

We are offering an excellent opportunity with a competitive salary, 25 vacation days, pension plan, Performance Incentive, laptop & telephone and opportunities for personal development and growth.

Soort dienstverband: Fulltime

Salaris: €4.000,00 - €5.500,00 per maand

Aanvullende vergoedingen:

* Bonusregeling
* Vakantiegeld

Arbeidsvoorwaarden:

* Pensioen
* Reiskostenvergoeding

Werkschema:

* ma-vr

Werklocatie: Fysiek

title: HR Service Coordinator
description:
#### **The role**



As HR Service Coordinator for the Swisscom DevOps Center you are responsible for HR operational services. This contains consisting out of the HR Generalists and our external HR service partner.



You will be responsible to ensure our 400+ Swisscom DevOps Center employees are served, supported by answering questions, guiding them through our HR processes following Swisscom policies with a professional but personal approach.



Meanwhile, you ensure smooth operational processes within expectations: improved employee satisfaction, lead-time management of raised cases, data driven reporting, process improvement proposals and/or existing policies.



HR service happiness within the team is an important element of your daily activities!  



  

  

  

***What you will do***


* Coordinate and carry out HR operational services in collaboration with the HR services partner and with HRBP's, like:
* Relocation, onboarding and offboarding of employees
* Sick leave reporting, service travel, work from abroad
* Home Office equipment, benefits, like: future savings
* Employee statements, diversity reports
* Chargeability, mutations, expense claims
* Conduct employee feedback meetings and exit interviews
* Guide and coach Swisscom DevOps Center HR Generalist employees and team alignment with employees of our HR service partner in all processes, administration and activities
* Chairing the Monthly review meeting with the HR services partner
* Manage the HR ticketing system, generate reports, provide analysis
* Diagnose and identify areas of improvement and drive appropriate solutions, striking the right balance between speed and processes
* Review, update, and communicate HR policies and processes
* Implementing changes to employment conditions or staff manual considering the local labor law.
  



 ***Who will be a great fit***


* ***You are already living in the Netherlands, and have good knowledge of Dutch labor law including employment regulations***
* 3+ years of experience within the HR domain
* Excellent level of proficiency in English, Dutch is a plus
* High-quality document preparation and presentation skills
* Enjoys international environments and able to work in multicultural team
* You are a team player, who embraces challenges


***Soft-skills***


* Team player;
* Take ownership and leading change;
* Flexibility and lean way of work;
* Having a sense of humor.

 **Want to know more about us?**



We are serving the Swiss market as Switzerland’s leading IT & Telecom company. We are actively driving digitalization and networking, and tapping new paths for our customers and our employees. To do so we are and act trustworthy, committed and curious.



Since 2019, we have been building up the coolest DevOps Center with 400+ employees at the top of the World Trade Center in the heart of Rotterdam. The Local Service Team is responsible to support our employees with our different departments: Office management, Community, Marketing and Employer Branding, Talent Acquisition, Finance, IT Service management, Compliancy and HR.



Within the Local Service Team, we are looking for a passionate HR professional, who has a lean way of working mindset and appreciate the team collaboration.

  

***Perks***

* Agile working environment;
* Attractive salary compensation based on your proven experience;
* Flexible working time model, hybrid and work from home alowance;
* Monthly allowance of EUR 200 for telephone/internet;
* Paid training days and access to Swisscom learning platforms;
* Commuting allowance;
* Contribution towards your future savings;
* Monthly contribution to the health insurance of EUR 230 gross;
* Gym subscription, Tax advice, and language course paid by the company.

title: HR Support Officer
Project Coordination Assistant (G-6)
company: International Criminal Court (ICC) - Cour Pénale Internationale (CPI)
description:
**Posting Date:** 05/09/2024
  

**Deadline for Applications:** 19/09/2024 (midnight The Hague time)
  

**Organizational Unit:** Information, Knowledge and Evidence Management Section, Integrated Services Division, Office of the Prosecutor
  

**Duty Station:** The Hague - NL
  

**Type of Appointment:** Short Term Appointment
  

**Minimum Net Annual Salary:** €52,725.00
  

**Contract Duration:** To be determined  

  

*Special Notice:*


A Short-Term Appointment is used to recruit staff to meet short-term needs. The duration of this assignment is provided above. The maximum duration of a short-term appointment including extensions shall not exceed 12 months.

  

A Short-Term Appointment does not carry any expectancy, legal or otherwise, of renewal and shall not be converted to any other type of appointment.

  

Due to the short-term nature of the assignment, the ICC reserves the right to make an appointment at one grade lower than that stated in the vacancy with a modified job description.

  

A current ICC staff member who is holding a fixed-term appointment may apply for any short-term position. Where a current ICC staff member is selected to a short-term position, he or she will be temporarily assigned to the position in line with section 4.10 of ICC/AI/2016/001. GS-level posts are subject to local recruitment only.

  

The terms and conditions of service for staff members appointed under a short-term appointment are governed by ICC/AI/2016/001.

  

**Organisational Context**


The position of Project Coordination Assistant exists within the Information, Knowledge and Evidence Management Section (IKEMS).

  

The Information, Knowledge and Evidence Management Section (IKEMS), headed by an Information Management Coordinator, reports directly to the Prosecutor, and combines the OTP’s information, knowledge and evidence management operations into one consolidated section. IKEMS aims to maintain a coordinated, flexible and operationally responsive IKEM support capacity throughout the OTP, in order to support the full spectrum of OTP information and evidence operations.

  

**Duties and Responsibilities**


Under the direct supervision of the Information Management Coordinator, the incumbent will perform the following tasks:


* Coordinate the collection of management data and information, collate, analyse and disseminate results of the annual IKEMS survey.
* Research, compile, analyse, summarize and present basic information/date necessary for IKEMS performance monitoring and reporting, by drafting periodic and/or ad hoc reports and prepare forecasts as well as compile the IKEMS annual report, procurement plan, and equipment lifecycle management and capital replacement plans ensuring completeness and accuracy of data.
* Prepare and regularly update the annual procurement plan and forecast equipment needs. Meet with and draft/send/receive correspondence from stakeholders across the OTP, and responds to enquiries from all OTP core business areas with respect to all IKEMS projects, equipment needs, budgets and procurement initiatives.
* Liaise and collaborate with OTP Financial Planning and Control Unit as well as Divisional Planning and Control Officers to ensure accuracy, effectiveness and efficiency of IKEMS service delivery targets, continuously monitor spending of IKEMS equipment and project-related budgets, draft and update IKEMS procurement plan, oversee project/program implementation and take corrective action where necessary.
* Keep abreast of software license renewal and OTP subscription needs ensuring requisite information is included and justified in terms of proposed activities, and serve as focal point for coordination, monitoring and implementation of procurement/equipment projects relating to IKEMS budgets; follow-up on any administrative actions and resolve issues related to procurement/project implementation.
* Serve as Section focal point for all section-level coordination functions including, time-keeping, event coordination, training and travel, drafting agendas, summaries, notes and minutes, coordinating leave management, on/off-boarding, and providing guidance to newly arriving staff.
* Organizes stakeholder meetings, sets agendas, captures end-user requirements in relation to equipment/procurement needs, drafts and/or reviews Scopes of Work for equipment purchases, provides presentations on equipment/procurement options, proposes alternatives and solutions to meet OTP and/or IKEMS equipment needs and prepares summaries and necessary business reporting on all of the above.
* Ensures purchased equipment is received by ICC Asset Management and delivered to intended IKEMS and/or OTP recipients, reviews and reports on all HQ-based and deployed OTP mission equipment stockpiles, recommends replacements or write-offs, and acts as Product Owner of the centralized OTP equipment database recommending improvements or corrective actions/developments to continuously improve the tool.
* Perform other duties as required.

  

**Essential Qualifications**


*Education:*


Diploma of secondary education.

  

*Experience*:


A minimum of eight (8) years of practical experience in an executive office management role in at least two of the following three areas is required:

  

1) Drafting and editing surveys, reports, memoranda and presentations as well as analysing and drafting survey results and/or management information in ad hoc, quarterly or annual reports relating to KPIs, service delivery targets, procurement planning or project implementation.

  

2) Gathering user requirements and drafting, updating and/or monitoring the implementation of a procurement plan and equipment budget, providing presentations, recommendations and reports on equipment purchase options, logistics management issues and/or financial planning, administration, or procurement of goods and/or services.

  

3) Managing Section-wide administrative and/or service support needs and requests including planning and organizing training or meeting events, agendas, and drafting minutes and correspondence.

  

An advanced or first-level university degree may be considered as a substitute for two years' working experience only to determine eligibility.

  

Knowledge of and demonstrated experience with SAP is required. Training or certificates in programme or project management, procurement, business administration, public/private administration, or supply chain management are desirable.

  

*Knowledge, Skills and abilities:*


* Knowledge of MS Office (in particular Excel, Word, Powerpoint and Outlook);
* Excellent knowledge of office management policies, procedures and practices;
* Knowledge of MS Visio, SharePoint and knowledge of HP RM or other enterprise records management system;
* Ability to understand and interpret financial rules and regulations and apply these to the annual procurement plan and end-user projects/requests;
* Able to respond to unforeseen and urgent situations and perform accurately under time pressure, even when requiring a high attention to detail;
* Ability to foresee some coordination and business administrative support needs, make recommendations, propose alternatives and take initiative and corrective action;
* Demonstrated business, financial and/or resource administration skills;
* Excellent organisational, coordination and planning skills, even in fast-paced environments, coupled with a steadfast attention to detail and an unwavering adherence to confidentiality;
* Able to work independently and to build effective working relationships with clients and colleagues at all levels;
* Attention to detail with complex data sheets and financial or procurement information;
* Ability to perform under pressure, work independently and contribute to finding creative solutions to achieve goals, within the prevailing regulatory, budgetary and policy environments of IKEMS/OTP/ICC;
* Ability to conduct research and basic analysis, coupled with strong English drafting and editing skills;
* Ability to work harmoniously in a multi-cultural environment with sensitivity and respect for diversity.

  

*Knowledge of languages:*


Proficiency in one of the working language of the Court, English or French, is essential. Working knowledge of the other is desirable. Knowledge of another official language of the Court (Arabic, Chinese, Russian and Spanish) would be considered an asset. Knowledge of Dutch would be considered an asset.

  


**ICC Leadership Competencies**  

*Purpose*  

*Collaboration*  

*People*  

*Results*


**ICC Core Competencies**  

*Dedication to the mission and values*  

*Professionalism*  

*Teamwork*  

*Learning and developing*  

*Handling uncertain situations*  

*Interaction*  

*Realising objectives*  

  

Learn more about ICC leadership and core competencies.  

  

**General Information**  

- *In accordance with the Rome Statute, the ICC is committed to achieving geographical representation and gender equality within its staff as well as representation of the principal legal systems of the world (legal positions). Nationals from t**he list of non-represented and under-represented States* *are strongly encouraged to apply. In addition, applications from women are strongly encouraged for senior positions at the Professional (P) and Director (D) levels. Posts shall be filled preferably by a national of a State Party to the ICC Statute, or of a State which has signed and is engaged in the ratification process or which is engaged in the accession process, but nationals from non-state parties may also be considered, as appropriate.*

  

  

- The selected candidate will be subject to a Personnel Security Clearance (PSC) process in accordance with the ICC policy. The PSC process will include but is not limited to, verification of the information provided in the personal history form and a criminal record check. All candidates should be in a positon to submit electronic copy of their passport and all diplomas listed on their profile when requested;  

* Applicants may check the status of vacancies on ICC E-Recruitment web-site;
* Personnel recruited at the General Service level are not entitled to all of the benefits granted to internationally-recruited staff;
* The ICC reserves the right to not make any appointment to the vacancy, to make an appointment at a lower grade, or to make an appointment with a modified job description.

title: Coordinator Account Operations
description:
**Join the Innovators in Electronics!**  

Murata's technologies, products and solutions are used everywhere, contributing to a safer, healthier and more efficiently connected world.  

As a global high tech house we are challenging ourselves every day to develop electronics solutions enabling innovations and shaping the future.  

Whether you are an experienced professional or a new graduate, you will find great opportunities to contribute, learn, and develop alongside a talented, diverse global team.


**Job Purpose**
---------------


Take care of the day-to-day processes with the customer in order to achieve the highest possible levels of service to maintain our quality accreditations and maximize customer satisfaction.


**Responsibilites and Tasks**
-----------------------------


* Order administration: in order to ensure correct and timely deliveries to the customer and to ensure correct pricing:  

	+ Order entry, rescheduling and expediting via internal system
	+ Ensure correct placing of purchase orders
	+ Adjust and improve purchase orders (change, improvement, escalation)
	+ Monitor and control reservation controlled items (CBM, Ceiling, etc.)
* Keep Customer Cross Reference files up-to-date in line with agreed contracts and quotations:  

- Invoicing, credit/debit- and selfbill handling: ensure a timely payment and balancing of stock and return shipments
* Stock control: have a good balance between meeting customer requirements by avoiding slow moving and excessive stock:  

- Monitor local and consignment stock levels, and take any corrective actions necessary together with the Sales team to minimize the slow-moving-, excessive- and obsolete stock levels
* Master file maintenance: facilitate the day-to-day running of the customer’s account:  

	+ Maintain accurate customer information, in order to have a clear record of customers’ specific requirements
* Customer Relationship: join customer visits depends on necessity:  

	+ Support Sales actively in terms of Logistic/SCM issues and customer visits
* Internal Relationship: facilitate the smooth communication and positive cooperation between CS and other Murata departments:  

	+ Follow processes in line with documented procedures within the job’s authorization levels
**Required Knowledge/Experience**
---------------------------------


* Secondary school level or comparable commercial education in connection with the appropriate professional experience (3 years)
* Advanced experience in ERP systems (USSO/AS400, SAP, etc.)
* Basic commercial Skills
* Good English and local language skills in speaking and writing
* Basic skills in standard software (MS Office, etc.) and Murata specific software
* Basic product knowledge
* Basic knowledge in Quality Management
* Basic communication skills (active listening, conflict management)
* Ready for business trips
* Basic negotiation skills


**What we have to offer you:**


* Possibility to work 40% of your time remotely
* Stable work environment, with focus on personal and professional development
* Work together with highly skilled and experienced professionals
* Well structured and personalized onboarding program
* Being part of a global leader that contributes to the advancement of society
* Possibility to participate in our Corporate Social Responsibility activities
* Positive work atmosphere and an open door mentality
* Frequent company events arranged by our Social Club

title: Privacy Officer
description:
**Privacy Officer**  

DLL is not your average financial services company. In fact, we are above average in almost every way. With an employee engagement score of 85% (compared to the 72% industry average), it sure seems like we are doing something right.



We collaborate with manufacturers, suppliers, and businesses in more than 30 countries to enable the acquisition of equipment, technology and software that companies need to contribute meaningfully to their communities. We believe in partnering with our customers to develop innovative and sustainable financial solutions that deliver meaningful value to the world.



At DLL, we are committed to making sure that all people, regardless of their race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, age, religion, physical characteristics, or mental abilities, feel welcomed and encouraged to be their authentic selves. We strive to create an inclusive environment that is reflective of the communities in which we operate. Come see what all the excitement is about.



Hence DLL also values to protect people’s privacy, ensures their safety, dignity, and other fundamental rights and freedoms such as freedom of thought and expression. The DLL Global Privacy Office ensures that there are policies, standards, procedure, and training and awareness related to privacy principles that ensure these values within DLL. The Global Privacy Office also monitors the implementation of privacy principles to make certain these values are adequately addressed in our operational business processes and privacy risks. The Global Privacy Office provides privacy advice to pro-active and when needed on how to treat risks in alignment with the regional Privacy Coordinators.



As a Data Privacy Officer, you will be a subject matter expert and support delivery on key components of the work of the DLL Global Privacy Office.



Find out more here about how you can unleash your full potential at DLL

 **Day to day:**  

* Support to improve the maturity towards a robust Data Privacy risk management program for DLL – identifying risks, working with the business to devise mitigations and monitoring their effectiveness.
* Communicate about data privacy and promote the Global Privacy Office’s messaging, including creating educational material, raising awareness through various initiatives and providing training (and training materials) for use across the company’s product developers, IT and commercial colleagues.
* Manage Global Privacy Office tasks including operating the privacy risk assessment methodology; assign ownership of obligations; evaluating requirements and providing practical and business operation focused advisory to the business; and action plan(s) to address gaps.
* Support the implementation of the Global Privacy policies and procedures to enable the effective identification and management of privacy risks.
* Provide assistance to the Senior Data Privacy Officers in regard to any regulatory events related to Data Privacy and any responses to regulatory guidance.
* Participate in our communication and reporting to management and other key stakeholders. Support in further enhancement of the privacy management information and reporting to enable effective oversight of the privacy and data protection control framework.
* Monitor changes in laws, rules and regulations relating to Data Privacy risk management and work with legal to interpret such changes.
* Participate in relevant regulatory examinations and internal audits including addressing all findings and recommendations in a timely manner.
* Build relationships, have reasonable dialogues with stakeholders and improve the Global Privacy Office connection with the operational business. Cooperate smoothly with stakeholders including colleagues within the compliance team. Understand the DLL business and its IT landscape to be able to recognize applicable requirements in your privacy advice.
* Provide balanced privacy advice to business.
* An effective change agent bringing fresh ideas and approaches which add value to the business.
* Support to mature to improve the ways of working in our privacy management platform (OneTrust).


**All members enjoy**

* Two working days per year volunteering for a local charity.
* Health and Wellness program including healthy food, free health checks, fun health & vitality activities.
* Flexible hours with possibility to work from home
* Career development opportunities: online learning, member development programs.
* Click this link for an overview of all the benefits in your region.


“We lead the way in meeting the need for flexibility and transparency which our customers increasingly expect”

 **Essentials:**  

* A bachelor's degree
* Data Protection certification (or equivalent) or extra years of experience
* At least 5-7 years working experience
* At least 3 years in privacy and data protection
* Extensive knowledge of privacy regulations and regulatory expectations
* Project management experience in a privacy and data protection environment
* Technical/IT affinity
* Experience in multi-national company
* Passionate about privacy
* Team player


**Extras:**


* Being able to successfully make, or understand the required translation from Privacy Policy to operational business process requirements via the relevant knowledge and experience gained during your career
* IT background or Information security background
* Compliance, Audit or (Information) Risk management
* Legal background
* Data Management knowledge
* Seen privacy implementations at multiple companies
* High level knowledge of business processes (financial sector core business processes and/or supporting function business processes at any multinational)
* Experience of embedding policies, procedures and processes into a multi-national organization
* High emotional intelligence
* Likes to engage and work with people
* Ability to take responsibility and be proactive on new matters and projects
* Positive, innovative and enthusiastic

  

**Choose wellbeing**  

DLL’s wellbeing ambition is to educate, equip and empower members to build connections, manage their mental, emotional, physical and financial wellness and maintain balance between work and the other priorities that make up their lives.



Our four wellbeing categories are as follows:


* Connection – Build meaningful connections with other DLL members
* Health – Manage mental, emotional and physical health
* Finance – Provide learning opportunities to help members achieve personal financial health
* Lifestyle – Maintain balance between work and life priorities


These are the things that matter to our members and the wellbeing of our members matters to DLL

 **Settling in**  

At DLL, we are many things. We are team members, family members, community member. We are members of society, members of different cultures and nationalities. Members of change. We each have different beliefs, different passions, different viewpoints, talents and interests. We come from different backgrounds, cultures, nationalities and histories.



But for all of our differences, we share one thing in common: each of us are members of DLL.



Our company was founded in the Netherlands. But today we are truly a multinational business. Our unique culture is rooted in higher collaboration, less hierarchy and an honest directness that enable us to integrate, ideate and innovate across country lines.



Many companies say they are European, American, Asian or Australian, at DLL we are all these places and more.



We are a cross-culture collaborative – an interconnected network – that comes together every single day with one goal in mind: **Partnering for a better world.**

 **Good to know:**  

* Deadline for application: September 22nd (Due to high volume of applications this requisition may close prior to posted close date)
* The selection process may involve an assessment.
* Applications via email will not be reviewed. Please apply online via our career website.
* DLL’s referral program applies
* #LI-DENNIS
* For more information, please contact our Talent acquisition partner Dennis van Hoof via dennis.vanhoof@dllgroup.com


DLL appreciates the time you spend applying to our openings. We advise only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted. Hiring subject to successful completion of a background check.



DLL is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection processes and work environments. If contacted for an employment opportunity, please advise Human Resources if you require accommodation in accordance with our values and all applicable legislation.

  

Job Reference: DLL NL02723

title: EHS Specialist
description:
**Why Valvoline Global Operations?**

  

Valvoline Global is a worldwide leader in automotive and industrial solutions, creating future-ready products and best-in-class services for partners around the globe. Established in 1866, we introduced the world’s first branded motor oil, claiming our position as The Original Motor Oil. As an affiliate of Aramco, one of the world's largest integrated energy and chemicals companies, we continue to invest strategically and expand globally, driving unparalleled product innovation and sustainable business solutions.

 **Our corporate values of care, integrity, passion, unified, and excellence** shape everything we do. Living out our values is what makes our company, our employees, our partners, our customers, and the communities we serve great.

  

When you join Valvoline Global, you join a culture that is committed to: treating all people with care, operating with integrity, striving for excellence in everything we do, showing passion about delivering on our commitments, and being unified in all our enterprise endeavors.

 **Job overview**

* <span 55="" helvetica="" roman="">Responsible for creating and maintaining an environment that drives continuous improvement in the areas of Environment, Health and Safety. Lead the implementation of and assure compliance with Valvoline EHS policies and local regulations applicable to the region.
* <span 55="" helvetica="" roman="">Provide leadership, professional knowledge and technical expertise in the administration and support of regulatory compliance, permitting, policy and program development and training to multiple supply chain facilities.
* <span 55="" helvetica="" roman="">Developing and driving programs that continuously improve employee safety performance in the region to world class standards;
* <span 55="" helvetica="" roman="">Guiding company wide EHS-related objectives and supporting execution of EHS-related initiatives;
* Developing and implementing regional and local EHS management systems and maintenance of applicable certifications of such systems (e.g., RC14001, ISO45001, ANSI Z10, etc.) within the assigned region.

 **What you'll be doing...**

 **Compliance**


Track/analyze local regulatory changes and provide local direction on compliance issues. Coordinate sustainability and environmental permits/processes

**Risk management**


Identifying and evaluating hazards, prioritizing the associated risks, and thereby managing measures that lead to acceptable (safety) conditions with costs and yield.

**Management of processes and systems**  

Maintain and continuously improve the (EHS) management systems in accordance with the primary process of Valvoline, to support a safe and environmentally friendly work situation. Coordinate purchasing requests regarding EHS related topics.

**Incident investigation**


Carrying out conducting effective root cause analyses for incidents and trends. Support in defining effective control measures.

**Transferring knowledge, attitudes and ethics**


Transferring knowledge, attitudes and ethical awareness and acting as a coach and counselor in safety and environmental issues, to enable individuals to fulfill their role and take responsibility

**Stakeholder management**


Make trade-offs about building relationships with stakeholders and involving and influencing them in the concern for safety.

**Culture and behavior**


Involving people and the organization to coach them effectively (during changes) for a positive safety result.

**Auditing and inspection**


Conducting and managing safety audits, in which facts and evidence are tested against legislation and standards, and inspections.

**Information collection / analysis and effective advice**


Retrieve Environmental and Sustainability, as well as Health and Safety information from the processes within the organization, analyze it and report on it to support decisions on an operational and tactical level.

 **Other responsibilities...**

* **Port Facility Security Officer (PFSO)**

Activity: the PFSO is responsible for supervising compliance with the set security measures.


Think of: ISPS, Principles of security, Port Security Measures, Port Facility Plan, Port Security Committee, Port Facility Assessment, Declaration of Security, Measures levels 2 and 3, Access control, Training requirements.

* **Prevention officer Dordrecht/ Klundert**

(Global EHS manager EMEA is back up for Klundert as being a SEVESO location)


Activity: To (co-) draw up and implement the Risk Inventory and Evaluation (RI&E).


Advising and working closely with the works council / staff representation on the measures to be taken for a good working conditions policy.

* **BNO Coordinator Dordrecht**

Activity: Coordinate training and execution of the BHV checklists, keep BHV up to date in number of participants

 **What you'll bring...**


4 year degree in engineering and/or safety.


5+ years in EHS, preferably with multi-site and some management experience

 **Preferably**:

* HVK certificate

 **Knowledge**

* Solid understanding of risk assessment and control methodologies
* Basic knowledge of formal auditing practices
* Working knowledge of comprehensive EHS management systems such as RC14001, ISO45001, or ANSI Z10

 **Skills**

* Excellent communication skills that enable to act at different levels (internal and external).
* Local regulatory codes safety, health and environment.
* ISO management systems such as VCA, 9001, 14001 and 45001
* Demonstrable extensive experience with Office / Word, Excel and Outlook, Teams, administrative processes
* Professional command of the Dutch & English language

  

Valvoline Global provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. Are you good at what you do? Join us.

  

The Company has put a process in place to make its recruitment process accessible to any and all users. Reasonable accommodations will be provided, upon request, to applicants with disabilities in order to facilitate equal opportunity throughout the recruitment and selection process. Please contact Human Resources at 1-800-Valvoline or email 1-800Valvoline@valvoline.com to make a request for reasonable accommodation during any aspect of the recruitment and selection process. The contact information is for accommodation requests only; do not use this contact information to inquire about the status of applications.

title: Customer Service Coordinator
description:
We're looking to expand our team with an enthusiastic:

**Customer Service Representative – Moving Industry** 

Are you someone who loves organizing and coordinating, and do you get excited about working in a dynamic environment? Then this is the job for you!

**Who are we?**

Our family business has been around since 1777, helping a wide variety of clients all over the world. We are proud of our group of dedicated employees who meticulously handle moves for (international) companies, expats, and private clients.

**What will you do?**

As a Move Coordinator at De Haan & Partners Verhuizingen, you are the driving force in the moving process. Once the client agrees to the quote, you will take over and ensure the move goes smoothly from start to finish. You are the link between the client, our internal departments, foreign partners, and customs, making sure everything runs like clockwork. No two days are the same; from coordinating national and international moves to managing costs and maintaining customer contacts, you thrive on variety and challenge!

**Who are we looking for?**

You are an energetic go-getter who:

· Has a bachelor's level of thinking and working. Experience is not a must, but a proactive attitude is. We especially encourage people from the hospitality, retail, transport and logistics, event sector, and other dynamic environments to apply; however, everyone with a proactive attitude is welcome!

· Possesses strong social and communication skills in both Dutch and English. Additional language skills are a plus!

· Is assertive, customer-focused, and solution-oriented. You enjoy building relationships and convincing clients.

· Excels in planning and organizing, with attention to detail and a structured way of working.

· Enjoys working both independently and as part of a team, and is not easily stressed.

Are there things you're not yet skilled at? No problem! No one is born with experience. If you are open to learning new things, we are happy to help you develop.

**What do we offer?**

At De Haan, you will have a challenging role within the international moving industry, with plenty of opportunities for personal development. You will work with an enthusiastic and motivated team committed to quality. After the first period in which you learn the tricks of the trade, it will be possible to work one or two days a week from home. We offer a competitive salary, depending on your experience and skills and several secondary benefits, in example (fiscal) corporate fitness.

Job Types: Full-time, Temporary  
Contract length: 12 months

Work Location: In person

title: IT Support
Front Office Supervisor | Fulltime | NH Utrecht
description:
Our hotel is perfectly located; next to the Central Station, Beatrix theater and the Jaarbeurs. Our guests can walk straight through the shopping center Hoog Catharijne into the city center. Our hotel is the largest hotel in Utrecht and we have a nice mix of business and leisure guests. During the week we welcome many conference-, meeting- and trade fair guests. In the weekend we mainly welcome guests who enjoy leisure activities. In short, every day is full of surprises. New colleagues are instantly welcomed into our team, and we have welcomed many colleagues from other NH hotels for the next step in their career. We often work together with our cluster hotel NH Centre Utrecht (Janskerkhof) and it could happen that you are also scheduled to work there occasionally. Another opportunity to broaden your horizon, isn’t that great?


"Every employee is equally important." – Chastity, Front Office Supervisor

**What will we offer you?**

* Free online & offline training organized by our own University.
* End of year bonus (up to 100% of monthly gross salary) & refer-a-friend bonus (500 EUR).
* Employee rates differing from 36 euros in all our hotels worldwide, 30% discount in the F&B outlets, and Friends & Family discount up to 25%. Various discounts in (web)shops.
* Team building events, trips and holiday parties.
* The opportunity to grow within our company worldwide.
* Salary based on your experiences starting from Horeca CLA scale 6.
  


**What’s in it for us?**

  

* Helping guests puts a big smile on your face. The 'always a pleasure' mentality is second nature for you, and you are happy go the extra mile for our guests;
* You are a 'Natural Host' and have some years' experience as a receptionist. Experience as Desk Manager/Shift Leader/Supervisor is an advantage;
* You are good at setting priorities, you have a good command of the Dutch and English language, you are accurate, and knowledge of computer systems is a plus;
* You enjoy variety in your work and working hours and working in a team gives you energy.


**A day in the life of a Front Office Supervisor**  

06:45 You arrive, in uniform, with a cup of coffee or tea in the back office. Your colleague from the night shift takes care of the handover.  

07:00 You start your checklist, and, in the meantime, you keep an eye on your colleagues at the desk and support where necessary.  

08:00 You have checked today's arrivals and communicated the details to the other departments.  

10:00 In the absence of your manager, you attend the morning meeting. After the meeting you go back to the front office and in between the phone calls, you also process the incoming emails and work your way through the 'morning rush'.  

12:00 Enjoy your lunch with colleagues from other departments.  

13:00 You check whether there are still guests pending to check out and continue with your checklist until all is done.  

14:00 You make sure the handover is updated for the evening shift.  

14:45 The evening shift has arrived, and you make sure they know everything they need to know to begin their shift.  

15:00 Time to go home!
Are you the one we are looking for? Apply now!

title: Meeting & Event Specialist | Fulltime | NH Conference Centre Koningshof
description:
**Speaking and writing Dutch on a professional level is a requirement for this position**

 **NH Conference Centre Koningshof has it all. In the surroundings of the hotel, our guests can walk and cycle in the beautiful countryside. For our business guests we offer everything you can think of for a successful meeting or large event. This diversity of events makes every day an adventure. We appreciate every talent, and we motivate and encourage all colleagues to go the extra mile for our guests. It is for a good reason that some colleagues have been working with us for many years and see the team as one family.**

**Our hotel is situated in the green heart of Brabant, just a few minutes away from Veldhoven and close to the city of lights Eindhoven. The hotel was originally a monastery used for teaching. Nowadays, this location is still used to train and share knowledge, not only with our guests, but also with our employees.**

**"The sky is the limit at NH Conference Koningshof." – Karim, Banqueting Employee**

**What’s in it for you?**

* **Free online & offline training organized by our own University.**
* **End of year bonus (up to 100% of monthly gross salary) & refer-a-friend bonus (500 EUR).**
* **Employee rates differing from 36 euros in all our hotels worldwide, 30% discount in the F&B outlets, and Friends & Family discount up to 25%. Various discounts in (web)shops.**
* **Team building events, trips and holiday parties.**
* **The opportunity to grow within our company worldwide.**
* **Salary based on your experiences starting from Horeca CLA scale 6.**

**What’s in it for us?**

* **Helping guests puts a big smile on your face. The ‘always a pleasure’ mentality is second nature for you, and you are happy go the extra mile for our guests;**
* **You have strong communication skill and you are someone who knows how to convince guests to book with us and upselling is your forte;**
* **You are flexible, accurate, and you are a real team player;**
* **In this position you always have a clear overview, you have a commercial attitude, and you always think one step ahead;**
* **In addition, you have excellent communication skills, both with guests and with other contacts, operational departments, and the GEM Office, you have a perfect command of the Dutch and English language.**

**What are you going to do?**  

**As Meeting & Events Specialist you are responsible for sales and organizing events in NH conference Centre Koningshof. At Meeting & Events you can think of meetings, conferences, weddings, gala dinners and much more. You are responsible for sales and all the associated negotiations, as well as the further preparations to make sure every events is a success. You are the point of contact for the contact person of the event and you ensure that everything is tightly organized to guarantee guests a unique experience in your hotel. In addition, you ensure clear communication with colleagues from the operational departments and you contribute to the service level in the hotel.**

**Finally, you are also the event manager during major events, during these events you will make sure the entire evens runs smoothly and you act as the connector between the operational departments and the contact person.**

**Are you looking for a new challenge? Apply now!**

**Minor Hotels Europe & Americas is committed to an inclusive working environment in which everyone is valued and encouraged equally, therefor we warmly welcome people from all horizons & personal abilities.**

title: Day/Night Receptionist | Fulltime | NH Arnhem Rijnhotel
description:
NH Arnhem Rijnhotel is located near the Center of Arnhem right on the banks of the river Rhine. Especially in the summer our guests can enjoy the perfect view over the river Rhine on our sunny terrace. Most of our business guests are welcomed during weekdays and the leisure guests we welcome during the weekends.


We are a small hotel and know all our regular guests by heart, which ensures a homely and relaxed atmosphere on the job. We are a small close-knit team who always goes the extra mile for both our guests and each other because we see ourselves as one big family.

**"(Being) all-round, that is what you learn in our hotel" Daphne, Food and Beverage Manager**

**What will we offer you?**

* Free online & offline training organized by our own University.
* End of year bonus (up to 100% of monthly gross salary) & refer-a-friend bonus (500 EUR).
* Employee rates differing from 36 euros in all our hotels worldwide, 30% discount in the F&B outlets, and Friends & Family discount up to 25%. Various discounts in (web)shops.
* Team building events, trips and holiday parties.
* The opportunity to grow within our company worldwide.
* Salary based on your experiences starting from Horeca CLA scale 5.


**What’s in it for us?**

* Helping guests puts a big smile on your face. The ‘always a pleasure’ mentality is second nature for you, and you are happy go the extra mile for our guests;
* You know how to prioritize and keep your cool during busy moments;
* You are a ‘Natural Host’. Experience and a relevant education are useful, but is not the most important for us;
* You like variety in your work and working hours. Due to alternating shifts (morning, evening, and night shifts), your life never seems dull;
* You are interested in computers and enjoy learning new systems.


**A day in the life of a Day/Night Receptionist**  

**06:45** You arrive, in uniform, with a cup of coffee in the back office, your colleague from the night shift does the handover, you note the action points.  

**07:00** You start with your checklist and are ready to provide a service with a heartfelt smile for the guests checking out.  

**08:00** You have checked today's arrivals and communicated special details to the Desk Manager and other departments.  

**10:00** Between phone calls, you handle incoming emails and work your way through the 'morning rush'.  

**12:00** Enjoy your lunch with colleagues from other departments.  

**13:00** You check whether there are still guests who need to check out and continue with your checklist until it is finished.  

**14:00** You prepare the handover for the evening shift, start counting the cash register, and make sure all tasks are done.  

**14:45** The evening shift has arrived, and you attend the handover.  

**15:00** Time to go home!


Are you the one we are looking for? Apply now!

title: Conference and Events Specialist, EMEA
description:
**Conference and Events Specialist, Regional Marketing EMEA**

**About the role:**



We are seeking an experienced and motivated Conference and Events Specialist to join our EMEA Regional Marketing team. The successful candidate will play a critical role in planning, organizing and executing conferences, user group meetings, and other key events across the EMEA region. This position demands a strategic thinker with a keen eye for detail and a passion for creating impactful, high-quality events that resonate with our scientific community and align with 10x Genomics' mission.


**What you will be doing:**


* **Event Planning:**
+ Develop and implement comprehensive event plans for conferences, user group meetings, and other key events that support 10x Genomics' marketing and business objectives in the EMEA region.
+ Set clearly defined event goals with Regional Marketing Manager
+ Research and recommend venues, vendors, and services that meet event requirements, ensuring optimal attendee experience and budget efficiency.

* **Event Execution:**
+ Oversee all logistical aspects of events, including contract negotiations, vendor management, registration, travel arrangements, and on-site coordination.
+ Create detailed event timelines, agendas, and floor plans to ensure smooth execution.
+ Manage the design and production of event materials, including signage, brochures, and digital content, in collaboration with the global and regional marketing team.
+ Ensure all technical and audiovisual requirements are met, coordinating with AV teams and other technical service providers as necessary.

* **Stakeholder Engagement:**
+ Build and maintain strong relationships with internal stakeholders (regional marketing, global marketing, sales, support) and external partners to ensure successful collaboration on event content and participation.
+ Serve as the primary point of contact for event stakeholders, addressing any enquiries and providing updates throughout the planning and execution phases.

* **On-Site Management:**
+ Lead on-site event coordination, ensuring all aspects of the event run smoothly and according to plan.
+ Address and resolve any issues or challenges that arise during the event, maintaining a high level of professionalism and customer service.
+ Coordinate on-site event staff and vendors to ensure seamless operations.

* **Post-Event Analysis:**
+ Conduct post-event evaluations, gathering feedback from attendees, stakeholders, and team members to assess event success and identify areas for improvement.
+ Analyze event metrics, including attendance, engagement, and ROI, and provide detailed reports to the marketing team.
+ Implement best practices and lessons learned to continuously improve the planning and execution of future events.

* **Compliance:**
+ Ensure all events comply with local regulations, company policies, and industry standards.

**Minimum Requirements:**


* Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Marketing, Event Management, Communications, or a related field
* Demonstrable experience in successfully managing large-scale conferences and events, from concept to completion, preferably within the life sciences, healthcare, or technology industries
* Strong project management and organizational skills, with the ability to handle multiple events and priorities simultaneously, to meet challenging deadlines in a fast-paced environment
* Detail-oriented with a focus on delivering high-quality experiences for attendees and stakeholders
* Proficiency with MS Office, Google Suite (Mail, Calendar), Concur, Confluence, JIRA, Salesforce, Pardot (or other marketing automation system), Zoom or WebEx Meeting and Event Center
* Excellent English communication skills (written / oral / presentation) and able to collaborate across multiple disciplines
* Ability to travel within the region as required to be successful in this field based role, expected to be at least 40% of time within the region


**Preferred Skills and/or Experience**


* Master's degree or equvalent in Marketing, Event Management, Communications, or a related field
* Advanced proficiency in event and marketing automation tools
* Additional European language skills, preferably German or French


#LI-KW1

**About 10x Genomics**



At 10x Genomics, accelerating our understanding of biology is more than a mission for us. It is a commitment. This is the century of biology, and the breakthroughs we make now have the potential to change the world.  

  

We enable scientists to advance their research, allowing them to address scientific questions they did not even know they could ask. Our tools have enabled fundamental discoveries across biology including cancer, immunology, and neuroscience.  

  

Our teams are empowered and encouraged to follow their passions, pursue new ideas, and perform at their best in an inclusive and dynamic environment. We know that behind every scientific breakthrough, there is a deep infrastructure of talented people driving the life sciences industry and making it possible for scientists and clinicians to make new strides. We are dedicated to finding the very best person for every aspect of our work because the innovations and discoveries that we enable together will lead to better technologies, better treatments, and a better future. Find out how you can make a 10x difference.


*Individuals seeking employment at 10x Genomics are considered without regards to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, or sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.*



10x does not accept unsolicited applicants submitted by third-party recruiters or agencies. Any resume or application submitted to 10x without a vendor agreement in place will be considered unsolicited and property of 10x, and 10x will not pay a placement fee.

title: Guest Relations Employee | Fulltime | NH Collection Amsterdam Barbizon Palace
description:
Opposite Amsterdam Central Station, the NH Collection Amsterdam Barbizon Palace hotel is right in the center of Amsterdam. The building itself is a highlight too, with beautiful architecture, and 268 bedrooms spread across over 19 buildings from the 17th-century houses. Our five-star hotel has all possible facilities under one roof. A real showpiece is our fine dining restaurant, Vermeer. It's one of 2 places you can dine, plus there's our exquisite Bottles & Jars Bar in addition to various meeting and event facilities such as the monumental 15th-century chapel Olofskapel. We see ourselves as a real learning company with a passionate team, who is happy to pass on their knowledge of hospitality and sense of luxury to new colleagues. We are always looking for colleagues who want to be part of our family and are ready for a "new" beginning at the "oldest" location in Amsterdam!

**''A pleasant working environment is important in our hotel. At NH Collection Barbizon Palace you work together with the team to make sure the guest has an extraordinary stay. Teamwork makes the dream work." - Lara, Food and Beverage Employee**

**What will we offer you?**

* Free online & offline training organized by our own University.
* End of year bonus (up to 100% of monthly gross salary) & refer-a-friend bonus (500 EUR).
* Employee rates differing from 36 euros in all our hotels worldwide, 30% discount in the F&B outlets, and Friends & Family discount up to 25%. Various discounts in (web)shops.
* Team building events, trips and holiday parties.
* The opportunity to grow within our company worldwide.
* Salary based on your experiences starting from Horeca CLA scale 4.


**What’s in it for us?**

* Your goal is to give every guest an “Extraordinary” experience;
* You are always one step ahead, and you love to exceed the guests' expectations. No is not an option for you;
* You get energized by interacting with colleagues and guests from different cultures, you have an open attitude, you are spontaneous and you have an eye for detail;
* You have a perfect command of the Dutch and English language and you have at least 1 year of experience in a similar role in a hotel;
* You are used to working on a project basis, and you are able to surprise guests in any possible way.


**What are you going to do?**  

You ensure that the first contact with guests is made before their stay, you maintain this contact during the stay and even take care of the last contact after the stay. You recognize bottlenecks in the field of service (hotel-wide), you analyze these and you actively contribute to improving the service level. You do all this with your natural enthusiasm and charisma.


In addition, you are the point of contact in the event of complaints and you are responsible for all correspondence on online review websites. Moreover, you ensure that the NH Hotel Group's Quality Standards are complied with throughout the hotel.

**Are you looking for a new challenge? Apply now!**


Minor Hotels Europe & Americas is committed to an inclusive working environment in which everyone is valued and encouraged equally, therefor we warmly welcome people from all horizons & personal abilities.

title: Front Office Agent
description:
**Company Description** **Our heart beats turquoise.**


Working at Motel One is like coming home to friends, where you can be your true self and where appreciation and support matter. We meet on an equal footing and see ourselves as one team: from our management to our trainees.


We create a home away from home for our guests with our shared passion for modern design and high-quality service. Our more than 80 hotels in 12 countries impress with exclusive design, high service standards and first-class inner-city locations at an attractive price.


As the founder and pioneer of the budget design concept, we are successfully expanding in the metropolises of Europe and beyond. Become part of our team and develop Motel One with us.

 **Job Description**  

The focus of this role is on the professional care of our hotel guests – from a warm welcome at check-in to a genuine farewell at departure. Your duties will also include the following:

* Looking after our guests, including check-in and check-out
* Reviewing and processing bookings, overbookings and options
* Invoicing, including managing payments, as well as cash transactions and cashing up
* Organisational and administrative tasks in both our front and back office (e.g. managing no-shows, answering emails)
* Gaining interdepartmental insights into new areas of activity by working in our multicultural teams

  

**Qualifications**  

Whether you are a hotel professional or changing careers – you will fit in here! Because personality and hosting skills are our priority. You will also:

* Have completed an apprenticeship in the hotel trade and/or have professional experience in the hotel/catering industry or be looking for a change of career
* Have an excellent sense of quality and service, as well as hosting skills and a passion for the hotel industry
* Be open and communicative and have a solid command of English
* Be a team player and willing to provide assistance across departments – we achieve our results together

  

**Additional Information**  

Together we work to change the hotel world for the better. We focus on personality and embrace diversity. The Motel One spirit can be experienced not only in the hotel, but also at our various team events. In addition, at Motel One you benefit from a wide range of career opportunities, individual development plans and an attractive bonus scheme. Join the Motel One team and start your career with one of the best employers in the industry.
