title: Data Center Technician
description:
As a Microsoft Data Center Technician (DCT), you will develop an understanding of standard processes and procedures for preparing, installing, performing diagnostics, troubleshooting, replacing, and/or decommissioning equipment under the guidance of more experienced Data Center colleagues. This opportunity will allow you to develop an understanding of our Data Center environment, familiarize yourself with security and data management procedures, and accelerate your career growth in the process.  

Microsoft’s Cloud Operations & Innovation (CO+I) is the engine that powers our cloud services. As a CO+I DCT, you will perform a key role in delivering the core infrastructure and foundational technologies for Microsoft's online services including Bing, Office 365, Xbox, OneDrive, and the Microsoft Azure platform. As a group, CO+I is focused on the personal and professional development of all employees and offers training and growth opportunities including Career Rotation Programs, Diversity & Inclusion trainings and events, and professional certifications.  

Our infrastructure is comprised of a large global portfolio of more than 200 Data Centers in 32 countries and millions of servers. Our foundation is built upon and managed by a team of subject matter experts working to support services for more than 1 billion customers and 20 million businesses in over 90 countries worldwide.  

With environmental sustainability and optimization at the forefront of our data center design and operations, we continue to grow and evolve as we meet the ever-changing business demands that hold Microsoft as a world-class cloud provider.  

Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.  

In alignment with our Microsoft values, we are committed to cultivating an inclusive work environment for all employees to positively impact our culture every day.  

#COICareers**Responsibilities**
--------------------

  

* Contributes to issue tracking through escalations, asking questions, and seeking guidance on timely resolution of issues from more experienced technicians.
* Participates in daily safety briefings, completes required training aligned to the role and workload including safety training, complies with safety procedures (e.g., equipment use, lifting, electrical hazards, ladder/rolling stair use).
* Completes assigned tickets efficiently and in alignment with Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) while meeting established Service Level Agreements (SLAs) with guidance from other technicians.
* Complies with security and data management procedures and policies with guidance from other technicians and completes the required security training.
* Maintains a strong client focus to understand the impact of their work when completing tickets and assigned tasks.
* Contributes to a positive and effective team environment by sharing information with others, contributing to regular team meetings, asking questions, and staying apprised of the status of others' work.
* Has pride and a sense of accountability for the service quality, completeness, and ownership of the data center facilities.
* Embodies our culture and values.

**Qualifications**
------------------

***Required*** **Qualifications**
* Completed High/Secondary School, GED, an apprenticeship/vocational qualification, or equivalent experience and basic knowledge of computer hardware and components.

**Background Check Requirements:**
Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings:* Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.


While not required, we also look for the following***Preferred Qualifications******:**** 1+ years' experience supporting IT equipment or related technology.
* Applicable certifications: CompTIA (A+, Server+, Network+), Basic Structure Cabling (BSC).

  


Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

title: Café Team Member part time (16 hours), Amsterdam
description:
**Company Description**  

Do you want to be part of a warm and inviting café concept in the ARKET store in Amsterdam? Are you someone who always puts service and quality first? Then you could be the Café Team Member we’re looking for.

**About us**


ARKET is a modern-day market that offers essential products for men, women, children and the home. ARKET stores also include a café.


ARKET’s mission is to democratise quality through widely accessible, well-made, durable products, designed to be used and loved for a long time. The ARKET café is based on the principles of the New Nordic Food Manifesto. The menu has been developed to express the freshness and simplicity naturally associated with our region, and blends traditional Scandinavian flavours with modern and global influences. The café also aims to reflect the changing seasons through ingredients that distinguish the climate and landscapes of each local region.

 **Job Description**  

As part of our café team you will work in a welcoming Nordic café environment, integrated in our store, where you never lose focus on quality, service and providing our guest with an experience they will remember. Putting the guest first and being flexible comes naturally for you. You and your team will be responsible for creating a warm and inspiring café environment together with a unique local service culture. Some of your responsibilities include:

* Put the guest first! Welcome and actively attend to the guest’s every need in a warm and genuine way
* Prepare and provide quality coffee and food products at a consistently high standard
* Promote the culture, values and concept of the café as a whole

 **Qualifications**  

As a person, you are communicative and have a positive attitude. You are efficient, team oriented, take pride in giving guests a high level of service and you are driven by quality. We value an outgoing personality and a genuine interest in providing personal service. If you have experience from the hospitality or retail industry that is of course of interest, but what we value even more is a genuine interest in being part of the ARKET store team, a passion for service and a willingness to constantly improve the café together with your team.

 **Additional Information** **We offer**


A work environment where culture and values play a big part in everything we do. We have a flexible attitude and value an entrepreneurial spirit. We are proud to support all colleagues in taking initiative to grow and challenge the industry and believe that a fun working place generates great results.


We offer market specific benefits including training for your personal development, staff discount & staff allowance, corporate health management, reward program, refreshments at work and others.

**We care**


ARKET was founded with the mission to simplify good choices and influence positive change in our industry. By presenting a broad collection of well-considered fashion, food, scents, beauty and home items under one roof, we want to inspire people to live a more sustainable lifestyle.


At ARKET we believe in an inclusive and diverse workplace and the great value of different perspectives. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

title: Stockroom Assistant part time (21 hours), Amsterdam
description:
**Company Description**  

Are you passionate about operations, logistics and quality? We are currently looking for a Stockroom Assistant to support our stockrooms in Arket Amsterdam.

**About us**


ARKET is a modern-day market that offers essential products for men, women, children and the home, ARKET stores also include a café based on the New Nordic Food Manifesto. ARKET’s mission is to democratise quality through widely accessible, well-made, durable products, designed to be used and loved for a long time.

 **Job Description**  

You work actively to organize our stockroom and keep our store replenished.


You make sure we meet our customers’ expectations at all times while always supporting your team in the store.


Your main responsibilities are:

* Keep our stockroom organized while following store operations best practices.
* Ensure size availability in the shop floor together with Store Management team.
* Implement Sale and other commercial actions in the stockroom (i.e. stickering of Sale items).

  

**Qualifications**  

As a person, you have a positive attitude, communicate with warmth and you dare to be personal and genuine. You always have our customer top of mind and ensure a high level of customer service by being available, attentive, and responsive to the customer need.


You are efficient, team oriented and you have the will to secure operations in the store and take ownership of our stockroom.


You have strong multitasking capabilities and an outgoing personality.


Experience in operations is beneficial, but not mandatory. We value a genuine interest in being part of the ARKET store team, a passion for service and a willingness to constantly improve our business together with your team.

 **Additional Information** **We offer**


We offer a work environment where culture and values play a big part in everything we do. We have a flexible attitude and value an entrepreneurial spirit. We are proud to support all colleagues in taking initiative to grow and challenge the industry and believe that a fun working place generates great results.


We offer training for your personal development, staff discount & staff allowance, reward program, refreshments at work and others.

**We care**


ARKET was founded with the mission to simplify good choices and influence positive change in our industry. By presenting a broad collection of well-considered fashion, food, scents, beauty and home items under one roof, we want to inspire people to live a more sustainable lifestyle.


At ARKET we believe in an inclusive and diverse workplace and the great value of different perspectives. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

title: Legal - Working Student
description:
bloomon is turning the flower industry on its head – for the better. How? By disrupting the traditional supply chain! We skip the auction and wholesale, to shorten the journey for our flowers. And we harness technology, brand and innovation to deliver gifts and subscriptions that delight our customers across Europe.  

We launched in Amsterdam in 2014, and in 2021 joined forces with Bloom & Wild, the UK's fastest growing ecommerce company (according to the Financial Times). Our group is backed by top tier investors and is now home to a family of 3 strong brands, Bloom & Wild, bloomon and Bergamotte. Together, we’ve delivered over 20 million orders (and counting!), making us the largest direct to consumer flower business in Europe.  

Our vision is to create the destination for making life a little more thoughtful and beautiful. And we won't stop at flowers and plants. Starting with the Bloom & Wild brand, we're expanding our gifting offering to other categories like cakes, candles and cocktails. This is all part of our ambition to build Europe's #1 direct to consumer gifting destination.  

We care wildly about people and our planet. Which is why we’re so proud to be a certified B Corp™ – committed to making long-term positive change for our community, and the world around us. **What will you do?**
We are seeking a motivated working student to join our legal department, a role instrumental in enhancing our operational efficiency. As we continue to scale, there's an increasing demand for effective management of routine legal tasks and administrative duties. This role offers a unique opportunity to gain practical experience in a dynamic legal environment and to contribute significantly to our team. Your contributions will free up our legal associate & general counsel to focus on complex issues, driving the company's growth and success.
* **️ What you'll be doing:**
+ Assisting in identifying and mapping the applicable regulations that impact our operations
+ Assisting with basic legal research and preliminary drafting
+ GDPR compliance
+ Managing routine administrative tasks such as document management, KYC/UBO forms
+ Responding to frequently asked legal queries from various departments under supervision of your manager, utilising your legal knowledge and research skills.

### **✅ You’ll love this role if you…**

+ You are about to finalise your bachelor’s or master degree in Dutch Law
+ High level of discretion and understanding of confidentiality requirements in handling sensitive legal information
+ Good written and verbal communication skills in English and preferably Dutch
+ Ability to work independently as well as part of a teamEagerness to learn and apply theoretical knowledge in a practical, fast-paced environment
+ You are available 8-12 hours per week and available for a period of min. 6 months.
These are some of the skills and experience we think will enable success in this role, but please don’t worry if you are missing some of these. We’re committed to building a team made up of different strengths, skills and experiences, so if you’re excited about our values, passionate about what you do and would like to join us in doing things more thoughtfully, we’d love to hear from you.  

**Belonging at Bloom & Wild Group**
We know that we learn through our differences, and building a diverse team has always been central to creating the best experience for our customers. We value all backgrounds, perspectives, ideas and experiences, and encourage everyone to share their opinions openly within our caring and inclusive team.  

**Our ways of working**
We do things a little bit differently. From inventing letterbox flowers to founding The Thoughtful Marketing Movement. We’re big on collaboration, empathy, knowledge sharing and growth, and our values drive our priorities every day: **Lead change for good:** we have the guts to try new things and step up to do what matters most**Think deeply, act swiftly:** we make sure there’s thoughtful rationale behind our approach and always act swiftly to implement ideas**Care wildly:** we pour care and creativity into everything we do and pay attention to the things that make a difference**Stay open, be curious:** we’re open about what we’re doing and why, and we welcome challenges from each other  

We really believe in the power of face-to-face connections - be that through a shared project, a learning and development opportunity, or an after work social - and trust our teams to make the right decisions (for them and us) about where and how they work each day. Our working patterns are flexible and vary across the business, depending on the type of work, need for collaboration, and personal and wellbeing circumstances.  

 **(Some of) The good stuff**
To care wildly for our customers, firstly we care wildly for our teams. We work hard to craft a culture of thoughtfulness and care, where there is a strong sense of inclusion and belonging, enabling all of our people to thrive and be successful each day.  

**Work that works for you*** Flexible working (core hours from 10-4pm)
* Work Abroad for up to 30 days each year
* 1 day per year to volunteer on a project that’s close to your heart
* We’ll support your commute to our office and site locations. Depending on your journey to work, this may include a Swapfiets, an NS business card or expense reimbursement

  

**Health and wellbeing*** Mental health support through Open Up, including access to online therapy sessions
* Allies and champions groups
* Mental Health First Aiders and awareness training for our managers
* In person and virtual yoga every week
* Our office kitchen is stocked with healthy drinks and snacks to keep you going
* Workplace pension contributions

  

 **Growth & Development*** A flexible training framework for every stage of your career development through our Bloom & Learn programme
* Internal & external Speaker Sessions on a variety of different inspirational topics.

  

 **Moments that matter*** We love having lunch together! We offer daily fresh and healthy lunch options at our locations in Amsterdam and Amstelveen,
* A BBQ-worthy rooftop terrace (Amsterdam HQ)
* Social & wellbeing monthly calendar
* We love to celebrate birthdays, anniversaries and other important milestones!
* Summer and End of Year events, team lunches and post-peak celebrations
* Irresistible discounts on our products, blooms & subscriptions!

 **‍** **Getting hired**
We know that job searching can be daunting, and we want to do everything we can to ensure that your experience with us is a good one. Interviewing is a 2-way process, and we’re keen to answer all of the questions you have, so that you can be sure (and excited!) that we’re the right move for you.  

We believe in **leading change for good**, so do let us know if there’s anything we can do to support your application process. Also, if you have any feedback, please help us to improve our candidate experience by sharing (anonymously) here.

title: Barista - Shop Assistant (24-32 uur)
description:
**About us**

Britton's Bakery is a charming and bustling new bakery shop known for its delectable and artisanal North American pastries, and 'soon to be' exceptional coffee.

We take pride in creating a warm and inviting atmosphere where customers can enjoy freshly baked goods and handcrafted coffee beverages.

If you have a passion for coffee and a love for making people smile, we invite you to join our team!

**Job Description**

As a Barista at Britton’s Bakery, you will play a key role in creating an unforgettable experience for our customers. You will be responsible for crafting and serving high-quality coffee beverages and pastries, as well as providing exceptional customer service. Your passion for coffee, food and dedication to delivering top-notch service will help us maintain our reputation and become the go-to bakery shop in the area.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Prepare and serve a variety of coffee beverages, including espresso, cappuccinos, lattes, and drip coffee.
* Take customer orders, provide recommendations, and answer any questions about our coffee, bakery items and other merchandise and products sold in our shop area.
* Prepare pastries, snacks, and other bakery items as needed.
* Maintain a clean and organized workspace, including coffee preparation areas and serving stations.
* Handle operate the point-of-sale (POS) system accurately.
* Uphold our commitment to exceptional customer service by engaging with customers in a friendly and welcoming manner.
* Collaborate with team members to ensure smooth operations and a positive work environment.
* Adhere to all health and safety guidelines, including food safety practices and cleanliness standards.

**Qualifications**

* Previous barista or coffee-making experience is preferred but **not required**; we are willing to train the right candidate.
* A genuine passion for coffee and food.
* Excellent customer service and communication skills.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and handle multiple tasks with a smile.
* Attention to detail and a commitment to maintaining high-quality standards.
* A positive attitude and a strong team player.
* Availability to work flexible hours, including weekends and holidays.

**Benefits**

* Salary in accordance with collective labor agreement and opportunities for tips.
* Training and development opportunities to enhance your barista skills.
* A friendly and supportive team environment.
* Staff discounts on our delicious bakery and coffee products.
* Opportunities for advancement within the company.
* Employee recognition and appreciation programs.

If you're passionate about coffee, love creating memorable experiences for customers, and want to be a part of a thriving bakery shop team, we encourage you to apply! Please submit your resume and a brief cover letter outlining your interest and relevant experience. We look forward to welcoming a talented barista to the Britton’s family.

*Equal Opportunity Employer: Britton’s Bakery is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.*

title: Shipping & Receiving Agent (Purchasing)
description:
**Job Number** 24153404  

**Job Category** Procurement, Purchasing, and Quality Assurance  

**Location** The Ritz-Carlton Aruba, L. G. Smith Boulevard 107, Aruba, Aruba, Aruba VIEW ON MAP  

**Schedule** Full-Time  

**Located Remotely?** N  

**Relocation?** N  

**Position Type** Non-Management  

**POSITION SUMMARY**


Receive, unload, and process deliveries and account for incoming freight based on invoice and receiving reports. Stage merchandise by department, mark appropriately for placement in facility, and deliver merchandise to appropriate department. Verify and track received inventory and complete inventory reports and logs. Reconcile shipping invoices and receiving reports to ensure count accuracy. Receive, store, ship, and deliver incoming and outgoing department packages and mail. Secure the receiving room and its contents, ensuring safekeeping of packages. Follow all national, state, and local hazardous material shipping guidelines and regulations. Ship all out-going mail and packages. Verify quantity and condition of packages upon receipt prior to delivery to guest. Communicate with guest regarding received packages. Maintain accurate tracking system on all shipping and receiving transactions, including receiving guest signatures for received packages. Communicate with proper management regarding any loss or damage with packages.


Report accidents, injuries, and unsafe work conditions to manager; complete safety training and certifications. Follow all company policies and procedures; ensure uniform and personal appearance are clean and professional; maintain confidentiality of proprietary information; protect company assets. Address guests' service needs in a professional, positive, and timely manner. Speak with others using clear and professional language; answer telephones using appropriate etiquette. Develop and maintain positive working relationships with others. Read and visually verify information in a variety of formats (e.g., small print). Visually inspect tools, equipment, or machines (e.g., to identify defects). Move, lift, carry, push, pull, and place objects weighing less than or equal to 50 pounds without assistance. Grasp, turn, and manipulate objects of varying size and weight, requiring fine motor skills and hand-eye coordination. Move through narrow, confined, or elevated spaces. Move over sloping, uneven, or slippery surfaces as well as up and down stairs and/or service ramps. Reach overhead and below the knees, including bending, twisting, pulling, and stooping. Perform other reasonable job duties as requested by Supervisors.


PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS


Education: High school diploma or G.E.D. equivalent.


Related Work Experience: No related work experience.


Supervisory Experience: No supervisory experience.


License or Certification: None

*Marriott International is an equal opportunity employer. We believe in hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive, people-first culture. We are committed to non-discrimination on any protected basis, such as disability and veteran status, or any other basis covered under applicable law.*

  

At more than 100 award-winning properties worldwide, The Ritz-Carlton Ladies and Gentlemen create experiences so exceptional that long after a guest stays with us, the experience stays with them. Attracting the world’s top hospitality professionals who curate lifelong memories, we believe that everyone succeeds when they are empowered to be creative, thoughtful and compassionate.

  

Every day, we set the standard for rare and special luxury service the world over and pride ourselves on delivering excellence in the care and comfort of our guests.
  

Your role will be to ensure that the “Gold Standards” of The Ritz-Carlton are delivered graciously and thoughtfully every day. The Gold Standards are the foundation of The Ritz-Carlton and are what guides us each day to be better than the next. It is this foundation and our belief that our culture drives success by which The Ritz Carlton has earned the reputation as a global brand leader in luxury hospitality. As part of our team, you will learn and exemplify the Gold Standards, such as our Employee Promise, Credo and our Service Values. And our promise to you is that we offer the chance to be proud of the work you do and who you work with.
  

In joining The Ritz-Carlton, you join a portfolio of brands with Marriott International. **Be** where you can do your best work, **begin** your purpose, **belong** to an amazing global team, and **become** the best version of you.

title: Technical Training Specialist / Trainer
description:
Technical Training Specialist / Trainer


**Location:** Rheden, Gelderland, Netherlands, 6991 GS


**Company:** Chart Industries


**The Big Picture**


Howden Reciprocating and Centrifugal compressors (HCR), a Chart Industries Company, is a specialist supplier of tailor-made gas compression equipment to various industries Our products have made a valuable difference for our clients for the past 100 years, and we are now looking for a Technical Training Specialist (Trainer) who will join our team and assist us in making a valuable difference in the century to come. You will be a core member of our Aftermarket Academy Europe, part of the Howden and Chart Industries Group, that will be responsible for developing and delivering comprehensive training programs, catering to both internal teams and external clients. The purpose of the role is equipping our employees with the skills needed to excel in their roles and ensuring our clients maximize the value of our cutting-edge products. In addition to the training responsibilities, you will spearhead the creation of offers and oversee the handling of orders, taking a leading role in managing the financial aspects associated with our training services.


**What needs to be done?**


* Develop and deliver engaging training programs for internal teams, focusing on technical product knowledge, features, and best practices.
* Create customized training modules for external clients, ensuring they have a thorough understanding of our products and how to leverage them effectively.
* Collaborate closely with product development teams to stay updated on the latest features, updates, and industry trends.
* Conduct in-house, on-site, and virtual training sessions for both internal and external audiences.
* Customize training content to meet the specific needs of different teams and clients.
* Provide ongoing support and assistance to internal teams and clients, addressing product-related queries and ensuring a seamless learning experience.
* Assess the effectiveness of training programs, gather feedback, and make continuous improvements.
* Manage customized offers and orders for training services, ensuring alignment with client needs and company standards.
* Take ownership of financial aspects related to training services, including budgeting, pricing strategies, and expense management.


**What do you need to bring?**


* Bachelor's degree in a relevant field or equivalent work experience. If available, practical experience as a Field Service Engineer. Experience as a Technical Product Trainer, with a track record of conducting both internal and external training programs or equivalent work experience.
* Fluent English and Dutch language skills, both verbal and in writing.
* Exceptional communication and presentation skills, with the ability to adapt content to diverse audiences.
* In-depth understanding of our products and the ability to translate technical concepts into accessible training material.
* Proficient in creating training materials using various tools and platforms.
* Familiarity with e-learning platforms and techniques.
* Enthusiastic about staying updated on industry trends and incorporating new knowledge into training programs.
* Product knowledge: Compression technology, instrumentation technology, hydraulics, pneumatics, process engineering.


**What will you get in return?**


We offer an interesting and challenging position within a professional, international organization with freedom to act, improve processes and the opportunity to work with a variety of clients. As we consider talent management as key to the success of our organization, we offer opportunities for personal and professional development. Potential future positions could be within other Howden locations, a horizontal or vertical move within HCR. We offer a salary package that is fully in line with the level of the position, and which is supplemented by an extensive package of fringe benefits. We offer a Hybrid Working policy that provides the opportunity to work from your home office up to 3 days per week. About us: We enable our customers’ vital processes, which advance a more sustainable world. This is the Howden vision that drives us! Liaise with our colleagues in 34 countries. We offer global and local opportunities, 6000 employees and world leading engineers, who create cutting edge developments. You will be a part of over 160 years of innovation and development that continues today with our digital solutions. At Howden we have a strong corporate identity and purpose. You will be a member of our team, shaping the future of the world and tackling some of the most pressing issues facing the planet. Our products and organization are Revolving Around You. Our culture promotes individual development to enhance our most important asset – our people.


**About us**


Chart Industries is a leading global manufacturer of highly engineered equipment servicing multiple applications in the clean energy and industrial gas markets. In 2023 Chart Industries acquired the Howden Group, and the entire group is now represented in over 40 countries worldwide with over 11,700 employees. Our vision is to enable the vital processes of our customers and thereby promote a more sustainable world. Learn more about us at www.chartindustries.com .

title: Sustainability Assistant
Board Coordinator Corporate Office
description:
### **Function**


Do you want to make a difference and contribute to creating a better world? Are you interested in developing your skills and knowledge, while putting your ideals to work? Join us, we are a frontrunner in ethical banking and global impact investing, and we need people like you to make change happen.



We believe that money can change the world for the better. In fact, our organisation was founded on this belief. Our mission is to create a society that protects and promotes the quality of life of all its members with human dignity at its core.



To strengthen our Corporate Office Team we are looking for a Board Coordinator Corporate Office


**Board Coordinator Corporate Office (32 hours)**



Together with your colleague Board Coordinator, you support the Boards of Triodos Bank, i.e. the Executive Board and Supervisory Board, and Stichting Administratiekantoor Aandelen Triodos Bank (SAAT) by applying your excellent planning and preparation skills.



You are responsible for the practical aspects of the Board meetings in close collaboration with the Corporate Secretary and two Deputy Corporate Secretaries.



You enjoy arranging (international) management meetings in a dynamic environment with a sense of humour and positive attitude while maintaining oversight and professionalism.

### **Profile**

**Take action**





* Arranging all practical aspects of the Supervisory Board and its committees’ meetings such as Outlook invitations, organisation and distribution of documents, (international) logistics and catering, as well as the logistics for the Board of SAAT
* Back-up for your colleague Board Coordinator: arranging all practical aspects of the weekly Executive Board meetings and retreats, and International Management Council (IMC) meetings, such as agenda/topic planning, Outlook invitations, organisation and distribution of documents, logistics and catering
* Scheduling of ad hoc Board meetings, calls and working sessions
* Point of contact for practical and administrative requests from the Supervisory Board and the Corporate Office team in general
* Taking care of financial administration and payment of remuneration of the members of the Supervisory Board and SAAT


**This is you**





* Accurate, consistent and proactive problem solving
* High level of trust and discretion. Able to work with highly confidential information
* Ability to perform well in a dynamic environment at a strategic level
* A team player, able to manage expectations, but also able to work independently
* When under pressure, you maintain your flexibility and your sense of humour
* Able to work with colleagues at all levels within the organisation
* Quickly familiarise yourself with new topics or assignments


**This is complemented by**





* MBO+ level educated preferably as a secretary or office manager
* Excellent communication skills both in English and Dutch
* Computer skills and experience with MS Office
* Systems and technology savvy
* Ideally experience with iBabs or similar meeting tool


**The team**





You are part of the Corporate Secretary Department that consists of two Board Coordinators, two Deputy Corporate Secretaries, the Business Manager COE and the Corporate Secretary. You will also work closely together with the Management Assistants of the Executive Board.

### **Offer**

**What we offer you**





**An inspiring work culture**  

The most important thing about working with us is that you are part of a community that is changing the world for the better. We are constantly improving our work culture to create conditions where every person can thrive, so you are able to:





* find a sense of meaning in your work
* create positive energy and impact with your co-workers
* build mutual trust and respect in working relationships
* enjoy fulfilment at a professional and personal level
* 

**A comfortable working environment**

  

Our award-winning sustainable head office is based in Driebergen-Zeist, the Netherlands at the Reehorst Estate, just a 3 minutes’ walk from the train station. Combined with working from home, it is an inspiring place to work and connect with your colleagues. One of the interesting facts about it is that we can completely take the building apart and move it to a new location.





**And of course, great remuneration and working conditions**





* a salary appropriate to the position, our remuneration policy and your experience
* an attractive pension policy
* a mobility card (including free private travels)
* flexible working hours and the opportunity to work from home
* reimbursement of a company bicycle to the max of € 1,500
* 30 holiday days with a 40-hour working week, plus the option of buying 2 weeks of extra holiday days
* extra leave to contribute to voluntary work
* a range of education and training opportunities
* the option to join our collective health insurance
* a working from home allowance per home office day
* suitable home office equipment up to € 750 every 5 years


**Sounds interesting?**

  

If you feel that you want to make a difference, don’t hesitate to join the Triodos community by applying for this role.



Everyone is welcome and our culture is built with human dignity at its core. We believe in equity and diversity, and we know how valuable everyone’s individual perspectives are. We strive to create an environment in which all co-workers and our broader community can feel safe and included.





**The closing date for applications is: 22 september 2024**





If the role interests you but you still have some questions, please connect with us. If there are any additional adjustments you may need during the application process, please email: Maaike van der Meer**, Corporate Secretary, via email maaike.vandermeer@triodos.com.**



We also don’t want to miss out on candidates who feel they don’t exactly match the job description, so if this is a role that sounds interesting to you, and you feel you could add value, please apply.


**Who we are**

  

Triodos Bank is a leading expert in sustainable banking, founded in 1980 in the Netherlands, with branches in Belgium, Germany, United Kingdom, and Spain.  

Triodos Investment Management is a globally recognised leader in impact investing, that currently manages 20 funds invested in both Europe and emerging markets.

  

Triodos Regenerative Money Centre is our business unit launched in 2019 with the explicit goal of restoring and regenerating nature and society.

  

We are a **certified B** Corp since 2015. B Corp is a growing global community of successful and sustainable companies that create positive social impact and change.

  

We are also one of the founders of **The Global Alliance for Banking on Values**, a global network of independent banks using finance to deliver sustainable economic, social, and environmental development.


**www.triodos.com** | **www.triodos-im.com** | **www.triodosfoundation.n**

title: Partner Success Coordinator
description:
*Are you ready for what’s next?**Come explore opportunities within Brunswick, a global marine leader committed to challenging conventions and innovating next-generation technologies that transform experiences on the water and beyond. Brunswick believes “Next Never Rests™,” and we offer a variety of exciting careers and growth opportunities within united teams defining the future of marine recreation.*
About Fliteboard
Growing from start-up to establishing a global brand following and a loyal community of customers spanning 90 countries.
We’re on a mission to build the world’s most loved electric water-sports brand, offering the most remarkable product and customer experience and innovating towards cleaner and quieter waterways.
About the role
The purpose of the Partner Success Coordinator is to represent the face of Flite to our partners and be their key to a great collaboration with Flite. In this dynamic and multi-layered role, you will be responsible for building loyal and supportive relationships with our partners, supporting their technical support needs, and converting those relationships into opportunities for longterm growth as a Flite partner. Alongside the territorial sales managers, you will be their main contact as their trusted advisor, aiding and guiding on operational, support, product-related issues and best practices that drive their success.
What you’ll love* Working together with a talented and diverse team
* Being part of a business that is passionate about building a loyal community around the world and prides itself on looking after its customers
* Growth and development opportunities
* Fliteboarding!


Responsibilities* Directly supporting our partners with any technical inquiries.
* On-boarding new Commercial Partners and assisting in keeping their information accurate and up to date.
* Managing Commercial Partner Accounts and ensuring their success through regular checking ins on technical and marketing support and where necessary evaluating the progress of our partners with regards to agreements made.
* Account orders & repeat orders in cooperation with local Sales team.
* Ensuring that our partners are always up to date with the newest instructions and resources available to them in cooperation with our Service Team and Marketing Team
* In-depth understanding of the technical side of all Fliteboard products to support internal and external stakeholders.
* Occasional technical on-boarding and training of all EMEA Service Partners, including refresher and technical level upgrade.


You’d be great at this job if you:* have a minimum of two to three years of experience in a similar role
* thrive in a fast-paced environment and are solution oriented
* are customer obsessed and excellence driven
* are technically minded and curious about how things work.
* have excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* ideally have experience with the water sports industry
* have a collaborative mindset but can also work autonomously


What we can offer* Competitive salary and bonus
* EAP for all global employees - we value well-being
* Birthday Leave - have a day off on us!

*Next is Now!*  

*We value growth and development, recognizing that people come with a wealth of experience and talent beyond just the technical requirements of a job. If your experience is close to what you see listed here, please still consider applying. Diversity of experience and skills combined with passion is a key to innovation and inspiration. Therefore, we encourage people from all backgrounds to apply to our positions. Please let us know if you require accommodations during the interview process.* *Brunswick is committed to providing a workplace that offers equal employment opportunities based solely on merit. Therefore, discrimination based on race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other protected status under applicable local, state or federal law is not tolerated.*
Brunswick and Workday Privacy Policies*Brunswick does not accept applications, inquiries or solicitations from unapproved staffing agencies or vendors.*
#Brunswick Corporation

title: People Operations Specialist
description:
**Your Mission**



We’re looking for a People Operations Specialist, to be the heart of our HR administration, providing essential support and guidance to our talented team members throughout their entire journey with us—from onboarding to offboarding. You’ll also collaborate closely with the People Team on initiatives that shape and enhance our company culture, ensuring that every employee’s experience is nothing short of outstanding.

  

**About the People Team**



You’ll be part of the Global People Team of 11 HR and Talent Acquisition professionals, and as a core member of both the Dutch and global team, you’ll report directly to our Head of People and take ownership of People Operations in the Netherlands and Germany. Our mission is simple but powerful; to set our people and the company up for success and at the same time ensure that our employees are happy, healthy, and productive  



  

**12 month journey**



The first 3 months: Immerse yourself in the world of Tellent—get to know our HR processes, our amazing team members (aka “Tellenties”), our locations, and the exciting People Projects we’re working on.

  

After 6 Months: You’ll be fully onboarded and taking full ownership of the employee lifecycle. This is your time to shine as you streamline HR processes, refine policies, and elevate the onboarding and offboarding experiences.

  

After 12 Months: You’ll be driving impact, contributing to our People Roadmap, and making meaningful improvements that resonate across the organization.

  

**What you’ll do**:

  

* Serve as the first point of contact for employee inquiries on benefits, leave, payroll, policies, and more.
* Own and execute onboarding and offboarding processes, including delivering the PeopleOps orientation.
* Collaborate regularly with managers, the People Team, and external stakeholders to address employment-related issues and ensure smooth operations.
* Maintain personnel records and ensure data accuracy within our HRIS system (KiwiHR).
* Manage and oversee the monthly Dutch and German payroll cycles, while coordinating with our EOR services for Portugal and Belgium.
* Handle HR and Benefits administration, including contracts, addendums, personnel administration, and probation periods.
* Lead and participate in impactful People Team projects to enhance team operations and employee experience.
* Proactively identify inefficiencies and drive continuous process improvements.
* Act as the primary contact for external providers (e.g., UWV, arbodienst, pensioenverzekering).
* Oversee absence management, ensuring compliance with the “Wet verbetering Poortwachter”.

 **What you’ll bring to the team:**

  

* +2 years of work experience as a People Operations, HR Coordinator, or a similar role in The Netherlands
* Solid understanding of Dutch employment law and payroll processes.
* Basic understanding of German employment law payroll processes.
* Excellent command of English language, written and spoken. Dutch or German is a bonus.
* A proactive and positive mindset

 **Why Tellent**


* Flexibility to work from home in the Netherlands and from our beautiful canal-side office in Amsterdam
* A chance to be part of and shape one of the most ambitious scale-ups in Europe
* Work in a diverse and multicultural team
* **€1,500 annual training budget** plus internal training
* Pension plan, travel reimbursement, and wellness perks
* 25 paid holiday days + 2 additional days to relax in 2024
* Work from anywhere for 4 weeks/year
* An inclusive and international work environment with a whole lot of fun thrown in!
* Apple MacBook and tools
* **€400 travel budget** to visit your colleagues in Poland or France
* **€200 Home Office budget**
* We’ll save you the startup pitch of Friday beers and ping-pong. Visit our Instagram to check us out!

 **About Tellent**



Tellent, a premier Talent Management Suite, enables People teams to improve the full employee lifecycle with a cutting-edge Applicant Tracking System, Human Resources Information System, and Performance Management Software – all in one place.  

  

With 300+ talented employees operating from six global locations, we've empowered over 7,000 organizations across 100+ countries with our leading HR tech solutions – Recruitee, KiwiHR, and Javelo. We have a growing network of over 300 partners, all committed to one vision: guiding all People leaders to create a better world of work.

  


**Have we caught your attention?** ️



If you’d like to be part of this incredible journey, please apply directly - we're looking forward to speaking to you!  

  

Tellent *is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and welcome applications from underrepresented groups and encourage people of all backgrounds to apply. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, neurodiversity, or status as an individual with a disability.*

title: Fleet Security Coordinator (d/f/m)
description:
**Your responsibilities**
-------------------------


The Fleet Security Coordinator is a pivotal role within Uniper, responsible for supporting all aspects of physical site-security to safeguard our people, assets, and reputation. This exciting new role involves collaboration with internal and external stakeholders to ensure compliance with established policies and regulations.


**Key Responsibilities**


* Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to manage site physical security effectively.
* Assess potential threats and implement risk mitigation measures.
* Maintain a site risk register and evaluate risks associated with any changes in site use or security systems.
* Manage the operation of security equipment and infrastructure.
* Develop, review, and test a comprehensive site security plan.
* Manage contract security service providers and maintenance services.
* Promote a strong security culture through incident reporting, investigation, and training sessions.
* Support the delivery of the security strategy and ensure compliance with policies and regulations.

**Your profile**
----------------


* Successfully completed vocational training
* Experience working within a security team environment.
* Ability to develop, implement, and manage a site security plan.
* Competent in conducting initial physical security incident investigations.
* Experience liaising with local government agencies and law enforcement.
* Integrity screening (VOG) is an obligated part of the selection process
* Reliable, trustworthy, and self-organized team player with good communication skills
* Target- and solution-orientated thinking
* Driving license and ability to travel (internationally) if required.
* Fluent in Dutch and good knowledge of English

title: Revenue Operations Specialist
description:
**Your Mission**

  


As a Revenue Operations Specialist with a focus on Partnership motion at Tellent, you will play a critical role in architecting and optimizing partnership operations.


You will work closely with other teams, including Customer Success, Sales, Marketing, Partnerships and Product, to optimise processes, improve customer experience, and drive customer satisfaction. This role requires a blend of analytical insight, operational expertise, and hands-on execution to ensure our customers continue to experience value and achieve their desired outcomes with our solutions.

 **Your Team**  

  

You will join a central team of 4 RevOps professionals, responsible for optimising inputs and outputs of the revenue funnel and report into the VP of Revenue Operations.

 **12-Month Journey**

  

**First 3 months:** Learn about the company's products, systems, and current processes. Begin assessing existing processes and tools, particularly around partnership operations. Start building relationships with key stakeholders across departments.

  

**After 6 months:** Begin implementing initial process improvements and project initiatives. Work on your first project related to the partnership. Take ownership of reporting for partnerships and other assigned areas.

  

**After 12 months:** Develop and implement processes to enhance efficiency and productivity. Lead ongoing improvements in systems and processes, based on data-driven insights.Fully own processes related to partnerships and support in other revenue operations.

 **What you'll do:**


* Develop and elevate the Partnership Operations: Analyze and refine partnership processes to drive efficiency and effectiveness. Implement tools and systems to enhance productivity, including forecasting & reporting.
* Collaborate with Partnership and other Teams: Partner with Partnership, Customer Success, Sales, Marketing, and Product teams to align processes with business objectives. Co-own partnership metrics, forecasting, and performance analysis with the RevOps team.
* Ensure CRM & Partnertack Data Accuracy and Hygiene: Work with Partnership team to maintain accurate CRM & Partnerstack data hygiene and integrity. Regularly audit and update customer information to ensure data accuracy.
* Design and Implement Process Improvements
* Generate Data Insights and Analysis: Translate complex data sets into actionable recommendations and insights for decision-making. Generate standard recurring customer health reports, renewal forecasts, and churn analysis.
* Serve as Subject Matter Expert and Main Point of Contact
* Collaborate in Strategic Initiatives and Track Project Progress

 **What You’ll Bring:**


* +2 years of experience in a similar role or in a SaaS company with an understanding of revenue processes.
* Critical Thinking and Problem-Solving: Ability to analyze complex data and processes to identify areas for improvement.
* Excellent communication skills with the ability to convey complex concepts.
* Comfortable navigating dynamic environments and managing stakeholders.

  


**Why Tellent ?**


* Flexibility to work from home and from our beautiful canal-side office in Amsterdam, OR in the heart of Paris
* Flexible remote policy
* Lunch vouchers - Swile (FR)
* Reimbursement of 50% of public transportation (Pass Navigo) 50% (FR)
* 33 paid vacation days per year (FR) or 25 paid holiday days (NL) + 2 wellbeing days.
* Work from anywhere for 4 weeks/year.
* **Learning budget** allocated per year
* **Travel budget** allocated per year to meet your colleagues in different countries
* **Home office setup budget** to make your remote work more convenient.
* International environment

 **About Tellent:**

  


Tellent, a premier Talent Management Suite, enables People teams to improve the full employee lifecycle with a cutting-edge Applicant Tracking System, Human Resources Information System, and Performance Management Software – all in one place.  

  

With 300+ talented employees operating from six global locations, we've empowered over 7,000 organisations across 100+ countries with our leading HR tech solutions – Recruitee, KiwiHR, and Javelo. We have a growing network of over 300 partners, all committed to one vision: guiding all People leaders to create a better world of work.  

  

**Have we caught your attention? ️**  

  

If you’d like to be part of this incredible journey, please apply directly - we're looking forward to speaking to you!  

  

*Tellent is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and welcome applications from underrepresented groups and encourage people of all backgrounds to apply. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, neurodiversity, or status as an individual with a disability.*

title: Early Careers Recruiter - DACH
description:
SoSafe have an ambition, which is to be the leading cyber security provider in Europe. Our award winning awareness platform triggers behavioral change by providing effective and engaging training and simulations on cyber security and data protection. Cybercrime is predicted to cost the world $10.5 Trillion annually by 2025 - we invite you to be part of the solution! Our Talent Acquisition organisation is growing, and we are now looking for a Senior Recruiter to join our team supporting hiring for our Go-to-Market organisation.  

  

As a University Recruiter at SoSafe, you will develop deep partnerships with universities in Germany and Amsterdam, internal stakeholders, your peers and with our wider People team. Your passion for recruiting and early careers programs and a genuine commitment for thinking outside the box are core skills needed to succeed in this role. You can be based remotely in Germany or the Netherlands. Ongoing travel within these regions will be required and expected.  

  

**Responsibilities:**

* Build a creative and unique early careers program that is going to be impactful both in the short and long term
* Build and maintain excellent relationships with relevant universities in Germany and the Netherlands
* Host in-house career days for students and recent graduates by department or field of expertise
* Attend college career fairs, interacting with students and promoting our employer brand and partnering with internal recruiters by attracting and onboarding relevant, talented individuals,
* Screen resumes, conducting interviews for junior positions and internships
* Partner with our employer branding specialist to build our employer brand within college communities that is consistent with our overall employer brand
* Report on recruiting metrics after every careers event, including number of candidates interviewed and hired, RoI on event costs and other relevant data to assess to efficacy of our activities
* Design and place ads on college campuses, alumni boards, and other relevant advertising activities

**Requirements:**

* Experience in an early careers recruiting role
* We require a programmatic approach to designing and launching an early careers program from the ground up, specifically within the DACH and Netherlands regions
* Knowledge of the university eco system in the DACH market
* Familiarity with social media sourcing and creative social media strategies
* Understanding of labor legislation, particularly regarding internships
* Excellent networking abilities
* Fluency in English, as well as German or Danish, is preferred.

**Why Us?**


At SoSafe, you'll be part of a cybersecurity team that thrives on innovation, safeguarding organizations against evolving threats and making the digital world a safer place. You will have the opportunity to make a real impact, surrounded by a dynamic and supportive team and environment committed to your professional growth.

**What we offer:**

**Work-Life Balance:**

* Flexible hours
* 33 vacation days
* **Mobility Support:**
* Public Transport Subsidy
* **Work Environment:**
* State-of-the-art tech
* Annual company off-site
* Networking events
* **Healthcare:**
* OpenUp
* **Other Perks:**
* Company Pension Scheme in some regions
* Corporate Discounts
* Referral Bonus
* Learning & Development Allowance

 **About Us**


We are one of the fastest-growing security awareness scale-ups worldwide. By putting people first and focusing on behavioral science, we are disrupting the status-quo of Cyber Security.


Backed by strong VC funding by those such as Highland Europe and Global Founders Capital, we are looking for more motivated team players who will assist us with our ambitious mission and international expansion. At SoSafe, you will take ownership for your work and your growth, taking your career to the next level! If you want to have an impact and are looking to contribute in meaningful ways within an open-minded environment that values diversity and community, SoSafe might just be the right place to work for you!


Are you our next Cyber Security Hero?


Join us on our journey to make the digital world a safer place!

title: Recon Sales Rep - South West NLD
description:
Sales Representative - Recon
South West Netherlands (Rotterdam/Hertogenbosch)
Life Unlimited.
At Smith+Nephew, we design and manufacture technology that takes the limits off living.
What will you be doing?
Firstly, build real and meaningful relationships with our customers. Beyond that it's about developing a strategy in partnership with our leadership that provides the best possible service keeping our customers and patients at the centre of what we do. This role will work with our recon customers, working with them to ensure that product availability meets their needs and the needs of the patient.
What does success look like?
Success in the role will be determined by revenue and an improved service provision and efficiency in our business interactions with our customers.
It's the ability to take strategic responsibility for your area, working with your customers to deliver for our patients. In turn, we expect such strategic relationships to maximise sales revenue across the geography this will likely impact on existing and new accounts to proactively drive growth.
Successful candidates would need the following:* Delivery of value-based business proposals to key target customers in defined accounts to meet in year sales revenue targets
* Strong focussed account management of segmented 'Grow' & 'Maintain' accounts
* Continuously stay up-to-date with all developments in local health care. Assess the territory and the relevant market to identify emerging trends and movements within the market

Travel requirements: ~ 75%
You. Unlimited.
