title: Recruitment Business Partner
description:
We are Quatt. A fast growing Dutch scale-up that is dedicated to expediting the energy transition with sustainable home energy solutions accessible to all, aiming to assist 3 million households in making the transition by 2030. That’s why we're looking for a highly motivated and ambitious individual who's ready to roll up their sleeves and make a tangible impact on the climate change challenge we're tackling head-on. **Are you ready to rise to the challenge?**

  

As our **Talent Acquisition Business Partner** you will be responsible for fulfilling our hiring needs in our Sales & Marketing domains. You will work closely together with the hiring managers in these departments and you will play a key role in advising them on hiring and talent related topics. You will also work together with a medior Talent Recruiter to execute the hiring roadmap of these departments. Finally, your experience and point of view will help us to improve our team and step up our game.

 **What you will do:**


* Collaborate with hiring managers to define roles, streamline the recruitment process, and align on hiring needs.
* Execute the hiring roadmap in partnership with the team lead, driving key recruitment KPIs such as time to hire and number of hires per month.
* Advise on salary ranges, job titles, and job descriptions, ensuring market competitiveness and alignment within your domain.
* Proactively push vacancies through recruitment marketing, campaigns, and collaboration with external partners.
* Ensure a smooth and positive candidate experience throughout the recruitment process.
* Mentor and coach the junior/medior talent recruiter, as well as hiring managers, on effective interview techniques and recruitment best practices.
* Manage offers to candidates, ensuring alignment with both company standards and candidate expectations.

 **What you’ll bring:**


* 5+ years of experience in end-to-end recruitment, with a focus on high-volume environments and sales & marketing roles.
* Proven ability to manage multiple roles simultaneously and advise on salary ranges and job titles based on market trends.
* Strong communication, organizational, and sourcing skills, with the ability to build extensive networks and ensure alignment across teams.
* Experience with recruitment marketing and candidate engagement strategies.
* Initiative, adaptability, and resilience in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment.
* Fluency in English and Dutch, and a high level of independence and energy.
* A collaborative mindset and the ability to mentor and coach both junior recruiters and hiring managers.

 **Ready to change the future with us?**  

If what you've read excites you and you believe you're a great fit for our team, please apply below. Don't worry if you don't tick every box – at Quatt, we value performance over prejudice and always look further than just your resume. Join us in our mission to accelerate the transition to sustainable home energy for all

 **How to Apply**  

Submit your application below. Our Talent Acquisition team will review it and get back to you within 10 working days.

 **Next Steps**  

Our process typically includes three interviews, where we start with getting to know each other a bit better.

 **Questions?**  

If you have any questions about the role, feel free to reach out to ipek@quatt.io  

  

Please note that we are not working with recruitment agencies at this time. Thank you for your understanding. Every resume we will get from an agency, will be treated as our own .

  

We believe in diversity, inclusiveness and we want to give everyone a fair chance, therefore it's okay to not mention your gender, nationality and date of birth on your resume.

title: Partnerships Support Officer
description:
**Reporting to**: Partnerships Manager - Europe

**Contract:** FTC (6 months), with the possibility of extension

**Salary**: €32,500 - €35,000 (pro rata) depending upon experience

**Location**: The Hague, The Netherlands (hybrid with 2-3 days in the office or onsite if preferred by candidate)

### **About HALO**


The HALO Trust is the leading global NGO addressing the impact and drivers of conflict in over 30 countries and territories, employing more than 12,500 staff. Our primary duty is to serve people affected by conflict, clearing landmines and the explosive remnants of war that threaten lives and livelihoods long after fighting has finished. We make land safe where war has ended, while also assisting those affected by active conflict and endemic violence, creating more durable solutions to support stability.


In recent years HALO has grown significantly, and with our financial strength and strong government, community, and partner relationships we are uniquely positioned to help build more resilient and prosperous communities.

### **About the role**


The Partnerships Support Officer is responsible for supporting the Partnerships Team (part of the Strategy Group) with donor relations and contractual management of existing global donors along with the development of new partnership and donor relationships. They will report directly to the Partnerships Manager Europe but support the wider partnerships team and Strategy Department as and when required.

**\*\*Please note that** ***only*** **applicants who have the right to work in the Netherlands will be considered.\*\***

### **Responsibilities**

* Contract Management.
* Assist the Partnerships Manager Europe with the management of multi-country, multi-year contracts, coordinating with country teams to meet contractual requirements.
* Monitor and analyse funding opportunities and other relevant information at global levels.
* Support with proposal development, with the coordination of multi-annual multi-country submissions and with the liaison with country programmes during these processes.
* Support with reporting requirements, including with IATI reporting requirements for European donors.
* Support for contract storage management.
* Support with compliance and due diligence processes.
* Support with development of other activities and events led by the Partnerships Team.

**Donor Relations**

* Support HALO Europe with desktop research and donor engagement on new potential donors.
* Assist with the preparation and organisation of donor meetings, take meeting minutes and notes as required.
* Support internal and external communication efforts within HALO.

**Support to Country Programme**

* Provide additional support to country programme teams with the production of high-quality concept notes, proposals, tenders, reports and annual plans.
* Keep up to date with country programme priorities and funding needs to advise and support future funding opportunities.

**Administrative support**

* Offer administrative support to the wider the Strategy Department Team. This may include support with the organisation of quarterly Strategy Department Meetings, ensuring calendars are aligned and thematic research.

**All HALO staff are expected to undertake the following general duties:**


* Work within the framework of HALO’s core values, promoting its ethos and mission statement.
* Work towards achieving programme and/or group business plan objectives.
* Travel overseas as and when required.

**Requirements**

**Required**

* Relevant Postgraduate University or professional qualification related to international relations, development or political or social sciences.
* Previous experience working for an international charity, NGO or international organisation.
* Knowledge and understanding of European Union institutions, development and humanitarian policies.
* Collaborative working and communication style.
* Numeracy skills and data analysis skills.
* Strong attention to detail.
* A self-starter, able to organise and manage their own time and deliver quality work.
* A practical and adaptable person, prepared to work in a challenging and fluid operating environment.
* Written and oral fluency in English.
* Experience with proof reading and editing professional text.

**Desirable**

* Familiarity with the NGO sector is desirable.
* Understanding/experience with donor management and compliance, particularly with German and Dutch Government Contracts.
* Knowledge and understanding of policy priority themes such as gender, environment, the triple nexus, localisation and conflict sensitivity.

**Benefits**

* Eligible to join the Dutch ‘Cycle to Work’ scheme. (either through leasing or buying) Economic incentive of €0.19 per kilometre when using the bicycle for commuting and work-related travel purposes.
* Eligible for % coverage on legal fees in application of the 30% tax exemption.
* 20 days Holiday allowance (excluding local public and bank holidays).
* 8% Holiday Allowance inclusive per annum.
* Variable elements: Bonus at the discretion of the Employer.
* Additional Benefits: As per HALO Trust SCPP.
* Eligible for private pension contributions (matched contributions paid by HALO.
* Access to Private Medical Insurance.

*Please submit a CV (no more than 2 pages) and a cover letter (no more than 1 page) outlining how your experience matches the key skills and competencies. We reserve the right to amend the closing date depending on the number of applications received. Closing date for applications is* ***20th September 2024*** *at midnight. If there is a sufficient calibre of applicant, we reserve the right to close the role earlier than the date noted.*

*Interviews are schedule for the w/c of* ***30/09/2024****. A written assignment will be part of the application process.*

*The HALO Trust is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against any applicant for employment because of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation.*

*The HALO Trust is committed to a culture that is both diverse and inclusive and we seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people form a diverse candidate pool.*

title: Jr. Strategy Executive, MeMo²
description:
We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in.
To start a career that is out of the ordinary, please apply...
Job Details
Kantar is currently looking for a Strategy Executive to join our MeMo² team in Amsterdam!
About MeMo²
MeMo² – a Kantar Company is an agency that has shown itself over the last 15 years, by winning several prestigious marketing & research awards, and successfully collaborating with many advertisers and media- & marketing agencies. Thanks to our energetic team, profits have increased by 60% over the last 2 years. Close partnership with the client is our priority. Our advice doesn’t stop after one campaign or one question: that’s just the beginning.
About the role
At MeMo² you will get the opportunity to offer concrete conclusions and optimisations, based on data, to the top-500 advertisers nationally and internationally. On a day-to-day basis you will be supporting our Strategy Consultants during intake, analysis and presentations. You are in close contact with agencies and data suppliers, you lead the planning of projects and you executive well-designed, professional reports for our top clients.
Your responsibilities* Manage client projects and look after research design, execution and data analysis.
* Provide brand managers and marketing departments with well-designed, straightforward reports and analytical insights.
* Co-design surveys, leading to actionable recommendations that support our clients in their strategic decision-making process.
* Attend client intakes, briefings and presentations.
* Represent MeMo² as a global Brand & Crossmedia specialist.


Your profile* You hold a relevant degree, combined with a proven marketing knowledge and curiosity about market research.
* Min. 1 year of professional work experience in a relevant role.
* You are comfortable with both quantitative and qualitative market research data.
* You are fluent in English and Dutch.
* You are experienced with various areas of word processing, spreadsheets, and presentation tools.
* You have experience with direct project management and team working experience.


On top of this, you ...* Have a passion for brands, advertising, and digital.
* Are a proactive and resourceful problem-solver.
* Are flexible and you like working in a dynamic organisation.
* Demonstrate client-centricity, creativity, empathy, and authenticity.


Is this you? Come join us!
We offer a versatile job in an inspiring, international, and informal working environment at a leading organization, where you will work together with a team of enthusiastic colleagues on challenging projects for some of the largest companies in the world.
In addition, we offer:* A challenging position where you are in contact with key clients, both for operational excellence and to provide them with insights and answers to important questions.
* A variety of clients, branches and consultancy-assignments.
* Intensive onboarding program, with guidance and help from Strategy Managers and Consultants.
* A cooperation with driven data scientists with joint responsibility to supply brand managers and marketing departments with useful insights.
* A spot at an award winning agency where growth and development are highly valued.
* Monthly internal knowledge sessions (MeMoUniversity).
* A beautiful, large and new office in the center of Amsterdam: fun lunches and weekly drinks.
* A gross monthly salary of ca. € 2750, with additional benefits such as a company laptop, WFH and travel allowance, and hybrid working.


Interested?
Send us your CV and cover letter today and give your career the ideal start in marketing, insights and consultancy.
#LI-BB3
#Ll-Hybrid
Location
Amsterdam, AmsteldijkNetherlands
Kantar Rewards Statement
At Kantar we have an integrated way of rewarding our people based around a simple, clear and consistent set of principles. Our approach helps to ensure we are market competitive and also to support a pay for performance culture, where your reward and career progression opportunities are linked to what you deliver.  

We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in. Apply for a career that’s out of the ordinary and join us.  

We want to create an equality of opportunity in a fair and supportive working environment where people feel included, accepted and are allowed to flourish in a space where their mental health and well being is taken into consideration.  

We want to create a more diverse community to expand our talent pool, be locally representative, drive diversity of thinking and better commercial outcomes.
Kantar is the world’s leading data, insights and consulting company. We understand more about how people think, feel, shop, share, vote and view than anyone else. Combining our expertise in human understanding with advanced technologies, Kantar’s 30,000 people help the world’s leading organisations succeed and grow.

title: Product Partnerships - Embedded Finance
description:
Mollie was founded in 2004 in Amsterdam. Since then, Mollie has grown exponentially to become a trusted payment service provider for over 200,000 businesses. However, this is just the beginning.


We feel that banking has been set up against us for too long. From overdraft fees to payment processing, banking products are confusing, stressful, and frankly—boring.


In contrast, Mollie was founded to change the status quo, aiming to provide a new generation of financial products designed to work entirely for our customers. A product-first approach that our customers can truly benefit from.

**Your opportunity**


Mollie collaborates with multiple product partners to improve our ability to provide customers with the most relevant and optimised products and features. As part of the Product Partnerships team, you will work on developing new cross-functional products and managing existing partnerships, making a significant impact on Mollie's success.


In this role, you will be a key enabler of our mission to help customers with effortless money management by supporting our new suite of Financial Services products, including Mollie Capital, Mollie Invoicing, and an exciting new offering yet to be disclosed. These products form a powerful toolbox designed to address our customers' cash flow needs. To accelerate the deployment of these solutions, Mollie builds partnerships with leading industry players. You will be responsible for managing these strategic relationships.

**What you'll be doing**

* Manage and grow partnerships with a variety of strategic partners for Mollie, focusing on enhancing our suite of Financial Services products
* Structure, negotiate, and develop partnership contracts that directly support our financial services and cash flow management solutions.
* Help to build and execute the payment partner strategy with best-in-class analytics.
* Deepen relationships with our partners and enhance collaborative efforts across product, marketing, support, operations, strategy, and planning to co-create best-in-class financial services products for our customers.
* Understand our product proposition and strategy, as well as the partner capabilities, to jointly develop financial services products tailored to our customers' needs.
* Be the first point of contact for partners both internal and external
* Responsible for performance management and quarterly business reviews
* Work closely with country managers, product, and marketing to ensure smooth resolution of issues, gather feedback, and identify and prioritize opportunities to enhance our financial services toolbox.
* Work closely with support to improve partner processes for efficiency

**What you'll bring:**

* 5+ years of experience in a partnership, account management, or strategy role, with a strong background in Financial Services - experience in neobank, embedded finance, or similar sectors is a must.
* Data-driven with proven experience in project management, particularly in developing and managing financial services products.
* Strong communicator with an ability to keep key stakeholders informed and consulted
* Ambitious and flexible; can-do attitude for a fast-paced scale-up environment
* Developed partnership management abilities, commercial acumen, and proven negotiation skills related to the financial services industry.

title: Teamleader Production IMP
description:
**Our Company**
---------------


Basic Pharma, a unique Dutch pharmaceutical company, is rapidly expanding, continually strengthening its organizational foundation, and advancing its specialization within the pharmaceutical industry. From product development, registration, production, and commercialization of (bio)pharmaceutical products to providing pharmaceutical services, Basic Pharma serves a diverse clientele ranging from startups to multinational corporations, both nationally and internationally.


Basic Pharma Manufacturing, manufactures various products such as nasal sprays, filled syringes, creams, and ointments. It also offers study medications and diverse services to third parties, including quality control and contract manufacturing.


Basic Pharma Technologies focuses on developing pharmaceutical products collaboratively with partners for its production organization and out-licenses them to customers. This unit now operates a biotech facility dedicated to product development and study medications.


Interdos specializes in providing consultancy services in the Regulatory Affairs, Pharmacovigilance, and Quality Management fields. Our expertise extends not only to internal support for Basic Pharma but also to external partnerships, ensuring seamless compliance and quality standards across the pharmaceutical landscape.


The synergy of these activities under one roof positions Basic Pharma as a resilient and versatile player in the pharmaceutical industry. With approximately 200 professionals, Basic Pharma's ambitions are expanding, prompting the search for individuals committed to professionalism and customer satisfaction. If this resonates with you, consider the following exciting opportunity


The IMP department is responsible for the manufacturing, testing and distribution of investigational medicinal products (IMPs). As Teamleader Production IMP, you will be responsible for the GMP manufacturing of (sterile) products used in clinical trials


We are looking for a  

**Teamleader Production IMP**

  

**What will you be working on at Basic Pharma?**
------------------------------------------------

* You will motivate, inform, train and guide (new) IMP operators.
* Provide production planning for IMP Operators and communicate this with relevant departments (QC/QA/Logistics and Purchase).
* Ensure GMP/quality level is sufficient within the IMP department
* Ensuring manufacturing activities are performed in according with cGMP and internal quality standards.
* You will be responsible for the stock levels of the department.
* Review and approve GMP documentation.
* Support the QA team during audits from authorities or clients.
* Improve cooperation and communication between departments.
* Actively involved in continues improvement within IMP, and improve efficiency of current processes.
* Supervise IMP operators.
* Clear communication with Project Managers in terms of planning and risk mitigations.
* Conduct assessments and performance interviews with IMP operators.
* Set personal and department goals for IMP operators and him/herself.
* Support and provide input to Project Managers.
* You will assist the IMP operators in GMP manufacturing activities, if needed.
  

**What do you bring as a Teamleader production IMP**
----------------------------------------------------

* You have HBO working and thinking level.
* You have experience with working in a cleanroom, and aseptic processes.
* 1-3 years of team leadership experience.
* You have knowledge of MS Office; experience with an ERP system is a pre.
* You are independent, accurate and result-oriented.
* You have a good command of the Dutch and English language, both verbally and in writing.
  

**What we offer**
-----------------

* Basic Pharma offers a challenging position with excellent working conditions in a dynamic and inspiring work environment:
* We are constantly developing
* Flexible working hours
* Working in a team of enthusiastic colleagues
* We stimulate our employees in their development by offering (internal) courses and training.

**Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.**

**Vacancy**
-----------


Employer
Basic Pharma Manufacturing B.V.**Characteristics**
-------------------


Hours/week
Study
HBO
Experience
3-5 jaar
Educational attainment
HBO **Vragen over deze vacature?**  

Neem dan contact op met onze afdeling HR via +31 (0)88 255 40 10 of hr@basicpharma.nl.

title: Trade Marketeer
description:
**Are you commercial, persuasive and a real team player? Do you get energy from planning and setting up inspiring campaigns together with leading and emerging brands in home and living? As a Trade Marketeer, you are responsible for the campaigns that contribute to commercial and brand objectives. You do this together with suppliers, partners and internal category managers.**

 **About fonQ**

fonQ is the online Home & Living specialist in the Netherlands and Flanders. We're not just about selling products; we're about creating exceptional experiences for our customers. With our extensive assortment, inspiration and excellent service, we make shopping in the Home & Living category fun and easy. We believe in innovation, creativity, and a passion for exceeding expectations. We're on the lookout for talented individuals who share our vision and drive to revolutionize the world of online shopping in Home & Living.  



  

**What will you do as a Trade Marketer?**



In this role, you will be responsible for the Trade Marketing function and the relationship with suppliers, partners and external brands to grow the Trade Marketing business at fonQ. With a data-driven attitude, you ensure that every trade marketing campaign or collaboration is better than the previous one.


You will work closely with the Category Managers, who are ultimately responsible for the commercial objectives. This requires a commercial mindset in which you are creative and can work well together.  



  

* Develop and manage the annual and monthly trade marketing plans based on the budgets for each supplier and partner that contribute to commercial objectives
* Responsible for communication with suppliers and the internal marketing and category management teams to ensure perfect follow-up and delivery of the necessary materials
* Position fonQ as a high-quality sales and marketing channel with our suppliers and partners and proactively close additional marketing deals
* Together with the category managers, you look at the right marketing conditions and work on long-term partnerships with our suppliers and partners
* Spot growth opportunities for the suppliers and partners, which you translate into concrete campaigns
Analyse sales and customer data and the fonQ proposition to create added value for the selling brands  
* 
  

  

**Are you the Trade Marketeer that we are looking for?**


* HBO/WO working and thinking level, with a commerce and/or marketing related study
* You have excellent communication skills in **Dutch** and **English**
* 2-4 years of relevant experience in Marketing / Commerce
* Affinity with the home and living industry is an advantage
* You can turn your creative ideas into commercial actions with a view to good results
* You are process-driven and work in a structured, efficient and careful manner
* You can communicate, present and collaborate very well in a cross-functional environment
You have strong analytical skills and possess a customer-centric mindset  
* 
  

**Here you recognize yourself in:**


Persuasive | Commercial | Team player | Enterprising | Planning & Organizing | Analytical | creative

 **W****hat we offer you**

* Salary and 8% vacation pay
* 25 vacation days (and possibility to purchase additional days)
* Travel and pension plan
* 20% discount on the fonQ assortment
* Space for personal development with the fonQ Academy
* Sport with discount at Onefit
* Daily fresh, attractively priced lunch in our lunchroom with roof terrace
* Space for new ideas and initiatives, regardless of your role
* A fun, informal work atmosphere with great colleagues and fonQy events
 **Excited? Great! Click on the "Apply" button quickly, Send your reaction to Rohit** **(Head of Growth ).** **See you soon!**

title: Associate Consultant
description:
We create possibilities that move life and commerce forward
Welcome to Manhattan Associates. Our supply chain commerce technology positively affects how people on six continents work, shop and live. If you want to tackle complex problems, push limits and redefine what’s possible, you’ve come to the right place.
Leading supply chain and omnichannel commerce experts, Manhattan Associates are looking for an Associate Consultant to join its ever-expanding Utrecht office.
Job Description:
Do you want to gain experience in software implementation, Have a passion for complex problem solving and business process improvement and do you want to work directly with world class customers in their supply chain and commerce development?
Each Associate Consultant works closely with customers to gather their requirements, attend design workshops, assist to write specifications, support configuration and testing processes and oversee the actual product implementation. You will be offered with great opportunities to travel through various European countries and beyond. You will be based in our Netherlands office.
We are looking for:
Here’s few things that we see as critical for someone to be successful in this role:* You want to gain experience in software or application implementation
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
* Excellent communication skills together with the ability to work effectively as part of a team
* You will be incredibly detail-oriented and customer focused, you are a get things done person and want to be measured by your output rather than your input
* Bachelor’s degree in logistics, engineering, computer science, mathematics or equivalent through business experience
* Fluent (spoken and written) in Dutch, another European language would be a plus.


What’s in for you?
Manhattan Associates supplies the vital links between processes, information and people that allow our customers to stay one step ahead of their competition. In short, we’re in the business of change.
What’s not changing is the way we run our business and how we treat our employees. At Manhattan Associates, we believe:* Support, encouragement and opportunity should be expected.
* Talent, leadership, innovative thinking and hard work is recognised and rewarded.
* An inclusive environment that leverages unique backgrounds, experience and perspectives makes us better.
* Collaboration can overcome any challenge.
* Where you take your career, and how you grow, is truly up to you. We’ll support you in your career progression.


To apply:* We really want to hear from you, even if it’s just to ask some questions about this job or have a chat. Connect with our EMEA Recruiter, Keith McCartney or click Apply!


#LI-KM1
Committed to diversity and inclusion
At Manhattan, it’s about more than just the work. From cultural celebrations to interest groups to volunteer
opportunities, your true self is always welcome here. Our team members’ backgrounds, experiences and
perspectives add to us as a whole and make us unique.
We are proudly an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for
employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin,
disability, or status as a veteran. In the United States, Manhattan Associates participates in the Employment
Eligibility Verification Program (E-Verify) operated by the Department of Homeland Security in partnership with the
Social Security Administration. Participation in the E-Verify Program allows Manhattan to confirm the employment
eligibility of all newly hired employees after the Employment Eligibility Verification Form (Form I-9) has been
completed.

title: Cash Allocation and Application Specialist
Software Engineer - Machine Learning Platform
description:
Dexter Energy is an Amsterdam-based scale-up dedicated to building **AI-based forecasting and optimization products** to support renewable energy companies. Our mission is to **enable a sustainable and affordable power system that transforms the energy market**. We are committed to making a significant impact on climate change by making renewables more predictable and profitable, thus accelerating the transition away from fossil fuels.


#### **Role Overview**



We are seeking a highly skilled **Software Engineer** to join our Machine Learning (ML) Platform team. This role is pivotal in designing and expanding the foundational infrastructure that **streamlines the operational machine learning lifecycle and accelerates research and development**. Our ML Platform team is seven people: five engineers, a technical product manager and an engineering manager. You will work closely with product teams to enhance model development and release processes, with a focus on quality, auditability, versioning, and data security. Your contributions will ensure that our data processing capabilities, both in batch and real-time streaming environments, are robust and scalable.


#### **Key Responsibilities**


* **Data Pipeline Development:** Build and scale data ingestion pipelines and manage the entire machine learning lifecycle to support the needs of our data scientists and engineers.
* **Model Development Support:** Enable product teams by providing the necessary tools and processes for model development and release, ensuring high standards of quality, auditability, versioning, and data security.
* **Collaboration:** Work closely with the Infra team to maintain the availability, reliability, scalability, and maintainability of our ML infrastructure.
* **Cross-Functional Communication:** Communicate clearly and effectively with team members across different functions and teams, using both verbal and asynchronous channels (e.g. Slack).
* **Documentation:** Maintain thorough and clear documentation of work processes, decisions, and updates to ensure transparency and knowledge sharing within the team.

#### **Required Qualifications**


* **Software Development Experience:** At least 5 years of experience in software development with proficiency in Python and at least one other programming language.
* **Cloud and Orchestration Expertise:** Experience with cloud platforms (preferably GCP, but Azure or AWS with a willingness to learn GCP is also acceptable) and orchestration technologies like Kubernetes, Nomad, or Docker Swarm.
* **Distributed Systems Knowledge:** Proven experience in designing and managing distributed systems that are scalable, reliable, and maintainable.
* **CI/CD Proficiency:** Strong experience in setting up and managing CI/CD pipelines to ensure smooth and continuous delivery of software products.
* **Communication Skills:** Exceptional verbal communication skills with the ability to convey complex ideas clearly, combined with proficiency in asynchronous communication, including effectively documenting processes, decisions, and updates using tools like Slack, Notion, or similar.
* **Passion for Renewable Energy:** A strong desire to contribute to the renewable energy sector and make a positive impact on the world.


#### **Why Join Us?**


* Engage in greenfield projects with opportunities to build new features and services from the ground up.
* Contribute to a **clean-tech scale-up with a positive environmental impact**.
* Be part of an ambitious, motivated, and entrepreneurial team with exceptional growth opportunities.
* Experience a flat hierarchy environment where decisions are made swiftly.
* Benefit from competitive salary and stock appreciation rights.
* Learn from highly talented colleagues eager to share their knowledge.
* Work with large data volumes and modern technologies on the Google Cloud Platform.
* Enjoy a balanced work-life dynamic, with support for planning work around personal interests.

 **Join Dexter Energy as a Software Engineer** and contribute to driving the renewable energy revolution. Apply now to be part of an inclusive, innovative team that is shaping the future of sustainable energy.

 *Dexter is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or gender identity.*

title: Staff Engineer I - Software
description:
TomTom’s Navigation SDK is a set of powerful, yet lightweight modules that allows developers to integrate map visualization, location handling and driver guidance into their applications without hassle. Map visualization (and embedded rendering library) is a center piece of the SDK offering where base map display and putting visual components on the map is handled along with map interactions and camera operations. All modules of Navigation SDK are powered by TomTom online services that supply fresh and rich data to all usage scenarios.  

We own all visualization use-cases of the SDK. Our technology stack is broad and includes: **Kotlin, C++, C#, Java, Unity, OpenGL, AWS, Azure, TypeScript, Jenkins, GitHub Actions** and more.
### **What you will do**

* Solve complex problems at scale cross teams, owning the software architecture and technical designs. The focus will be to solve end-to-end scenarios of visualization – involving visualization UI, data services, map rendering etc.
* Provide technical leadership and expertise, acting as a force multiplier. It will involve checking alternative solutions, liaising between departments and proposing optimal ways of solving usage scenarios in the visualization domain
* Enable your team for success through interaction with the technical community at an organization level
* Drive the technical decisions to improve engineering, test, and operational excellence best practices
* Participate to all phases of the project lifecycle – gathering requirements, designing solutions, building new interfaces, integration with existing architectures, development, and testing
* Manage technical risks to ensure successful product delivery and continuous development flow
* Build scalable, highly available and resilient applications by utilizing the optimal cloud technologies and programming languages and frameworks that best suit your use cases
* Support hiring for team vacancies, and investments into team and product health

### **What you will need**

* Bachelor's degree in computer science or related field or 8+ years of equivalent experience in at least one modern programming language
* Proven ability to learn new languages and technologies, and lead others in acquiring new skills
* Comfortable with written and/or verbal communication in English
* Strong Computer Science and development fundamentals, including object-oriented design, data structures, algorithm design, and complexity analysis
* Strong knowledge and practice of professional software engineering and best practices for the full software
* development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations
* Experience defining system architectures and exploring technical feasibility trade-offs
* Experience building scalable, distributed, production software systems with an understanding of design for performance and reliability
* Experience working with data processing tools/frameworks and cloud technologies

**What we offer**  

A competitive compensation package, of course.  

Time and resources to grow and develop, including a personal development budget and paid leave for learning days, as well as paid access to e-learning resources such as O’Reilly and LinkedIn Learning.  

Time to support life outside of work, with enhanced parental leave plus paid leave to care for loved ones and volunteer in local communities.  

Work from home, the office, or even abroad – each team has the flexibility to choose how they work based on business needs.  

Improve your home office with a setup budget and get extra support with a monthly allowance.  

Enjoy options to work from your home country and abroad for a set number of days each year, to visit family and friends, or to simply explore the world we’re mapping.  

Take the holidays you want with a competitive holiday plan, plus an extra day off to celebrate your birthday.  

Join annual events like our Hackathon and DevDays to bring your ideas to life with talented teammates from around the world.  

Become a part of our inclusive global culture and have the chance to collaborate with a diverse community – we have over 80 nationalities at TomTom!  

Find out more about our global benefits and enjoy additional local benefits tailored to your location. **Meet your team**  

We are the Map Visualization Product Unit. We develop map rendering technology that can be integrated into navigation systems and location-based applications, providing our technology to our customers in the form of cloud-based APIs and SDKs.  

We see quality-management processes as a source of competitive advantage. As part of our product-led and outcome-oriented culture, we believe it is crucial to have mechanisms in place to measure and improve the quality of our products in a continuous manner so we can achieve our mission of mapping the world in real time. **At TomTom...**  

You’ll help people find their way in the world. In 2004, TomTom revolutionized how the world moves with the introduction of the first portable navigation device. Now, we intend to do it again by engineering the first-ever real-time map, the smartest and most useful map on the planet.  

Work with a team of 3,700 unique, curious and passionate problem-solvers. Together, we’ll open up a world of possibilities for car manufacturers, enterprises and developers to help people understand and get closer to the world around them. **After you apply**  

Our recruitment team will work hard to give you a meaningful experience throughout your journey with us, no matter the outcome. Your application will be screened closely and you can rest assured that all follow-up actions will be thorough, from assessments and interviews all the way through onboarding. To find out more about our application process, check out our hiring FAQs. **TomTom is an equal opportunity employer**  

TomTom is where you can find your place in the world. Every day we welcome, nurture and celebrate differences. Why? Because your uniqueness is what makes you, *you*. No matter your culture or background, you’ll find your impact at TomTom. Research also shows that sometimes women and underrepresented communities can be hesitant to apply for positions unless they believe they meet 100% of the criteria. If you can relate to this, please know that we’d love to hear from you.
company_description: At TomTom, we want to engineer the first real-time map. You might think it has been done before but it hasn't. Help us make it happen – become a mapmaking trailblazer.

title: VP, Client Management
description:
**Company Description** *At Jellyfish, we believe in the power of diverse perspectives and inclusive collaboration. We welcome individuals who excel in collaborative, varied teams and value the unique contributions that each person brings to the table.*

  

Jellyfish is a global digital marketing agency; a unique fusion of tech enthusiasts, creative minds, and media and data experts all united to empower our clients along their digital journey. Our commitment to embracing diverse perspectives fuels our innovation and strategies that challenge the status quo, reinvent media activation, and craft influential stories for our global clients and their customers. Join us in shaping a future where business growth and personal fulfilment go hand in hand.

 **Job Description**  

Reporting into the MD, Amsterdam, we are looking for someone who has global media expertise in abundance. You will have a solid background in client management and will be a true partner to our clients, leading our teams in identifying client challenges, interpreting briefs, and turning them into the best agency solutions.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* As a VP, Client Management, you will manage the strategic leadership of a multi-market portfolio, ensuring you and the team strive for excellence on behalf of your clients.
* You will contribute to the success of Jellyfish through the leadership of your portfolio by setting the highest standards in client satisfaction and retention, plus service expansion across your portfolio. You will lead by example and mentor others.
* You will lead one or more of the most complex and/or important client(s) accounts at Jellyfish. Working in close collaboration with partner companies to deliver integrated services. This will include Creative, Production and Influencer Marketing.
* Seen by a client as the lead voice on an account, you will be a trusted advisor, working with C-level members of your accounts, unlocking the potential for growth within our client organization.
* You'll be a champion for innovative transformation in measurement, AI and Digital Media to generate commercial impact for your clients and Jellyfish alike
* You will work with the most senior levels of both Client and Jellyfish leadership to develop strategy, resulting in a significant positive impact to client results. Connecting with other departments/industry/global leads to developing innovative approaches to solving the trickiest of client business problems.
* Advocate, drive adoption of and support execution of CM practices across client teams and offering solutions to the Client Management team to improve the overall effectiveness and/or efficiency of the practice.
* As client lead, you will manage client commercial targets. Lead and facilitate the growth of portfolio clients' net revenue.
* You will help drive excellence for our clients, ensuring best-in-class delivery.

  

**Qualifications**  

* Someone with 15+ years experience in client management at an agency, publication or brand
* Exceptional communication skills - oral and written
* Excellent presentation skills and experience sharing new ideas with clients
* Digital media subject matter expertise, from platform knowledge to development and successful execution of multi market media retainers
* Ability to think big and develop long-term client and agency plans
* Ability to prioritize and effectively delegate and manage multiple jobs simultaneously

  

Note: We emphasise skills, expertise and behavioural attributes over years of experience and traditional degrees. If you want to join our collaborative team, we invite you to apply today with your resume in English.

 **Additional Information**  

Join Jellyfish and experience a workplace where we prioritise your growth, celebrate your contributions, and empower you to tailor your work environment to suit your needs.


Reward: You'll receive a loyalty salary increase on your Jellyfish anniversary, in addition to our company-wide annual bonus.


Custom Work Environment: Work remotely for up to 60% of your days and shape your day between 8am. and 6:30pm with flexible working hours.


Growth, Your Way: Grow your career with one paid day each month for self-development and access to LinkedIn Learningwith unlimited online courses.

 *Unfortunately, there has been an increase in fake recruiters impersonating Jellyfish and unlawfully using our brand name. If you are unsure if an email with a job offer you have received is genuinely from Jellyfish, or if you suspect any fraudulent activity, please report it to* *talentacquisition@jellyfish.com**.*


#LI-Hybrid

title: Index Analyst
description:
Euronext
Euronext N.V. is a listed, high-tech company with strong European roots. It is the leading European stock exchange, with listing venues in Amsterdam, Brussels, Dublin, Lisbon, Milan, Oslo and Paris. Our mission is to build the leading European market infrastructure, shaping the capital markets for future generations by making an impact on our industry and our ecosystem. Euronext connects local European economies to the global capital markets, to accelerate innovation and sustainable growth.
There are almost 2,000 companies listed on the Euronext exchanges, including national and international blue-chip companies such as AMSL, Unilever, Philips, Heineken and Just Eat Takeaway, with a total worth of almost €5.6 trillion. It is also the leading exchange for derivatives, with on average 3.3 million transactions per day with a transaction value of €11.26 billion, and is home to more than 1200 indices, including the AEX and CAC 40. With four central securities depository (CSDs) and one clearing house in Europe, Euronext manages the entire capital markets value chain.
About the department
With decades of experience in the index space, Euronext is one of the leading index providers in Europe. The company has over 1200 indices of all sizes and profiles, that are designed, calculated, and published in house. This includes over 45 ESG indices and 8 major blue-chip indices in Europe, namely our national flagship indices: AEX®, BEL 20®, CAC 40®, CAC 40 ESG® ISEQ 20®, OBX® and PSI 20®, MIB ESG®. More than 15,000 ETFs, funds, warrants, certificates, futures, and options are associated with the Euronext indices and over €100 billion of assets is benchmarked.
The team of Euronext Indices is the strategic business unit of Euronext responsible for the development, management and licensing of all Euronext indices and the partnerships with partners and data vendors. Besides our ESG and national blue-chip indices our product offering also consists of indices tailored to meet the demands of world’s largest issuers of financial products and investors looking for specific or enhanced market exposure at lower costs.
To complement our team of index structuring and business development experts and to strengthen our processes and governance structure, we are looking for a driven individual to contribute to the team responsible for the Index Rules, regulation, and governance procedures.
The Euronext Index Team consists of 14 team members in 2 European countries, who collaborate closely together to further strengthen Euronext’s position as international leading index provider. The position of the Index Analyst is stationed at Euronext Amsterdam or Euronext Paris office.
For more information on Index Rules, procedures and methodologies please refer to the dedicated webpage on the Euronext website:
https://live.euronext.com/products-indices/index-rules
About the position
The Index Analyst will contribute to the maintenance and development of the Euronext Index methodologies, including corporate actions methodology, and will ensure compliance with relevant Index regulations and market practices.
The candidate will primarily be responsible for:* Creation, maintenance and development of Index Rules and methodologies
* Preparing agenda’s and contribute to internal committees on evolutions of Index Rules
* Contributing to external client consultations on Index Rules
* Analyzing and advising on the treatment of complex Corporate Actions in Indices
* Tracking regulation and ensure Euronext Indices complies with the regulatory requirements (EU-BMR)
* Reporting on Index Activities for internal senior management and regulators.


Your profile* 0-2 years of experience in financial markets (e.g. Corporate Actions, Indices or Market Data)
* Master’s Degree in Business / Finance
* English: full professional proficiency is required
* Rigorous, curious and autonomous
* Hands-on approach and attention to details
* Team player and intercultural competence and excellent communication skills
* Excellent proficiency in Microsoft Office, Excel and Word ESG expertise is a plus
* ESG expertise is a plusESG expertise is a plus


What Euronext Amsterdam has to offer
At Euronext we stand out for our strong local connection within an international high-tech company. With more than 2,100 capital markets experts with 55 nationalities represented in 18 countries, our company is a unique and diverse place to work.
The attraction and growth of talent is key at Euronext Amsterdam. To ensure this, we provide our team members with a stimulating, progressive working environment. Our way of working focuses on empowering productivity and creativity. Collaboration through teamwork and a non-hierarchical approach are of paramount importance.
As a modern employer we offer an attractive employee value proposition through which our employees can achieve their full potential. This includes a competitive salary, and many other benefits dedicated to personal growth, ongoing education and employee wellness, such as:* A generous pension plan, fitted to modern standards
* A large number of holiday hours
* Continuous learning and development opportunities to grow as industry leaders and experts, including
* a personal training budget
* opportunities for coaching
* full access to our own online Euronext Academy and a wide variety of events during our annual learning week
* In-house physiotherapist and gym


Euronext Values
Unity* We respect and value the people we work with
* We are unified through a common purpose
* We embrace diversity and strive for inclusion


Integrity* We value transparency, communicate honestly and share information openly
* We act with integrity in everything we do
* We don’t hide our mistakes, and we learn from them


Agility* We act with a sense of urgency and decisiveness
* We are adaptable, responsive and embrace change
* We take smart risks


Energy* We are positively driven to make a difference and challenge the status quo
* We focus on and encourage personal leadership
* We motivate each other with our ambition


Accountability* We deliver maximum value to our customers and stakeholders
* We take ownership and are accountable for the outcome
* We reward and celebrate performance


We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate against individuals on the basis of race, gender, age, citizenship, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, or any other legally protected factor. We value the unique talents of all our people, who come from diverse backgrounds with different personal experiences and points of view and we are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect.
Additional Information
This job description is only describing the main activities within a certain role and is not exhaustive. It does not prevent to add more tasks, projects.

title: Senior Scheduling Specialist
description:
At Dow, we believe in putting people first and we’re passionate about delivering integrity, respect and safety to our customers, our employees and the planet.  

Our people are at the heart of our solutions. They reflect the communities we live in and the world where we do business. Their diversity is our strength. We’re a community of relentless problem solvers that offers the daily opportunity to contribute with your perspective, transform industries and shape the future. Our purpose is simple - to deliver a sustainable future for the world through science and collaboration. If you’re looking for a challenge and meaningful role, you’re in the right place.
About you and this role
We have an exciting opportunity as Senior Scheduling Specialist, located in Terneuzen, The Netherlands!
As Senior Scheduling Specialist you act as a technical resource for Scheduling within the Global Project Methodology (GPM) work process and supports establishment of the overall schedule baseline and reporting to monitor and control the project within established tolerances of the baseline supporting efficient project execution.
In this role you coordinate data inputs from the various disciplines and functions to ensure accurate forecasts and reporting of schedule and engage the project steering team to understand causes of the deviation and the need to establish actions to mitigate, where deviations from established tolerances occur. Requires expanded conceptual and practical knowledge in own job discipline and broadens capabilities.
Responsibilities* Recommendations on cycle time reduction opportunities and techniques as applied to scheduling.
* Develops and maintains comprehensive integrated master project schedules including Front-end Loading, Detail Design, Procurement, Construction and Start-up/Commissioning Project Stages.
* Maintains schedule during the project life cycle monitoring progress and incorporating modifications where changes in the original scope occur or delays are encountered.
* Utilizes project cost estimates to resource load project schedules and gain alignment with estimated scope of work and the project schedule.
* Performs staffing density checks or staffing limitation checks to validate schedule durations and ensures resource-leveling supports the project strategy.
* Performs critical path analysis to determine problem areas in regards to project schedule and resource overloads and offers alternative courses of action to the project team.
* Evaluates project deviations to assess schedule impact for proper decision making and recovery plans.
* Works with cost management to gain alignment when forecasting schedule completion dates.
* Applies established schedule management practices to ascertain critical schedule issues and recommend corrective actions.
* Defines comprehensive Schedule Management solutions for capital and expense projects.


Qualifications* You have minimum a technical bachelor's degree
* You have minimum of 4 years of relevant working experience (scheduling, engineering, manufacturing or related experience)
* You are fluent in English.
* You have good communication skills.


Preferred Skills* Fluency in Dutch is a plus.


Benefits – What Dow offers you
We invest in you.
Dow invests in total rewards programs to help you manage all aspects of you: your pay, your health, your life, your future, and your career. You bring your background, talent and perspective to work every day. Dow rewards that commitment by investing in your total wellbeing.
Here are just a few highlights of what you would be offered as a Dow employee:* Equitable and market-competitive base pay and bonus opportunity across our global markets, along with locally relevant incentives.
* Benefits and programs to support your physical, mental and emotional well-being, to help you get the care you need...when you need it.
* Competitive retirement program that may include company-provided benefits, savings opportunities, financial planning and educational resources to help you achieve your long term financial-goals.
* Become a Dow shareholder through various employee stock programs.
* Opportunities to learn and grow through training and mentoring, work experiences, community involvement and team building.
* Workplace culture empowering role-based flexibility to maximize personal productivity and balance personal needs.
* Global Paid Time Off (PTO) policies:
	+ Paid time off for new parents (birthing and non-birthing, including adoptive and foster parents).
	+ Paid time off to care for family members who are sick or injured.
	+ Paid time off to support volunteering and Employee Resource Group’s (ERG) participation.


Join our team, we can make a difference together.
About Dow
Dow (NYSE: DOW) is one of the world’s leading materials science companies, serving customers in high-growth markets such as packaging, infrastructure, mobility and consumer applications. Our global breadth, asset integration and scale, focused innovation, leading business positions and commitment to sustainability enable us to achieve profitable growth and help deliver a sustainable future. We operate manufacturing sites in 31 countries and employ approximately 35,900 people. Dow delivered sales of approximately $45 billion in 2023. References to Dow or the Company mean Dow Inc. and its subsidiaries. Learn more about us and our ambition to be the most innovative, customer-centric, inclusive and sustainable materials science company in the world by visiting www.dow.com.
As part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, Dow is committed to equal opportunities in employment. We encourage every employee to bring their whole self to work each day to not only deliver more value, but also have a more fulfilling career. Further information regarding Dow's equal opportunities is available on www.dow.com.
company_description: We're a diverse and inclusive community of relentless problem solvers that offers the daily opportunity to contribute your perspective, transform industries and shape the future.

title: Assistant Business Controller
description:
***Are you looking for a challenging role as an Assistant Business Controller where you can work independently and have plenty of room for personal development? Then this position at Wageningen Food Safety Research (WFSR) might be perfect for you! We are seeking an enthusiastic, customer-oriented, and proactive colleague for our Finance & Control department.***


In this role, you'll have the freedom to use your talents and grow, with the right support and coaching to succeed. Do you want to be part of a team where your input is valued, and you can truly make an impact? If so, we warmly invite you to apply and seize this great opportunity!


Wageningen University & Research offers excellent terms of employment. A few highlights from our Collective Labour Agreement include:* sabbatical leave, study leave, and partially paid parental leave;
* working hours that can be discussed and arranged so that they allow for the best possible work-life balance;
* the option to accrue additional compensation / holiday hours by working more, per week;
* there is a strong focus on vitality and you can make use of the sports facilities available on campus for a small fee;
* a fixed December bonus of 8.3%;
* excellent pension scheme.


In addition to these first-rate employee benefits, you will of course receive a good salary. Depending on your experience, we offer a competitive gross salary of between €3.040,- and €4.687,- for a full-time working week of 38 hours, in accordance with the Collective Labour Agreements for Dutch Universities (CAO-NU) (scale 8-9). Additionally, a contract for 32 FTE can be discussed. Initially, we offer you a one-year contract, which will then be extended to an open-ended contract if there is mutual enthusiasm. Of course, we would be happy to discuss this with you if you have any questions.  

  

Wageningen University & Research encourages internal advancement opportunities and mobility with an internal recruitment policy. There are plenty of options for personal initiative in a learning environment, and we provide excellent training opportunities. We are offering a unique position in an international environment with a pleasant and open working atmosphere.You are going to work at the greenest and most innovative campus in Holland, and at a university that has been chosen as the “Best University” in the Netherlands for the 19th consecutive time. The mission of Wageningen University & Research is “To explore the potential of nature to improve the quality of life”. Under the banner Wageningen University & Research, Wageningen University and the specialised research institutes of the Wageningen Research Foundation have joined forces in contributing to finding solutions to important questions in the domain of healthy food and living environment. With its roughly 30 branches, 7,600 employees (6,700 fte) and 13,100 students and over 150,000 participants to WUR’s Life Long Learning, Wageningen University & Research is one of the leading organisations in its domain. The unique Wageningen approach lies in its integrated approach to issues and the collaboration between different disciplines.  

  

Read the 5 reasons why your future colleagues enjoy working at WUR and watch the video below to get an idea of our green campus!  

  

*We will recruit for the vacancy ourselves, so no employment agencies please. However, sharing in your network is appreciated.* Your tasks and responsibilities as an Assistant Business Controller:* You will work in a dynamic role that combines aspects of financial control and business control.
* You will play a key role in the monthly internal financial reporting on operations and projects, as well as in preparing budgets and forecasts.
* You will collaborate closely with your direct colleagues from Finance & Control and management.
* The Planning & Control cycle guides your work planning, and you will be responsible for completing these tasks on time and in full.
* You have an affinity with IT and Fintech. Together with your colleagues, you will contribute to the digitization of processes and explore the potential of data science and dashboarding using Power-BI to take the financial department to the next level.


You will be working alongside 10 other colleagues, spread across Financial Administration, project control, and business control in Wageningen.


In our international working environment there is an increasing amount of communication in English. For this position it is about language level B1.  

  

You can see that there are plenty of challenges ahead of you. These challenges can also be seen as development opportunities. So if you do not yet have the track-record required in the vacancy, but do have solid work experience, we would also like to invite you to apply.


For more information about this position, please contact Sandra Nendels, Team Manager Finance & Control ; sandra.nendels@wur.nl.  

  

For more information about the procedure, please contact Jeanine van ‘t Veer, corporate recruiter, 0317-481707 or; jeanine.vantveer-drost@wur.nl.  

  

Do you want to apply?  

You can apply directly using the apply button on the vacancy page on our website which will allow us to process your personal information with your approval.  

This vacancy will be listed up to and including <Monday September 30th, 2024.  

  

**Procedure**  

As part of our selection process, an assessment may be incorporated within the procedure  

  

**Equal opportunities**  

Wageningen University & Research (WUR) employs a large number of people with very different backgrounds and qualities, who inspire and motivate each other. We want every talent to feel at home in our organisation and be offered the same career opportunities. We therefore especially welcome applications from people who are underrepresented at WUR. A good example of how WUR deals with inclusiveness can be read on the page working at WUR with a functional impairment.

title: Customer Service Team Lead
description:
Hunkemöller is looking for an experienced and passionate Customer Service Teamlead (m/f) for our e-commerce customer service department based in our HQ in Almere. **Your key responsibilities…**

* Your primary focus is to inspire, support, lead and develop our international team of around 20 customer service agents and make sure they feel happy and motivated to deliver the best possible service to our customers.
* You are responsible for the day-to-day operations of the team, including scheduling, reporting and monitoring.
* Work closely with our Quality department and our Teamlead in Germany to make sure our way of working is aligned, we optimize our efficiency and improve our quality of customer contacts.
* Work together with other departments such as Omnichannel, CRM, E-Commerce and IT to improve processes and contribute to projects.
* As you’re truly customer centric, you always know what our main contact drivers are and flag issues or start projects to improve our experience and service.

**You ideally…**

* Have a minimum of 2 years experience as Teamlead in a Customer Service department
* Have experience in managing bigger teams of which partly remote
* Know how to balance day-to-day tasks whilst working on projects
* Are positive, reliable and resilient
* Have a problem-solving and solution-driven mentality
* We work with a bunch of applications so being tech-savvy is very beneficial
* Fluency (Written and verbal) in both English and preferably Dutch or another European language.

**We offer…**

* A fun team full of passionate colleagues from all kind of backgrounds to lead
* Lots of room for initiative and growth
* Staff discount


Hunkemöller strives to be a much loved, social & inclusive brand. A place where people love to work, are proud of the brand, and where we create true brand ambassadors. Working in a passionate, energetic, design-led and performance-driven environment where our key customer persona 'Shero' sits at the heart of everything we do. Hunkemöller is a certified TOP EMPLOYER of the Netherlands 2024, which underlines our people initiatives and achievements.

  

Together Tomorrow – Join a Retailer that's on the move to be better for our planet, better for people, better together! From diversity & inclusion, reducing waste, to product care and how we work with our suppliers, our Together Tomorrow initiative reflects what we do and helps drive change across our business. Ready to help us achieving our ambitious goals? Where ever you'll start working with us, if in Stores or our HQs, you can contribute!


Apply now with your CV or LinkedIn profile.

**What you can expect when joining a TOP EMPLOYER**  

* **performance reviews**
* **staff discount**
* **buddy & mentor**
* **career and talent programs**
* **mental health & wellbeing support**
* **pension support**
* **internal learning platform**
* **community events**
* **collective company insurance discount**
* **support in travel cost**
* **lifestyle workshops**
* **25 days annual leave**
**Application procedure**  

* **Submit your application**
* **Have a chat with the store manager**
* **Receive an offer**
* **Congratulations! Welcome to Hunkemöller**
company_description: Be inspiring, be amazing, be you - join HKM!

title: Head of Change Management Office ICS
description:
Head of Change Management Office ICS**At a glance**
  

  

International Card Services (ICS) is a 100% subsidiary of ABN AMRO Bank N.V. with its own independent bank license. ICS is a payment service provider and market leader in issuing credit cards in the Netherlands, with a subsidiary in Germany. We have been issuing, promoting, administrating, and processing payments of Visa and Mastercard credit cards for over 30 years. ICS issues credit cards both under its own brand and in conjunction with co-branding partners, for both Consumer and Commercial clients. In addition, we offer various other financial services and products.
  

As Head of Change Management Office you will take ownership of strategic and regulatory change (ICS Change Portfolio). You will lead the team of, a.o. program/project/portfolio/implementation managers and implement the new 'stage gate' change management process across ICS. You will be part of the MT Products Solutions & Control and report to the Chief Products Solutions & Control.
  

  

**Working environment**
  

  

The culture within ICS can be described as family-oriented, helpful, people-oriented, and service-oriented. Service is in the genes. You work in a dynamic environment, in close collaboration with, amongst others, the Product Domain, Operations, and IT. ICS is located in Diemen, for this job you will be asked to spend most part of the job at the office but of course there is room for hybrid working.
  

  

The organization is currently changing in order to serve customers and the market even better, with the safety and reliability of our services being the cornerstone. We are rebalancing our business model, which means challenging, but exciting times for ICS. Our purpose 'Carefree Payments' and our vision and our mission 'We offer our customers and partners relevant, sustainable and secure payment products' are at the heart of all our activities. We believe that this sets us apart from other companies. In other words: A solid reason to choose ICS.
  

  

Per October '24 the new governance of ICS will be in place. A new department Product, Solutions & Control (PSC) will be introduced. This department will consist of 6 domains who are highly interconnected and need to work together with all other departments of ICS, ABN AMRO, and other relevant stakeholders. The following domains are within PSC: products, generic processes, change management, data management, risk & regulations, and client integrity.
  

  

**Your job**
  

  

You will play a vital role in shaping the required knowledge and capabilities needed for a newly created team to deal with the aforementioned dynamics. In this pioneering stage, you will be responsible for:
  

* Shaping and setting up this new domain, which will consist of, a.o. portfolio managers, program & (IT) project managers, implementation managers, and PMO.
* Lead and motivate teams, and cultivate a culture of Courage, Care, and Collaboration, encouraging teams to innovate and challenge the status quo.
* Defining and embedding a consistent and effective way of working and methodology (change gate process for change initiatives) and actively managing the integral ICS change portfolio. Facilitating and organizing priority setting for the Change Portfolio in the ICS Change Board.
* Introducing and implementing the new 'stage gate' change management process within the new organizational design.
* Balancing strategic- and regulatory requirements.  

  

The desired outcome of this new role is a stream-lined and efficient change management process with an effective coordination of the execution of change and resource planning.

  

**Your profile**
  

  

We are looking for an experienced leader who has earned her/his spurs in the areas of change management and payments/credit within a banking or financial organization or within consultancy in these areas. Do you think you fit in with us? Check your profile:  

  

  

* Master's degree.
* 10 - 15 years of experience in Consulting/Financial Services/Payments.
* Experience with change management and the agile way of working.
* Experience with managing a diverse and highly experienced team.
* Excellent communication skills (both in Dutch and English) to convey complex ideas clearly and concisely to different audiences, including senior management and cross-functional teams.
* Demonstrates resilience and adaptability, steering the team through challenges, and fostering a culture of continuous learning.
* Demonstrates risk awareness and decision-making capabilities, excels in stakeholder management, and embodies the organization's core values.
* Demonstrates ownership by taking responsibility for one's actions, decisions, and their consequences, demonstrating accountability and commitment towards achieving goals or resolving issues.

  

**We are offering**
  

  

We offer a job that requires and provides insight into all customer processes of ICS. In addition, the opportunity to go through a steep learning curve in a multitude of substantive subjects. This job offers the opportunity to set up and maintain a broad network.
  

  

Furthermore:
  

* The gross monthly salary (min. Eur. 94.747 - max. Eur. 135.352) displayed above is based on a 36-hour work week, including vacation pay and benefit budget. A 40-hour work week is also possible.
* The Benefit Budget is 11% of your salary. The Benefit Budget allows you to acquire additional employment benefits. If you make no purchases or reservations in the Benefit Shop in a given month, you are paid one twelfth of your Benefit Budget that month.
* Five weeks of vacation per year. You have the option to purchase an additional four weeks per year.
* Personal development Budget of € 1,000 per year, which you can accumulate up to € 3,000.
* Possibility to work from home (in consultation with your team).
* An annual public transport pass with free public transportation throughout the Netherlands.
* An excellent pension scheme.

  

**Interested?**
  

  

Please apply to this vacancy online and include your resume and motivation letter. If you want to know more about this vacancy? Please contact Lisa Goverts (lisa.goverts@icscards.nl).
  

  

**Equal opportunities for all**
  

  

The success of our organisation depends on the quality of our people and the ideas that they have. Truly surprising insights and innovative solutions for our clients result from an interplay of cultures, knowledge and experience. Diversity is therefore extremely important to our organisation. To ensure that everyone at ABN AMRO can develop their talents, we encourage an inclusive culture in which all colleagues feel engaged and appreciated.
  

  

**Disclaimer external recruitment agencies**
  

  

External recruitment agencies need to have a signed agreement with ABN AMRO BANK N.V., executed by a Talent Acquisition Specialist, when submitting a resume to a vacancy. No unsolicited services or offers, please.
  

  

Lees meer
  

  

**Wie zijn je collega's?**
  

  

"Een bank heeft een belangrijke maatschappelijke functie, met name voor bedrijven zijn wij de smeerolie van de economie."
  

Lees het verhaal
  

  

**Lennart Jilesen**
  

Relationship manager
  

  

"De financiële sector is natuurlijk redelijk rechttoe rechtaan, maar wij hebben juist te maken met creatieve processen en mensen. Daarom is het belangrijk om mondig te zijn en lef te hebben."
  

Lees het verhaal
  

  

**Sanne van der Bie**
  

Communicatiemanager

title: Visual Merchandise Project Coordinator
description:
* This role will be located in our HQ NL in Almere (address: Sterkenburg 3, Almere) We are looking for a talented Visual Merchandise Project Coordinator for our Visual Merchandising team within the marketing department

  

Join our journey of being a much loved, social & inclusive brand and contribute to our success by performing these tasks:

* Coordinating the development of windows and in-store POS materials, 3D decoration, POS, instore signing and displays, from briefing to delivery for seasonal campaigns, new projects and ad hoc requests.
* Control your part of the Visual Merchandise budget and ensure delivery is consistent with design concept while optimizing functionality and costs.
* Managing supplier relationships to ensure high quality, on-time and smooth delivery against brand briefs.
* Being main point of contact between project stakeholders, marketing department, studio and suppliers.
* Taking on job briefings ensuring proper workflow consisting of thorough, on-time briefing for production and delivery, ending with final check-in to ensure proper quality and timings are met.


The ideal CANDIDATE:

* HBO education in related field e.g. communication, marketing, business , production management.
* Ideally 3 years’ experience in similar role.
* Experience in project & process management.
* Excellent operational skills.
* Meticulous attention to detail with problem solving skills.
* Ability to work under pressure, handle short timelines and changing priorities.
* Knowledge of Microsoft Office, Adobe CC.
* Excellent English skills, written and verbally


Hunkemöller strives to be a much loved, social & inclusive brand. A place where people love to work, are proud of the brand, and where we create true brand ambassadors.
