**Benefits**  

  

Whether it's transportation or financial health, we continually invest in our employees to help them achieve greatness - inside and outside of work. All who work here should be able to realize their full potential.

title: Team Lead Operations Support
description:
**Do you get excited from delivering high quality technical support to a global (offshore) operation? And are you (or do you aspire to be) a hands-on and people focused team lead with good communication skills and attention to detail? Then we might have the perfect fit for you. We are looking for a new Team Lead to head the Operations Support team within our Operations Control Centre. Are you ready for the next step in your career? Please scroll down to read more about the role and how to apply!**

 **About Ampelmann**  

Ampelmann makes offshore access as easy as crossing the street. Our drive is to make the offshore industry safer, enable the energy transition and have a great career in the meantime. We combine the challenges of a large globally-operating organisation with a change-positive attitude and entrepreneurial spirit. Personal development and responsibility take centre stage at Ampelmann. Growing Ampelmann means growing you.

  

Read more about the Ampelmann story here and have an ‘inside look’ here.

 **About the** **Operations Control Centre (OCC) team**



The OCC is part of our Operations department. The Operations department is responsible for making sure our global operation runs safely and efficiently. The OCC team ensures that all operations in the area are conducted safely and in full satisfaction of our clients. The OCC is split into two teams: one team providing first line support (the OCC Engineers, spread across the Netherlands, Brunei and the USA) and another team providing second line support. That team currently consists out of four Technical Planners - of which two are based in the Netherlands and two in Brunei - and is looking for a new Team Lead.

  

In this role you will report to the Manager OCC.  



  

**Your role as Team Lead Operations Support**



As Team Lead Operations Support you will manage the second line support team within the OCC. You lead, coach and manage a team of four Technical Planners. The job of a Technical Planner is to make sure that our Gangway Operators (who are deployed offshore) have access to all necessary information and tools to execute maintenance jobs to the Ampelmann system. Secondly, the Technical Planners support the Operations Project Managers and Maintenance Technicians with the preparation and execution of open tasks on the assets. As Team Lead, you ensure – together with your Technical Planners – that all Operations Support activities are executed in a timely manner and according to our quality standards.



You keep an overview of open work items, track metrics and create reports so you can keep all your stakeholders informed, both internal and external. You are also responsible for creating an environment in which the maintenance jobs are carried out safely and you identify risks and anomalies, which you escalate to management if necessary. Zooming out, you make sure the Operations Support process ties in with the larger OCC and Maintenance strategy and drive a mindset of continuous improvement, constantly looking for ways to improve work processes and optimize the use of the ERP system (Microsoft Dynamics 365).

 **Regular activities**


* Manage the day-to-day operation of the Operations Support team; e.g. leading stand-ups, monitoring progress of tasks, setting priorities, stepping in where necessary.
* Execute the full performance management cycle with your team members: from regular 1-on-1s to setting OKRs and doing year-end appraisals.
* Monitor and report on progress of team’s activities via dashboards and filtering in ERP system to relevant stakeholders.
* Collaborate with other departments such as regional Maintenance and Operations teams, Supply Chain Management and the ERP team.
* Identify, develop and gather the resources necessary to continuously improve the team’s processes, services and safe execution of tasks.

  

**We ask**


* Bachelor’s degree (HBO) in engineering or technology (preferred) and > 5 years relevant working experience
* Experience with, or motivated to, leading a global team
* Experience with training, teaching and coaching of (more junior) team members
* Good technical knowledge (e.g. understanding of hydraulics, electronics, mechanics)
* Good understanding of ERP systems, preferably Microsoft Dynamics 365
* Excellent communications skills in English

  

**You get**


* A great work environment with innovative and change-willing aspirations
* High degree of responsibility and room to have significant impact
* Monthly gross salary between EUR 3.860 and EUR 5.000 based on experience
* Good secondary benefits (e.g. unlimited vacation days, annual bonus, Working from Home policy, non-contributory pension plan, and more)
* Ampelmann Academy for all your personal and professional development needs

  

**Interested?**



You can apply until **18 September** by uploading your CV and motivation letter via the “Apply” button on our website. In the week after the closing date, we will let you know if you have been selected for the first interview round. If there is a match after the first interview, you will proceed to the second interview round. Still a match? Then we will offer you the job!



If you have any questions related to this vacancy, please contact recruitment@ampelmann.nl. Your contact person for this vacancy is Sander Petersen.

title: Senior People Operations Specialist
description:
We’re on a mission to accelerate the energy transition with sustainable home energy for all and it’s our goal to help 3 million households transition by 2030. That is why we're seeking a highly motivated and ambitious person that’s not afraid to make their hands dirty and make a real dent in the climate change challenge that we are already facing. Are you ready to rise to the challenge?

  

As a **Senior People Operations Specialist** at Quatt, you will manage and build out people operations. Quatt is growing fast, and we’re looking for a People Operations Specialist who’s ready to dive in and help us expand. If you love setting things up from scratch, scale operations across borders, be the go to person for employees and making sure everything runs smoothly, this could be the perfect role for you!

 **What you will do:**

  

* **Manage People Ops:** From onboarding to offboarding, benefits, and everything in between, you’ll own it all.
* **Be the Go-To Person:** Employees will come to you with their questions and needs, and you’ll be ready with solutions and support.
* **Grow Our Team:** You’ll be the driving force behind growing our team both here and internationally, setting up people operations as we expand.
* **Handle Payroll:** You’ll make sure payroll is spot-on, compliant, and smooth.
* **Get Things Done:** You’re the kind of person who follows through on commitments, takes action, and pays attention to the details. Thanks to you all information in HiBob is always up to date.
* **Experienced:** You’ve got solid experience in People Operations and know what it takes to scale an organization and set up in new countries.


* **Proactive:** You don’t wait around. You spot issues before they become problems and take care of them.
* **Solution-Oriented:** You’re always ready with practical solutions when challenges pop up.
* **Detail-Focused:** You’ve got a sharp eye for detail and make sure nothing slips through the cracks.
* **Action-Oriented:** You believe in getting things done, even if it’s not perfect. Progress over perfection and action is better than no action.
* **Leadership:** You’ve built up a team and coached colleagues on the job. You are a subject matter expert for managers in terms of payroll.

 **Why Quatt:**

* A competitive monthly salary, excluding holiday allowance (8%) that we pay on top of your monthly salary.
* We like to see you! We are flexible in when and where you work, but we encourage you to come to our vibrant office in Amsterdam multiple times a week.
* Whenever you come to the office, we cover your travel costs, either by car or with an NS business card.
* Recharge with 25 paid holiday days a year to contribute to our mission in a healthy way.
* Work abroad for up to 1 month per year to visit family and friends and escape the Dutch weather.
* We support your career growth and encourage all Quatters to pursue new learning and career opportunities within the company.
* Join our original Quatt culture where you can truly be yourself and meet people from all over the world. We have over 30 nationalities working with us!
* Enjoy a healthy, vegetarian/vegan lunch at our office, freshly made by our in-house chef.
* Have fun at our themed monthly Quatt drinks and seasonal parties.
* Good people hire good people, so earn a €2,000 bonus by referring a friend as amazing as you.

 **Ready to change the future with us?**



If what you've read excites you and you believe you're a great fit for our team, please apply below. Don't worry if you don't tick every box – at Quatt, we value performance over prejudice and always look further than just your resume. Join us in our mission to accelerate the transition to sustainable home energy for all

 **How to Apply**



Submit your application below. Our Talent Acquisition team will review it and get back to you within 10 working days.

 **Next Steps**



Our process typically includes three interviews, where we start with getting to know each other a bit better.

 **Questions**?



If you have any questions about the role, feel free to reach out to ipek@quatt.io

  

Please note that we are not working with recruitment agencies at this time. Thank you for your understanding. Every resume we will get from an agency, will be treated as our own .



We believe in diversity, inclusiveness and we want to give everyone a fair chance, therefore it's okay to not mention your gender, nationality and date of birth on your resume.

title: (Senior) Consultant People& Transformation - People Consulting
description:
(Senior) Consultant People & Transformation - People Consulting

  

Do you want to make a lasting impact on people and organisations?


Do you want to be challenged and inspired?


Do you want to work at pace and drive global delivery?


Then join EY to gain experiences that will last a lifetime.

  

We’re looking for two (senior) consultants to join our People &Transformation competence within People Consulting team.

  



We continue to experience unprecedented growth for multiple teams/competences within People Consulting, please check also the other outstanding interesting vacancies for ourHR M&A and Restructuring and Digital HR Team.

  

The opportunity - What future are you building towards?


As a (Senior) Consultant in the People Consulting team you will be offered a diverse and fulfilling career. Together with EY colleagues from other expert teams, you will have the opportunity to work with a range of (international) clients on large and small-scale engagements across multiple industries; both domestic and globally.

  

Our team - Do great minds always think alike?


The People Consulting department consists of 45 HR and change management professionals that have at least one thing in common. We have a human-centric mindset and put humans at the center of our engagements to make a lasting impact for our clients. While you will be onboarded in a specific competency, we closely work together across our competences in order to make a lasting client impact.

  

People & Transformation


Change is constant and so are business needs and underlying solutions. In achieving business objectives and adoption of the overall solution, setting humans at center has been our key differentiator and success factor. Our focus is driving (behavioral) change management strategies as part of large business transformations, whilst targeting company culture and different leadership components. In addition, there is a strong focus on HR topics related to creating HR strategies and supporting the implementation of future of work best practices while enabling skills-based organisations.

  

Responsibilities – How can you make a lasting impact in a rapidly changing world?

  

* Demonstrate technical skills in the aforementioned competencies, e.g. Change Management
* Work alongside clients and lead project workstreams, from planning through implementation together with your team
* Support during the sales process by brainstorming with the team on the client’s request and drive the development of solutions
* Prepare client workshops and assist in facilitating workshops
* Contribute to generate profitable revenue by identifying additional engagement opportunities and building lasting relationships with clients
* Influence and persuade clients and stakeholders to gain support for project related initiatives and/or decisions

  

Skills and Attributes for success

  

* Team player with the ability to integrate with new teams quickly and effectively
* Collaborative and good at building relationships
* Ability to manage projects, analyze problems and to provide input to insightful, practical and sustainable solutions
* Qualitative and quantitative data analysis skills and data manipulation and presentation, such as through MS Excel tools and Power BI
* Able to manage stakeholders and client relationships in a fast paced and complex environment
* Strong written and verbal communication skills and experience of producing high quality reports, papers, presentations with excellent attention to detail
* Ability to bring ideas and insights to clients that provide value, help address risk and assist in the driving solutions
* You demonstrate resilience in stressful situations and excel in performing under time pressure
* You are familiar with fast-paced dynamics and are able to navigate them effectively

  

General job requirements – Where do you start if you want to change the world?


To qualify for the role, you must have

* A relevant master’s degree, e.g. in Change Management
* Relevant working experience of 1 to 5 years within industry or consulting related roles with strong affinity for the people agenda
* Ability to analyze problems and to provide input to insightful, practical, and sustainable solutions
* Strong understanding of people related processes related to HR transformations.
* Strong oral and written skills in English and Dutch is required.
* See for more specific job requirements the descriptions above


Additionally, we are looking for candidates who..

* Strong understanding and experience deploying change management for different initiatives
* Familiarity and experience with HR practices and/or functional set up is a plus, this includes proficiency in areas such as HR operations, HR business partnering, talent & performance management


Aware of cultural mechanics and leadership behaviors in organisations


Already interested? Apply now!

  

What we offer – Is everything that counts being counted?

* Vitality: the choice is yours. An online session with an external vitality coach, practical tips on topics such as nutrition, energy, sleep, and mindset and/or a voucher card to rent a padel court.
* Flexible working: you decide where and when you work in consultation with your team. At home, at the office, at the client or from another European country (up to 20 working days per year).
* Home office arrangement: to optimally set up your home office, EY has the following resources available for you: office chair, sit/stand desk, external monitor, desk lamp, (Bluetooth) headset and a large external keyboard.
* Laptop and smartphone: you are entitled to a laptop and smartphone with a business subscription.
* Salary: in addition to your fixed salary, depending on EY's financial performance, you may be eligible for a bonus. You are also entitled to an expense allowance (depending on the function) and an internet allowance of €40 net per month.
* Time off: you are entitled to 29 vacation days per year when full-time employed.
* Sabbatical: the option to take unpaid leave after consultation.
* Birth leave: EY will pay 100% of the birth leave, in case of an additional birth leave EY will pay 70% of the salary.
* Training and education: EY believes it's important for everyone to always have the opportunity to further develop yourself. We therefore offer you the opportunity to take part in various soft & hard skills training, external courses and/or sign up for an additional education. For example, obtaining an MBA to broaden your skills in Leadership, Business and Tech.
* Mobility: Contribute directly to our ambition to reduce EY's carbon footprint to zero by 2025. With the new scheme you choose the most diverse sustainable options via the EY My Daily Travel app or online environment. Think of the use of lease bicycles, electric shared scooters, electric shared cars, flexible lease cars and various subscriptions for public transport. You can also view your CO2 footprint via the app.
* Bicycle arrangement: finance the purchase cost of your new bicycle from your gross monthly salary (purchase cost amount divided over 12 months) or from your non-statutory holiday entitlement.
* Pension scheme: you will build up a pension capital directly after your start at EY. Each month the available premium amount is transferred for you in an investment account at our pension provider. You will also have the option to build up additional pension capital on a voluntary basis.

  

For more information about our employment terms, visit our page here.

  

The office


Our office in Amsterdam is located on the Zuidas: a bustling area where many companies are based. In our Cross Towers, as many as 1000 people are welcomed daily. Haven't had breakfast yet? Then a special smoothie will be made for you or simply a delicious cappuccino. During lunchtime, the team is ready to serve you a fresh lunch. For a breathtaking view of Amsterdam, head to the 22nd floor. Collaboration takes on a new meaning through the Wavespace. This high-tech environment brings together clients and colleagues virtually worldwide!

  

Recruitment procedure – How can you prepare for a long life together?


The selection procedure exists in general out of 2 interview rounds and/or business case.


An (online) assessment an pre-employment screening will also be part of the process.

  

Pre-employment screening  

Due to laws and regulations, and because EY (and in some cases its clients) has high demands on the reliability and integrity of its employees, every new employee will be screened. Depending on your rank the pre employment screening could contain the following: Certificate of Conduct (in Dutch: VOG) or - if requesting a Dutch VOG is not possible - Criminal Background Check of the country you are currently living or have lived during the last five years, integrity questionnaire, verification of ID, diploma’s and/or work experience and consultation of the Dutch insolvency registry.

title: (Junior) Plant Physiologist
description:
*Contributing to the optimization of speed and selection pressure in our crops*
What are you going to do
As a (Junior) Plant Physiologist, you develop crop cultivation methods and systems to accelerate the seed-to-seed cycle of Enza Zaden crops, as well as create on-demand selection pressure based on abiotic stress conditions. You do this by influencing and analyzing environmental conditions as well as their effect on plant phenotype in fully controlled, greenhouse and open field conditions. This means that you convert research into new cultivation practices and put them in motion. Your objective is to create such conditions during the various plant growth and development stages, that we shorten our cycles from seed to seed and can better select against physiological disorders/abiotic stress.
You are responsible to conduct literature research, design trials, execute, analyze and report your results to your stakeholders.
You are on top of new technologies and developments in plant physiology and create knowledge on the optimization of climate and cultivation processes. You experiment with various tools (eg. light, fertilization, hormones) and deploy sensors to assess the performance of our genetics (eg. IoT sensors, cameras, photosynthesis).
You work with the different crops that Enza Zaden has to offer. Together with colleagues from Breeding, Biotechnology and R&D Operations you make these projects a success. You also have and maintain a network with relevant specialists at universities and suppliers.
The plant physiology team is a young and dynamic team with room to be creative and bring your own ideas into practice.
Your power
You have thorough knowledge of plant physiology and like to bring this knowledge into practice in controlled (greenhouse and indoor farming) and open-field conditions. You are analytical and solution-oriented with a hands-on working mentality. Due to your curiosity and research mindset, you keep an active eye on both industry and academic advancements in the related fields. You translate information from the external environment into innovative ideas to serve internal goals.
You are an independent researcher, capable of solving problems and reach out to the right people, but also a team player exhibiting a proactive and collaborative approach in projects with a common goal. You are resilient on working under pressure, willing to take risks and focus on project execution. You demonstrate strong values of trust, integrity and respect in your work and interaction with others, aligned to Enza Zaden’s values and principles.
In short, you:* have a Master’s degree in Plant Sciences;
* have knowledge and experience in plant physiology, abiotic stress, indoor/vertical farming and open-field conditions;
* have knowledge on the use of sensors and interpretation of climate and plant data;
* have solid knowledge on statistics and are familiar with statistical software (R or similar);
* have basic lab skills (working safely in the lab) or the willingness to learn;
* have strong analytical and problem-solving skills;
* have strong planning, organizational skills and are familiar with managing projects;
* have excellent and assertive communication skills in the English language, verbal and written (Dutch is a plus).


Our Power
Enza Zaden is a vegetable breeding company that develops, produces and sells vegetable varieties seeds all over the world. To explain to you properly (and as briefly as possible) what we do, we have created an animation.
The goal of our work? Giving everyone worldwide access to healthy and varied vegetables. With more than 2,500 passionate colleagues around the world, we work together every day on tomorrow's vegetables.
Would you like to know more about Enza Zaden as an employer? Then take a look at the Careers & Learning page or check out our page on LinkedIn.
A sneak peak of our benefits:* Flexible working policy
* Home working allowance
* Travel allowance at +10 km home/work distance based on Google Maps
* 8.33% holiday allowance
* Performance reward percentage
* Individual and collective salary increase
* 25 holidays + 1 vitality day (other vitality days depend on age)
* Contribution to pension scheme


Interested?
Send your application to our Recruitment Department
More information:*Annemarie Weening**Senior Corporate Recruiter**+31 62970 6834**a.weening@enzazaden.nl**Acquisition in response to this vacancy is not appreciated.*
  
Über uns


Unsere Mitarbeiter sind die treibende Kraft unseres Unternehmens. Jeder Einzelne trägt aus seinem spezifischen Fachgebiet heraus dazu bei, die Gemüsesorten der Zukunft zu schaffen.
Wir setzen auf Spezialisten und die breit gefächerten Kompetenzen von Menschen mit langjähriger Erfahrung in diesem Bereich. Und die innovative Vision von Praktikanten und Quereinsteigern. Wir schätzen dieses Wissen und diese Erfahrung und investieren daher in unsere Mitarbeiter, indem wir ihnen viele Möglichkeiten zur persönlichen Entwicklung und Weiterentwicklung bieten.
Wirf einen Blick auf unsere aktuellen Stellenangebote und prüfe, ob es eine Möglichkeit gibt, die zu dir passt.

title: Bike Hunter (Full Time)
Mid Office Banking Specialist at BMG
description:
Bank Mendes Gans (BMG) is known world-wide as a niche bank for liquidity and information management services, providing integrated customized solutions for corporate companies around the globe. BMG has developed and perfected a full and integrated range of liquidity and information management services required by its corporate clients whom it serves with a high level of professionalism and personal service. BMG is part of the ING Wholesale Banking Clients Coverage.

**Role and responsibilities**


As a Mid Office Banking Specialist at BMG you are part of one of our Client Services teams (so-called Mid Office) and the first contact of international clients on all operational matters. You are a team player not afraid to pick up the phone and call our clients about their high value treasury transactions, day-to-day cash pool and netting business and coordinate implementations.

* You provide excellent client support on sensitive international payments with complex routing and on interest calculations. You are responsible for accurately processing incoming (FX) payments and in accordance with cash pool balances and customer limits time sensitive assessment of payment execution together with the Account Manager and the Risk department.
* In close cooperation with the Back Office and Treasury department you offer full support on the customers’ Netting cycles including preliminary and final runs, limit excess procedures and FX payments and receivables. All operational netting related questions are addressed by you through constant prioritization and flawless teamwork.
* Increasingly the static data maintenance of our Netting and Cash Pool products is brought to the self-service portals in our banking platform: Megabank. The Mid Office team supports customers in using both as well as with the maintenance of all customer and account data. Contract verification, account activation and keeping customer files according to high quality standards requires accuracy and eye for details.


Summarizing the above: as an Mid Office Banking Specialist you will have a dynamic job in the front line of our organization. You will work in close relation with our high demanding clients, your team members and colleagues from various BMG departments. Through working in the cash pool, netting and administration teams in one of the Mid Offices you will become an expert in international (FX) payments and cash & liquidity management while you master top notch service skills in a highly professional organization.

**Company Culture**

* A challenging environment with a team of dedicated co-workers
* A customer centric and result driven attitude
* A growing organization that values initiative and entrepreneurship
* Hands-on mentality and no-nonsense attitude

**How to succeed**


We hire smart people like you for your potential. Our biggest expectation is that you’ll stay curious. Keep learning. Take on responsibility. In return, we’ll back you to develop into an even more awesome version of yourself.


Furthermore you have:


* Current residency in the Netherlands is required to be considered
* Completed university (Bachelor) education
* Experience and familiar with international (FX) payments, cash pool and/or netting in an banking environment is a plus but not essential
* You are not afraid to pick up the phone and call our clients about their high value treasury transactions, day-to-day cash pool and netting business and coordinate implementations
* Able to work with, and have experience with, tight deadlines and a high pressure environment
* Fluent command of the English language. Dutch is a plus but not essential
* Customer focus, attention to details, teamwork, planning and organizing, persuasiveness
* Your mentality is to take it on and make it happen, to help others to be successful and to always are a step ahead

**Want to apply directly?**

Are you enthusiastic and do you want to get started as Operations Specialist at BMG? Then apply directly by clicking on the application button below, **submit your CV and cover letter with your motivation** on how we can help grow your long term financial career within BMG!

 **Rewards & benefits**


We want to make sure that it’s possible for you to strike the right balance between your career and your private life. You can find out more about our employment conditions here.


The benefits of working with us at ING include:

* A salary tailored to your qualities and experience
* 12 month contract with view to extend
* 36 or 40 hour workweek
* Individual leave: 24+2 individual holiday days based on 36 hr workweek
* Diversity leave: 3 days per year (1,5 paid, 1,5 unpaid)
* CSR days: up to 2 days per year to actively engage in society by volunteering
* 13th month salary
* 8% Holiday payment
* Individual Savings Contribution (BIS), 3.5% of your gross annual salary
* Mobility card
* Attractive pension scheme
* Hybrid working to blend home working for focus and office working for collaboration and co-creation

**Want to apply directly?**

Upload your **CV and motivation letter** by clicking the “Apply” button.


Please note, multiple interview steps involving various business stakeholders will be part of the selection process.

**About us**


With 60,000 employees and operations in approximately 40 countries, there is no shortage of opportunities for people with initiative who want to help people take a step ahead in life and in business. Do you want to work at the cutting edge of what’s possible and at the same time ensure you work with integrity and hold the customer’s interests at heart? Do you want to be surrounded by progressive, inspiring, diverse and supportive colleagues? Then there is no better place to invest your talents than at ING. Join us and apply today!

title: Business Analyst Legal Operations
description:
ING is looking for a proactive and enthusiastic Business Analyst to strengthen the Corporate Legal Operations team (“CLO team”). As a part of the Corporate Legal Affairs department, this role is at the very heart of ING and offers various process improvement and digitalization challenges and opportunities.

**The Corporate Legal Operations team**


The Corporate Legal Operations team (“CLO team”) consists of 5 paralegals and 3 functional application managers/project management support colleagues. The team operates in a highly dynamic, international and challenging environment and collaborates with a wide variety of departments on all levels and in all geographies. The Corporate Legal Operations team is responsible for procedural legal activities, corporate housekeeping, program management support and functional application management of various legal applications. These applications include Eagle for ING’s legal structure, MyPRS for the registration of Powers of Attorney, iManage for document management, Sherpany for facilitating board meetings and MS Power Platform to support various processes. Collaboration is key for our team. We are always looking for opportunities to further improve our processes and way of working.

 **Roles and responsibilities**


As Business Analyst in the CLO team, you will:

* Analyse processes of the current situation (AS IS) and define the requirements for the future optimized situation (TO BE).
* Support and guide colleagues towards the TO BE.
* Functionally manage applications and support users.
* Drive change and innovation within the legal department of ING.
* Be the linking pin and closely work together with various stakeholders: ING TECH, ING’s robotics team, external IT-suppliers, ING colleagues and (senior) management.
* Keep up to date with new technology in the field of efficiency and effectivity.

 **How to succeed**


We hire talented and skilled people like you for your potential and your ability to contribute. Our biggest expectation is that you’ll stay curious. Keep learning. Take on responsibility and be a team player.


We are looking for someone with the following mind-set and approach:

* **Stakeholder management and engagement**: Act as an expert to the legal departments and pro-actively liaise and educate colleagues/users.
* **Team spirit**: At all times comply with ING’s Orange Code (collaboration) – help others to be successful, take it on and make it happen and always be one step ahead. Share knowledge and skills and actively seek collaboration.
* **Analytical self-starter**: Take ownership of challenges, provide oversight and be process driven.
* **Solution-oriented**: Think strategically and creatively, seek and develop solutions in consultation with colleagues.

*Required skills and experience:*

* A relevant bachelor's or master's degree, e.g. in Industrial Engineering & Management.
* 1-3 years working experience in business analyses and functional application management, preferably in a corporate environment.
* Fluent in English, both verbal and writing. And preferably in Dutch too.
* Proficient in MS Power Platform.
* Proactive, analytical, tech-savvy and a positive critical attitude.
* Executer: turning ideas into actual implementations.
* A socially skilled team player who can perform under pressure, prioritise and quickly navigate amongst several topics.

**Rewards and benefits**


We want to make sure that it’s possible for you to strike the right balance between your career and your private life. You can find out more about our employment conditions at https://www.ing.jobs/netherlands/Why-ING/benefits.htm.


The benefits of working with us at ING include:

* A salary tailored to your qualities and experience
* 24-27 vacation days depending on contract
* Pension scheme
* 13th month salary
* Individual Savings Contribution (BIS), 3.5% of your gross annual salary
* 8% Holiday payment
* Hybrid working to blend home working for focus and office working for collaboration and co-creation
* Personal growth and challenging work with endless possibilities
* An informal working environment with innovative colleagues

**About us**


With 60,000 employees and operations in approximately 40 countries, there is no shortage of opportunities for people with initiative who want to help people take a step ahead in life and in business. Do you want to work at the cutting edge of what’s possible and at the same time ensure you work with integrity and hold the customer’s interests at heart? Do you want to be surrounded by progressive, inspiring, diverse and supportive colleagues? Then there is no better place to invest your talents than at ING. Join us. Apply today.

**Questions?**


Contact the recruiter attached to the advertisement for more information. Want to apply directly? Please upload your CV and motivation letter by clicking the “Apply” button.

title: Director of Global People Operations
description:
**Help us bring people and businesses together**
Our SaaS platform enables multi-location brands and businesses to boost their online presence. From big to small, from Adidas to ZenPark, our client base contains some of your favourite brands as well, we bet. **The Past, Present & Future** **The Past:** Uberall was founded in 2013 by David Federhen and Florian Hübner, two longtime friends with a vision to improve customer experience across the online and offline worlds. They created a platform that connected companies with local customers in the digital-first moment. **The Present:** We're on a mission **to empower businesses to thrive locally**, and believe every business deserves success, regardless of size or location. Simply put, our location marketing platform exists to help our customers get found online and connect with customers through search, discovery, engagement, and conversion. **The Future:** We're a growing company with a bright future, and our journey to become the global leader in location marketing is well underway. We have a passionate and diverse team, a comprehensive, intuitive platform, and a clear vision for the future. We're looking for talented and passionate people (like you \uD83D\uDC4B) to join us on our journey.  

  

**You and us**  

We are approaching 400 Uberallers, with 50+ different nationalities, who live and breathe our three core values:  

\uD83C\uDF35 GROW TOGETHER* DEMONSTRATE PASSION & PERFORMANCE


✊ BE BOLD & DRIVE CHANGE  

So, what are you waiting for? If you're passionate, driven, and ready to be bold, we want you on our team! Apply now and let's grow together.\uD83D\uDE80  

Our Global People & Culture team is looking for a **Director of Global People Operations**. In this role you are a key player in our Uberall People & Culture team, turning our People First strategy into reality daily. You make a direct impact on evolving our amazing company culture. You lead a small, global, and professional team that is passionate about Uberallers. As a leader of Uberall’s global People Operations team your work is crucial in ensuring that our 400+ Uberallers across 30 countries can be productive day by day - you and your team provide relevant people services, support, and tools in a compelling and compliant way.  

Not only that - the foundations you set also help Uberall grow for the future. In addition, you will be responsible for managing compensation and benefits programs, ensuring they are compliant and aligned with industry standards. You will be leading this function in a largely remote workforce and a distributed workforce, managing EOR aspects as well. In this role you will be part of the Global People & Culture leadership team you’ll report directly to the Chief People Officer.
### **Responsibilities:**

* Define, implement, and continuously evolve the full range of Uberall’s employment-related policies & processes in a people-centric way, ensuring we offer a compelling and compliant people experience for Uberallers and are an employer of choice for our candidates.
* Lead and continuously develop a high-performing team of PeopleOps experts around the globe in a fast-paced environment
* Drive excellence by taking care of the details in all things employment: Your team is responsible for the employee lifecycle from onboarding to offboarding, including preparing necessary documents by local labour law requirements
* Plan and execute our ‘rhythm of the business ’ of people processes regarding performance, compensation, development, and engagement.
* Ensure that Uberall maintains accurate and accessible employee data and records and has a powerful toolset (HRIS etc.) that Uberallers love using.
* Make the connection between the HRIS and the people analytics and insights function. Ensure we run efficient payroll and benefits processes by collaborating effectively with our partners
* Handle all employment relations matters professionally, swiftly, and in strong collaboration with our legal partners.
* Experience of fostering collaborative and constructive relations with work councils. Collaborate effectively with other key stakeholders (Finance, IT, Legal, etc.) to keep shaping powerful moments along the employee journey.

### **Your Profile:**

* Integrity - You deeply value professionalism and compliance and know how to apply these principles constructively with business stakeholders
* HR generalist - You know the nuts and bolts of HRM, are likely certified and have spent about 8+ years leading a people operations team in a global growth environment, ideally in a scaleup or global organisation
* Applied labour law - You have in-depth knowledge and experience of applied Spanish & German labour law and are versed in working with employment matters across global geographies, in particular, North America and EMEA (e.g. US, UK, Germany, France, Netherlands, Portugal, Spain)
* Experience of operating with Works Councils
* Compensation & benefits - You have the ability to understand the importance of such a strategy and execute it from global to local
* Implements people first culture - You understand how to turn policies and processes into a compelling experience for Uberallers
* Emotional intelligence - You are able to relate to people from a range of backgrounds and are a whizz at conflict resolution
* Diversity & Inclusion - You love working across cultures and timezones in a hybrid work environment
* Proactive - you foresee issues before they arise and continuously work to ensure conflicts or disengagement does not happen
* Maintain accountability - You possess strong ownership and drive, you make things happen and push to finish what you started
* You are results- not task-focused - You know how to prioritise, you drive momentum both individually and in a team environment
* Continuous improvement & innovation - You care about quality implementation and delivery, and constantly look for ways to improve and evolve what we do
* Performance - You set targets, provide constructive and frequent feedback and are great at managing expectations up, down and across the organisation
* Present & available - You are service-minded and enjoy being in the front line working directly with Uberallers
* Stakeholder management - You educate and coach leaders and stakeholders in alignment with organisational goals
* Stellar communication skills - You maintain clarity, transparency and simplicity in how you communicate at all levels of the organisation

**What we offer:**  

\uD83D\uDC9C **A mission with meaning and purpose** At Uberall, we foster genuine connections between local businesses and people. Our diverse team allows us to win together with our partners, co-workers, and customers. Speaking of our customers, they’re some of the most recognizable businesses in the world.  

\uD83D\uDE01 **A truly human culture** We’re famous for our culture. Uberallers live by our values of mutual respect and boldness. We’re open, collaborative risk-takers with a whole lot of passion and grit.  

\uD83E\uDD38\uD83C\uDFFD‍ ️ **Flexibility** **to** **fit** **your** **lifestyle** Want to come to an office for collaboration? We’ve got space for you in Berlin, Amsterdam, Barcelona, Detroit, and London. We also offer co-working access in Montreal, Paris, LA and San Diego. Prefer to work remotely? Fine by us! Bonus points if we meet your pets in a video call. If working from another country is legally possible for you and within a reasonable time zone, we happily support work-ations.  

\uD83D\uDCB8 **A piece of the pie** Our pay & perks are competitive, and you better believe we review them on the regular to make sure they stay that way. We grow together, so of course all Uberallers are part of our long-term incentive program through VSOP/ESOP.* **Emotional and intellectual connection** Events and alignment sessions - YES and YES. With the team, cross-functions, regional, you name it - we love bringing people together. Uberallers share a LOT of hobbies. Whatever you’re into – reading books, baking, heavy metal, fostering kittens . . . you’ll find kindred spirits on our team.

  

\uD83E\uDDD8 **Health and Wellness** We prioritize your wellness with generous holiday time, paid parental and circumstantial leave, and individualized health and wellness opportunities depending on your location.* ️ **All-access pass** Get immersed in Uberall from day one. Your onboarding is packed with a deep dive into our values, insights into all our departments, and a chance to ask the CEO anything. We come together monthly for our town hall and product showroom so you’re always in the know.

  

\uD83C\uDF35 **Everyday growth** We support you on your non-stop learning journey. We offer development dialogues, live workshops on topics like resilience and feedback, and a Leadership Academy to make sure our leaders have all the tools to bring out the very best in teams. We also invest in your growth with a learning grant program reinforcing our commitment to fostering a culture of continuous learning.  

\uD83D\uDDA5 **Top-of-the-line** **tech** MacBook Pro, magic mouse, 2nd screen . . . Need anything else? Let the People & Culture team know.  

Remember our "**Grow Together**" value from the beginning of the ad? **We mean it.**  

\uD83C\uDF35\uD83C\uDFD4✊  

Everything starts with getting in touch. The best way to express your interest is by applying online. We will be carefully reading your profile and can't wait to hear from you.  

In the meantime, let our "life@uberall" social accounts give you some real-life impressions.  

\uD83D\uDC65 **Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Belonging:**  

At Uberall, we believe inclusion unlocks the potential of diversity. It’s right there in our number one core value – Grow Together. Sure, we’re approaching 400 unique people with over 50 nationalities working in 30 different countries, but we’re all Uberallers. That means we’re collaborative, open-minded, and assume positive intent in everything we do. We don’t judge, and we don’t exclude.  

Our flexible ways of working are designed to make sure each and every Uberaller belongs and thrives, no matter their background, abilities, or lifestyle. We don’t just think inclusion makes us stronger, we KNOW it.

title: Sales Assistant || 14h Store Debijenkorf Maastricht
description:
**Purpose of the role:** 

The role of Sales Assistant is an essential part of the retail function.

Connecting and engaging with the Zadig&Voltaire customers, supporting the day to day activities of their team and store.

We are looking for someone who is attentive, reliable, full of energy, approachable, punctual with extensive knowledge of fashion and trends of the season and confident in engaging and styling clients.

The Sales Assistant will welcome and assist customers throughout the entire sales process, describing the product, always focusing on delivering the highest customer experience.

You will support the store management in building a store environment that nurtures creativity and employees development.

**Expectations of the role** **:**

Selling skills:

- Be a brand ambassador and embrace the brand Selling Ceremony

- Drive sales: warm welcome, exceptional customer approach, use appropriate sales techniques from start to closing the sale.

- Be part of targeting the ZV objectives and meeting store KPIs (AB and UPT)

- Provide personalised advice and drive sales according to the customer’s needs

- Be able to build customer loyalty, understand customer relationship management

- Be able to communicate efficiently and effectively

- Be knowledgeable of the collection and the brand iconic pieces

Operations :

- Drive sales: Operating till system, take and process payments

- Manage the till and customers queuing efficiently

- Follow company policy and procedure

- Manage the needs of the customer including exchanges, credit notes and holds

- Offer each customer the opportunity to be on the mailing list

- Maintain the replenishment of bags, boxes etc

- Follow up stock transfers between stores and manage the faulty items procedure with the support from the manager

- Processing the deliveries

- Maintain a luxurious store environment and standards

- Answer calls promptly and efficiently, with a pleasant and welcoming manner

- Execute the loss prevention procedure and conducts regular inventories

- Ensure the shop floor and stock room standards are maintained in a clean, tidy condition

- Follow the health & safety guidelines

Merchandising:

- Process deliveries (new collection, replenishment…), transfers

- Process the replenishment of the items on the shop floor according to the ZV Standards

- Support the Store Management in the VM guidelines implementation

**Required knowledge & skills :**

- Be a quick learner and good listener

- You must have excellent communication skills

- Excellent organization skills

- Understands and delivers a luxurious customer experience

- Able to suggest additional items as ad-on sales

- Understand the sales and financial targets

- Be quick operationally while having strong attention to detail

- You have to be adaptable and a team player

- Show passion about the retail and interest in fashion and retail market trends

**Required qualities :**

- Details focused!

- Strong verbal & written communication skills

- Problem solver! Adapt to new situation, be proactive!

- Great people skills, be enthusiastic, dynamic!

- Punctual

- Team player

- Flexible according to the working hours and situations

- Able to multi-task

- Be eager to learn, develop yourself and others.

*We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age.*

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Temporary

Expected hours: 14 per week

Work Location: In person

title: Handler / Magazijnmedewerker
description:
* 

  

We have an exciting opportunity for you to join our Operations team as a package handler.  

  

**Who we are:**  

FedEx is the largest express transportation company in the world, connecting more than 220 countries and territories. We work every moment to deliver the most important package of someone’s day. Our team of passionate people know their day-to-day work is invaluable in delivering outstanding experience to our customers. 530,000 team members strong, we are as diverse as the world we serve. We love what we do, and we do it well. Our reach is big, and so are our dreams. Join us and let's write our next chapter together.  

  

**What you will be doing:**  

* Sorting, scanning, loading, and unloading packages in a fast-paced environment
* Using relevant equipment and technology when needed
* Following our Health and Safety regulations
* Supporting your supervisor and team members as required

  

**What do you bring with you:**  

* Be a great team player
* Be able to complete all required training
* Be able to communicate effectively, in a fast-moving environment
* Have excellent eye for detail and be able to make quick, accurate decisions

  

**What do we offer:**  

* Attractive compensation package
* Training to get you started and on-the-job learning opportunities
* Extensive learning resources to further develop your skills and knowledge
* Tuition Assistance Program (\*applicable for FedEx positions with a permanent contract)
* Employee Assistance Program for you and your family in difficult life situations
* Employee reduced-rate shipping
* Great career opportunities
* FedEx is one of the worlds most admired companies and trusted brands year after year

  

Bring your ideas, individuality, and dreams to our global community. Feel good about where you work. Choose your career path - we’re ready to invest in your development. Join FedEx.  



  

FedEx was built on a philosophy that puts people first, one we take seriously. We are an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce in which we provide growth opportunities for all

**Our Company**
---------------


FedEx is one of the world's largest express transportation companies and has consistently been selected as one of the top 10 World’s Most Admired Companies by "Fortune" magazine. Every day FedEx delivers for its customers with transportation and business solutions, serving more than 220 countries and territories around the globe. We can serve this global network due to our outstanding team of FedEx team members, who are tasked with making every FedEx experience outstanding.

**Our Philosophy**
------------------


The People-Service-Profit philosophy (P-S-P) describes the principles that govern every FedEx decision, policy or activity. FedEx takes care of our people; they, in turn, deliver the impeccable service demanded by our customers, who reward us with the profitability necessary to secure our future. The essential element in making the People-Service-Profit philosophy such a positive force for the company is where we close the circle, and return these profits back into the business, and invest back in our people. Our success in the industry is attributed to our people. Through our P-S-P philosophy, we have a work environment that encourages team members to be innovative in delivering the highest possible quality of service to our customers. We care for their well-being, and value their contributions to the company.

**Our Culture**
---------------


Our culture is important for many reasons, and we intentionally bring it to life through our behaviors, actions and activities in every part of the world. The FedEx culture and values have been a cornerstone of our success and growth since we began in the early 1970’s. While other companies can copy our systems, infrastructure and processes, our culture makes us unique and is often a differentiating factor as we compete and grow in today’s global marketplace.

title: Corporate Traineeship
description:
As a Corporate trainee you are ambitious, think and act beyond boundaries and strive to develop yourself within your discipline or even broader.


The FrieslandCampina traineeship is a two-year program, starting in March and September. With two challenging assignments, both one year, you can make a difference in your field and really contribute to the company and a better world.


Our ‘fast track’ program for future leaders accelerates personal and professional development with lots of potential to grow in a short time, for example with our training & development program set up by a renowned partner.  


Wat we vragen


* Fresh graduate or entry level work experience
* Finished Masters degree
* Eager to learn
* Strong self-motivated
* Ready to make an impact
* Dutch for the tracks Supply Chain & Operations and Technology & Operations


Wat we bieden


* A fast track program for future leaders
* Personal development program based on future leadership skills (eg. one-on-one coaching and hard and soft skill training)
* Career development program (eg. internal mentoring program, business challenges and career days)
* Two challenging one year assignments
* Informal activities with your interdisciplinary cohort (eg. introduction week and factory visits)

  

Vacaturetekst
We have a trainee program for the following disciplines starting March 1st:

* Finance
* Commercial
* Supply Chain & Operations
* Technology & Operations


The applications are now open! You can apply from September 1st until October 10 23:59.


Bij FrieslandCampina geloven we in een werkomgeving waar iedereen zich hun volledige en authentieke zelf kan voelen en in hun kracht wordt gezet om het beste uit zichzelf te halen. We omarmen elkaars verschillen en ontvangen graag je sollicitatie, ongeacht je geslacht, geloof, afkomst, seksuele voorkeur, leeftijd, beperking, of nationaliteit. Als wie wij zijn bij jou past, moedigen we je aan om te solliciteren, ook als je niet zeker weet of je aan alle eisen voldoet.
Ons team
Zie alle collega's op LinkedIn
The traineeship is a program of 2 years, where you will complete two assignments for one year. The assignments could be an extension of each other or totally different. Your first assignment is assigned to you by us. After the first year we assess together what could be a good second assignment for your development and personal growth. When you work at FrieslandCampina you will find out the sky is the limit when it comes to your own career! When you proactively look for new opportunities, anything is possible. After the second assignment you will flow into a permanent position, which is a logical next step for your career.  

  

As a trainee you work with a lot of external and internal stakeholders, this is why we need people with strong communication and influencing skills. We are looking for trainees with an open mindset, who work in a proactive and self-asserting way.

  


Contact


Pien Mulder


Pien.Mulder@frieslandcampina.com

title: Magazijnmedewerker (part-time 10-20h warehouse employee)
description:
**Position Summary**

For our warehouse we are looking for an enthusiastic employee to join our team. As a warehouse employee, you are an all-round employee in the warehouse. Your tasks will vary from inbound to outbound and from labelling to processing customer-specific requirements. To train you as best as possible, you start with a (paid) full-day training. Your duties will consist of the following:

* Order picking;
* Preparing goods for shipment - labelling and packing of orders;
* Performing counts / stock management;
* All other common warehouse activities.

The work takes place 2 times a week (Monday - Tuesday) with working hours to be agreed upon together.

**What do we ask?**

* You can work independently in the warehouse, therefore a few years of work experience within a similar position is an advantage;
* You live within a radius of 25 km;

**What do we offer?**

* A nice job within an informal working environment;
* Up to 30 hours working week with working hours to be agreed upon together.
* A decent salary that suits your level.

Soort dienstverband: Fulltime

Salaris: €13,00 - €14,00 per uur

Verwacht aantal uur: 15 – 20 per week

Aanvullende vergoedingen:

* Overuren uitbetaald
* Vakantiegeld

Arbeidsvoorwaarden:

* Flexibele werkuren
* Kosteloos parkeren
* Mogelijkheid tot promotie
* Pensioen

Flexibele taalvereiste:

* Nederlands niet vereist

Werkschema:

* Dagdienst
* ma-vr
* Ploegendienst

Toestemming om te werken:

* Netherlands (Vereist)

Werklocatie: Fysiek

Verwachte startdatum: 01-10-2024

title: Technical Assistant, Entry
description:
Provides support for technical issues. Identifies, researches and resolves routine technical problems of low complexity. Responds to telephone, email and on line requests for technical support. Documents, tracks, and monitors the problem using applicable systems and tools. May coordinate with other teams or departments to resolve user problems. May perform password re-sets for users.


PPG pay ranges and benefits can vary by location which allows us to compensate employees competitively in different geographic markets. PPG considers several factors in making compensation decisions including, but not limited to, skill sets, experience and training, qualifications and education, licensure and certifications, and other organizational needs. Other incentives may apply.  

  

Our employee benefits programs are designed to support the health and well-being of our employees. Any insurance coverages and benefits will be in accordance with the terms and conditions of the applicable plans and associated governing plan documents.

  

**About us:**
  

  

Here at PPG we make it happen, and we seek candidates of the highest integrity and professionalism who share our values, with the commitment and drive to strive today to do better than yesterday – everyday.
  

  

PPG: WE PROTECT AND BEAUTIFY THE WORLD™
  

Through leadership in innovation, sustainability and color, PPG helps customers in industrial, transportation, consumer products, and construction markets and aftermarkets to enhance more surfaces in more ways than does any other company.. To learn more, visit www.ppg.com and follow @ PPG on Twitter.
  

  

The PPG Way
  

Every single day at PPG:
  

We partner with customers to create mutual value.
  

We are “One PPG” to the world.
  

We trust our people every day, in every way.
  

We make it happen.
  

We run it like we own it.
  

We do better today than yesterday – everyday.
  

  

PPG provides equal opportunity to all candidates and employees. We offer an opportunity to grow and develop your career in an environment that provides a fulfilling workplace for employees, creates an environment for continuous learning, and embraces the ideas and diversity of others. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, pregnancy, race, color, creed, religion, national origin, age, disability status, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression. If you need assistance to complete your application due to a disability, please email recruiting@ppg.com.
  

  

PPG values your feedback on our recruiting process. We encourage you to visit Glassdoor.com and provide feedback on the process, so that we can do better today than yesterday.
  

Benefits will be discussed with you by your recruiter during the hiring process.

title: Production employee
Houseman
company: Park Inn by Radisson Amsterdam City West - Rooms
description:
**Do you prefer a diverse job in which you won’t get bored easily? Do you have a pro-active approach and can your colleagues always count on you? Then you are the one we need at the Park Inn by Radisson Amsterdam City West!**

  

Your job as a houseman is a diverse job in which you support the entire housekeeping department, an important and fun job! Curious what such a day will look like? Keep on reading!

  

As a houseman you start in the morning with a briefing from the quality supervisor in which you will be informed what is waiting for you that day. By this time, the linen has arrived and you make sure there is enough stock in each pantry for the room attendants. In the meantime whilst you are cleaning up the linen you receive a call from the Front Office, room 528 would like to have an iron and ironing board in their room before going to breakfast. You know how important it is to satisfy our guests so you ensure that the guest has received his iron and ironing board within no time. After arranging this you get called by the quality supervisor, due to a few sick reports, the team needs some extra help cleaning the rooms. With pleasure you help the room attendants with the stripping of the rooms which means that you already take of the bed linen and pick up the used towels. After you have stripped the necessary rooms you go to the canteen for a delicious lunch! In the afternoon you will refill the pantries and storerooms of the housekeeping. You get called again by the Front Office to bring an extra bed to a room with kids and also to bring a set of extra towels to the same room. For you it is never too much and with your enthusiasm you are happy to be of service to everyone!

 **Your job and other responsibilities:**

* Handling guest requests and internal housekeeping requests
* Refilling housekeeping storerooms and pantries
* Responsible for the distribution of linen
* When necessary, stripping rooms (gather bedlinen and towels from rooms)
* When necessary, assisting in cleaning public areas and back of house spaces
* Helping guests, and of course always with a smile!

 **What we are looking for:**

* You enjoy assisting and supporting your colleagues.
* You are a real multitasker
* You have good communication skills and are not afraid of talking to guests
* You have a ‘hands-on’ mentality and are flexible in availability
* You have good verbal skills in English
* You have a valid work permit & BSN registration (if applicable) and health insurance

 **What do we have to offer?**

* Competitive salary based on the Horeca CLA and a travel allowance;
* Guidance in your development as a hotel professional;
* Passionate colleagues and empowering managers;
* Informal culture where having fun in your job is important;
* International training possibilities;
* Introduction program for your position, our hotel brands and the company culture;
* After your probation period, a 'Weet Waar je Werkt' (Know Where You Work) program so you can have a real guest experience;
* Discount in hotels around the world belonging to the Radisson Hotel Group, and not just for you but also your friends & family!;
* Possibility to participate in a collective medical insurance.

  

Are you enthusiastic after reading this vacancy? Please send us why you are our next Moment Maker!

 **Park Inn & VEN**

 **The Park Inn by Radisson Amsterdam City West is a colorful and unique hotel with 476 rooms and 20 meeting rooms, all designed by Karim Rashid. The hotel is part of the VEN complex, which means that the building is shared with Holland Casino, a Wellness and apartments of B-Apart. Curious?**

  

Natuurlijk ben je ook benieuwd hoe het is om te werken bij het Park Inn by Radisson Amsterdam City West. Dit kan het best worden omschreven als fun en informeel, waarbij aandacht voor onze gasten en het leveren van kwaliteit altijd onze focus heeft. Het hotel is onderdeel van de Radisson Hotel Group, wat een wereld aan mogelijkheden geeft naar een internationale carrière en trainingsprogramma’s. Het Park Inn by Radisson Amsterdam City West is heel gemakkelijk te bereiken per auto of openbaar vervoer, het ligt op loopafstand van station Sloterdijk.

  

Radisson Hotel GroupTM (voorheen Carlson Rezidor Hotel Group) is een van de werelds grootste hotelgroepen met acht onderscheidende hotel brands en heeft 1.400 hotels wereldwijd in gebruik en in ontwikkeling. Onder de Radisson Hotel Group portfolio behoort Radisson CollectionTM, Radisson Blu®, Radisson®, Radisson RED®, Park Plaza®, Park Inn® by Radisson, Country Inn & Suites® by Radisson en prizeotel. Meer dan 95.000 internationale teamleden werken voor de Radisson Hotel Group.Het hoofdkantoor van het bedrijf bevindt zich in Brussel, Minneapolis en Singapore.


INDHOTEL

title: Housekeeping Supervisor
description:
Canal House is located in the heart of the Jordaan, the cultural centre of Amsterdam and we are looking for a Housekeeping Supervisor to join our team.

The hotel is a 23 bedroom boutique property that exudes sophisticated luxury.

Our rooms, feature, hard wood floors, silk wall paper, rich velvet fabrics and opulent Bisazza mosaics along with contemporary furnishings and Dutch Art.

We are seeking somebody who is very hand on, as this role is part room attendant and part Supervisor. the role is for 38hrs weekly on a variety of days of the week and weekend as well as various shifts. ( 8-4pm or 1-9pm)

As a Supervisor you will need to open the department, arrange the housekeeping team members, check the hotel standards of housekeeping in all areas, be a good trainer and mentor for the team.

You will need the following skills:

Attention to detail, in both cleaning and presentation of your areas.

Team work

Previous experience in a luxury hotel in housekeeping

Be able to work in a tidy and professional manner at all time.

Good communicator

You will have previous experience setting the team for the day, reports, daily tasks, and training for housekeeping.

Willingness to learn and be developed in the future.

Please note you will need a Dutch BSN, and we do NOT have any staff accommodation.

Job Types: Full-time, Contract, Permanent  
Contract length: 7 months

Pay: €2.573,44 per month

Experience:

* housekeeping: 2 years (Required)

Work Location: In person

Application Deadline: 10/09/2024  
Expected Start Date: 12/09/2024

title: Project Leader Fiber Application Development
description:
###### **Department**


Renewable Polymers
###### **Office**


Headquarters
###### **Location**


Amsterdam

  






**Project Leader Fiber Application Development**
================================================


Avantium is a pioneer in the emerging industry of renewable and sustainable chemistry. We seek to take part in the opportunities of the transition towards a circular economy to create value for our stakeholders and society as a whole. Avantium’s mission is to aid the transition to a fossil-free world by developing ground-breaking products based on renewable feedstock instead of fossil resources. Sustainable alternatives for fossil-based chemicals and materials include plastic bottles for drinks, films for food packaging and electronics, fibres for textiles and even material used in toys.



Avantium aims to be a world leader in renewable and sustainable chemistry and technology solutions and to commercialise them through partnerships and licensing. The company is best known for its PEF – a fully plant-based, sustainable plastic material – that can be used in packaging, textiles, film, and everyday items that match today’s world. It is an exciting time to join Avantium, as we are on the brink of scaling up to a first-of-a-kind commercial plant to produce PEF, unlocking the high potential of this novel, highly innovative plastic material PEF.



Avantium is looking for material scientist to further develop the fundamental knowledge on the application of FDCA based polymers, such as PEF (polyethylene furanoate), in fiber production and end applications.


**What will you do?**



The Project Leader Fiber Application Development will be part of the Polymer & Application Development (P&AD) team within the Technology & Innovation department. The P&AD team is an internal team with professionals in chemistry, chemical engineering and polymer engineer.



You will be initiating, coordinating and leading developments expanding knowledge on the behavior of our polymers during the fiber spinning, texturizing and further downstream processing steps. All with the purpose to have solid insights in the interrelation of the material, the design and the processing on the performance of the final article. You will also be in charge of launching, coordinating and implementing internal research projects, as well as setting up external trials with development partners. In addition, you will have a strong interaction with the Technical Account Management team to support them in customer trials.



Responsibilities:


* Identify knowledge gaps on the material behavior during the conversion process from plastic granules into fiber based end applications and define research project to bridge these gaps.
* Explore improvement routes on the material, its processing and the design of the end product and decide which (combination) of the routes has the highest potential also from a business perspective.
* Propose polymer modifications and assess the fitness for use of new polymer compositions in fiber applications.
* Prepare and maintain processing guidelines for the different fiber applications.
* Support (material) performance assessment of customer trials.
* Keep the overview on the state of art on FDCA based fiber development and build on Avantium’s IP portfolio.
* Clear communication and coordination of laboratory activities with team members, to effectively generate high quality data and creating a safe work environment.


**What do you bring?**



As a PL Fiber Application Development you have the following:


* a scientific or R&D background on a polymeric material approach to improve processing and performance; linking the physical behavior of the polymer chain to the observations while performing fiber conversion processes. (“thinking from the chain”).
* an MSc., PhD or equivalent in polymer physics or engineering.
* experience and or background in fiber or textile engineering is a plus.
* creative mindset to come to new approaches to solve existing challenges.
* are a good collaborator in an international team environment.
* good (English) communication and interpersonal skills.


**What do we offer?**



As we are a small company, we also offer you a unique chance to learn a lot about many fields, not only science, but also business and management, leading people and operations, market strategies, quality and last but not least safety. Learning paths can be steep and we do not offer you predefined career paths and development tracks. You are in the lead of your career, what you bring to the table will be noticed and taking initiative is rewarded and recognized. We have an informal culture, a flat organization and we recognize and celebrate the many cultures that we represent. And on top of that we offer good primary and secondary benefits.


**Does this sound like you?**  

Let us know by applying through our website. If you have any questions you can reach our Corporate Recruiter Kylie Hoffman at kylie.hoffman@avantium.com or send a message to recruitment@avantium.com.
